Title: Suzuki to invest ₹10,440 cr to make electric vehicles, batteries in Gujarat
Content: Japan's Suzuki Motor Corporation has announced plans to invest around ₹10,440 crore to locally manufacture electric vehicles (BEV) and BEV batteries in Gujarat. The memorandum of understanding was signed at India-Japan Economic Forum in the presence of PM Narendra Modi and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida. "We'll continue active investment in India to realise Atmanirbhar Bharat," Suzuki's President said.

Title: ₹224 cr undisclosed income found during raids on Maharashtra-based unicorn
Content: The Income Tax department found an undisclosed income of about ₹224 crore after it raided a unicorn startup based in Pune and Thane in Maharashtra. While the firm is engaged in wholesale and retail of construction materials, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said that its annual turnover exceeded ₹6,000 crore. Unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore has also been seized.

Title: Reliance Retail acquires 89% stake in women's innerwear brand Clovia
Content: Reliance Retail Ventures Limited (RRVL) has acquired an 89% equity stake in Purple Panda Fashions Private Limited, which owns and operates Clovia, a brand for women's innerwear and loungewear. Reliance made an investment of ₹950 crore through a combination of secondary stake purchase and primary investment. Clovia was launched in 2013 by Pankaj Vermani, Neha Kant and Suman Chowdhury.

Title: Russia's richest man's property worth $116 million seized by Italy
Content: Italian authorities have seized a building complex owned by Russian businessman Alexei Mordashov, Prime Minister Mario Draghi's office announced. The property is located on the Mediterranean island of Sardinia and is worth around $116 million. Earlier this month, a 215-foot yacht worth more than $71 million, called the "Lady M", belonging to Russia's richest man Mordashov was impounded in Italy.

Title: Govt working on classification of cryptos under GST law: Report
Content: The government is reportedly working on the classification of cryptocurrencies as goods or services under the GST law. "There's a clarity needed in regard to levy of GST on cryptocurrencies and whether it has to be levied on the entire value," an official told PTI. Currently, the government levies 18% GST on the services provided by the crypto exchanges.

Title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $281 mn to Boys & Girls Clubs of America
Content: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $281 million to Boys & Girls Clubs of America, marking the largest gift by an individual in the organisation's 160-year history. "Gifts like this are rare and have incredible impact," the organisation's President Jim Clark said. MacKenzie, who divorced Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in 2019, has a net worth of $54.4 billion, as per Bloomberg.

Title: Brazil bans Telegram, CEO says 'company was checking wrong email id for orders'
Content: After Brazil’s Supreme Court banned Telegram for facilitating disinformation and failing to comply with orders, CEO Pavel Durov issued a statement saying that the company was checking the wrong email address for communications with the court. Durov said the company had given a different email address for further communication but the court sent the orders to an old email address.

Title: Apple ex-employee charged with defrauding company out of $10 mn in US
Content: Dhirendra Prasad, a former Apple employee, has been charged with defrauding the tech giant out of more than $10 million in the US. The 52-year-old worked for 10 years as a buyer in Apple's Global Service Supply Chain department. According to the federal prosecutors, Prasad exploited his position to defraud Apple by allegedly taking kickbacks, stealing equipment and laundering money.

Title: Cooperating with authorities: Infra.Market after ₹224 cr undisclosed income detected
Content: Infra.Market Founder Souvik Sengupta on Sunday said that they are cooperating with the authorities to provide them with the necessary information to solve the issues they have in relation to the recent searches. The Income Tax department has found an undisclosed income of ₹224 crore from the Maharashtra-based unicorn startup group and has seized unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore.

Title: He is Aatmanirbhar: Anand Mahindra on 19-year-old's midnight run in Noida
Content: Sharing the viral video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "He is Aatmanirbhar!" While he refused a lift offered by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, Mahindra wrote, "This is indeed inspiring. But you know what my Monday Motivation is? The fact that he is so independent and refuses the offer of a ride."

Title: US toy company raises money for Ukraine with Zelenskyy's 'Lego' figures
Content: A Chicago artist has designed a Lego-style figurine of the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a bid to raise money for Ukraine. Joe Trupia, the owner of Citizen Brick, a toy manufacturing company, has no personal connections to the war but felt compelled to help. Citizen Brick has raised over $145,000 and donated it to a charity organisation helping Ukraine.

Title: UK's luxury department store Harrods admits to 'mistakenly' selling Russian vodka
Content: Luxury British department store Harrods admitted that it "mistakenly" sold an expensive brand of Russian vodka, having previously removed the bottles after sanctions against Russia due to the Ukraine war. Harrods spokesperson said, "After an inquiry by a customer, it was mistakenly brought out of stock and given to the customer. This was an error and shouldn't have happened."

Title: US is offering rewards of up to $5 million for info on Russian oligarchs' assets
Content: The US government is offering rewards of up to $5 million for anyone who can provide information leading to the seizure of assets belonging to Russian oligarchs. Under the program, assets can include yachts, jets, and properties situated in the US. The government has also provided names of 28 Russians, for which they are interested in receiving information.

Title: Condom sales surge in Russia amid Western sanctions & fear of shortage
Content: Amid Western sanctions and fear of shortage, sales for condoms have surged in Russia. The country’s largest online retailer Wildberries saw condom sales surging 170% in the first two weeks of March as compared with last year. Pharmacy chain 36.6 also reported a 26% jump in its sales. Meanwhile, a government official said a shortage of this product isn't expected.

Title: Jhunjhunwala purchased 12 apartments for ₹371 crore to build his new home: Report
Content: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala bought 12 apartments in Ridgeway Apartments Malabar Hill to build his new multi-storey home currently being built in Mumbai, Moneycontrol reported. He paid ₹176 crore in 2013 for the first six apartments and ₹195 crore in 2017 for the next six. Jhunjhunwala's new home will spread across 70,000 square feet and will also have a banquet hall.

Title: Jhunjhunwala's multi-storey mansion to have living room larger than 3BHK: Report
Content: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's 70,000 sq ft multi-storey Mumbai residence will have living and dining rooms larger than the size of 3BHK apartments in luxury projects, Moneycontrol reported. "His master bedroom of 731 square feet is 20% bigger than the average 2BHK," it added. The 4th floor will have a banquet hall and the 10th floor will have four guest bedrooms.

Title: India's forex reserves decline by $9.6 bn in biggest weekly drop in 2 yrs
Content: India's foreign exchange reserves declined by $9.646 billion to $622.275 billion in the week ending March 11, marking its biggest weekly drop in nearly two years, data shared by the Reserve Bank of India showed. The decline was on account of a fall in foreign currency assets (FCA), a major component of the overall reserves, which decreased by $11.108 billion.

Title: Future Retail to hold shareholder meeting to vote on Reliance deal in April
Content: Future Group companies, including Future Retail, have informed the stock exchanges that they will convene meetings of their respective shareholders and creditors in April to vote on the ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance Retail. The development comes amid Reliance Industries' takeover of Future's stores. Future has said it's committed to taking all actions for the reversal of takeover of stores.

Title: Elon Musk among witnesses in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's court case
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has been included in list of witnesses slated to testify in a defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Depp has alleged that Heard had an extra-marital affair with Musk and James Franco while they were married. Both Musk and Franco are scheduled to testify virtually during the trial next month.

Title: PayPal expands services for Ukrainian users, waives transaction fees
Content: PayPal said it is expanding services in Ukraine and Ukrainians will now be able to send and receive money from friends and family. Earlier, PayPal users in Ukraine could only send money internationally from their accounts and not receive it. PayPal is also waiving transaction fees for remittances to Ukrainian accounts.

Title: No proposal from RBI on crypto trading mechanism yet: Govt
Content: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Monday said the RBI has not yet proposed any mechanism for the trading of crypto assets. He said the cryptocurrency sector's legal framework "may be finalised only after all aspects are carefully examined". Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had earlier proposed a 30% tax on income earned from crypto transactions in Budget 2022.

Title: Renault resumes production at Moscow plant
Content: French automobile manufacturer Renault has resumed production at its plant in Moscow. Renault suspended operations at its car assembly plant in Moscow in late February due to logistics bottlenecks that caused component shortages. According to ratings agency Fitch, Renault generated 10% of its revenue and around 12% of its operating profit margin in the country in 2021.

Title: Working for Jeff Bezos was relentless, unforgiving: Former assistant
Content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' former executive assistant Ann Hiatt said working for Bezos was "relentless" and the environment could be "unforgiving". She told Insider, "In a single word (relentless), is who he is and who he wants his employees and...company to be." Notably, Bezos initially thought of naming the e-commerce giant 'Relentless.com' and the domain still leads to Amazon's website.

Title: Appalling and awful: UK FM on ferry firm firing 800 staff over Zoom
Content: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said the way that P&O Ferries has treated its workers is appalling and awful. The UK-based ferry company last week fired 800 employees without any warning over a Zoom video. According to a report by Sunday Times, several government ministers were aware of the company's plans to fire employees before P&O Ferries' staff was informed.

Title: Saudi Aramco's net profit more than doubles to $110 billion in 2021
Content: Oil giant Saudi Aramco on Sunday reported that its annual net profit for 2021 has more than doubled amid soaring crude oil prices. Aramco said its net profit increased by 124% to $110 billion in 2021, compared to $49 billion in 2020. The company has further announced that it plans to boost its capital expenditure to $40-$50 billion this year.

Title: Working to improve tax literacy & number of taxpayers: CBDT chief
Content: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said the Income Tax department is working to improve the "abysmally poor" tax literacy in the country to increase the number of taxpaying entities and enhance collections. "Banks have invested in expanding the banking knowledge of the people. That thing has not happened in (income) tax and that is on top of our mind," he said.

Title: Govt plans to merge BBNL and BSNL this month: BSNL chief
Content: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) Chairman and MD PK Purwar said the government has decided to merge BSNL and Bharat Broadband Nigam Limited (BBNL) this month. He added that the government has given BSNL an opportunity to turnaround their losses. With the proposed merger, BSNL will get 5.67 lakh kilometre of optical fibre network laid across 1.85 lakh village panchayats.

Title: Indian firms may replace Western pharma companies leaving Russian market: Russia
Content: Indian firms may replace Western pharmaceutical companies leaving the Russian market over Ukraine war, Russian envoy to India Denis Alipov told the Rossiya 24 broadcaster. The newly appointed Russian envoy added that India is a "world pharmacy". Earlier this month, Alipov had said that Moscow welcomed the independent foreign policy of India amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

Title: What could become costlier in India due to the war in Ukraine?
Content: Global prices of commodities and fuel have soared to unprecedented levels amid the war in Ukraine. Edible oil, food grains, corn could become costlier in India due to the war. Rare metals such as nickel, platinum, palladium, and gold could become costlier as Russia is one of the biggest exporters, and sanctions have stopped the metals from reaching global market.

Title: I-T dept makes highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22
Content: The Income Tax department has made the highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22, according to CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra. The direct tax collection numbers for current financial year stand at ₹13.63 lakh crore as against over ₹9 lakh crore in 2020-21, he said. "The year-on-year net collections today is more by 48.4% over 2020-21," he added.

Title: LG suspends all shipments to Russia amid war with Ukraine
Content: South Korean multinational conglomerate LG Electronics has announced that it's suspending all shipments to Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. LG added that it will continue to keep a close watch on the situation as it unfolds. "We are deeply concerned for the health and safety of all people, and LG remains committed to supporting humanitarian relief efforts," LG stated.

Title: Russian fast-food chain reveals logo nearly identical to McDonald's
Content: A Russian fast-food chain called Uncle Vanya has filed to trademark a logo that looks nearly identical to Golden Arches of McDonald's. The logo that shows the Cyrillic letter 'Ve', representing 'V' in Vanya, also uses the red and yellow colour scheme associated with McDonald's. After McDonald's shut 850 restaurants, Russia's State Duma suggested replacing it with Uncle Vanya.

Title: Ukrainian CEO featured in Forbes' rich list stays behind in Kharkiv to help rescuers
Content: A Ukrainian businessman, ranked among wealthiest Ukrainians, chose to stay back in Kharkiv to help local defenders and rescuers, a media report said. Vsevolod Kozhemyaka, CEO of Agrotrade Group, has been posting images and videos related to attacks on Kharkiv on Instagram. He was on the 88th spot in Forbes' list of 100 richest people in Ukraine in 2020.

Title: Want to shut all 800 restaurants but our Russian partner refused: Burger King owner
Content: Restaurant Brands International, the parent company of Burger King, said it wants to immediately shut all its 800 restaurants in Russia but its Russian joint venture partner has "refused" to do so.  "We can't unilaterally suspend operations" because it's a "complicated legal process", it added. Earlier, the company suspended corporate support for Russian locations amid Ukraine's invasion.

Title: 'Skip Intro' button used 136 mn times a day, saves users’ 195 years: Netflix
Content: In a blog post, Netflix has revealed that its 'Skip Intro' button is pressed about 136 million times each day, saving users across the world a cumulative time of 195 years. Explaining how the ‘Skip Intro’ feature was created five years ago, Netflix stated that 15% of the time customers were manually advancing the series within the first five minutes.

Title: ₹2,000 cash found at unicorn founder's home after 3-day I-T raid on Infra.Market
Content: The I-T department conducted a three-day raid at the offices of unicorn startup Infra.Market and the residences of Founders Souvik Sengupta and Aaditya Sharda. It found ₹2,000 in cash and jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh at Sengupta's residence and cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh each at Sharda's residence. No unaccounted cash or assets were found at its offices, Moneycontrol reported.

Title: This looks superb and so inviting: Mahindra on pics of new highway in Manipur
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has praised a new highway built in Manipur. Retweeting a post by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari that featured a few photos of the Wangjing-Khonkhang section of NH-39 in Manipur, Mahindra wrote, "This looks superb and so inviting. The magic of Manipur is now much more accessible. These highways will knit India together even more tightly."

Title: India & Sri Lanka sign agreement for a $1-billion line of credit
Content: The State Bank of India (SBI) will provide a $1-billion credit facility to Sri Lanka for the procurement of food, medicines and other essential items, the Union Finance Ministry said on Thursday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa in Delhi. The ministers discussed wide-ranging issues, the ministry added.

Title: Quess Corp Founder donates ₹105 cr to IISc to set up centre for public health
Content: Quess Corp Founder Ajit Isaac and his wife Sarah have committed ₹105 crore to establish a Centre for Public Health at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru. The centre will be a part of the postgraduate medical school and it will be operational by 2024. Earlier, Mindtree Co-founders donated ₹425 crore to IISc to establish the medical school.

Title: I don't know how to live: Russian oligarch after being sanctioned by EU, UK
Content: A Russian oligarch revealed that he doesn’t know how to live, days after he was sanctioned by the European Union and the UK. Mikhail Fridman, whose net worth was $14 billion before the war, is now worth around $10 billion. Fridman, a co-founder of the London investment firm LetterOne, added, "I don't understand the logic behind punishing me."

Title: Ferry firm that fired 800 workers on Zoom call can face unlimited fine: UK govt
Content: UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng wrote to P&O Ferries, a shipping company that fired 800 employees over a three-minute Zoom call. Kwarteng said failure to give sufficient notice of large-scale redundancies, via the Insolvency Service and the Redundancy Payment Service, "is a criminal offence and can lead to an unlimited fine". Meanwhile, protests erupted against P&O Ferries across UK ports.

Title: Ukrainian bridal gown brand is now making military nets, vests for soldiers
Content: A Ukrainian brand known for its wedding gowns is now also producing military nets and assault vests for the country's soldiers and medical workers amid the war with Russia. "Along with making brides around the globe happy, we are focused on saving our country," said Milla Nova's CEO Ulyana Kyrychuk. The CEO said they have already made 1,500 items.

Title: Businessman to give away free gas worth $1 million as prices hit record high in US
Content: US businessman Willie Wilson has announced that he would be giving away $1 million worth of gas free of cost to Cook County residents from March 24 as prices hit record high in the country. Earlier this week, several cars lined up at gas stations after he announced $200,000 worth of free gas at 10 stations in the city.

Title: Wealthy Russians have up to $214 billion stashed in Swiss bank accounts
Content: Wealthy Russians have stashed up to $214 billion in secretive Swiss bank accounts, the Swiss Bankers Association (SBA) has revealed. However, SBA said the amount of Russian wealth held in Switzerland was small compared with total assets held in the country. Switzerland "must do everything possible to turn off the money taps", Social Democrats' co-president Mattea Meyer said.

Title: Russian oligarch's superyacht stuck in Norway as no one is selling it fuel
Content: A superyacht owned by a Russian oligarch is stuck in a Norwegian port because no one is willing to sell it fuel in protest of the Ukraine war. The Ragnar is valued at $85 million and is owned by Vladimir Strzhalkovsky. Meanwhile, the yacht’s captain said that none of the crew is Russian and that such discrimination is "extremely unjust".

Title: Smoke from a huge fire at Walmart warehouse in US visible from space
Content: A plume of smoke emitted from a huge fire at a Walmart distribution centre in Plainfield, US, was so vast that it could be seen from space on Wednesday afternoon, Bloomberg said. A clip posted on Twitter by National Weather Service gave a satellite's-eye view of the smoke spreading across the surrounding area. Twenty-four fire departments are fighting the fire.

Title: Fortunes of US oil tycoons jump 10% to $239 billion amid Russia-Ukraine war
Content: The collective net worth of American oil and gas industrialists jumped nearly 10% to $239 billion since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Harold Hamm, the Co-founder of Continental Resources, moved up 28 places on Bloomberg's list of world's 500 richest people with $18.6 billion fortune. Meanwhile, Freeport LNG's Founder Michael Smith entered the list for the very first time.

Title: Adani Group exploring buying a stake in oil giant Saudi Aramco: Report
Content: Adani Group is exploring the possibility of buying a stake in oil gaint Saudi Aramco, Bloomberg reported. Billionaire Gautam Adani-led conglomerate has held preliminary talks on a range of potential cooperation and joint investment opportunities with Aramco and Public Investment Fund (PIF), the report said. Adani may offer PIF the opportunity to invest in infrastructure in India, it added.

Title: Best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair: Indra Nooyi
Content: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi said the best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair. In a video posted on LinkedIn, she added, "Don't wait to be invited because the invitation may never come. Actively seek out opportunities to participate and take every opportunity you can to share your talent and unique perspective."

Title: 800 employees fired by UK ferry firm in a 3-minute pre-recorded Zoom video
Content: UK ferry company P&O Ferries has fired 800 crew in a three-minute pre-recorded Zoom video, saying that its vessels will now "be primarily crewed by a third-party crew provider". "Your final day of employment is today," an executive said in the video. The company has denied claims that it sent security guards with handcuffs to take crew off the ships.

Title: TCS reappoints Rajesh Gopinathan as CEO and MD for five years
Content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reappointed Rajesh Gopinathan as its Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD) for five years. The company's board has also extended the term of Ganapathy Subramaniam as Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director to May 2024, as per its retirement age policy. Both Gopinathan and Subramaniam have held their respective positions since 2017.

Title: Suzuki Motor to invest ₹9,569 cr for EV production in India: Report
Content: Japan's Suzuki Motor plans to invest about ₹9,569 crore to produce electric vehicles and batteries in India, Reuters reported citing the Nikkei's report. Suzuki aims to build a new electric vehicle production line in India and start operations as early as 2025. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is visiting India on Saturday to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Title: Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD, CEO extended for 3 more months
Content: RBI on Thursday extended Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD and CEO for three more months with effect from March 25, the bank said. Ahuja was appointed as the interim MD and CEO on December 25 after former chief Vishwavir Ahuja's abrupt exit. In an unusual move, RBI also appointed an Additional Director on the bank's board.

Title: Direct tax collection in FY22 stands at ₹13.63 lakh cr: CBDT chief
Content: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said direct tax collection for FY22 outmatches revised estimates of ₹12.5 lakh crore after touching ₹13.63 lakh crore. He added that government's cumulative collection through tax deducted at source currently stood at ₹6.79 lakh crore and corporate tax collection stood at ₹7.19 lakh crore. "The numbers are more than what we expected," he said.

Title: Who are the world's 10 richest people & what are their net worths as per Hurun?
Content: Tesla's Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $205 billion wealth, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. He's followed by Jeff Bezos with $188 billion wealth and LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault with $153 billion wealth. Bill Gates is the 4th richest person and he's followed by Warren Buffett and Google Co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page.

Title: Mukesh Ambani only Indian to enter the top 10 in Hurun Global Rich List 2022
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani is the only Indian to feature among the top 10 people on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. With a 24% y-o-y increase in wealth, Ambani was ranked 9th among the world's billionaires, with his wealth estimated at $103 billion. Gautam Adani & family ranked 12th globally, with their wealth estimated at $81 billion.

Title: Adani added ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021: Hurun
Content: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani, who ranks 12th on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, added an average of ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021, Hurun said. With a net addition of $49 billion, Adani added the most amount of wealth among the world's billionaires. Adani & his family's total wealth is estimated at $81 billion.

Title: Hindustan Petroleum buys 2 million barrels of Russian crude oil: Report
Content: The Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd has bought two million barrels of Russian crude oil, PTI reported on Thursday. This comes after reports claimed that the Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) bought 3 million barrels of crude oil from Russia at a steep discount. IOC reportedly bought Urals crude for May delivery at a discount of $20-25 a barrel to dated Brent.

Title: If Putin is afraid to fight, I'll use only my left hand & I'm not left-handed: Musk
Content: World's richest man Elon Musk, who challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to "single combat" amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, tweeted, "If he (Putin) is afraid to fight, I will agree to use only my left hand and I am not even left-handed." Musk tweeted this after Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov told Musk, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's."

Title: Crypto produces 17 'known' billionaires worldwide: Hurun Rich List 2022
Content: Cryptocurrency has produced 17 "known" billionaires worldwide, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. The pack of 17 billionaires is led by Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance. He's followed by Bahamian cryptocurrency exchange FTX's CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase, is the world's third-richest crypto billionaire.

Title: Paytm's target price slashed to ₹450 by Macquarie citing 'tough times ahead'
Content: Macquarie has cut its target price for Paytm's parent company One97 Communications Ltd shares by about 36%, to ₹450 apiece, as it sees "tough times ahead" for the company. "With the RBI raising issues with Paytm Payments Bank and Chinese ownership being over 25%, the probability of Paytm getting a small finance banking licence is significantly lower now," Macquarie said.

Title: Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth now 4 times higher than Paytm CEO's
Content: India's richest self-made woman and Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth is now nearly four times higher than that of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, as per Forbes data. Sharma's fortune briefly fell below $1 billion on Wednesday, but currently stands at $1.1 billion. Meanwhile, Nayar's net worth stands at $4.9 billion. Both their companies went public in 2021.

Title: Musk to exit Miss Universe owner Endeavor's board, firm says 'he has little time'
Content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk will resign from the board of directors of Endeavor, with effect from June 30, 2022. "We know he has a lot of demands and little time and we appreciate the support he provided us," the company said. Endeavor owns the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and the Miss Universe pageant.

Title: Woman entrepreneur dies by suicide in balcony after cancer diagnosis in Karnataka
Content: Female entrepreneur Suma Sathish, who was reportedly the owner of a textile company, allegedly died by suicide in the balcony of her home in Karnataka's Mangaluru in the early hours of Tuesday. Police said she allegedly took the step after being diagnosed with cancer. A case has been registered at Barke Police station.

Title: Investors ₹19 lakh cr richer as Sensex adds over 5,000 points in 8 sessions
Content: The Sensex added more than 5,000 points and the Nifty50 gained over 1,400 points in the last eight sessions in a row, barring the March 15 trading, making investors ₹19 lakh crore richer, Moneycontrol reported on Thursday. On Thursday itself, investors' wealth increased by ₹4 lakh crore. This comes amid positive global cues, easing commodity prices and declining volatility.

Title: IDFC FIRST Bank's CEO gifts 5,00,000 shares to family of a deceased colleague
Content: IDFC FIRST Bank's MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 5,00,000 shares of the bank to family members of a deceased colleague. The deceased colleague was "closely known" to Vaidyanathan and the shares have been gifted to back the family's education and financial security, the bank said. Earlier, Vaidyanathan gifted shares to five people including his driver and househelp.

Title: Who are India's 10 richest people and what are their net worths as per Hurun?
Content: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person and 9th-richest worldwide with $103 billion wealth, as per 2022 Hurun Global Rich List. Adani & family are 2nd-richest in India, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family, Serum Institute's Cyrus Poonawalla and ArcelorMittal's Lakshmi Mittal. DMart's Radhakishan Damani & family are 6th richest in India and SP Hinduja & family 7th richest.

Title: Sensex ends 1,047 points higher at 57,864, logs best week in over a year
Content: The Sensex jumped 1,047 points on Thursday to close at 57,864 following gains in global markets, a day after US Federal Reserve's first interest rate hike in over three years. The Nifty 50 jumped 312 points to end at 17,287. HDFC and Reliance Industries were among top gainers. The Sensex and Nifty logged their best week in over a year.

Title: Sensex jumps 1,000 points after US Fed's 1st rate hike in 3 years
Content: Indian benchmark indices gained over 1.5% on Thursday, tracking gains in the global markets, following the US Federal Reserve's first rate hike in over three years. The Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to trade above 57,800, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 280 points to trade at 17,250 levels. HDFC and Kotak Mahindra Bank were among top gainers.

Title: India has world's 3rd highest number of self-made billionaires: Hurun
Content: As per the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, India ranks third in the list of self-made billionaires with 119 such individuals. These individuals have cumulative wealth of $474 billion. China has the most number of self-made billionaires at 1,050, with $3.756 trillion combined wealth, while the US stands second with 523 self-made billionaires, whose combined wealth is $3.554 trillion.

Title: China's richest billionaires gain $71 billion as stocks jump most since 2008
Content: The combined net worth of China's 75 richest billionaires surged by $71 billion on Wednesday as stocks across Hong Kong and China jumped the most since the 2008 financial crisis. Tencent's Pony Ma, NetEase's William Ding and Pinduoduo's Colin Huang, added over $5 billion each to their net worths, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

Title: Reliance's drastic action came as a surprise: Future Retail on stores' takeover
Content: Future Retail (FRL) has said it's committed to taking all actions "necessary to seek value adjustments and reversal of takeover of stores" by Reliance Industries (RIL). RIL's "drastic and unilateral action" to takeover stores came as a "surprise" to FRL, it added. It also complicated the positive scenario which was building up after the CCI order in December, FRL claimed.

Title: Consumers could lose invested money if they buy crypto assets: EU
Content: The European Union's securities, banking and insurance watchdogs in a joint statement warned that consumers risk losing all their money invested in cryptocurrency assets and could fall prey to scams. "Consumers should be alert to the risks of misleading advertisements, including via social media and influencers," the authorities said. They also mentioned energy consumption by some assets.

Title: Reliance, Ola Electric win bids under ₹18,100 cr PLI scheme: Reports
Content: Reliance Industries and Ola Electric will receive incentives under Centre's ₹18,100 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to boost local battery cell production, Reuters reported. Hyundai Motors and Indian jewellery maker Rajesh Exports have also won the bids. Ola Electric and Hyundai will get incentives for 20 Gwh capacity while Reliance and Rajesh Exports have won incentives for 5 Gwh.

Title: SC to hear Amazon's plea for protection of Future Retail's assets on Mar 23
Content: The Supreme Court will hear Amazon's application seeking relief against the alienation of Future Retail's assets on March 23. Amazon filed the plea after Reliance Industries began taking control of Future Retail's stores across India. The court proposed that Amazon can press for relief during proceedings before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre-governed tribunal.

Title: Moody's slashes India's FY22 GDP growth estimate from 9.5% to 9.1%
Content: Moody's has slashed India's GDP growth estimate for FY22 from 9.5% to 9.1%. According to the rating agency, the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war is expected to cost India a high fuel and fertiliser import bill in FY22, leading to reduced government spending and a reduction in India's GDP growth. Moody's has projected India's year-end inflation at 6.6% in FY22.

Title: COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia: ADB
Content: Lockdowns imposed due to the COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia, Asian Development Bank (ADB) said in a report. The job losses pushed 47 lakh people to extreme poverty last year as inequality widened and movement restrictions hit retail and informal sectors the hardest. "The pandemic's impact on poverty and unemployment will likely persist," ADB said.

Title: I-T Dept recovers ₹20 crore cash in raids on Omaxe's offices: Reports
Content: The Income Tax Department has recovered ₹20 crore in cash after conducting raids on various offices of realty firm Omaxe Limited, ANI reported. The department has also seized "accounts and sales documents which show more than ₹200 crore unaccounted transactions of the company". The raids, which started on Monday, are still underway at 38 out of 45 premises.

Title: 66 FDI proposals from neighbouring countries approved since Apr 2020: Govt
Content: India has received 347 foreign direct investment (FDI) proposals from neighbouring countries since April 2020, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Som Parkash said. The total value of the proposals is about ₹75,951 crore. The highest number of approved proposals, at eight, were from the electronics sector, followed by the automobile and chemicals sectors at seven and five respectively.

Title: Starbucks CEO to step down, Founder Howard Schultz to return as interim CEO
Content: Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson will step down from his role on April 4 and Founder Howard Schultz will take over as interim CEO, the company announced on Wednesday. "I feel this is a natural bookend to my 13 years with the company," Johnson said. He will continue in an advisory role to the company and its board through September.

Title: Ex-Fortis Healthcare Promoter Shivinder Singh's interim bail plea rejected by SC
Content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected former Fortis Healthcare Promoter Shivinder Singh's interim bail plea in a money laundering case, NDTV reported. Singh, who was arrested in December 2019, is accused of misappropriating ₹2,397 crore of Religare Finvest Limited's funds. Taking note of "serious allegations" and Singh being a "flight risk", SC rejected the interim bail plea.

Title: Govt has no plans to introduce cryptocurrency: MoS Finance
Content: The government is not planning to introduce a cryptocurrency that will be regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. Cryptocurrencies are currently unregulated in India, he added. ''RBI doesn't issue cryptocurrency. Traditional paper currency is a legal tender and is issued by RBI," he clarified.

Title: Zomato loans $150 mn to Blinkit, buys 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 mn
Content: Zomato is loaning $150 million to Blinkit (formerly Grofers) as per its plan of investing $400 million cash in Indian quick commerce over the next two years. The loan's interest rate will be 12% p.a. or higher with a tenor of not more than one year. Zomato is also acquiring a 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 million.

Title: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in Apr-Jun 2021 amid 2nd wave
Content: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in April-June 2021 from 9.3% in the previous quarter amid COVID-19's second wave, according to data released by the government. The rise in unemployment in the second quarter of 2021 was the first such increase since the jobless rate peaked at 20.8% in April-June 2020, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said.

Title: Elon Musk changes his Twitter name to 'Elona' as Putin's ally calls him effeminate
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk changed his Twitter name to 'Elona' after Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally and the Chechen Republic's head Ramzan Kadyrov mocked him as "effeminate". Kadyrov said, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's." "You'll need to pump up those muscles...to change from the gentle (effeminate) Elona into the brutal Elon you need to be," he added.

Title: India buying discounted crude oil from Russia does not violate US sanctions: US
Content: India taking up Russia's offer of discounted crude oil would not be a violation of US sanctions, the White House has said. "Our message to any country continues to be that abide by the sanctions that we have put in place and recommended," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at a press briefing on Tuesday.

Title: Russia threatened to arrest McDonald's, IBM execs who criticised govt: WSJ
Content: Russian prosecutors issued warnings to McDonald's, IBM and Yum! Brands threatening to arrest corporate leaders for criticising the government, the Wall Street Journal reported. The companies that are withdrawing from Russia amid Ukraine's invasion were also warned that their assets could be seized. Yum! Brands, which operates KFC and Pizza Hut, and McDonald's have suspended operations in Russia.

Title: It'll be support for invasion: US on if India buys discounted crude oil from Russia
Content: On being asked about possibility that India could take up Russian offer of discounted crude oil, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "Think where you want to stand when history books are written in this moment in time." "Support for Russian leadership is support for invasion that is having a devastating impact," she further said.

Title: Tata Communications becomes Formula 1's official broadcast connectivity provider
Content: Formula 1 and Tata Communications on Wednesday announced a multi-year strategic collaboration under which Tata will be F1's official broadcast connectivity provider. Tata Communications will facilitate transfer of over 100 video feeds and 250 audio channels from the racetrack to F1's Media & Technology Centre in the UK. F1 and Tata had ended their eight-year marketing partnership in January 2020.

Title: Chinese stocks jump the most since 2008 after $1.5 tn wiped out in two days
Content: Stocks across Hong Kong and China witnessed a massive rally after China's state council vowed to keep its stock market stable following a $1.5-trillion wipeout over the past two sessions. The Hang Seng China Enterprises Index jumped 13% on Wednesday, its biggest gain since the global financial crisis of 2008. Chinese technology firms including Alibaba and Tencent gained over 23%.

Title: Alibaba, Tencent lose over $1 trillion in market value over a year
Content: Chinese technology giants Alibaba and Tencent have lost more than $1 trillion in combined market value over the last 13 months. The stocks of Chinese tech companies plunged over the past year as the government extended its regulatory crackdown. While food delivery platform Meituan's market value has plunged by $254.6 billion since February 2021, e-commerce platform Pinduoduo lost $217.6 billion.

Title: Russia's space chief, who called Musk 'little devil', invited him home 6 months ago
Content: Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin, who called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "little devil" after he challenged President Vladimir Putin for a single combat, praised Musk six months ago. Rogozin even invited Musk to his home in Russia in September and said he'd "already set the teakettle on heat". Rogozin wanted to discuss "exploring the universe" with Musk.

Title: Paytm share price drops 71% from IPO price; out of BSE top-100 mcap list
Content: Paytm shares dropped to an all-time low of ₹616.55 apiece on Tuesday, leading it to drop out of the BSE top 100-most valued companies by market capitalisation. Following RBI's order on Paytm Payments Bank, its shares crashed 20% in the last two trading sessions. Notably, its share price has dropped 71% from its issue price of ₹2,150 apiece.

Title: Amazon's demand for $200 mn caused Amazon-Future settlement talks to fail: Report
Content: The dispute settlement talks between Amazon and India's Future Retail failed over the US company's demand for the return of at least $200 million it had invested in Future, Reuters reported. Future instead offered a stake of an equivalent amount in one of its remaining group companies after Reliance takes over most of its retail assets. Amazon didn't accept that.

Title: SoftBank's Munish Varma steps down from Paytm, PolicyBazaar boards
Content: Paytm on Tuesday informed stock exchanges that Munish Varma, Managing Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers, has resigned from Paytm's board "due to personal commitments and other pre-occupations". He has also resigned from Policybazaar's board. Varma's resignation is consistent with Softbank's move globally, as it steps away from board positions after its portfolio companies get listed.

Title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly loses billionaire status
Content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly fell off the list of billionaires on Wednesday, according to Forbes' data, amid volatility in the stock's price movement. The stock recovered some losses on Wednesday after falling 70% below its IPO price in four months. Sharma's current net worth stands at $1.1 billion, as per Forbes' real-time data.

Title: Air travel may get costlier as ATF prices hit all-time highs after 18% hike
Content: Air travel may get costlier as aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices were hiked by over 18%, the steepest ever increase, to all-time high levels on Wednesday. The prices crossed the ₹1-lakh-per-kilolitre mark for the first time ever after the sixth straight hike this year. Jet fuel makes up for almost 40% of the running cost of an airline.

Title: Mukesh Ambani's grandson Prithvi seen for first 1st time in public, pics surface
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani’s grandson, Prithvi Akash Ambani, was on Tuesday spotted for the first time in public with his mother Shloka Ambani at his nursery school in Mumbai. Prithvi was seen at Sunflower School in Malabar Hill, the same school where both his parents went for their schooling. Akash Ambani and Shloka Mehta had got married in 2019.

Title: Indian Oil Corporation buys 3 mn barrels of Russian Urals oil amid sanctions: Reports
Content: Amid sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine war, Indian Oil Corporation bought 3 million barrels of Russian Urals oil from Geneva-based trader Vitol for May delivery, said sources. Vitol reportedly sold the cargoes at a discount of $20-$25/barrel to dated Brent. IOC didn't see any issue with the purchase as it wasn't dealing with a sanctioned entity, added sources.

Title: Amazon's $8.5-billion MGM deal cleared by EU antitrust regulator
Content: The European Union's antitrust regulator has approved Amazon's proposed $8.5-billion acquisition of MGM Studios after concluding that the transaction "won't raise competition concerns" in Europe. Their combined market shares are low and they have strong rivals, the regulator noted. The deal, which is Amazon's second-biggest acquisition, is still pending approval by the US Federal Trade Commission.

Title: Sensex jumps 1,040 points to end at 56,817; Nifty above 16,900
Content: The Indian benchmark indices recouped the previous day's losses to end in the green on Wednesday amid positive global cues. The Sensex jumped nearly 1,040 points to close at 56,817, while the broader Nifty 50 also surged 312 points to end at 16,975. Ultratech Cement and Axis Bank were among top Sensex gainers, while Paytm ended 7% higher.

Title: PNB reports fraud of over ₹2,000 crore in NPA account of ITPCL
Content: The Punjab National Bank on Tuesday reported a fraud of ₹2,060 crore in the NPA account of IL&FS Tamil Nadu Power Company Ltd (ITPCL). The bank said it has already made provisions amounting to ₹824.1 crore as per prescribed prudential norms. In February, Punjab & Sind Bank had declared IL&FS Tamil Nadu a fraud account with dues of ₹148 crore.

Title: Sensex jumps 900 points in early trade, Nifty above 16,900
Content: The Indian benchmark indices opened higher on Wednesday amid positive global cues. In early trade, the Sensex jumped more than 900 points to trade near 56,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 250 points to trade above 16,900 levels. Banks and financials, including IndusInd Bank and Axis Bank, were among top Sensex gainers.

Title: Amazon's ad campaign laughable, attempt to confuse Indian govt: CAIT
Content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said it finds Amazon's claims in a paid public advertisement "sanctimonious and laughable". "They are nothing but a pathetic attempt at buying media legitimacy and confusing the Indian government...about Amazon's persistent violations of India's FDI laws," it added. The traders' body further said the contents of the public notice are mala fide.

Title: ₹7.34 lakh crore recovered by banks since FY16: MoS Finance
Content: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad on Tuesday said banks have recovered ₹7,34,542 crore in the last six financial years and in the first six months of FY22. This includes recoveries in cases of non-performing assets and written-off loan accounts. He added that systematic and comprehensive checking led to unearthing of frauds perpetrated over the years.

Title: Will make calibrated interventions to keep fuel prices under control: Govt
Content: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Tuesday said the government will make "calibrated interventions" to keep domestic fuel prices under control and "safeguard the interests of the common man". He added that retail prices of diesel and petrol have not been revised since November 2021. Fuel VAT has been reduced by many state governments too.

Title: India had 8.22 cr taxpayers in FY20, will identify more soon: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India had 8,22,83,407 taxpayers in FY20 out of the total projected population of 136.30 crore (as on March 1, 2021). This includes persons who pay income tax and corporate tax. "The (tax) department seeks to bring more non-filers into the tax net by formulating region-specific strategies...for identifying potential non-filers," she added.

Title: Kerala Assembly passes unanimous resolution against LIC IPO
Content: The Kerala Legislative Assembly on Wednesday passed a unanimous resolution against the Centre's decision to sell its stakes in insurance company LIC. The resolution, which was moved by Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, urged the Centre to retain its stake in the institution. Vijayan recalled that LIC was nationalised with an aim to protect stakeholders from the exploitation of private companies.

Title: We're broke, Amazon is driving us to our knees: Future Group to Supreme Court
Content: After Amazon objected to Reliance Industries' takeover of several Future Retail stores, the Kishore Biyani-led group told the Supreme Court, "We are broke, we have no money. Amazon is driving us to the knees." "Rents haven't been paid for 2 years...Landlords terminated leases and we had no money to pay them. Reliance signed up with landlords," Future's lawyer said.

Title: Musk shares old fake pic of Putin riding a bear, says he can bring it to fight him
Content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has shared an old photoshopped picture of Russian President Vladimir Putin riding a bear after challenging him to single combat. In response to Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin's tweet, Musk wrote, "He can even bring his bear." Earlier, Rogozin quoted a Russian poet's verse to call Musk a "little devil".

Title: 'Musk-Putin's fight will be over in 10 secs' says Twitter user; Musk says 'pretty much'
Content: Elon Musk responded "pretty much" to a Twitter user who claimed Musk and Russian President Vladimir Putin's "fight" would be over in 10 seconds. The user said, "It'd just depend on how much damage Elon would want to do (and) how fast. Nothing else...Elon is also 19 years younger." This comes after Musk challenged Putin to single combat for Ukraine.

Title: Ukraine's economy could shrink as much as 35% in 2022 if war continues: IMF
Content:
Ukraine's economy may contract by 10% in 2022, assuming there's a "prompt
resolution of the war" with Russia, the International Monetary Fund said in a report. If the war continues, Ukraine's economy could shrink by 25% to 35%, the IMF added, citing wartime real GDP data from Iraq, other countries. Ukraine is set to experience a "deep recession", it stated.

Title: Little devil, you're weak: Russian space chief to Musk on combat challenge to Putin
Content: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to single combat, Russian space agency Roscosmos' head Dmitry Rogozin replied with a verse by Alexander Pushkin calling Musk a "little devil". Quoting the poet, Rogozin wrote, "You, little devil, are still young. You're weak to compete with me; it'd only be a waste of time. Overtake my brother first."

Title: 700 investors face I-T dept's scrutiny for unaccounted crypto transactions: Report
Content: India's I-T department is reportedly planning to issue notices to 700 investors over high-value crypto transactions. "We've a long list of people who were transacting in crypto assets but weren't paying tax...[We've] shortlisted about 700 transactions, where tax liability is very high," an official told The Economic Times. They're likely to face 30% tax, penalty and interest, the report said.

Title: Amazon accuses Future Retail, Reliance Industries of 'fraud' in newspaper ads
Content: Amazon on Tuesday took out ads in newspapers, accusing Future Retail and Reliance Industries of "fraud" after Reliance took over several Future stores. Amazon and Future are currently engaged in a legal battle over the ₹24,713-crore Future-Reliance deal. In the ads, Amazon said, "These actions have been done in a clandestine manner by playing a fraud on...constitutional courts in India."

Title: Reliance is acting outside the litigation & taking over stores: Future to Supreme Court
Content: Amid the legal dispute with Amazon, Future Retail told the Supreme Court, "Reliance is acting outside the litigation. Reliance is taking over [stores]...We can't do anything." "Not one store has been surrendered. Reliance took away the boards as they're entitled to...our assets are where they are," it said. Landlords terminated stores' leases after Future didn't pay rents, the company added.

Title: Paytm shares tank another 8% after report on Paytm Payments Bank data leak
Content: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares tanked another 8% on Tuesday even as its CEO denied a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities. On Monday, the shares fell around 13%. "It is an absolutely malicious story...We have no server that is outside India," CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma clarified.

Title: Paytm says RBI order on Paytm Payments Bank 'won't impact overall business'
Content: After RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers, its parent company, One 97 Communications, in a stock exchange filing on Tuesday said that the measure "will not materially impact Paytm’s overall business." On Monday, Paytm Payments Bank also dismissed a report that claimed that RBI’s action was taken as the bank was sharing information with China-based entities.

Title: I launched it 6 months ago: Ashneer day after BharatPe unveils gold loan services
Content: After BharatPe launched gold loan services for merchant partners, its former founder Ashneer Grover accused CEO Suhail Sameer of taking credit for his segment. He said, "The Gold Loan business was launched by me and Nikhilesh 6 months back...Suhail had no contribution...and is selling lies as he hasn't been able to launch...things which I had planned in last 3 months."

Title: Zomato, Blinkit sign term-sheet for merger: Reports
Content: Online food delivery firm Zomato and online grocer Blinkit, formerly known as Grofers, have reportedly signed a term-sheet for a merger, reports said. The two companies are likely to approach the Competition Commission of India for an approval soon. Zomato currently owns about 10% stake in Blinkit and may reportedly invest more into the cash-strapped startup until the merger closes.

Title: Supertech's Noida twin towers to be demolished in 9 secs using over 2,500 kg explosives
Content: Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida's Sector 93A will be demolished in nine seconds on May 22 using explosives, said officials. The demolition ordered by Supreme Court will require around 2,500-4,000 kg of explosives, which will be loaded into the structure in 12-15 days. Around 1,500 households in the vicinity will be moved out for around five hours that day.

Title: Billionaire's 31-yr-old son killed by boat propeller while trying to save fiancée in US
Content: Juan Carlos Escotet Alviarez, the 31-year-old son of a Venezuelan banking billionaire, died while trying to save his fiancée during a fishing competition in Florida, US over the weekend. Alviarez dived into the water to save his fiancée after she fell off the boat. After entering the water, Alviarez was struck by a boat propeller and died from his injuries.

Title: A year after Suez Canal blocking, another giant Evergreen ship runs aground in US
Content: A year after a giant container ship got stuck in the Suez Canal for nearly a week and disrupted global trade, another Evergreen Marine Corp vessel has run aground. The 334-metre vessel was en route to Virginia when it got stuck in US' Chesapeake Bay. It "isn't preventing other ships from transiting to the Port of Baltimore", an official said.

Title: China's richest billionaires lose over $52 billion in a day as stocks plunge
Content: The combined net worth of China's 78 richest tycoons fell by over $52 billion in a day as Chinese stocks plunged on Monday. Bottled water company Nongfu Spring's Founder and the country's richest person Zhong Shanshan lost the most, with his fortune declining by $5 billion. Tencent's Pony Ma saw his net worth drop by $3.3 billion to $35.2 billion.

Title: Air India has 2,657 pending cases in Indian and international courts: Govt
Content: Air India has 2,657 cases pending against it in Indian and international courts, VK Singh, the Minister of State for Civil Aviation, informed Rajya Sabha on Monday. These cases related to issues such as employee service matters, consumer complaints and commercial matters. "These cases are against Air India as a legal entity and will remain with Air India," Singh said.

Title: Pizza topping is not pizza, it'll attract 18% GST: Haryana appellate authority
Content: A pizza topping is not pizza and hence it should attract a higher GST of 18%, the Haryana Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling (AAAR) stated in a recent ruling. It noted that a pizza topping can't be classified as "processed cheese" because it has other ingredients like vegetable oil. Pizza topping would merit classification as "food preparation", the authority said.

Title: I knew only two words in English when I first arrived in Bombay: Anil Agarwal
Content: Anil Agarwal, the 68-year-old billionaire Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources, tweeted, "When I first arrived in Bombay, I knew only two words in English, 'yes' and 'no'." He said, "I held on to my dreams of making it big." He added, "I came to know a cable company was on the brink of bankruptcy...I started dreaming about acquiring that company."

Title: Japanese billionaire who flew to space buys robotics startup Groove X
Content: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa-owned fund has acquired a majority stake in robotics startup Groove X and will move to full ownership in April. The startup's product 'Lovot', an amalgam of "love" and "robot", has wheels and resembles a penguin with cartoonish human eyes, and communicates in squeaks. Maezawa spent 12 days on the International Space Station last year.

Title: Reliance buys assets of battery maker Lithium Werks for ₹467 cr
Content: Reliance Industries has acquired the assets of battery maker Lithium Werks for ₹467 crore through its subsidiary Reliance New Energy. The acquired assets include Lithium Werks' portfolio of about 219 patents, a manufacturing facility in China, key business contracts and existing employees. Earlier in December, Reliance agreed to buy UK-based sodium-ion battery company Faradion for ₹1,000 crore.

Title: Bentley to roll out one electric car annually for 5 years from 2025
Content: Luxury carmaker Bentley plans to build a new electric car annually for five years from 2025. Bentley, which is targeting to be end-to-end carbon-neutral by 2030, recorded an operating profit of $427 million for 2021, which was $405 million more than in 2020. Bentley's deliveries jumped 31% to 14,659 cars on demand for new hybrid models.

Title: Nearly 6,000 MSMEs got shut down during FY21 and FY22: Govt
Content: Minister of State for MSMEs Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma on Monday said 5,907 MSMEs got shut down in FY21 and FY22. In FY21, 330 MSMEs got shut down, which increased nearly 17-fold in FY22 to 5,577 MSMEs. Maharashtra topped the chart with 1,608 MSME shutdowns, followed by 527 in Bihar, 521 in Tamil Nadu and 442 in Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Jack Ma's Ant sells shares in China tech outlet 36Kr Holdings
Content: Billionaire Jack Ma's Ant has sold its entire stake in China-based tech outlet 36Kr Holdings, a regulatory filing showed. Ant held about 18% of 36Kr Holdings as of early 2021, Bloomberg data revealed. The shares of Alibaba, which owns a third of Ant, fell 10% in New York on Monday, while 36Kr Holdings tumbled 12%.

Title: Radicon Vedantam's Greater Noida office sealed for non-payment to homebuyers
Content: The office of realty firm Radicon Vedantam in Greater Noida's Sector 16C has been sealed for failing to pay ₹4 crore to homebuyers. "We'll seal the offices of other realty firms tomorrow if they don't clear homebuyers' payments,” said VP Mishra, Tehsildar of Dadri. Properties of different developers are likely to be auctioned too for failing to hand over possession.

Title: Bank frauds fell from ₹61,229 cr in FY17 to ₹648 cr in Apr-Dec 2021: Govt
Content: Bank frauds recorded a sharp decline over the past five years to ₹648 crore in the first nine months of FY22, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said on Monday. They stood at ₹61,229 crore in FY17 and at ₹11,583 crore in FY21. According to Karad, improved detection and reporting along with comprehensive steps resulted in the decline.

Title: ED attached wrong properties of ex-Amrapali Director: Auditor to SC
Content: Forensic auditor Pawan Agarwala told the Supreme Court that the Enforcement Directorate has attached wrong properties of Amrapali Group's ex-Director Prem Mishra. These properties need to be detached and auctioned off to generate funds for stalled projects' construction, Agarwala said. SC had directed ED to investigate alleged money laundering by realtors, including Amrapali Group.

Title: Do you agree to this fight?: Musk to Putin after challenging him to single combat for Ukraine
Content: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday in a tweet tagged the President of Russia's official Twitter account and asked, "Do you agree to this fight?" In an earlier tweet, Musk had said, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Did you think this through?", Musk responded, "I am absolutely serious."

Title: I hereby challenge Putin to single combat, stakes are Ukraine: Elon Musk
Content: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Will you be surprised when he (Russian President Putin) accepts your challenge?", Musk responded, "That would be an honour." Musk's tweet garnered users' reactions like, "Go to bed Elon," and "I need some of what you're drinking."

Title: I still own & won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge: Elon Musk
Content: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I still own and won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge." However, he added, "As a general principle...It's generally better...to own physical things like a home or stock in companies you think make good products...than dollars when inflation is high." Bitcoin, Ether and Doge prices saw a brief spike after Musk's tweet.

Title: Retail inflation rises to 8-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022
Content: India's retail inflation rose to an eight-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022, government data showed on Monday. This is the second successive month that retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The retail inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), stood at 6.01% for the month of January in 2022.

Title: Tata Sons chief N Chandrasekaran appointed as Air India chairman
Content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran was appointed as the chairman of Air India on Monday. His appointment comes a month after he was given a five-year extension in his term as Tata Sons’ Executive Chairman. Meanwhile, Air India is currently looking for a new CEO after the former Chairman of Turkish Airlines Ilker Ayci declined to be Air India's CEO.

Title: How could you say no to this?: Rishad Premji on US author's letter to Monroe
Content: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji tweeted a letter written by Nobel Prize-winning US author John Steinbeck, to actress Marilyn Monroe in 1955, asking her for an autographed photo for his nephew-in-law. "He's already your slave...This would make him mine...If you'll do this, I'll like you very much," Steinbeck wrote. Premji tweeted, "How could you say no to a letter like this?"

Title: iPhone supplier Foxconn halts production in China's Shenzhen amid COVID-19 curbs
Content: Apple iPhone supplier Foxconn on Monday said that it has suspended operations until further notice in China's Shenzhen city after authorities imposed lockdown measures in the tech hub city amid rising COVID-19 cases. Foxconn added it would deploy backup plants to reduce the disruption to production. On Sunday, China reported over 3,000 new daily cases, its highest in two years.

Title: Russia offering oil at heavy discount, India looking to buy it: Report
Content: India is considering taking up a Russian offer to buy its crude oil and other commodities at discounted prices, Reuters reported. India, which imports 80% of its oil needs, usually buys about 2% to 3% of its supplies from Russia. "Russia is offering oil and other commodities at a heavy discount. We'll be happy to take that," an official said.

Title: Do not fear: Sea's secretive billionaire CEO to staff on tech firm losing $150 bn value
Content: Forrest Li, the 44-year-old secretive billionaire CEO of Singapore-based technology firm Sea Ltd, which owns e-commerce platform Shopee, mobile game Garena Free Fire among other businesses, wrote a 900-word memo to his employees. The memo addressed a $150-billion plunge in his company's value since late 2021. He wrote, "This drop is painful...Do not fear: We're in a strong position internally."

Title: Have no server outside India: CEO denies report of Paytm Payments Bank data leak
Content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma dismissed a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities. He said, "Absolutely false...The RBI in its letter didn't raise concern over any leak of data...We have no server that is outside India, and no foreign national has any access to our servers."

Title: Paytm shares fall to all-time low of ₹672 after RBI curbs on Paytm Payments Bank
Content: The shares of Paytm fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE in Monday's early deals. This comes after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers until its audit is done. The stock has declined around 70% compared to its issue price of ₹2,150 per share.

Title: I was there, police were in awe of his humility: Innov8 founder on Paytm CEO's arrest
Content: Amid reports of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma being arrested for alleged rash driving in February, the founder of Innov8 has come forward as a witness. Dr Ritesh Malik tweeted, "There was no arrest, no negligent driving...the car didn't even have a scratch. I was there and saw...how he managed the situation was fantastic...Police were in awe of his humility."

Title: Completely false: Paytm Payments Bank on report of leaking data to Chinese firms
Content: Paytm Payments Bank denied a report that claimed that it was punished by the RBI for allegedly sharing information with China-based entities that indirectly own a stake in Paytm Payments Bank. "The report is completely false and simply sensationalising," the company said. Notably, China's Alibaba Group Holding and its affiliate, Jack Ma's Ant Group, own shares of Paytm.

Title: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna sent to 14-day judicial custody in co-location scam
Content: A Delhi court on Monday sent former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna to 14-day judicial custody in the co-location case. Ramkrishna, who has been accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', was arrested by the CBI a few days back. Earlier, CBI had demanded 14-day custody of Ramkrishna saying that she had been "evasive in her replies".

Title: Russian court allows Peppa Pig piracy without punishment after Western sanctions
Content: A Russian court has ruled that Peppa Pig's trademarks can be used by Russian businesses without punishment. Entertainment One, which owns the rights of the cartoon character had asked for 40,000 roubles in compensation from a Russian entrepreneur who had drawn his own version of the character. The court dismissed the case citing "unfriendly actions of US and affiliated countries."

Title: Adani, Piramal among 14 firms looking to buy Anil Ambani's Reliance Capital: Report
Content: Adani Finserve, KKR, Piramal Finance and Poonawalla Finance are among the 14 prominent firms that have expressed interest in buying debt-ridden Reliance Capital promoted by Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, PTI reported on Sunday. The last date for submission of bids for the firm was extended to March 25. Last year, RBI superseded Reliance Capital's board in view of payment defaults.

Title: Not a VIP, won't be given special facilities in jail: Court denies home food for Chitra
Content: A Delhi court remarked that former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is "not a VIP" and won't be provided special facilities during her 14-day judicial custody. Denying her home-cooked food, it said, "There are inmates who are in their 70s, who eat Tihar jail food. I have myself eaten Tihar...food. It’s good...VIP prisoners want everything...Every accused, every prisoner is the same."

Title: Sensex ends 935 points higher at 56,486, Nifty settles at 16,871
Content: The Sensex on Monday climbed 935 points or 1.68% to settle at 56,486, while Nifty 50 jumped 241 points or 1.45% higher to close at 16,871. While Infosys was the top Nifty gainer as it rose close to 4%, Paytm shares fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE on Monday.

Title: Maggi, coffee, tea to get costlier as Nestlé, HUL hike prices: Report
Content: Nestlé products like Maggi noodles, Nescafé coffee and Hindustan Unilever Ltd's (HUL) BRU coffee, Taj Mahal tea and Brooke Bond tea will get costlier as the two companies have increased the prices of some of their products, CNBC-TV18 reported on Monday. Maggi noodles are set to get costlier by 9-16%, it added. Taj Mahal tea prices were hiked by 3.7-5.8%.

Title: Sanctions have frozen almost $300 bn of Russia's gold, forex reserves
Content: Sanctions imposed on Russia have frozen around $300 billion of $640 billion that Russia had in its gold and forex reserves, Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said on Sunday. He added that the West was also pressuring China to limit its trade with Russia. Siluanov said Russia will pay roubles to its debt holders until reserves are unfrozen, RIA reported.

Title: Govt hasn't agreed to set up regulator for crypto investments: MoS Finance
Content: The government has not agreed to set up a regulatory authority for investments in cryptocurrencies, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. On being asked about policies regarding misleading crypto ads, he replied that the government and the RBI have been cautioning investors about potential economic, financial, legal, and security related risks.

Title: LIC reports ₹235 crore net profit in Q3 ahead of IPO
Content: IPO-bound LIC's net profit rose from ₹94 lakh in Q3 FY21 to ₹234.9 crore in Q3 FY22 while its net profit between April-December 2021 rose to ₹1,643 crore from ₹7 crore reported last year. First year premiums during Q3 rose 10% YoY to ₹8,748 crore. LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares in the upcoming IPO, its draft papers said.

Title: India's wholesale inflation rises to 13.11% in February 2022
Content: Wholesale inflation in India rose 828 basis points YoY from 4.83% in February 2021 to 13.11% in February 2022, as per Commerce Ministry's data. Wholesale inflation was at 12.96% in January 2022. The Ministry said high inflation in February was caused by rising prices of mineral oils, metals, crude petroleum, natural gas and food articles, among other commodities.

Title: LIC IPO likely to be launched in mid-May: Reports
Content: LIC's IPO may be postponed to mid-May amid rising market volatility due to the Russia-Ukraine war, Moneycontrol reported. India NSE Volatility Index was at about 26 in Mumbai on Monday, 11 points above the required 15 to launch the IPO. If the IPO is not launched before May 12, a new IPO prospectus will have to be filed by LIC.

Title: I-T dept conducts searches at real estate group Omaxe's premises
Content: The Income Tax Department on Monday conducted searches at premises of real estate group Omaxe. At least 30 locations in Delhi-NCR and few others in Uttar Pradesh and Punjab are being searched on charges of tax evasion, officials said. Searches conducted by the department are linked to alleged irregularities and concealment of income by the company.

Title: Govt can float LIC IPO without fresh filing till May 12: Reports
Content: The government has time till May 12 to float the LIC IPO without filing fresh papers with SEBI, PTI reported. If the deadline is missed, the government will have to file fresh papers with Q3 FY22 results and an updated embedded value. "We're watching the volatility and will file the red herring prospectus giving price band soon," an official said.

Title: Cooperative sector to contribute hugely in $5 trillion economy goal: Amit Shah
Content: Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the cooperative sector is going to make the largest contribution to PM Narendra Modi's aim of making India a $5 trillion economy. He said a strong cooperative sector will also help realise the dream of Aatmanirbhar Bharat. He added that the cooperative sector will benefit several crore people associated with it.

Title: Interest rate on EPF deposits reduced to 8.1% for 2021-22, lowest in 44 years
Content: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1% from 8.5% in 2020-21. This is the lowest since 1977-78, when the EPF interest rate was 8%. The decision was taken at the 230th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees Employees' Provident Fund.

Title: Tina Ambani shares pics from son Anmol Ambani's wedding featuring Bachchan family
Content: Businessman Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani took to Instagram on Friday to share pictures from the wedding of their son Anmol Ambani to Khrisha Shah. "A new chapter begins for Anmol and Khrisha with blessings from friends and family - the wedding," she wrote in the caption of the post. One of the photos features Amitabh Bachchan and his family.

Title: World's largest brewer stops sale of Budweiser in Russia, to forfeit JV profits
Content: Anheuser-Busch InBev has asked its partner in Russia, Anadolu Efes, to suspend the sale and production of Budweiser beer in the country. The world's largest brewer said it will also forfeit "all financial benefit from the joint venture operations". The announcement comes after Heineken NV and Carlsberg A/S said they would stop producing and selling their beers in Russia.

Title: Largest food company Nestlé stops exports of non-essential items to Russia
Content: World's largest food company Nestlé has stopped exporting and importing non-essential food items from and to Russia. The company will still supply Russians with necessities such as baby food, cereal and therapeutic pet food sold at veterinarian clinics. "We are shocked and deeply saddened by the invasion of Ukraine...[It] has brought heartbreaking, unimaginable human suffering," the company said.

Title: Meta cuts on-site perks including free laundry, valet service for employees
Content: Meta Platforms, Facebook's parent company, has informed its employees about cutting down various on-site perks including free laundry, dry cleaning and valet service. The company also announced that it would delay the free dinner time from 6 pm to 6:30 pm. While Meta offered a remote work option, many employees are scheduled to return to the office on March 28.

Title: Anand Mahindra shares video of Cong leader Deora's music performance, calls him 'cool'
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video featuring Congress leader Milind Deora, where the latter can be seen playing the guitar onstage at the Mahindra Blues Festival. Mahindra also mentioned that Deora goes by the stage name of MD Mississippi. He wrote, "His party is the INC, & with him, the 'C' stands for Cool!"

Title: Paytm Payments Bank stopped by RBI from onboarding new customers
Content: RBI has directed Paytm Payments Bank Ltd to stop onboarding of new customers with immediate effect. "The bank has also been directed to appoint an IT audit firm to conduct a comprehensive System Audit of its IT system," an order read. "Onboarding of new customers...will be subject to specific permission granted by RBI after reviewing report of...IT auditors," it said.

Title: Ashneer Grover denies owning ₹10-cr dining table, says 'It's not even worth 0.5% of that'
Content: Ashneer Grover has denied a report claiming he spent ₹10 crore on a dining table, saying, "It's not even worth 0.5% of that". He tweeted, "Is it a space rocket? Is it a time machine?...I don't hold Guinness World Record for the most expensive table...Press – don't fall for BharatPe Board (undisclosed sources) lies – you'll lose credibility like them."

Title: He could've funded it himself: Lawyer on Musk's 'taking Tesla private' tweet
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer told a US court the billionaire is rich enough that he could've funded Tesla's going-private transaction himself. He was referring to Musk's 2018 tweet claiming he was considering taking Tesla private and that he had secured the funding. The lawyer said, "None of Musk's deals have ever had a funding issue...[He has] great personal resources."

Title: Reports on CEO's arrest for rash driving exaggerated, no harm caused: Paytm
Content: Responding to reports of Paytm founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's arrest and subsequent bail in a case of rash driving in February, a company spokesperson called it a "minor incident". The spokesperson added that no harm was caused to any person or property due to it and that media reports claiming the nature of the arrest are exaggerated.

Title: Paytm Payments Bank issues statement after RBI bars it from taking new customers
Content: A day after RBI directed Paytm Payments Bank to stop onboarding new customers with immediate effect, the company issued a statement saying they are taking immediate steps to comply with RBI directions. It added, "We shall notify when we recommence the opening of new accounts after obtaining RBI approval." It also said the accounts of existing customers are fully functional.

Title: CEO rejects $100 mn offer for CB Insights, says 'never reply to Twitter DMs'
Content: CB Insights' Indian-American CEO Anand Sanwal revealed he has declined a $100 million offer to acquire his market intelligence platform. Sharing screenshots of his conversation with the potential buyer, Sanwal tweeted, "A great reminder to never check or respond to Twitter DMs again." "You just missed the opportunity of a lifetime," the buyer told Sanwal after he rejected their offer.

Title: Sitharaman stresses on need for multilateral action amid rising global inflation
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke to International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva and stressed on the need for multilateral action amid rising prices of commodities due to global supply chain disruptions.
