According to the Finance Ministry, Sitharaman and Georgieva suggested that the key question remains on the control of inflation while balancing needs for growth.

Title: Against our values: Germany's Deutsche Bank refuses to cut off ties with Russia
Content: Amid various brands suspending their operations in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, Germany’s largest bank Deutsche Bank refused to cut ties with Russia. Bank’s Chief Executive Christian Sewing said, "We are often asked why we aren't withdrawing completely from Russia. The answer is that this would go against our values." Sewing added, "We've clients who cannot exit Russia overnight."

Title: Video shows long car queues outside McDonald's in Russia as brand shuts stores
Content: A video showing long queues outside a McDonald's outlet in Moscow has surfaced on social media. McDonald’s has temporarily closed its 847 stores in the country over the Ukraine war. As per the company, the closure will cost it about $50 million a month. Meanwhile, people were also seen selling McDonald's burgers for high prices in Russia online.

Title: Deutsche Bank shuts down business in Russia, a day after its refusal
Content: Deutsche Bank has decided to suspend its operations in Russia over the Ukraine war, a day after it had refused to do so. Stating that there won't be any new business in Russia, Germany's largest bank said, "We're in the process of winding down our remaining business in Russia while we help our non-Russian multinational clients in reducing their operations."

Title: Azim Premji forgives person who filed 70 cases against him; SC praises him
Content: The Supreme Court praised former Wipro Chairman Azim Hasham Premji after he agreed to forgive the person who through his companies filed over 70 cases against Premji and his associates. "We're happy to note that Mr Azim Hasham Premji has taken a constructive view of the matter and agreed to forgive the past conduct of Mr Subramanian," the court said.

Title: Have trouble sitting idle, sitting quietly for 5 mins feels like waste of time: Nooyi
Content: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the Jaipur Literature Festival 2022 spoke about what motivated her. She said, "When I sit quietly, I feel I have wasted five minutes of my time. I'm constantly thinking about how to change the world or to help somebody...I have trouble sitting idle. That's why meditation has never been a part of my life."

Title: I find things chilly, I'm thin: World's largest air-conditioning firm Daikin's CEO
Content: Masanori Togawa, the 73-year-old CEO of the world's largest air-conditioning company Daikin, while speaking about his personal air-conditioning usage, said, "I tend to find things chilly; I'm thin and don't have enough muscle!" He told Bloomberg, "But we're based in Osaka, which is brutally hot during the summer. There's no way we can survive there without air conditioning."

Title: RBI lifts restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after a year
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has lifted restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after more than a year, the private lender said. These restrictions were imposed in December 2020, due to instances of outages in HDFC's internet banking services. In 2021, the RBI allowed HDFC Bank to issue new credit cards after imposing a ban for eight months.

Title: Ex-Financial Services Secretary Debasish Panda appointed IRDAI Chairman
Content: The government on Friday appointed Debasish Panda as Chairman of Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI). The appointment comes nearly 11 months after the post fell vacant following the completion of Subhash Chandra Khuntia's term in May last year. Panda is a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Uttar Pradesh cadre who retired as Financial Services Secretary this year.

Title: Pratik Pota resigns as CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks to 'explore external opportunity'
Content: Pratik Pota has resigned as the CEO and whole time director of Jubilant FoodWorks as he wished to pursue an external opportunity, the company informed in a filing to stock exchanges. The company added that Pota will continue in his current role till June 15, 2022. Credited for the company's turnaround, Pota had joined Jubilant FoodWorks in 2017.

Title: World's 5th richest person Buffett got $373,000 in compensation for 2021
Content: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman and CEO Warren Buffett received $373,204 in compensation for 2021, including his salary and security cost, down from $380,328 a year ago. Buffett's 16.2% stake in Berkshire comprises most of his $117.9 billion net worth, making him the world's fifth richest person. Buffett has been receiving an annual salary of $100,000 for more than four decades now.

Title: Reduction in EPFO interest rate BJP's return gift after poll win: Cong
Content: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said the reduction in Employees' Provident Fund Organisation interest rate was a "return gift" of the BJP to people after it won Assembly elections in four states. "Is it right to attack...savings of crores of employees on...basis of electoral victory?" he asked. EPFO has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1%.

Title: Dollar-denominated debt is bad idea, exposes one to Fed's moods: Zoho CEO
Content: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that dollar-denominated debt is a bad idea. "They leave companies and the country exposed to the Fed's (the US' Federal Reserve) mood swings," he explained. Vembu was commenting on a Twitter thread by Human Rights Foundation's Alex Gladstein. "The fiat/petrodollar system can be considered a form of neocolonialism," Gladstein wrote in the tweet.

Title: Sachin Bansal's Navi Tech files draft papers for ₹3,350 crore IPO
Content: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal-led Navi Technologies has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,350 crore through an initial public offer (IPO), Moneycontrol reported. The offer will primarily consist of fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Sachin Bansal co-founded the financial services company with Ankit Agarwal after exiting Flipkart in 2018.

Title: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 7.9%
Content: Morgan Stanley has cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 by 50 basis points to 7.9% and raised retail inflation projection to 6%. The firm also expects current account deficit to widen to a 10-year high of 3% of GDP. High oil prices, trade and tighter financial conditions are expected to affect the Indian economy in FY23.

Title: Kim says 'get your f***ing a** up and work' to women in business; criticised
Content: Businesswoman and socialite Kim Kardashian is being criticised for her remarks in a Variety Magazine interview, where she said, "I have the best advice for the women in business, get your f***ing a** up and work." She added, "It seems like nobody wants to work these days." Several people criticised her, with one tweeting, "Also: be born rich. Really helps."

Title: Rihanna planning IPO for her lingerie company at $3 billion valuation: Report
Content: Singer Rihanna is reportedly working with advisers on taking her lingerie company Savage X Fenty public, which could value her lingerie company at $3 billion or more. The report claims that the listing could happen this year but the company hasn’t made any official decision yet. Savage X Fenty was launched in 2018 as an online-only brand.

Title: Goldman Sachs becomes the first major US bank to exit Russia
Content: Goldman Sachs on Thursday said it was closing its operations in Russia, becoming the first major US bank to exit the country following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Goldman Sachs is winding down its business in Russia in compliance with regulatory and licensing requirements," the bank said. In its annual filing earlier, the bank disclosed a $650-million credit exposure to Russia.

Title: No global firm can touch Russia's blood money, thank you Mastercard: Ukraine Vice PM
Content: Days after Mastercard suspended its operations in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said, "I'm sure...no global company can touch Russia's blood money as long as its tanks and missiles kill Ukrainians." "Thank you, Mastercard, for the first steps towards peace, but have you terminated all financial contracts with Russia?" he wrote on Twitter.

Title: Tesla to pay salary for 3 months to Ukrainian employees called to fight Russia
Content: Elon Musk-led Tesla will pay its Ukrainian employees, who are asked to return to Ukraine to defend their country following the Russian invasion, for at least three months, according to a company e-mail seen by CNBC. The e-mail was sent to Tesla employees in Europe, the Middle East and Africa region. Tesla will reassess the situation in three months.

Title: Food prices will rise globally: Putin on western sanctions on Russia amid war
Content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that western sanctions on Russia due to the Ukraine war could lead to an increase in global food prices. "Russia and Belarus are some of the biggest suppliers of mineral fertilisers. If they continue to create problems for...delivery of our goods, then prices will rise and this will affect the final...food products," said Putin.

Title: Japan Tobacco, the largest cigarette maker in Russia, suspends Russia investments
Content:
Japan Tobacco Inc (JTI), the largest cigarette producer in Russia, has suspended all new investments and marketing activities in Russia effectively immediately following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "The challenges of operating in Russia at this time
are unprecedented," the company said. JTI added it "cannot exclude the possibility of a
suspension of manufacturing operations in Russia".

Title: Russia bans export of 200 products till end of 2022 amid sanctions
Content: Russia has banned the export of over 200 products till the end of this year after the US, EU and others hit the country with sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine. The ban covers telecoms, medical, auto, agricultural and electrical equipment and some forestry products like timber. The measure is necessary "to maintain stability on the Russian market", it said.

Title: 33-yr-old Indian-American among 2 indicted in US for crypto money laundering
Content: A US court has indicted two people, including an Indian-American, for their roles in a cryptocurrency money laundering scheme. If convicted, 75-year-old Lois Boyd and 33-year-old Manik Mehtani, both from Virginia, could face up to 20 years in federal prison. In the course of their operation, Boyd, Mehtani and their co-conspirators allegedly laundered over $750,000, federal prosecutors alleged.

Title: SBI app users spammed with random notifications, bank says fixing issue
Content: Several users of SBI's Yono Lite app took to Twitter on Friday to complain that they were spammed with multiple notifications for instant personal loans. "Since morning I got hundreds of random notifications from Yono app...with different names," one Twitter user wrote. SBI tweeted, "Our technical team is working to resolve this issue. Please bear with us."

Title: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg offers to cover insurance for fired expecting parents
Content: Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg said he'll pay insurance expenses for a group of expectant parents, who lost their jobs as the company fired around 3,000 US and India employees this week. The mortgage lending startup is offering extended medical benefits to 19 expecting parents, an internal communication said. Earlier, Garg was criticised for firing 900 employees on a Zoom call.

Title: Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh welcomes 2nd baby, calls him 'baby shark'
Content: Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh welcomed her second baby with husband Varun Alagh on Thursday. Sharing a photo on Instagram, she wrote, "And then there were 2, our second son Ayaan is here to make our lives even more fun. Ayaan means 'blessing from god' and that’s what he is. Thanks for all the kind wishes and blessings. #babyshark"

Title: Social media users criticise Ola for its '8 missed calls from mom' notification
Content: Social media users have criticised Ola after it sent a notification that read '8 missed calls from mom'. Ola sent the notification to promote 40% discount on certain services. "Why is Ola traumatising me like this?" a user asked, while another user wrote, "Ola, are you trying to give me a heart attack?"

Title: Russia bans sale of foreign currency cash to citizens for 6 months
Content: Russia has banned foreign currency sales for six months until September 9, 2022, amid the falling value of the ruble against the US dollar. Banks and brokers are banned from selling US dollars, euros and other foreign currency in exchange for rubles. Additionally, Russians with existing foreign currency accounts are allowed to withdraw up to $10,000 in US dollars only.

Title: India becomes world's 5th most-valued stock market, beats UK: Report
Content: India has become the fifth most-valued stock market, beating the UK, Canada and Saudi Arabia, Moneycontrol reported. The Indian market has lost around $257.35 billion since the start of 2022 amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine and its value is currently above $3 trillion. The US stock market, which is world's most-valued at $47.32 trillion, has lost $6.6 trillion this year.

Title: India is good at managing finances but global energy price rise will impact it: IMF
Content: IMF's Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva has said that "India has been very good in managing its finances" but the surge in global energy prices will have a negative impact on the Indian economy. The price rise amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine has "implications on the purchasing power of Indian households", IMF's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath said during a roundtable.

Title: Colgate-Palmolive India names Prabha Narasimhan as MD and CEO
Content: Colgate-Palmolive (India) on Thursday announced it has appointed Prabha Narasimhan, former Executive Director of Hindustan Unilever, as its new CEO and Managing Director (MD). Ram Raghavan, the MD and CEO of Colgate-Palmolive (India), has been promoted to President of enterprise oral care for Colgate-Palmolive. Raghavan will be based out of Colgate-Palmolive headquarters at New York, it added.

Title: Subramanian thought he can be 'yogi' & no one would identify: CBI to court
Content: The CBI on Friday told a Delhi court that the NSE's former Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian impersonated the 'Himalayan yogi' and influenced the decisions of former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Speaking in the co-location case, the CBI said Subramanian "thought he can be yogi for four years and no one would identify. He was operating the email IDs."

Title: It'll take us back 100 years: Russian tycoon on seizing assets of firms exiting Russia
Content: Russia's richest person and President of Norilsk Nickel Vladimir Potanin warned that confiscating the assets of Western companies that left Russia after Ukraine's invasion will "take us back 100 years to 1917". "We shouldn't try to slam the door but endeavour to preserve Russia's economic position in those markets which we spent so long cultivating," the 61-year-old added.

Title: Former NSE official Anand Subramanian denies being 'yogi' who influenced Chitra
Content: After the CBI informed a Delhi court that he impersonated the 'Himalayan yogi' to influence former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's decisions, Anand Subramanian through his lawyer said, "I'm not the 'yogi'". Subramanian's lawyer argued that the co-location scam took place between 2010 and 2014 while the accused had joined in 2013. The CBI argued that Subramanian was a flight risk.

Title: Marriott pauses new hotel openings, investment in Russia
Content: Hotel chain Marriott on Thursday said it has paused opening of new hotels and all future hotel development and investment in Russia owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Marriott will also close its corporate office in Russia. "Our hotels in Russia are owned by third parties and we continue to evaluate the ability for [them] to remain open," the company said.

Title: $117 billion wiped off Tesla rival Rivian's market cap in 4 months
Content: US-based electric vehicle startup Rivian has lost about $117 billion in market value in just four months. Rivian's market valuation had topped $153 billion a few weeks after its initial public offer (IPO), but the company's valuation now stands at about $36 billion. Rivian briefly became the second most valuable automaker in the US after billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla.

Title: US inflation increases 7.9% YoY in February, biggest rise in 40 years
Content: Retail inflation in the US rose 7.9%, the biggest YoY rise since January 1982, the US Labor Department reported on Thursday. Monthly rise in US inflation has stayed above the 0.6% mark since October 2021, marking a 0.6% increase in both December 2021 and January 2022 and a 0.8% rise in February. Food Price Index marked a 7.9% YoY increase.

Title: India likely to grow at 7.8% in FY23 with downside risks: CRISIL
Content: Indian economy is likely to grow at 7.8% in FY23, driven by the government's infrastructure spending push and likely increase in private capital expenditure, a CRISIL report said. It added that the Russia-Ukraine war and rising inflation pose a downside risk to the growth. Higher oil prices will widen India's current account deficit to 2.2% in FY23, the report added.

Title: SpiceJet MD granted interim relief from arrest in alleged cheating case
Content: SpiceJet promoter and Managing Director Ajay Singh has been granted interim protection from arrest by a Delhi court in connection with an alleged cheating case registered against him. The court said that no coercive action should be taken against Ajay Singh till March 28. It has further directed him to join the investigation regarding the transfer of SpiceJet shares.

Title: Delhi HC directs DMRC to pay ₹6,330 cr to Reliance's Airport Express Line
Content: The Delhi High Court directed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to pay ₹6,330 crore to Reliance Infrastructure's Delhi Airport Metro Express Private Limited (DAMEPL) for an arbitration award passed in 2017. It asked DMRC to divert funds or raise loans to pay the amount to DAMEPL. DMRC is required to pay the amount in three installments by May 31.

Title: SC closes nearly 70 criminal cases against ex-Wipro Chairman Azim Premji
Content: The Supreme Court on Thursday closed nearly 70 criminal cases filed by India Awake for Transparency, an NGO, against ex-Wipro Chairman Azim Premji and his wife Yasmeen Azim Premji. It filed the cases for breach of trust and corruption during a merger with a firm from the Azim Premji group. The NGO later issued an unconditional apology in the SC.

Title: Pics of crowds at Soviet Union's 1st McDonald's surface as firm shuts Russian shops
Content: Pictures showing long queues outside Soviet Union's first McDonald's on its opening day surfaced online after the company temporarily shut restaurants in Russia. The first McDonald's opened in Moscow's Pushkin Square in 1990, symbolising the opening of USSR to the West. "I stood in line for...an hour to get a cheeseburger in 1990...It's a sad day," a Twitter user said.

Title: Sensex opens over 1,200 points higher amid counting of votes in Assembly elections
Content: Sensex surged over 1,200 points to open at over 55,770 on Thursday amid counting of votes in Assembly elections for five states. The broader Nifty was up 314.20 points or 1.92% at 16,659.60. Around 1,860 shares have advanced, 185 shares declined, and 38 shares are unchanged. Asian Paints and Axis Bank jumped up to 5%.

Title: Reliance stepping in to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia-Ukraine crisis: Report
Content: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd's (RIL) Jamnagar facility is gearing up to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a report said. According to Bloomberg, RIL has deferred maintenance work at Jamnagar plant, and is increasing crude processing in a bid to gain from surge in global demand. It's already sending shipments of fuel to Europe, it said.

Title: UK freezes Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich's assets, blocking the club's sale
Content: The UK has imposed sanctions on Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, which includes freezing of assets and a prohibition on transactions with UK individuals. This means that he cannot sell Chelsea or invest in the football club. Abramovich is among seven Russians targeted in fresh sanctions. The list includes Rosneft CEO Igor Sechin, an ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Title: Amazon stops shipping products to Russia, suspends access to Prime Video
Content: Amazon has stopped shipping retail products to its customers in Russia and Belarus amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine. The company is also suspending access to Prime Video for its Russia-based customers. "We have a long-standing policy of not doing business with the Russian government," Amazon said, adding that it doesn't have offices or data centres in Russia.

Title: Musk posts old meme linking Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi & Motorola to Bitcoin creator
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk shared an old meme speculating that Satoshi Nakamoto is derived from the names of Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi Corp and Motorola. Satoshi Nakamoto is the pseudonym of the developer of Bitcoin whose true identity is unknown. Responding to Musk, Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus joked, Bitcoin creator "is half Japanese, a quarter Korean and a quarter American".

Title: Better.com accidentally sent severance cheques a day before mass layoffs: Report
Content: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com accidentally released severance payslips a day before mass layoffs were meant to be announced, TechCrunch reported citing employees. "No email, no call, nothing. This was handled disgustingly," an employee, who received a severance cheque, said. After the mistake, CFO Kevin Ryan sent an email to employees confirming the layoffs in US and India.

Title: Better.com is laying off 3,000 India & US workers after firing 900 on a Zoom call
Content: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which had fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, has announced that it's reducing its workforce in India and the US in a significant manner over "the coming days". A company spokesperson told TechCrunch that the number is "just over 3,000". CFO Kevin Ryan said affected employees will be eligible for 60-80 days of severance pay.

Title: My computer shut down while I was responding to client: Better.com worker on layoff
Content: A Better.com employee named Amanda Bullard, speaking about the layoff wherein roughly 4,000 workers including her were sacked on Tuesday, shared her experience on LinkedIn. "I didn't find out through...payroll system, my bank account showing a severance check, or a phone call from HR. My computer just shut down in the middle of me responding to [a client]," she stated.

Title: Pregnant women among 4,000 Better.com workers laid off on Women's Day, says employee
Content: Better.com employee Eric Blattberg shared a colleague's post regarding layoff of roughly 4,000 employees on Tuesday. "Included in...laid-off crowd are pregnant women who trusted Better with their stability," it read. "I wanted to share [the] post calling on Better's leadership...to provide extended medical benefits to currently-pregnant employees they're laying off on...Women's Day," wrote Eric.

Title: Ashneer Grover, wife Madhuri pay ₹8.2 crore advance tax: Report
Content: Former BharatPe Managing Director Ashneer Grover has paid ₹7.1 crore advance tax for the assessment year 2022-23, as per a PTI report. Grover's wife Madhuri Jain has paid ₹1.1 crore advance tax, the report said. "This makes him one of the highest taxpayers among startup founders for two years in a row," PTI added while quoting a source.

Title: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump as ban on international flights lifted after 2 years
Content: Shares of Indian airlines, including SpiceJet, IndiGo parent InterGlobe Aviation and Jet Airways, rose 5-8% each, a day after the government lifted the ban on regular international flights after two years. The Centre will resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27. Currently, international flights operate under air bubble arrangements with nations.

Title: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day ahead of 5 state assembly election results
Content: The Sensex jumped over 1,100 points during intraday trade on Wednesday ahead of the five state assembly election results tomorrow. While the Sensex was trading above 54,500 levels, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 300 points to trade above 16,300 levels. Earlier, exit polls predicted that AAP may win in Punjab, while BJP will retain Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Size doesn't matter: Mahindra on China's defence budget being 3 times that of India
Content: After China announced its 2022 defence budget of $230 billion, which is three times that of India's, businessman Anand Mahindra said, "Size doesn't matter. The future of warfare will be different." Ukraine's armed drones are playing havoc with convoys of tanks, he tweeted. "It's not how much we spend but how smartly we spend that will matter," Mahindra added.

Title: Sensex ends 1,223 points higher at 54,647 ahead of assembly poll results
Content: The Sensex ended 1,223 points or over 2% higher at 54,647 on Wednesday, a day ahead of five state assembly election results. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped 332 points or 2% to close at 16,345. The benchmark indices ended in the green for the second straight day. Reliance Industries, Asian Paints, Bajaj Finance were among top Sensex gainers.

Title: Reliance terminates lease of 950 Big Bazaar, Central stores: Future Group
Content: Future Group companies have received notices from Reliance Industries to terminate the lease of nearly 950 stores due to non-payment of rent. Future Retail said it has received notices in respect of 835 large and small format stores, including Big Bazaar and Easyday. Future Lifestyle Fashions has received termination notices for 112 stores, including Central and Brand Factory stores.

Title: McDonald's says closing stores in Russia will cost it $50 mn per month
Content: McDonald's on Wednesday said closing stores in Russia in response to the Russia-Ukraine war will cost the fast food chain $50 million a month. McDonald's owns 84% of its Russian locations itself and said it'll continue to pay its 62,000 staff and restaurant employees in Russia. "This is a really challenging and complex situation for...us," said McDonald's CFO Kevin Ozan.

Title: B'luru court rejects ED plea for proclamation order against Devas CEO
Content: A special court in Bengaluru has rejected Enforcement Directorate's plea for a proclamation order against Ramachandran Vishwanathan, the CEO of Devas Multimedia. The ED had filed a money laundering case against Ramachandran following a failed 2005 satellite deal between Devas Multimedia and ISRO's commercial arm Antrix Corporation. Notably, a non-bailable warrant was issued against him last month.

Title: Finance Minister Sitharaman interacts with entrepreneurs in Bengaluru
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday interacted with leading entrepreneurs of IT/BT, Startups and Semiconductor sectors in Bengaluru, a press release said. Expressing her gladness over the Startup ecosystem of Karnataka, she said Karnataka sets an example to be emulated by others. She added, "We should make most of the economic opportunities that exist in the semiconductor sector."

Title: Ex-Goldman banker faked ex-wife's email account to lie to girlfriend
Content: Former Goldman Sachs banker Tim Leissner has detailed how he used his ex-wife's email to lie to his former girlfriend, Kimora Lee Simmons. Leissner, a key witness against former Goldman banker Roger Ng in the 1MDB scandal, posed as Judy Chan to convince Simmons the two were no longer married. Leissner was questioned about the phoney account by Ng's lawyer.

Title: Sensex ends 817 points higher at 55,464 amid Assembly election results
Content: The Sensex ended 817 points higher at 55,464.39 on Thursday amid five state assembly election results. Benchmark indices ended higher for the third consecutive session, with the broader Nifty surging 249 points or 1.53% to settle at 16,594.90. HUL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SBI were among top Nifty gainers, whereas Coal India, Tech Mahindra, TCS were the biggest losers.

Title: Cabinet approves SPV for sale of surplus govt land and buildings
Content: The Union Cabinet has approved setting up of the National Land Monetisation Corporation (NLMC), a special purpose vehicle (SPV) to handle the sale of surplus government land and buildings. NLMC's board will include senior central government officers and eminent experts. In addition to selling surplus land and buildings, NLMC will own and manage surplus assets of central PSUs under closure.

Title: ED attaches assets worth ₹1,984 crore in Karvy Stock Broking scam
Content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday said it has attached immovable and movable properties worth ₹1,984 crore belonging to Karvy Stock Broking, its Chairman Comandur Parthasarathy and others in a money laundering case. Attached properties include landed properties worth ₹213.6 crore, tangible/intangible assets worth ₹1,280 crore and Parthasarathy's shareholding worth ₹438.7 crore, ED said.

Title: SAT declines to stay SEBI order directing Dish TV to disclose AGM results
Content: Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has declined to stay SEBI's order directing Dish TV to disclose voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM). SAT has also directed Dish TV to file its reply in the matter against SEBI's order by March 20.  SEBI passed the order after receiving complaints from Yes Bank and other Dish TV shareholders.

Title: GST authorities expand probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe
Content: GST authorities have expanded probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe to include reported issuance of fake invoices by those close to the firm's ousted Co-founder Ashneer Grover, PTI reported. Bharatpe's books are now being scrutinised to check if bogus invoices were issued for services too. Grover, his wife were stripped of their positions for indulgence in alleged financial irregularities.

Title: Ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian sent to 14-day judicial custody
Content: Former NSE Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian has been sent to 14-day judicial custody by a CBI court in connection with the NSE co-location case. Subramanian is the "yogi" who guided the actions of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramakrishna, reports said quoting CBI sources. A Delhi court on Monday also granted seven-day custodial interrogation of Ramakrishna to the CBI.

Title: Financial services firm EbixCash to raise ₹6,000 crore through IPO
Content: EbixCash, the Indian subsidiary of Nasdaq-listed Ebix Inc, has filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an IPO to raise ₹6,000 crore through a fresh issue of shares. The firm may consider a pre-IPO placement of as much as ₹1,200 crore, the DRHP said. EbixCash has a network of over 6,50,000 physical agent distribution outlets for payment solutions.

Title: After McDonald's, Coca-Cola, Pepsi & Starbucks suspend business in Russia
Content: After McDonald's announced that it's temporarily shutting around 850 restaurants in Russia, Starbucks, Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and General Electric have suspended operations in the country. However, PepsiCo will continue to sell essentials like milk and baby food. Cereal manufacturer Kellogg's, KFC parent Yum Brands and Kraft Heinz are suspending their investment into Russia amid Ukraine invasion.

Title: McDonald's temporarily shuts Russian restaurants, says 'can't ignore suffering in Ukraine'
Content: McDonald's has announced it is temporarily closing all of its 850 restaurants in Russia, saying, "Our values mean we cannot ignore the needless human suffering unfolding in Ukraine." CEO Chris Kempczinski said the company will continue paying its 62,000 employees in Russia, adding, "At this juncture, it's impossible to predict when we might be able to reopen our restaurants."

Title: Russia's rating cut for 2nd time in a week by Fitch
Content: Russia's sovereign rating has been downgraded by six notches to the second lowest level of 'C' by Fitch Ratings, which said that a bond default is "imminent". "This rating action follows our downgrade...to 'B'/Rating Watch Negative on 2 March," it said. "Developments since then have...further undermined Russia's willingness to service government debt," the rating agency added amid sanctions.

Title: Russian oil ban will be catastrophic, prices could hit $300 a barrel: Deputy PM
Content: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak has warned that a ban on Russian oil imports by Western countries "would lead to catastrophic consequences for the global market". "The surge in prices would be unpredictable. It would be $300 per barrel if not more," he added. On Monday, Brent crude price briefly hit $139/barrel for the first time since July 2008.

Title: 1 Russian ruble now worth less than 1 American penny: US President Biden
Content: While announcing a ban on imports of Russian oil and gas, US President Joe Biden said that the country's "most significant package of economic sanctions in history" has caused the Russian economy to "crater". "The Russian ruble is now down...by 50% since Putin announced his war. One ruble is now worth less than one American penny," he added.

Title: Shell to stop buying oil, gas from Russia, apologises for buying cargo after invasion
Content: British oil giant Shell has announced that it will stop purchasing Russian oil and gas, with CEO Ben van Beurden apologising for buying a cargo of Russian crude oil after Ukraine invasion. "As an immediate first step, we will stop all spot purchases of Russian crude oil, shut service stations, aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia," Shell said.

Title: How will the new UPI work on feature phones and in offline mode?
Content: To use RBI's UPI123Pay, users need to link their bank account with their feature phones and set up a UPI pin with a debit card. They can call an Interactive Voice Response number to transfer money. They can also use a missed call payment feature to send money to a merchant/shop or tap their phones on a sound-based payments device.

Title: RBI launches UPI for feature phones; transactions won't require internet
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has launched a UPI-based payment product for feature phones called UPI123Pay. The product will allow customers to use feature phones for almost all transactions, except scan and pay, and it doesn't need internet connection for transactions. This will help NPCI reach its goal of processing a billion transactions a day, the RBI said.

Title: RBI launches 24/7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' for digital payment queries
Content: The RBI has launched a 24x7 helpline for digital payments queries, DigiSaathi. The initiative will help customers address digital payments queries including cards, and the most relevant and appropriate information will be delivered as soon as possible. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das also launched an instant payment system "UPI 123PAY" for feature phone users.

Title: We're sorry, we messed up: Flipkart on 'Get kitchen appliances' text on Women's Day
Content: Flipkart has apologised after the e-commerce platform was criticised for sending a message promoting kitchen appliances on International Women's Day 2022. "Dear Customer, This Women's Day, let's celebrate You. Get Kitchen Appliances from ₹299," the message read. "We messed up and we're sorry. We did not intend to hurt anyone's sentiments," Flipkart wrote on its official Twitter account.

Title: I'm the healthiest person I know & I got breast cancer: Zerodha Co-founder's wife
Content: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil has revealed in a blog that she was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2021 despite being "the healthiest and fittest person" she knew. "The last few months...have been a blur and an emotional roller coaster. As cliché as it may sound, health really is wealth," Patil, who's Zerodha's whole-time director, wrote.

Title: We both went bald: Zerodha Co-founder's wife on their pic amid her chemotherapy
Content: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil, who was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy, said she decided not to go for a wig as cancer's already a "taboo". "It...didn't feel right...so, we both went bald at the same time. Nithin has agreed to remain bald until my hair grows back again," she wrote, sharing their picture.

Title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff on Zoom, plans laying off 4,000 this week: Report
Content: Three months after Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, the US-based mortgage company is planning to lay off around 4,000 people this week, TechCrunch reported citing sources. That is about 50% of its staff of about 8,000. Following the December layoffs, Garg apologised, saying that he "blundered the execution" and took time off.

Title: I've done my best to lead NSE in a difficult period: CEO on not seeking 2nd term
Content: National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Vikram Limaye said that he won't apply for a second term as his first five-year term ends in July 2022. "I've done my best to lead the organisation in a very difficult period and to stabilise, strengthen and transform NSE," he added. Earlier, NSE published an advertisement calling for candidates for CEO role.

Title: Nickel price more than doubles in a day, briefly hits $100,000 a tonne
Content: Nickel price jumped as much as 111% on Tuesday to briefly surge above a record $100,000/tonne on London Metal Exchange (LME), before paring some gains. LME halted trading in nickel as brokers faced trouble in paying margin calls following the largest-ever price move on the exchange. This comes amid a rise in risk of shortages from Russia, following Ukraine's invasion.

Title: Warren Buffett among world's 5 richest people again as fortune hits $117 billion
Content: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett's net worth has grown by over 7% this year to around $117 billion as his company's shares rallied, Bloomberg reported. The 91-year-old is now back among the world's five richest people, after falling to as low as world's 11th richest person in October. World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth has dropped by 15% this year.

Title: Credit Suisse cuts India's rating to 'underweight', cites rising crude prices
Content: Credit Suisse has downgraded India's rating to 'underweight' from 'overweight' in the wake of rising crude oil prices, referring to the cut as "tactical". In Asia, India is the "most vulnerable to higher oil prices, along with the Philippines", the agency noted. The downgrade comes as crude oil prices briefly hit a 14-year high on Monday amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

Title: LIC gets SEBI nod for India's biggest-ever IPO: Reports
Content: State-run Life Insurance Corporation of India has reportedly received market regulator SEBI's approval for an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO is expected to be the country's biggest-ever public issue. According to its draft papers filed on February 13, LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares. Earlier, reports said the government may defer the IPO to next fiscal amid Russia-Ukraine war.

Title: M&A in their early days: Harsh Goenka as he shares childhood pic of Ambani brothers
Content: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka has shared a childhood photograph of Mukesh Ambani and Anil Ambani on Twitter and wrote, "Two brothers in their early days...M&A." The picture shows the two brothers dressed in formal suits with garlands around their necks. "Mukesh Ambani's looks are always constant," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

Title: Universal Music suspends operations, closes offices in Russia
Content: Universal Music Group has said it is suspending all operations in Russia and closing its offices, amid the growing protest from global firms against the violence in Ukraine. "We are adhering to international sanctions and...have been working with groups from a range of countries...to support humanitarian relief efforts," it said. It also urged for an end to violence in Ukraine.

Title: Ukraine war may have limited impact on domestic credit market: Report
Content: An India Ratings and Research (IRR) report said Russia-Ukraine war's impact on the domestic credit market may be limited as the banking system has adequate liquidity. The duration and intensity of the war will be the key determinant for the macro and micro risks. Entities with a weak financial profile may face financing challenges if the situation worsens, it added.

Title: Clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government sees "clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency". She added that the digital rupee is a conscious call taken in consultation with RBI and that the government expects the digital currency to come out from RBI this year itself. "I see a possibility for revenue in [digital currency]," she said.

Title: Heartened to see US ban Russian oil imports, UK must follow: Branson
Content: Billionaire Richard Branson praised the US ban on Russian oil imports saying, "Heartened to see...US...ban the import of Russian oil and natural gas." "This will have an impact on remaining revenue flows to Russia," he added. Branson said UK and EU must enforce a ban too as complete economic isolation is the "only way of forcing Russia out of Ukraine".

Title: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1, to cost ₹57.51/kg in Delhi
Content: CNG prices have been increased in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1 per kg with effect from Tuesday. In Delhi, one kg CNG will now be costlier by 50 paise and cost ₹57.51 from earlier ₹57.01. The prices in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad have been hiked by ₹1 per kg and CNG in these cities will cost ₹59.58 per kg.

Title: To say that govt controlled oil prices due to polls is incorrect: Puri
Content: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said oil prices are determined by global prices and "to say that the government had controlled oil prices due to elections is not correct". "We'll take decisions in the best interest of our citizens," he added. This comes after global oil prices reached close to the $140/barrel mark on Monday.

Title: Norway wealth fund puts Adani Ports, 2 others on its watch list
Content: Norway's sovereign wealth fund has put Adani Ports, Canada's Bombardier and South Korea's Hyundai Glovis on its watch list for possible exclusion from investment due to ethical concerns. It said Adani Ports has been put on the watch list for its possible contribution to "serious violations" of human rights because of its involvement in building a port terminal in Myanmar.

Title: Dish TV to move SAT against SEBI order to disclose its AGM voting results
Content: Dish TV on Tuesday said it will move the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's interim order directing Dish TV to disclose its annual general meeting's (AGM) voting results. SEBI had ordered Dish TV on Monday to disclose AGM results within 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and directed depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors.

Title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing info with 'yogi', arrested by CBI
Content: NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', has been arrested by the CBI in connection to the NSE co-location case in Delhi. A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application while calling CBI's conduct in the case "lackadaisical". Notably, the CBI has already arrested her former colleague Anand Subramanian.

Title: Liquor prices hiked by up to ₹80 at TASMAC shops by Tamil Nadu govt
Content: Tamil Nadu has increased the price of liquor at Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation Limited (TASMAC) shops and the hike ranges from a minimum of ₹10 to ₹80. Now, a 180 ml bottle of rum and brandy will cost ₹130 as compared to its earlier price of ₹120. The price of beer per bottle has been increased by ₹10.

Title: Indian rupee hits its lowest level against the US dollar
Content: The Indian rupee hit its lowest level against the US dollar as it opened at ₹76.96 on Monday compared to a close of ₹76.17 on Friday. The rupee's previous low was at ₹76.91 in April 2020. The sharp fall comes amid soaring oil prices following the Russia-Ukraine conflict and continued outflows of foreign portfolio money.

Title: Best employers don't support bloodshed: Ukraine to Amazon Founder Bezos
Content: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written an open letter to Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos urging him to suspend provisions of Amazon Web Services in Russia amid war. "I believe that the best employers...would never support bloodshed and disinformation," Fedorov said. He also wrote that many Ukrainians are working for Amazon globally and they need the company's support today.

Title: McDonald's sued for $900 million by US startup over false advertising claims
Content: US-based Kytch, which sells devices to fix broken ice cream machines, has sued McDonald's for $900 million alleging false advertising and tortious interference with its business. As per Kytch, McDonald's told its franchisees that the startup's devices violated their machines' warranties and could lead to "serious human injury". Kytch denied both the claims and accused McDonald's of defamation.

Title: Paytm's market cap falls below ₹50,000 cr as shares hit record low
Content: The market capitalisation of Paytm's parent One97 Communications fell below ₹50,000 crore on Monday as the company's shares hit record low of ₹751. Paytm's market capitalisation stood at ₹48,785 crore as its shares ended 4.15% lower on the NSE on March 7. Paytm made its stock market debut in November 2021 and its shares have declined nearly 65% since then.

Title: Assume tough times ahead, be prepared: Zoho CEO to staff amid Russia-Ukraine war
Content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted some advice that he had shared with this staff amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Vembu wrote, "The world faces many serious challenges…While our company is on a...healthy foundation...we have weathered two serious downturns in our 25-year history...Assume...tough times will be ahead and be prepared…We don't know what lies ahead. Expect turbulent times."

Title: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna sent to 7-day CBI custody in co-location scam
Content: A Delhi court granted the CBI seven-day custodial interrogation of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case on Monday. The probe agency had sought 14-day custody of Ramkrishna, who is also accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi'. She was arrested by the CBI in Delhi on Sunday, a day after her anticipatory bail was denied.

Title: What is the co-location case for which ex-NSE CEO Chitra has been arrested?
Content: The NSE co-location case refers to a series of events wherein some brokers received preferential access through the co-location facility, resulting in faster access to the markets. The matter came to light after a whistleblower wrote to SEBI in 2015. The NSE co-location facilities were launched in 2009 while Chitra Ramkrishna was appointed as the Joint MD the same year.

Title: Keep Saturdays free, address grievances of tax assessees: FM to CBDT, CBIC officials
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rapped CBDT and CBIC for allegedly not responding to grievances of tax assessees and directed officials to reserve Saturdays to hold meetings with them. "Are you engaging with your own assessees?...Engage with them and give the clarification required," Sitharaman said. She was having a post-budget interaction with industry members and tax officers in Bengaluru.

Title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra refused to identify former colleague Subramanian: CBI tells court
Content: The CBI has been granted seven-day custody of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case after she was arrested on Sunday. The CBI had sought 14-day custody from the court arguing that Ramkrishna had been evasive in her replies and despite being confronted with her former colleague Anand Subramanian, a co-accused, she "refused to even identify him."

Title: Clothing is a necessity, Russians have right to live: Uniqlo as it stays open in Russia
Content: Fast Retailing, the parent company of Japanese clothing brand Uniqlo, on Monday defended its decision to keep the Russian stores open amid rival brands suspending operations in the country over the invasion of Ukraine. Tadashi Yanai, President of Fast Retailing, said, "Clothing is a necessity of life. The people of Russia have the same right to live as we do."

Title: Sensex plunges over 1,600 points, drops below 53,000 for 1st time in 7 months
Content: Sensex plunged over 1,600 points to trade at over 52,600, while Nifty was down over 400 points at over 15,820 in the opening session on Monday as Russia-Ukraine war entered its 12th day. This is the first time in over seven months that Sensex dropped below 53,000. Tata Steel is the only gainer on Sensex today so far.

Title: Sensex ends nearly 1,500 points lower at 52,842, Nifty settles below 15,900
Content: The Sensex plunged 1,491 points to close at 52,842 while the Nifty settled at 15,863 after falling 382 points on Monday amid weak global cues. The sharp fall comes as crude oil prices surged past the $130-per-barrel mark amid heightened tensions between Russia and Ukraine. Metal index gained over 2%, while auto, bank, FMCG, PSU bank and realty fell 2-5%.

Title: Indian investors lose ₹29 lakh cr wealth since February, more than Ukraine's GDP
Content: Indian investors have lost ₹29 lakh crore of wealth since the beginning of February amid heightening geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine and oil prices touching a 13-year high. The wealth lost by Indian investors is a lot more than Ukraine's GDP, which was estimated at $181 billion (nearly ₹15 lakh crore) in 2021, according to the Statista website.

Title: I'd sell & buy metal scrap: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal while sharing an old picture
Content: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday tweeted an old picture of him while revealing some details about his earlier days. He wrote, "I rented an 8 ft by 9 ft office in Bhoiwada (metal market) in Kalvadevi where I'd work day-in, day-out." He added, "I would sell and buy metal scrap collected from cable companies, and Bihar, my hometown."

Title: Accounting firms EY, Deloitte sever links with Russia
Content: EY and Deloitte on Monday said they will sever ties with Russia, following two other of the world's Big Four accounting firms KPMG and PwC. EY won't serve any Russian government clients, state-owned enterprises or sanctioned entities, individuals, the firm said. "We'll separate our practice in Russia, Belarus from the global network of member firms," said Deloitte CEO Punit Renjen.

Title: Moody's cuts Russia's credit rating to 2nd-lowest on its scale
Content: Moody's Investors Service on Sunday cut Russia's credit rating to Ca, the second-lowest rung of its ratings ladder. Moody's said its decision was "driven by severe concerns around Russia's willingness and ability to pay its debt obligations". "At the Ca rating level, the recovery expectations are at 35% to 65% (of face value)," Moody's said.

Title: Oil prices touch highest level since 2008, jump close to $140 mark
Content: Oil prices continued to soar on Monday after reports said the US and European allies are planning to ban Russian oil imports over its invasion of Ukraine. In the first few minutes of trade on Monday, Brent crude hit $139.13/barrel while West Texas Intermediate hit $130.50/barrel, both at their highest since July 2008. Russia is the world's second-largest crude exporter.

Title: Microsoft to set up its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad
Content: Microsoft on Monday said it plans to establish its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad, with its first phase expected to become operational by 2025. Microsoft India President Anant Maheshwari said the company is making long-term investments and that it has doubled its existing three data centres' capacity. “We already serve more than 3,40,000 companies in India,” he said.

Title: Activision Blizzard sued for wrongful death of female employee
Content: The parents of 32-year-old Activision Blizzard employee Kerri Moynihan are suing the company for her wrongful death. Moynihan was found dead in a hotel room at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in 2017. Her parents alleged the "hostile, intimidating, offensive, and abusive" workplace she experienced was a "significant factor" that contributed to her suicide, The Washington Post reported.

Title: MoS Rajeev Chandrasekhar to attend India Global Forum in Bengaluru
Content: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will attend India Global Forum (IGF) which is being held in Bengaluru on Monday and Tuesday. It's being held in the city for the first time. "India is in midst of a major transformation of and expansion of its economy with PM Narendra Modi's Atmanirbhar Bharat economic roadmap," Chandrasekhar said.

Title: Sachin Bansal's Navi to file for ₹4,000-cr IPO this week: Report
Content: Financial services company Navi Technologies is planning to file draft papers with SEBI for ₹4,000-crore initial public offer (IPO) this week, PTI reported. The issue is expected to open in June and will be a fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal co-founded Navi with Ankit Agarwal after exiting the e-commerce startup in 2018.

Title: 4 directors of TN-based firm's held for cheating people of ₹1,100 cr
Content: Four directors of a Tamil Nadu-based firm were arrested by the ED for defrauding people of over ₹1,100 crore. Disc Assets Lead India Limited and Ors collected the money from public in 'Collective Investment Scheme', reportedly promising land or money with higher interest in return. The accused were identified as N Umashankar, N Arun, V Janarthanan and A Saravana Kumar.

Title: SC directs 6 banks to release ₹1,200 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
Content: The Supreme Court has ordered six banks to release ₹1,200 crore before March 14 to aid the National Buildings Constructions Corporation (NBCC) in completing Amrapali's stalled projects. Bank of Baroda, the consortium's lead bank, told SC that it has already infused its share of ₹300 crore. NBCC said it'll also be conducting an independent structural audit of Amrapali's under-construction projects.

Title: Disclose AGM voting results within 24 hours: SEBI to Dish TV
Content: SEBI has ordered Dish TV to disclose the voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM), held on December 30, in the next 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and ordered depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors and compliance officer. Dish TV didn't disclose AGM voting results citing a pending case in the Bombay HC.

Title: Airlines urge govt to raise cap on domestic fares citing rising fuel prices
Content: Airlines in India have urged the Civil Aviation Ministry to raise caps on domestic fares citing rising aviation turbine fuel (ATF)  prices. ATF, one of the biggest components of air fares, has risen 26.4% or ₹19,508.25/kl in Delhi since December 15. The Civil Aviation Ministry had temporarily set upper and lower airfare limits in the wake of the pandemic.

Title: Mother Dairy to hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR from tomorrow
Content: Mother Dairy on Saturday announced that it will hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre for all milk variants in Delhi-NCR from March 6. The company cited a rise in fuel costs, costs of packing material and procurement prices as the reason for it. Apart from this, Amul and Parag Milk Foods had also increased milk prices recently.

Title: Hundreds book Airbnbs in Ukraine to send money to citizens amid war
Content: Hundreds of people are booking Airbnb rentals in Ukraine to offer monetary assistance to local families affected by war. This came after US-based influencer Tommy Marcus proposed the idea of paying for Ukrainian Airbnbs to financially support their hosts. Marcus shared some replies from Ukrainian hosts, one of which said, "Hope we'll win and stop this horror."

Title: Western sanctions on Russia are akin to declaration of war: Putin
Content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that Western sanctions on Russia over the invasion of Ukraine, "are akin to a declaration of war", adding, "But thank God it has not come to that." Putin reiterated that he aims to defend Russian speaking communities in Ukraine through the "demilitarisation and de-Nazification" of the country so that it becomes neutral.

Title: Zelenskyy invites world's richest man Elon Musk to visit Ukraine; shares video
Content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on a video call with Elon Musk invited the world's richest man to visit Ukraine. "So, If you have time after the war, you are very welcome, I invite you," Zelenskyy told Musk. In a video clip shared by Zelenskyy on Instagram, Musk responded, "That sound's good, I look forward to visiting once things are..."

Title: Putin's war has always been a war against his own people: Branson
Content: Billionaire Richard Branson while expressing his thoughts on the Russian-Ukrainian war said Russian President Vladimir Putin's war has "always also been a war against his own people". He said Putin has created "a system of control, intimidation, oppression, and disinformation". He added Russians had their dignity "stripped away slowly but continuously" as Russia "slipped into totalitarianism".

Title: Doesn't it smell of Ukrainian blood?: Ukraine as Shell buys Russian oil
Content: After UK oil giant Shell purchased a cargo of Russian crude oil at a record low discount, Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba asked the company, "Doesn't Russian oil smell (of) Ukrainian blood for you?" Defending the purchase, Shell said it would choose alternatives to Russian oil wherever possible and will commit profits from the limited purchase to a dedicated fund.

Title: I'm grateful to Musk for supporting Ukraine in words and deeds: Zelenskyy
Content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to Twitter to share details of the conversation he had with the world's richest man Elon Musk, and tweeted, "I am grateful to him for supporting Ukraine with words and deeds." He informed that next week, Ukraine will receive another batch of Starlink systems for destroyed cities. "Possible space projects were discussed," Zelenskyy added.

Title: We're too big to be isolated: Russia on sanctions over Ukraine war
Content: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Saturday termed western nations' sanctions on Russia "economic banditry", adding, "This does not mean Russia is isolated." He added, "The world is too big for Europe and America to isolate a country and even more so a country as big as Russia." He said that US' sanctions on Russia's energy exports would jolt energy markets.

Title: Singapore sanctions 4 Russian banks; bans military goods, computers export
Content: Singapore announced sanctions against Russia over its "unprovoked attack" on Ukraine, becoming one of the few Southeast Asian nations to do so. It includes a ban on dealing with four Russian banks and an export ban on electronics, computers and military items. The sanctions "aim to constrain Russia's capacity to conduct war" and engage in "cyber aggression", Foreign Ministry said.

Title: Ratan Tata always keeps his promises: 28-yr-old assistant lists 2 of Tata's values
Content: Shantanu Naidu, the 28-year-old assistant of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, in an interview revealed two values that he had observed in the latter. Naidu said, "He will just help so many people each day and then totally forget about it." He added that Ratan Tata always keeps his promises and "always delivers when he has given his word."

Title: I find it difficult to meditate, I use NSDR to relax: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
Content: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai in an interview with The Wall Street Journal spoke about how he relaxes, and said, "I found these podcasts which are non-sleep deep rest, or NSDRs." He said, "While I find it difficult to meditate, I can go to YouTube, find an NSDR video." He added, "They're available in 10, 20 or 30 minutes."

Title: CCI dismisses predatory pricing claims against e-commerce firm Shopee
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has dismissed allegations of predatory pricing levelled against the e-commerce platform Shopee. In its order, CCI said that Shopee did not hold a significant market power as it is a new entrant. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) had claimed that Shopee sold various products at low prices and indulged in predatory pricing.

Title: CBI court refuses anticipatory bail to ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna
Content: A special CBI court has dismissed the anticipatory bail of former NSE chief executive Chitra Ramkrishna in connection with the NSE co-location case. Accused of sharing information with a 'Himalayan yogi', the court said that no grounds were made out to grant anticipatory bail to Ramkrishna. It is reported that the CBI argued against granting protection to her.

Title: China announces $230 billion defence budget, 3 times that of India's
Content: China has reserved $229.47 billion in the national budget this year to enhance military training and combat readiness for the People's Liberation Army. This is over three times that of India's ₹5.25 lakh crore ($70 billion) defence spending announced for 2022. China's defence budget has been increased by 7.1% as compared to last year.

Title: Madhya Pradesh govt increases DA for state govt employees to 31%
Content: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to increase the dearness allowance for state government employees to 31%, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Saturday. The payment for the same will start from April 2022. He further announced that the state government will also give an additional ₹25,000 to girl students under the "Ladli Laxmi scheme" on taking admission in the college.

Title: CBI lackadaisical, SEBI too kind: Court as it rejects Ramkrishna's pre-arrest bail
Content: Rejecting ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail in the co-location case, a Delhi court called CBI's conduct "lackadaisical". It said, "The conduct of...CBI is most lackadaisical...no action seems to have been taken against the main beneficiaries of the...co-location scam...for almost four full years...Even SEBI, despite being the...markets watchdog, has been too kind and gentle."

Title: What are the major announcements made for B'luru in state Budget 2022-23?
Content: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that ₹8,409 crore has been allocated for Bengaluru's development, including 1,000 crore for the Mekedatu project. He said that a skywalk will be constructed at Banashankari junction to connect the metro station with the bus stand. A mega jewellery park, 'Green Expo' and 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru.

Title: Visa, Mastercard suspend all operations in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
Content: US payments firms Visa and Mastercard have announced that they will suspend all operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. Both the companies said that cards issued abroad will no longer work at Russian ATMs and cards issued by Russian banks will not be supported by their networks. "We don’t take this decision lightly," said Mastercard in its statement.

Title: Fashion brands H&M, Zara & Mango shut outlets in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
Content: Zara owner, Inditex has announced that it will close its shops in Russia and also halt online sales over the country’s invasion of Ukraine. Inditex has 502 stores in Russia, of which 86 are Zara outlets. This comes after fashion retailers Mango and H&M also closed their respective shops in Russia owing to the same reason.

Title: Russian billionaires' luxury yachts, villas worth $156 million seized by Italy
Content: Italian authorities have seized luxury yachts and villas worth $156 million from sanctioned Russian billionaires since Friday. Italy has impounded yachts belonging to Russia's richest man, Alexei Mordashov and Gennady Timchenko, a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Further, reports said villas owned by billionaire Alisher Usmanov and state TV host Vladimir Soloviev were also seized.

Title: Satyagraha will prove an unconquerable force: Mahindra on protests in Ukraine
Content: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted a video of unarmed Ukrainians protesting against Russian troops in Kherson. Mahindra wrote, "When an army has to face unarmed civilians, they’re facing a weapon more powerful than tanks. Satyagraha will always prove an unconquerable force…Ask the British." In the clip, shots were also fired to disperse the crowd.

Title: Look for a job you'd choose if you had no need for money: Warren Buffett
Content: Warren Buffett, the Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth-richest man, has advised college students to seek employment in the field and with the kind of people they would choose if they had no need for money. In his recent shareholder letter, he added, "For when they find that sort of job, they will no longer be 'working'."

Title: Russian banks to switch to China's UnionPay as Visa, Mastercard cut links
Content: Sberbank, Russia's biggest lender, along with Alfa Bank and Tinkoff on Sunday said they would soon start issuing cards using the Chinese UnionPay card operator's system coupled with Russia's Mir network. This comes after Visa and MasterCard suspended their operations in Russia owing to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Payments company PayPal also suspended its operations in Russia on Saturday.

Title: Biggest advice I got from Elon on crypto is 'be cautious': Musk's brother
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk told Input Magazine the biggest advice he got from Elon regarding cryptocurrencies is "be cautious". Kimbal said he doesn't even know what the Tesla CEO's views are on cryptocurrencies. Kimbal earlier said Tesla was ignorant of the environmental impact of cryptocurrencies when it purchased Bitcoin and started accepting it for car purchases.

Title: Psychologist said ex-NSE CEO Chitra was evasive during probe: CBI
Content: During the hearing of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application in connection with co-location case, the CBI said a senior forensic psychologist was roped in to extract facts from Ramkrishna. "The...psychologist...observed that [Ramkrishna] was evasive in her responses. She always attributed knowledge regarding matters to her lower functionaries," the CBI told the court.

Title: FPIs withdraw record ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4
Content: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4 amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. This is almost half of the amount FPIs withdrew in February 2022 at ₹35,506 crore, which was the highest amount withdrawn since March 2020. As per depositories data, they pulled out ₹14,721 crore from equities and ₹2,808 crore from the debt segment.

Title: GST Council may raise lowest tax slab from 5% to 8%: Reports
Content: The GST Council may, in its next meeting, raise the lowest tax slab from 5% to 8% and prune the GST exemption list to increase revenues, Moneycontrol reported. A state finance ministers' panel will submit its report by March-end to the Council. The panel may also recommend a three-tier GST structure, with rates at 8%, 18% and 28%.

Title: Nag Ashwin seeks Mahindra's help to build futuristic vehicles for film, Mahindra replies
Content: Director Nag Ashwin, who's shooting 'Project K' starring Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan and Deepika Padukone,  sought Anand Mahindra's support in building futuristic vehicles for the movie. "How could we refuse an opportunity to help you envision the future of mobility?" Mahindra responded. "Chief of Global Product Development @Velu_Mahindra will...happily throw his weight behind you," he added.

Title: US imposes full blocking sanctions against Putin's spokesperson, 7 Russian elites
Content: The US announced new full blocking sanctions against seven Russian elites and President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov, calling him a "top purveyor of Putin's propaganda". It also imposed visa restrictions on 19 oligarchs and their families. One of Russia's richest men Alisher Usmanov's property has been blocked from use in US, including his superyacht, which Germany seized recently.

Title: Russia blocks access to BBC's website, Facebook, Google Play: Report
Content: The BBC's website appeared to be blocked in Russia as reports said there were problems accessing the website, hours after it brought back shortwave radio technology to cover the Russia-Ukraine war. BBC Russia's Twitter account claimed that Facebook parent Meta, Google Play Store and German public broadcaster Deutsche Welle also appeared to be blocked in Russia.

Title: Russian economy headed for deep recession, may face 1998-like crisis: JPMorgan
Content: JPMorgan & Chase's economists said the Russian economy "now looks headed for a deep recession" following sanctions by Western countries. They expect Russia's GDP to contract 7% this year as compared to a 5.3% contraction in the 1998 debt crisis. A peak-to trough decline in Russian GDP is now expected "at around 12%, comparable to 1998 (~10%) crisis", economists added.

Title: I found him shrewd, charismatic: Harsh Goenka on meeting Vladimir Putin years ago
Content: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Harsh Goenka, the Chairman of RPG Enterprises, took to Twitter to recall that he met Russian President Vladimir Putin several years ago. "I found him shrewd, calm, charismatic and nationalistic. They say that the face becomes the mirror of the mind," he wrote. His tweet included an artwork showing Putin with fangs, surrounded by houseflies.

Title: UK freezes assets of Russian billionaire & ex-deputy PM, imposes travel ban on them
Content: The UK government has announced new immediate sanctions on two Russian oligarchs, which include a full asset freeze and travel bans. The two oligarchs are Arsenal FC's former billionaire shareholder Alisher Usmanov and Russia's former deputy PM Igor Shuvalov. "Putin associates [are] now cut off from their significant UK interests including mansions worth tens of millions," the government said.

Title: Apple's corporate staff to start returning to offices from April 11
Content: Apple's corporate employees will start returning to offices from April 11, the company's CEO Tim Cook told employees in an email. Employees will be required to work from office at least one day per week by that date, Cook said. He added that employees will need to be in the office at least three days a week from May 23.

Title: Need to increase oil, gas output to make up for Russian exports: Musk
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to discuss the need to increase oil and gas output, saying, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately." He acknowledged the move would "negatively affect Tesla", however, he further said, "Sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil & gas exports."

Title: Microsoft suspends sales of products & services in Russia
Content:
Microsoft on Friday announced that it was suspending new sales of its products and services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Microsoft added that it will proactively work to help 
cybersecurity officials in Ukraine defend against Russian attacks. "We stand with Ukraine in calling for the restoration of peace, respect for Ukraine’s sovereignty," the company added.

Title: We're not obsessed with wealth, it's boring: World's richest man Musk's brother
Content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk said in an interview that he and his brother aren't obsessed with wealth. "I do know other people...are obsessed with wealth...And that's not me...it's not my brother. It's boring," he added. Kimbal claimed Musk has "paid more taxes than any human on the planet in the history of America".

Title: Twitter to reopen all offices from March 15, staff can pick work from home 'forever'
Content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Twitter will reopen all its offices around the world from March 15 after nearly two years. However, he added that employees can work wherever they feel the most "productive and creative" and that includes "working from home full-time forever". They can also choose to work some days in office and some days at home.

Title: BharatPe removes Ashneer Grover's profile from its website days after his exit
Content: After the company removed Ashneer Grover as the founder of BharatPe, his profile and photo have also been removed from its website. In a statement, the company had accused Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain of misappropriating company funds to fund their lavish lifestyle. The 'About Us' page now features Co-Founder Shashvat Nakrani, CEO Suhail Sameer, Nishit Sharma, among others.

Title: Russia's 4th richest person's ₹543 crore superyacht seized by Italy
Content: Italian authorities have detained the superyacht of Russian billionaire Alexey Mordashov, who was recently sanctioned by European Union, in the coastal city of Imperia. The 56-year-old Chairman of Russian steel industry firm Severstal is Russia's fourth richest person with a $20.1 billion fortune, as per Bloomberg. His 215-foot yacht named 'Lady M' is worth €65 million (₹543 crore).

Title: China sets lowest GDP growth target in over 30 years at 5.5%
Content: World's second largest economy China has set a GDP growth target of around 5.5% this year, the slowest pace in more than three decades. Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said in his government work report, "Our country will encounter many more risks and challenges." The country will spend 7.1% more on defence this year, outpacing the government's economic growth forecast.

Title: Wait for official announcement: Maker of 'Mriya' reacts to video of its damage
Content: Days after the world's largest aircraft 'Mriya' was destroyed by the Russian forces in Ukraine, its manufacturer, Antonov, responded to a viral video allegedly showing the damage sustained by 'Mriya'. It wrote, "Until the AN-225 has been inspected by experts, we cannot report on the technical condition of the aircraft. Please wait for the official announcements about its condition."

Title: Sanctioned Russian billionaire barred from his European firm's offices
Content: Mikhail Fridman, Russian Co-founder of Luxembourg-based investment group LetterOne, has been barred from entering the company's office buildings or speaking to its employees after the European Union (EU) imposed sanctions on him. LetterOne also said that billionaire Fridman and Russian banker Petr Aven have stepped down from the company's board and their assets in the business have been frozen.

Title: Aviation veteran Sanjiv Kapoor appointed Jet Airways CEO
Content: The Kalrock Capital and Murari Lal Jalan consortium, Jet Airways' new promoters, has appointed Sanjiv Kapoor as CEO of the airline. Kapoor, who was previously SpiceJet's Chief Operating Officer and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer, resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels on Thursday. "By having Sanjiv as CEO...I'm certain Jet Airways will reclaim its lost glory," Jalan said.

Title: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 16,200 amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
Content: The Sensex tanked more than 1,050 points on Friday amid weak global cues due to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The Sensex was trading below 54,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell around 320 points to trade below 16,200. Banks and auto stocks, Maruti Suzuki and Axis Bank, were among worst-hit during intraday trade.

Title: UK's richest woman Denise Coates earns $400 million in a year from her betting company
Content: Denise Coates, the 54-year-old Founder and CEO of Bet365, received £300 million ($400 million) in pay and dividends in a year despite a salary cut, according to a filing by the online bookmaker. The UK's richest woman has earned more than $1.8 billion over the past decade, according to Bloomberg. Her salary makes her one of the world's best-compensated bosses.

Title: Russia-backed media outlet RT America shuts down, fires most of its staff
Content: Russia-backed media outlet RT America is shutting down operations and laying off most of its employees, CNN reported. T&R Productions, the production company behind RT America, attributed the decision to "cease production" to "unforeseen business interruption events" in a memo to its staff. Earlier, satellite operator DirecTV stopped carrying RT America in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine.

Title: Who is Sanjiv Kapoor, the new CEO of Jet Airways?
Content: Sanjiv Kapoor, who reportedly resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels this week, will join Jet Airways as its new CEO on April 4. Kapoor, a Wharton School MBA graduate, started his airline career with Northwest Airlines in the US in 1997. He was SpiceJet's COO between 2013 and 2015 and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer between 2016 and 2019.

Title: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank freezes Russia lending
Content: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) on Thursday said it has put all activities relating to Russia and Belarus on hold and under review owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. China, despite being the Bank's largest shareholder and holding 26.5% of AIIB's voting power, has opposed sanctions imposed on Russia by governments of various countries.

Title: Renault shares fall to lowest since Nov 2020 amid Russia-Ukraine war
Content: The price of shares of French automaker Renault has fallen since last week to trade at their lowest since November 2020, amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It has reportedly lost around a quarter of its market value after the Russian invasion and growing sanctions. Renault, which owns a majority stake in Russian automaker Avtovaz, is monitoring the situation in Ukraine.

Title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee park to be built on 350-acre land in B'luru: Bommai
Content: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced to set up an Atal Bihari Vajpayee park on a 350 acre land in the Jarakabande area of Bengaluru's Yelahanka to increase the city's green cover. The proposed park will be based on the model of Bengaluru's Lalbagh and Cubbon Park. Notably, Bommai has allocated ₹8,409 crore for Bengaluru's development.

Title: K'taka CM allocates ₹1,000 crore to implement Mekedatu project
Content: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 today, announced that ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for the implementation of the Mekedatu project.
