He said the Mekedatu Balancing Reservoir and Bengaluru Drinking Water Project will be implemented by getting a nod from the centre. This comes after the Congress concluded its Mekedatu padayatra on Thursday in Bengaluru.

Title: NSE invites applications for the role of CEO, seeks IPO experience
Content: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) of India is inviting applications from candidates for the role of Managing Director and CEO. The exchange is seeking candidates having IPO (initial public offering) experience and a track record of strengthening corporate governance. The NSE's current Managing Director and CEO Vikram Limaye's five-year tenure is set to end in July 2022.

Title: IPO-bound LIC appoints insurance veteran Sunil Agrawal as CFO: Reports
Content: LIC has appointed former Reliance Nippon Life Insurance CFO Sunil Agrawal as the IPO-bound insurer's CFO, Bloomberg reported. Agrawal served as Nippon's CFO for 12 years till 2018. Prior to that, he worked for ICICI Prudential Life Insurance for five years. He replaced LIC Executive Director Shubhangi Soman and is the first outsider to be appointed to the position.

Title: Oil soars to highest since 2008, hits $116/barrel as Russia invades Ukraine
Content: Oil prices soared to $116 a barrel on Thursday, the highest level since 2008, as buyers continued to reject Russian crude following its invasion of Ukraine. The invasion has sparked supply concerns across commodity markets from energy to grains. Meanwhile, the OPEC+ has stuck with the 4,00,000 barrel-a-day production increase that was scheduled for April.

Title: EU cuts 7 Russian banks from global payment system SWIFT, bans RT & Sputnik
Content: The European Union has said that it is cutting seven Russian banks, including the country's second-biggest lender VTB Bank, from the main international payment system SWIFT. The list doesn't include Russia's largest lender Sberbank and Gazprombank, which handle payments for Russian oil. The EU also banned Russian state-run media outlets RT and Sputnik over disinformation on Ukraine's invasion.

Title: Russia's rating cut to 'junk' by Fitch & Moody's amid sanctions
Content: Global rating agencies Fitch and Moody's have each cut Russia's sovereign credit rating by six notches to "junk" status after the country's invasion of Ukraine. Western sanctions imposed on Russia could undermine its capability and willingness to service debt, they said. Meanwhile, index providers FTSE Russell and MSCI announced that they will remove Russian equities from all their indexes.

Title: Which major US & European companies have taken action against Russia?
Content: British oil companies BP and Shell announced their exit from Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe's Airbus and America's ExxonMobil and Boeing, have cut ties with Russia, while Harley-Davidson and General Motors suspended vehicle exports to Russia. Apple and Dell halted all product sales in Russia, and Apple said, "We are deeply concerned about the Russian invasion of Ukraine."

Title: Chinese company Huawei accused of tax evasion in India: Report
Content: A tax investigation on China's Huawei Technologies allegedly found that the telecoms equipment maker manipulated account books to reduce its taxable income in India, Reuters reported citing a government source. On Thursday, the Finance Ministry said that a "major telecom group" did not account for income of ₹400 crore in its books and couldn't justify expenses of ₹480 crore.

Title: Ford names its EV unit 'Model e', the name it stopped Elon Musk from using
Content: Ford has split its business into two separate entities, one focused on electric vehicles and the other on gas-powered ones. Ford named its electric vehicle unit 'Ford Model e' and the gasoline division 'Ford Blue'. Nearly a decade ago, Ford had stopped Elon Musk's Tesla from naming its car 'Model E' and Tesla eventually named its car 'Model 3'.

Title: Ex-Nissan exec found guilty of helping ex-CEO hiding compensation
Content: Former Nissan executive Greg Kelly has been given a six-month suspended sentence for helping former CEO Carlos Ghosn hide his compensation from regulators, in Tokyo. A judge suspended Kelly's sentence for three years in his ruling on Thursday, ending months of trial proceedings. The two executives were arrested in Tokyo in November 2018 and charged with various financial misconduct offences.

Title: Amazon may file criminal case over Future's transfer of stores to Reliance: Report
Content: Amazon is reportedly planning to initiate criminal court proceedings against Future Retail for allowing the transfer of assets to Reliance Industries. Earlier, Reuters reported that Mukesh Ambani-led RIL had started taking over 500 of Future's stores. The development came amid Future's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over its ₹24,713-crore sale of retail assets to RIL.

Title: Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals: Future Retail in SC
Content: Amazon's counsel on Thursday in the Supreme Court proposed talks with Future Retail and Reliance to end months-long legal battles between the companies. After Amazon's proposal, advocate Harish Salve, representing Future Retail said, "Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals." He asked, "What is preventing Amazon's boss from calling up Biyanis (Future Group's Kishore Biyani)?"

Title: Amazon, Future Group agree to hold talks to settle 18-month long legal dispute
Content: During a Supreme Court hearing on Thursday, Amazon and Kishore Biyani-led Future Group agreed to initiate talks for an out-of-court settlement of the 18-month long legal dispute between the two. "No one is winning. FRL, Reliance and Amazon all have issues," Future Group's counsel Harish Salve said. The court granted them 10 days to explore settlement.

Title: World's largest yacht worth ₹4,500 cr seized by Germany from Russian billionaire: Reports
Content: German authorities have reportedly seized the ₹4,500-crore superyacht belonging to Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov in a Hamburg shipyard. The 512-foot yacht named Dilbar is the world’s largest motor yacht by gross tonnage at 15,917 tons. Usmanov was on a list of billionaires to face sanctions from European Union in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

Title: Tesla, Google, Apple & 5 other US stocks to begin trading on NSE IFSC today
Content: The NSE International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) platform in Gujarat's GIFT City will start trading in eight US stocks from today. The stocks include Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet (Google), Apple, Meta Platforms (Facebook), Microsoft, Netflix and Walmart. To make US stocks accessible to Indians, market makers will buy shares in US and issue unsponsored depositary receipts against them, NSE said.

Title: I had no idea there was such a shortfall of medical colleges in India: Mahindra
Content: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday tweeted, "I had no idea that there was such a shortfall  of medical colleges in India." The billionaire tweeted this in response to a graphic that listed the top destinations for Indian medical students and the number of students who are there. It stated that 23,000 Indian medical students are in China alone.

Title: How can Indian investors trade in US stocks like Tesla through NSE IFSC?
Content: Indian retail investors will be able to trade in eight US stocks, including Tesla, through NSE IFSC platform from today. The platform's market makers will buy shares in US and issue receipts against them to investors. The receipts, issued at low costs, will represent a fraction of the value of shares. Trading in receipts will take place in US dollars.

Title: Mukesh Ambani's $89.9 bn fortune nearly equals Russia's 4 richest men combined
Content: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani currently has a net worth of $89.9 billion, which is nearly equal to that of Russia's four richest billionaires combined. Russia's richest man Vladimir Potanin has a net worth of $25.2 billion, as per Bloomberg, while Severstal's ex-CEO Alexey Mordashov and Novatek Founder Leonid Mikhelson's fortunes stand at $22 billion each.

Title: Oracle suspends operations in Russia, SAP pauses sales
Content: Oracle said it has suspended all operations in Russia, while SAP announced it will pause all sales, after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote letters to them requesting to end services to Russia. In response to Fedorov's request, Oracle said it had "already suspended all operations". SAP called sanctions against Russia "an important mechanism" in efforts to restore peace.

Title: Ikea suspends Russia, Belarus operations; 15,000 staff to be affected
Content: Ikea on Thursday said it would suspend its operations in Russia and Belarus in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. The shutdown of operations will affect 15,000 employees, 17 stores and three production sites. "The war has had a huge human impact already. It is also resulting in serious disruptions to supply chain and trading conditions," the company said.

Title: YouTube's creators contributed ₹6,800 cr to Indian GDP in 2020: Report
Content: Google-owned YouTube on Thursday said its creator ecosystem in India contributed ₹6,800 crore to India's GDP and supported an equivalent of 6,83,900 full-time jobs in the country in 2020. YouTube cited an Oxford Economics report while sharing the company's economic impact in India. "Impact [of our creators, artists] on the economy's overall success will only continue to accelerate," YouTube said.

Title: Representations on crypto regulations have been made to govt: Ex-SEBI chief
Content: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator has made representations to the government on regulation of cryptocurrencies in India. Tyagi said SEBI has been in discussion with the government since November 2021 and has made several representations. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in Budget 2022 that a 30% tax will be imposed on all virtual digital assets.

Title: India trying to increase its footprint in international gaming sector: PM Modi
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the gaming sector "is huge internationally" and India is trying to increase its footprint in it. "The number of youth connected to this market globally is increasing. That's why...we have focused on Animation Visual Effects Gaming Comic [in Budget 2022]," PM Modi said. "For us, technology is mainstay of making the country self-reliant," he added.

Title: Palihapitiya accused of insider sale of Virgin Galactic shares worth $315 mn
Content: Former Virgin Galactic Chairman Chamath Palihapitiya has been accused of selling 10 million of firm's shares for $315 million by leveraging his position before quitting. The lawsuit also alleges Founder Richard Branson nabbed $301 million by selling shares while stock price was "artificially inflated". The suit was filed on behalf of Virgin Galactic to seek damages from directors and officers.

Title: 12th edition of Bengaluru India Nano to be held from March 7-9
Content: The 12th edition of the three-day-long Bengaluru India Nano event with 'Nanotech for Sustainable Future' as its central theme will be held from March 7-9, said Karnataka Minister Dr Ashwathnarayan CN. Over 10 countries and 2,500 registered delegates will be participating in the summit which will have over 40 companies showcasing its nanotech products, services, and innovation and poster sessions.

Title: Vodafone Idea to raise ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to promoters
Content: Vodafone Idea (Vi) on Thursday said its board has approved raising ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to its promoters on preferential basis. The firm will issue up to 3.39 billion shares at ₹13.30 a share, 20% premium to its current market price, to Vodafone Group's Euro Pacific Securities and Prime Metals and Aditya Birla Group's (ABG) Oriana Investments.

Title: Reliance to invest ₹1,670 cr in Sanmina to make electronics in India
Content: Reliance Industries will be investing ₹1,670 crore in a joint venture with US-listed Sanmina for making electronic products in India. Reliance will hold a 50.1% stake in the JV after the investment in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The new entity will serve both domestic and export markets. It aims to make hardware for 5G communications, among other things.

Title: SEBI didn't dilute orders on NSE matter, acted as per remit: Ex-SEBI Chief
Content: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator didn't "dilute" its orders on the National Stock Exchange issue, and that it "came out with orders within [SEBI's] remit and understanding". This comes days after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government was analysing if SEBI took "necessary punitive" action in the matter. SEBI's working is transparent, Tyagi added.

Title: Eveready's Chairman & MD resign post open offer from Burman family
Content: Eveready's Non-Executive Chairman Aditya Khaitan and Managing Director Amritanshu Khaitan resigned from their positions following an open offer from Dabur Group's Burman family to buy an additional 26% stake in Eveready. The company said the two have stepped down "to enable [Eveready] to benefit from new leadership and direction". Joint MD Suvamoy Saha will assume charge as Eveready's interim MD.

Title: UP RERA's NCR forum settled 1,150 property disputes worth over ₹345 cr
Content: UP Real Estate Regulatory Authority's (RERA) NCR conciliation forum has so far settled 1,150 disputes involving properties worth over ₹345 crore, officials said. Most of the disputes came from the allottees of the projects in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Meerut and Bulandshahr, they added. The cases pertained to delay in registered sale deed and possession of units to allottees.

Title: Apollo 24|7 launches 'One Tap' consultations starting at just ₹250
Content: Apollo announced 'One Tap' consultations with their expert doctors using Apollo 24|7 app, starting at just ₹250. "Users will benefit from these consultations, especially in cases of minor ailments, and no-one will have to take medicines without proper medical supervision," Apollo said, calling this a big step towards better healthcare in India. Users can download Apollo 24|7 app for free.

Title: Ashneer no longer a founder, his family engaged in misappropriation of funds: BharatPe
Content: A day after BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover resigned as MD, BharatPe said in a statement on Wednesday that he is "no longer an employee, a founder, or a director of the company". BharatPe also alleged that Ashneer's "family and their relatives engaged in extensive misappropriation of company funds" and board reserves the right to take further legal action against him.

Title: US oil giant Exxon to exit its last Russian project, won't make new investments
Content: American oil giant ExxonMobil will exit its last remaining oil and gas project in Russia and won't invest in new developments in Russia, following Ukraine's invasion. Exxon operates the Sakhalin-1 project on behalf of a consortium that includes Japanese, Indian and Russian companies. Exxon would end over a quarter-century of continuing business presence in Russia by quitting this project.

Title: Russia's largest lender Sberbank to exit Europe, cites abnormal cash outflows
Content: Russia's largest lender Sberbank is leaving almost all European markets after coming under pressure of Western sanctions that were imposed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The group's subsidiary banks have faced abnormal cash outflows and threats to the safety of its employees and branches," it said. Earlier, the European Central Bank (ECB) ordered the closure of Sberbank's European arm.

Title: Switzerland breaks 207-yr-old policy of neutrality to impose sanctions on Russia
Content: Switzerland has broken away from its long-standing policy of neutrality after 207 years and agreed to adopt all the sanctions that the EU has imposed on Russia, due to its invasion of Ukraine. Accordingly, the Swiss assets of certain Russian people and companies will be frozen. "We're in an extraordinary situation where extraordinary measures could be decided," said Swiss President.

Title: Grover family used company's money to fund their lavish lifestyles: BharatPe
Content: BharatPe on Wednesday alleged that Ashneer Grover and family "grossly abused" company expense accounts to "enrich themselves and fund their lavish lifestyles". The Grover family created "fake vendors through which they siphoned money away from the company's account", it said in a statement. BharatPe removed Ashneer as a founder, a day after he resigned as MD and director.

Title: If I start speaking, Sequoia won't be able to invest in India: BharatPe's Ashneer
Content: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as MD, in an interview, criticised board chairman Rajnish Kumar, CEO Suhail Sameer and other independent directors and investors, saying, "I have so much dirt on them." "Tomorrow if I start speaking, Sequoia (Capital) will not be able to make a single investment in India. You will have ED, CBI behind them," he claimed.

Title: Won't allow deplorable conduct of Grover family to tarnish our reputation: BharatPe
Content: While removing Ashneer Grover as an employee, founder and director, BharatPe said in a statement, "The board will not allow the deplorable conduct of the Grover family to tarnish BharatPe's reputation." The company alleged that his family engaged in "misappropriation of funds" and Ashneer submitted his resignation ahead of the board's plan to table the report on the governance review.

Title: Biden praises only Ford & GM in State of the Union speech; Tesla CEO Musk reacts
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to US President Joe Biden after he praised GM and Ford for investing billions on electric vehicles and didn't include Tesla in State of the Union address. "Tesla...created over 50,000 US jobs building EVs & is investing more than double GM + Ford combined. [FYI to person controlling this Twitter]," the Tesla CEO said.

Title: Ashneer's wife says 'time to move on', deletes tweets & videos against BharatPe
Content: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain, who was recently fired by BharatPe, deleted tweets and videos criticising the activities of the company's top officials. "We stand by each of our statements but it's time for us to move ahead towards positivity and away from...endless media drama," she said. She also deleted an alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Bhavik Koladiya abusing Ashneer.

Title: India needs to be economically strong to not be lectured on freedom: Zoho CEO
Content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu in a tweet discussing India being "lectured" on democracy, freedom and the global order by others, said, "The only way for India not to get lectured is to be technologically self-reliant and economically strong." He added that sustained efforts will take India 10-20 years to achieve technological parity. "There are no shortcuts," Vembu said.

Title: Ship with 4,000 cars including Porsches sinks 2 weeks after catching fire mid-ocean
Content: A burnt-out cargo ship carrying around 4,000 cars made by Volkswagen Group, including Lamborghinis, Porsches, Bentleys and Audis, sank on Tuesday off the Portuguese Azores archipelago. The ship sank nearly two weeks after it caught fire mid-ocean. "When the towing started...water started to come in...The ship lost its stability and sank," the captain of the nearest port said.

Title: Inflation hits all-time-high of 5.8% in 19 nations using euro
Content: Consumer inflation in the 19 countries that use the euro currency increased by an annual 5.8% in February 2022,  European Union statistics agency Eurostat said on Wednesday. It's the highest level since recordkeeping for the euro started in 1997. Inflation in Europe, as in other major economies, has been increasing by surging energy prices following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

Title: Sensex crashes 1,100 points, Nifty below 16,600 amid Russia-Ukraine war
Content: The Sensex crashed around 1,100 points on Wednesday after crude oil price surged past $110 per barrel amid Russia-Ukraine war and India reported that its GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in Q3. The Sensex was trading below 55,200 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 fell over 270 points to trade below 16,600 levels.

Title: I need to go back & review the situation: FM on LIC IPO amid Russia-Ukraine war
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while speaking on LIC IPO amid the Russia-Ukraine war, told The Hindu BusinessLine, "Now there's a full-scale war. Therefore, I need to go back and review the situation." Sitharaman also said, "Ideally, I'd like to go ahead with it, because it is something we have planned for some time purely based on Indian considerations."

Title: Russian billionaires lose combined $83 billion wealth in 2 months
Content: The combined wealth of Russia's 22 richest individuals has plunged by $83 billion since January 2022, as per Bloomberg. The wipeout comes amid extreme market declines following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Lukoil Chairman Vagit Alekperov has lost the most among Russian billionaires with his net worth declining by $13 billion. Meanwhile, Gennady Timchenko has lost almost half of his wealth.

Title: Nike temporarily halts sales in Russia via its website, app
Content: Nike is temporarily halting sales from its website and app in Russia, saying that it "cannot guarantee delivery of goods to customers in Russia". An update on its website directed customers to their nearest Nike stores. Ukrainian Member of Parliament Lesia Vasylenko praised Nike saying it's a "great example" of how private companies can impose sanctions against Russia.

Title: Oil price crosses $110 mark, reaches highest level since July 2014
Content: Crude oil price hit its highest level since July 2014 as it rose past the $110/barrel mark on Wednesday as sanctions imposed on Russia continued to mount. Brent crude rose over 5.8% to $111.09/barrel, its highest since July 2014. US West Texas Intermediate jumped nearly 6% to $109.30/barrel, its highest since September 2013.

Title: Visa, Mastercard block Russian financial institutions after sanctions
Content: Visa and Mastercard have blocked multiple Russian financial institutions, including the Russian central bank, from their network after the US imposed sanctions over Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We'll continue to work with regulators...to abide fully by our compliance obligations as they evolve," Mastercard said. Visa and Mastercard also promised to contribute $2 million each for humanitarian aid.

Title: Honda suspends car, motorcycle exports to Russia amid invasion
Content: Honda has suspended its automobile and motorcycle exports to Russia, amid growing sanctions on Russia in protest against its invasion of Ukraine. A Honda spokesperson said exports to Russia were already suspended as of Wednesday. The firm's suspension is reportedly based on complications with its distribution networks and concerns surrounding sanctions against Russia.

Title: Bitcoin briefly rises above $44,000 for the 1st time since Feb 17
Content: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, was briefly trading above $44,000 for the first time since February 17 on Tuesday. It rose as much as 6% to $44,183 and was later trading at around $43,400. The surge came amid growing demand for cryptocurrencies following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and escalating sanctions on Russia.

Title: Firm behind Free Fire app loses $132 bn in market value in 5 months
Content: Singapore-based Sea Ltd, the owner of Garena Free Fire game, has lost $132 billion in market value from its peak last year in October. Its shares fell 13% in US trading on Tuesday, wiping $11 billion from its market valuation. Sea had earlier lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned Free Fire's app.

Title: Reliance buys majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore
Content: Reliance Retail on Tuesday announced it has acquired a majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore (A&T) for an undisclosed amount. A&T's founders Rakesh Thakore, Kevin Nigli and David Abraham will continue to lead the creative direction of the brand, the company said. Reliance has recently invested in several designer labels including Ritu Kumar and Manish Malhotra's companies.

Title: Adani Group forays into media business with minority stake in Quintillion
Content: Adani Group will acquire a minority stake in Quintillion Business Media (QBM) Private Limited as it ventures in the news industry. A joint statement by the two companies said their relationship "marks a strong beginning of Adani Group's foray into Indian media". The deal is only limited to QBM and not any other products of QBM's parent company Quint.

Title: Jet fuel prices touch highest ever after 3.3% hike, fifth hike in 2022
Content: Prices of Jet fuel, or Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF), touched their all-time high after a 3.22% rise due to rising crude oil prices. ATF price was hiked by ₹3,010.87/kilolitre to ₹93,530.66/kl in Delhi. This is the fifth time that prices of ATF, which makes up for almost 40% of an airline's running cost, have been hiked in 2022.

Title: GST revenues rise 18% in Feb to cross ₹1.3 lakh cr mark for 5th time
Content: Gross revenue collection from GST surged 18% YoY to ₹1,33,026 crore in February 2022, government data showed. This is the fifth time GST collection crossed the ₹1.3 lakh crore mark. Revenues collected in February 2022 are 26% higher than those collected in February 2020. Of the total revenue, central GST is ₹24,435 crore and state GST is ₹30,779 crore.

Title: Future Retail gets NCLT nod to convene meetings to approve RIL deal
Content: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has allowed Future Retail to convene meetings of its shareholders and creditors to seek their approval for the sale of its retail assets to Reliance Retail. The companies had announced the ₹24,713 crore deal in 2020. Notably, Reliance has started taking over the operations of Future Retail stores, as per reports last week.

Title: Ilker Ayci declines offer to be new Air India CEO
Content: Former Chairman of Turkish Airlines, Ilker Ayci, has rejected Tata Sons' offer to be Air India's new CEO. Ayci alleged that his appointment to the position was "coloured" by Indian media, Bloomberg reported citing an email. Earlier, RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch opposed the appointment of Ayci, who was Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's advisor in 1990s, citing "national security".

Title: Ashneer Grover quits as BharatPe MD, says 'I'm being forced to bid adieu'
Content: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover, who's in a tussle with the board over a governance review, has resigned as MD and director. In his letter, Ashneer said, "I write this with a heavy heart as...I'm being forced to bid adieu to a company of which I'm a Founder." Earlier, his wife Madhuri was fired as Head of Controls on funds misappropriation allegations.

Title: Disney, Warner Bros, Sony pausing film releases in Russia over Ukraine invasion
Content: Hollywood studios Disney, Warner Bros, and Sony Pictures Entertainment said they would pause theatrical releases of upcoming films in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The Walt Disney said it is pausing the release of theatrical films, starting with the upcoming Pixar Animation Studios release, 'Turning Red'. WarnerMedia said it would pause this week's release of 'The Batman' in Russia.

Title: SBI stops handling trade with sanctioned Russian entities: Report
Content: India's largest lender State Bank of India won't process any transactions involving Russian entities that have been sanctioned after the invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing a letter. "Transactions involving entities, banks, ports or vessels appearing" on a US, European Union or United Nations sanctions list won't be processed irrespective of the currency used, SBI told certain clients.

Title: Russia further isolated from international financial system, Putin must fail: UK
Content: UK's Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said, "We've further isolated Russia from the international financial system this morning." He added, "Working with our partners, and the G7, we are determined to impose the most severe economic measures possible against Russian President Vladimir Putin for his abhorrent campaign against Ukraine." The UK PM also said, "Putin must fail."

Title: UK oil giant Shell to exit all joint ventures with Russia's Gazprom
Content: British oil giant Shell will exit all its joint ventures with Russian government-controlled energy company Gazprom and related entities. Its assets in these ventures are worth about $3 billion. Shell will also stop working on the Nord Stream 2 pipeline project. Describing Russia's actions in Ukraine as "a senseless act of military aggression", Shell said, "We will not stand by."

Title: Do you think I listen to anyone's advice?: Ashneer on his decision to quit BharatPe
Content: Ashneer Grover, while responding to a journalist’s query if his decision to resign from BharatPe was a personal one or advised by his lawyer, said, "Do you think I listen to anyone’s advice?...God has given me my mind and I have enough courage to take decisions on my own." He added, "I am Ashneer Grover...I'm not answerable to anyone."

Title: You treat founders as slaves, cut us down at will: Ashneer to BharatPe investors
Content: In his letter of resignation as BharatPe MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover alleged that the company's investors and board treat founders as "slaves", pushing "us to build multi-billion-dollar businesses and cutting us down at will". "Today I'm being vilified and treated in the most disgraceful manner...I cease to be a human for you (investors)," he added.

Title: Ashneer quit ahead of PwC report, board reserves right to take action: BharatPe
Content: After BharatPe's Ashneer Grover resigned as MD and director, BharatPe said he resigned "minutes after receiving the agenda for upcoming board meeting that included submission of the PwC report regarding his conduct". "The Board reserves the right to take action based on the report's findings," the company added. Co-founder Ashneer said he was being "forced to bid adieu" to BharatPe.

Title: I challenge you to run this company better without me: Ashneer to BharatPe board
Content: While resigning as BharatPe's MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover said in a letter to the board, "Since you clearly believe you can run this company better without me – I'm leaving you with this challenge." "Build incrementally even half of the value I created so far," he wrote. He added that he'll continue as BharatPe's single largest individual shareholder.

Title: Not a beggar: Ashneer on receiving any compensation after quitting BharatPe
Content: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover on Tuesday resigned from the company. When asked if he was offered any monetary compensation by the board, he responded, "I am not a beggar. The board can't even look me in the eyes. I am not at their mercy. They are at our mercy." He also said that he'll be a shareholder at the company.

Title: Price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinder increased by ₹105 in Delhi from today
Content: The prices of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders have been increased by ₹105 in Delhi, effective from March 1. With this increase, now 19 kg commercial cylinder will cost ₹2,012 in the national capital. The price of 5 kg commercial LPG cylinders has also been raised by ₹27. Now a 5 kg cylinder will cost ₹569 in Delhi.

Title: Russia bans residents from transferring money abroad from March 1
Content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a ban on foreign exchange loans and transfers by its residents to outside of the country from March 1, in response to the economic sanctions imposed by the West. It also prohibits companies from buying back their own stocks. This comes after Russia banned flights from 36 countries in a retaliatory move against EU.

Title: India's GDP growth slows to 5.4% in Q3 of FY22 compared to 8.4% in Q2
Content: India's GDP growth slowed down to 5.4% during the third quarter of 2021-2022 compared to 8.4% in the previous quarter, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said on Monday. It also estimated that India's GDP will likely grow by 8.9% in 2021-22. In its first advanced estimate, the government had estimated the GDP in 2021-22 to grow by 9.2%.

Title: Amul increases price for milk across India by ₹2 per litre
Content: Amul on Monday said it is increasing the price for its milk across India by ₹2 per litre. The increased price of Amul milk will be applicable from tomorrow, March 1. Amul said that it is increasing the price of milk due to an increase in the prices of energy, packaging, transportation cost and animal feed.

Title: After Amul, Gowardhan milk prices increased by ₹2 per litre
Content: A day after Amul increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre, Parag Milk Foods has raised the price of Gowardhan brand of cow milk by ₹2 per litre with immediate effect. "This price hike is being done after almost 3 years due to rise in costs of energy, packaging, logistics and cattle feed," Chairman Devendra Shah said.

Title: Estée Lauder fires senior exec Demsey for posting racist meme on Instagram
Content: The Estée Lauder Companies has fired Executive Group President John Demsey for posting a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about COVID-19. The company said Demsey's Instagram posts caused "widespread offence". Demsey, who oversees brands like Clinique and Mac, had apologised last week for "carelessly reposting a racist meme without reading it beforehand."

Title: Old income tax regime with deductions must go: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj
Content: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has said that the old income tax regime must be disincentivised and the new regime must be incentivised with no exemptions. "The new regime will not take over unless we do so," Bajaj said. "What should the simple regime be? The simple regime should be broader tax slabs, lower taxes, no exemptions," he added.

Title: Who is Madhabi Puri Buch, the first-ever woman to head SEBI?
Content: Madhabi Puri Buch has been appointed as the first-ever woman Chairperson of SEBI. She was not only SEBI's first woman whole-time member but also the first person working at SEBI from the private sector. An IIM Ahmedabad alumna, Buch started her career with ICICI Bank, joined Greater Pacific Capital in Singapore and also served at New Development Bank in Shanghai.

Title: US bans transactions with Russian central bank, National Wealth Fund
Content: The United States on Monday banned its citizens and companies from carrying out transactions with the Russian central Bank, the National Wealth Fund and the Ministry of Finance. The move will immobilise any Russian central bank assets held in the US, the country's Treasury department said. The US also announced penalties on the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF).

Title: $2.4-bn fraud accused Indian founder of BitConnect has disappeared: US regulator
Content: Cryptocurrency investment platform BitConnect's Founder Satish Kumbhani, charged criminally in the US for running a $2.4-billion ponzi scheme, has disappeared from India, officials said. The 36-year-old Kumbhani has "likely relocated from India to an unknown address in a foreign country", SEC attorney Richard Primoff said in a court filing. US SEC has been attempting to locate him since November.

Title: GM, Harley-Davidson halt shipments to Russia amid ongoing war
Content: General Motors and Harley-Davidson have halted their shipments to Russia amid the ongoing war in Ukraine and the resultant economic sanctions. GM cited "a number of external factors, including supply chain issues and other matters beyond the company's control". Harley-Davidson relied on Europe and the Mideast for 31% of motorcycle sales last year.

Title: Burman family makes offer to buy additional 26% stake in Eveready
Content: Eveready's single-largest investor Burman family on Monday said it made an open offer to buy an additional 26% stake, or 18.9 million shares, for ₹604.76 crore in Eveready Industries Ltd. The mandatory open offer under the takeover regulations was made as the Burmans acquired an additional 5.26% share of Eveready for ₹122.30 crore, taking their total shareholding to 25.11%.

Title: Credit growth to industry rises to 6.4% in Jan 2022 from 0.7% in Jan 2021
Content: Reserve Bank of India's data showed that India's credit growth to industry rose from 0.7% in January 2021 to 6.4% in January 2022. Credit growth to medium enterprises is pegged at 74.7% against 21.8% in January 2021. Credit growth to micro and small industries accelerated to 19.7% from 0.5% and credit to large industries rose to 0.5% against -0.2%.

Title: Biocon Biologics acquires Viatris' biosimilars assets in ₹25,169 cr deal
Content: India's largest biopharmaceutical firm Biocon Biologics Ltd (BBL) signed a pact with Viatris to acquire the latter's biosimilars business for up to $3.34 billion (₹25,169 crore) in cash and stock. Viatris will receive $2 billion (₹15,071 crore) in cash on closing of the transaction and up to $335 million (₹2,524 crore) as additional payments expected to be paid in 2024.

Title: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's appeal to drop its remarks against him in 10 days
Content: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's appeal to expunge remarks made against him in the Court's 2021 verdict upholding Mistry's removal from the Tata Sons board. The plea said SC's remarks affect Mistry's "reputation, integrity and character". The Court said it will hear the plea in 10 days.

Title: Govt's fiscal deficit rises to 59% of FY22 target in Apr 2021-Jan 2022
Content: The Centre's fiscal deficit rose to 58.9% of its FY22 target between April 2021 and January 2022, data by the Controller General of Accounts showed. In Budget 2021, the government had aimed for a fiscal deficit of 6.8% of the GDP in FY22. Centre's capital expenditure in April 2021-January 2022 recorded a 22% YoY rise to ₹4.42 lakh crore.

Title: US, allies cut selected Russian banks from main international payment system SWIFT
Content: The US, EU and their allies have agreed to cut off a number of Russian banks from the main international payment system, SWIFT. The measures also include restrictions on the Russian central bank's international reserves, ending the "golden passports" for wealthy Russians and their families and targeting individuals and institutions in Russia and elsewhere that support the war against Ukraine.

Title: Government assures fuel price stability amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
Content: The Centre on Saturday said that it is closely monitoring global energy markets and potential energy supply disruptions amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The government said, "With a view to ensuring energy justice for its citizens and for just energy transition towards a net zero future, India stands ready to take appropriate action for ensuring ongoing supplies at stable prices."

Title: Madhabi Puri Buch appointed as first woman Chairperson of SEBI
Content: The government on Monday appointed Madhabi Puri Buch as the first woman chairperson of market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for three years. Buch, a former SEBI Whole Time Member, will be replacing Ajay Tyagi whose tenure ends on February 28. Buch, who studied at IIM Ahmedabad, has previously worked at ICICI Bank and Greater Pacific Capital.

Title: UK oil giant BP to exit its 19.75% shareholding in Russian oil firm Rosneft
Content: British oil giant BP will exit its 19.75% shareholding in Russian government-owned oil firm Rosneft. "Russia's attack on Ukraine is an act of aggression that is having tragic consequences across the region," BP Chairman Helge Lund said. BP, which has operated in Russia for over 30 years, will no longer report reserves, production or profit for Rosneft.

Title: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, rejects calls to sell Russian assets
Content: World's largest sovereign wealth fund's CEO Nicolai Tangen is rejecting calls to sell its Russian assets after the country invaded Ukraine. "If we sold out of Russia now, it would be a wrapped gift to the oligarchs who buy our shares," Tangen said. The Norway-based Norges Bank Investment Management owns 1.5% of every listed company in the world.

Title: Japanese billionaire donates $8.7 mn to Ukraine, says 'Met Ukraine Prez in 2019'
Content: Japanese billionaire Hiroshi 'Mickey' Mikitani, the Chairman and CEO of electronic commerce company Rakuten, has donated $8.7 million to Ukraine. He called Russia's attack "a challenge to democracy". In a letter to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Hiroshi said, "I vividly remember the early summer of 2019 as if it were yesterday when I visited Kiev and met with you."

Title: One thing this war teaches for sure, be Atmanirbhar: Kotak on Russia-Ukraine
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank's billionaire CEO Uday Kotak in a tweet said, "One thing this war teaches for sure: be Atmanirbhar!" He said, "Ukraine Russia conflict highlights that geography matters." He added, "For India, with China on one side and Pakistan on the other, both nuclear enabled, our dependence on Russian military equipment, and the US far away, we have challenges."

Title: Russian central bank raises key interest rate to 20% from 9.5%
Content: The Russian central bank on Monday raised its key interest rate to 20% from 9.5% to counter risks of rouble depreciation and higher inflation. Russia has also ordered companies to sell 80% of their foreign currency revenues. Several other measures were also announced by the bank to support domestic markets amid harsh Western sanctions.

Title: Russia to seize foreigners' funds in response to freeze on citizens' money abroad
Content: Russia has said it'll respond to the seizure of money of its citizens due to the ongoing invasion of Ukraine, by seizing funds of foreigners and foreign companies in Russia. Moscow does not rule out nationalising the assets of companies registered in the USA, European Union and other "unfriendly jurisdictions", Deputy Head of Russia's Security Council Dmitry Medvedev said.

Title: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, to divest its Russian assets
Content:
Norway's $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will divest its Russian assets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We have decided to freeze the fund's investments and have begun a process of selling out (of Russia)," Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre
 said. Norges Bank Investment Management's (NBIM) Russian assets were worth $2.83 billion at the end of 2021.

Title: Russia's ruble falls 30% against US dollar amid sanctions over Ukraine invasion
Content: Russia's ruble plunged nearly 30% against the dollar on Monday after world powers imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The ruble was indicated to be down 27% at 114.33 per dollar in offshore trading, according to Bloomberg News. The US and European Union said they would exclude some Russian banks from the international bank payments system SWIFT.

Title: Amazon sued for $100 mn by US man who lost his leg in crash with delivery van
Content: A man is suing Amazon for $100 million in the US after a collision with a delivery van resulted in the amputation of his left leg. Justin Hartley claimed the accident caused him "severe bodily injuries", including a fractured left wrist. He alleged that Amazon is responsible because it puts pressure on employees, causing them to become distracted while driving.

Title: Got caught up in FOMO, made deals I shouldn't have: Mittal on Shark Tank India
Content: Speaking about his participation in Shark Tank India, Anupam Mittal, the Founder and CEO of Shaadi.com, admitted that he didn’t know about the show’s process. Mittal said, "I got caught in FOMO (fear of missing out). And in Shark Tank, there are your fellow investors...It gets exciting when you invest money...I ended up making several deals I shouldn’t have."

Title: Screenshots of chats between 'yogi' & Chitra found with Subramanian: Report
Content: CBI sources alleged that investigators found "a mail trail, some screenshots, and critical evidence" with ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian, based on which it was suspected that he was the 'Himalayan yogi'. As per a source, "screenshots" of conversations between former NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna and the 'yogi' were also found with him. Subramanian has denied having been involved, source added.

Title: Sensex drops 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,400 amid Russia-Ukraine war
Content: Sensex fell more than 1,000 points to trade at around 54,850, while Nifty dropped over 280 points to 16,378. This comes amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday ordered nuclear forces to be put on high alert. Other Asian markets also plunged, with Japan's Nikkei falling 0.34% and Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index falling 1.49%.

Title: Govt shouldn't give clearance to Air India's new CEO Ilker Ayci: RSS affiliate
Content: The government should not give clearance to the appointment of Ilker Ayci as the CEO and Managing Director of Air India, said RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch's co-convenor Ashwani Mahajan. Citing national security, Mahajan added, "I think the government is already sensitive to the issue and has taken up the matter very seriously." Ayci is the former Chairman of Turkish Airlines.

Title: Scaling down ops: Future Retail amid reports of Reliance taking over its stores
Content:
Amid reports of Reliance Industries taking over operations of its stores and offering jobs to its staff, 
Future Retail said that it is scaling down its operations to reduce losses. In an exchange filing, it said, "The company has been finding it difficult to finance the working capital needs...Company has made a loss of ₹4,445 crore in last four quarters."

Title: World's 6th richest man Buffett praises IITian Ajit Jain, calls hiring him 'perfect choice'
Content: World's sixth richest man Warren Buffett praised Ajit Jain, who runs all of Berkshire's insurance operations, in his annual shareholder letter. Buffett revealed he hired Jain in 1986 even after Jain said he had no experience in insurance, and called his decision "as perfect a choice as could have been made". Jain, who hails from Odisha, studied at IIT Kharagpur.

Title: Reliance takes control of Future Retail stores, offers jobs to staff: Report
Content: Reliance Industries is taking over the operation of Future Retail (FRL) stores and is offering jobs to the company's employees, Reuters reported. The development comes amid FRL's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over sale of its retail assets to Reliance. Reliance has reportedly decided to rebrand about 200 stores that would otherwise be closed as FRL failed to make payments.

Title: Future Retail suspends store operations amid Reliance takeover: Report
Content: India's second-largest retailer Future Retail has suspended most of its online and offline operations amid reports of Reliance Industries taking over its stores including Big Bazaar, reported Reuters. "We regret to inform you that currently stores are non-operational for 2 days," Big Bazaar told social media users on Sunday. Its app and website were also not available for online ordering.

Title: Govt allows FDI of up to 20% in IPO-bound LIC via automatic route: Reports
Content: The Cabinet has reportedly permitted foreign direct investment (FDI) of up to 20% in IPO-bound Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) under the automatic route. Earlier this month, the state-run insurer filed papers for its IPO, which is expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue. In its meeting on Saturday, Cabinet also simplified and enhanced the existing FDI policy, reports said.

Title: Anil Ambani's family welcomes Khrisha; shares Anmol-Khrisha's wedding pics
Content: Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani took to Instagram to share a family picture that included her daughter-in-law Khrisha Shah, and captioned it, "Welcoming our daughter! A new chapter for Anmol, a new energy in the house." She also shared several pictures from her son Anmol Ambani and his entrepreneur-wife Khrisha Shah's wedding ceremonies, including 'Mandva Mahurat', mehendi and haldi.

Title: British Airways cancels 150 flights over IT outage, rules out cyberattack
Content: British Airways has cancelled more than 150 short-haul flights to and from its London Heathrow hub, citing "significant technical issues" following a systems outage. The airline said that the problem had not been caused by a cyberattack but due to a hardware issue. Earlier, UK's National Cyber Security Centre warned companies to bolster their online defences after Russia invaded Ukraine.

Title: Apple's 'brilliant' CEO regards Apple users as first love: Warren Buffett
Content: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman Warren Buffett in his annual letter to shareholders said, "Tim Cook, Apple's brilliant CEO...regards users of Apple products as his first love." Listing Apple under "Our Four Giants", Buffett said Berkshire holds a 5.55% stake in Apple. The 91-year-old investor also credited the growth of Berkshire's insurance unit to his hiring of Ajit Jain in 1986.

Title: World's largest wealth fund to vote against Apple CEO's 2021 compensation
Content: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will vote against ratification of Apple's management remuneration plan. The development comes after proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services urged investors to vote against Apple CEO Tim Cook's compensation of $98.7 million for 2021. Norges Bank Investment Management, which operates the wealth fund, said it would follow the advice.

Title: India's oil imports to cross $100 bn in FY22, almost twice of FY21
Content: India's oil import bill is set to cross the $100 billion mark in FY22, almost double of what it spent in FY21 at $62.2 billion. India has already spent $94.3 billion on oil imports between April 2021 and January 2022. India imported oil worth $11.6 billion in January 2022, a 50.6% YoY rise against $7.7 billion spent in January 2021.

Title: FPIs withdraw net ₹35,506 cr in Feb 2022, highest since March 2020
Content: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹35,506 crore in the month of February 2022, the highest amount withdrawn by FPIs since March 2020 at ₹1,18,203 crore. FPIs have been net sellers since October 2021. During February 1-25, FPIs pulled out ₹31,158 crore from equities and ₹4,467 crore from the debt segment, according to depositories’ data.

Title: EU announces sanctions targeting 70% of Russian banking market, key govt-led firms
Content: The European Union has approved a package of further sanctions against Russia after it invaded Ukraine, which includes financial sanctions, targeting 70% of the Russian banking market and key state-owned companies. It's also banning exports to target the energy sector, and banning sale of aircraft to Russian airlines. Further, diplomats and business people won't get privileged visa access to EU.

Title: Delhi approves Film Policy 2022, to give ₹3 cr subsidy for film production
Content: Delhi government on Thursday approved the Film Policy 2022 aimed to create jobs and boost the economy in the national capital. Delhi government will give a subsidy of up to ₹3 crore for film production, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia announced. He added that a ₹50 crore Delhi Film fund will be set up to support film producers.

Title: S&P cuts Russia's credit rating to 'junk' amid Ukraine invasion
Content: Standard and Poor's (S&P) has cut Russia's long-term foreign currency credit rating to 'junk' by lowering it to 'BB+' from 'BBB-' amid Ukraine's invasion. The sanctions imposed against it "could carry significant negative implications for the Russian banking sector's ability to act as a financial intermediary for international trade", S&P said. It also cut Ukraine's rating to 'B-' from 'B'.

Title: Putin must be held accountable, his assets should be frozen: Richard Branson
Content: After Russia invaded Ukraine, billionaire Richard Branson said that Russian President Vladimir Putin must be held accountable for "initiating a war of aggression". "He should not be allowed to travel, his assets should be frozen or seized, including his prized yacht," Branson tweeted. He added, "The least all of us can do is to make sure Putin...pays the price for...aggression."

Title: My family's hearing sirens, explosions & they don't know what to do: Ukrainian CEO
Content: Speaking about Russia's invasion, a Ukrainian CEO, who lives in the UK, said, "My family's in Kyiv and they can't leave the country. They hear explosions and...sirens. They don't know what to do." "My team is based in 3 major [Ukrainian] cities...No one taught me what CEO needs to do when the war starts," Musemio's Olga Kravchenko wrote.

Title: Is crypto illegal or not? Make your stand clear: Supreme Court to govt
Content: The Supreme Court has asked the Centre to clarify if cryptocurrencies are "illegal or not". "You have to make your stand clear," the court bench said. The court was hearing a case related to the ₹20,000-crore GainBitcoin scam. In 2018, Amit Bhardwaj and his brother Vivek were accused of running GainBitcoin, a ponzi scheme promising huge returns on Bitcoin investments.

Title: Indian economy to be among worst hit in Asia amid Russia-Ukraine war: Nomura
Content: India, Thailand and the Philippines will be the biggest losers among Asian economies as the Russia-Ukraine war drives up prices of oil and other commodities, as per a Nomura report. Every 10% rise in crude oil price will shave off around 0.2 percentage points from GDP growth in India and add around 0.4 percentage points to inflation, the report said.

Title: What is SWIFT, the financial system from which Russia could be cut off?
Content: SWIFT, or Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication, allows the smooth and rapid transfer of money across borders. The Belgium-based system links 11,000 banks and institutions in over 200 countries and Russia's the second-largest country in terms of number of users. If SWIFT excluded Russia, it'd become hard for Russian companies to pay for imports and receive cash for exports.

Title: Nestlé, Carlsberg, Coca-Cola among firms to shut operations in Ukraine
Content: Several companies have shut down operations in Ukraine following Russia's invasion on Thursday. World's largest food company Nestlé temporarily closed its three factories in the region, whereas beermaker Carlsberg and bottler Coca-Cola HBC have halted operations and sent their workers home. Oreo maker Mondelez International said it will close its plants if the situation gets too dangerous.

Title: Indian founder of BitConnect indicted for running $2.4 bn crypto ponzi scheme
Content: Cryptocurrency investment platform BitConnect's Indian Founder Satish Kumbhani, has been indicted on charges of orchestrating a $2.4 billion global ponzi scheme, federal prosecutors said. It's believed to be the "largest crypto fraud ever charged", the US Justice Department said. Kumbhani is charged with conspiracy to commit wire fraud, price manipulation and international money laundering.

Title: Russian billionaires lost $39 billion in 1 day after Ukraine invasion
Content: The net worth of Russia's 22 richest individuals plunged by a combined $39 billion in one day after the invasion of Ukraine, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The wipeout came as Moscow's benchmark index closed 33% lower on Thursday, recording the fifth-worst plunge in market history. Lukoil Chairman Vagit Alekperov lost the most as his fortune fell by $6.2 billion.

Title: Air India to operate 2 flights to bring back Indians stuck in Ukraine
Content: Air India on Friday said that it will operate two flights from Delhi and Mumbai to Bucharest (Romania) and Budapest (Hungary) on Saturday (February 26) to fly back Indians stranded in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. The flights have been arranged based upon inputs from MEA on the emerging situation in Ukraine, Air India said.

Title: Musk's net worth jumps by over $8 billion in a day, re-enters $200-billion club
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reclaimed his position as the only member of the $200-billion club a day after his net worth fell to $198.6 billion. Musk became richer by $8.49 billion on Thursday after Tesla shares jumped 4.81%. The 50-year-old currently has a net worth of $207 billion despite losing over $63 billion in 2022, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

Title: Will be supporting local humanitarian efforts in Ukraine: Apple CEO Tim Cook
Content: Apple CEO Tim Cook has expressed his concern with the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Cook tweeted, "I am deeply concerned with the situation in Ukraine. We're doing all we can for our teams...and will be supporting local humanitarian efforts. I am thinking of the people who are right now in harm’s way and joining all those calling for peace."

Title: Ex-NSE official Anand's wife's pay raised from ₹60 lakh to ₹1.34 cr in 3 yrs: SEBI
Content: According to SEBI, Sunitha Anand, wife of former NSE official Anand Subramanian, arrested by the CBI, was hired at an annual salary of ₹60 lakh at NSE. Between 2013 and 2016, her compensation was more than doubled from ₹60 lakh to ₹1.34 crore. Her contract was foreclosed in December 2016, the same month as Chitra Ramkrishna's exit from NSE.

Title: Ex-NSE official Subramanian is 'yogi' who guided Chitra Ramkrishna: Reports
Content: Former NSE Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian, who has been arrested by the CBI, is the 'Himalayan yogi' who guided former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, as per CBI sources. The email address ‘rigyajursama@outlook.com’, through which Chitra shared information with the 'yogi', was created by Subramanian, sources added. Subramanian was offered ₹1.68 crore to join NSE.

Title: Pak's 2nd-largest bank fined $55 mn for anti-money laundering violations by US
Content: National Bank of Pakistan has been fined $55 million for anti-money laundering violations by two US authorities. "[NBP] allowed serious compliance deficiencies in its New York branch to persist for years despite repeated regulatory warnings," the New York State Department of Financial Services' Superintendent said. Shares of Pakistan's second-largest bank fell 7.4% on Friday, the most in a year.

Title: Ex-NSE official allegedly appointed on a yogi's advice arrested by CBI: Reports
Content: The CBI has reportedly arrested Anand Subramanian, NSE's former Group Operating Officer, in connection with the probe into a 2018 stock market manipulation case. Earlier, market regulator SEBI penalised ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and others over alleged governance lapses in Subramanian's appointment. CBI in its investigations stated that a 'Himalayan yogi' allegedly influenced his appointment.

Title: Pay compensatory dues of ₹4,200 cr to Adani Power: SC to Raj discoms
Content: The Supreme Court on Friday ordered three state-run discoms in Rajasthan to pay a total compensatory tariff of ₹4,200 crore to Adani Power. The discoms have been granted four weeks to pay a sum of ₹3,000 crore along with 9% interest. Adani Power had filed a contempt petition seeking a payment of ₹6,738 crore from three discoms towards compensatory tariff.

Title: Sensex ends 1,329 points higher, recovers half of Thursday's losses
Content: The Sensex jumped around 1,329 points to close at 55,858.5 on Friday, recouping nearly half of its losses from yesterday and ending a seven-day losing streak. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped 410 points to close at 16,658. The Sensex had crashed 2,702 points on Thursday following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, recording its second worst day since March 2020.

Title: $4.7 mn in crypto crowdfunded for Ukrainian army since invasion: Report
Content: Several NGOs and volunteer groups in Ukraine have raised around $4.7 million in crypto-asset donations for the Ukrainian military since the Russian invasion, blockchain analysis firm Elliptic reported. One Ukrainian volunteer group, Come Back Alive, received $3 million in a single bitcoin donation alone on Friday. However, the identity of those behind the donations was not revealed.

Title: Infosys unveils Metaverse Foundry with 100 ready-to-apply use cases
Content: Infosys has launched Metaverse Foundry that will help clients create their own metaverse environment, among other things. It already has over 100 ready-to-apply use cases and templates for the clients. Infosys has already worked with a few clients including Roland Garros and the Australian Open where they have created a virtual world where people can buy things around tennis.

Title: Metaverse is beyond being a buzzword today for sure: Infosys Prez
Content: Infosys President Ravi Kumar S in an interview discussing metaverse and Infosys' Metaverse Foundry said metaverse is beyond being a "buzzword" today for sure. He added it was "ahead of its time" when the Second Life Founder Philip Rosedale built the original metaverse in 2003. Kumar also said metaverse is a reset to building the internet's next version in 3D.

Title: CCI doesn't have power to suspend its own orders: Amazon to NCLAT
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) doesn't have the power to keep its own orders in abeyance, Amazon told the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT). Last year, the CCI had suspended a 2019 deal between Amazon and Future Coupons. This is the first time it's happening in India that approval is suspended after two years, Amazon's counsel told NCLAT.

Title: Zomato, Paytm, Nykaa to be included in NIFTY Next 50 index
Content: Zomato, Paytm and Nykaa will be included in the NIFTY Next 50 index from March 31, 2022, the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) has announced. Indian Oil Corporation, Mindtree and SRF Limited will also be included in the index. The index represents the performance of 50 stocks that rank after the top 50 stocks (NIFTY 50) listed on NSE.

Title: Bharti Airtel to buy 4.7% stake in Indus Towers from Vodafone Plc
Content: Bharti Airtel on Friday announced that it has entered into an agreement with Vodafone Plc to buy 4.7% stake in Indus Towers. The deal will be done on the principal condition that the amount paid shall be inducted by Vodafone as fresh equity in Vodafone Idea (VIL) and simultaneously remitted to Indus Towers to clear VIL's outstanding dues, it said.

Title: Ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian sent to CBI custody till March 6
Content: NSE's former Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian has been remanded to CBI custody till March 6 following his arrest in connection with the investigation into a stock market manipulation case. Subramanian is the "yogi" who guided the actions of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, reports said quoting CBI sources. It was earlier alleged that the "yogi" had influenced Subramanian's appointment.

Title: US sanctions Russian banks that together hold around $1 trillion in assets
Content: US President Joe Biden announced new economic sanctions on Russia following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We've now sanctioned Russian banks that together hold around $1 trillion in assets," he said. "Today, we're also blocking four more major Russian banks...every asset that they have in America will be frozen. This includes VTB, the second-largest bank in Russia," Biden added.

Title: UK announces its biggest-ever sanctions against Russia, bans Russian banks
Content: The UK has announced its biggest-ever economic sanctions against Russia after the Russian invasion of Ukraine. It's banning Russian banks from the UK finance system, stopping them from accessing sterling and clearing payments through the UK. Russian companies will be banned from raising funds in the UK and the UK will limit the money Russians can deposit in UK banks.

Title: Sensex crashes 2,702 points to end at 54,530 amid Russia's attack on Ukraine
Content: The Indian benchmark indices crashed nearly 5% on Thursday amid Russia's military operation in eastern Ukraine with the Sensex plunging 2,702 points. The Sensex ended at 54,530, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell 823 points to close at 16,240. The indices recorded their second worst day since March 2020, the month when India imposed COVID-19 restrictions, as per Bloomberg.

Title: Russia-Ukraine conflict wipes over $200 billion from crypto market
Content: The market cap of all cryptocurrencies has plunged by $200 billion following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The market cap of all cryptocurrencies now stands at approximately $1.56 trillion, down from a high of $1.77 trillion during the last 24 hours, data from CoinMarketCap showed. Bitcoin is trading just over $35,500, a decline of 9% in the last 24 hours.

Title: Nykaa initially saw job applicants' passion not experience: Founder
Content: Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar in an interaction with Investcorp MD Sanjay Kohli revealed Nykaa, in its early days, did not check if job applicants had the relevant experience. "Anyone who was passionate about Nykaa, and Nykaa's vision of doing something, we used to recruit them," she added. Nayar also said Nykaa is always "willing to give people a chance".

Title: Russian currency crashes to lowest on record after attacks on Ukraine
Content: The Russian ruble sank to its lowest level on record after Russian President Vladimir Putin launched a military operation in Ukraine, as per Bloomberg. Ruble fell as much as 9.4% in local trading to 89.60 against the US dollar, before paring some of its losses. The Moscow Exchange halted trading for several hours after stocks also fell most on record.

Title: Russian stocks post biggest-ever slump of 45%, erase $250 billion in value
Content: Russian stocks slumped as much as 45% on Thursday, their biggest-ever drop, after the country launched a military operation in Ukraine. This wiped out over $250 billion in stock market value, as per Bloomberg. Earlier, the Russian ruble also fell to its level on record. The market crash came as Western countries said they'll impose unprecedented sanctions on Russia.

Title: Reawakened nightmares of '65 & '71 wars: Mahindra on air raid sirens in Ukraine
Content: Sharing a video of air raid siren sounds in a Ukrainian city amid Russia's attack, businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "I've lived through two (Indo-Pakistani) wars during my childhood: '65 & '71." "I remember how spine chilling it was when air raid sirens went off in Mumbai. This sound has reawakened those nightmarish memories," he added on Twitter.

Title: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day after crashing 2,702 points amid Ukraine crisis
Content: The Sensex jumped more than 1,100 points in early trade on Friday, a day after it crashed 2,702 points following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Sensex was trading near 55,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 330 points to trade near 16,600 levels. On Thursday, Sensex and Nifty logged their second worst day since March 2020.

Title: IKEA names Susanne Pulverer as 1st woman CEO for India business
Content: World's largest furniture retailer IKEA announced the appointment of Susanne Pulverer as its first woman CEO and Chief Sustainability Officer for its India business. Pulverer will replace outgoing CEO Peter Betzel and this will be her third stint in India. She joined Sweden-based IKEA in 1997 and moved to India in 2007 to head purchasing function for IKEA South Asia.

Title: India refunds ₹7,900 cr to UK's Cairn Energy to settle retrospective tax dispute
Content: The Indian government has refunded ₹7,900 crore to Britain's Cairn Energy Plc to settle a dispute over the levy of retrospective taxes, the company said on Thursday. Cairn, now known as Capricorn Energy Plc, said, "Net proceeds of $1.06 billion have been received." In August 2021, India brought a law to scrap all retrospective tax demands and refund money collected.

Title: Wall Street opens 2% lower amid Russia-Ukraine crisis
Content: Wall Street opened 2% lower on Thursday following Russia's invasion of Ukraine and global crude oil prices crossing the $100/barrel mark. Dow Jones Industrial Average was trading over 2% or 665 points lower at 32,467.08 while S&P 500 was down 1.51% at 4,161.53 points. The tech-heavy Nasdaq, on the other hand, traded 1.71% or 222 points lower at 12,815.11.

Title: Musk, his brother face probe over possible insider trading in US: WSJ
Content: The US SEC started a probe last year to see whether recent stock sales by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his brother Kimbal Musk "violated insider trading rules", the WSJ reported. The probe began after Kimbal sold $108 million-worth shares, a day before Musk polled on offloading his stake. Musk claims Kimbal didn't know about the poll ahead of it.

Title: Tesla was ignorant of Bitcoin's environmental impact: Musk's brother
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk in interaction with TechCrunch said Tesla was "very ignorant" of Bitcoin's environmental impact when it announced that it would purchase Bitcoin worth $1.5 billion. "It didn't take...long to get a million messages telling us what we were doing to the environment," he added. Kimbal said he doesn't agree with cryptocurrency's environmental impact.

Title: Firm behind Free Fire app no longer Southeast Asia's biggest listed firm
Content: Singapore-based Sea Ltd, the owner of Garena Free Fire game, has lost its title as Southeast Asia's biggest publicly-traded company after its shares plunged to an 18-month low. It was overtaken by the Indonesian bank PT Bank Central Asia. Sea had earlier lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned Free Fire's app.

Title: UK's Lloyds on 'heightened alert' for Russian cyberattacks on banks
Content: Britain-based bank Lloyds has been on "heightened alert" for cyberattacks from Russia amid the ongoing crisis in Ukraine. "We've been on...alert...internally around our cyber risk controls and we've been focused on this now for quite a while," Lloyds CEO Charlie Nunn said. The government and banking industry leaders in a meeting about Russia had discussed preparation for potential cyberattacks.

Title: Nykaa insiders including CFO sold stock worth ₹143 cr last week: Report
Content: Nykaa-parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures sold stocks worth ₹143 crore last week, Moneycontrol reported quoting data on BSE. The sellers include CFO Arvind Agarwal, CTO Sanjay Suri, CEO of private label beauty brands Reena Chhabra, CEO NykaaMan Nihir Parikh and Vice President Neha Grover. They sold 9,84,528 shares at an average price of ₹1,424 per share.

Title: No plans to spin off EV business, but change coming: Ford CEO
Content: Ford Motor CEO Jim Farley denied reports which claimed he's considered spinning off its electric vehicle (EV) or internal combustion businesses and said there are "no such plans". The company is reinventing itself by removing costs and ramping up for large-scale EV, software sales, Farley added. "I can't turn to ICE organisation and say go be Tesla," he further said.

Title: Rolls-Royce CEO Warren East to step down at the end of the year
Content: Rolls-Royce CEO Warren East will step down from his position at the end of the year. This comes as Rolls-Royce reported a profit in 2021 spurred by cost cuts implemented by East and a restart of long-distance travel that had eaten into the company's jet-engine income. Rolls-Royce still forecasted stagnant margins and revenue growth of less than 10% in 2022.

Title: New age tech firms going public key challenge to capital markets: SEBI chief
Content: SEBI chief Ajay Tyagi said new age tech companies, which are generally loss making, accessing public market is a key challenge to capital markets. The flourishing landscape of environment, social and governance (ESG) investments is another major challenge due to absence of uniform ESG evaluation matrices, Tyagi added. New age tech companies have raised ₹43,283 crore through IPOs in FY22.

Title: Operations running normally in Ukraine amid Russian attack: Nestle
Content: World's largest food company Nestle said that operations in Ukraine were running normally after Russian forces fired missiles at several cities in Ukraine. The company is closely monitoring the situation and have business continuity plans in place, it added. Nestle is operating in Ukraine for more than 25 years and has three factories and about 5,000 employees in the country.

Title: Indus Towers shares end 18% lower as Vodafone plans to sell stake
Content: Shares of Indus Towers ended over 18% lower on Thursday after Vodafone announced that it'd sell 2.4% stake in the company through a block deal to Bharti Airtel, who's also a promoter. The stake is reportedly estimated to be valued at over ₹3,300 crore. Bharti Airtel holds close to 42% stake in Indus Towers while Vodafone holds about 28% stake.

Title: Moody's raises India's GDP growth forecast to 9.5% from 7% for 2022
Content: Moody's has raised India's GDP growth forecast for 2022 to 9.5% from 7% earlier, citing a stronger economic recovery after the COVID-19 pandemic. It retained GDP growth forecast for 2023 at 5.5%. The credit ratings firm's forecast projects 8.4% growth for FY 2022-23 and 6.5% for FY 2023-24. RBI had projected India's GDP growth at 7.8% for 2022-23.

Title: Indian economy poised for recovery, but high oil prices worrisome: CEA
Content: Chief Economic Advisor Anantha Nageswaran said the Indian economy is poised for growth but high crude oil prices are a cause for concern. He added that the country's banking sector is stable and credit offtake is also poised to take off. "We're not unique to the phenomenon of uncertain growth and high inflation due to the pandemic," he added.

Title: Hindustan Unilever splits Chairman & CEO posts, Sanjiv Mehta to remain CEO
Content: Hindustan Unilever (HUL) has announced the separation of the roles of chairman and CEO as the company seeks to boost governance standards. Sanjiv Mehta will continue as the CEO and MD, while Nitin Paranjpe, who is currently the Chief Operating Officer, will take over as the Non-executive Chairman. The change will be effective from March 31, the company said.

Title: RBI cancels registration of PC Financial for violating guidelines
Content: In its first major action against a digital lender, RBI cancelled the registration certificate of PC Financial Services for "gross violations" of the central bank's guidelines. RBI said the company had violated outsourcing and know-your-customer norms. "The company was also found to be charging usurious rate of interest and other charges to its borrowers in an opaque manner," RBI added.

Title: Tata may review Air India CEO Ayci's appointment if govt nod delayed: Report
Content: Tata Sons may reportedly consider other options for Air India's CEO post, if there's a delay in security clearance of recently appointed CEO and MD Ilker Ayci. Ayci is seen as close to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who's considered as a Pakistan ally. The Ministry of Home Affairs will reportedly carry out thorough background check of Turkish national Ayci.

Title: ₹18,000 crore recovered by banks from Mallya, Nirav Modi, Choksi: Centre to SC
Content: Banks have recovered ₹18,000 crore from fugitives Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court. The SC was told that the value of cases registered under the PMLA against the three is now ₹67,000 crore. As of July 2021, banks had recovered ₹13,109 crore after the sale of assets belonging to the three.

Title: Sensex crashes 2,000 points as Russia announces military operation in Ukraine
Content: The Sensex crashed over 2,000 points on Thursday as investors turned cautious following Russian President Vladimir Putin's announcement of a military operation in eastern Ukraine. The Sensex was trading at 55,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 slumped over 590 points to trade at 16,450 levels. Other Asian markets were also trading lower following the news.

Title: Who is Natasha Bassett, 27-yr-old actress rumoured to be dating Musk?
Content: Natasha Bassett, the rumoured girlfriend of the world's richest man, Elon Musk, is a 27-year-old Australian actress, a screenwriter and a director. She grew up in Sydney and moved to New York to attend drama school, and played Britney Spears in the 2017 biopic about the singer. She will appear as Elvis Presley's girlfriend Dixie Locke in an upcoming film.

Title: What are the crypto ad guidelines applicable in India from April 1, 2022?
Content: Advertising Standards Council of India's (ASCI) guidelines, applicable on ads of crypto-related products from April 1, 2022, say such ads shouldn't carry the words "currency", "securities", "custodian" and "depositories". Ads should carry a disclaimer saying, "Crypto products & NFTs are unregulated and can be highly risky." Information on past performance shall not be provided in a biased manner.

Title: Elon Musk falls out of $200-billion club, loses $13.3 billion in a day
Content: No person in the world currently has a fortune of over $200 billion as Elon Musk's wealth fell by $13.3 billion on Wednesday. The Tesla CEO was the only member of the $200-billion club but his fortune now stands at $198.6 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. He has lost about $72 billion this year, but still remains world's richest.

Title: Very upset by Putin's decision to go to war: Ethereum's Russia-born Co-founder
Content: Vitalik Buterin, Ethereum's 28-year-old Russian-born Co-founder, tweeted, "Very upset by Putin's decision to abandon the possibility of a peaceful solution to the dispute with Ukraine and go to war instead." He added, "This is a crime against the Ukrainian and Russian people." He also said, "I want to wish everyone security, although I know that there will be no security."

Title: Ashneer's wife used BharatPe funds for beauty treatments, US & Dubai trips: Report
Content: Madhuri Jain Grover, the wife of BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, used company funds for personal beauty treatments, buying electronic items and family trips to the US and Dubai, reports said on Wednesday. She also allegedly paid her personal staff out of company accounts and produced fake invoices. BharatPe has fired Madhuri, the company's controller, on charges of misappropriation of funds.

Title: Nykaa settles suit with L'Oreal over IP rights infringement after 2 yrs
Content: Nykaa has announced the settlement of its 2019 litigation with L'Oreal. The France-based firm had filed a case against Nykaa over similarity in certain packaging causing an alleged IP rights infringement and obtained a restraining order, preventing Nykaa from using the packaging on its own brands. As per the settlement, the modified artwork adopted by Nykaa was approved by L'Oreal.

Title: Can't tolerate mudslinging by anyone: BharatPe's Rajnish on Ashneer's claims
Content: BharatPe board Chairman Rajnish Kumar, in response to the letter by Co-founder Ashneer Grover that accused him of being biased and prejudiced amid a row over the governance review, said he cannot "tolerate this type of mudslinging by anyone". "Should...board members have any doubts about my impartiality in the matter, I have no intention to continue," Kumar added.

Title: Ashneer's wife shares alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Koladiya abusing Ashneer
