Content: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover took to Twitter to share an alleged audio clip of Bhavik Koladiya, one of the original Co-founders of BharatPe, allegedly "threatening" and abusing Ashneer over a call. In her tweet, Madhuri called Koladiya "BharatPe 3rd party vendor as per company". BharatPe has fired Madhuri over charges of 'misappropriation of funds'.

Title: Oil hits $100 a barrel for 1st time since 2014 as Ukraine crisis escalates
Content: Oil prices surged to $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014 after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a military operation in eastern Ukraine. Brent crude hit a high of $101.34 per barrel in early Asia trade on Thursday, the highest since September 2014. Russia is the world's second-largest oil producer, which mainly sells crude to European refineries.

Title: Biden's aides feared US sanctions won't stop Putin from attacking Ukraine: Report
Content: US President Joe Biden's own aides feared that sanctions wouldn't stop Russian President Vladimir Putin from invading Ukraine, Bloomberg reported. The US officials spent hundreds of hours over five months to finalise sanctions on Russia, including sanctions on two large Russian financial institutions. Biden warned Russia of "further consequences" after Russia attacked Ukraine on Thursday.

Title: Reliance took 15 yrs to become a $1 bn company, 38 yrs to hit $200 bn: Ambani
Content: Mukesh Ambani said, "It took Reliance 15 years to become a $1-billion company, 30 years to become a $10-billion company, 35 years to become a $100-billion company and 38 years to touch $200 billion." He added, "I foresee at least 20-30 new Indian energy and tech companies will grow as big as Reliance, if not bigger, in next 10-20 years."

Title: Ambani says 'India will emerge as global New Energy leader'; gives 3 reasons
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, "I have absolutely no doubt that India can, and India will emerge as a global New Energy leader." Ambani said, "First: India is a country full of entrepreneurial spirit, innovation and youth." He added, "Second: We now have a proactive and forward-looking policy, and third, our entrepreneurs now have assured financing options."

Title: Nooyi shares account from 2009 when both Obama, Manmohan Singh said 'she's one of us'
Content: On President's Day that US observes, ex-PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi recalled meeting ex-PM Manmohan Singh and ex-US President Barack Obama in 2009. She shared an excerpt from her memoir, which read, "Obama began introducing the American team to his Indian counterpart. When he got to me...Singh exclaimed, 'Oh! But she's one of us!'" Obama responded, "She's one of us, too!"

Title: Russia-Ukraine crisis wiped out ₹8 lakh crore from Indian markets in 1st hour
Content: Indian investors' wealth tumbled by over ₹8 lakh crore in the first hour of trade after Russia launched a military operation in Ukraine. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies crashed to ₹2,47,46,960.48 crore at around 10.15 am on Thursday from ₹2,55,68,668 crore on Wednesday's close. The Sensex slumped by more than 2,000 points during intraday trade.

Title: Russia-Ukraine war may hit commodities beyond oil and gas: Raghuram Rajan
Content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan told CNBC that the Russia-Ukraine war has the potential to affect not just oil and natural gas but various essential commodities like wheat. "Grain prices can also go up because Ukraine and Russia contribute a great amount of wheat exports to the world." On the global economic recovery, Rajan said that recovery is at risk.

Title: Bharti Airtel acquires strategic stake in blockchain startup Aqilliz
Content: Bharti Airtel has acquired a strategic stake in Singapore-based blockchain technology startup Aqilliz. The startup has developed a patented hybrid blockchain platform, Atom, that integrates differential privacy and federated learning on a distributed digital ledger. Airtel aims to deploy Aqilliz's technologies at scale across its adtech, digital entertainment and digital marketplace offerings.

Title: RBI's view may have delayed crypto bill: Deputy Governor
Content: The views of the RBI on cryptocurrency may have delayed the government's proposed legislation on crypto assets, RBI Deputy Governor Michael Patra said on Wednesday. Central Bank Digital Currency will be introduced in FY23 but India will proceed gradually on the subject as there are concerns on privacy, its impact on monetary policy formulation and energy intensity, Patra added.

Title: India to have 1 billion smartphone users by 2026: Deloitte study
Content: India will have one billion smartphone users by 2026 with rural areas driving the sale of internet-enabled phones, according to a Deloitte study. India had 1.2 billion mobile subscribers in 2021, of which about 750 million are smartphone users, the study revealed. The country is poised to be the second-largest smartphone manufacturer in the next five years.

Title: Will visit IRS just to say hi: Musk as Warren discusses his taxes
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in response to US Senator Elizabeth Warren discussing his taxes on CNN, said, "Will visit IRS next time I'm in DC just to say hi, since I paid the most taxes ever in history for an individual last year." Warren had brought up Musk not having had paid anything in taxes in 2018 on the channel.

Title: Inflation peaked in Jan, its momentum is declining: RBI Deputy Governor
Content: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor Michael Patra said inflation in India has reached its peak and its momentum "is actually declining". Referring to inflation rates breaching RBI's 6% target ceiling, Patra said policymakers had room to keep borrowing costs lower for longer to support the economy. Inflation rose to its seven-month high of 6.01% in January this year.

Title: 40% of workers in India could switch jobs this year: Survey
Content: Nearly 40% of workers in India may switch jobs this year, according to a survey, which included 1,024 respondents. Respondents in India reported some of the highest levels of engagement (85%) and wellbeing (89%) at work globally, Qualtrics' report said. However, only 62% of them may stay with their current employer for the next 12 months, the report added.

Title: India's fuel demand expected to grow 5.5% next fiscal: Govt
Content: India's fuel demand is likely to grow 5.5% in the fiscal year beginning April 1 as economic activity is getting back on track after COVID-19 pandemic, the Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell (PPAC) said. Fuel consumption in 2022-23 is estimated to rise to 214.5 million tonnes from expected sales of 203.2 million tonnes in 2021-22, government estimates showed.

Title: Employer must pay damages for delay in payment of EPF contribution: SC
Content: The Supreme Court ruled that the employer is obligated to pay damages for delay in payment of Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) contribution of an employee. The Court was hearing a plea against a Karnataka High Court order stating the same. The two-judge bench said the employer is liable to make deductions and deposit the EPF contribution in the worker's account.

Title: India Ratings pegs India's FY22 GDP growth at 8.6% on data revision
Content: India Ratings and Research (IRR) revised its GDP growth forecast for FY22 to 8.6%, down from the 9.2% projected earlier. According to IRR, the National Statistical Organisation will likely peg FY22's GDP growth at ₹147.2 lakh crore. IRR believes the major reason for the downward revision to be the upward revision of FY21's GDP growth rate from -7.3% to -6.6%.

Title: Tata Housing to invest ₹270 cr to develop 2 residential projects in Maldives
Content: Tata Housing, a subsidiary of Tata Sons, said it will invest around ₹270 crore to develop two luxury residential projects at Nadhee and Odean, in Male, Maldives. The company will construct around 117 housing units with three bedroom apartments in these two projects. This is the second phase of Tata Housing's projects after completion of social housing project in Maldives.

Title: UK imposes sanctions on 5 key Russian banks, freezes assets of 3 Putin aides
Content: The UK has announced the first sanctions against Russia in connection to the situation in Ukraine by targeting five key Russian banks and three allies of Russian President Vladimir Putin. The individuals targeted in the sanctions have a high net worth and any assets they have in the UK will be frozen, PM Boris Johnson said.

Title: What are the major announcements made in Rajasthan Budget 2022-23?
Content: In his 2022-23 Budget speech, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot announced 50 units of free electricity for households consuming up to 100 units monthly. Chiranjeevi Yojana health insurance will be increased from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh, he added. All state government employees appointed on or after January 1, 2004, will be entitled to the pension scheme like earlier, Gehlot stated.

Title: BharatPe sacks Ashneer's wife Madhuri amid funds misappropriation charges: Reports
Content: BharatPe has reportedly terminated the services of Madhuri Jain, Head of Controls and wife of Co-founder Ashneer Grover. "Reasons for termination are misappropriation of funds and authorisation of inflated bills," Moneycontrol quoted a source as saying. Earlier, reports said Jain was named in a preliminary report by Alvarez and Marsal as directly connected to financial discrepancies at BharatPe.

Title: World's richest man Elon Musk dating 27-yr-old actress Natasha Bassett: Reports
Content: Elon Musk, the 50-year-old Tesla CEO who's the world's richest man, is dating 27-year-old Australian actress Natasha Bassett, reports said. A few days ago, she was photographed leaving Musk's private jet in Los Angeles. Musk and Bassett were friends first and began dating after Musk's split with Canadian singer Grimes, with whom he had his son 'X Æ A-Xii'.

Title: Virgin Hyperloop fires half its staff as it switches from passenger travel to freight
Content: Virgin Hyperloop has laid off almost half of its employees as the company developing the high-speed mass transportation system pivots from passenger travel to freight. The company confirmed to Financial Times that 111 employees were laid off on Friday. Backed by billionaire Richard Branson’s Virgin Group, Virgin Hyperloop conducted the first-ever test of Hyperloop technology with humans in 2020.

Title: Young entrepreneur shares pic with Ratan Tata, says 'Blessed to have him as mentor'
Content: Arjun Deshpande, a young entrepreneur whose pharma startup Generic Aadhaar received investment from Ratan Tata, recently took to social media to share a picture with the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons. "In every meet, there are new learnings and motivation for me and I am truly blessed to have Ratan Tata Sir as my Mentor," Deshpande captioned the picture.

Title: Worst experience: Lido employee takes to social media amid reports of shutdown
Content: Amid reports of edtech startup Lido Learning shutting its operations, one of its employees shared a post to talk about his "worst experience" in the industry. Rishabh Kumar wrote, "The company closed its business...without...any notice to anyone...Suddenly on February 4...the founder announced the organisation has no funds...and they're shutting it down. They have no funds to credit salaries."

Title: Ashneer's wife Madhuri posts videos of BharatPe officials allegedly drinking in office
Content: After BharatPe's Head of Controls Madhuri Jain was fired, she tweeted videos of Suhail Sameer (CEO), Shashvat Nakrani (Co-founder) and other officials allegedly drinking and smoking in office. "Now you may indulge in...'drunken orgies' without having to wait for me...to leave office," Ashneer Grover's wife wrote. "You have no pain for what Ashneer...built...and you snatched," she said.

Title: Startup Lido Learning, backed by Ronnie Screwvala, shuts operations: Report
Content: Edtech startup Lido Learning, backed by entrepreneur Ronnie Screwvala, Shaadi.com's Anupam Mittal, among others, has apparently shut operations. As per employees, Lido Learning's Founder Sahil Sheth informed them that the startup is going through financial constraints. Founded in 2019, the startup had raised $10 million in September last year in a round led by Screwvala's Unilazer Ventures.

Title: Ashneer should've shown maturity: BharatPe's Rajnish amid governance review row
Content: Amid a row over the governance review at BharatPe, board Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said that Co-founder Ashneer Grover "should've shown maturity". "The whole strategy of Ashneer is to make out a case that governance review is biased against him," he alleged. Earlier, Ashneer in a letter to the board of BharatPe parent Resilient Innovations accused Rajnish of being biased.

Title: BharatPe accuses Ashneer of spreading false content, says it's 'unbecoming of an MD'
Content: BharatPe has asked Co-founder Ashneer Grover to stop "spreading false and inflammatory content" about the firm's senior management. BharatPe said in a letter, "Your conduct...is completely unbecoming of a managing director." Earlier, Ashneer alleged that Bhavik Koladiya, one of the original Co-founders, used "foul language" on a call with him and that board Chairman Rajnish Kumar was with him.

Title: Russia's richest people lose $32 billion this year amid Ukraine crisis
Content: The net worth of Russia's 23 billionaires has fallen by $32 billion to $343 billion so far this year amid the Ukraine crisis, as per Bloomberg. Gennady Timchenko, who's a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, has seen his wealth disappear by almost a third this year. Meanwhile, Novatek shareholder Leonid Mikhelson's fortune has fallen by $6.2 billion.

Title: Who are the 5 people to whom IDFC First Bank CEO gifted shares worth ₹3.95 cr?
Content: IDFC First Bank CEO V Vaidyanathan on Monday gifted shares worth ₹3.95 crore to five people - his trainer Ramesh Raju, househelps Pranjal Narvekar and Santosh Jogale, driver Algarsamy C Munapar and office support staff Deepak Pathare, to purchase houses. In 2020, he gifted shares to his former mathematics teacher for lending him ₹500 when he was a broke student.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air to hire 350 cabin crew, pilots by March 2023: Report
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air is reportedly planning to hire over 300-350 cabin crew members and pilots by March 2023. The airline is offering 80% higher salaries to pilots than SpiceJet, ET reported. A spokesperson said pilot and cabin crew hiring is currently underway and the employee strength will depend on the level of the airline's network and operations.

Title: UK woman whose boss shouted she 'must be in her menopause' wins ₹20 lakh payout
Content: A 54-year-old woman named Leigh Best has been awarded over £20,000 (over ₹20 lakh) payout by an employment tribunal in the UK after her boss allegedly shouted she 'must be in her menopause'. The incident happened in March 2020 when her boss made the remark following an argument over an order mix-up. She was fired in May 2020.

Title: 'Growth' stocks like Meta, Apple, Amazon still not cheap: JP Morgan
Content: Analysts at JP Morgan said that despite some sharp falls in the market over the last six months, tech-dominated "growth" stocks like Facebook (Meta), Apple, Amazon, Netflix and Google are "still not outright cheap". Talking about the Russia-Ukraine crisis, the analysts said it shouldn't drive a return to big tech names which were safe even during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Strike against power privatisation in Chandigarh impacted telecom towers: COAI
Content: The Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) on Wednesday said that the strike by Chandigarh electricity department employees against power privatisation has impacted telecom towers, leading to disruption in mobile network connectivity. Chandigarh electricity department employees launched a three-day strike on Tuesday against the Union Territory administration’s decision to privatise it.

Title: Sanjeev Sanyal joins PM's Economic Advisory Council as full-time member
Content: Noted economist Sanjeev Sanyal has been inducted as a full-time member of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), the council's Chairman Bibek Debroy announced on Tuesday. Prior to this, Sanyal was serving as the Principal Economic Advisor in the Finance Ministry. The EAC-PM is an independent body that advises the Prime Minister on economic and related issues.

Title: Govt analysing whether SEBI took adequate measures in NSE case: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government is studying the National Stock Exchange (NSE) matter to see if SEBI has taken "necessary punitive" action over it. She added the government won't tolerate any doubt over the credibility of the institutions. Ex-NSE MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is accused of providing confidential information to an "unidentified Himalayan Yogi".

Title: Snacks maker Bikaji Foods files IPO papers, founders to dilute stake
Content: One of India's largest FMCG companies Bikaji Foods International has filed draft papers with markets regulator SEBI to raise funds via IPO. The company said it will offer for sale (OFS) 2.93 crore shares by its existing promoters and shareholders. The Indian snacks and sweets maker's Founders Shiv Ratan Agarwal and Deepak Agarwal will sell 25 lakh shares each.

Title: PMJJBY subscribers not eligible for shares at discounted rates: LIC
Content: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are ineligible for shares at a discounted price in the upcoming LIC IPO, the insurer clarified on Tuesday. "It is a group insurance product and [PMJJBY policyholders] aren't eligible," LIC said in a statement. This comes after LIC Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said PMJJBY subscribers are eligible for discounted shares.

Title: Jet Airways appoints Ex-SriLankan Airlines CEO Vipula Gunatilleka as CFO
Content: Jalan-Kalrock Consortium, the promoters of Jet Airways, have named former SriLankan Airlines CEO Vipula Gunatilleka as the airline's Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Gunatilleka has been tasked with reviving the grounded carrier and will take on the role from March 1. He is reportedly considered as a "turnaround specialist" and was hired by SriLankan Airlines for its restructuring in 2018.

Title: Vistara to increase total staff count to 5,000 this year: CEO Vinod Kannan
Content: Vistara plans to significantly increase its staff strength to 5,000 from the current 4,000 by the end of 2022 as it focuses on "increasing capacity utilisation", CEO Vinod Kannan said. "This will include everyone on Vistara's payroll and won't include outsourced third-party partners," he added. Vistara also plans to add 20 more aircraft by the end of 2023.

Title: Oil price hits highest level since 2014 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
Content: Crude oil price hit its highest level since 2014 on Tuesday pushing prices to near $100 per barrel as tensions between Russia and Ukraine escalated after Moscow ordered troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine. The global benchmark, Brent crude LCOc1, was up $3.48 at $98.87 at 09:00 GMT, having earlier reached $99.38, the highest since September 2014.

Title: PMJJBY policyholders eligible for LIC IPO at discount: Chairman
Content: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are eligible for LIC's upcoming IPO at a discount, Chairman MR Kumar said. PMJJBY is a pure term insurance policy available to people in the age group of 18-50 years for a premium of ₹330 per annum per subscriber. The LIC IPO may reportedly open for subscription from March 10-14.

Title: There's a buzz for LIC IPO in market, going ahead with it: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the government is going ahead with the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) IPO amid concerns raised over rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. "There is a buzz in the market and there is interest for LIC IPO," she said. The way the IPO prospectus has been crafted has generated a lot of interest, Sitharaman added.

Title: Govt tracking crude prices to decide possible cut in fuel tax: FM
Content: Government is keeping an eye on geopolitical developments affecting crude oil prices to take a call on a possible duty cut in fuel prices, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This comes after Brent crude touched its seven-year high of $99.50/barrel amid rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. Indian fuel prices have remained unchanged for over two months despite rise in global oil prices.

Title: Bachchan family, Hema Malini and others attend Anmol Ambani's wedding
Content: Actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, Abhishek's sister Shweta Bachchan and Hema Malini were among the celebrities who attended the wedding of businessman Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani in Mumbai, on Sunday. Fashion designer Sandeep Khosla was also among the attendees. Philanthropist Pinky Reddy, the wife of GVK Group's GV Sanjay Reddy, also attended the wedding.

Title: Cadila Healthcare shares fall as Biological E's vaccine gets nod for 12-18 age group
Content: Cadila Healthcare's shares fell over 3% on Tuesday after the Indian drug regulator DCGI granted emergency use approval to rival Biological E's COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax for children of 12-18 years age. Prior to this, Cadila Healthcare's ZyCoV-D and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin had received approval for use in adolescents. Corbevax is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein sub-unit vaccine.

Title: Porsches, Lamborghinis on ship burning mid-ocean may be worth ₹1,150 cr: Report
Content: A fire on the ship off the coast of Portugal's Azores Islands, that broke out on February 16, is expected to generate at least $155 million (over ₹1,150 crore) in expected losses for Volkswagen, risk solutions company Russell Group has estimated. The ship was carrying Volkswagen group's Porsche, Audi, and Lamborghini vehicles. The ship was reportedly carrying over 4,000 cars.

Title: China asks biggest state-owned banks to report exposure to Jack Ma's Ant Group: Report
Content: Chinese authorities have asked the biggest state-owned firms and banks to conduct thorough checks on their financial exposure and other links to billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group and report the findings, reported Bloomberg. This is reportedly the most thorough and wide-ranging scrutiny into Ant's deals. In 2020, China suspended Ant's $35-billion IPO that was set to be the world's largest.

Title: Ashneer files arbitration plea, calls BharatPe investigation against him illegal: Reports
Content: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover filed an arbitration plea in the Singapore International Arbitration Centre claiming that BharatPe's investigation against him is illegal, ET and Livemint reported. He claims BharatPe kept the investigation opaque and gave him no chance to present his case. Grover also sought indemnity from any future action against him in his settlement talks with BharatPe.

Title: Air India flight gets water salute in Maldives for 46 yrs of air service
Content: Air India on Monday shared a video of one of its flights receiving a water cannon salute on landing at Male airport in Maldives. The aircraft was welcomed to commemorate 46 years of air service between India and the Maldives. The airlines mentioned that the first flight between the two countries was operated from Thiruvananthapuram to Male in February 1976.

Title: Woman told to remove hijab at UCO Bank branch in Bihar, bank responds
Content: A Muslim woman was allegedly asked to remove her hijab for withdrawing money at a UCO Bank branch in Bihar's Begusarai and a video of the same also went viral online. UCO Bank responded to the video by saying it "respects the religious sentiments of citizens...doesn't discriminate...on basis of caste or religion". It said it's checking facts on the issue.

Title: IDFC FIRST Bank MD gifts shares worth ₹3.95 cr to driver, 4 others to buy houses
Content: IDFC FIRST Bank MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 9 lakh shares of the bank held by him worth ₹3.95 crore, to five individuals, including a driver and house help, to help them purchase homes. Additionally, the Rukmani Social Welfare Trust has disposed of 2 lakh equity shares to support social activities. Vaidyanathan is a trustee of Rukmani trust.

Title: Indian investors lose ₹9.1 lakh crore amid Russia-Ukraine crisis since Feb 16
Content: The geopolitical tensions between Ukraine and Russia have eroded the market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies by ₹9.1 lakh crore since February 16, Moneycontrol reported. On Tuesday, the Indian benchmark indices crashed by around 2% after Russia recognised two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent and ordered troop deployment there. The Sensex opened 1,245 points lower at 56,439.

Title: Blackmailers circulating same complaints for 3 years: Indiabulls after ED searches
Content: After the ED searched its premises in Mumbai, Indiabulls Housing Finance said that ED's case report was based on an FIR filed by Ashutosh Kamble, who's part of "the long-running extortion racket" against it. "The FIR is a copy-and-paste of earlier several patently false...and malicious complaints that blackmailers have been circulating for three years now," the company added.

Title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,900 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
Content: The Sensex tanked more than 1,000 points in early trade following a sell-off in global markets after Russia ordered deployment of troops in two breakaway regions in Ukraine. In the pre-opening session, the Sensex fell 1,245 points lower to 56,438.6, while the broader Nifty 50 plunged 359 points at 16,848. US stock index futures also tumbled amid the geopolitical tensions.

Title: Fraudster Madoff's sister, her husband found dead in apparent murder-suicide in US
Content: The sister of late Bernie Madoff, who was convicted of masterminding the world's largest Ponzi scheme, and her husband have been found dead in Florida. Sondra Wiener, 87, and her husband Marvin were found with gunshot wounds, the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office said, adding that it appeared to be a murder-suicide. Madoff died aged 82 in US prison last year.

Title: Vedanta makes oil discovery in Rajasthan's Barmer
Content: Vedanta in a statement said, "We've informed the Petroleum Ministry of an Oil Discovery (named 'Durga') in our exploratory well in Rajasthan's Barmer." The block where the discovery was made was awarded to Vedanta in October 2018 and is one of the 41 blocks awarded to it in OALP-I round of bidding. Vedanta holds 100% participating interest in the block.

Title: Alibaba leads China tech stocks drop amid regulatory action fear
Content: Alibaba led the decline in Chinese technology stocks following a Bloomberg report that authorities have begun another round of checks on its fintech business arm. The tech stocks have been dropping amid worries over Beijing's regulatory plans for the sector. The Hang Seng Tech Index fell over 3% on Tuesday, heading for the lowest close since its inception in 2020.

Title: PharmEasy parent gets SEBI's approval for ₹6,250 crore IPO
Content: PharmEasy parent API Holdings has received the Securities and Exchange Board of India's (SEBI) approval for its ₹6,250 crore initial public offering (IPO). According to the company's draft papers, the proceeds will be used to prepay or repay an outstanding debt of ₹1,929 crore. The offer is entirely a fresh issue and its founders and investors will not sell shares.

Title: Swiggy preparing for $800 million IPO early next year: Report
Content: Swiggy has started preparations to raise at least $800 million through an IPO early next year, the Nikkei reported. The food and grocery delivery platform reportedly plans to position itself as a logistics company and has begun adding independent directors to the board. Notably, Swiggy raised $700 million last month, reportedly doubling its valuation to $10.7 billion in six months.

Title: Women reluctant to join company boards: Union Finance Minister
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said women are reluctant to join company boards. "I have actually made a lot of attempts on my own level as a minister in calling up some people and saying please would you not want to come to a board?" she said. "No, I have not had enough women coming," Sitharaman added.

Title: Investors shouldn't worry about govt control post IPO: LIC Chairman
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said potential investors shouldn't worry about government control post LIC's IPO as the insurance company's decisions are taken by the board, not the government. He added that LIC is well-capitalised and that he doesn't believe it requires capital at the moment.

Title: India growing at 9.2%, among fastest-growing large economies: NITI Aayog CEO
Content: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Monday said the Indian economy is growing at 9.2% and is among the fastest-growing large economies in the world. "Today, India is witnessing unprecedented levels of economic development and technological disruptions," he said. The Centre's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme will add $520 billion to India's output in the next five years, Kant said.

Title: Can't compare profits of insurers with manufacturing firms: LIC Chairman
Content: LIC Chairman MR Kumar said that profits of insurance companies cannot be compared with manufacturing companies as dynamics of the businesses are "different". IPO-bound LIC has generated over ₹50,000 crore surplus in the past two years, out of which 95% goes to policyholder, he added. The remaining 5% may appear small but then it is not so, he further said.

Title: Credit Suisse denies alleged wrongdoing after client data gets leaked
Content: Credit Suisse said it "strongly rejects" allegations of wrongdoing after media outlets published findings of investigations into a leak of data on the bank's accounts. The bank allegedly has human rights abusers and businessmen who had been placed under sanctions as its clients. The bank said about 90% of the reviewed accounts are either closed or in process of closure.

Title: Vedant Fashions shares fall below IPO price for 1st time since listing
Content: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar's owner Vedant Fashions' shares fell below the IPO price for the first time since its listing on Tuesday. The stock listed at ₹936 on February 16 with gains of 8% from its issue price of ₹866 per share. The stock had hit a high of ₹993 on listing day and has declined nearly 16% since then.

Title: IPO-bound LIC may not sell entire stake in IDBI Bank: Chairman
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said the IPO-bound insurance company may not sell its entire stake in IDBI Bank. LIC may use the bank's large network of branches to market its insurance services, Kumar said. "[IDBI Bank] has been the strongest contributor to the bancassurance channel for us," he added.

Title: Officer's Choice whisky maker Allied Blenders picks banks for IPO: Report
Content: Allied Blenders & Distillers, which makes Officer's Choice whisky, has chosen ICICI Securities and Axis Capital to manage its IPO, Bloomberg reported. The Mumbai-based company plans to file preliminary offer documents by April and is targeting to list as soon as this year. Bloomberg earlier reported that Allied Blenders is planning to raise as much as $300 million through IPO.

Title: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's petition against his removal from Tata Sons on Mar 9
Content: A three-judge bench of the Supreme Court agreed to hear Cyrus Mistry's petition against the court's order upholding Mistry's removal from the position of Chairman of Tata Sons. The arguments on the review petition will be heard on March 9. Mistry alleged oppression of minority shareholders and said his removal from Tata Sons was an instance of such oppression.

Title: Ex-Police Commissioner criticises 'Gehraiyaan', Mazumdar-Shaw says 'Watch whole film'
Content: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao criticised 'Gehraiyaan' and tweeted, "We started watching [it], 20 minutes later, stopped." "I'm fan of Deepika...she's idolized by millions...Extramarital and destruction of home...Wrong message. Am I old fashioned[?]" he said. "Watch the whole film it's really well made with...twists," Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw replied.

Title: My wife doesn't listen to me: Ashneer on wife wearing dress by designer he rejected
Content: After Ashneer Grover's wife wore a dress designed by a 'Shark Tank' contestant he'd rejected, he addressed accusations of hypocrisy, saying, "Clearly my wife has a mind of her own and...doesn't listen to me." He said the designer left a dress for his wife Madhuri, adding, "I don't know what [she] liked, she wore it to 'The Kapil Sharma Show'."

Title: We'll have another pandemic with a different virus: World's 4th richest person Gates
Content: World's fourth richest person and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates told CNBC that the risks of severe disease from COVID-19 have "dramatically reduced" but "we'll have another pandemic". "It will be a different pathogen next time," he said. Gates added, "The cost of being ready for the next pandemic is not that large. It's not like climate change."

Title: Half of India's population under 25, suitable for Olympic Movement: Nita Ambani
Content: Businesswoman and International Olympic Committee (IOC) member Nita Ambani said, "Nearly half of India's population, over 600 million people, are under 25 years of age." She added, "This makes India one of the most crucial and exciting places to nurture and grow the Olympic Movement." India will host the IOC Session in 2023 after 40 years.

Title: Amazon, Reliance to compete for IPL telecast rights for a record ₹50,000 cr: Report
Content: Amazon and Reliance Industries are expected to take on Sony Group and Walt Disney's India units for exclusive five-year TV and digital broadcast rights of IPL, Reuters reported on Sunday. The cost to acquire these rights could run to a record ₹50,000 crore, the report added. Disney-owned Star India paid ₹16,348 crore in 2017 to have these rights until 2022.

Title: I don't use social media: Nilekani as he lists 3 devices he uses for work
Content: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani in an interview revealed that he doesn't use social media. Speaking about the three modes he works with, he said, "In the create mode to work...I use a laptop...For the curate mode...or just browse, I use an iPad; and for...communication I use...phone." He added that he uses Twitter to broadcast information and not for discussions.

Title: 4 senior executives at Better.com resign amid reports of more layoffs in March
Content: Four more senior executives of Better.com have resigned, three months after the company fired 900 employees over a Zoom call. The latest resignations include Clayton Carol, VP of Finance; Christian Wallace, Head of Real Estate; Paul Tyger, General Manager of Purchase; and Stephen Rosen, Head of Sales. Reports suggest that the company is preparing for a massive layoff next month.

Title: Tesla may accept Dogecoin as payment at Supercharger stations in future, hints Musk
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said in future Tesla charging stations may be able to accept Dogecoin as payment. Ryan Zohoury, founder of Tesla Console, tweeted, "Ten minutes after...new Santa Monica Superchargers opened and they're already almost full!" while tagging Musk. "And futuristic diner/ drive-in theater planned for Hollywood area! And of course, you can pay in Ðoge," Musk replied.

Title: SEBI proposes new disclosure norms for IPOs of loss-making firms
Content: SEBI has proposed to tighten disclosure standards for new-age technology companies that are planning to list their shares but don't fulfil the three-year profitability track. As per its proposal, such companies will have to disclose more details about how they arrived upon their IPO price. This comes as shares of several firms, including Paytm and Zomato, plunged post their listing.

Title: Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani marries Khrisha Shah in Mumbai, pic surfaces
Content: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani got married to Khrisha Shah in Mumbai.  GVK Vice Chairman GV Sanjay Reddy's wife Pinky Reddy took to Instagram to share photos from the event. Several personalities including actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan and NCP MP Supriya Sule attended the wedding.

Title: Who is Anmol Ambani's wife Khrisha Shah?
Content: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani has got married to Khrisha Shah. According to reports, Shah was born and brought up in Mumbai and is a social worker and entrepreneur. She founded Dysco, a social network company. She was earlier an employee of Accenture in the UK and later returned to India to become an entrepreneur.

Title: Govt to 'scrupulously' carry out background check of Air India's new CEO: Report
Content: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) will "scrupulously" carry out a thorough background check of Air India's new CEO and MD Ilker Ayci, a Turkish national, PTI reported. Tata Group named Turkish Airlines' former Chairman Ayci as Air India's CEO. MHA carries out a thorough background check of all foreign nationals when they're appointed in the key positions, PTI added.

Title: Dr Lal PathLabs, Metropolis and other labs' shares fall as COVID-19 eases
Content: The shares of listed Indian clinical labs including Dr Lal PathLabs and Metropolis Healthcare have fallen at least 30% this year as COVID-19 testing reduced due to the easing of the outbreak. The stock of Thyrocare Technologies has already lost a fifth of its value in 2022. Shares of these companies had at least doubled in the previous two years.

Title: Some businesses I invested in had terrible products: Shark Tank's Ghazal
Content: Ghazal Alagh of 'Shark Tank India' has said certain businesses that she invested in turned out to have terrible products. "There have been deals where you...loved their products, but then you...checked those products [on internet] and you go like, 'What do you do now'," she said. "Now [if] products don't have a good rating, it is your problem," she added.

Title: Govt gets 5 proposals worth ₹1.5 lakh crore for chip, display plants
Content: The government has received five applications for the establishment of semiconductor and display plants under its ₹76,000 crore PLI scheme. The Ministry of Electronics and IT said the companies have proposed to invest a total of $20.5 billion (₹1.53 lakh crore). Vedanta-Foxconn JV, IGSS Ventures and ISMC have proposed to set up semiconductor plants with a total $13.6 billion investment.

Title: Tata Technologies to hire 1,000 more people in FY 2023: CEO
Content: Tata Technologies will hire at least 1,000 more people in FY2023 than its planned recruitment of over 3,000 innovators over 12 months under its expanded talent acquisition program, said CEO Warren Harris. "That speaks to the fact that increasingly, we are not opportunities constrained," he added. The company had announced its decision to recruit over 3,000 people in January.

Title: Digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter': Ethereum Co-Founder
Content: Vitalik Buterin, the Co-Founder of the Ethereum blockchain, has said that the digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter'. "The winters are the time when a lot of those applications fall away and you can see which projects are actually long-term sustainable," said Buterin. Crypto winter refers to a prolonged bearish period where asset prices fall over many months.

Title: Berkshire had no prior knowledge of Microsoft-Activision deal: Buffett
Content: Billionaire Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway, which invested in Activision Blizzard last year, "had no prior knowledge" that Microsoft was planning to acquire the video game maker. Berkshire held nearly 14.7 million shares in Activision Blizzard as of December 31. The stock purchase was made ahead of Activision's $69-billion deal with Microsoft, which was announced in January.

Title: Govt to create equity fund for startups with 20% limited stake: MoS IT
Content: The government will create an equity fund for startups with a 20% limited stake, the Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said at an event conducted by the Confederation of Indian Industry. The fund will be managed by private fund managers, Chandrasekhar said, adding that "this will create required private equity capital as an addition to what exists today".

Title: Tesla changes S Korea ad as probe finds exaggerated claims on battery
Content: Tesla changed an advertisement on its South Korean website about the driving range for its Model 3 after an antitrust regulator found that it exaggerated the specifications of its batteries. The description of Tesla's Model 3 was changed to say the vehicle is capable of travelling a "maximum" of 528 kilometres on a single charge, from "more than" 528 kilometres.

Title: Union Budget will help in implementing National Education Policy: PM
Content: Union Budget will help in implementing the National Education Policy, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "National Digital University is an unprecedented step. The problem of shortage of seats can be resolved. There will be unlimited seats. I urge all the stakeholders to ensure digital uni starts as soon as possible," PM Modi added.

Title: New policy to cut green hydrogen cost by 40-50%: India's largest oil firm IOC
Content: India's largest oil firm Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has said that the offer to waive transmission charges on green energy will help cut the cost of manufacturing green hydrogen by 40-50%. The cost will go down further if electrolyzers are indigenously manufactured instead of the present practice of importing them, said Director for Research & Development S.S.V. Ramakumar.

Title: BBMP invites suggestions from public for upcoming Budget for B'luru
Content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has invited suggestions and instructions of the public for the upcoming Budget 2022-23 for the city. BBMP said that a suggestion box has been placed near the BBMP office and said that general public can give their suggestions through the box. Bengaluru's Budget is usually announced 15 days after the state Budget is presented.

Title: Traders object after Delhi's Palika Bazaar named in US' notorious markets list
Content: Palika Bazaar Association has objected after the Delhi market was named in the US' Notorious Markets List of 2021 for allegedly selling counterfeit products. It demanded to drop the market's name from the list, condemning the "false allegations". The list identified 35 physical markets globally that are "reported to engage in or facilitate substantial trademark counterfeiting or copyright piracy".

Title: India-UAE trade pact to help jewellery sector get export boost: Commerce Secy
Content: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said that India's jewellery sector will get a huge export boost after the India-UAE trade pact as it will now get duty-free access in the UAE market. The gulf nation will also get greater access to the gold market here as India will give duty concessions on imports of up to 200 tonnes/year, he added.

Title: Future Retail pays $14 mn interest on USD notes in grace period
Content: Future Retail has paid $14 million for interest due on the dollar-denominated notes (USD notes) listed on Singapore stock exchange after missing the due date last month. The company told the NSE last month that it had 30 days to make the payment. Future Retail had cited continued impact of COVID-19 and its financial situation as reasons for missing payment.

Title: Which countries are preferred by India's millionaires for their kids' education?
Content: As per the Hurun India Wealth Report 2021, 70% of India's millionaires that were surveyed preferred sending their children abroad for education. Of these, 29% preferred the US for their kids' education, 19% preferred the UK, 12% preferred New Zealand and Germany found favour with 11%, the report said. Mumbai has the most number of millionaire households at 20,300.

Title: Meta falls from ranks of world's 10 most valuable companies
Content: Meta Platforms, formerly known as Facebook, fell out of the world’s 10 largest companies by market value after it closed on Thursday with a value of $565 billion, as per Bloomberg. On February 3, the company announced a drop in its daily active user base for the first time ever, which then wiped out $240 billion from its market capitalization.

Title: I became the world's richest man for 7 minutes, overtook Elon Musk: YouTuber
Content: UK-based YouTuber Max Fosh claimed he overtook Elon Musk as the world's richest person for seven minutes. In a video, he explained how he registered a new company 'Unlimited Money Limited' with 10 billion shares and priced them at £50 each, valuing his company at £500 billion ($680 billion). Later, he dissolved the company after being "accused of fraudulent activity".

Title: Which are now the world's 10 most valuable firms as Meta loses ranking?
Content: Apple is the world's most valuable company with $2.8-trillion market value, followed by Microsoft with $2.2 trillion, as per Bloomberg. Aramco, Alphabet, Amazon and Tesla rank between 3rd and 6th with a market value of $2 trillion, $1.8 trillion, $1.6 trillion and $905.7 billion, respectively. Tencent now ranks 10th after Meta fell to the 11th position with $565.4-billion market value.

Title: Met 'yogi' 20 yrs ago on banks of Ganges: Ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna told SEBI
Content: Former NSE chief  Chitra Ramkrishna, who was questioned by the CBI over allegations of sharing information with a 'Himalayan Yogi', met the latter 20 years ago on the banks of the Ganges. Calling him a "spiritual force", Ramkrishna told SEBI that he gave her his email address for further communication which she used for personal and professional matters.

Title: You must learn different ways to plait your hair: 'Yogi' told ex-NSE chief Chitra
Content: In a detailed order released by SEBI against former NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna and others, some of her e-mail conversations with the 'Himalayan yogi' have been revealed. In one of the emails, the ‘yogi’ wrote, "Today you are looking awesome. You must learn different ways to plait your hair which will make your looks interesting and appealing!! Just free advice."

Title: LIC likely to launch ₹59,760 crore IPO on March 11: Reports
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India is expected to launch its IPO at $8 billion (₹59,760 crore)  on March 11, three sources have informed Reuters. LIC’s IPO is expected to be India’s largest-ever public issue. As per reports, the shares of LIC could be priced between ₹2,000-2,100 each, where 10% of the total offer size will be reserved for policyholders.

Title: I'm prepared for failure: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala on starting Akasa Air
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala at the CII Real Estate Confluence 2022 said, "Lots of people have questioned why I've started an airline. I said I'm prepared for failure." He added, "It's not that I have bet my life on it or I have mortgaged my wife's jewellery and done it." He further said he hopes to prove his critics wrong.

Title: Hurun survey shows brands preferred by Indian millionaires; Mercedes top car brand
Content: As per Hurun India Luxury Consumer Survey 2021, high net worth individuals' most-preferred luxury car brand is Mercedes-Benz and luxury sports car brand is Lamborghini. Their most-preferred hospitality brand is Taj, followed by Oberoi. Rolex is the most-preferred luxury watch brand, Tanishq is the most-preferred Indian jewellery brand and Louis Vuitton is the most preferred luxury goods brand.

Title: Names of 3 Indian cities with the most millionaire households released by Hurun
Content: As per the Hurun India Wealth Report 2021, Mumbai has the highest number of millionaire households in India, followed by Delhi and then Kolkata. The report defines such households as those that have a net worth of at least ₹7 crore. It further said that such households have increased by 11% to 4,58,000 households, as compared to last year.

Title: Planning Seychelles trip, we can enjoy sea bath: 'Yogi' to ex-NSE CEO in e-mail
Content: As per e-mail correspondence shared by SEBI between ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and an unknown 'yogi', the latter planned a trip to Seychelles with her. "Keep bags ready I'm planning a [trip] to Seychelles...will try if you can come...If you know swimming...we could enjoy a sea bath in Seychelles and rest on the beach," the 'yogi' wrote to Ramkrishna.

Title: My father, Tatas, Winston Churchill: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala on his role models
Content: At a CII event, billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala shared that his father is his "first role model" for giving him "morals, thoughts, guts and curiosity". His second role model is the house of Tatas and third is ex-British PM Winston Churchill for "tenacity and sheer guts". The 61-year-old added that he looked up to American billionaire George Soros for trading.

Title: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal resigns from board, will cut down stake
Content: IndiGo operator InterGlobe Aviation Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal has resigned as Non-Executive Director from the company's board with immediate effect. In his resignation letter, Gangwal wrote, "I've been a long-term shareholder...for more than 15 years and it's only natural to...think about diversifying one's holdings." He said he plans to reduce his stake in IndiGo "over the next 5 plus years".

Title: $26 bn wiped off Meituan's m-cap after China asks food delivery apps to cut fees
Content: Shares of Chinese food delivery giant Meituan fell the most in nearly seven months on Friday, wiping out $26 billion from its market capitalisation. The development came after the Chinese government issued guidelines asking online food delivery platforms to reduce fees for restaurants in regions hit by COVID-19 pandemic. The benchmark Hang Seng Index closed 1.9% lower on Friday.

Title: Apple investors urged to vote against Tim Cook's $99 mn pay package
Content: Apple shareholders have been urged by Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) to vote against the $98.7 million pay package awarded to CEO Tim Cook last year. The advisory firm has cited concerns around the magnitude of Cook's equity award, adding that "half of the award lacks performance criteria". The package includes $3 million in salary and $82.3 million in stock awards.

Title: Ford Motor exploring ways to run EV business separately: Report
Content: Ford Motor is reportedly considering ways to separate its electric-vehicle operation from its 118-year-old legacy business. CEO Jim Farley has considered spinning off Ford's EV operations or its internal combustion engine business, Bloomberg reported citing sources. Since splitting the firm may be difficult, Ford could separate EV business internally under a broad reorganisation, the report said.

Title: Retail inflation for farm, rural workers rises to 5.49%, 5.74% in Jan
Content: Retail inflation for farm workers rose to 5.49%, while that of rural labourers rose to 5.74% in January, mainly due to higher prices of certain food items, official data showed. Food inflation for farm workers stood at 4.15% and for rural labourers at 4.33% in January 2022 compared to 2.99% and 3.17%, respectively, in the previous month.

Title: Housing price rise by 7%, sales rise by 36% in Hyd in 2021: Report
Content: Hyderabad housing markets witnessed the growth of 7% in annual price hike in 2021, a report by PropTiger stated. Hyderabad also reported a 36% rise in housing sales during 2021, with Bachupally, Tellapur and Miyapur reported to be the most preferred localities by homebuyers. Reportedly, the average per square foot rate of housing projects in Hyderabad now stands at ₹5,900-₹6,100.

Title: India signs its first-ever bilateral free trade agreement with UAE
Content: India and the UAE signed their first-ever bilateral free trade agreement on Friday. The Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) is expected to raise the total trade up to $100 billion in the next 5-years and will cut import duties on various products while boosting the export of jewellery and apparel. Notably, UAE is India's third-largest trading partner.

Title: Foreign COVID vaccine firms can do business here, but on India's terms: Govt
Content: Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that major foreign COVID-19 vaccine manufacturers were demanding indemnity and sovereign immunity waiver to supply vaccines in India. The government made it clear that they are welcome to do business here but on "India's terms", he added. The conditions put forth by these companies strengthened India's plan of developing indigenous vaccines, he further said.

Title: He's best man for the CEO job: Quess Corp Chairman on Srinivasan
Content: India's largest staffing firm Quess Corp's chairman Ajit Isaac praised the appointment of new CEO Guruprasad Srinivasan and called him the "best man for the job". Last week, Srinivasan took charge as MD & CEO of Quess, replacing Suraj Moraje, who announced his sudden exit from the company. Quess stock declined after the news even after posting strong Q3 performance.

Title: Biggest coal miner Coal India warns output may fall without price hike
Content: World's biggest coal miner Coal India has warned that production may fall if the company isn't able to raise prices on an "urgent" basis. The company said it's facing cost pressures from a rise in salaries and on higher prices of diesel used to power mine equipment. Over 70% of electricity generation in India is done by Coal India.

Title: Boards fail when they allow CEOs to be imperial: Indra Nooyi
Content: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the NASSCOM Technology and Leadership Forum 2022 said that when boards allow CEOs to be imperial, they fail in their duties. "There are many CEOs, mostly men who are imperial, because...the belief is that when you become CEO, you've been anointed...king," Nooyi added. "That's not what people expect from the CEO," she further said.

Title: India's mobile subscriber count fell by 1.28 cr in Dec 2021: TRAI
Content: The mobile user count in India fell by 1.28 crore in December 2021 compared to the previous month, TRAI data showed. Reliance Jio lost about 1.29 crore wireless subscribers bringing its user base to 41.57 crore whereas Vodafone Idea lost 16.14 lakh mobile subscribers bringing user base to 26.55 crore. In contrast, Airtel gained 4.75 lakh customers in December 2021.

Title: Q3 results reflected true performance, drawn with full transparency: SpiceJet
Content: The SpiceJet said that company's Q3 results reflected its true performance and ''these have been drawn with full transparency''. This comes after many attributed SpiceJet's profit to the compensation received from Boeing for the grounding of its 13 Boeing MAX aircrafts. SpiceJet reported a net profit of ₹42.5 crore in Q3 after reporting loss in the past seven consecutive quarters.

Title: Air passenger traffic falls by 17% in January to 64 lakh: DCGA
Content: Air passenger traffic for January 2022 went down by 17% at 64.08 lakh passengers compared to January 2021, as per DGCA data. This was 43% lower as compared to December last year. The passenger load factor (PLF) of SpiceJet was at 73.4% followed by IndiGo at 66.6%. IndiGo was the largest airline with 55.5% market share in January.

Title: Govt focusing on making gem, jewellery sector self-reliant: Piyush Goyal
Content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India needs a "self-reliant" gem and jewellery sector and the government is focusing towards helping boost both domestic as well as export growth. The proposed policies in Budget 2022 will help facilitate exports through e-commerce, Goyal added. The sector contributes 7% to the GDP and employs around 50 lakh people, he added.

Title: Navi US Total Stock Market Fund of Fund NFO closes on Feb 18
Content: Navi Mutual Fund announced that its latest NFO closes tomorrow. It stated that this Fund of Fund will invest in units of Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF, world's 3rd-largest ETF, that represents almost entire investable US stock market. With total expense ratio of 0.06% (subject to change within overall 1% limit), the NFO is available on Groww, Coin, among others.

Title: Offering myself for auction as a star player, jokes Anand Mahindra on Pillow Fight C'ship
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video about the PFC Pillow Fight Championship which recently took place in the US. He jokingly wrote, "I am offering myself for auction as a star player for this league. After a holiday with my 4-year-old grandson, I think I’m fit, trained & ready to fight! Opening bid: ₹50,000."

Title: I hope you change your mind: Poonawalla to Djokovic on COVID-19 vaccination
Content: Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla on Thursday tweeted to Novak Djokovic about the tennis player's view on COVID-19 vaccination. "I respect your views on not getting vaccinated and love watching you play, but I hope you change your mind," tweeted Poonawalla. Djokovic has said that he'd rather miss tournaments than be forced to get a COVID-19 vaccine.

Title: In 2009, billionaire Munger said Tesla would fail: World's richest man Musk
Content: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person, Elon Musk, recalled a 2009 incident when billionaire Charlie Munger described "all the ways" in which his company Tesla would fail. "Made me quite sad, but I told him I agreed with all those reasons...but it was worth trying anyway," tweeted Musk. He was responding to Munger calling for a ban on cryptocurrency.

Title: Bill Gates conferred Pakistan's second-highest civilian award on his first-ever visit
Content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates was conferred the Hilal-e-Pakistan award by Pakistan President Arif Alvi for his contribution to "eradication of polio and the betterment of the people" of the country. The award, which is Pakistan's second-highest civilian award, was given to Gates on his first-ever visit to Pakistan. PM Imran Khan also hosted a luncheon in honour of Gates.

Title: Bill Gates makes his first-ever visit to Pakistan, eats lunch with PM Imran Khan
Content: Microsoft Co-founder and the world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, is on his first-ever visit to Pakistan. Gates on Thursday called on Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan and was briefed about efforts to tackle the coronavirus pandemic and eradicate poliovirus from the country. The Pakistan PM also hosted a luncheon in honour of Bill Gates.

Title: I'm heartbroken, we fell short of expectations: Vistara CEO to customers
Content: Vistara CEO Vinod Kannan has written an open letter to customers where he admitted that the airline fell short of customers' expectations "in the last few months". "Knowing that you have been inconvenienced and disappointed with our services has been heartbreaking for me," he added. Addressing flight disruptions and Vistara's app and website issues, he said, "Grievances haven't gone unnoticed."

Title: I don't drink but anything habit-forming is good business: Shark Tank's Ashneer Grover
Content: Shark Tank judge and BharatPe Co-Founder Ashneer Grover said he never drinks but he thinks that "anything habit-forming is good business". "Bira (craft beer company) has been my biggest portfolio investment...I've been investing in the company for five years," he revealed during a talk show. Grover said he invested in 'In a Can' because it had "potential to develop habits".

Title: Ship carrying thousands of luxury cars to US catches fire, drifts in sea without crew
Content: A 650-foot-long Panama-flagged cargo ship carrying thousands of new Volkswagen Group vehicles from Germany to the US caught fire earlier this week. Its 22 crew members were evacuated from Felicity Ace near Portugal, but the burning ship continued to drift in the Atlantic Ocean on Thursday. The ship reportedly carried nearly 4,000 cars including 1,100 Porches and 189 Bentleys.

Title: Ashneer's wife says BharatPe board accepted a resignation she never tendered: Report
Content: BharatPe's Head of Controls and Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover has reportedly written to the company's board, alleging she never tendered the resignation it had accepted. BharatPe told ET it "never sought any resignation" from Jain and hence its acceptance of such "doesn't arise". "She was asked to go on compulsory leave of absence on January 20," BharatPe said.

Title: CBI questions ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing info with 'yogi'
Content: The Central Bureau of Investigation is questioning former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna amid the controversy that she shared confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi'. It has also issued a Look Out circular against her, Ravi Narain and former COO Anand Subramanian. The questioning comes a day after raids were conducted by the Income Tax department on Ramkrishna's office and residence.

Title: IndiaMART, Delhi's Palika, 3 other Indian markets on US' list of notorious markets
Content: E-commerce website IndiaMART and four Indian markets, including Delhi's Palika Bazaar and Tank Road, have featured on US' Notorious Markets List of 2021. The other two markets are Mumbai's Heera Panna and Kolkata's Kidderpore. The list identified 42 online and 35 physical markets in the world that are "reported to engage in or facilitate substantial trademark counterfeiting or copyright piracy".

Title: Elon Musk posts meme comparing Canada PM to Hitler, deletes it later
Content: Elon Musk on Wednesday posted a meme comparing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau with Adolf Hitler. Musk shared an image of the former German dictator, with text that read, "Stop comparing me to Justin Trudeau. I had a budget." The meme was shared by Musk in response to an article detailing Trudeau's order sanctioning crypto wallets associated with truckers' protests.

Title: India's largest FMCG company HUL hikes prices twice in 2 months
Content: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL), India's largest fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) company, has undertaken another round of price hikes across product categories. This is the second price hike by the company in two months. The move is in line with the management's commentary after December quarter earnings, wherein it indicated "calibrated price hikes" as it expected higher input price inflation.

Title: Buffett, who called crypto 'rat poison', invests $1 bn in crypto-friendly bank
Content: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway recently bought a $1 billion stake in Brazil-based digital neobank NuBank. Even though NuBank does not allow crypto trading, its investment unit NuInvest lets users dabble in crypto and bitcoin exchange-traded fund. Buffett had earlier said crypto is "probably rat poison squared" and "has no unique value at all".

Title: Visa, Amazon agree to end dispute over credit card fees
Content: Visa credit cards will be accepted at all Amazon stores and sites as part of a global agreement, the payments giant said. Earlier, Amazon said it would stop accepting payments made via Visa credit cards issued in the UK, citing high transaction fees, but later halted the plan. Both the companies were in talks to resolve the dispute over fees.

Title: Didn't expect from you: FM as Manmohan criticises govt's economic policy
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday reacted to former PM Manmohan Singh's comments about the government's handling of the economy. "I have great regards for you (Singh). I did not expect this from you," Sitharaman said. She added that Singh was more remembered for having brought India to "fragile five" and rampant inflation during his tenure.

Title: President of B'luru's Raghavendra Bank arrested in money laundering case
Content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested K Ramakrishna, the President of a Bengaluru-based cooperative bank, Sri Guru Raghavendra Sahakara Bank Niyamitha, in a money-laundering case. The case is linked to the alleged misappropriation of public funds worth ₹1,000 crore. ED alleged the bank officials siphoned off the money deposited by the public. They reportedly cheated over 40,000 depositors.

Title: Air travel may get costlier as jet fuel prices hit record high
Content: Air travel may get costlier as oil marketing companies raised the aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices by 5.2% on Wednesday hitting a record high. This is the fourth hike in ATF prices in less than two months following a spike in global oil prices. Currently, India has some of the world's highest rates of taxation on the ATF.

Title: Housing prices rise by 6%, sales rise by 7% in B'luru in 2021: Report
Content: According to a report by property brokerage firm PropTiger.com, the housing prices increased by 6% in Bengaluru in 2021. The report 'Real Insight Residential- Annual Round-up 2021' further stated that the housing sales increased by 7% in Bengaluru last year. "It seems very likely that we will see an increase in prices in 2022," said Rajan Sood, PropTiger.com's Business Head.

Title: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj's memorial to be set up in Pimpri-Chinchwad
Content: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has decided to set up a memorial of former Bajaj Group Chairman and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj, who passed away last week. "Bajaj contributed immensely to development of Pimpri-Chinchwad," the standing committee chairman said. "Had it not been for the initiative of Rahul Bajaj, Pimpri-Chinchwad would have never become internationally known," he added.

Title: CBI questions ex-ABG Shipyard CMD in India's biggest bank fraud case
Content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) recently questioned former ABG Shipyard Chairman and MD Rishi Agarwal in connection with its probe into the country's largest bank fraud case. CBI has also issued lookout circulars against Directors of the company to ensure they do not leave the country. ABG Shipyard allegedly cheated a consortium of banks of ₹22,842 crore.

Title: Punjab and Sind Bank to raise ₹4,600 cr by issuing shares to govt
Content: The Punjab and Sind Bank on Thursday said its Board has given approval to raise ₹4,600 crore by issuing preference shares to the government. The Delhi-headquartered lender had posted a net profit of ₹301 crore in the October-December 2021 quarter. The Bank recorded a net loss of ₹2,376 crore in the same quarter a year ago.

Title: 50% of our staff from India, country's role growing: Capgemini CEO
Content: Over 50% staff in Capgemini are from India and the nation's role in the company is only growing as it becomes a big centre of innovation, said the French IT firm CEO Aiman Ezzat. As of December 2021, the company's total headcount stood at 324,700. "In future, there will probably be more Indian senior executives overall in Capgemini,'' he added.

Title: GAIL to connect Srinagar to gas grid; Mumbai-Nagpur line by May 2023
Content: GAIL India plans to lay a pipeline to Srinagar via Jammu to take the environment-friendly natural gas to the Kashmir Valley, Chairman Manoj Jain said. By May 2023, GAIL will complete a 700-km pipeline from Mumbai to Nagpur. The company is on track to meet the target of mid-2022 for completing major portions of Urja Ganga project, he added.

Title: India, UAE may sign free trade agreement on Feb 18: Reports
Content: India and UAE may reportedly sign a proposed free trade agreement, which would give both countries duty-free access to a number of products from different sectors, on February 18. PM Narendra Modi and the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi will hold a Virtual Summit on Friday. This would be second such agreement to be signed by the current government.

Title: LIC sees decline in policy issuance due to COVID-19 pandemic
Content: LIC said that the total number of individual and group policies has witnessed a decline due to the COVID-19 pandemic. According to the DRHP filed by LIC, the total number of individual and group policies issued in India decreased by 16.76% to 62.43 million for fiscal 2020 and it further decreased by 15.84% to 52.54 million for fiscal 2021.

Title: Chinese company Huawei's premises in India raided by Income Tax Dept: Reports
Content: The Income Tax Department conducted raids at Chinese company Huawei's premises in Delhi, Gurugram and Bengaluru on Tuesday, according to multiple reports. The officials looked at financial documents, account books and company records as part of a tax evasion investigation against the company. Huawei has said that its operations in the country were "firmly compliant" with the law.

Title: Infosys to hire 55,000 or more freshers in FY23: CEO Salil Parekh
Content: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh said, "We will recruit 55,000 college graduates in this financial year, and we will hire that or a higher number next year." Of the 55,000 people Infosys is hiring this year, 52,000 are from India. Parekh added, "We want to reskill our employees and make them career-ready for what they can do with the new technologies."

Title: Tesla needs to buy $500 million of local parts in India to get import tax cut: Report
Content: The government reportedly wants Elon Musk-led Tesla to source at least $500 million worth of auto parts from India for it to be eligible for import tax cuts on electric vehicles. Tesla can start at a lower base but needs to ramp up Indian parts purchases by 10-15% a year until a satisfactory level is achieved, Bloomberg reported citing sources.

Title: Ratan Tata honoured with Assam's highest civilian award; CM shares pics
Content: Tata Trusts Chairman Ratan Tata was on Wednesday honoured with Assam's highest civilian award, 'Assam Baibhav', by Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. "The visionary industrialist and philanthropist has made exceptional contribution towards furthering cancer care in Assam," the Assam CM said. The award carries a citation, a medal and a cash amount of ₹5 lakh.

Title: Dated Brent, main price benchmark for physical crude, hits $100 amid Ukraine crisis
Content: Dated Brent reached $100.80/barrel on Wednesday for the first time since September 2014 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, according to S&P Global Platts. The dated Brent crude oil benchmark, which refers to the price of cargoes bought and sold in North Sea, sets a baseline for over half the world's physical crude cargoes. A Bloomberg report called it "world's most-important oil price".

Title: I left Bihar with a tiffin & dreams in my eyes: Billionaire Agarwal on moving to Mumbai
Content: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal tweeted that he's among millions of people who came to Mumbai "to try their luck". "I left Bihar with...a tiffin box, bedding, and dreams in my eyes. I arrived at Victoria Terminus station, and for the first time...saw a kaali peeli taxi...and the City of Dreams," he wrote. Agarwal urged youngsters to "work hard".

Title: There's no such thing as balancing work, family: Indra Nooyi in note for husband
Content: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi shared a note for her husband Raj Nooyi for Valentine's Day saying, "The truth is, there's no such thing as balancing work and family. It's a constant juggling act." "Our life partners...make this juggling possible," she added. Nooyi also shared that her husband often told her he's at the bottom of her priority list.

Title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Mohandas Pai argue on Twitter over 'yogi ran NSE' report
Content: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw and Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai engaged in an argument on Twitter over a SEBI report that claimed a Himalayan yogi influenced former National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD Chitra Ramkrishna's decisions. "No yogi ran NSE! Please stop spreading such falsehoods," tweeted Pai. In response, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "So do we junk the SEBI report?"

Title: LIC to raise ₹65,400 crore in India's largest-ever IPO: Reports
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India is reportedly looking to raise ₹65,400 crore through its IPO, which will be India's largest-ever public issue. Shares of LIC could be priced between ₹2,000-2,100 each, with discounts to some retail investors, BloombergQuint reported citing sources. The IPO may open for subscription from March 10-14, if approvals come on time, the report said.

Title: Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor gets bail in ₹300-crore fraud case
Content: A special PMLA Court in Mumbai on Wednesday granted bail to Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and Avantha Group's Gautam Thapar in an alleged fraud case of over ₹300 crore. ED claimed Kapoor obtained a bungalow in a prime location in Delhi after Thapar's firm was extended a loan. However, both will remain in jail in connection with other cases.

Title: Australian whisky firm's CEO quits after video shows him smoking meth pipe
Content: The CEO of Australia's largest listed whisky company has resigned after a video in which he appeared to be smoking a methamphetamine pipe became public. An Australian newspaper reported that Lark Distilling's Geoff Bainbridge was seen "fondling himself in skimpy black underwear" and making sexual remarks. Bainbridge said he's been a "victim of extortion" due to this video for years.

Title: Just another day in the markets, not for faint-hearted: Mahindra on rollercoaster video
Content: Sharing a video showing a rollercoaster ride, billionaire businessman Anand Mahindra wrote, "Just another day in the markets. Not for the faint-hearted." His tweet came as the Sensex ended 1,736 points higher on Tuesday, a day after it tanked around 1,747 points. The Indian benchmark indices nearly recouped Monday's losses to record their best day in over a year.

Title: Ex-NSE MD accused of sharing info with Himalayan 'yogi' raided by I-T dept: Reports
Content: The income tax (I-T) department on Thursday conducted searches at the Mumbai residence of former Managing Director of the National Stock Exchange (NSE), Chitra Ramkrishna, reports said. This comes days after market regulator SEBI alleged that Ramkrishna shared confidential information about NSE with an unknown Himalayan 'yogi'. She was fined ₹3 crore for violating securities contract rules.

Title: Cathie Wood's ARK buys Sea shares that lost $16 bn after India app ban
Content: Cathie Wood's ARK Invest bought over 1,45,000 shares of Garena Free Fire game's owner Sea Ltd after it lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop. Sea closed 18% lower in New York on Monday after India banned its game Free Fire. India banned 54 apps on Monday, of which 'Garena Free Fire- Illuminate' was one.

Title: East Delhi civic body extends property tax amnesty scheme till March 31
Content: East Delhi Municipal Corporation (EDMC) has extended the last date for availing the amnesty scheme for payment of property tax to March 31. EDMC Mayor Shyam Sunder Aggarwal said that a 100% rebate on interest and penalty will be given on payment of outstanding property tax. This could be the last extension in the scheme, another EDMC official said.

Title: China courts freeze $157 mn of Evergrande assets over missed payments
Content: A Chinese court has ordered the freezing of Evergrande Group assets worth $101 million, according to a filing by Shanghai Construction Group. Last week, a Guangzhou court had frozen $57 million assets of a different Evergrande unit. Many suppliers and contractors have launched legal actions against Evergrande, which is having liabilities of over $300 billion, over missed or late payments.

Title: Salary increments in India to touch 5-yr high of 9.9% in 2022: Survey
Content: Salary increments in India will touch a five-year high of 9.9% in 2022 as organisations are planning to invest in new-age capabilities, as per Aon's 26th Salary Increase Survey. The study analysed data across 1,500 companies from more than 40 industries. E-commerce and venture capital, hitech/IT and IT enabled services (ITeS) are industries with the highest projected salary increases.

Title: India and UAE complete talks on bilateral pact to boost trade
Content: India and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) have completed negotiations for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) between the two countries, the Indian External Affairs Ministry said on Wednesday. It added that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed al Nahyan will hold a Virtual Summit on February 18 to discuss bilateral cooperation.

Title: CBDT issues refunds worth over ₹1.71 lakh cr in 1.97 cr cases in FY22
Content: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued refunds worth ₹1.71 lakh crore to over 1.97 crore taxpayers between April 1, 2021 and February 14, 2022. A total of ₹63,234 crore has been issued as income tax refunds in 1.95 crore individual cases. Corporate tax filed by companies accounted for 2.28 lakh cases and ₹1.08 lakh crore as refunds.

Title: UP RERA fines 9 real estate developers ₹1.40 cr over non-compliance
Content: Uttar Pradesh Real Estate Regulatory Authority has imposed a penalty of ₹1.40 crore on nine real estate developers for not complying with its orders. RERA has asked promoters to submit the compliance report within 15 days and deposit the penalty amount within 30 days. Failing to do so, the sum shall be recovered as arrears of land revenue, RERA warned.

Title: Jet fuel prices touch highest ever after a 5.2% price hike in Delhi
Content: Jet fuel, or Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) prices reached their highest ever after a 5.2% price hike due to rise in international oil prices. ATF price was hiked by ₹4,481.63 to ₹90,519.79/kilolitre in Delhi, according to a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. The rate is higher than ₹71,028.26/kilolitre reached in August 2008 when international crude oil prices touched $147/barrel.

Title: RBI cancels Mantha Urban Cooperative Bank's licence citing weak financials
Content: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday cancelled Mantha Urban Cooperative Bank's licence citing inadequate capital and earning prospects and asked it to cease banking operations from February 16. RBI has requested Maharashtra's Cooperation Commissioner to issue an order for winding up the bank. The continuance of the bank is prejudicial to the interests of its depositors, RBI said.

Title: India's highway construction falls to 4-year low during April-Jan
Content: India's highway construction fell to a four-year low of 22.2 km/day during April 2021-January 2022, the government data showed. India built highways at a pace of 30.4 km/day in the same period in FY21. The sharpest fall was recorded in January 2022 during which only 499 km highway stretches were constructed compared to 1,929 km in January 2021.

Title: Govt releases draft MSME policy, outlines 8 action areas
Content: MSME Ministry has released the draft National Policy for MSMEs in India and has proposed eight "specific action areas" to ensure the sector's rapid growth. The action areas include linking MSMEs with transport infrastructure for improved cross-border trade, creation of two sets of MSME database with different verticals and a focused institution to encourage technology upgradation, R&D projects.

Title: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions lists at 8% premium over IPO price
