Content: The shares of Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions got listed with an 8% premium over its IPO issue price of ₹866 per share on Wednesday. The stock got listed at ₹936 on the BSE and ₹935 on the NSE. The ₹3,149-crore IPO of Vedant Fashions, which was a complete offer for sale, was subscribed 2.57 times during February 4-8.

Title: ED to probe ABG Shipyard's directors in ₹22,842 cr fraud case: Reports
Content: The ED will reportedly open a money-laundering probe against ABG Shipyard's erstwhile management and directors for allegedly diverting funds out of the total ₹22,842-crore fraud amount. ED is examining documents related to the case to map money-laundering trails, reports said. Earlier, CBI issued lookout circulars against the accused in India's biggest bank fraud case to prevent them from fleeing.

Title: UK's inflation rises to 5.5% in January, highest since 1992
Content: The United Kingdom's Consumer Price Index reached its highest levels since March 1992 at 5.5% in January. It edged up from 5.4% in December and raised probability that the Bank of England (BoE) may raise its main interest rate for the third time in a row. The BoE has forecast Britain's annual inflation rate to peak at 7.25% in April.

Title: Fake news: Nilekani on post claiming he has launched crypto project
Content: Nandan Nilekani, the billionaire Co-founder of Infosys, has clarified that he has not launched any cryptocurrency-based project. "You may have encountered a post on various social media platforms claiming that I have launched a crypto project. This is fake news," Nilekani tweeted. He further urged people to avoid clicking on the post and report it as misleading or false information.

Title: India's Free Fire app ban causes company behind the game to lose $16 billion
Content: Garena Free Fire game's owner Sea Ltd lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned the game's app. 'Garena Free Fire - Illuminate' was one of the 54 apps banned by the government on Monday. "Sea is a Singaporean company and we aim to partner in India's digital economy mission," the company told Bloomberg.

Title: India's IT sector sees highest growth in a decade, adds 4.5 lakh new jobs in FY22
Content: India's IT sector is set to become a $227 billion industry in 2021-22, registering a 15.5% growth, the highest in a decade, industry body NASSCOM said. NASSCOM President Debjani Ghosh termed it as a year of "resurgence". In its yearly strategic review, NASSCOM said the industry added 4.5 lakh new jobs, taking its overall direct employees to 50 lakh people.

Title: 27-yr-old Evan Luthra became millionaire at 17, set to become billionaire at 30
Content: Delhi's 27-year-old entrepreneur Evan Luthra, who became a millionaire at the age of 17 after learning coding from YouTube, is set to become a billionaire by the time he hits 30, according to the New York Post. He built and invested in over 300 companies. "I was bitten by the 'digital bug' aged around 12," Luthra said.

Title: Indians 'world's most spoilt customers', want discount even at lowest price: Ashneer
Content: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover during a conversation with Raj Shamani said, "Indian customers are the world's most spoilt customers." He said, "They want everything at the lowest price, in the smallest size and they want it now...And even after that, they want a discount." He added, "In the US, things are expensive in the city and cheaper in the outskirts."

Title: Bumped me off my paid seat: Man accuses IndiGo of succumbing to 'VIP pressure'
Content: A Twitter user named Birender Dhanoa accused IndiGo of succumbing to "VIP pressure". "They bumped me off my paid seat because some former bureaucrat and "party" couldn't be anywhere except row 1," he tweeted. In another tweet, he claimed that another passenger encountered a similar situation, to which IndiGo replied, "We're sorry for the inconvenience...our team will get in touch."

Title: Belgians allowed to request 4-day work week with no loss in salary
Content: Belgian employees can now request to work four days a week instead of five without losing their salary, after Belgium's seven-party coalition federal government reached a deal on Tuesday. Employers will still have the right to turn down requests for a condensed work week, on the condition that they explain their refusal in writing, Deputy Prime Minister Pierre-Yves Dermagne said.

Title: Sensex surges 1,736 points in best day in a year, nearly recoups Monday's losses
Content: Indian benchmark indices logged their best day in over a year on Tuesday as Sensex jumped 1,736 points to end at 58,142. The Nifty 50 jumped 510 points to close at 17,352. The Sensex nearly recouped its losses from Monday as Russia-Ukraine geopolitical tensions eased. The Sensex had plunged 1,747 points in its worst fall in 10 months on Monday.

Title: Sensex jumps 1,400 points a day after crashing 1,700 points
Content: The Sensex jumped over 1,400 points to cross 57,800 during intraday trade on Tuesday, a day after it crashed over 1,700 points. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped over 400 points to trade above 17,200 levels. On Monday, the Indian benchmark indices logged their worst fall in 10 months amid global fears of a Russian invasion in Ukraine.

Title: Nilekani shows his phone's home screen, says 'No WhatsApp, only essential apps'
Content: Nandan Nilekani, the billionaire Co-founder of Infosys, took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a picture of his smartphone's home screen. "No WhatsApp. No notification badges. Only essential apps," Nilekani tweeted. He also said that he prefers to control his digital life using multiple devices.

Title: Aditya Birla, Franklin Templeton invest in UAE's digital bank Zand
Content: Aditya Birla Group and Franklin Templeton have invested in UAE-based digital bank Zand. Abu Dhabi's Al Hail Holding, Al Sayyah & Sons Investments, Global Development Group, Yusuff Ali of Lulu Group, and Zand co-founder Olivier Crespin also invested in the bank. Earlier in December, Zand shareholders completed the acquisition of the majority of shares in Dubai Bank from Emirates NBD.

Title: Talent crunch is real: Wipro's Rishad Premji on tech industry
Content: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter to acknowledge the talent crunch in technology industry. "The technology industry in India now employs over 5 million people and added 450,000 new jobs this year...yet the talent crunch is real!" Premji wrote in a tweet quoting NASSCOM's annual strategic review. He further said this presents a great opportunity for new job creation.

Title: Tesla shares jump after CEO Musk discloses 21.2% stake in company
Content: Shares of Tesla jumped nearly 5% on Tuesday after its billionaire CEO Elon Musk disclosed that he owns one-fifth of the electric carmaker. According to the SEC filing, Musk held 231 million shares of Tesla as of December 31, 2021, representing a shareholding of 21.2%. The stake is worth around $202 billion at Monday's closing price of $875.76 per share.

Title: Rolls-Royce's electric small plane may be out by 2025: Official
Content: Rolls-Royce's fully-electric small aircraft with 8-18 seats will likely be ready in three to five years, the company's electrical division president Rob Watson said. The aircraft's range will keep improving with better battery technology and it may ''eventually be able to fly 400 km in the 2030s'', Watson added. Rolls-Royce manufactures engines for Airbus and Boeing aircraft.

Title: Make provisions in scrappage policy to boost vehicle purchase: Panel to govt
Content: A Parliamentary Standing Committee has suggested the government to make provisions for "upfront financial incentives in the scrappage policy to boost demand for purchase of new vehicles". The proposed financial incentives would encourage end-users to discard their old and polluting vehicles and go in for the purchase of the new BS-VI compliant vehicles, the committee said in its report.

Title: Poor nations got SII's vaccines at price of a cup of tea: Cyrus Poonawalla
Content: The Chairman of Serum Institute of India (SII), Cyrus Poonawalla, said that the vaccines manufactured by the company were made available to poor nations at a price of a "cup of tea". Two-thirds of the world population has been protected by one or more of SII's vaccines, he added. Over 170 countries worldwide use SII vaccines, Poonawalla further said.

Title: India's trade deficit touches $17.42 billion in January: Govt
Content: India's trade deficit in January touched $17.42 billion, the Commerce Ministry data showed. The country's exports in January rose 25.28% to $34.50 billion compared to $27.54 billion in January 2021, while the imports rose to $51.93 billion in January from $42.03 billion last year. The rise in exports was due to good performance in the engineering, petroleum and jewellery sectors.

Title: Coal India net profit jumps 48% in Q3; firm declares 2nd dividend
Content: Coal India has reported a 47.7% rise in consolidated net profit to ₹4,558.4 crore for the October-December quarter compared to net profit of ₹3,085 crore in the year-ago period. The company's consolidated revenue from operations rose 20% to ₹28,434 crore from ₹23,686 crore in Q3 of FY21. Coal India's board approved a second interim dividend of ₹5 per share.

Title: SpiceJet reports ₹42.5 cr net profit after 7 consecutive quarterly losses
Content: SpiceJet reported a consolidated net profit of ₹42.5 crore in the October-December quarter after reporting net losses in the past seven consecutive quarters. The airline's consolidated revenue rose 33.8% YoY from ₹1,692 crore to ₹2,263 crore. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization were down 52.4% YoY from ₹244.3 crore to ₹116.4 crore.

Title: Cipla shares plunge after promoters sell 2.5% stake in block deal
Content: Pharmaceutical giant Cipla's shares plunged over 3% on Tuesday as its promoters sold 2.5% stake to institutional investors through a block trade. Promoters Yusuf Khwaja Hamied and Mustafa Khwaja Hamied sold the stake to raise funds for personal purposes, Cipla said. Earlier, reports said the deal may fetch them ₹1,849 crore. The promoter group now holds 34.23% of the company.

Title: Future Retail allowed by SC to approach HC to resume Reliance deal
Content: The Supreme Court has allowed Future Retail to approach the Delhi High Court for seeking continuation of proceedings before the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail is seeking to resume the process of NCLT approval for its deal with Reliance. The Supreme Court had reserved its order on Future Group's plea earlier this month.

Title: Centre cuts agri-cess on crude palm oil to 5% to check price rise
Content: The Centre has reduced the agri-cess for crude palm oil from 7.5% to 5% with effect from February 12. This move will benefit the domestic edible oil refiners and also check prices of cooking oils, the government said. ''After reduction of the agri-cess, the import tax gap between CPO and Refined Palm Oil has increased to 8.25%,'' the government informed.

Title: SEBI makes separation of Chairperson and MD, CEO's role voluntary
Content: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) on Tuesday said provision for separation of roles of a listed company's Chairperson and Managing Director or Chief Executive Officer is applicable on a "voluntary basis". The regulator had earlier mandated the separation of the role of Chairperson and MD/CEO of listed companies to be applicable from April 1, 2022.

Title: Initiate next gen reforms to improve ease of doing business: FM to SEBI
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday asked the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to initiate next generation reforms to improve India's ease of doing business. Further, she asked SEBI to "be prepared for the possible market turbulence on account of US Federal Reserve's actions". Sitharaman also appreciated the regulator's initiatives to strengthen investor protection.

Title: Oil prices drop from 7-year high amid reports of Russian troops' withdrawal
Content: Oil prices fell over 3% from a seven-year high on Tuesday after Russia said some of its military units were returning after military exercises near Ukraine. Brent crude was down $2.87, or 3%, at $93.61/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude dropped $3.49, or 3.7%, to $91.97/barrel. Both oil benchmarks hit their highest since September 2014 on Monday.

Title: Zoho reports ₹1,918 cr profit, ₹5,230 cr revenue in FY21: Reports
Content: Zoho reported a profit of ₹1,918 crore in FY21, a 139.5% YoY increase from ₹800.8 crore, Entrackr reported. Its operational revenue grew by 22.3% YoY from ₹4,274 crore in FY20 to ₹5,230 crore in FY21 while its employee benefit expenses rose 58.4% YoY to ₹1,725 crore. The United States continued to be Zoho's biggest market with a 42.7% share.

Title: Lookout circular against ABG Shipyard Directors in India's biggest bank fraud case
Content: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has issued a lookout circular against ABG Shipyard Directors in India's biggest bank fraud case to ensure they do not leave the country. The company allegedly cheated a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India (SBI) of ₹22,842 crore. According to CBI's complaint, ABG Shipyard owes ₹7,089 crore to ICICI Bank.

Title: Berkshire bought Activision's $1 bn worth shares before Microsoft takeover
Content: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway bought nearly $1 billion of shares in Activision Blizzard before Microsoft agreed to acquire it for $68.7 billion, according to a regulatory filing. Berkshire said it owned 14.7 million shares worth about $975 million of Activision as of December 31. Microsoft's plan to buy Activision Blizzard, which is its largest-ever acquisition, was announced in January.

Title: Musk donates $5.7 billion of Tesla shares, one of the biggest to charity in history
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk donated over 5 million shares of Tesla to charity from November 19-29, a regulatory filing has revealed. The shares were worth around $5.7 billion, making it one of the biggest to a charity in history, Bloomberg reported. In October, Musk said he'd donate $6 billion if UN can explain how that would solve world hunger.

Title: Banning cryptocurrency most advisable choice open to India: RBI Deputy Governor
Content: RBI's Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar at a recent event said that banning cryptocurrency is "perhaps the most advisable choice open to India". He added, "We have examined the arguments proffered by those advocating that cryptocurrencies should be regulated and found that none of them stand up to basic scrutiny."

Title: Not justified to say crypto ban will cause losses: RBI's Deputy Governor
Content: RBI's Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar termed the argument that banning cryptocurrencies would lead to a loss of wealth as "not justified". Giving three reasons, he said, "Investors can be provided with a reasonable exit". He added, "Cryptocurrency investors were fully aware of the risks," and "There's no data to justify the amount of investment or number of investors".

Title: Mamaearth's parent company Honasa Consumer acquires BBLUNT
Content: Mamaearth's parent company Honasa Consumer Private Limited has acquired beauty brand BBLUNT. Godrej Consumer Products divested its entire stake in Bhabani Blunt Hair Dressing Private Limited, and the right to use the 'BBLUNT' brand name for products, and said it'll receive a total of ₹84.5 crore from the divestment. BBLUNT's salon business will continue to operate as an independent entity.

Title: Zomato shares dip below IPO price for 1st time since listing in July
Content: Shares of food delivery platform Zomato fell below the issue price of ₹76 for the first time since its listing in July 2021 on Tuesday. The stock hit a low of ₹75.75 during intraday trade on BSE, but recovered some of its losses. Zomato's shares hit an all-time high of ₹169.10 in November and have declined over 50% since then.

Title: Paytm CEO's stake value falls below $1 billion as stock hits new low
Content: The value of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's stake in the company has fallen below $1 billion after the share price dropped to a new record low on Tuesday. Paytm parent One 97 Communications' shares declined 2.7% during intraday trade to ₹840.05 on BSE. The value of Sharma's shares have eroded by over $1.5 billion since its listing in November.

Title: Hiranandani Group to invest ₹3,500 cr in in-house platform Tez
Content: Hiranandani Group plans to invest ₹3,500 crore in its in-house consumer tech platform Tez over the next 2-3 years. The platform will be launching this year at an initial outlay of about ₹1,000 crore. "We have a road map to launch two highly sought-after services in 2022, followed by another three in the next year," Hiranandani CEO said.

Title: Better.com's Zoom layoffs in US added 1,000 employees for the firm in India
Content: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's 900 layoffs, which took place over a Zoom call last year, effectively added 1,000 employees for the firm in India, a regulatory filing showed. The layoffs changed the geographic mix for Better.com, as per Bloomberg. On June 30, Better.com had 3,100 employees in lower-wage India, while on December 31, it had 4,100 employees in India.

Title: No wonder he was so loved: Sonia Gandhi in letter to Rahul Bajaj's son
Content: Congress president Sonia Gandhi condoled Rahul Bajaj's demise in a letter to the late industrialist's son, Rajiv Bajaj. "The name Bajaj stood for quality that one could trust, for fairness and honesty," she wrote. "Your father, in a way, served as a moral compass for the world of Indian industry...No wonder he was so widely admired and loved," she added.

Title: Retail inflation rises to 7-month-high of 6.01% in January 2022
Content: The retail inflation accelerated to a seven-month-high of 6.01% in January 2022, breaching the 6% upper limit of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) tolerance band, government data showed on Monday. The retail inflation was 5.66% in the preceding month of December. Earlier, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that inflation close to 6% should not create any panic.

Title: Tatas appoint Ilker Ayci as CEO and MD of Air India
Content: Former Turkish Airlines Chairman Ilker Ayci has been appointed as the CEO and Managing Director of Air India, a release by Tata Sons said on Monday. This came after the Air India board met to consider Ayci's candidature, the release said, adding, "This appointment is subject to requisite regulatory approvals." Ayci said he's "delighted and honoured" to accept the appointment.

Title: Big B recalls Air India ad from his college days as airline returns to Tata Group
Content: Actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled an old Air India advertisement from his college days after the airline returned to the Tata Group. "I remember the banner ad, in the late 50's on a striking building in Connaught Place, New Delhi, that I'd pass by as I travelled to University," tweeted Bachchan. Quoting the advertisement, he added, "There's an air about India!"

Title: Who is Ilker Ayci, Air India's new MD and CEO?
Content: Tata Sons appointed 51-year-old Ilker Ayci, the Istanbul-born ex-Chairman of Turkish Airlines, as Air India's MD and CEO. He's 1994 alumni of Bilkent University and after a research stay on political science at Leeds University in the UK in 1995, he completed an International Relations Master's program in Istanbul in 1997. Ilker resigned as Turkish Airlines Chairman in January 2022.

Title: Monday's market crash wiped $4 billion off Gautam Adani's fortune
Content: India's second richest person and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani lost nearly $4 billion in net worth on Monday as his group's stocks plunged amid the market crash. His current net worth stands at $82.8 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. No individual in the world lost more money than Adani on February 14, Moneycontrol reported.

Title: Investors lose ₹8.5 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex logs worst fall in 10 months
Content: Investors lost nearly ₹8.5 lakh crore on Monday as the Sensex crashed 1,747 points to close at 56,405. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, fell to ₹255.42 lakh crore from ₹263.90 lakh crore. The Sensex witnessed its worst single-day fall in ten months as the Ukraine crisis triggered a global selloff.

Title: Sensex crashes over 1,700 points to close at 56,405 in worst fall in 10 months
Content: The Sensex fell 1,747 points on Monday to end at 56,405 while the Nifty plunged 531 points to close below the 16,900 level, at 16,842. This is the worst fall that the benchmark indices have seen in 10 months. This comes as fears of a possible invasion of Russia in Ukraine triggered a global selloff.

Title: Affordable vaccines saved over 30 million lives: Cyrus Poonawalla
Content: While speaking at a felicitation ceremony in Pune on Monday, Chairman of the Serum Institute of India (SII) Cyrus Poonawalla said affordable vaccines like those produced by SII have saved more than 30 million lives across the world. "Our vaccines are low cost and of high value, this is the secret of our success," Poonawalla further said.

Title: Vedanta to make semiconductors in India with iPhone maker Foxconn
Content: Vedanta has signed a memorandum of understanding with Taiwan's Foxconn, which is known for making Apple's iPhones, to manufacture semiconductors in India. Foxconn will invest $118.7 million to set up a joint venture company with Vedanta and the latter will be a majority shareholder of the new venture. Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will be the Chairman of the joint venture.

Title: Govt, RBI working in complete harmony on crypto, other issues: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government and the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) are working in complete harmony on all matters including cryptocurrencies. "[We are] respecting each other's domain...There's no turfing here," the Finance Minister added. She further said that the RBI and the Ministry of Finance are onboard and discussions regarding cryptocurrencies are taking place.

Title: Future Retail reports ₹1,063 cr net loss in Q3, 86.85% rise in revenue
Content: Future Retail Limited (FRL) reported consolidated net loss of ₹1,063.36 crore in Q3 FY22 as compared with a net loss of ₹846.92 crore in Q3 FY21. The company's revenue in the October-December 2021 quarter jumped 86.85% YoY from ₹1,506.87 crore to ₹2,815.68 crore. FRL's total expenses rose 62.66% YoY from ₹2,391.43 crore to ₹3,890.02 crore in the reported quarter.

Title: Adani Wilmar's consolidated PAT rises 66% YoY to ₹211.4 cr in Q3
Content: Adani Wilmar reported a 66% YoY rise in its consolidated profit after tax (PAT) to ₹211.4 crore in Q3. The company's revenue from operations grew 40% YoY from ₹10,229 crore in Q3 FY21 to ₹14,378.7 crore. The company's consolidated operating profit grew 35% YoY to ₹1,420 crore and its FMCG segment's sales rose 46% YoY rise to ₹704 crore.

Title: Wholesale Price Index eases to 12.96% in January; food prices rise
Content: Wholesale price-based inflation eased for the second consecutive month in January 2022 at 12.96% even as food prices soared, the government said on Monday. After remaining in double digits since April 2021, Wholesale Price Index in December 2021 stood at 13.56%. Inflation in food articles spiked to 10.33% in January 2022 from 9.56% in December 2021.

Title: Refund amount with interest to Sohna's Hilltown's buyers: NCDRC to Supertech
Content: National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC) directed Supertech to refund entire paid-up amount to home buyers of Hilltown Project in Sohna (Haryana) within six weeks. The refund will include interest at a rate of 9% per annum. The order follows Supertech's failure to pay pre-EMIs since 2018 under its subvention scheme and its failure to deliver the project's possession.

Title: Govt likely to extend COVID-19 loan guarantee scheme for 6 months: Reports
Content: The government is likely to extend the Loan Guarantee Scheme for COVID-19 Affected Sectors (LGSCAS) by another six months, Moneycontrol reported. The ₹50,000 crore scheme has allocated less than 5% of the scheme's funds since 2021. Under the scheme, scheduled commercial banks will provide credit with an interest rate capped at 7.95% per annum for healthcare sector projects.

Title: Kalanithi Maran rejects SpiceJet's ₹600 crore settlement offer
Content: SpiceJet's former promoter Kalanithi Maran and his firm KAL Airways have rejected the airline's one-time settlement offer of ₹600 crore to end the share-transfer dispute between the parties, the Supreme Court was informed on Monday. The settlement offer is not feasible as the total amount owed to Maran is around ₹920 crore, the lawyer representing Maran told the court.

Title: LIC files draft papers with SEBI to seek approval for India's biggest IPO
Content: State-run Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Sunday filed the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) with capital markets regulator SEBI for an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO is expected to be the country's largest public issue. The LIC will offload over 31.62 crore shares of face value ₹10 each, according to the draft prospectus.

Title: We have lost a visionary: Rahul Gandhi on Rahul Bajaj's demise
Content: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi condoled the death of industrialist and former Chairman of Bajaj Group, Rahul Bajaj, on Saturday. "We have lost a visionary whose courage made us proud," he tweeted. Dr Purvez K Grant, Chairman of Ruby Hall Clinic, where Bajaj passed away, said, "He was under treatment for cardiac and lung-related problems for the last one month."

Title: Piyush Goyal shares meme featuring Shark Tank's Anupam Mittal, he replies
Content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has shared a Shark Tank meme featuring Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal to mock the Opposition. The minister informed that India added eight new unicorns in 40 days of 2022 and mocked the Opposition, saying it can't digest it. Reacting to the meme, Mittal tweeted, "Piyush Goyal [It] appears like India is finally very Modivated."

Title: I've made multi-billion dollar businesses, it was possible due to honesty: Ashneer Grover
Content: Speaking on Figuring Out podcast, BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover spoke about his "brutal honesty". "I have to keep myself honest otherwise the market will kill you," he stated. "In the last fours years whatever businesses I've made, these are multi-billion dollar businesses and it was possible because there's some level of honesty with yourself and with...your stakeholders," Ashneer added.

Title: 13-yr-old girl gets ₹50 lakh funding on Shark Tank for her anti-bullying app
Content: A Class 8 girl became the youngest contestant to pitch her entrepreneurial idea for an anti-bullying app at Shark Tank India. A student of Pathways School Gurugram, 13-year-old Anoushka Jolly received funding of ₹50 lakh for her app 'KAVACH', which lets students and parents report incidents of bullying anonymously, thereby allowing concerned authorities to intervene in the matter.

Title: No visits to duty-free, wear minimum jewellery: Air India in new cabin crew advisory
Content: Air India on Sunday issued a new advisory for its cabin crew in a bid to improve the airlines’ performance. The new advisory asked the cabin crew to wear minimum jewellery "to avoid any delays at customs and security checks." It also asked them to not visit duty-free shops and to proceed to the gates after security checks.

Title: Bajrang Dal stage protests, put posters at KFC, Hyundai, Kia showrooms in Guj
Content: Several Bajrang Dal members staged protests at outlets and showrooms of KFC, Pizza Hut, Hyundai and Kia in Gujarat days after their Pakistani distributors' posts on Kashmir. Hundreds of posters reading 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' were also put up at the outlets. "Kashmir, including PoK, is an integral part of India," the posters read.

Title: What is the ₹22,842 cr ABG Shipyard case, biggest bank fraud registered by CBI?
Content: The CBI in its biggest bank fraud case booked Mumbai-based ABG Shipyard, its directors and ex-Chairman Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal for allegedly defrauding 28 banks, including SBI, of ₹22,842 crore. The company's loan account became an NPA in 2013. An E&Y forensic audit report in 2019 identified fraud and attributed it to diversion of funds, misappropriation and criminal breach of trust.

Title: Rahul Bajaj cremated with full state honours, sons Rajiv & Sanjiv perform last rites
Content: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj, the late Chairman Emeritus of Bajaj Auto, was cremated with full state honours in Maharashtra's Pune on Sunday. The last rites of the Padma Bhushan-awardee, who passed away at 83 on Saturday, were performed by his sons Rajiv Bajaj and Sanjiv Bajaj. Rahul Bajaj breathed his last in a Pune hospital on Saturday due to illness.

Title: Spine of Indian business cracks: Harsh Goenka on Rahul Bajaj's demise
Content: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka described the demise of industrialist and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj as the cracking of the "spine" of Indian business. "A close family friend, he was a visionary, straight talking and very respected for his value systems," he said. "He leaves behind the two most capable sons in Indian industry, Rajiv and Sanjiv," Goenka added.

Title: All men die, not all men truly live: Rajiv Bajaj's WhatsApp status after father's demise
Content: Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj, the son of industrialist Rahul Bajaj, paid tribute to his father in a WhatsApp status that read, "All men die, not all men truly live," Moneycontrol reported. Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj passed away at the age of 83 on Saturday. He was cremated with full state honours in Pune on Sunday.

Title: Sensex crashes over 1,400 points, Nifty slips below 17,000
Content: Indian equity benchmark Sensex fell by more than 1,400 points to around 56,732 and the Nifty slipped below the 17,000-mark. All the stocks were in the red zone on the Sensex-30 shares barring TCS. The BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices were also in red. ICICI Bank, SBI, Tata Steel and L&T shares tanked more than 3%.

Title: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna took advice from unknown 'yogi' on key decisions: SEBI
Content: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, who's been fined ₹3 crore for violating securities contract rules, was guided by an unknown Himalayan 'yogi' she had never met, SEBI said. Ramkrishna consulted him for employee appointments, appraisals and shared NSE data with him, SEBI said. She told SEBI he was a "spiritual force that could manifest itself anywhere...didn't have any physical...co-ordinates".

Title: 5G spectrum auction expected to be held in May: Telecom Secretary
Content: Telecom Secretary K Rajaraman told PTI the 5G spectrum auction is expected to be held in May this year. "Telecom Regulatory Authority of India has indicated that they will send it (recommendations on rules regarding the sale process) by March," Rajaraman said. He added that it will take the department two months to start the auction after getting those recommendations.

Title: No e-comm firm has been found guilty of predatory pricing yet: MoS
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has received certain complaints against e-commerce companies alleging predatory pricing but it has not found any company guilty so far, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry, Som Parkash, said. "Imposition of unfair or discriminatory prices...by a dominant enterprise or group is prohibited under provisions of...Competition Act, 2002," he added.

Title: Govt extends police modernisation scheme with ₹26,275 crore outlay
Content: The Union Home Ministry has approved the continuation of the Modernisation of State Police Forces scheme for five years up to 2025-26 with an outlay of ₹26,275 crore. The Ministry said the scheme includes security-related expenditure in Jammu and Kashmir, northeastern states and Maoists-affected areas. The scheme also aims to raise new battalions and develop high-tech forensic labs.

Title: LIC's embedded value set at ₹5.39 lakh crore
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Sunday filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI for an IPO. The draft papers revealed that LIC's embedded value stood at ₹5,39,686 crore as on September 30, 2021. The embedded value of a life insurance company represents the sum of present value of future profits and the net value of assets.

Title: FPIs withdraw net ₹14,935 cr between Feb 1-11, turn sellers for 4th month
Content: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net ₹14,935 crore between February 1 and February 11 and have been net sellers for the fourth consecutive month. As per data from depositories, FPIs took out ₹10,080 crore from equities and ₹4,830 crore from the debt segment. This comes after US retail inflation recorded its biggest rise in 40 years at 7.5%.

Title: Import duty on crude palm oil cut to 5.5% to cool edible oil prices
Content: Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) reduced the effective duty on crude palm oil import from 8.25% to 5.5%. CBIC aims to control cooking oil prices and support domestic processing companies with this move. Effective from Sunday, CBIC has cut agri infra development cess to 5% and extended reduced import duty on crude oils by six months.

Title: Multidimensional approach key to achieve $1 tn exports by 2030: CII
Content: A report by Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) said India needs to adopt a multidimensional approach to take the country's merchandise exports to $1 trillion by 2030. The CII report recommends finalising free trade agreements, attracting global firms and addressing domestic manufacturing issues to achieve the target. It added that India needs to integrate closely with global value chains.

Title: TVS Supply Chain files draft papers to raise funds via IPO
Content: Chennai-based logistics firm TVS Supply Chain Solutions has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the SEBI seeking approval to raise funds through an IPO. The offer comprises a fresh issue of ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of 5.94 crore shares. The company plans to use part of the IPO proceeds to repay some of its debt.

Title: IL&FS group to resolve ₹55,000 crore debt by March 2022
Content: Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services (IL&FS) group would resolve debt of ₹55,000 crore by March 2022, the company's board stated in its affidavit filed before the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT). Led by Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak, the bank's board said the debt would be resolved through asset monetisation, restructuring and insolvency proceeding initiatives.

Title: NSE, its 2 former CEOs fined ₹7 cr by SEBI over lapses in hiring
Content: SEBI has penalised the National Stock Exchange (NSE), its former CEOs Chitra Ramkrishna and Ravi Narain, and two other officials. They allegedly violated the securities contract rules related to the appointment of Anand Subramanian as Group Operating Officer and adviser to the Managing Director. While Ramkrishna was fined ₹3 crore, NSE and Narain were fined ₹2 crore each by SEBI.

Title: Only 5 of 15 MSME technology centres completed since 2015: Govt data
Content: Only 5 out of 15 proposed MSME technology centres (TCs) have been completed in the last seven years, government data showed. The TCs were proposed under the Technology Centre Systems Programme (TCSP) and were due to be completed by 2020-21. Work at five TCs at Bhiwadi (Rajasthan), Pudi (Andhra Pradesh), Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh), Rohtak (Haryana) and Puducherry was completed.

Title: Rahul Bajaj was under treatment for cardiac, lung-related problems: Doctor
Content: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj, who passed away aged 83 on Saturday, was under treatment for cardiac and lung-related problems at Ruby Hall Clinic in Pune for the last one month, the hospital's managing trustee Dr Purvez Grant told ANI. His condition had deteriorated in the last few days, Grant told Indian Express. Bajaj's funeral will be held on Sunday in Maharashtra.

Title: LIC reserves up to 10% of issue size for policyholders in its IPO
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has decided to reserve a maximum of 10% and 5% of its IPO issue size of 31.6 crore shares for policyholders and employees respectively. The quantum of discount on the share price will be announced later. Policyholders who fail to update their PAN details by February 28 will not be eligible for this quota.

Title: SBI expects to recover ₹8,000 cr from written-off accounts in FY22
Content: State Bank of India (SBI) is expecting to recover around ₹8,000 crore from written-off accounts, including from National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) resolved cases, in FY22. During the October-December quarter, SBI recovered ₹1,500 crore while between April-December 2021, it recovered ₹5,600 crore, SBI said. The bank's non-performing assets dropped from 4.9% in Q2 FY22 to 4.5% in Q3 FY22.

Title: Show the world your Kotak Fan Card: Kotak Mahindra Bank
Content: With the arrival of the new season of T20, Kotak Mahindra Bank aims to bring a new way of celebrating cricket through its #KonaKonaCricket campaign. The key objective of the campaign is to encourage cricket fans to show the world how much they love and support their favorite teams through their fan card with Kotak MyTeam Debit and Credit card.

Title: Rahul Bajaj, former Chairman of Bajaj Group, passes away aged 83
Content: Former Chairman of Bajaj Group and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj passed away on Saturday aged 83. "It is with deep sorrow that I inform you about the passing away of Shri Rahul Bajaj, husband of the late Rupa Bajaj and father of Rajiv/Deepa, Sanjiv/Shefali and Sunaina/Manish. He passed away...in the presence of his closest family members," Bajaj Group stated.

Title: IBM execs called older staff 'dinobabies', favoured millennials, emails reveal
Content: IBM executives discussed how to force out older employees and called them "dinobabies" who should be made an "extinct species", Bloomberg reported quoting emails revealed in a court filing. The officials expressed frustration over the company having a much lower share of millennials in its workforce than a competitor. IBM is facing age bias complaints by former employees in US.

Title: I once tried to raise money for BharatPe from Anupam, made a pitch to him twice: Ashneer
Content: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover, speaking on Figuring Out podcast, revealed he knew co-judge Anupam Mittal (Shaadi.com Founder) from back when he was raising investment for BharatPe. "I...once tried to raise money...from him. I got the money from elsewhere, so I never ended up taking his money...I had made a pitch to him not once but twice," said Ashneer.

Title: He was a great conversationalist, pained by his demise: PM on Rahul Bajaj
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday condoled the death of ex-Bajaj Group Chairman Rahul Bajaj and said, "[He] will be remembered for his noteworthy contributions to the world of commerce and industry." He added, "Beyond business, he was passionate about community service and was a great conversationalist. Pained by his demise." Bajaj will be accorded a state funeral in Maharashtra.

Title: Bajaj was a successful entrepreneur, instrumental in the industry: Gadkari
Content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari took to Twitter to express his "heartfelt tributes" to Rahul Bajaj, the former Chairman of Bajaj Auto, who passed away aged 83 on Saturday. Calling Bajaj a "successful entrepreneur, philanthropist", Gadkari said he has had a personal relationship with the Padma Bhushan awardee for many years. "Rahul ji...has been instrumental in the industry," he further wrote.

Title: Deora shares old pic of late Rahul Bajaj, calls him 'most outspoken industrialist'
Content: After former Bajaj Group Chairman Rahul Bajaj's demise, Congress' Milind Deora tweeted an old image of the industrialist and wrote, "Hard to come to grips with the news that India's most outspoken industrialist, Rahul Bajaj is no more." "Many of us knew of Rahul uncle's health was deteriorating but the news of his passing comes as a shock," he added.

Title: Rahul Bajaj's death leaves a void in the world of industry: President Kovind
Content: President Ram Nath Kovind condoled the demise of industrialist and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj and said he was a "doyen of Indian industry". He added, "His career reflected the rise and innate strength of the nation's corporate sector. His death leaves a void in the world of industry." Bajaj's funeral will be held with full state honours in Maharashtra.

Title: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj's funeral to be held with full state honours in Maharashtra
Content: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday announced that former Bajaj Group Chairman and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj's funeral will be held with full state honours. The industrialist died aged 83 on Saturday, with the Bajaj Group stating that he passed away in the presence of his closest family members.

Title: SEBI bars Anil Ambani, others from securities market for 3 months
Content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has barred Anil Ambani and three associates from securities market for alleged siphoning of funds from Reliance Home Finance (RHFL). They have also been restrained from associating with any listed company, stock market intermediary or any public company that intends to raise money.

Title: ABG Shipyard booked for cheating banks of ₹23,000cr in CBI's biggest bank fraud
Content: In the biggest bank fraud case ever registered by the CBI, the agency has booked ABG Shipyard and its former MD Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal among others, for allegedly cheating 28 banks of ₹22,842 crore. As per the complaint filed by the State Bank of India, the company owes ₹2,925 crore to it and ₹7,089 crore to ICICI Bank.

Title: India has lost a great son, nation builder: Mazumdar-Shaw on Bajaj's demise
Content: Condoling the demise of industrialist Rahul Bajaj, Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "I am devastated - he was a dear, dear friend and will miss him dearly." She further wrote, "The country has lost a great son and nation builder." Bajaj, who had resigned as the Chairman of Bajaj Auto last year, passed away aged 83 on Saturday.

Title: Thanks for letting me clamber up onto your broad shoulders: Mahindra on Rahul Bajaj
Content: After industrialist Rahul Bajaj's demise, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "'I stand on the shoulders of giants.' Thank you, Rahulbhai, for letting me clamber up onto your broad shoulders, advising me, cheering me on, encouraging me to be bold." "Your footprints on the sands of Indian Business will never be extinguished," he added.

Title: Ford considering producing electric vehicles in India for export
Content: Ford told Reuters it is exploring the possibility of using a plant in India to produce electric vehicles (EVs) for export. In September 2021, Ford announced it would cease local manufacturing in India, citing an operating loss of $2 billion over the past 10 years. The US-based automaker may also consider selling electric cars in India, its spokesman said.

Title: Dyson accused of profiting from unlawful conditions at supplier firm
Content: Ten former workers of Malaysian firm ATA IMS, Dyson's parts supplier, have claimed Dyson "unjustly" benefitted from "unlawful" and "exploitative" conditions at ATA's factory. "These allegations relate to employees of ATA...If proceedings were to be issued we would robustly defend them," Dyson said. It added that it takes its responsibilities towards workers of suppliers "extremely seriously".

Title: Billionaire Soros buys Amazon-backed EV startup Rivian shares for $2 bn
Content: Billionaire investor George Soros bought nearly 20 million shares of Amazon-backed EV startup Rivian in the December-quarter, filings revealed. The shares were worth about $2 billion at the time. Rivian, which is 20% owned by Amazon, is yet to produce a consumer vehicle. Shares of Rivian fell 9% on Friday and are down 43% for the year to date.

Title: Passenger vehicle wholesales dip 8% in January amid chip shortage
Content: The passenger vehicle dispatches from factories to dealers in India dropped 8% in January, mainly due to chip shortage, auto industry body SIAM said. The total passenger vehicle wholesales dropped to 2,54,287 units in January 2022 as compared to 2,76,554 units in January 2021. Two-wheeler dispatches declined 21% to 11,28,293 units from 14,29,928 units in the year-ago period.

Title: Stellantis recalling 20,000 plug-in minivans for fire risks
Content: Chrysler-parent Stellantis is recalling nearly 20,000 plug-in hybrid minivans and has urged owners to stop recharging them and park them away from structures and other vehicles, after reports of 12 fires in parked vehicles. It will be recalling 16,741 vehicles in the US, 2,317 in Canada and another 750 outside North America. The recall covers 2017-2018 Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid vehicles.

Title: I don't check my house's price every day: CEO on Freshworks share price
Content: Speaking about the decline in Freshworks' share price since its IPO, CEO Girish Mathrubootham told Moneycontrol, "I am not looking at the price of my house every day when I wake up." Stating that "stock market is something that we cannot control", he said, "Markets will go up, markets will go down, and...over the long term, things will automatically self-correct."

Title: India's tea exports decline to 175 mn kg in first 11 months of 2021
Content: India's tea exports came down to 175.38 million kg in the first 11 months of 2021 compared to 189.83 million kg in the corresponding period in 2020, the Tea Board said. The decline in exports is due to shortage of containers, high ocean freight and less offtake by the 'lucrative' Iran market due to payment issues, as per industry experts.

Title: IRCTC to fully resume cooked meals service in trains from Feb 14
Content: IRCTC will resume serving cooked meals on all trains, starting February 14. The services were stopped in March 2020 due to COVID-19 pandemic. In January this year, IRCTC had resumed serving cooked meals in 80% of its trains and is now expanding the resumption across the board. The services are being completely restored amid decline in COVID-19 cases, IRCTC said.

Title: Ruchi Soya to launch ₹4,300-crore FPO in last week of Feb: Report
Content: Ruchi Soya is likely to launch its follow-on public offer (FPO) in the last week of February to raise up to ₹4,300 crore, PTI reported. It had received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an FPO in August last year. Ruchi Soya is launching the FPO to meet SEBI's norm of minimum public shareholding of 25% in a listed entity.

Title: Bank of Baroda to acquire Union Bank's 21% stake in IndiaFirst Life
Content: Bank of Baroda has announced acquisition of a 21% stake of Union Bank of India in IndiaFirst Life Insurance. However, the valuation of the deal was not disclosed by the bank. On completion of the acquisition, BoB will hold a 65% stake in IndiaFirst Life, Union Bank will hold 9% and Carmel Point Investments India will have the remaining 26%.

Title: Walmart allows vaccinated US workers to go mask-free
Content: Walmart on Friday informed its staff that fully vaccinated workers in the United States will no longer be required to wear masks in the company's facilities unless required by a state or local mandate. The company further said, workers who work in clinical care settings or with direct customer contact, will be required to wear masks, regardless of vaccination status.

Title: Noel Tata joins two main Tata trusts as trustee: Reports
Content: Noel Tata has been reportedly inducted as a trustee on the board of Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and Allied Trusts which are the two main Tata Trusts controlling the Tata Sons. The move happened last week as part of the succession planning exercise, The Economic Times reported. Noel stepped down from all executive roles at Tata Group in November 2021.

Title: Rahul Bajaj was a rare businessman who spoke truth to power: Kotak
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak took to Twitter to condole the demise of former Bajaj Auto Chairman Rahul Bajaj and called him "bold and fearless". Kotak wrote, "A rare businessman who spoke truth to power. A proud Indian. Built world-class enterprise." The industrialist is survived by two sons, Rajiv Bajaj and Sanjiv Bajaj, and a daughter Sunaina Kejriwal.

Title: Make December AGM results public  or face action: SEBI to Dish TV
Content: SEBI has asked Dish TV to ''immediately'' disclose the voting results of its December 30 annual general meeting. In its advisory, dated February 9, SEBI said, ''the disclosure has already been delayed by 37 days'' and warned the company that further delay would result in initiation of regulatory action. Dish TV is already fighting a legal battle with Yes Bank.

Title: McDonald's files trademarks for virtual restaurant featuring home delivery
Content: McDonald's has filed trademarks with the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to open a virtual restaurant that will deliver food online and in-person. The filings aim to trademark "operating a virtual restaurant featuring actual and virtual goods" and home delivery. The company has also trademarked providing entertainment services, including "online actual and virtual concerts".

Title: Tesla sued over 'racial segregation' claims at factory by California
Content: Tesla has been sued by California's civil rights regulator after it received complaints from hundreds of workers and "found evidence that Tesla's Fremont factory is a racially segregated workplace". Black workers are subjected to racial slurs, drawings and are assigned the most physically demanding jobs, the regulator said. Tesla earlier said it was expecting the lawsuit and called it "misguided".

Title: Not doing anything to legalise or ban crypto at this stage: FM on 30% tax
Content: Speaking in Rajya Sabha, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that many people asked if the government is legitimising cryptocurrencies after it announced a 30% tax on income from 'virtual digital assets'. "We have taxed the profit emanating from the transactions. I am not doing anything to legalise it or ban it...at this stage," she clarified during a debate on Budget.

Title: Everything is back as normal now: Airtel after brief outage of internet services
Content: Airtel on Friday restored its internet services after it suffered a "brief disruption". "We deeply regret the inconvenience this may have caused you...Everything is back as normal now, as our teams keep working to deliver a seamless experience," Airtel tweeted. Several users across India complained that Airtel's mobile internet and broadband services and Thanks app weren't working.

Title: Binance, led by world's richest crypto billionaire, to invest $200 million in Forbes
Content: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has said that it's making a $200 million strategic investment in the 104-year-old news publisher Forbes. Binance is led by world's richest crypto billionaire, CEO Changpeng Zhao, who has a fortune of $82.6 billion, as per Bloomberg. "Our investment...is to help them build Web3 infrastructure," Zhao said, adding that Forbes' editorial independence is "sacrosanct".

Title: Ambani, Adani should be worshipped as they create jobs: BJP MP
Content: During a parliamentary debate over unemployment, BJP MP and former Union Minister KJ Alphons said, "Be it Reliance, be it Ambani, be it Adani, be it anybody, they must be worshipped. Yes, because they provide jobs." He added that every industrialist who creates money in India creates jobs and they need to be respected.

Title: Zomato shares fall 6% day after it reports loss of ₹63.2 cr in Q3
Content: Zomato shares on Friday fell 6% to around ₹88, a day after it reported a consolidated loss of ₹63.2 crore in the October-December quarter. The firm's consolidated net loss narrowed from a net loss of ₹352.6 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose 82.7% year-on-year from ₹609.4 crore to ₹1,112 crore.

Title: Tata, Hyundai among 20 companies selected by govt for automobile PLI scheme
Content: Centre has released a list of 20 companies approved under 'Champion OEM Incentive Scheme' of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme for automobile and auto component industry. Ashok Leyland Limited, Ford India Private Limited, Hyundai Motor India Limited, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd, Suzuki Motor Gujarat Private Limited, Tata Motors Limited, Bajaj Auto Limited are among the selected applicants.

Title: Amul's ad features Shark Tank's Ashneer & contestant he rejected; Ashneer replies
Content: Amul's latest topical has featured Shark Tank India judges Ashneer Grover and Ghazal Alagh and contestant Niti Singhal who failed to secure an investment after presenting her convertible and reversible clothes. Grover told Singhal on the show, "I don't think anyone will wear this." Responding to Amul's cartoon, which had the catchphrase 'Yeh sabko digest hota hai', Grover said, "Honoured!"

Title: Business won't get affected by allegations, trust the board: BharatPe CEO to staff
Content: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer has told employees in a letter that the allegations against the company won't have any bearing on "medium to long term health of the business". "I would just request all of you to keep your trust on the board of BharatPe," he said. This comes amid tensions between Co-founder Ashneer Grover and BharatPe's board.

Title: Sensodyne, Naaptol asked to discontinue 'misleading' ads; Naaptol fined ₹10 lakh
Content: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has ordered GlaxoSmithKline Consumer Healthcare to discontinue advertisements of Sensodyne toothpaste in India. The ads showing dentists practicing outside India endorsing the products qualify as "misleading", CCPA said. It also asked Naaptol Online Shopping to discontinue misleading ads like 'Magnetic Knee Support' and imposed a ₹10-lakh penalty.

Title: Thums Up becomes a billion-dollar brand in India
Content: Thums Up became a billion-dollar brand in India in 2021, "driven by focussed marketing and execution plans", The Coca-Cola Company Chairman James Quincey said during an earnings call. Launched in 1977 by Ramesh Chauhan of Parle, the brand was acquired by Coca-Cola in 1993. For the full year, Coca-Cola reported 17% growth in net revenue, driven by China and India.

Title: World catches a cold when US sneezes, not this time please: Kotak on 40-yr high inflation
Content: After US' retail inflation hit a 40-year high, billionaire banker Uday Kotak said, "7.5% inflation and 0% interest rates! You'd think it's an emerging market with poor institutional governance. It's the...USA!" "When US sneezes, world catches a cold. Not this time please, Mr USA," Kotak wrote. "In 2013, India paid the price for its taper tantrum," he added.

Title: Very happy Chandrasekaran's tenure has been extended, he deserves it: Murthy
Content: Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy said he is "very happy" that N Chandrasekaran has been reappointed as the Executive Chairman of Tata Sons for another five years. "Chandrasekaran is a highly respected and successful corporate leader in India. His tenure at both TCS and Tata Sons has been very lustrous...He richly deserves it," Narayana Murthy told Moneycontrol in an email.

Title: Twitter users share memes after US' inflation hits a 40-year high
Content: After US' retail inflation hit a 40-year high, Twitter users shared memes and jokes about it. US Representative Lee Zeldin wrote, "Last time inflation was this high I was 2 years old...learning how to do my first sit-up." One user shared a meme calling US senators "professional looters". US President Joe Biden said, "We'll make it through this challenge."

Title: Tata Sons re-appoints N Chandrasekaran as Chairman for another 5 years
Content: Tata Sons' board has unanimously approved the reappointment of N Chandrasekaran as Executive Chairman for another five years. The company's Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata expressed his satisfaction on the progress of Tata Group under Chandrasekaran's leadership and recommended his term be renewed. "I'm delighted at the opportunity to lead Tata Group for another five years," Chandrasekaran said.

Title: I've tried to convince Tesla India head to set up plant in India: Gadkari
Content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari told News18 that he had an interaction with Tesla's India head a few days back and tried to convince him to set up a plant in the country. "Tesla is welcome in India, we don't have any problem...We have all ancillaries available, you can get quality production...good sales here...If you start here, you're welcome," Gadkari said.

Title: India's internet economy likely to reach $1 trillion by 2030: Report
Content: India's internet economy is surging by over 50% year over year and may reach $1 trillion by 2030, a report by consulting firm RedSeer said. The internet economy includes sectors like e-tailing, e-health, food tech, online mobility and quick commerce. ''In just 2021, more than $40 billion of funding and 42 new unicorns were born,'' RedSeer CEO Anil Kumar said.

Title: 44 unicorns added between 2020 & 2021 showcase India's innovation: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Thursday that 44 unicorns have been identified in India between 2020 and 2021. "They have created wealth. They showcase India's talent and innovation," Sitharaman said while replying on the Union Budget 2022 in the Lok Sabha. As of January 14, 2022, India had 83 unicorns, with a total valuation of $277.77 billion.

Title: Freshworks reports 44% rise in total revenue at $105 mn in Q4
Content: US-headquartered software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Freshworks said its total revenue surged 44% for the quarter ended December 31 to touch $105.5 million. It reported a loss of $56.4 million, from $3.4 million loss it reported in the year-ago period. Freshworks said it expects total revenue of $107.0 million-$109.0 million for the first quarter of 2022.

Title: PB Fintech Founders to reduce 2.4% stake via $140-mn block deal
Content: PB Fintech Founders Yashish Dahiya and Alok Bansal will be selling shares worth 2.4% of their stake in a block deal worth $130-140 million, filings revealed. Dahiya will be selling up to 70 lakh shares, while Bansal will sell 38.9 lakh shares. The founders' cumulative stake will reduce to 8.01% on a fully diluted basis from 10.33% currently.

Title: Gautam Adani's son meets CM Mamata, discusses investment plans: Report
Content: Billionaire Gautam Adani's son Karan Adani met West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and discussed possible investments in the state, a top government official told PTI. The development comes two months before West Bengal's annual global business summit. The duo reportedly had discussions regarding the construction of the proposed deep-sea port at Tajpur. In December, Gautam Adani had also met Banerjee.

Title: Swiggy's net operating revenue drops 26.5% YoY to ₹2,547 cr in FY21
Content: Swiggy's parent company Bundl Technologies reported a 26.5% YoY drop in its net operating revenue from ₹3,468 crore in FY20 to ₹2,547 crore in FY21. The company reported a net loss of ₹1,314 crore in FY21, a 65% YoY decrease, while its total expenses stood at ₹3,310 crore. Swiggy's employee benefit expense stood at ₹935 crore.

Title: Investor Ruchir Sharma joins Rockefeller Capital as Chairman
Content: US-based financial advisory firm Rockefeller Capital Management has roped in Indian investor Ruchir Sharma as the Chairman of its international business. Sharma, who is Morgan Stanley Investment Management's former Chief Global Strategist, will act as an advisor to the firm. He will also form an investment company, Breakout Capital, in partnership with Rockefeller, CEO Gregory Fleming said.

Title: India's industrial output growth falls to 10-month low in December
Content: India's industrial production growth fell to a 10-month low of 0.4% in December 2021, according to data released by the government on Friday. The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) rose 0.4% in December 2021 as compared to an increase of 1.3% in November. As per use-based classification, capital, consumer durables and consumer non-durables saw their output shrink in December 2021.

Title: Sensex falls 773 points to close at 58,153; Nifty ends below 17,400
Content: The Sensex fell over 773 points on Friday to close at 58,153, while the Nifty 50 slumped 231 points to end at 17,375. The Indian benchmark indices fell amid weak global cues, after US' 40-year-high inflation fuelled fears of aggressive rate hikes. Grasim Industries, Tech Mahindra, Infosys, HCL Technologies and UPL were the top Nifty laggards.

Title: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions fixes issue price at ₹866/share for IPO
Content: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions has fixed the issue price at ₹866 per share which is also the upper end of the price band of its IPO. The price band was ₹824-₹866 per share. The company fetched ₹3,149.19 crore through its IPO by receiving bids for over 6.53 crore shares against the total issue size of over 2.54 crore shares.

Title: Indian crypto exchange CoinDCX crosses 1 crore-user mark
Content: India's first crypto unicorn, CoinDCX which claims to be the nation's safest crypto exchange, announced that it now has 1 crore+ users. The brand states that this milestone follows CoinDCX's growth since its inception, adding that, this is a firm step towards the company's vision to provide safe, secure, and easy access to digital assets to 5 crore Indian users.

Title: Why worry? Make it an NFT: Mahindra as bored guard draws eyes on painting worth crores
Content: After a 'bored' security guard drew eyes on a painting insured for ₹7.4 crore in Russia, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra reacted to the news article by saying, "Why worry? Just convert the new 'creation' into an NFT!" Anna Leporskaya's Three Figures was painted between 1932 and 1934 and was part of an abstract art exhibition.

Title: Crypto is a threat to financial stability; value not even a tulip: RBI Governor
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das cautioned cryptocurrency investors by saying, "Keep in mind that...cryptocurrencies have no underlying (value). Not even a tulip." They're a threat to our "macroeconomic and financial stability", he added. Notably, the 'tulip mania' of 17th century is cited as an example of a financial bubble, where the price of something rises rapidly, outpacing its true value.

Title: Digital rupee will be exactly like normal rupee, except it'll be on phone: RBI
Content: RBI Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar explained that digital rupee, which will be launched in 2022-23, will be "exactly like normal rupee". "It will be 1-to-1 convertible...Like normal rupee is kept in your purse or pocket, the digital rupee will be...in your cellphone device," he said. Governor Shaktikanta Das said RBI can't give a timeline on its release yet.

Title: Ratan Tata gets custom-made electric Nano car; pic surfaces
Content: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has received a custom-built electric Nano from Electra EV. Founded by Ratan Tata himself, Electra EV offers EV powertrain solutions to Tata Motors and various other automakers. "It is a moment of truth for team Electra EV when our Founder takes a ride in the custom-built 72V Nano EV," Electra EV wrote on LinkedIn.

Title: RBI Governor Das quotes Lata Mangeshkar's song 'Aaj Phir Jeene Ki Tamanna Hai' in speech
Content: During the first Monetary Policy Committee address of 2022, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das quoted late singer Lata Mangeshkar's song 'Aaj Phir Jeene Ki Tamanna Hai'. "Together with the spirit behind the next line of this...song, she conveyed an eternal message of optimism," he said. Das stated it while talking about how COVID-19 pandemic has taught us to not lose optimism.

Title: Retail inflation projected at 4.5% in 2022-23: RBI
Content: The RBI on Thursday retained its estimate for retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), for 2021-22 at 5.3% and projected inflation for 2022-23 at 4.5%. The RBI expects retail inflation to be at 4.9% in the first quarter of 2022-23, 5% in the second, 4% in the third and 4.2% in the fourth.

Title: Cap on e-RUPI payment voucher hiked to ₹1 lakh, can be used more than once
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has announced that the cap on e-RUPI, which is a prepaid digital voucher, will be enhanced from ₹10,000 to ₹1 lakh. The vouchers, issued by the Centre or state governments, will be allowed for use more than once, until the balance is fully used. This will further facilitate delivery of government schemes to beneficiaries, Das said.

Title: What are the key takeaways from RBI's Monetary Policy announcement?
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das announced that the Monetary Policy Committee is keeping repo rate and reverse repo rate unchanged at 4% and 3.35%, respectively. The MPC projected GDP growth for 2022-23 at 7.8% and retail inflation at 4.5%. RBI hiked cap on e-RUPI voucher to ₹1 lakh and extended on-tap liquidity scheme for healthcare, contact intensive sector till June 30.

Title: Pic shows India's first pilot's licence earned by JRD Tata in 1929
Content: A post shared by Tata Group shows India's first pilot's licence earned by JRD Tata. "On February 10, 1929, JRD 'Jeh' Tata earned the first commercial aviator's certificate in India...setting...stage for the...dream of giving wings to the nation," the post read. "Jeh not only set up India's first airline...but also went on to pilot its inaugural flight," it said.

Title: Quess Corp shares tank 11% after report says CEO Suraj Moraje may step down
Content: Shares of India's largest staffing firm Quess Corp tanked over 11% during intraday trade on Thursday after a report said that CEO Suraj Moraje will likely step down. Moraje's exit is likely due to differences in strategy between him and Quess promoter Ajit Isaac, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. He was appointed the group's CEO in November 2019.

Title: LIC likely to file papers for India's biggest-ever IPO tomorrow: Report
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India is reportedly expected to file its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with market regulator SEBI on February 11 (tomorrow). The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority (IRDAI) cleared the LIC IPO proposal in a board meeting on February 9,  CNBC-TV18 reported citing sources. LIC's IPO is likely to be India's largest-ever public issue.

Title: Kerala businessman gifts Mercedes-Benz to employee of 22 years, says 'we're partners'
Content: A Kerala businessman, who owns the digital retail store MyG, gifted a Mercedes-Benz GLA 220D to the company's chief business development officer, who's been working with him for 22 years. "We're partners, he [CR Anish] isn't an employee. I'm very happy. It's a proud moment," AK Shaji said. "Hope you loved your new cruising partner," the businessman wrote on Instagram.

Title: Adani Wilmar shares jump 65% over its IPO price in 3 days
Content: Adani Wilmar, which became the seventh Adani Group company to be listed, is now among the top 100 most-valuable publicly traded firms in India, Moneycontrol reported. Its shares have surged more than 65% over its IPO price of ₹230 apiece in three sessions, taking its market value to nearly ₹50,000 crore. On Thursday, the stock hit a 20% upper circuit.

Title: What does RBI Governor's 'not even a tulip' remark on cryptocurrencies mean?
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "Cryptocurrencies don't have any underlying, not even a tulip." He referred to the 'tulip mania' of 17th century in Holland, a speculative market bubble followed by a subsequent crash. Speculation drove the price of tulips to all-time-highs, around $750,000 at its peak in today's value, before the demand suddenly ended and prices hit staggering lows.

Title: Reliance Industries to invest ₹50 crore in EV tech firm Altigreen
Content: Reliance Industries (RIL) on Thursday announced that it will invest ₹50.16 crore in Bengaluru-based Altigreen Propulsion Labs. However, RIL did not disclose the percentage of equity to be acquired. Incorporated on February 8, 2013, Altigreen provides electric vehicle technology and solutions for commercial last-mile transportation. It had a turnover of ₹103.82 lakh in 2020-21.

Title: Focused on building sustainable business: Nykaa Founder after Q3 profit slump
Content: As shares of Nykaa fell by 7.5% on Thursday, Founder and CEO Falguni Nayar said that she's focused on building a long-term sustainable business with an eye on profitability. Nykaa is "investing for the future" and has seen an increase in user base, she added. On Wednesday, Nykaa reported a 59.5% decline in its net profit for the October-December quarter.

Title: Zomato reports loss of ₹63.2 cr in Q3, revenue up 83% to ₹1,112 cr
Content: Zomato on Thursday reported a consolidated loss of ₹63.2 crore in the October-December quarter. Its revenue from operations rose 82.7% YoY from ₹609.4 crore in Q3 FY21 to ₹1,112 crore in Q3 FY22. Zomato reported that its gross order value grew 84.5% YoY and 1.7% QoQ to ₹5,500 crore while the number of orders it received grew 93% YoY.

Title: Phoenix Mills to open 5 malls by 2025 at a cost of ₹5,300 crore
Content: Retail mall developer Phoenix Mills (PML) is planning to open an additional five malls with around 6 million square feet of retail space at a cost of around ₹5,300 crore, MD Shishir Shrivastava said. Mall of Asia in Bengaluru, which will have around 1.2 million square feet of retail space, will be among the largest malls in India, Shrivastava added.

Title: SC gives last chance to Mallya to defend in contempt case on Feb 24
Content: The Supreme Court on Thursday adjourned a contempt case against fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya for February 24, while granting him the last opportunity to appear before it personally or through counsel. The court said if Mallya fails to do so, it will take the case to a logical conclusion. The court had sought his presence before it on various occasions.

Title: RBI extends on-tap liquidity scheme for contact intensive sectors till June 30
Content: The RBI has extended the on-tap liquidity facilities of ₹50,000 crore and ₹15,000 crore for emergency health services and contact intensive service sectors, respectively, from March 31 till June 30. This has been done on account of "continued uncertainties brought on by the third wave", RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said. Banks get certain incentives for lending under the two schemes.

Title: Supertech's twin tower in Noida to be demolished by May 22
Content: The Supertech's 40-storey twin towers located in Noida Sector 93A will be demolished by May 22 in accordance with the Supreme Court orders, said Noida authority officials. A final road map for the process was readied on Wednesday and almost all NOCs have been issued except from the police, the officials added. Edifice Engineering will carry out the demolition process.

Title: RIL completes acquisition of 40% stake in Sterling & Wilson Renewable
Content: Reliance Industries (RIL) has completed the acquisition of a 40% stake in Shapoorji Pallonji Group's Sterling & Wilson Renewable Energy (SWREL) for ₹2,845 crore, the company said. In October 2021, Reliance had announced two acquisitions, one was to buy Norway's REC Solar Holdings for $771 million and the other was for 40% stake in SWREL in a multi-stage transaction.

Title: Mahindra and Mahindra reports 155% YoY rise in net profit to ₹1,353 cr in Q3
Content: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) on Thursday reported a 154.88% YoY rise in its standalone net profit from ₹530.86 crore in Q3 FY21 to ₹1,353.07 crore in Q3 FY22. The company's revenue from operations in the October-December quarter stood at ₹15,238.82 crore, marking an 8.41% YoY rise from ₹14,056.54 crore. M&M's consolidated profit rose 57% YoY to ₹1,987 crore in Q3.

Title: Govt likely to sell 5% stake, not issue fresh stock in LIC's IPO: Reports
Content: The government is considering selling about 5% stake in Life Insurance Corporation of India's (LIC) IPO, Bloomberg Quint reported. The government plans to offer 316 million shares of the 6.32 billion shares it owns in LIC and the company is unlikely to issue fresh stock. LIC's embedded value is estimated to be about ₹5 trillion.

Title: RBI to hike VRR cap for foreign investors to ₹2.5 lakh cr from April 1
Content: The RBI will hike the limit for investments under Voluntary Retention Route to ₹2.5 lakh crore from ₹1.5 lakh crore from April 1. "This'll provide access to additional sources of capital for the domestic debt market including g-secs," Governor Shaktikanta Das said. The scheme was introduced in March 2019 to facilitate long-term investment by foreign portfolio investors in debt securities.

Title: US retail inflation increases 7.5% YoY, biggest rise in 40 years
Content: Retail inflation in the United States rose 7.5%, the biggest YoY rise since February 1982, the US Labour Department reported on Thursday. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased 0.6% in both December and January after increasing 0.7% in November and 0.9% in October. Increase in the indices for food, electricity, and shelter were the largest contributors to CPI's overall increase.

Title: Huge boost for the logistics sector: Windmill Capital
Content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman stated that PM Gati Shakti is driven by roads, railways, airports, ports, mass transport, waterways, and logistics infrastructure. This lays focus on improving logistics and pushing economic growth, said Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd (a SEBI-registered research analyst- INH200007645). WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases on themes like logistics, transport, and more.

Title: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 4% for 10th time in a row
Content: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Thursday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% for the 10th consecutive time. The reverse repo rate also remains unchanged at 3.35%. The reverse repo rate is the rate at which RBI borrows money from banks. "Accommodative stance" will continue as long as needed, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said.

Title: Glenmark launches anti-COVID-19 nasal spray that cuts 99% viral load in 48 hours
Content: Glenmark Pharma, in partnership with Canada-based SaNOtize, has launched a nitric oxide nasal spray called FabiSpray in India for treating COVID-19 in adult patients who have high risk of progression of disease. The spray, used in the upper airways, reduced viral load of 94% in 24 hours and 99% in 48 hours during Phase 3 trial in India, Glenmark said.

Title: Bill Gates writes a book on how to make COVID-19 the last pandemic
Content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has written a book titled 'How to Prevent the Next Pandemic'. "I believe COVID-19 can be the last pandemic and my book explains why," Gates said. "Every time I read about the latest death toll or hear about someone who lost their job...I can't help but think: We don't have to do this again," he added.

Title: $3.6 bn in stolen Bitcoin seized in US' biggest-ever financial seizure, couple arrested
Content: The US Department of Justice seized over $3.6 billion in stolen Bitcoin in its largest financial seizure ever and arrested a couple in relation to it. The husband-wife allegedly conspired to launder cryptocurrency stolen during the 2016 hack of Bitfinex, a virtual currency exchange, presently valued at $4.5 billion. A hacker attacked Bitfinex and initiated over 2,000 unauthorised transactions.

Title: 'Empire' of fake Gucci, Chanel, LV items being run on Facebook, Instagram: Research
Content: Meta is struggling to stop a "burgeoning empire" of counterfeiters pushing fake luxury goods impersonating brands like Gucci, Chanel, Dior & Louis Vuitton across Facebook and Instagram, a research found. About 65% of accounts selling fake items were China-based. Counterfeiters took advantage of WhatsApp's product catalogues feature available via app's 'business profile' to market such products.

Title: Joe Biden acknowledges Tesla as 'US' largest electric vehicle maker'; Musk responds
Content: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday acknowledged Tesla as the country's "largest electric vehicle manufacturer", days after Elon Musk called him a "damp sock puppet in human form" for ignoring Tesla. A Twitter user said over 58,000 people signed a petition to ask Biden to "acknowledge Tesla's EV leadership". Responding to this, the billionaire said, "Thanks, this made a difference!"

Title: 25-yr-old employee's death sparks overwork, '996' work culture debate in China
Content: A 25-year-old content moderator working for Chinese video site Bilibili died from cerebral haemorrhage, sparking the debate on China's '996' work culture, where employees work from 9 am-9 pm, six days a week. The employee's death prompted accusations that Bilibili was overworking its staff. Bilibili denied the employee died from overwork, but said it would hire 1,000 new content moderators.

Title: Hyundai, Kia recall 484,000 cars over fire risk, ask owners in US to park outside
Content: Hyundai and its affiliate Kia have issued recalls for over 484,000 vehicles in the US over a potential fire risk in the engines and advised owners to park their cars outdoors and away from buildings. The companies said that an electrical component in their anti-lock brake systems could short circuit and cause a fire, even if the vehicles aren't running.

Title: I understand, my firstborn died in my arms: Musk told father of Tesla crash victim
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk emailed the father of a teen who died in a 2018 Tesla crash for weeks, court records show. Tesla CEO had asked James Riley if he'd like to talk, to which Riley said, "There's nothing worse than losing a child." "I understand...My firstborn son died in my arms. I felt his last heartbeat," Musk responded.

Title: Any hurt caused is regretted: Honda apologises on Pak dealer's post on Kashmir
Content: Honda Motor Company issued a statement over a social media post by the company's dealer in Pakistan that expressed solidarity with Kashmiri separatists. "Honda is...committed towards ensuring compliance with laws and sentiments of every country it operates in. Any hurt caused to this effect is regretted," it said. Kia India, Toyota, Suzuki and Hyundai also apologised for posts on Kashmir.

Title: India's real GDP growth projected at 7.8% in 2022-23: RBI
Content: While announcing the RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das projected India's GDP growth at 7.8% in 2022-23. India is expected to grow at 17.2% in the first quarter, 7% in the second quarter, 4.3% in the third and 4.5% in the fourth, he said. Real GDP growth at 9.2% for 2021-22 is modestly above growth level of 2019-20, Das added.

Title: Government has no business to do business: PM Narendra Modi
Content: PM Narendra Modi in an interview with ANI said, "Government has no business to do business." He explained, "Its job is to think about food for the poor, make houses and toilets, get them clean drinking water, make health facilities available to them, make roads, and think about small farmers." He added, "If somebody calls this socialism, I accept it."

Title: Taxpayers can update income tax returns only once in an assessment year: CBDT
