Content: A taxpayer would be permitted to file only one updated return for an assessment year, CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said on Wednesday. He said the intent of the provision is to help people who have genuinely missed out on filing their returns. Budget 2022-23 permitted taxpayers to update their returns within two years of filing, subject to payment of taxes.

Title: India gets $339.55 billion FDI in the last 5 years, govt shares year-wise details
Content: During the last five financial years, Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) inflows worth $339.55 billion have been reported into India, the government said on Wednesday. "FDI inflows have shown a continuous increase from $45.15 billion in 2014-15 to $81.97 billion in 2020-21," it added. The government also mentioned investor-friendly policies allowing 100% FDI in most sectors under the Automatic route.

Title: Mukesh Ambani overtakes Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest person again
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has become Asia's richest person again, a day after Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth surpassed his, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. As of Tuesday, Ambani's net worth stood at $89.2 billion, while that of Adani's fell to $86.3 billion. Adani has gained $9.8 billion so far this year, Bloomberg data showed.

Title: Why has a Chinese city's lockdown sent aluminium prices to 14-year high?
Content: The COVID-19 lockdown in China's Baise city sent global prices of aluminium to a 14-year high. Baise was locked down on Monday after mass testing identified nearly 100 people with COVID-19. Nicknamed the "aluminium capital of southern China", Baise produces about 2.2 million tonnes of aluminium per year, but the production was impacted due to travel restrictions hindering logistics flows.

Title: Nykaa reports 59.5% YoY fall in net profits to ₹27.9 crore in Q3
Content: Nykaa on Wednesday reported a 59.5% YoY decline in its net profits to ₹27.9 crore in the October-December quarter against ₹69 crore in Q3 FY21. The e-commerce company's consolidated revenue from operations jumped 36% YoY to ₹1,098.4 crore in the reported quarter. Nykaa's employee costs jumped 56% YoY while finance costs in the quarter increased 71.5% YoY.

Title: Fitness company Peloton offers 1-yr membership to fired employees
Content: Home fitness company Peloton on Tuesday announced it is firing 2,800 employees and as part of the severance package, it will be offering a complimentary Peloton membership to impacted team members for the next year. Peloton will also offer a "meaningful cash severance" based on job level and tenure, extended healthcare coverage and equity vesting periods, alongside other benefits.

Title: Manyavar owner's IPO subscribed 2.57 times on final day
Content: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions' IPO, which opened for subscription on February 4, got subscribed 2.57 times on its final day, BSE data showed. The IPO received bids for over 6.53 crore shares against the total issue size of over 2.54 crore shares. Its retail portion was subscribed 0.39 times. The company had raised nearly ₹945 crore from anchor investors.

Title: Sensex ends 657 points higher, Nifty at 17,463 ahead of RBI monetary policy
Content: The Sensex closed 657 points higher at 58,466, while the Nifty 50 index ended 197 points higher at 17,463 on Wednesday, a day before RBI's monetary policy announcement. Both the indices extended gains for the second consecutive session. The gains were led by automobile and banking stocks. Coal India, Maruti Suzuki India, Indian Oil and Hindalco were among top gainers.

Title: Over 71 lakh people enrolled under Atal Pension Yojana: Govt
Content: The government-administered Atal Pension Yojana (APY) subscribers have reached over 71 lakh as of January 24, 2022, during 2021-22, MoS Finance Bhagwat Karad informed Parliament on Tuesday. The Atal Pension Yojana was launched in May 2015 with the objective of creating a universal social security system for all Indians. In FY20, there were over 68 lakh APY subscribers.

Title: SIPs in mutual fund industry cross 5 crore mark for 1st time in Jan
Content: Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) in the mutual fund industry crossed the five crore mark for the first time in January this year. The industry added 14 lakh new SIPs in January, according to Association of Mutual Funds in India's data. The contribution of SIPs to the mutual fund industry in January stood at ₹11,516 crore.

Title: Open to some tinkering in capital gains tax regime: Revenue Secy
Content: Addressing a CII event, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said, the current capital gains tax structure is "too complicated" in terms of varied rates and period of holding across the assets. "We need to rework the capital gains structure for rates, holding period. We would be open to some tinkering in it the next time we get an opportunity," Bajaj added.

Title: Adani Wilmar shares surge 20% a day after its market debut
Content: Shares of newly listed Adani Wilmar extended gains for the second session, surging 20% to hit its upper circuit on Wednesday. The stock closed at ₹321.90 on NSE and ₹318.20 on BSE. The FMCG company's stock made a subdued debut on Tuesday by listing at a discount of 4% over its IPO issue price, but closed around 16% higher.

Title: DB Realty to issue 50 mn convertible warrants to Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, others
Content: Real estate company DB Realty has said that it will issue 50 million convertible warrants to non-promoter investors such as Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's RARE Enterprises, Rekha Jhunjhunwala, KIFS Dealers and others. The stock hit a 5% upper circuit on Wednesday after the news. The preferential issue comes days after Godrej Properties withdrew its proposed investment of ₹400 crore for 10% stake.

Title: mCaffeine reveals its Valentine’s campaign with premium coffee gift sets
Content: Caffeinated personal care brand mCaffeine unveiled its range of gift kits and urged its users to celebrate Valentine's with a fresh spin. These kits are gender-neutral with a blend of 100% natural and vegan ingredients, mCaffeine said, adding that customers can get these at flat 20% off for limited time. Users can head to the website to avail this offer.

Title: Tesla cannot have a market in India but jobs in China: Govt
Content: Minister of Heavy Industries Krishan Pal Gurjar said there cannot be a situation where Tesla has a market in India but jobs are created in China. Stating that Tesla is yet to apply for schemes in India, he told the Lok Sabha, "Our policy is if a company wants to use Indian market, it has to provide jobs to Indians."

Title: Amazon more than doubles maximum base salary to $350,000 from $160,000 in US
Content: Amazon is more than doubling the maximum base salary for its US-based technology and corporate employees to $350,000 from $160,000, according to a leaked internal memo seen by Bloomberg. "This past year has seen a particularly competitive labour market," the memo said. Amazon also said it was increasing overall compensation ranges for most jobs globally.

Title: Comfortable but damaging in long run: CRED Founder Kunal Shah on work from home
Content: CRED Founder Kunal Shah has said that work from home is comfortable but damaging in the long run. Shah tweeted, "Impact of WFH on youth is the same as impact of children who study at home." He added, "No real bonds. No real social or network skills. Illusion of understanding and learning. No osmosis."

Title: Peloton's CEO John Foley to step down, company to cut 2,800 jobs
Content: Peloton's Co-founder John Foley is stepping down as CEO after leading the company since its inception, the US-based home fitness company told The Wall Street Journal. Barry McCarthy, former Chief Financial Officer of Spotify and Netflix, will become CEO as Foley will transition to Executive Chair. Peloton said it will cut roughly 2,800 jobs, affecting 20% of its corporate positions.

Title: Regret hurt to sentiments: Suzuki Motor Corp on Pak dealerships' posts on Kashmir
Content: Suzuki Motor Corporation issued a statement saying that it "deeply regrets the hurt to sentiments" caused by "insensitive communication" in the social media posts made by the company's dealers in Pakistan. The posts in question had expressed solidarity with Kashmiri separatists. "We don't align with any political or religious inclination in any part of the world," Suzuki Motor Corporation said.

Title: Be more forceful in your apology: Govt to Hyundai after Pak distributor's Kashmir tweet
Content: Amid controversy over a tweet by Hyundai's Pakistani partner on Kashmir, Union Minister Piyush Goyal informed the Parliament that government has asked the company to be "more forceful in their unequivocal apology" on this issue. "This issue has been taken up both with the government there and the company concerned," he added. Several Indian Twitter users called for Hyundai's boycott.

Title: S Korean Minister calls Jaishankar over Pak Hyundai tweet, says 'We regret the offence'
Content: After controversy over Hyundai Pakistan's social media posts on Kashmir, South Korean Foreign Minister Chung Eui-yong called up External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and said the country regretted the offence caused to the people and Government of India. MEA said, "It's...expected that such companies or their affiliates will refrain from false and misleading comments on...territorial integrity.

Title: Govt's 'strong displeasure' on Hyundai Pak post expressed to S Korean ambassador: MEA
Content: The MEA on Monday summoned the South Korean ambassador and expressed the government's "strong displeasure" over the "unacceptable" social media post by Hyundai Pakistan. MEA highlighted the matter concerned India's territorial integrity on which there could be no compromise. South Korean automaker Hyundai's Pakistan distributor expressed solidarity with Kashmiri separatists in a now-deleted post.

Title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani gets richer than Ambani?
Content: Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $235 billion wealth according to Bloomberg, followed by Jeff Bezos, Bernard Arnault, Bill Gates and Google Co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin. Warren Buffett is the world's 7th richest person, followed by Steve Ballmer and Larry Ellison. Gautam Adani, with $88.5 billion wealth, surpassed Mukesh Ambani as the world's 10th richest person.

Title: Domino's India apologises for Domino's Pakistan's posts on Kashmir; issues statement
Content: Domino's India on Tuesday issued an apology after Domino's Pakistan's social media posts expressing solidarity with Kashmiri separatists surfaced on social media and raised boycott calls for the brand in India. "We regret and apologise for the unsolicited social media post published on Domino's social media handles outside the country," Domino's India said.

Title: Gautam Adani overtakes Mukesh Ambani as Asia's richest person
Content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani surpassed Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani to become Asia's richest person after his net worth reached $88.5 billion on Monday, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Mukesh Ambani's net worth stands at $87.9 billion, as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani is the world's biggest wealth-gainer of 2022 so far.

Title: Bharti Airtel's board approves raising up to ₹7,500 crore in debt
Content: Bharti Airtel's board has granted approval to raise up to ₹7,500 crore in debt, the company said in an exchange filing. The amount can be raised through the issuance of listed or unlisted non-convertible debt securities, including debentures and bonds, in one or more tranches. Bharti Airtel's net profit fell by 2.8% year-on-year to ₹830 crore in the third quarter.

Title: Crypto industry seeks revision of 30% tax on crypto transactions
Content: India's cryptocurrency industry seeks to appeal to the Centre to revise the 30% tax on crypto transactions announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. The proposal is being headed by the Blockchain and Crypto Assets Council. WazirX Founder Nischal Shetty also endorsed an online petition on the same lines started by crypto education portal Crypto India's Co-founder Aditya Singh.

Title: Peloton shares jump after its CEO John Foley steps down
Content: Shares of Peloton jumped more than 28% on Tuesday after the home fitness company said that its Co-founder John Foley will step down as CEO. Foley will be replaced by Barry McCarthy, the former Chief Financial Officer of Spotify and Netflix. The company also announced that it plans to cut 2,800 jobs which would affect 20% of its corporate workforce.

Title: Volvo Cars to invest $1.1 bn in Swedish plant to expand EVs production
Content: In a move to expand production of fully electric cars, Volvo Cars will invest 10 billion crowns ($1.1 billion) in its Torslanda manufacturing plant in Sweden in the next few years, the company said on Tuesday. Last week, Volvo and battery maker Northvolt announced to build a joint battery plant in Gothenburg with an investment of 30 billion crowns.

Title: India tops fintech investments in Asia-Pacific region with $5.94 bn in 2021
Content: India continued to lead fintech investments in the Asia-Pacific region with $5.94 billion raised across 236 deals in 2021, according to S&P Global Market Intelligence report. India also topped the list in 2020, with $1.50 billion raised across 118 deals. Venture capital investments in Asian fintech companies surged to a record high of $15.69 billion in 2021, the report added.

Title: IRCTC profit jumps 167% YoY to ₹209 crore in Q3
Content: IRCTC on Tuesday reported a 167.41% year-on-year (YoY) rise in the October-December quarter with the net profit rising to ₹208.80 crore from ₹158.57 crore reported in September 2021 quarter. The revenue from operations jumped by 141% to ₹540.21 crore compared to ₹224.37 crore posted in the same period last fiscal. Internet ticketing segment contributed 58% to the revenue.

Title: Reserve Bank of India may hike reverse repo rate to 3.55%: Poll
Content: A Reuters poll of economists forecast suggests that the RBI will raise the reverse repo rate to 3.55% from 3.35%, narrowing the gap between the repo rate to 45 bps. As per the poll, the repo rate is expected to go up by 25 bps in April. Reverse repo rate is the rate at which central bank borrows from banks.

Title: Govt cancels ₹24,000 cr bond auction citing cash position
Content: The government said that auction of all securities scheduled for February 11 has been cancelled, following review of its cash position. According to RBI's schedule, the government had planned to raise ₹24,000 crore in the auction. The decision comes after the benchmark 10-year bond yields surged to 6.87% on Friday, before rising to as high as 6.95% in the session.

Title: German MNC Bosch to set up facility in Hyd & employ 3,000 people: KTR
Content: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao has said that a German multinational company, Bosch, will set up a facility in Hyderabad. He said, "German MNC and...world leader in Mobility, Industrial Engineering and Home Appliances has chosen Hyderabad as a strategic location with its Bosch Global Software Technologies and R&D presence." The facility will provide employment to about 3,000 people, he added.

Title: Adani Wilmar's shares surge after listing at 4% discount on debut
Content: Shares of Adani Wilmar made a subdued debut on Tuesday as they listed at a discount of 4% on the issue price of ₹230 apiece. The company's shares later surged more than 17% to hit an intraday high of ₹270.40 on the NSE. The market capitalisation of Adani Wilmar, which raised ₹3,600 crore through IPO, now stands at ₹34,948 crore.

Title: IPO-bound LIC may give 5% discount to policyholders: Reports
Content: IPO-bound Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) might give a 5% discount on the IPO's price band to its policyholders, ET Now reported. It added that retail bidders and employees are also likely to be given a concession and that LIC may file its IPO prospectus on February 10. The government is likely to sell a 5-7% stake in LIC.

Title: Spotify to invest $100 mn in content from underrepresented creators: CEO
Content: Spotify CEO Daniel Ek said that the company will invest $100 million in the licensing, development and marketing of music and audio content from historically underrepresented creators. This is reportedly the same amount of money that Spotify paid to US podcaster Joe Rogan for his exclusive content deal. Rogan was criticised for use of racist language in his Spotify show.

Title: Bank fraud complaints rose to 1.45 lakh in FY21, 7.28% YoY increase
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that bank fraud complaints registered by the RBI under various Ombudsman schemes rose to 1,45,309 in FY21, a 7.28% YoY increase. RBI registered 1,35,448 complaints under various categories in FY20. Mobile/Electronic Banking complaints rose 12.01% and Credit Card complaints rose 52.99% between FY20 and FY21.

Title: RBI begins 3 day monetary policy meet to decide on key rates
Content: Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) began its three-day deliberations on Tuesday to decide the country's monetary policy in the backdrop of Budget 2022-23. The six-member committee headed by RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das is scheduled to announce the policy decision on Thursday. Experts opine that the MPC may change its policy stance from 'accommodative' to 'neutral'.

Title: Bharti Airtel's profit after tax falls 27% QoQ to ₹829.6 cr in Q3
Content: Bharti Airtel reported a 27% QoQ fall in its profit after tax to ₹829.6 crore and a 5.4% QoQ rise in consolidated revenues at ₹29,866 crore in Q3. The company's consolidated operating profit also rose 6.3% QoQ to ₹14,905 crore while its average revenue per user jumped 6.5% QoQ to ₹163/user/month. Its consolidated operating margin also rose to 49.9%.

Title: Start demolition of Supertech's 40-storey twin tower in Noida within 2 weeks: SC
Content: The Supreme Court on Monday ordered that the demolition works of Supertech’s 40-storied twin towers in Noida will start within two weeks. The court also directed NOIDA CEO to convene a meeting within 72 hours to finalise the schedule for demolition. It had also asked Supertech to refund the money with interest to all home-buyers by February 28.

Title: The focus is on growth and adoption for Digital India: Windmill Capital
Content: Union Budget 2022 is focused on promoting digital economy, fintech and technology-enabled development, said Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd, a SEBI-registered research analyst- INH200007645. They added that unchanged financial support from government for this ecosystem will encourage further adoption of digital payments. WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases on themes like digital inclusion.

Title: COVID, you did your worst & stole our voice: Mahindra as Mangeshkar is cremated
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Sunday shared a picture from veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar's funeral and said, "COVID-19, you did your worst while leaving. (You) stole our voice. I hate you." The 92-year-old Bharat Ratna awardee was laid to rest with full state honours in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai on Sunday evening.

Title: RBI's digital rupee blockchain would be able to trace all transactions: Report
Content: The digital rupee blockchain being developed by the RBI would be able to trace all transactions, unlike the current system of mobile wallets offered by private companies, PTI reported. The units issued in the digital rupee would be included in the currency in circulation, it added. The RBI's digital currency is likely to debut by early 2023.

Title: Meta says data regulations may cause Facebook, Instagram shutdown in Europe
Content: Meta in its annual report to the US SEC said it might have to stop operating Instagram and Facebook in Europe due to data regulations. Meta said the regulations could adversely affect its ability to target ads, thus impacting its financial results. Meta said the services couldn't be offered in Europe if a new transatlantic data transfer framework isn't adopted.

Title: Wishy-washy words not needed, say sorry: Shiv Sena MP to Hyundai India
Content: Shiv Sena's MP Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted to Hyundai India, "Wishy-washy words not needed...All you need to say is - we're unequivocally sorry." Hyundai India had issued a statement after Hyundai Pakistan's social media posts supported separatists in Kashmir. Hyundai India said, "The unsolicited post linking Hyundai Motor India is offending our unparalleled service to this great country."

Title: We deeply apologise: KFC India after brand's Pak account shares post on Kashmir
Content: KFC India on Monday issued an apology after its Pakistan arm shared a social media post supporting 'Kashmir Day' on February 5, which led to a controversy. Taking to Twitter, KFC wrote, "We deeply apologise for a post that was published on some KFC social media channels outside the country. We...respect India, and remain steadfast in...serving... Indians with pride."

Title: Sensex falls over 1,100 points, Nifty trades below 17,200-mark
Content: The Sensex fell over 1,100 points during intra-day trade on Monday to trade at 57,423 while the Nifty slumped over 300 points to trade below the 17,200-mark. Both the indices had opened over 0.25% lower earlier in the day and slipped further. Except oil & gas, PSU bank, metal and power all other sectoral indices were trading in the red.

Title: Adani Wilmar shares to debut on BSE, NSE on February 8
Content: The shares of one of India's largest FMCG companies, Adani Wilmar, will debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Tuesday. Adani Wilmar's IPO was subscribed 17.37 times during January 27-31, with support from all kinds of investors. The listing price could be around ₹265/share against the issue price of ₹230/share, according to experts.

Title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to end at 57,621 dragged by financial, FMCG stocks
Content: The Sensex on Monday slumped 1,023 points to settle at 57,621, dragged by financial, auto, IT and FMCG stocks. The Nifty 50 index fell 302 points to close at 17,213 points. A sharp cut in Monday's trading session comes amid heavy selling by FIIs amid rising US bond yields and crude oil prices.

Title: Hyundai India issues statement after Hyundai Pak's social media posts on Kashmir
Content: Hyundai India issued a statement on Sunday after Hyundai Pakistan's social media posts supported "Kashmiri brothers" in their "struggle for freedom", which were later deleted. As Indian users called for the Hyundai brand's boycott, Hyundai India said, "The unsolicited social media post linking Hyundai Motor India is offending our unparalleled commitment and service to this great country."

Title: UK company spends ₹1 cr to take all employees on holiday for working in pandemic
Content: UK-based Yolk Recruitment is spending over £100,000 (over ₹1 crore) to take all of its 55 employees on a holiday to thank them for working through the COVID-19 pandemic. It's taking them on an all-expense-paid trip to Tenerife, the largest of Spain's Canary Islands. Chief Commercial officer Pavan Arora said, "We want to thank employees for the last two years."

Title: Toshiba to split into 2 companies instead of 3, spin off devices unit
Content: Toshiba has announced that it will now split into two companies instead of three after facing fierce criticism from activist shareholders. The Japanese conglomerate will now spin off its devices business. It will use 300 billion yen ($2.6 billion) of excess capital for shareholder returns over two years. Toshiba said that the new plan is simpler and would save costs.

Title: Tesla's bitcoin holding worth nearly $2 billion as of Dec 31
Content: Tesla on Monday said in its annual filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission that its bitcoin holdings' fair market value as of December 31, 2021 was $1.99 billion. The company added that it registered about $101 million in impairment losses last year due to bitcoin's value. Tesla also briefly accepted crypto as payment for sales of certain products.

Title: Tourism body calls for commercial flight operations in full strength
Content: The Federation of Associations in Indian Tourism and Hospitality (FAITH) asked the government to resume commercial flight operations in India in full strength. The country's inbound and outbound travel industry has been shut for the past 23 months, FAITH said in a statement. The body urged the Tourism Ministry to resume commercial flights "with zero quarantine to fully vaccinated travellers".

Title: Macquarie cuts Paytm's target price, Goldman Sachs upgrades stock to 'buy'
Content: Brokerage firm Macquarie on Monday retained its "underperform" rating on Paytm's stock and cut its target price to ₹700. Meanwhile, Goldman Sachs upgraded Paytm's stock to "buy" from "neutral" with a target price of ₹1,460, revised from ₹1,600 earlier. The development comes after Paytm parent, One97 Communications, reported a net loss of ₹778.4 crore in the quarter ended December.

Title: India's GDP projected to be at ₹147.5 lakh cr in FY22: MoS Finance
Content: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said on Monday that India's GDP in FY22 is estimated to grow at 9.2% to ₹147.5 lakh crore. He added that as per National Statistical Office's advance and revised estimates, India's real GDP increased from ₹105.3 lakh crore in 2014-15 to ₹135.6 lakh crore in 2020-21.

Title: LIC ropes in 6 independent directors to meet corporate governance norms
Content: IPO-bound Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) last month appointed six independent directors on its board to meet regulatory norms of corporate governance. LIC reportedly appointed ex-Financial Services Secretary Anjuly Chib Duggal, ex-SEBI member G Mahalingam, ex-SBI Life Managing Director Sanjeev Nautiyal, and Chartered Accountants MP Vijay Kumar, Raj Kamal, and V S Parthasarathy.

Title: We're keeping watch on global inflationary pressures: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "We're fairly watchful of what's happening as regards global developments...US Fed's decisions, as also regards global inflationary pressures." Speaking at a post-budget interaction, she added that the government will not allow the economy to suffer for lack of preparation. She said an opportunity was missed after the global financial crisis of 2008-09.

Title: RBI's Monetary Policy Committee meeting rescheduled to February 8-10
Content: The meeting of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has been rescheduled to February 8-10, 2022 after Maharashtra government declared February 7 as a public holiday as a mark of respect to late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar. The meeting was earlier scheduled for February 7-9, 2022. It will be the MPC's last meeting during the financial year 2021-22.

Title: Billionaire Bloomberg's housekeeper abducted at gunpoint, later rescued
Content: A housekeeper at Colorado ranch of billionaire Michael Bloomberg was abducted by a man at gunpoint this week and has been freed unharmed. Joseph Beecher, who forced the housekeeper to drive them to Wyoming, has been taken into custody and jailed without bond. Michael Bloomberg said he was "deeply grateful" to law enforcement for "ensuring that no lives were lost".

Title: ₹50,000 cr Self Reliant India fund likely to benefit 5,000 MSMEs: Rane
Content: MSME Minister Narayan Rane said the ₹50,000 crore Self Reliant India fund, announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in May 2020, is likely to benefit around 5,000 MSME units. The fund will make equity investments in MSMEs for their growth, listing on stock markets, and global expansion. The government is its sole anchor investor with initial support of ₹10,000 crore.

Title: MSMEs get extension till March 31 for registering on Udyam
Content: MSMEs have been granted extension by the MSME Ministry for migrating to the Udyam registration portal that was launched on July 1, 2020. The deadline has been moved from December 31, 2021 to March 31, 2022. MSMEs not registered on Udyam can continue to avail benefits of provisions under various existing schemes and incentives, including priority sector lending till March-end.

Title: Around 6.17 cr I-T returns, 19 lakh audit reports filed on new portal: CBDT
Content: The Central Board of Direct Taxes said that around 6.17 crore income tax returns and about 19 lakh tax audit reports have been filed on the new income tax e-filing portal. Of the 6.17 crore returns filed till February 6, 48%, or 2.97 crore, are ITR-1, while 27%, or 1.65 crore, are ITR-4 and 13%, or 81.6 lakh, are ITR-3.

Title: Govt yet to decide on banks that are to be privatised: MoS Finance
Content: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad told the Lok Sabha on Monday that the government is yet to decide on public sector banks (PSBs) that are to be privatised. The government had announced in Budget 2021 that it intended to privatise two PSBs during the year. He added that relevant Acts need to be amended for initiating privatisation process.

Title: Govt prepared to deal with any global development: Nirmala Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday said India is ready to deal with any situation arising out of global developments. She urged corporates to take advantage of India's economic recovery and step up investment. "It's time now for us as Team India to rise. We are at such a juncture where revival of the economy is very clear," Sitharaman said.

Title: SEBI should hear views of companies on Chairperson, MD posts separation: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said if companies have a view on the decision to separate posts of Chairperson and MD in listed companies, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) should hear them. "I am not giving them diktat," Sitharaman said. Listed entities are required to comply with the norms before the April 2022 deadline.

Title: What can you say when you no longer have your voice: Mahindra on Lata Mangeshkar
Content: After Lata Mangeshkar passed away at 92 on Sunday, businessman Anand Mahindra wrote on Twitter, "What can you say when you no longer have your voice? Om Shanti." He also shared a black and white picture of her. Several leaders paid a tribute, including PM Narendra Modi, who wrote, "She leaves a void in our nation that cannot be filled."

Title: Lata Mangeshkar will eternally cast her shadow over us: Shaw on 'Tu Jahan Jahan Chalega'
Content: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw shared Lata Mangeshkar's song from 'Mera Saaya' (1996), 'Tu Jahan Jahan Chalega', on Twitter to mourn the veteran singer's demise. She'll "eternally cast her large shadow over us and remind us of her eternal legend. Om Shanthi", she wrote. The song's first line translates to "Wherever you go, remember my shadow will be with you".

Title: Nostalgia with moist eyes & lump in throat: Kotak on Lata Mangeshkar's demise
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank MD Uday Kotak took to Twitter to condole the demise of India's veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar. "India's favourite voice. Nostalgia with moist eyes and lump in the throat," he wrote, sharing a black-and-white picture of the late singer. Earlier, businessman Anand Mahindra and several celebrities including Priyanka Chopra paid a tribute to her on social media.

Title: There's no greater tribute to our unity than Lata Didi: Gautam Adani
Content: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani took to Twitter to condole the demise of veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar and wrote, "There can be no greater tribute to our unity than Lata Didi." He added, "If anyone represented all of India, it was Lata Didi lending her incomparable voice to songs in 36 languages." Lata Mangeshkar passed away aged 92 on Sunday.

Title: I used to catch Patna-Banaras train to listen to Lata ji's songs in theatre: Anil Agarwal
Content: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal in a tweet said he remembers how he used to catch the Patna to Banaras train to watch the first day-last show of movies. "Such was the desperation to listen to Lata ji's songs in the theatre," he tweeted. "She'll always remain immortal in hearts, inspiring generations to come," Agarwal said, mourning Lata Mangeshkar's demise.

Title: Mahindra tweets video of kids running Punjab eatery, says 'going to binge here'
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Saturday shared a video of two brothers aged 17 and 11 years who've been running a restaurant in Punjab's Amritsar, after their father's death in December 2021. "These kids are amongst the pluckiest I've seen anywhere...I love Amritsar...I'm going to add this place to my food binge when I'm next in town," said Mahindra.

Title: 19-yr-old tracking Elon Musk's jet refuses Tesla subscription offer to delete bot
Content: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old college student who runs a Twitter account to track world's richest person Elon Musk's private jet, refused to accept a Tesla to delete the bot. Car-hire company Autonomy's CEO Scott Painter offered Sweeney a three-year subscription to a Tesla Model 3. "If I got an actual Tesla, then I would take it down," Sweeney said.

Title: It's not my money: Musk as GoFundMe blocks C$10 mn raised for Canadian truckers
Content: After GoFundMe blocked C$10 million (over ₹58 crore) raised for Canadian truckers protesting against COVID-19 vaccines, world's richest person Elon Musk referred to them as 'professional thieves' on Twitter. Responding to a Twitter user, Musk added, "It's not my money." The meme, shared by him, also referred to thieves raiding train cargo in the US as 'amateur thieves'.

Title: Bezos gets richer by $19 bn in a day as Amazon adds record $191 bn in value
Content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' net worth climbed by $18.8 billion on Friday after the e-commerce giant's shares soared nearly 14%. Bezos, the world's third-richest person, is now worth $183.5 billion, according to Forbes. Amazon added $191 billion to its market value in the biggest single-day gain in US market history after beating profit expectations for the fourth quarter.

Title: Musk's Neuralink may have misled US regulators about his role: Report
Content: Billionaire Elon Musk's brain-chip startup Neuralink may have misled US regulators about Musk's role at the company, Fortune reported. In a 2018 letter to the US SEC, an attorney representing Neuralink wrote "Musk has no executive or management role at Neuralink". In 2018, Musk held a decision-making role at Neuralink and referred to himself as CEO, former employees told Fortune.

Title: There will be corrective action based on audit report: BharatPe board Chairman
Content: BharatPe board Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said that the board will launch "corrective action" depending on the audit report by Alvarez and Marsal, that is examining corporate governance issues. The board is yet to receive the report, he added. Earlier, reports claimed that a preliminary probe by the risk advisory firm found fraudulent transactions including payments to non-existent vendors.

Title: Egyptian media tycoon charged with sexual assault of 7 orphan girls
Content: Egyptian businessman Mohamed el-Amin has been charged with "human trafficking" and "sexual assault" and will be undergoing trial. The tycoon, who founded several Egyptian media outlets, was arrested on January 8 over accusations that he abused seven girls in an orphanage he founded and is currently in custody. The orphanage was shut last year after the allegations came to light.

Title: Got no request to dismantle bridge for Bezos' superyacht: Dutch Mayor
Content: The Mayor of Rotterdam in the Netherlands has said that he hasn't received any application for a permit to temporarily dismantle a historic bridge to allow billionaire Jeff Bezos' superyacht to pass. "No decision has yet been taken," said Ahmed Aboutaleb. He added the Amazon Founder or his shipbuilder Oceanco may have to foot the bill if it happens.

Title: Tata Group shares how Air India was named 75 years ago via employees' votes
Content: Tata Group tweeted the story behind how 'Air India' got its name 75 years ago when Tata Air Lines expanded from a division of Tata Sons into a company in 1946. The choices were Indian Airlines, Pan-Indian Airlines, Trans-Indian Airlines and Air-India. Tata employees voted and the final count showed 72 votes for Air-India and 58 for Indian Air Lines.

Title: Reliance Jio network down in Mumbai, users share memes on Twitter
Content: Several Reliance Jio users complained on Twitter that they had no network on their phones on Saturday afternoon, most of which were from Mumbai and nearby areas. Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit also complained he wasn't able to make calls. "I was freaking out about my Jio sim not working but...it's not just me," a Twitter user wrote. Users also shared memes.

Title: Markets shouldn't worry about high borrowing number in Budget: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the markets "should not get flustered" about the government's borrowing numbers. During the Union Budget, the government pegged the gross market borrowing number at ₹14.95 lakh crore for 2022-23. Following the news, bond yields rose to their highest level in nearly two years. Sitharaman said it may be due to global changes as well.

Title: Paytm net loss widens to ₹778.5 crore in Q3, revenue surges 89%
Content: Paytm parent One 97 Communications' consolidated net loss widened to ₹778.5 crore in October-December quarter as against ₹535.5 crore loss posted in the year-ago period. The company reported net loss of ₹473.5 crore in the September quarter. The revenue from operations jumped by 89% to ₹1,456.1 crore in Q3 compared to ₹772 crore recorded in the corresponding period of 2020.

Title: Peloton stock jumps on reports of Amazon, Nike exploring bids to buy it
Content: Shares of home fitness startup Peloton surged 26% in extended trading on Friday after media reports claimed Peloton has drawn interest from potential buyers including Amazon and Nike. Amazon and Nike are evaluating separate bids for Peloton and have not held direct talks with Peloton, the reports said. Last month, investor Blackwells Capital urged Peloton's board to pursue a sale.

Title: Ford to suspend or cut output at 8 factories due to chip shortage
Content: Ford Motor plans to suspend or cut production at eight of its factories in the United States, Mexico and Canada throughout next week due to chip shortage in the factories, a spokesperson told Reuters. Ford will also reduce shifts at its factories in Dearborn, Kentucky and Louisville and remove overtime at its Oakville factory in Canada, from February 7.

Title: Clear loans of homebuyers of twin tower project by Mar 31: SC to Supertech
Content: Supreme Court has directed Supertech to clear all outstanding bank loans of homebuyers, who'd invested in the twin towers at its Noida's Emerald Court project by March 31. This was in addition to an earlier order wherein Supertech was directed to refund the amounts paid by homebuyers by February 28. The twin towers were ordered to be demolished last year.

Title: Makes no sense for staff to trek to office to be on Zoom: AmEx CEO
Content: Speaking about hybrid model of working, American Express CEO Steve Squeri told Bloomberg, "It makes no sense to trek all the way in (to the office)...to sit on...Zoom or be on a phone." He said employees should "come in with purpose". American Express has asked New York-based staff to return to office at least one day a week from March.

Title: IndusInd Bank files insolvency plea against Zee over ₹83 cr default
Content: IndusInd Bank has moved the National Company Law Tribunal seeking to initiate corporate insolvency proceedings against Zee Entertainment claiming a default of ₹83 crore. Zee is a party to the Debt Service Reserve Account Guarantee Agreement with IndusInd Bank for a term loan facility advanced to Siti Networks. Earlier, Axis Bank had sent a legal notice to Zee's promoters.

Title: Job creation is govt's priority and we are doing it: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while addressing the National Council of Confederation of Indian Industry at a post-budget interaction, said the government's priority is job creation and "we are doing it". She added that this year's Budget has again focused on demand-driven schemes. She further called on the Indian industry to invest in sunrise and new-age sectors.

Title: SBI posts highest ever quarterly net profit of ₹8,432 crore in Q3
Content: State Bank of India reported its highest ever net profit of ₹8,431.9 crore for the October-December quarter, a jump of 62% as compared to ₹5,196 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Interest earned for the quarter rose 4.41% YoY to ₹69,678 crore. SBI's net interest income (NII) rose 6.48% to ₹30,687 crore from ₹28,820 crore in Q3 of 2020.

Title: 67% MSMEs temporarily shut, profits dipped for 66% in FY21: SIDBI survey
Content: A SIDBI survey showed that 67% MSMEs were temporarily shut for up to a three-month period in FY21 due to COVID-19. The survey, with a sample size of 1,029 MSMEs across 20 states and two UTs, also found that 66% MSMEs reported decline in profitability. The results were shared by MSME Minister Narayan Rane in the Lok Sabha on Thursday.

Title: Name auditorium after Toni Morrison, not me: Bezos to MLK Library
Content: Billionaire Jeff Bezos has requested that the auditorium at the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Library be named after late Nobel Prize laureate Toni Morrison instead of himself. The development comes after thousands criticised the decision to name the auditorium "The Bezos Auditorium". Bezos said he was "honoured and grateful" when the foundation offered to name the auditorium after him.

Title: India's coffee exports rise by 28% in 2021, earn $950 million
Content: Indian coffee exports rose 28% to around 3,95,700 tonnes and earned nearly $950 million in 2021, the highest figure achieved in last ten years, Coffee Board data showed. The surge in exports in the last few months was because of "pent-up demand", Coffee Exporters Association said. Coffee shipments shrank to 3,08,050 tonnes worth $714 million in 2020 due to COVID-19.

Title: Drop in Meta's market value more than the total value of India's largest firm: Kotak
Content: After Facebook parent Meta lost $251 billion in market value, suffering the biggest wipeout in US market's history, Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak said, "That is more than the total value of India's largest company." "It highlights the fragility and fickleness of our times. Welcome to the never normal world," he added.

Title: Facebook's user growth in India slowed due to data price rise: Meta CFO
Content: Facebook's user growth in India was hit due to a hike in prepaid data prices in the fourth quarter of 2021, Meta CFO David Wehner has said. This came after the social media giant recorded a drop in its Daily Active Users (DAUs) for the first time in its 18-year history. Wehner also blamed "competitive services" for the DAU drop.

Title: Dutch locals to throw eggs at Bezos' superyacht if 1927 bridge is dismantled for it
Content: After reports said the 1927 'De Hef' bridge in the Netherlands' Rotterdam will be dismantled to allow passage for Jeff Bezos' $500-million superyacht, residents have planned to throw "rotten eggs" at it. Locals created an event on Facebook for the same and over 1,000 people have signed up for it so far. The event description called Bezos a "megalomaniac billionaire".

Title: Amazon adds $135 bn in one of the biggest 1-day gains in US market
Content: Amazon added more than $135 billion in market value in one of the biggest single-day gains in US stock market history after its shares surged as much as 12% on Friday. The company's stock surged after it beat profit expectations for the fourth quarter. On Thursday, Amazon stock declined 7.8%, wiping out more than $110 billion from its market value.

Title: Amazon adds $191 billion in value in biggest 1-day gain in US market history
Content: Amazon shares jumped nearly 14% on Friday to add $191 billion to its market value after it beat profit expectations for the fourth quarter. The advance is the biggest single-day gain in US market history, Bloomberg reported. It came a day after Facebook's parent company Meta lost $251 billion in market capitalisation in the biggest wipeout in US market history.

Title: Meta drops below Berkshire Hathaway in market value for 1st time in 2 yrs
Content: Meta Platforms is now worth about $50 billion less than Berkshire Hathaway after the social media giant's stock plunged 27% on Thursday, wiping out over $250 billion from its market capitalisation. Meta overtook billionaire investor Warren Buffett-led Berkshire in market value nearly two years ago. Buffett is now richer than Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who lost $31 billion on Thursday.

Title: More top executives resign after Better.com CEO who laid off 900 staff returns
Content: Two more top executives of US-based online mortgage lender Better.com have resigned, days after Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, returned as CEO after a break from full-time duties. One of the executives, Sarah Pierce, was upset with the way Garg publicly disparaged the employees, majority of whom had reported to her, TechCrunch reported citing sources.

Title: I am sorry for nothing: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover to employees
Content: When asked if he'd want to say something to his employees who feel "mistreated", BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol, "I'm sorry for nothing." "I'm absolutely unapologetic...I have the best of intentions," he said. One can't expect someone to "create a $6 billion dollar business in less than four years" and "want everything to be perfect, including culture", Grover added.

Title: Mukesh Ambani buys ₹13cr Rolls-Royce SUV, one of India's most expensive cars: Report
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has bought Rolls-Royce Cullinan costing ₹13.14 crore, one of India's most expensive cars, PTI reported quoting RTO officials. While base price of the car is said to be ₹6.95 crore, reports claimed that customised modifications substantially raised the SUV's price. A one-time tax of ₹20 lakh has reportedly been paid by RIL for the car.

Title: JD.com's billionaire CEO to donate shares worth $2.3 billion to charity
Content: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's Founder and CEO Richard Liu will donate company shares worth about $2.3 billion to charity, JD.com has announced. The move comes amid Chinese President Xi Jinping's call to achieve "common prosperity", which seeks to narrow wealth inequality. According to Bloomberg Billionaires Index, 49-year-old Liu has a net worth of $16.3 billion.

Title: Jio invests $15 million in US-based startup Two Platforms for 25% stake
Content: Jio has announced that it has invested $15 million in Silicon Valley-based startup Two Platforms for a 25% equity stake on a fully diluted basis. "TWO is an Artificial Reality company with focus on building interactive and immersional AI experiences," Jio said. "Jio is foundational to India's digital transformation. We...are excited to partner with Jio," TWO CEO Pranav Mistry said.

Title: RBI examining if BharatPe violated corporate governance rules: Report
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is examining if there were violations of corporate governance rules at BharatPe amid the recent controversy involving its Co-founder Ashneer Grover, reported Moneycontrol. BharatPe and Centrum Financial Services are joint venture partners of Unity Small Finance Bank. The fintech startup's board has hired two firms to conduct a corporate governance review.

Title: Shaadi.com's Anupam Mittal invested ₹5.4 crore in 24 businesses on Shark Tank India
Content: Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal revealed on LinkedIn that he has committed ₹5.4 crore to 24 businesses on Shark Tank India, of which 50% are led by women entrepreneurs and 70% by youngsters. Out of a total of 198 pitches, 67 businesses received deals on the show, he wrote. Of them, 87% of the founders had no IIT/IIM degrees, Mittal added.

Title: Couple arrested for evading GST of ₹12 crore in Thane
Content: Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) authorities in Thane have arrested a couple, a 50-year-old man and his 48-year-old wife, for allegedly evading GST of ₹12.23 crore. The couple were partners in a city-based firm, Datalink Consultancy. They charged GST from high-profile companies for providing manpower but didn't deposit it to government exchequer for over a year, an official said.

Title: IndiGo appoints Co-founder Rahul Bhatia as Managing Director
Content: Budget carrier IndiGo's parent company InterGlobe Aviation announced on Friday that it has appointed its Co-founder Rahul Bhatia as Managing Director with immediate effect. Bhatia has been appointed for a period of five years and will not draw any remuneration during his tenure, the company said. Bhatia and Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal together own a 74.44% stake in the company.

Title: Govt hasn't acknowledged reality of jobs crisis: CMIE CEO on Budget
Content: Reacting to the Budget 2022-23, CEO of Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) Mahesh Vyas said that the budget overlooked the factors that are influencing the decline in the employment rate. "The government has not even acknowledged the reality of the jobs crisis," he added. "There is an absence of a microeconomic view and a macroeconomic solution," he further said.

Title: Budget 2022-23 thoughtful policy agenda for India: IMF MD
Content: Reacting to India's Budget 2022-23, International Monetary Fund's MD Kristalina Georgieva said that it is a very ''thoughtful policy agenda''. ''We are very positive on the fact that India is thinking of addressing short-term issues, but also long-term structural transformation," she added. "There's a great deal of emphasis placed on innovation on research...and digitalisation,'' she said further.

Title: Budget 2022 focused on capex, boosting infra: Hiranandani Group MD
Content: Budget 2022 focused on capital expenditure, manufacturing and 'atmanirbharta' in defence and also push on infrastructure, Hiranandani Group MD Niranjan Hiranandani said. The Budget grants infrastructure status to data centres which will "enable India to become a global data centre hub", he added. It also strikes "a balance between macro-growth with micro-all-inclusive welfare", he said further.

Title: Duties not a hindrance: CBIC chief on Tesla's call for tax breaks
Content: Speaking about Tesla's demand for import duty cuts on electric vehicles, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs' (CBIC) Chairman, Vivek Johri, said that duties are "not a hindrance". "We looked at whether the duties need to be re-jigged, but some domestic production is happening and some investments have come in with the current tariff structure," Johri told Bloomberg.

Title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $133 mn to education non-profit
Content: Amazon's billionaire Founder Jeff Bezos' ex-wife and philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $133.5 million to Communities in Schools (CIS). "The unprecedented gift is the largest unrestricted donation in CIS' history," the US-based education nonprofit said. MacKenzie Scott has a net worth of $46.6 billion, as per Bloomberg. She has donated more than $8.6 billion to over 780 organisations.

Title: Before Meta, which firms recorded biggest 1-day drops in US market history?
Content: Facebook's parent Meta's shares lost over $251 billion in market value on Thursday in the biggest collapse for any US company. Before this, the record was held by Apple, which shed nearly $180 billion on September 3, 2020, as per Bloomberg. Microsoft had lost $178 billion on March 16, 2020 and Tesla lost $140 billion on November 9, 2021.

Title: Bosch India to invest over ₹1,000 cr in localisation of advanced auto tech
Content: Auto components firm Bosch has said that it will invest over ₹1,000 crore in India for the localisation of advanced automotive technologies over the next five years and support the government's Atmanirbhar Bharat mission. Bosch, which completed its 100th year in the Indian market, also launched its mobility marketplace to provide its mobility-related assets under one platform.

Title: Wine sales may jump 25% as Maha allows sale in supermarkets: AIWPA
Content: Days after Maharashtra government allowed the sale of wine in supermarkets and shelf-in shops, All India Wine Producers Association (AIWPA) said that wine sales in the state could rise 25-30%. Maharashtra accounts for 25-30% of the total wine sales in the country, which roughly translates to around 75-90 lakh litres, AIWPA President Jagdish Holkar added.

Title: Manyavar owner gets ₹945 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
Content: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions mobilised ₹945 crore from 75 anchor investors ahead of its IPO, which opened for subscription on Friday. The company has allotted over one crore equity shares to anchor investors at its upper price band. Vedant Fashions has fixed the price band at ₹824-₹866 per share and is raising ₹3,150 crore through its IPO.

Title: Adani Wilmar fixes issue price at ₹230 apiece for ₹3,600 crore IPO
Content: Adani Wilmar has finalised the issue price for its ₹3,600 crore IPO at the upper end of its price band at ₹230 per share. The company's shares are expected to list on the bourses on February 8. Its offer was subscribed 17.37 times between January 27 and January 31, with non-institutional investors bidding for 56.3 times the allotted quota.

Title: I spent a lot of time in writing my Budget 2022 speech: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told ET NOW that she herself wrote Budget 2022 speech which was her shortest Budget speech. "I've spent a lot of time in making sure that the words matter," she said. Income from virtual digital assets will be taxed at 30% and 'digital rupee' will be issued by RBI starting 2022-23, Sitharaman announced in her speech.

Title: IndiGo posts ₹130 cr profit in Q3 after reporting losses for 7 quarters
Content: InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of India's biggest airline IndiGo, has reported a net profit of ₹129.79 crore for the third quarter ended December 2021, after posting losses for seven consecutive quarters. The company's revenue from operations rose 89.3% year-on-year to ₹9,294.8 crore during the period. Its passenger ticket revenues were up 98.4% and stood at ₹8,073.1 crore for the quarter.

Title: RBI cancels licence of Maha-based Independence Co-operative Bank
Content: RBI has cancelled licence of Maharashtra-based Independence Co-operative Bank, citing inadequate capital. It will cease to carry on banking operations from the close of business on February 3. In the present situation, the bank won't be able to pay its depositors in full, RBI said. It added that the bank didn't comply with multiple sections of Banking Regulation Act, 1949.

Title: Self-taught beautician to micro-entrepreneur, meet Asha: Urban Company
Content: The latest episode of Urban Company Impact interviews Asha Thakur, a small-town woman, who believes women should always fly high. She talks about how she struggled for 7 years, learning the trade all by herself and working with different parlours, until she finally joined Urban Company as an independent salon professional and found the growth she was looking for.

Title: This is an infrastructure and growth-focused Budget: Windmill Capital
Content: Capex outlay has been increased and private capital will be required to finance infrastructure projects, said Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd, a SEBI-registered research analyst - INH200007645 about Budget 2022. Enhancing viability with best practices, innovative financing, and balanced risk allocation will be facilitated to focus on growth, it added. WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases.

Title: Facebook parent Meta's $230-billion wipeout biggest in US market history
Content: Facebook's parent Meta's shares plunged 27% and Thursday's collapse wiped out $230 billion of the company's market value. It's the biggest collapse in market value for any US company but there's no certainty that the losses will hold, given the volatility, Bloomberg said. This comes after Facebook's daily active users fell for the first time in its 18-year history.

Title: Mark Zuckerberg loses $31 bn in one of the biggest one-day drops in wealth ever
Content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's wealth dropped by $31 billion in one of the biggest one-day drops in wealth ever, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Zuckerberg's net worth is now estimated at $92 billion, down from $120.6 billion as of market close on Wednesday. This comes after Meta's fourth-quarter results fell short of analysts' expectations and the company's shares fell around 25%.

Title: Facebook parent Meta's rating cut by JPMorgan for 1st time since its IPO
Content: JPMorgan Chase analyst Doug Anmuth has downgraded his rating on Facebook parent Meta to "neutral" from "overweight" and lowered the share price target after the company's earnings report. The cut took place for the first time since the company went public in 2012, Bloomberg reported. On Thursday, Meta's shares tanked over 26%, erasing more than $251 billion in market value.

Title: Why did Facebook's parent company Meta lose $200 billion in one day?
Content: Facebook parent Meta's shares fell over 20% early Thursday causing a $200-billion wipeout after Facebook reported a fall in daily active users for the first time in 18-year history. Facebook said it faces increased competition for users' time and shift of engagement from core News Feed to Reels. Facebook's Reality Labs, that's building 'metaverse', lost over $10 billion in 2021.

Title: Ambani, Adani become richer than Zuckerberg after he loses $29 billion: Forbes
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani are now richer than Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg, as per Forbes' real-time billionaires list. Zuckerberg's wealth fell by $29.7 billion to $84.8 billion as Facebook's parent company Meta's shares crashed 26% after a weak revenue forecast. Adani's fortune stood at $90.1 billion, while Ambani's fortune is $90 billion.

Title: Facebook facing unprecedented level of competition: CEO after Meta's $251 bn wipeout
Content: At a virtual meeting, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg explained that the stock crashed due to weak revenue forecast in the current quarter and asked employees to focus on Facebook's short-video product. Zuckerberg reportedly said Facebook is facing an "unprecedented level of competition" due to video platforms like TikTok. Meta's stock collapse wiped out $251 billion in market value on Thursday.

Title: The idea was forced into my head by CEO Suhail: BharatPe's Ashneer on voluntary leave
Content: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol it wasn't his idea to go on leave till March-end amid the Kotak controversy. "That idea was forced into my head basis misrepresentations from Suhail (CEO) and Sumeet (General Counsel)...in connivance with investors," he explained. "All of them sided with investors and said you should go," Grover said, calling Suhail a "puppet of investors".

Title: Ashneer Grover seeks removal of CEO Suhail Sameer from BharatPe's board: Reports
Content: BharatPe Co-founder and MD Ashneer Grover, who's currently on leave, has reportedly sought to remove CEO Suhail Sameer as a director on the company's board. In a letter dated February 2, Grover stated that he's withdrawing his nomination for Sameer's appointment on the board, reports said. In an interview to Moneycontrol, Grover referred to Sameer as "a puppet of investors".

Title: If board thinks I shouldn't be MD, they can give me ₹4,000 crore: BharatPe's Ashneer
Content: When asked whether he considered resigning amid BharatPe's governance review, Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol, "Why would I resign? I am the MD. I run the company." "If the board thinks I don't need to be the MD...Please put my ₹4,000 crore on the table and take the key from me," he added. Grover also accused the board of "arm-twisting" him.

Title: BharatPe board lawyered up to arm-twist me: Ashneer on governance review
Content: After BharatPe's board hired two firms for a corporate governance review, Co-founder Ashneer Grover alleged that the board is "trying to lawyer up and arm-twist" him. "What is this sending on temporary leave of absence? It's not defined in my SHA (shareholder agreement)," he told Moneycontrol. Grover added that he hasn't been told what the audit is about.

Title: ₹4,355-cr PMC Bank scam accused arrested in Bihar while trying to flee country
Content: Daljit Singh Bal, who was a director of PMC Bank when the ₹4,355-crore scam was unearthed in Maharashtra, has been arrested near Bihar-Nepal border, immigration officials said. He was held along with his wife and son and "was planning to leave for Canada via Kathmandu", AK Pankaj, DSP (immigration), said. In 2019, Mumbai Police issued a lookout circular against him.

Title: Crypto transactions done before April 2022 won't be tax-free: CBDT Chairman
Content: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra was quoted by ANI as saying, "Crypto investors should know that the transactions done before April 2022 will not be tax-free." He added, "The taxability of the crypto-currency is certain for this financial year too." Earlier, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said the income tax return forms will have a separate column for crypto from next year.

Title: Woman banker in UK wins ₹21 cr in case after male employee paid more for same role
Content: A woman banker at BNP Paribas in London was awarded £2,081,449 (over ₹21 crore) by an employment judge after she complained of unequal pay. Stacey Macken, paid £120,000 annually, found out that a man hired with the same job title and responsibilities was being paid £160,000. She also said drunken male colleagues once left a witch's hat on her desk.

Title: Emami Founders step down from executive roles to make way for next gen
Content: Emami Founders RS Agarwal and RS Goenka have stepped down from their executive positions to transition the business to their next generation. The board appointed Goenka as Non-Executive Chairman while re-designating RS Agarwal as Chairman Emeritus. Agarwal's younger son Harsha V Agarwal and Goenka's eldest son Mohan Goenka have been in the FMCG business for over two decades.

Title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air to offer stock options to attract staff
Content: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air, which may start flying in late May, is planning to offer stock options to attract staff. The stock options will be "far greater than most airlines in India and hopefully reminiscent of maybe some...tech startups", CEO Vinay Dube said. However, stock options may not be given to air crew or regular pilots, BloombergQuint reported.

Title: Budget will sustain growth, has disappointed middle-class, startups: Pai
Content: Former Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai said that the Union Budget 2022 carries forward the government's growth and development efforts but has been disappointing for startups and the middle-class. "India can expect to be on high growth path for the next two-three years," said Pai and added that the middle-class and startups have not been given any tax relief.

Title: Budget aims at inclusive development, is forward-looking: ICSI & ICAI
Content: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India called the Budget "progressive" as it aims at "inclusive development through incentivising MSME sector and startups". It focuses on strengthening the digital payment ecosystem, ICSI added. The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India said the Budget was "forward-looking" and the "proposal to tax virtual digital assets at 30% provides certainty".

Title: Nike sues StockX over sale of unauthorised NFTs of its sneakers
Content: Nike sued online reseller StockX in the US for selling unauthorised NFTs of its sneakers. The complaint said StockX has sold over 500 Nike-branded NFTs. StockX allegedly told buyers they would be able to redeem the tokens for physical versions of the shoes in future. Nike has complained about the NFTs' "inflated prices and murky terms of purchase and ownership".

Title: Musk protected by rights for his tweet on staff unionising: Lawyers
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyers have argued in the US that he is protected by constitutional right to free speech in case of his 2018 tweet on his staff unionising. Judges had questioned whether Musk had threatened workers with the loss of stock options if they formed a union. The US NLRB had ordered for Musk to remove the tweet.

Title: No property tax for flats with 500 sq ft carpet area in Mumbai: BMC
Content: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Thursday announced that flats in Mumbai with 500 square feet of carpet area have been granted 100% relief from property tax. "About 16,14,000 citizens will get 100% property tax relief. The amount of exemption to citizens is to the tune of ₹462 crore per annum," BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said in his budget speech.

Title: Tata Steel's Dutch arm faces criminal probe over 'intentional' pollution
Content: Dutch public prosecutors have launched a criminal probe against the Dutch arm of Tata Steel for alleged "intentional and unlawful" pollution of surface water. The probe has also been launched against Harsco Metals Holland, which operates on Tata Steel's premises. The investigation follows a complaint filed by a lawyer representing 800 persons and organisations in May 2021 against the companies.

Title: Banks urge SC to allow Amazon, Reliance to bid for Future Retail
Content: The 27 lenders to Future Group urged the Supreme Court to allow Amazon and Reliance to bid for Future Retail's assets to facilitate recovery of ₹17,000 crore. Senior Advocate Rakesh Dwivedi, the banks' representative, said banks have begun classifying Future Retail as a non-performing asset. He added that bidding is the only "sure shot" method of recovering the money.

Title: LIC's embedded value could be set at over ₹5 trillion: Govt official
Content: The embedded value of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) could be more than ₹5 trillion, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey told Reuters. "I would say...the enterprise value will be multiples of [the embedded value]," Pandey said. He added that the government plans to issue a draft red herring prospectus to investors early next week.

Title: MRF to challenge CCI's ₹622 crore cartelisation charge
Content: MRF Ltd said it will challenge Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order imposing a ₹622.09 crore penalty on the company for "indulging in cartelisation". MRF said that the order "is not based on a proper appreciation of facts and law". A ₹1,788.06 crore penalty was imposed on MRF, Apollo Tyres, CEAT, JK Tyre and Birla Tyres by CCI on Wednesday.

Title: Mumbai businessman Pravin Raut arrested in ₹1,034-crore chawl land scam case by ED
Content: The ED has arrested Guruashish Construction's former Director Pravin Raut in the ₹1,034-crore Patra chawl land scam case. ED alleged that Raut and Housing Development Infrastructure's promoters, Rakesh and Sarang Wadhawan, "illegally sold FSI (floor space index)" to various builders. They siphoned off the money without any intent to complete the redevelopment project in Mumbai's Goregaon, ED said.

Title: Boost to EVs a big step: Windmill Capital
Content: Increased use of EVs in public transport, special mobility zones with zero fossil-fuel policy are positive steps for the sector and companies will be encouraged to develop innovative business models for 'Energy as a Service', stated Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd, a SEBI-registered research analyst- INH200007645. WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases on themes like EVs and Rural demand.

Title: Bitcoin, Ethereum or NFT will never become legal tender: Finance Secretary
Content: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan was quoted by ANI as saying, "Bitcoin, Ethereum or NFT will never become legal tender." He added, "People investing in private crypto should understand it doesn't have government authorisation...one may suffer losses and government isn't responsible for this." He also said, "Some people declare their crypto assets, some don't. Now uniform rate will be 30% tax."

Title: Crypto investment doesn't have govt authorisation, govt not responsible for loss: Finance Secy
Content: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan was quoted by ANI as saying, "People investing in private crypto should understand it doesn't have the authorisation of the government." He added, "There's no guarantee whether your investment will be successful or not, one may suffer losses and government is not responsible for this." He added, "Bitcoin, Ethereum or NFT will never become legal tender."

Title: Mark Zuckerberg risks losing $24 billion wealth as Meta shares crash
Content: Mark Zuckerberg risks losing $24 billion from his personal wealth as Meta's shares crashed over 20% in after-hours trading on Wednesday following its fourth-quarter earnings. If the move holds, his fortune will fall from $120.6 billion (at market close) to $97 billion, Bloomberg reported. This will take Zuckerberg off the world's 10 richest persons list for first time since 2015.

Title: Melinda not to give majority of wealth to Gates Foundation: WSJ
Content: Melinda French Gates, Co-founder of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, will no longer be pledging the majority of her wealth to the philanthropic organisation, the Wall Street Journal reported. She will instead distribute much of her fortune across other philanthropies. Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and Melinda had earlier pledged to give the bulk of their fortune to the foundation.

Title: Bezos to dismantle 1927 Dutch bridge to let his $500-million superyacht pass: Report
Content: The Netherlands' Rotterdam will reportedly dismantle its 'De Hef' bridge, built in 1927, to allow passage for a 127-metre-long superyacht that's being built in Alblasserdam for world's second richest person Jeff Bezos. The Amazon Founder and shipbuilder Oceanco will pay the costs incurred, local media said. The $500-million three-masted yacht will need to pass through Rotterdam to reach the ocean.

Title: Facebook's daily active users fall for first time in 18-year history
Content: Facebook has seen its daily active users (DAUs) fall for the first time in its 18-year history. Facebook's parent company Meta said DAUs fell to 1.929 billion in the three months to the end of December, compared to 1.930 billion in the previous quarter. Meta's shares fell over 20% in after-hours trading, wiping $200 billion off the company's market value.

Title: Tesla co-worker used N-word, threw a hot tool at me: Black, gay ex-worker in lawsuit
Content: A former Tesla worker has filed a lawsuit against the company for failing to address racial, homophobic behaviour directed towards her by a co-worker. The co-worker struck Kaylen Barker with a hot grinding tool while calling her the "N-word" and a "b***h", the suit alleged. Barker said she was "violated physically, mentally, and emotionally" because she's an "African-American lesbian".

Title: Mahindra offers to fund IITians' 3D printing startup, asks 'Any room for me to join?'
Content: Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to offer funds to Tvasta, a startup by three IIT Madras alumni that made India's first 3D printed house. Mahindra tweeted, "I know you raised some seed funding, but any room for me to join in?" India's first 3D printed house, printed and assembled in 21 days, was inaugurated at IIT Madras campus in 2021.

Title: Unemployment rate falls to 6.57%, lowest since March 2021: CMIE
Content: After hitting a four-month high in December, India's unemployment rate fell sharply to 6.57% in January, the lowest since March 2021, Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) data showed. Unemployment in urban India fell to 8.16%, while in rural areas it was 5.84%. Telangana reported the lowest unemployment rate at 0.7% in January, while Haryana had the highest at 23.4%.

Title: List shows unemployment rate in Indian states; highest in Haryana, lowest in Telangana
Content: Independent think-tank Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy has released a list showing unemployment rate in Indian states in January 2022. Haryana has the highest unemployment rate at 23.4%, followed by Rajasthan (18.9%) and  Tripura (17.1%). Telangana reported the lowest unemployment rate at 0.7% in January this year, followed by Gujarat (1.2%), Meghalaya (1.5%) and Odisha (1.8%).

Title: Anand Mahindra employs man with no limbs after offering him job, shares pics
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra, who had earlier offered a job to a differently-abled man with no limbs, shared an update on Wednesday. "I want to thank Ram and @Mahindralog_MLL for employing Birju Ram at one of our EV charging yards in Delhi. EVERYONE deserves a break," he wrote. In December, he had tweeted a video of the differently-abled man.

Title: Income tax return form to have a separate column for crypto next year
Content: The income tax return form will have a separate column for gains made from cryptocurrencies and paying taxes from next year, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said. The government will from April 1 charge a 30% tax plus cess and surcharges, on such transactions, he added. Bajaj said crypto gains were always taxable and the budget provided certainty over the issue.

Title: CNN President Jeff Zucker quits over undisclosed relationship with senior executive
Content: CNN's President Jeff Zucker resigned after failing to disclose his relationship with CNN's Executive VP and CMO Allison Gollust. Zucker said, "I acknowledged the relationship evolved in recent years...I was required to disclose it when it began but I didn't. I was wrong." Gollust, who's remaining at CNN, said, "I regret we didn't disclose our relation at the right time."

Title: Sensex closes 696 points higher at 59,558 a day after Budget presentation
Content: The Indian benchmark indices recorded positive growth on Wednesday with Sensex gaining 695.76 points and closing at 59,558.33 a day after the Union Budget 2022 was presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Nifty 50 recorded a surge of 203.15 points before closing at 17,780. Sensex and Nifty 50 closed at 58,862 and 17,577 on Tuesday.

Title: Crypto tax will help measure the depth of the market: CBDT
Content: Central Board of Direct Taxes Chairman JB Mohapatra said that cryptocurrency tax will "give an idea as to the depth of the market" and help the Income Tax Department know if "the investment is contaminated or illicit". He added that digital assets "do not ipso facto become legal or regular just because you have paid taxes on that".

Title: TCS to expand operations in New Jersey, add 1,000 employees by 2023
Content: Tata Consultancy Services will expand operations in New Jersey by hiring about 1,000 additional employees by 2023 to meet growing needs of customers to digitally transform their businesses, it said. It'll also grow the reach of its STEM and computer science education programs in New Jersey by 25%, the company added. Currently, TCS has over 3,700 employees in New Jersey.

Title: Cognizant reports highest-ever quarterly revenue at $4.8 billion
Content: Cognizant's revenue for the December quarter rose by 14.2% year-on-year to $4.8 billion, its highest-ever quarterly revenue. For the full year 2021, Cognizant reported a 10% year-on-year growth in revenue to $18.5 billion. It expects its full-year 2022 revenue to grow 8.5-11.5% in constant currency to $20-20.5 billion, its highest-ever annual revenue outlook.

Title: K'taka approves 88 industrial projects worth ₹2,367 cr; to create 10,904 jobs
Content: The Karnataka government gave green signal to 88 industrial projects worth ₹2,367.99 crore that would generate jobs for over 10,904 people in the state. The clearance was given to these projects during the State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC) meeting held under the chairmanship of Minister for Large and Medium Scale Industries Murugesh R Nirani on Tuesday.

Title: Reports on merger with parent firm 'speculative, misleading': Vedanta
Content: Metals and mining major Vedanta Limited has denied media reports about its merger with parent company Vedanta Resources as "speculative and misleading" to investors. Reports said that billionaire Anil Agarwal held preliminary talks with advisers about combining the indebted holding company with its listed Indian unit Vedanta Limited. "No such proposal is under consideration," the firm clarified.

Title: Centre might achieve divestment target if LIC IPO goes well: Revenue Secy
Content: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Wednesday that the Centre might be able to achieve its FY22 divestment target of ₹1.75 lakh crore if the LIC IPO goes as planned. He said, "I am confident that we will not only achieve the targets but also exceed them." He added that the LIC IPO may help exceed revised estimates too.

Title: Services sector activity slips to 6-month low of 51.5 in January
Content: India's services sector activity hit six-month low in January as the IHS Markit India Services PMI dipped to 51.5 in January from 55.5 in December 2021. The composite PMI also fell from 56.4 in December to 53.0 in January, the data showed. The escalation of the pandemic and inflationary pressures led to the slow growth across services, IHS Markit said.

Title: Domestic 2-wheeler sales fall 21% in January: ICRA data
Content: According to credit rating agency ICRA, the domestic two-wheeler sales witnessed 21% y-o-y decline in January, even as the segment registered a 14% sequential growth in domestic wholesale volumes. The numbers are based on the data released by six major original equipment manufacturers, ICRA said. ''The industry is cautiously optimistic about recovery in coming months,'' ICRA VP Rohan Gupta said.

Title: We are conscious of inflation, it affects financial planning: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Wednesday that the government is conscious of inflation and it does affect financial planning. "I think globally all economies are worried about inflation," Sitharaman said and added that it has a bearing on all economies around the world. She said global factors like high-priced metals, reduced production and cartelisation are causing inflation.

Title: CCI penalises MRF, Apollo Tyres & others for indulging in cartelisation
Content: Competition Commission of India (CCI) has imposed a penalty of ₹1,788.06 crore on Apollo Tyres, MRF, CEAT, JK Tyre and Birla Tyres for "indulging in cartelisation". "The tyre manufacturers had exchanged price-sensitive data amongst them through the platform of Automotive Tyre Manufacturers Association (ATMA) and had taken a collective decision on the prices of tyres," CCI said in a statement.

Title: Climb the leaderboard on final day of shopping fest to win rewards: CRED
Content: CRED brings the leaderboard where its members can win various rewards during Republic of CRED shopping festival by redeeming CRED coins on in-app deals. The top 3 members can win a 24-inch iMac, the next 7 win iPhone 13 128 GB, and the following 40 win Apple Airpods, CRED announced. Today is the last day to avail these offers.
