Title: Every 15 seconds a millennial opens a savings account with us: Jupiter
Content: Citing convenience and personalisation as top priorities, millennials now prefer a digital-only banking experience as they want to feel like they're in control and are being smarter with their spending, stated Jupiter, a digital-only banking app. Built for these evolving needs, combined with our customer experience innovations, we're seeing exponential growth in millennial users, added Jupiter.

Title: Govt wants RBI to promote digital currency & kill all other currencies: Jhunjhunwala
Content: Ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala told CNBC-TV18, "I think the government wants RBI to promote a digital currency and kill all other currencies, just like China is doing." The billionaire added, "It's the right approach." In the Union Budget 2022-23, the government said RBI will launch digital rupee and announced a 30% tax on income from transfer of virtual digital assets.

Title: 58 paise to come from taxes for every ₹1 earned by the govt: Budget documents
Content: For every rupee earned by the government, 58 paise will come from direct and indirect taxes, 35 paise from borrowings and other liabilities, 5 paise from non-tax revenue and 2 paise from non-debt capital receipts, according to Budget 2022-23 documents. GST will contribute 16 paise in every rupee revenue and income tax will yield 15 paise to every rupee collection.

Title: Industry said 'Growth-oriented budget Caro'na', FM replied with Dolo for infra: Goenka
Content: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka wrote a COVID-19-inspired tweet while praising the Union Budget presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "Industry asked FM 'Growth-oriented budget Caro'na'. FM...responded with- Dolo for infrastructure, Booster for housing, Sanitisers for MSMEs...social distancing from raising taxes! Plus, clearing PCR (PMGatiShakti- Capex- Reforms) test," he wrote.

Title: Govt allocates additional nearly ₹52,000 cr to settle Air India's debt
Content: The Central government has allocated an additional ₹51,971 crore for clearing Air India's debt. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained that the revised estimate is ₹37.70 lakh crore and the revised estimate of capital expenditure is ₹6.03 lakh crore. "This includes an amount of ₹51,971 crore towards the settlement of outstanding guaranteed liabilities of Air India," she added.

Title: Crypto assets not illegal, to be taxed like gambling win: Finance Secretary
Content: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan told Bloomberg TV, "Crypto assets are currently neither illegal nor are they encouraged. They are in a grey area." He added, "It's not illegal to buy and sell crypto assets in India...but we've now put in a taxation framework that treats crypto assets the same way that we treat winnings from horse races or from bets."

Title: Middle class disappointed with the Budget for sure: Mazumdar-Shaw
Content: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget 2022-23, Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw took to Twitter to say, "Middle classes are disappointed with the Budget for sure." She added, "The COVID-19 pandemic impact has badly hit the informal sector, MSMEs and the services sectors. They are urgently in need of fiscal stimulus."

Title: Indian-origin Maju Kuruvilla becomes CEO of US-based fintech unicorn Bolt
Content: Indian-origin executive Maju Kuruvilla has been appointed as the new CEO of San Francisco-based fintech unicorn Bolt. Kuruvilla studied Computer Engineering at Mangalore University and did his MBA from the University of Washington. He joined 'one-click checkout' services provider Bolt as its CTO in January 2021 and was later promoted as COO.

Title: Ratan Tata welcomes flyers onboard Air India flights, airline shares voice note
Content: Air India on Wednesday shared a voice note of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata welcoming the passengers onboard Air India flights on Twitter. "The Tata Group welcomes Air India's new customers and is excited to work together to make Air India the airline of choice in terms of passenger comfort and service," said the 84-year-old industrialist to the passengers.

Title: Budget progressive, will help in increasing farmers' income: Yogi
Content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday welcomed the Union Budget, calling it progressive and growth-oriented. Adityanath said the Budget will solve the long-standing demand of farmers of increasing their income and has provisions of creating 60 lakh jobs for the youth. "It will help the economy become the world's largest...during the COVID-19 period," he said.

Title: MHA budget increased by 11.5%, CAPFs get largest share of allocation
Content: The government has raised the funds allocated to Ministry of Home Affairs by 11.5% to ₹1.85 lakh crore in Budget 2022-23. Among the total fund allocated to MHA, the majority of spending is on Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) like CRPF, BSF and for ramping up infrastructure along international borders. Last year, the government allocated ₹1.66 lakh crore to MHA.

Title: No law on cryptocurrencies but govt imposed tax against it: Sachin Pilot
Content: Reacting to the Union Budget 2022-23, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that the Finance Minister didn't utter a word for the poor, youth and unemployed or even inflation. "There's no law on digital currency but there's a tax against it now," he added. The government imposed 30% tax on income generated by cryptocurrencies and other virtual assets in Budget.

Title: Law Ministry gets ₹1,525 crore for new EVMs in Budget 2022
Content: The government allocated ₹1,525 crore in the Union Budget to Law Ministry to provide funds to Election Commission for purchase of new EVMs and destruction of obsolete voting machines. The ministry has also been allocated funds for Lok Sabha polls and identity cards for voters. Old EVMs are destroyed under the watch of an expert panel, following a strict protocol.

Title: Budget is only for the rich, has nothing in it for poor: Mallikarjun Kharge
Content: Rajya Sabha's Leader of the Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge said the Union Budget 2022-23 is "only for the rich" and has nothing for the poor. ''This Budget has been tailor-made to please the crony-capitalist friends of BJP,'' he claimed. ''The Budget completely overlooks the needs of middle class and the poor, who form 90% of the population,'' he added.

Title: Delhi Police budget increased to ₹10,355 crore from ₹8,654 crore
Content: Delhi Police has been allocated ₹10,355 crore in the Union Budget 2022-23. Delhi Police was allocated ₹8,654 crore in 2021-22. Of the total allocation, ₹9,808 crore will go towards "establishment-related expenditure", Delhi Police said. "₹259 crore will be spent for police infrastructure for the construction of office buildings...maintenance of new police headquarters building PPP mode," it added.

Title: Govt lowers MGNREGA allocation to ₹73,000 cr in FY 2022-23
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Union Budget speech allocated ₹73,000 crore for India's rural jobs guarantee programme for the upcoming fiscal. Last year, the government had revised the allocation in MGNREGA from ₹1.11 lakh crore to ₹98,000 crore. Meanwhile, the government has increased allocation for the ministry of rural development by 3.36% to ₹1,35,944 crore.

Title: Budget made keeping in mind vision for next 25 years: MoS Finance Karad
Content: Union Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Kishanrao Karad said that the Union Budget 2022-23 has been made to ensure the development of every sector keeping in mind the vision for the next 25 years. "We are confident that this Budget will boost the development of the country," he added. "The Budget is truly an 'aam aadmi' Budget," Karad stated.

Title: Musk claims his tweet on taking Tesla private was 'entirely truthful'
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has claimed that his 2018 tweet about taking Tesla private was "entirely truthful". Musk's lawyers said in a court filing that Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund had agreed to support his attempt to take Tesla private. "Not only did Mr Musk firmly believe funding was secured when he tweeted, in reality...it was secured," the filing read.

Title: Elon Musk adds $21 billion to his wealth as Tesla stock jumps 11%
Content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk added $21.4 billion to his wealth on Monday as shares of the electric carmaker jumped 11%. Musk's net worth surged to almost $242 billion, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Tesla stock jumped after Credit Suisse upgraded the stock to "outperform" and the broader market rebounded.

Title: Pfizer-BioNTech seek FDA approval of COVID vaccine for kids under 5
Content: Pfizer and BioNTech are seeking emergency authorisation from the USA's Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to make first two doses of their COVID-19 vaccine available for children aged between six months and five years. Both the companies have started submitting their formal application. The FDA has also confirmed that it will hold a meeting with them to consider their request.

Title: Dolce & Gabbana to stop using animal fur in collections from 2022
Content: Italian fashion house Dolce & Gabbana will no longer use animal fur in its collections from this year and will switch to eco-friendly alternatives, the company said. "D&G is working towards a more sustainable future that can't contemplate the use of animal fur," communications officer Fedele Usai said. Armani, Prada, Moncler are some other brands following this rule.

Title: India can become $5 trillion economy by FY26: Chief Economic Advisor
Content: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said that India can become a $5 trillion economy by FY26 or FY27 if it continues to attain 8% real GDP growth rate. According to government estimates, India's economy is projected to grow at 9.2% and 8-8.5% in FY22, FY23. International Monetary Fund projects India's GDP to grow at 9% in FY22 and FY23.

Title: HDFC reports 11.4% YoY rise in net profit to ₹3,261 crore in Q3
Content: Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) on Tuesday reported an 11.4% YoY rise in net profit in Q3 to ₹3,260.7 crore. The lender's net interest income also grew 7% YoY to ₹4,284 crore in the October-December quarter. The company's overall assets under management grew 12% YoY to ₹6.2 lakh crore, fueled by the second-highest monthly disbursement of individual loans in December.

Title: Tech Mahindra net profit jumps 4.5% y-o-y to ₹1,369 crore in Q3
Content: IT major Tech Mahindra reported a 4.5% year-on-year rise in its consolidated net profit for October-December quarter at ₹1,369 crore which was at ₹1,309 crore in the last year period. The revenue from operations in Q3 was up by 19% year-on-year at ₹11,451 crore. The growth in revenues of the company was led by the communications, retail and manufacturing verticals.

Title: Zydus Cadila begins supply of its needleless COVID vaccine to Centre
Content: Ahmedabad-based Zydus Cadila has started supplying the first batch of its COVID-19 vaccine, ZyCoV-D, to the Union government. "We have started the supply of the three-dose ZyCoV-D to the Government of India. We are also planning to make it available in...private market," the pharmaceutical firm said in a statement. The needleless vaccine has been priced at ₹358 per dose.

Title: LIC likely to file draft papers for IPO within 2 weeks: DIPAM Secy
Content: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) is likely to file the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) to raise funds through an IPO with SEBI within two weeks, said the Secretary of Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), Tuhin Kanta Pandey, on Tuesday. Earlier while presenting the Union Budget 2022, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that LIC's IPO is expected shortly.

Title: What becomes cheaper after Union Budget 2022-23?
Content: Cut and polished diamonds and gemstones will become cheaper after the Union Budget 2022-23 as the government reduced the customs duty. Further, leather goods, clothes, steel scraps, mobile phones, mobile phone chargers and chemicals used for petroleum products will also get cheaper. Meanwhile, umbrellas will get costlier.

Title: Currency becomes a currency when it's issued by central bank, even if it's crypto: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the post-Budget press conference said, "The RBI will be issuing the digital currency. A currency becomes a currency when it's issued by the central bank (RBI), even if it is crypto." She added, "Anything that prevails outside of it are assets created by individuals and the transactions happening in the 'crypto world' will be taxed."

Title: Sensex gains 848 points to close at 58,862 after Budget presentation
Content: The Indian benchmark indices ended in the green on Tuesday after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget for 2022-23. The Sensex jumped 848 points to close at 58,862, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 237 points to close at 17,577. The Budget proposed to raise capital expenditure outlay for 2022-23 by 35.4% to ₹7.50 lakh crore.

Title: Upliftment of poor main focus of Budget 2022-23: PM Modi
Content: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented her fourth Union Budget, PM Narendra Modi said the main focus of the Budget is the upliftment of the poor. "Every poor person should have a pucca house, water from a tap, toilet and gas facility...All these have been given special attention," he said. The Budget also focussed on modern internet connectivity, he added.

Title: SEZ Act to be replaced to allow states to become partners: Sitharaman
Content: The Special Economic Zones Act will be replaced with new legislation, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced on Tuesday. "This will enable states to become partners in the development of enterprise and service hubs. It will cover the existing industrial enclaves and enhance the competitiveness of exports," she added. The existing SEZ Act was enacted in 2005.

Title: Zero sum budget, nothing for middle class, youth & farmers: Rahul
Content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the Union Budget terming it a "zero sum Budget". "It has nothing for salaried class, middle class, the poor and deprived, youth, farmers and MSMEs," he tweeted. Separately, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Salaried class and middle class were hoping for relief in times of pandemic...FM and PM have again deeply disappointed them."

Title: Sometimes boring is good, nothing has changed for investors: Zerodha Co-founder
Content: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget 2022-23, Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath said, "Sometimes boring is good." "From a market, investor or trader standpoint nothing has changed so this will largely play out as a non-event for the stock markets," he added. He referred to the government taking steps to regulate virtual currency as a "positive" move.

Title: COVID definitely impacted jobs, but govt helped citizens to recover: FM
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the COVID-19 pandemic has definitely impacted jobs, but the Centre has been trying to help citizens recover successfully through various schemes. Sitharaman was addressing the media after presenting the Union Budget 2022-23. Prime Minister Narendra Modi described the Budget as "people-friendly" and "progressive".

Title: Battery swapping policy announced for electric vehicles in Union Budget
Content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman during her Union Budget 2022-23 speech said, "Considering the constraint of space in urban areas for electric vehicle charging stations at scale, a battery swapping policy will be launched." She added, "Inter-operability standards will be formulated." Additionally, private sector will be encouraged to develop sustainable business models for 'Battery or Energy as a Service'.

Title: Surcharge on long-term capital gains tax capped at 15% for all assets
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her Union Budget speech proposed to cap surcharge on long-term capital gains (LTCG) on transfer of any type of assets at 15%. Currently, LTCG on listed equity shares are liable to maximum surcharge of 15%, while other LTCG face graded surcharge up to 37%, she added. The move will help the startup community, FM added.

Title: Centre committed to maximum governance, 1,486 Union laws repealed: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the Centre is committed to 'minimum government and maximum governance' as a result of which 1,486 Union laws were repealed in recent years. She added 25,000 compliances were also reduced. "This is the outcome of the government's trust in the public along with measures such as Ease of Doing Business (EODB)," she said.

Title: Which imported items will become costlier after Union Budget 2022-23?
Content: Due to a hike in customs duties on imported parts as proposed by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the Union Budget 2022-23, several commonly used items will become more expensive. Some of the items include umbrellas, imitation jewellery, single or multiple loudspeakers, headphones and earphones, smart metres, solar modules, X-ray machines and parts of electronic toys.

Title: Govt never let inflation hit double-digits since 2014: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the post-Budget press conference said the government has always taken steps to tackle inflation. "Our government didn't allow inflation to go to double-digits. It has never breached 6% limit also, maybe once it could have," she added. "Before 2014, it was always in the range of 10, 11, 12, 13(%), even food products," Sitharaman stated.

Title: Didn't want to earn a single paisa by increasing tax during the pandemic: Sitharaman
Content: While addressing the press conference after presenting the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Centre didn't want to increase the income tax during the COVID-19 pandemic. Adding that according to the direction given by PM Narendra Modi, the government did not want to earn a single paisa by raising taxes and increasing burden on people.

Title: 'Middle Class' memes go viral after no change in personal income tax slabs in Budget
Content: On Tuesday, several social media users shared 'Middle Class' memes after no changes were announced in the existing personal income tax slabs during Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget speech for 2022-23. #IncomeTax also started trending on Twitter. "Middle class [people] are allowed to breathe, drink water & eat food. What else do you all want?" a tweet read.

Title: Can't wait for regulation to tax profits: FM on tax on digital asset income
Content: While responding to a question on how 30% income tax is going to be charged on cryptocurrency without any regulations, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Regulation goes through [a] process." Saying that public stakeholders are being consulted for the regulations, Sitharaman added, "I [cannot] wait till regulation is in place to tax people who are earning profits, can I?"

Title: Union Budget brings in new hopes and opportunities for people: PM Modi
Content: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Union Budget 2022-23 speech, PM Narendra Modi said, "This Budget brings in new hopes and opportunities for the people. It strengthens the economy." "It is full of more infrastructure, more investment, more growth and more jobs. There is also a new provision of green jobs. It ensures a bright future for youth," he added.

Title: Ex-Vistara executive flies Air India economy post-Tata takeover, rates it 5/10
Content: Former Vistara airlines chief strategy and commercial officer Sanjiv Kapoor has rated his experience of an Air India economy flight at a 5 out of 10, post its takeover by Tatas. Kapoor noted that priority boarding lane was open, aircraft was clean and in decent shape. However, seat belt/seat upright checks and enforcement of social distancing were missing, Kapoor said.

Title: What was the Mahabharata shloka Nirmala Sitharaman mentioned in her Budget speech?
Content: While talking about direct taxes during Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman mentioned a verse from Shanti Parva Adhayaya of Mahabharata. "The king must make arrangements for Yogakshema (welfare) of...populace by way of abandoning any laxity and by governing the state in line with Dharma, along with collecting taxes which are in consonance with Dharma," the translation of the shloka reads.

Title: Build an inclusive India with 25-yr vision, proud to be Indian: Kotak on Budget
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak, reacting to the Budget 2022-23 presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, said it reposes faith in taxpayers, entrepreneurs, investors. "Build an open, digital and inclusive India with a 25 year vision. I am proud to be Indian," Kotak tweeted. Vedanta's Anil Agarwal said the Budget was "growth-oriented and forward-looking" and "for the masses".

Title: Govt subsidies to drop 39% to ₹4.3 lakh cr in FY22, drop 27% more in FY23
Content: Government subsidies on food, fertilisers and petroleum are estimated to decline by 39% to ₹4,33,108 crore in FY22 as against actual budget estimate of ₹7,07,707 crore, the Budget document said. It added that in FY23, subsidies are estimated to decline by 27% to ₹3,17,866 crore. Of FY22's total subsidies, food and petroleum subsidies account for ₹2,86,469 crore and ₹6,517 crore.

Title: PM-DevINE scheme announced for North-East, ₹1,500 cr allocated
Content: Prime Minister's Development Initiative for North-East (PM-DevINE) scheme was announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman today while presenting Budget 2022-23. The scheme will be implemented through the North-Eastern Council and fund infrastructure and social development projects with an initial allocation of ₹1,500 crore. Sitharaman said the scheme will help enable livelihood activities.

Title: Govt allocates ₹60,000 cr in 'Har Ghar, Nal Se Jal' scheme in Budget
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman allocated ₹60,000 crore to the 'Har Ghar, Nal Se Jal' scheme in Union Budget 2022-23. ''Under the scheme, 8.7 crore households have already been covered of which 5.5 crore have been covered in the past two years,'' the FM said. With the new allocation, the scheme will now cover another 3.8 crore households, she added.

Title: Budget will change scale of economy, make India self-reliant: Amit Shah
Content: Home Minister Amit Shah said that the Union Budget 2022-23 will change the Indian economy's scale and make the country self-reliant. Calling it a "visionary budget", Shah said the Budget will "lay the foundation of a new India of the 100th year of independence". He added that increasing the budget's size to ₹39.45 lakh crore indicates a rapidly growing economy.

Title: Budget to promote modern infra, improve lives of 130 cr Indians: Gadkari
Content: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said that Budget 2022-23 is a budget "to promote modern infrastructure in the country". Taking to Twitter, he added, "[It] will lay the foundation for a new India and improve the lives of 130 crore Indians." Budget 2022-23 mentioned that the National Highway network will be expanded by 25,000 km in FY23.

Title: India's manufacturing PMI falls to 4-month low in January at 54
Content: India's manufacturing sector hit a four-month low in January as the IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 54 from 55.5 in December, a survey said. However, the data pointed to an improvement in overall operating conditions for seventh straight month. In PMI reading, a score above 50 means expansion, while a score below 50 denotes contraction.

Title: No change in personal income tax slabs in Union Budget 2022-23
Content: No changes were announced in the existing personal income tax slabs during Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget speech for 2022-23 on Tuesday. The basic income tax exemption limit was last revised in 2014 when it was raised from ₹2 lakh to ₹2.5 lakh, and ₹3 lakh for senior citizens. In 2020, a new tax regime was introduced.

Title: What are the key highlights from the Union Budget 2022-23?
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her Union Budget 2022-23 speech announced that e-passports with embedded chips will be rolled out in 2022-23 and 'digital rupee' will be issued by RBI starting 2022-23. The 5G spectrum auction will begin in 2022 to roll out the 5G network within 2022-23. Income from virtual digital assets will be taxed at 30%, Sitharaman said.

Title: 68% of defence capital procurement set aside for domestic industry: FM
Content: India will earmark 68% of its capital procurement budget of the defence sector for the domestic industry, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. This move will reduce dependence on imports of defence equipment. In the last fiscal, this figure was 58%. She also announced that defence research and development (R&D) will be opened for industry, startups and academia.

Title: Budget takes care of interests of people living in Northeast: Rijiju
Content: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday praised the Union Budget 2022-23 presented by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "It is a very inclusive Budget that takes care of the interests of every section of society including the poor, rural and border areas, and the people living in the Northeast," he said. Sitharaman presented the Budget for the fourth time.

Title: Huge expansion on capital expenditure real highlight of Budget: NITI Aayog CEO
Content: Union Budget 2022-23 is a very progressive and forward-looking Budget, NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant said on Tuesday. "It prepares India for the next stage of its sustained growth. It is a continuation of last year's Budget. The real highlight of the Budget is its huge expansion on the capital expenditure," Kant added.

Title: A reasonable proposition, won't criticise: Tharoor on announcement of digital rupee
Content: After the government proposed introduction of digital rupee using blockchain and other technologies in the Union Budget, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said, "To the best of my knowledge, a reasonable proposition. I don't think we'll be criticising that." The digital rupee will be issued by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) starting 2022-23, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced.

Title: Positive rhetoric with no negative surprises: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Budget
Content: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw called the Union Budget 2022-23 a "balanced budget" while adding, "Positive rhetoric with no negative surprises." She tweeted, "Fiscal prudence and business ease has been the theme." She also said, "35% increase in capital expenditure will drive infrastructure and jobs."

Title: 80 lakh houses under PM Awas Yojana to be completed in 2022-23 : FM
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that 80 lakh houses, both in rural and urban areas, will be completed in 2022-23 under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY). "₹48,000 crore has been allocated for this purpose. The Central government will work with state governments for reduction of time required for all land and construction-related approvals," she explained.

Title: Period of incorporation for startups to avail tax incentives extended by 1 yr: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her Budget 2022-23 presentation said eligible startups established before March 31, 2022, had been provided a tax incentive for three consecutive years. "In view of COVID-19, I propose to extend the period of incorporation of eligible startups by one more year," she added. Startups have emerged as drivers of growth for our economy, she noted.

Title: Tax exemption on employer's NPS contribution for state govt staff hiked to 14%
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed to increase the tax deduction limit from the existing 10% to 14% on employer's contribution to the National Pension System (NPS) account of state government employees. This will provide equal treatment to state and Central government employees, she said. "This will help in enhancing social security benefits of state government employees," she added.

Title: What falls under 'virtual digital asset' as govt announces 30% tax?
Content: As income from virtual digital asset will be taxed at 30%, Finance Bill 2022 stated it'll include a non-fungible token or any other token of similar nature. It'll also include any code, number or token generated through cryptographic means or otherwise that provides a digital representation of value exchanged. It may also include digital assets that government may notify later.

Title: Govt to promote Kisan Drones use for land records, insecticides spraying
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has announced that use of Kisan Drones for crop assessments, land records and spraying of insecticides will be promoted. NABARD will be providing fund with blended capital to fund startups working in the agricultural field and rural enterprises relevant for the farm produce value chain. States will be asked to revise agricultural universities syllabi.

Title: Alternate Minimum Tax to be cut to 15% for co-operative societies: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget speech proposed to cut Alternate Minimum Tax for co-operative societies to 15%, at par with companies. She proposed to reduce surcharge for co-operative societies from 12% to 7% for those having total income of over ₹1 crore and up to ₹10 crore. "This would help in enhancing...income of cooperative societies," the FM said.

Title: 400 new Vande Bharat trains to be introduced: FM Sitharaman
Content: While presenting the Union Budget 2022-23, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced 400 new Vande Bharat trains will be introduced in the next three years. Sitharaman also said that a total of 100 PM Gati Shakti Cargo terminals would be set up in the next three years. Contracts for multi-modal parks at four locations will be awarded in 2022-23, she added.

Title: What an incredible announcement: Paytm Founder on digital rupee
Content: Reacting to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's announcement regarding the introduction of a digital rupee, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "What an incredible announcement of Budget 2022." Hailing the move as "transformational", Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl said, "The significance of this step is monumental." The digital rupee will be issued by the RBI starting 2022-23.

Title: Gross GST collection for Jan 2022 is ₹1.4 lakh crore, highest since GST inception: FM
Content: Presenting the Union Budget on Tuesday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated that the gross GST collection for the month of January 2022 is ₹1,40,986 crore, which is the highest since the inception of GST. "Taxpayers deserve applause who have diligently contributed to fulfilling their responsibilities in improved tax and GST," she added.

Title: AVGC promotion task force with all stakeholders to be set up: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman discussing the Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming and Comics (AVGC) sector in her Budget speech said an AVGC promotion task force with all stakeholders will be set up. The sector offers "immense potential to employ youth", Sitharaman added. The task force will recommend ways to build domestic capacity for serving India's markets and the global demand.

Title: What were the announcements on virtual digital assets in the Budget speech?
Content: Any income from the transfer of any virtual digital asset will carry a 30% tax and only the cost of acquisition will be considered while calculating this income. In the case of gifting such assets, the tax will be paid by the recipient. Additionally, 1% TDS will also apply to payments made on the transfer of digital assets.

Title: Centre to promote chemical-free natural farming along Ganga: FM Sitharaman
Content: While presenting the Union Budget 2022-23, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that the government will promote chemical-free natural farming throughout the country along the river Ganga. "Chemical-free natural farming will be promoted throughout the country with a focus on farmers' land in five kilometre-wide corridors along the river Ganga in the first stage," she added.

Title: Nirmala Sitharaman's shortest budget speech may prove to be most impactful: Mahindra
Content: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget in the Parliament on Tuesday, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "[Sitharaman's] shortest budget address may prove to be the most impactful." "Brevity has always been a virtue," he added. Sitharaman gave her shortest budget speech which lasted for around 90 minutes.

Title: Customs duty on cut & polished diamonds, gems reduced to 5%
Content: During her Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that customs duty on cut and polished diamonds and gems is being reduced to 5%. Custom duty on imitation jewellery is being prescribed in a manner that a duty of ₹400 per kg is paid on its import, Sitharaman said. Imports on select chemicals have also been reduced, the FM announced.

Title: Fiscal deficit estimated at 6.9% of GDP in FY22, up from budget target of 6.8%
Content: The revised fiscal deficit in FY 2021-2022 is estimated at 6.9% of GDP against 6.8% projected in budget estimates. The fiscal deficit in 2022-23 is estimated at 6.4% of GDP. It is consistent with the fiscal consolidation announced last year to reach a fiscal deficit level below 4.5% by 2025-26.

Title: Is crypto legal now?: Cong as govt imposes 30% tax on digital asset transfer
Content: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala asked Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to clarify whether cryptocurrency is now legal in India. "What about its regulator? What about regulation of crypto exchanges? What about investor protection?" Surjewala tweeted. During the Budget 2022 speech, Sitharaman announced that income from transfer of virtual digital assets will be taxed at 30%.

Title: Gift of virtual digital asset to be taxed in the hands of recipient: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget speech on Tuesday said that gift of virtual digital asset would be taxed in the hands of the recipient. The minister announced that any income from the transfer of any virtual digital asset shall be taxed at 30%, and no deduction can be allowed while computing such income, except the cost of acquisition.

Title: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman gives her shortest Budget speech
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday gave her shortest Budget speech which lasted around 90 minutes. Sitharaman holds record for delivering the longest speech when she spoke for around 2 hours and 40 minutes while presenting Union Budget 2020-21 on February 1, 2020. In 2019, Sitharaman delivered Union Budget speech that went on for around 2 hours and 15 minutes.

Title: Extremely disappointing, a damp squib: Tharoor on Union Budget 2022-23
Content: Commenting on the Union Budget 2022-23, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said that it is an "astonishingly disappointing" Budget. "Extremely disappointing, a damp squib! There seems to be absolutely nothing in this Budget," he added. "When you listen to the speech, no mention of MGNREGA, of Defence, of any other urgent priorities facing the public," Tharoor further said.

Title: Expert committee to scale VC investments in startups to be set up: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman while presenting the Union Budget 2022-23 on Tuesday said, "Venture capitals (VCs) and private equities (PEs) poured ₹5.5 lakh crore into the startup ecosystem last year." An expert committee will be set up to examine and suggest appropriate measures to scale up venture capital (VC) investments, the Finance Minister added.

Title: Digital rupee to be issued by the RBI starting 2022-23: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her Union Budget 2022-23 presentation said that the introduction of a digital rupee using blockchain and other technologies is proposed. The digital rupee will be issued by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) starting 2022-23. "Introduction of a central bank digital currency will give a big boost to the digital economy," said Sitharaman.

Title: Taxpayers can file updated return within 2 years of assessment year: Nirmala Sitharaman
Content: While presenting the Union Budget 2022-23, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a new provision permitting tax payers to file an updated return on payment of additional tax. She said that this will provide taxpayers an opportunity to correct errors. She added that the updated return can be filed within two years from the end of the relevant assessment year.

Title: E-passports with embedded chips to be rolled out in 2022-23: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that e-passports using embedded chips will be rolled out in 2022-23. The move is for the convenience of citizens in their overall travels, she said. The government had earlier announced e-passports with electronic chips that will store digitally-signed personal particulars of applicants, for enhanced security.

Title: Income from virtual digital assets will be taxed at 30%: Nirmala Sitharaman
Content: Income from the transfer of any virtual digital assets will be taxed at 30%, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "No deduction in respect of any expenditure or allowance shall be allowed while computing such income, except the cost of acquisition," said Sitharaman. Digital rupee using blockchain technology will be issued by RBI, she announced earlier today.

Title: 5G spectrum auction to be held in 2022 to roll out 5G in 2022-23: Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her Union Budget 2022-23 presentation said that the 5G spectrum auction will be held in 2022 to roll out the 5G network in the country within 2022-23 by private players. "A scheme for design-led manufacturing will be launched to build a strong ecosystem for 5G as part of the Production Linked Incentive Scheme," she said.

Title: States will be encouraged to revise syllabi of agricultural universities: FM
Content: During her Union Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the states will be encouraged to revise the syllabi of agricultural universities to meet the needs of natural, zero-budget and organic farming, modern-day agriculture. "Fund to be facilitated through NABARD to finance startups for agriculture and rural enterprise, relevant for farm produce value chain," Sitharaman added.

Title: RAMP programme with outlay of ₹6,000 cr over 5 yrs to be rolled out: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during the Union Budget 2022-23 on Tuesday said that Raising and Accelerating MSME Performance (RAMP) programme with an outlay of ₹6,000 crore over five years  will be rolled out. "This will help the MSME sector become more resilient, competitive and efficient," Sitharaman said. MSMEs such as Udyam, e-Shram, NCS and Aseem portals will be interlinked.

Title: National tele mental health programme with 23 centres to be launched: FM Sitharaman
Content: While presenting the Union Budget 2022-23, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that a national tele mental health programme will be launched for mental health counselling. She further stated that the programme will include a network of 23 tele-mental health centres of excellence. National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) will be the programme's nodal centre.

Title: Govt revises FY21 GDP growth to -6.6% from -7.3% ahead of Budget
Content: India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) contracted by 6.6% in 2020-21, according to the National Statistical Office's (NSO) first revised estimate released on January 31. NSO had in May 2021 projected 7.3% contraction in 2020-21, as per provisional data. On Monday, the Economic Survey estimated that Indian economy is set to grow at 9.2% for 2021-22 and 8-8.5% in 2022-23.

Title: 75 digital banking units to be set up in 75 Indian districts: FM Sitharaman
Content: During her Union Budget 2022-23 presentation, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that the government will set up 75 digital banking units in 75 districts of the country through scheduled commercial banks. The aim is to take "digital banking to every citizen", Sitharaman said. Financial support for digital ecosystem announced in previous Budget will continue in 2022-23, the FM added.

Title: '1 Class, 1 TV channel' programme for educating students expanded to 200 channels: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her Union Budget speech said children from government schools have lost two years of school education due to COVID-19. 'One Class, One TV channel' program of PM eVIDYA will be expanded from 12 to 200 TV channels, Sitharaman announced. This will enable states to provide supplementary education in regional languages for classes 1-12, she added.

Title: National Highway network to be expanded by 25,000 km in 2022-23: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the National Highway network will be expanded by 25,000 km in 2022-23. PM Gati Shakti National Master Plan will be formulated in 2022-23 to facilitate faster movement of people and goods, Sitharaman said in her Budget 2022-23 speech. She said ₹20,000 crore will be mobilised through innovative ways of financing to complement the public resources.

Title: 5-7% biomass pellets to be co-fired in thermal plants, will mitigate stubble burning: FM
Content: While presenting the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that 5-7% of biomass pellets will be co-fired in the thermal plants resulting in carbon dioxide savings of 38 MMT annually. She added that it will mitigate stubble burning in agricultural fields and will provide extra income to farmers and job opportunities to locals.

Title: What are the four priorities of the govt in the Union Budget 2022-23?
Content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman said that PM Gati Shakti, inclusive development, productivity enhancement and investment and financing of investment are four priorities of the government in Budget 2022-23. "PM Gati Shakti is driven by seven engines - roads, railways, airports, ports, mass transport, waterways and logistics infrastructure," said FM. The government will focus on climate action, she added.

Title: ECLGS for MSMEs extended till March '23, guarantee cover expanded: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday announced that the Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme (ECLGS), which was introduced in 2020 after COVID-19 outbreak to help MSMEs, has been extended till March 2023. "The guaranteed cover will be expanded by ₹50,000 crore to a total cover of ₹5 lakh crore," she said as she presented the Union Budget for fourth time.

Title: Govt to boost capital expenditure outlay by 35.4% in FY23 to ₹7.5 lakh crore
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that outlay for capital expenditure in the Union Budget will be stepped up by 35.4% from ₹5.54 lakh crore to ₹7.50 lakh crore in 2022-23. This is 2.9% of the GDP. The effective capital expenditure of the Central government is estimated at ₹10.68 lakh crore in 2022-23 or 4.1% of the GDP, Sitharaman added.

Title: Sensex jumps 850 points ahead of FM Sitharaman's 4th Budget
Content: Sensex jumped more than 850 points to trade above 58,800 levels in early trade on Tuesday ahead of Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's fourth consecutive Union Budget presentation. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 250 points to trade above 17,500. On Monday, Sensex ended 814 points higher after the Economic Survey projected India's GDP growth at 8-8.5% in 2022-23.

Title: Finance Minister Sitharaman uses 'Made In India' tablet for paperless Budget
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman carried the Union Budget 2022-23 in a paperless format in a 'Made in India' tablet kept inside a red cover with National Emblem embossed on it. It's the second straight year Sitharaman is using a 'Made in India' tablet to present the Budget. "From 'Bahi Khata' to 'Made in India' tablet," Digital India's Twitter account tweeted.

Title: PLI Scheme in 14 sectors to create 60 lakh jobs in next 5 years: FM
Content: While presenting the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme in 14 sectors received an excellent response. This has the potential to create 60 lakh new jobs and additional production of ₹30 lakh crore during the next five years, she added. She presented the Budget using a 'Made in India' tablet.

Title: Wordle has gotten bigger than I ever imagined: Game's creator as NYT buys it
Content: The New York Times has purchased the viral word game Wordle, created by engineer Josh Wardle, for an undisclosed seven-figure sum. The game, which challenges players to find a five-letter word in six guesses, was released in October 2021 and has millions of players. Wardle said, "The game has gotten bigger than I ever imagined," adding that this is "overwhelming".

Title: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman pictured with tablet ahead of presenting Budget
Content: Ahead of presenting the Budget 2022-23, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was pictured with a tablet, in a red coloured cover, outside the Ministry of Finance on Tuesday. Sitharaman replaced the traditional leather briefcase with a traditional red cloth ‘bahi khata’ in 2019 and 2020. In 2021, she read out the Budget from a tablet as it went paperless.

Title: Work from home extended for 50% of govt staff below Under Secy level till Feb 15
Content: The government has extended work from home for 50% of its employees below the level of Under Secretary till February 15, as per an order. Earlier, the government extended work from home for these employees till January 31 amid a COVID-19 surge. All officers of the level of Under Secretary and above are to attend office regularly, the order stated.

Title: India to grow at 9.27% in FY22, highest among all large economies: FM Sitharaman
Content: During her Union Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that India is estimated to grow at 9.27% in 2021-22, which is the "highest among all large economies". "We are in a strong position to withstand challenges due to higher vaccinations," Sitharaman added. The FM further said that Union Budget 2022-23 "will steer the economy towards India @100".

Title: SC sets aside Delhi HC orders passed in Future-Amazon dispute; asks for fresh decision
Content: The Supreme Court has set aside earlier orders of Delhi High Court passed in Future-Amazon dispute. It asked Delhi High Court for fresh decision on merit. Orders by Delhi High Court initiated steps against the Future group companies and its promoters Biyanis for alleged violation of the Emergency Award passed by the Singapore Tribunal on the application filed by Amazon.

Title: FM will present inclusive budget in line with all sectors' needs: MoS Finance
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present an inclusive budget, in line with each and every sector's needs, Pankaj Chaudhary, Minister of State for Finance, said ahead of the Union Budget presentation. ''The budget will be benefiting everyone...all sectors (including farmers) should have expectations from it,'' he added.

Title: Support MSMEs, rationalise tax: Padma Shri Prahlad Rai Agarwala to govt
Content: The government should focus on developing the best healthcare facilities and should support MSMEs as it is the backbone of our economy, Padma Shri Prahlad Rai Agarwala said ahead of Union Budget. There should be rationalisation of tax and GST should be withdrawn from the textile industry as it provides maximum employment, the Chairman of Rupa & Company added.

Title: Hope FM Sitharaman delivers a feel-good Budget: Mazumdar-Shaw
Content: Ahead of the upcoming Budget 2022, Biocon's Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said everyone is hoping it will deliver good news, adding, she hopes Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman delivers a "feel-good" Budget. "The faster we open up...economy the better it is for...economic revival," she added. She also posted a list of three wishes and discussed ways to address them all.

Title: Economic Survey projects 8-8.5% GDP growth for 2022-23
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday tabled the Economic Survey 2021-22 prepared by Principal Economic Adviser Sanjeev Sanyal, which predicted a GDP growth of 8-8.5% for the upcoming financial year. The Indian economy is set to grow at 9.2% in the current fiscal year, the survey stated. India's GDP grew by 8.4% in the July-September quarter.

Title: Fundraising from IPOs hit decade high in first 8 months of FY22: Economic Survey
Content: The Economic Survey 2021-22 said 75 companies raised ₹89,066 crore through IPOs between April-November 2021. "The money raised by IPOs has been greater than what has been raised in any year in last decade by a large margin," it added. "2021-22...has been an exceptional year...with a boom in fundraising through IPOs by many new-age companies/tech startups/unicorns," the survey said.

Title: Delhi replaces Bengaluru as startup capital, adds 5,000 in nearly 3 years
Content: The Economic Survey 2021-22 said that Delhi has replaced Bengaluru as the startup capital of India over the recent years. Between April 2019 to December 2021, 5,000 recognised startups were added in Delhi while 4,514 startups were added in Bengaluru, the survey stated. With a total of 11,308 startups, Maharashtra has the highest number of recognised startups.

Title: Better.com employees 'leaving in droves' after CEO who fired 900 returns: Report
Content: Employees at US-based online mortgage lender Better.com are "leaving in droves" after Vishal Garg returned to the company as CEO after a break from full-time duties, TechCrunch reported. Garg had taken a leave of absence after criticism over firing 900 employees over a Zoom call in December 2021. An employee said Garg is paranoid about information being leaked to media.

Title: Bharti Airtel to buy 25% stake in tech startup Lavelle Networks
Content: Bharti Airtel on Monday announced that it has entered into an agreement to acquire nearly 25% stake in Bengaluru-based technology startup Lavelle Networks. The company did not disclose the financial details of the deal. The agreement is subject to applicable statutory approvals, Bharti Airtel said. Founded in 2015, Lavelle Networks specialises in Software-defined Wide Area Network solutions.

Title: 28 lakh street vendors have received ₹2,900 crore monetary aid from govt: Prez
Content: President Ram Nath Kovind, while addressing both Houses on Monday, said that, so far, 28 lakh street vendors have received monetary support worth over ₹2,900 crore under the PM SVANidhi scheme. The government is also connecting street vendors with online companies, he added. The President further said that the Jan Dhan-Aadhaar-Mobile (JAM) trinity's impact, to empower citizens, can be seen.

Title: Why has the Economic Survey projected GDP growth at 8-8.5% in FY23?
Content: The Economic Survey, which pegged India's GDP growth for FY23 at 8-8.5%, expects growth to be supported by vaccine coverage, easing of regulations and scope for fiscal space. The projection is based on assumption that there'll be no further debilitating COVID-19-led economic disruptions, oil prices will range from $70-75/bbl, global supply chain disruptions will ease and monsoon will be normal.

Title: Power sector workers to hold nationwide protest against privatisation on Feb 1
Content: All India Power Engineers Federation has said that power sector workers will hold a nationwide protest against the government's privatisation policies on February 1 on the call of the National Coordination Committee of Electricity Employees & Engineers. They are demanding withdrawal of Electricity (Amendment) Bill 2021 and no privatisation of profit-making power departments in Union Territories.

Title: India to remain fastest growing major economy in 2021-24: Economic Survey
Content: The Economy Survey tabled by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India has fiscal space to provide additional support to the economy and is projected to be the world's fastest growing major economy in 2021-24. The survey was quoting IMF's latest outlook, which projected India's GDP growth at 9% in both 2021-22 and 2022-23 and at 7.1% in 2023-24.

Title: What are the key takeaways from the Economic Survey 2021-22?
Content: Economic Survey 2021-22 said India's economy is estimated to grow by 9.2% in real terms in 2021-22 subsequent to a contraction of 7.3% in 2020-21, while GDP is projected to grow by 8-8.5% in 2022-23. "This implies overall economic activity has recovered past the pre-pandemic levels," it said. Retail inflation moderates to 5.2% in 2021-22 (April-December) YoY from 6.6%.

Title: Finance Minister Sitharaman pictured with CBDT budget team on Budget eve
Content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, MoS Finance Pankaj Chaudhary and MoS Finance Bhagwat Kishanrao Karad were pictured with the CBDT budget team on the Union Budget 2022-23 eve on Monday. The Income Tax Department's official Twitter handle shared the picture. Finance Secretary TV Somanathan, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj, CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra and others were also seen in the picture.

Title: UAE govt to charge corporate tax on business profits from June 2023
Content: UAE, known as a tax haven and the regional headquarters for many multinational corporations, will tax business profits of over 3,75,000 dirhams (approximately ₹76.18 lakh) at 9% from June 2023. The move would pave the way for the introduction of a global minimum tax rate, UAE government said. UAE earlier switched Friday-Saturday weekends to Saturday-Sunday to align with global markets.

Title: Tokyo's population drops for the first time in 26 years
Content: Japan's capital Tokyo's population dropped by about 48,600 people to under 1.4 crore at the start of 2022 in the first decline in Tokyo's population in 26 years, Bloomberg reported citing Tokyo Metropolitan Government data. It comes as more companies turned to remote work amid COVID-19. A government survey showed 55% of companies in Tokyo have tried remote working practices.

Title: Services sector hardest hit by COVID-19, to grow by 8.2% in FY22: Economic Survey
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the Economic Survey 2021-22 on Monday, which said that the services sector has been the hardest hit by the COVID-19 pandemic, especially segments that involve human contact. The sector is estimated to grow by 8.2% this financial year, the survey said. It further predicted that India's agriculture sector will grow by 3.9% in 2021-22.

Title: India became 4th largest forex reserves holder in world in FY22: Economic Survey
Content: The Economic Survey 2021-22 said that India became the fourth-largest foreign exchange reserves holder in the world after China, Japan, and Switzerland as of end November 2021. "Despite all the disruptions caused by the global pandemic, India's balance of payments remained in surplus throughout the last two years," it added. This allowed RBI to keep accumulating forex reserves, it said.

Title: Sensex ends 814 points higher a day before Union Budget 2022-23
Content: The Sensex ended 814 points higher on Monday, a day before the Budget presentation by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. Sensex surged over 1,000 points during intraday trade to eventually close at 58,014, while Nifty 50 ended 238 points higher at 17,340. Earlier in the day, Sitharaman tabled the Economic Survey 2021-22, which projected India's GDP growth at 8-8.5% in 2022-23.

Title: India needs to be wary of imported inflation: Economic Survey
Content: The Economic Survey 2021-22 has said that India needs to be wary of imported inflation, especially from elevated global energy prices. "India's CPI inflation stood at 5.6% year-on-year in December 2021 which is within the targeted tolerance band," it stated. "WPI, however, has been running in double-digits...This is partly due to base effects that will even out," the survey added.

Title: Time taken for patent application process fell to 42 months in 2020: Govt
Content: Principal Economic Advisor Sanjeev Sanyal said the time taken for processing a patent application reduced to 42 months in 2020 from 64 months in 2017 and 52 months in 2019. The number of patents granted increased in last 10 years from 7,509 to 28,391, he added. Notably, the share of patents filed by Indian residents increased to 41.5% in 2020-21.

Title: Tata Motors reports net loss of ₹1,516 cr in Q3, 4.5% drop in revenues
Content: Tata Motors posted a consolidated net loss of ₹1,516.14 crore for Q3 FY22 as compared with profit after tax of ₹2,906.45 crore in Q3 FY21. It also reported a 4.5% YoY decline in consolidated revenues to ₹72,229 crore. Overall, the company posted a consolidated operating profit of ₹7,400 crore and a fall of 460 basis points in margin to 10.2%.

Title: Time for contrition and change: Chidambaram on Economic Survey
Content: Former Finance Minister and Congress leader P Chidambaram said it is time for "contrition and change (of approach), not for boasts and no change" after Economic Survey 2022's release. He said, "The two years (of the pandemic) have impoverished people: millions of jobs have been lost; 84% households have suffered loss of income; 4.6 crore have been pushed into poverty."

Title: India's export sector to drive growth revival in FY23: Economic Survey
Content: Resilience of India's export sector bodes well for economic growth revival in FY23, the Economic Survey tabled in the Parliament said. India has so far exported goods worth $301.4 billion, which is more than 75% of FY22's year-long export target of $400 billion. Exports have been bolstered by factors like recovery in key markets, increased consumer spending, the Survey noted.

Title: Economy little short of pre-pandemic levels: Principal Economic Advisor
Content: Principal Economic Advisor Sanjeev Sanyal said that the Indian economy is just a little short of where it was pre-pandemic. He added that even though health cost of the second COVID-19 wave was more severe, the economic cost was milder. He expects the Indian economy to have grown by 9.2% this year after a 7.3% contraction in the previous year.

Title: Govt collects ₹1.38 lakh cr as GST in January, marks 15% YoY increase
Content: The Centre's gross GST revenue for January 2022 rose 15% YoY to ₹1,38,394 crore, the Ministry of Finance said. This is the fourth consecutive month that GST collection has crossed the ₹1.30 lakh crore mark, with ₹1.17 lakh crore gross GST revenue collected in September 2021. The highest monthly GST collection at ₹1.39 lakh crore was recorded in April 2021.

Title: FY22's health expenditure expected to be ₹4.72 lakh cr, 73% more than FY20's
Content: The Centre's expenditure on the health sector during FY22 is projected to increase by 73% to ₹4.72 lakh crore when compared with FY20, the Economic Survey said. "Although the pandemic has affected almost all social services, yet the health sector was the worst hit," it added. The government expenditure on the health sector was ₹2.73 lakh crore in FY20 (pre-COVID).

Title: Centre on track to meet FY22 fiscal deficit target: Economic Survey
Content: The Economic Survey 2021-22 said that India is on its way to meet the fiscal deficit target of FY22. Budget 2021 had set a target of 6.8% of FY22's GDP, a reduction of 240 basis points as compared to FY21's fiscal deficit of 9.2% of GDP. In FY22's first eight months, fiscal deficit amounted to 46.2% of the full-year target.

Title: $1.4 trillion investment on infra needed to achieve $5 trillion GDP by FY25
Content: The Economic Survey said that India needs to invest $1.4 trillion on infrastructure by 2024-25 to achieve a GDP of $5 trillion. India invested $1.1 trillion on infrastructure between financial years 2008 and 2017. "The challenge is to step up infrastructure investment substantially," the Survey said and added that the National Infrastructure Pipeline (NIP) was launched keeping this in mind.

Title: Tata Steel Long Products wins bid to buy Neelachal Ispat for ₹12,100 cr
Content: The government on Monday announced that Tata Steel Long Products has emerged as the successful bidder for Neelachal Ispat Nigam Limited. The company outbid JSW Steel and a consortium of Jindal Steel and Power and Nalwa Steel and Power. Tata Steel Long Products will acquire a 93.71% stake in the Neelachal for ₹12,100 crore, the Ministry of Finance said.

Title: Let reason & science prevail: Mahindra on Covid-related things that 'don't make sense'
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra shared a cardiologist's post mentioning Covid-19-related things that don't make sense and tweeted, "Good points. Let reason and Science prevail now." According to the cardiologist, masking kids and teachers in school, routine school testing, virtual classes, masking door to table in restaurants and current Chinese policy among other things don't make sense.

Title: H-1B visa registrations for fiscal year 2023 to start from March 1: US
Content: The US Citizenship and Immigration Services has announced that the initial registrations for H-1B visas for the fiscal year 2023 will be functional from March 1-18, 2022. In December 2021, the US waived the in-person interview requirement for H-1B visa owing to the pandemic. The H-1B visa is a non-immigrant visa that allows US companies to employ foreign workers.

Title: BharatPe's Ashneer praises Uday Kotak despite tussle, calls him a 'legend'
Content: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover praised Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak in a comment on a LinkedIn post about Kotak. "Uday Kotak is a legend...I had the fortune of starting my career in Kotak, 7 years, and can tell you no one understands or does finance better in India," Grover commented. Grover's response comes despite his tussle with the bank.

Title: Who are the members of the team behind Union Budget 2022-23?
Content: The team that helped Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepare the Union Budget includes Finance Secretary TV Somanathan, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj and Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth. It also includes Disinvestment Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey and Financial Services Secretary Debasish Panda. V Anantha Nageswaran was appointed as Chief Economic Adviser, few days ahead of the Budget.

Title: SBI withdraws rule which called women pregnant over 3 months 'unfit' amid criticism
Content: SBI on Saturday withdrew its earlier issued circular which declared women pregnant over three months “temporarily unfit” for service at the bank. In a statement, the bank said, "In view of the public sentiments, SBI has decided to keep the revised instructions regarding recruitment of pregnant women candidates in abeyance and continue with the existing instructions in the matter."

Title: No employee fired: BharatPe amid rumours after Ashneer, wife's voluntary leave
Content: Amid rumours of BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover's services being terminated, the company issued a statement and said that no employee has been fired and reports suggesting any termination are "untrue." It further said, "No action has been taken or will be taken till the audit has been completed." Grover's wife has also gone on leave amid scrutiny over BharatPe’s practices.

Title: Rename tests, they're hurting our reputation: Power producer NTPC to Railways
Content: India's largest energy conglomerate NTPC Ltd asked the Indian Railways to rename the Non-Technical Popular Categories (NTPC) tests organised by the Railway Recruitment Board. The request comes amid large-scale protests over Railways' alleged certain irregularities in its screening process. "NTPC Limited has inadvertently been caught in the crossfire...it's hurting our reputation," NTPC Ltd said.

Title: Wealth of Asia's 20 richest families led by Ambanis $495 bn, more than Hong Kong's GDP
Content: Asia's 20 richest families led by Mukesh Ambani's family jointly control $495 billion wealth, more than the gross domestic product of Hong Kong or Singapore, according to Bloomberg. Ambanis led the list for the third year running with $90.3 billion in wealth. They are followed by Indonesia's Hartono family worth $36.3 billion and India's Mistry family worth $34 billion.

Title: Govt extends tenure of IPO-bound LIC's Chairman by 1 year: Report
Content: The government has extended the tenure of IPO-bound LIC's Chairman MR Kumar by one more year, PTI reported. Kumar, whose tenure has been extended for the second time, will now reportedly continue as LIC Chairman till March 2023. LIC's IPO is likely to be India's biggest-ever and the government may seek a valuation of ₹15 lakh crore, Bloomberg earlier reported.

Title: Sensex jumps 1,000 points ahead of Economic Survey 2021-22
Content: Indian benchmark indices were trading in the green on Monday ahead of the Economic Survey 2021-22. Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to trade at 58,200 levels, while broader Nifty 50 jumped over 290 points to trade near 17,400. This year the Economic Survey, which is presented a day before Union Budget, is reportedly likely to have a single volume.

Title: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley CEOs become best-paid US banks' CEOs
Content: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon will receive $35 million in compensation for 2021, up from $17.5 million a year ago. He was required to return a third of his pay last year as penalty for the bank's role in an international bribery scandal. Solomon is now tied with Morgan Stanley's James Gorman as the highest-paid CEOs at major US banks.

Title: Everyone on Shark Tank India set calls me 'Basanti': Namita Thapar
Content: Shark Tank India's Namita Thapar, the executive director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, has revealed that everyone on the set of the show calls her 'Basanti' as she is a chatterbox. She further said she is a film buff and loves 'Sholay'. Her children Jai and Vir are named after the film's lead characters portrayed by Amitabh Bachchan and Dharmendra, Namita added.

Title: Telcos must offer at least 1 recharge plan with 30-day validity: TRAI
Content: Telecom regulator TRAI has directed telecom companies to offer at least one plan voucher, one special tariff voucher and one combo voucher with 30-day validity. At least one plan voucher, one special tariff voucher, one combo voucher renewable on same date of every month must also be offered. "This would...facilitate consumers in making a more informed tariff-related choice," TRAI said.

Title: T-Mobile to fire US corporate staff who aren't vaccinated by April
Content: Wireless carrier T-Mobile US will fire corporate employees who aren't fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by April 2. In an email to its US employees, the company said that employees who haven't received the first dose of vaccine by February 21 will be placed on unpaid leave. The policy applies to employees who need regular or occasional access to T-Mobile offices.

Title: IMF urges El Salvador to dissolve $150 million Bitcoin trust fund
Content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has urged El Salvador to dissolve $150 million Bitcoin trust fund and return any of those unused funds to its treasury. It recommended ending the offer of $30 as incentive for people to start using digital wallet Chivo. "In near-term, the actual costs of implementing Chivo and operationalising Bitcoin law exceed potential benefits," it added.

Title: Applications for 6,000 patents, 20,000 trademarks filed in FY22: Prez
Content: Addressing both Houses of Parliament ahead of Budget session, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "The government has relaxed various norms in the patents and trademarks sector." "We have already witnessed 6,000 applications for patents and 20,000 applications for trademarks in 2021-22," he added. The President further said India has become one of the fastest growing economies of the world.

Title: Prioritise job creation, infra development: Mercedes-Benz India to govt
Content: Mercedes-Benz India in its Budget recommendation asked the government to aim at long-term growth for the auto industry prioritising job creation, infrastructure development and introduction of latest technologies. "With stable policies and a clear road map...an accelerated growth can be achieved transitioning the industry swiftly into...e-mobility era," Mercedes-Benz India MD Martin Schwenk said.

Title: No 'Zero Hour' & 'Question Hour' in Parliament on Jan 31, Feb 1
Content: Parliament's Budget session will not have 'Zero Hour' and 'Question Hour' on January 31 and February 1 due to the address of President Ram Nath Kovind and presentation of Union Budget 2022. Matters of urgent public importance are raised during the 'Zero Hour', while 'Question Hour' allows MPs to ask questions to ministers.

Title: India's exports to China jump 34% from 2019 to $22.9 billion
Content: India's exports to China have surged about 34% to $22.9 billion in 2021 from $17.1 billion in 2019, according to Commerce Ministry data. Imports also increased by 28% to $87.5 billion last year compared to $68.4 billion in 2019, the data showed. India's trade deficit with China widened to $64.5 billion in 2021, as per the data.

Title: RBI imposes withdrawal cap of ₹1 lakh on Indian Mercantile Co-op Bank
Content: The RBI announced that it has imposed several restrictions on Lucknow-based Indian Mercantile Co-operative Bank including a cap of ₹1 lakh on withdrawals. The bank will not, without its prior approval, grant or renew any loans and advances, or make any investment, RBI said in a statement. The bank will continue to undertake banking business with restrictions, RBI clarified.

Title: Real estate body urges govt to reduce short-term capital gains tax in Budget
Content: Federation of All India Real Estate Association (FAIRA) has urged government to bring down short-term capital gains tax from 30% to 20% in upcoming Budget. It sought an increase in home loan interest deduction from ₹2 lakh to ₹5 lakh for tax rebate. "If...Budget can offer SOPs to make investment in housing more attractive...real estate sector will boom," it added.

Title: World is awash in capital, rarely been a better time to be entrepreneur: KM Birla
Content: Aditya Birla Group's billionaire Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla shared his reflections for 2021-22 and said, "The world is awash in capital and there has perhaps rarely been a better time to be an entrepreneur." He further wrote, "The competition for investment opportunities and the Fear of Missing Out (FOMO) have driven up valuations of many fledgling companies to stratospheric levels."

Title: India needs to invest 3% of GDP in research: Infosys Co-founder
Content: Infosys Co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan speaking about his expectations from the upcoming Budget said India needs to invest about 3% of its GDP (gross domestic product) in research. "Currently, India invests about 0.7% of GDP in research," he added. "This is the direction India needs to take and get there in the next two to three years," Gopalakrishnan told Financial Express.

Title: EPFO onboards Air India, 7,453 staff to get social security benefits
Content: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has onboarded Air India for social security coverage after Tata Group's takeover of the airline. The social security benefits will be provided to around 7,453 Air India employees. These employees will receive an extra 2% employer's contributions in their Provident Fund accounts at 12% of their wages and a guaranteed minimum pension of ₹1,000.

Title: Govt allows 2 states to borrow additional ₹7,309 cr for reforms
Content: The Finance Ministry granted additional borrowing permission of ₹7,309 crore to Rajasthan and Andhra Pradesh on Friday for undertaking stipulated power sector reforms. The Ministry has allowed Rajasthan to borrow ₹5,186 crore and Andhra Pradesh to take ₹2,123 crore. Apart from these two states, nine other states have also submitted their proposals to the Ministry of Power for additional borrowing.

Title: Direct DMRC to deposit ₹6,208 cr into escrow account: DAMEPL to HC
Content: Delhi Airport Metro Express (DAMEPL) has filed an application requesting the Delhi High Court to direct Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to deposit ₹6,208 crore available in its various bank accounts into project escrow account. The Reliance Infrastructure arm has also rejected any out of court negotiations or settlement or assignment of debt to the DMRC in its fresh application.

Title: 38% global emissions caused by construction, operation of buildings: WEF
Content: According to the World Economic Forum, the construction and operation of buildings are responsible for 38% of global emissions. There's an urgent need for solutions to help accelerate decarbonisation of the urban-built environment to limit the global temperature rise to below 1.5°C, the forum said. WEF also noted that there's an urgent need to accelerate investment to implement these solutions.

Title: Investor once refused to meet me, he wanted to talk business with a man: Vineeta Singh
Content: Sugar Cosmetics co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh, who appears on Shark Tank India, spoke about facing sexism in an interaction with Humans of Bombay. "Once, an investor refused to hold a meeting just with me. He wanted to have the business talk with a 'man'," she stated. "I decided to let my work do the talking," said Vineeta.

Title: There were times when I'd be pumping breast milk & handling office calls: Vineeta Singh
Content: Sugar Cosmetics Co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh, who appears on Shark Tank India, spoke to Humans of Bombay about juggling motherhood and career. "There were times when I'd be pumping breast milk...handling office calls, all the while hoping to not wake my son up," she said. "I walk into...office with...files in one hand and my baby in another," Vineeta added.

Title: Lived in matchbox house in Mumbai which would flood during monsoon: Vineeta Singh
Content: Speaking to Humans of Bombay, Sugar Cosmetics co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh, who appears on Shark Tank India, said, "At 23, I moved to Bombay. I lived in a matchbox house which would flood during monsoon." "My savings were diminishing...But I pushed on," she added. Vineeta further revealed she got a "great job offer" after MBA but she declined it.

Title: No plans to build our own smartphone device: Bharti Airtel CEO
Content: Bharti Airtel has no plans to build their own smartphone device, the company's CEO for India and South Asia Gopal Vittal said. On Friday, Bharti Airtel announced that Google will invest up to $1 billion in the company, including $700 million for a 1.28% stake. Speaking about Google's investment in Bharti Airtel, Vittal said there's "absolutely zero conflict of interest".

Title: Gold will become cool, when crypto becomes uncool: Zerodha Co-founder
Content: Stock brokerage platform Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath told Moneycontrol that gold has proved itself to be a "good hedge" against inflation. "Gold, in my mind, will become cool when cryptocurrencies become uncool," he said. Speaking of the recent crash in cryptocurrency prices, he added, "If that crash were to speed up I think gold will...start becoming more attractive again."

Title: BharatPe starts independent audit of internal systems amid Ashneer's voluntary leave
Content: BharatPe Board has initiated an independent audit of the firm's internal systems and controls. Through its legal firm Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas, BharatPe has appointed risk advisory firm "to advise the Board on its recommendations," a statement said. This comes days after Co-founder Ashneer Grover went on voluntary leave following alleged use of inappropriate language against Kotak Group staff.

Title: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer's wife also goes on leave amid governance probe: Report
Content: After BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover went on voluntary leave, his wife has also gone on leave amid the board's review of internal governance process, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Madhuri Jain Grover heads Controls at BharatPe. "This isn't about a legal notice to Uday Kotak anymore...[It] shows the scope of the board's investigation has widened," a source was quoted as saying.

Title: How has Union Budget presentation evolved over the years?
Content: Until 2018, then Finance Minister Arun Jaitley carried Budget documents in a leather briefcase, sticking to a British tradition, and so did Piyush Goyal in his 2019 interim Budget. FM Nirmala Sitharaman replaced the briefcase with a traditional red cloth 'bahi khata' in 2019 and 2020. In 2021, Sitharaman read out the Budget from a tablet as it went paperless.

Title: Who is IIM alumnus V Anantha Nageswaran, the new Chief Economic Advisor?
Content: The new Chief Economic Advisor, Dr V Anantha Nageswaran, was Dean of the IFMR Graduate School of Business and a Visiting Professor of Economics at Krea University. He holds a Post-Graduate Diploma in Management from IIM-Ahmedabad and a doctoral degree from the University of Massachusetts. He was a part-time member of the Economic Advisory Council to the PM from 2019-21.

Title: Dr V Anantha Nageswaran appointed as India's new Chief Economic Advisor
Content: The Union Finance Ministry on Friday announced that the government has appointed Dr V Anantha Nageswaran as the new Chief Economic Advisor. "Prior to this appointment, Dr Nageswaran has worked as a writer, author, teacher and consultant. He has taught at several business schools and institutes of management in India and in Singapore and has published extensively," the ministry said.

Title: Anti-women: DCW on SBI's rule preventing women over 3 months pregnant from joining
Content: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) issued a notice to State Bank of India (SBI), seeking withdrawal of revised guidelines that prevent women who are over three-month pregnant from joining service. DCW Chairperson Swati Maliwal termed SBI's new guidelines "anti-women rule" and said that they are both discriminatory and illegal. In their guidelines, SBI had also termed those women "temporarily unfit".

Title: 'Woman over 3 months pregnant temporarily unfit', says SBI's new hiring rule
Content: India's largest lender SBI has put in place new recruitment rules under which a woman candidate who's over three months pregnant will be considered "temporarily unfit". "She may be allowed to join within four months after delivery of child," SBI's guidelines said. Earlier, women candidates with up to six months of pregnancy were recruited subject to various conditions.

Title: China jails 47 steel executives for up to 1.5 years for faking emissions data
Content: China has announced jail for 47 officials from four steel mills in Tangshan city and a fine of up to $1.1 million for two companies, for faking air pollution data. They were given prison sentences from six months to one-and-a-half years, court documents showed. The officials interfered with monitoring devices to allow release of large quantities of pollutants in 2021.

Title: I was a young TCS intern then: Tata Sons Chairman on his 1st Air India flight in 1986
