Content: After taking over Air India, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran wrote on LinkedIn that his first flight was on Air India in December 1986. "I was a young intern then, at Tata Consultancy Services. I vividly recall, even after all this time, how I felt that day," he added. He said he was excited and "it was a special experience".

Title: Air India seeks to settle $1.2 billion lawsuit in US citing new owner: Reports
Content: After Tata Group's takeover, Air India is reportedly seeking to end a case filed by Devas Multimedia in a US court, arguing that recent change in ownership prevents demands over recovery of arbitration awards. Devas demanded $1.2 billion from Indian government and sought to seize Air India's overseas assets by calling the carrier an alter ego of Indian government.

Title: Tech tycoon Lynch's extradition to US to face criminal charges approved
Content: The UK government has approved tech tycoon Mike Lynch's extradition to the US to face criminal fraud charges. Lynch can appeal the order and a separate court's decision allowing his extradition. Prior to the extradition ruling, a London judge ruled the tech tycoon was dishonest in the $11 billion sale of his company to Hewlett Packard in 2011.

Title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie sold Amazon stock worth $8.5 bn last year
Content: World's fifth-richest woman MacKenzie Scott cut her stake in Amazon by 2.5 million shares worth as much as $8.5 billion last year, Bloomberg reported citing regulatory filings. She still holds 14.9 million Amazon shares and has a net worth of $48.3 billion. Scott has donated over $8.6 billion to charities since her divorce from Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in 2019.

Title: HP wins fraud case against UK tech tycoon Lynch over Autonomy deal
Content: Hewlett Packard has won most of its civil case against British tech tycoon Mike Lynch over its acquisition of Autonomy in 2011, a London judge ruled. HP had sued Lynch alleging he had fraudulently inflated the value of Autonomy before selling it to HP. The judge said HP will likely receive less than the $5 billion it demanded in damages.

Title: Canadian truckers rule: Musk as drivers protest COVID-19 vaccine mandate
Content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk voiced his support for Canadian truck drivers protesting against the country's COVID-19 vaccine mandate for cross-border truck drivers. "Canadian truckers rule," Musk tweeted. In a recent interview with TIME magazine, Musk said that while he and his eligible children are vaccinated, he opposes vaccine mandates and called them an "erosion of freedom".

Title: Budget should boost demand by offering tax reliefs to households: Report
Content: India's Budget should focus on supporting the pandemic-hit economy and boost consumption demand by offering income tax reliefs and lowering taxes on oil products, a report by India Ratings said. The report expects the government to delay fiscal consolidation and make it a gradual and calibrated process. The report also called for setting pragmatic disinvestment targets.

Title: Govt plans $40 bn for food, fertiliser subsidy in Budget: Report
Content: The government is planning to set aside about ₹3 lakh crore ($40 billion) on food and fertiliser subsidies in its Budget for 2022-23, reported Reuters citing sources. About ₹1.1 lakh crore will be allocated to fertiliser subsidies and ₹2 lakh crore to food subsidies, the report said. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is due to present the Budget on February 1.

Title: Air India will regain lost place in domestic, int'l skies: Scindia
Content: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia wished Tata Group, the new owners of Air India, the very best and said, "I'm very confident that under their stewardship and leadership...they will make a great success of Air India." Scindia told Hindustan Times, "Air India will regain its lost place not only in our domestic skies, but in international skies as well."

Title: It has been a roller coaster ride: DIPAM Secy on Air India sale
Content: Speaking about the official hand over of Air India to the Tata Group, DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said, "I feel very relieved today; it has been a roller coaster ride with legal challenges." He said Devas Multimedia had emerged as one of the main hurdles for the deal. Devas had dubbed the airline "alter ego" of India, he added.

Title: Take action to address inefficiencies in banking sector: USISPF to govt
Content: The US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) in its Budget recommendations asked government to take urgent action to address the distortions and inefficiencies arising out of regulatory mandates in banking sector. Its other suggestions included a commitment to global tax norms, specific steps to promote digital solutions like developing inter-operable QR codes and digitising B2B payments.

Title: H&M reports $640 mn profit in Q4, aims to double sales by 2030
Content: Swedish fashion group H&M reported a 64% jump in its pre-tax profit to $640 million in the fourth quarter compared to the same period last year. The company said that it will increase its investments to about $10 billion in 2022 with the aim of doubling sales by 2030. After the announcement, H&M's shares rose by 5% in early trade.

Title: India's gold demand surged 78.6% to 797 tonnes in 2021: WGC
Content: India's gold consumption surged by 78.6% to 797.3 tonnes in 2021 compared to 446.4 tonnes during 2020, according to the World Gold Council. "The spurt in demand...is less likely to be repeated this year, though the revival will continue to set a new normal," WGC's India MD Somasundaram PR said. The jewellery demand in India surged 93% in 2021.

Title: Adani Wilmar's ₹3,600-crore IPO fully subscribed on day 2
Content: The ₹3,600-crore IPO of Adani Wilmar was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding as it received bids for 13.05 crore shares against an offer size of 12.25 crore shares. The portion of the IPO reserved for retail investors was subscribed 1.76 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 0.84 times as of 4 pm on Friday.

Title: Google to invest up to $1 billion in Bharti Airtel, buy 1.28% stake
Content: Bharti Airtel has announced that Google will invest up to $1 billion in the company as part of its Google for India Digitization Fund. The deal includes $700 million investment to acquire 1.28% stake in Bharti Airtel and up to $300 million towards implementing various commercial agreements. The companies will focus on enabling affordable access to smartphones across price ranges.

Title: Maha passes proposal to allow wine sale at supermarkets & walk-in stores
Content: Maharashtra Cabinet passed a proposal to allow selling wine at supermarkets and walk-in stores. The stores' area should be over 1,000 square feet and should be registered under Maharashtra Shops and Establishments Act. However, those near places of worship won't be allowed to sell wine. Condemning the move, former CM Devendra Fadnavis said, "We won't allow Maharashtra to become 'Madya'Rashtra."

Title: Bharat Biotech's intranasal COVID-19 vaccine approved for booster dose trials
Content: The Drugs Controller General of India on Friday permitted Bharat Biotech to conduct trials for its intranasal COVID-19 booster dose. As per reports, the trials for the first-of-its-kind dose will be conducted at nine different sites in India. Over 1 crore precautionary or booster doses have been administered to the eligible population so far, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said today.

Title: Elon Musk calls Biden a 'sock puppet', says he's treating Americans like 'fools'
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk said Joe Biden is a "damp sock puppet in human form" after the US President left Tesla out of a discussion about electric vehicle production. "Companies like General Motors and Ford are building more electric vehicles here at home than ever before," Biden said. In another tweet, Musk said, "Biden is treating...American public like fools."

Title: Zuckerberg drops below Warren Buffett on rich list, loses $15 bn this year
Content: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett has become richer than Facebook parent Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg again amid a slump in global tech stocks. Zuckerberg's fortune has fallen by $15.2 billion to $110 billion in 2022 so far, according to Bloomberg. Meanwhile, Buffett's fortune has surged by $2.4 billion this year to $111 billion, making him the world's sixth richest person.

Title: Google increases leave for all employees who give birth to 24 weeks
Content: Google on Thursday announced that it has expanded parental leave from 12 weeks to 18 weeks for all employees globally. For employees who give birth, their leave has been hiked from 18 weeks to 24 weeks. The tech major is also increasing employees' paid vacation time to a minimum of 20 days a year, up from 15, starting April 2.

Title: Honour to be recognised with so many extraordinary people: Nadella on Padma Bhushan
Content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, named among Padma Bhushan awardees, said it's an honour to receive it and "to be recognised with so many extraordinary people". He wrote on Twitter, "I'm thankful to the President, Prime Minister and people of India." Nadella added that he'll continue working with people across India to "help them use technology to achieve more".

Title: Over $100 billion wiped off Tesla's market value in 1 day
Content: Tesla shares dropped by around 12% in a single day on Thursday, wiping out $109 billion off its valuation. This in shares came after Tesla announced its fourth-quarter earnings and near future outlook, with CEO Elon Musk stating that the company would not bring any new vehicles to market this year.

Title: Tata Sons Chairman meets Sitharaman, thanks her for Air India takeover
Content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran met Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday and thanked her "for the successful closure of the Air India transaction". Tata Group acquired 100% stake in Air India from the government after 69 years by bidding ₹18,000 crore. Prior to the official takeover, Chandrasekaran met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Thursday.

Title: Dear guests, welcome aboard this historic flight: Air India's message for flyers today
Content: Passengers travelling aboard Air India flights today will be hearing a new in-flight announcement by pilots before departure, as per an official order that followed Tata Group's takeover. The announcement will be as follows: "Dear guests...Welcome aboard this historic flight, which marks a special event. Today, Air India officially becomes a part of...Tata Group again, after seven decades."

Title: Syndicate of 275 firms involved in fake invoices worth ₹3,189 cr busted
Content: GST officers from the Ghaziabad Regional Unit of the Directorate of Goods and Service Tax Intelligence (DGGI) busted a syndicate of 275 firms involved in fake invoices worth ₹3,189 crore which led to a GST evasion of ₹362 crore. The officers searched two office premises from where various incriminating documents related to over 200 fake firms were recovered.

Title: No halwa ceremony before Budget, staff due for 'lock-in' at workplace get sweets
Content: Sweets were provided to core staff due for 'lock-in' at their work workplace instead of the customary halwa ceremony ahead of the Union Budget 2022-23 amid COVID-19. To maintain the secrecy of the Budget, there's a 'lock-in' of officials involved in making the Budget. Budget Press in North Block houses officials in the period leading up to the Budget presentation.

Title: Supreme Court stays SpiceJet winding up order for 3 weeks
Content: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed the publication of Madras High Court's order on winding up of SpiceJet for three weeks. However, it pulled up the airline over the non-payment of $24 million to Credit Suisse AG and asked it to submit details of its financial status. "Both parties are already in advanced discussions to settle the matter," SpiceJet said.

Title: This isn't the way you run airlines: SC to SpiceJet on Credit Suisse dues
Content: Credit Suisse AG informed the Supreme Court that SpiceJet's current offer over pending dues "isn't even worth mentioning". SC asked SpiceJet, "Do you want to run the show or close it? This isn't the way you can run your airlines. What's your contribution?" After the airline said it's "working something out", court stayed SpiceJet's winding up order for three weeks.

Title: Tata Sons Chairman writes to Air India employees, says entire nation's eyes are on us
Content: In his first communication to Air India employees after taking over the airline, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said, "Entire nation's eyes are on us, waiting to see what we'll achieve together." "I am convinced that the golden age of Air India lies ahead. Our journey towards it starts now," he added. "Welcome. And welcome back," he told the employees.

Title: Your arrival was much awaited: Tata as Air India returns to the group after 69 yrs
Content: Tata Group in a tweet said, "Your arrival was much awaited, Air India," after the airline returned to the group after 69 years on Thursday. Meanwhile, Air India tweeted, "Two iconic names come together to embark on a voyage of excellence." The airline was founded by JRD Tata in 1932 before being converted into a public company.

Title: Bad bank gets all approvals, ₹50,000 crore assets to be transferred initially
Content: SBI Chairman Dinesh Khara has announced that all requisite approvals to commence operations of National Asset Reconstruction Company (NARCL) and India Debt Resolution Company (IDRCL) have been received. In the initial phase, 15 cases worth ₹50,000 crore will be transferred to the proposed bad bank this fiscal. Public sector banks will have a majority stake in NARCL, Khara said.

Title: No better custodian to restore Air India's old glory: Anand Mahindra on Tata Group
Content: Congratulating Tata Group and Air India on their "milestone", Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Air India is a brand that's part of the nation's treasure trove." "There is no better custodian, from the point of view of both passion and resources to restore its old glory," Mahindra said about Tata Group. Tata took over Air India after 69 years.

Title: Apple posts all-time revenue record of $123.9 bn in Dec-quarter
Content: Apple, in its fiscal 2022 first quarter ended December 25, posted an all-time revenue record of $123.9 billion, up 11% year-over-year. Its profit was $34.6 billion, compared to $28.7 billion in the year-ago period. iPads sales fell 14% to $7.25 billion compared with analyst estimates of $8.2 billion, while iPhone revenue rose 9% year-on-year to $71.63 billion.

Title: Electronic goods exports surge 49% YoY to $11 bn in April-Dec 2021
Content: India's electronic goods exports surged 49% YoY to $11 billion in the April-December 2021 period, the Commerce Ministry's data showed on Thursday. India exported electronic goods worth $7.4 billion in the same period in 2020. Exports rose to $1.67 billion in December 2021, a 33.99% YoY growth from $1.25 billion in December 2020.

Title: SoftBank COO to leave firm, reportedly after pay dispute with CEO
Content: SoftBank Group has said its COO, Marcelo Claure, is leaving the firm. The exit comes after dispute with Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son over his pay, Reuters reported citing sources. Claure had been in talks to leave SoftBank for several months and may launch his own investment firm. Claure's deputy, Michel Combes, has been appointed SoftBank Group International's CEO.

Title: Toyota remains world's biggest carmaker as it sells 10.5 mn vehicles in 2021
Content: Toyota Motor sold 10.5 million vehicles in 2021, making it the world's biggest carmaker for a second straight year. The company said that the vehicle sales included those by its affiliates Daihatsu Motors and Hino Motors. Volkswagen, which ranked second in the world in vehicle sales, delivered 8.9 million vehicles last year, marking its lowest sales figures in 10 years.

Title: Retail industry seeks GST reforms, loan moratorium in Budget
Content: Retailers Association of India CEO Kumar Rajagopalan said that the retail industry is seeking a more predictable GST regime, along with a loan moratorium for mall owners in the upcoming Budget. "Many clauses around carrying forward and refund of GST need clarification," Rajagopalan added. Retailers are also expecting announcement of the long-pending National Retail Policy.

Title: Vedant Fashions fixes price band for IPO at ₹824-₹866 per share
Content: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹824-₹866 per share. The issue is an offer for sale of 3,63,64,838 shares and the company will raise ₹3,150 crore at the upper price band. Vedant Fashions' IPO will be the third public issue of 2022 and will open for subscription on February 4.

Title: Karvy Group Chairman and CFO arrested by ED in ₹2,000 crore scam
Content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Karvy Group's Chairman and MD Comandur Parthasarathy and CFO G Hari Krishna in an ongoing ₹2,000 crore security and money laundering case. The accused were allegedly involved in fraud through illegal diversion of clients' securities worth ₹2,873.8 crore and pledging of these securities with banks and NBFCs to seek loans and subsequent loan defaults.

Title: US corporate body congratulates Tata Group for 'homecoming' of Air India
Content: The US-India Business Council has congratulated Tata Group for the "homecoming" of Air India and commended the Indian government for its asset monetisation programme. Meanwhile, US-India Strategic and Partnership Forum's President Mukesh Aghi wrote, "A milestone moment for Tata Companies. Congratulations to Chairman N Chandrasekaran and...Tata Group." Tata took over Air India after 69 years.

Title: Air India officially handed over to Tata Group after 69 years
Content: Air India was officially handed over to Tata Group on Thursday, nearly 69 years after its nationalisation. Ahead of the handover, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran met PM Narendra Modi. Tata Group won the bid to buy the airline, which it founded in 1932, for ₹18,000 crore. It has completed a cash payment of ₹2,700 crore.

Title: Covaxin, Covishield vaccines given 'conditional' market approval by DCGI
Content: Covaxin and Covishield COVID-19 vaccines have received conditional market authorisation from DCGI. Earlier, CDSCO committee recommended upgradation of the status from restricted use in emergency situations with conditions in adults. The authorisation is conditional to submission of ongoing clinical trial data of the vaccine on a six-monthly basis or as and when available, whichever is earlier.

Title: I'm deeply grateful to the President, PM & Indians: Pichai on Padma Bhushan
Content: Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai, named for the Padma Bhushan award, said, "I am deeply grateful to the Padma Awards Committee, the President and Prime Minister, as well as the people of India." He added, "It's made all the more meaningful to be among this esteemed group of individuals who've had a profound impact on their fields and communities."

Title: Headphones maker boAt files papers for ₹2,000-crore IPO
Content: Imagine Marketing, the parent company of headphones and wearables maker boAt, has filed papers with market regulator SEBI for a ₹2,000-crore IPO. It comprises a fresh issue of shares worth up to ₹900 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹1,100 crore. Aman Gupta and Sameer Mehta, who started the company in 2016, will be diluting their stake.

Title: Tata Group to take over Air India today, N Chandrasekaran to meet PM Modi: Reports
Content: Tata Group is likely to take over Air India today (January 27), nearly 69 years after it was taken from the conglomerate, reports said. Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran will reportedly be meeting PM Narendra Modi ahead of the handover and Air India's current board will resign. Tata Sons had won the bid to buy the airline for ₹18,000 crore.

Title: What are IMF's Gita Gopinath's recommendations for India's Union Budget?
Content: IMF's First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath said that India's Union Budget for 2022-23 should address "the very unequal recovery within the economy". The rural jobs guarantee scheme should remain "well-funded" and the government should extend the free food scheme beyond March 2022, India-born Gopinath told BloombergQuint. Spending on healthcare and education also needs attention, she added.

Title: Delighted Air India is back, will create a world-class airline: Tata Sons Chairman
Content: After officially taking over Air India, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said, "We're totally delighted that this process is complete and happy to have Air India back in the Tata Group." "We look forward to working with everyone to create a world-class airline," he added. Tata Group acquired 100% stake in Air India from the government by bidding ₹18,000 crore.

Title: Tata Sons Chairman meets PM Modi before official takeover of Air India
Content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Thursday ahead of Tata Group's official takeover of Air India. The Prime Minister's Office shared a picture of their meeting on Twitter. In October, Tata Group won the bid to acquire Air India for ₹18,000 crore. It will be taking over the airline after nearly 69 years.

Title: Air India will bloom under their wings: Aviation Minister as Tata Group takes over
Content: After Air India was officially handed over to Tata Group, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "Best wishes to the new owners. I am confident...the airline will bloom under their wings." Tata Group won the bid to buy the airline for ₹18,000 crore. "This proves the govt's ability and...resolve to carry out disinvestment effectively in non-strategic sectors," Scindia tweeted.

Title: Thanks for igniting my spark: Nair on leaving Unilever after 30 yrs to be Chanel CEO
Content: Indian-origin Leena Nair, who's leaving Unilever to become Chanel's global CEO, posted a farewell note on Twitter. She wrote, "After thirty years at Unilever, I'm sure you can imagine how hard it is to say goodbye." She called the company "unique and the best place in the world for developing leaders," while adding, "Thank you for igniting my spark."

Title: Barbie maker Mattel wins rights to make Disney Princess toys after 6 years
Content: Barbie maker Mattel has won the rights to produce dolls based on Disney's princess characters, including Frozen's Elsa. Its rival Hasbro took over the Disney Princess and Frozen license in 2016 after Mattel had been making the toys for 20 years. "This is a defining moment in our transformation," CEO Ynon Kreiz said, without revealing the deal's financial terms.

Title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points in early trade, falls below 57,000-mark
Content: The Sensex crashed over 1,000 points during early trade on Thursday amid weak global cues and a possibility of rate hikes by US Federal Reserve from March. The Sensex fell below the 57,000-mark, while the broader Nifty 50 plunged around 300 points to fall below the 17,000-mark. Tata Steel, Titan, Tech Mahindra were among top losers on the Sensex.

Title: Tesla reports $2.32 bn in Q4 profit, to launch no new model this yr
Content: Tesla has reported a net income of $2.32 billion in the fourth quarter, up 760% year-on-year. Its revenue rose by 65% year-on-year to $17.72 billion in the quarter, beating analyst estimates of $16.57 billion. Tesla CEO Elon Musk in the earnings call said the firm will not be introducing new vehicle models this year due to supply chain issues.

Title: Renault-Nissan share plan to spend $26 billion on EVs in next 5 yrs
Content: Renault and Nissan on Thursday shared detailed plans to spend $26 billion on electric vehicles over the next five years and said they will work more closely together to make electric cars. The companies also plan to increase the number of common platforms for EVs to five from four and build a combined EV line-up of 35 vehicles by 2030.

Title: Income tax refunds worth ₹1.62 lakh crore issued so far in FY22
Content: Income Tax department said on Thursday that it has issued refunds worth ₹1.62 lakh crore to 1.79 crore taxpayers so far in FY22. This includes 1.41 crore refunds for FY21. Personal Income Tax refunds of ₹57,754 crore have been issued to over 1.77 crore entities and corporate tax refunds of ₹1.04 lakh crore have been issued in 2.23 lakh cases.

Title: Tata gets loan commitment from SBI-led consortium for Air India: Reports
Content: An SBI-led consortium of lenders has reportedly agreed to provide loans to Tata Group for the smooth operations of its newly acquired airline Air India. The consortium agreed to grant both term loans and working capital loans, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Tata had offered to take over Air India's debt of ₹15,300 crore and pay ₹2,700 crore to the government.

Title: Govt notifies Air India asset transfer agreement with AIAHL
Content: Ahead of Air India's official takeover by Tata Group, the government notified the agreement between the airline and special purpose vehicle AI Assets Holding Limited (AIAHL) for the transfer of non-core assets. The government set up AIAHL in 2019 for holding debt and non-core assets of Air India. Around 75% of Air India's total debt will be transferred to AIAHL.

Title: Petroleum industry body seeks to bring natural gas under GST
Content: The government must bring natural gas under the GST regime to realise PM Narendra Modi's vision of a gas-based economy, the Federation of Indian Petroleum Industry (FIPI) said in its pre-Budget memorandum. GST on transportation of natural gas through pipeline must be rationalised and import duty on LNG must be lowered to make it competitive with other fuels, FIPI said.

Title: Sterlite Tech bags multi-year order worth ₹170 cr from Power Grid
Content: Sterlite Technologies announced that it has bagged a multi-year order of about ₹170 crore to build a unified network management system for Power Grid Corporation of India. The broadband technology company will also provide a consolidated infrastructure with centralised controls for their inter-regional networks. Sterlite said it has already been supplying optical fibre cables to Power Grid.

Title: Continuation of near-term income support measures a must in Budget: CRISIL
Content: CRISIL research said the government must continue budgetary support on incomes in Budget 2022 to strengthen household consumption demand. "Delaying a sharp fiscal correction to make room for boosting employment, infrastructure spending is probably the best bet at this juncture," CRISIL said. It added that the Centre can create additional fiscal space of ₹35 lakh crore over fiscals 2022-2026.

Title: Tata offers 'enhanced' meals on flights as 1st move in Air India: Reports
Content: The Tata Group has taken its first step in Air India by introducing "enhanced" meal service in four flights operating from Mumbai today (January 27), reports said citing officials. The enhanced meal service will also be introduced at five Mumbai-Delhi flights on Friday, as per reports. Tata is expected to officially take over Air India today after nearly 69 years.

Title: Budget should focus on bridging economic inequality: Ex-RBI Guv
Content: Former RBI Governor Dr D Subbarao on Thursday said the Budget should focus on creating jobs and bridging the widened inequality in the economy besides accelerating growth. Citing the World Inequality Report, he said, "Such inequality...will dent our long-term growth prospects." He also opined that export promotion behind protectionist walls is seldom competitive and thus tariffs must be reduced.

Title: Future Group to sell 25% stake in insurance JV to Generali for ₹1,253 cr
Content: Debt-ridden Future Group will sell its 25% equity in Future Generali India Insurance (FGIICL) to its joint venture partner Generali for a cash consideration of ₹1,252.96 crore, the company said. Generali has also acquired an option to buy out Future Enterprises' remaining interest in FGIICL, directly or through a nominee. Currently, Future Enterprises holds a stake of 49.91% in FGIICL.

Title: Right time for India to review fiscal, monetary policy: Uday Kotak
Content: Ahead of the Union Budget, Uday Kotak said it's the "right time for India to review its fiscal and monetary policy" after US Federal Reserve indicated that it may raise interest rates in March. Fed rate hike "will shrink balance sheet", he added. The Kotak Mahindra Bank MD further said that India's upcoming Budget and next RBI meeting are crucial.

Title: Banks ask govt to scrap quarterly issuance of TDS certificate in Budget
Content: Indian Banks' Association (IBA) recommended the government to scrap quarterly issuance of Tax Deducted at the Source (TDS) certificates (Form 16A) and allow the issuance annually to cut banks' compliance burden. Under its Budget suggestions, IBA sought the setting up of special dispute resolution mechanism to cut litigations between banks and tax department. It also sought relief from GST notices.

Title: ICAI flags concerns over provisions of CA Act amendment bill
Content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has submitted a memorandum to the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance, raising concerns over provisions of the Chartered Accountants (CA) Act amendment bill. According to ICAI President Nihar N Jambusaria, ICAI's issues include change in the disciplinary committee and proposed coordination committee's leadership.

Title: Crude oil prices hit 7-year high following rising Russia-Ukraine tensions
Content: Benchmark oil prices touched their highest levels since 2014 as escalating geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine added to possibility of supply disruptions. Brent crude rose $1.37, or 1.6%, to $89.57/barrel after reaching $89.60/barrel, the highest since October 2014, earlier today. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude was up $1.13, or 1.3%, to $86.73/barrel.

Title: TCS, Infosys in world's 10 most valuable IT services brands listed by Brand Finance
Content: Brand valuation consultancy Brand Finance has named Accenture as the world's most valuable IT services brand of 2022 with a valuation of $36.2 billion. It's followed by India's TCS and Infosys with valuations of $16.8 billion and $12.8 billion, respectively. Infosys is followed by IBM, Cognizant, Capgemini, India's Wipro and HCL, and Japan's NTT Data and Fujitsu.

Title: Which are the world's 10 most valuable brands according to Brand Finance?
Content: Apple has been named the most valuable brand of 2022 by brand valuation consultancy Brand Finance with a valuation of $355.1 billion. Apple is followed by Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Walmart, Samsung, Facebook, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Huawei and Verizon. While technology remains the most valuable industry, pharmaceutical is the fastest-growing industry, Brand Finance said.

Title: I will eat a happy meal on TV if McDonald's accepts Dogecoin: Musk
Content:
World's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "I will eat a happy meal on tv if 
McDonald's accepts Dogecoin." Hours ago, McDonald's Twitter account, in an apparent dig at falling crypto prices, had tweeted, "How are you doing people who run crypto Twitter accounts?" Earlier this month, Musk had announced that Dogecoin could be used to buy Tesla merchandise.

Title: Woman stalked Tim Cook, claimed to be his wife & sent pics of loaded gun: Apple
Content: Apple has been granted a restraining order against a 45-year-old woman who has allegedly been stalking CEO Tim Cook. She claimed that Cook's her husband and father of her children and emailed him 200 times from October-mid-November 2020, Apple said. The company alleged that she threatened him, sent him photos of a loaded pistol and even trespassed at his home.

Title: My mentor, my hero: Adar Poonawalla shares old pic as father gets Padma Bhushan
Content: Covishield maker Serum Institute's CEO Adar Poonawalla shared a childhood picture with his father Cyrus Poonawalla on Twitter after the government named him as a Padma Bhushan awardee for 2022. Adar wrote, "I thank the government of India for acknowledging my mentor, my hero, my father." He also congratulated all "deserving individuals who will receive the Padma awards this year".

Title: Satya Nadella and Sundar Pichai awarded Padma Bhushan
Content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai are among the awardees of Padma Bhushan this year. Serum Institute of India MD Cyrus Poonawalla and Bharat Biotech Founders Dr Krishna Ella and Suchitra Ella have also been named among the awardees. A total of 17 people have been awarded the Padma Bhushan this year.

Title: IMF releases world economic outlook, cuts India's FY22 growth forecast to 9%
Content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday released its latest world economic outlook growth projections and cut India's FY22 economic growth forecast to 9% from 9.5%. It put the growth forecast for India for 2022-23 at 9% and 7.1% in 2022-24. IMF's 2022 global growth projection is 4.4%, lower than previously forecasted.

Title: China to begin 3-year nationwide crackdown on money laundering
Content: China will begin a three-year nationwide crackdown to stop money laundering and other related crimes, lasting till December 2024. Eleven government agencies will execute the campaign led by the People's Bank of China and the Ministry of Public Security. In June 2021, China arrested over 1,100 people in a crackdown on the use of cryptocurrencies for money laundering.

Title: Who are the recipients of the Padma Awards 2022 in the business field?
Content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran, Covaxin maker Bharat Biotech's Krishna Ella and Suchitra Ella and Covishield maker Serum Institute's Founder Cyrus Poonawalla are among Padma Bhushan awardees in the business field for 2022. Padma Shri awardees are Jagjit Singh Dardi, Muktamani Devi, Japan's Ryuko Hira and Rupa & Co's Prahlad Rai Agarwala.

Title: IMF's Gopinath shares video message after her last World Economic Outlook release
Content: India-born Gita Gopinath on Tuesday released her last World Economic Outlook as IMF's Chief Economist. "There are numerous challenges facing the global economy...But...global recovery is continuing. Let's hope that we can make 2022 the year we truly exit the pandemic," she said in a video message on Twitter. Gopinath is taking up the role of IMF's First Deputy Managing Director.

Title: Vijay Kedia sells rights to the jingle 'BSE Meri Jaan Ho Tum' to BSE for ₹1
Content: Vijay Kedia, a long-term investor and Founder of Kedia Securities, sold the rights of his jingle 'BSE Meri Jaan Ho Tum' to BSE for ₹1. "From my first failed attempt in 1989 to become a sub-broker at BSE to today where my voice becomes a part of this great institution, the journey is both overwhelming and an honour," Kedia said.

Title: How much wealth have world's 10 richest people lost amid global market selloff?
Content: World's 10 richest people have lost a combined $158 billion from their wealth amid a global market selloff this month, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. World's richest person Elon Musk's fortune shrunk by $33 billion, while Jeff Bezos' fortune fell by $27 billion. Warren Buffett is the only person among them who gained. His net worth increased by $2.6 billion.

Title: James Murdoch, Uday Shankar to buy 40% stake in Reliance's Viacom18: Report
Content: Billionaire James Murdoch and ex-Star and Disney India Chairman Uday Shankar plan to acquire nearly 40% stake in Viacom18, ET reported citing sources. Murdoch, Shankar, Reliance Industries and other investors plan to infuse ₹12,000 crore in the business, the report said. Reliance Industries-owned Network18 has 51% stake in Viacom18, while ViacomCBS owns 49% stake in the joint venture.

Title: A truly global leader: Pai as Tata Sons' Chandrasekaran gets Padma Bhushan
Content: Ex-Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai has congratulated Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran on being awarded Padma Bhushan, calling him "a truly global leader". "He is a great Patriot, nationalist and has worked hard to put India on the global map always!" he added. Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella are also among the recipients of Padma Bhushan.

Title: Dogecoin jumps after Musk urges McDonald's to accept it as payment
Content: Dogecoin jumped as much as 8% on Tuesday after the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk urged McDonald's to start accepting the meme-inspired cryptocurrency for payment. "I will eat a happy meal on tv if McDonald's accepts Dogecoin," Musk had tweeted. McDonald's rival Burger King responded to Musk's tweet saying, "Only a king knows what da coin do."

Title: Bentley to invest $3.4 billion to exclusively offer EVs by 2030
Content: Luxury carmaker Bentley will spend over $3.4 billion over the next decade to become a fully electric luxury brand by 2030. Bentley said it will start production of its first fully-electric car in 2025. The investment will include research and development and significant upgrades to Bentley's plant manufacturing campus in Crewe, England, through 2032.

Title: MakeMyTrip's Kalra moves on from exec role, to be Group Chairman
Content: MakeMyTrip's Co-founder Deep Kalra is moving on from his executive role as the Group Executive Chairman, the company said in a US SEC filing. Kalra will be assuming the role of Chief Mentor and Group Chairman, effective April 1, 2022. In his new role, "Kalra will devote his time in providing mentorship to MakeMyTrip's leadership team", the company said.

Title: ₹70,000-crore investment proposals achieved within a year: J&K LG
Content: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha said that target of investment proposals worth ₹70,000 crore has been achieved within a year. "The global investors exhibited keen interest in investing in J&K, and investment proposals worth ₹3,000 crore were finalised in a short span of two days," Sinha added while highlighting the investments attracted by J&K at the Dubai Expo.

Title: Aluminium association seeks to hike customs duty on scrap to 10% in Budget
Content: Ahead of the Union Budget, Aluminium Association of India (AAI) has sought an increase of customs duty on aluminium scrap from 2.5% to 10% citing that country's consumption of scrap is "100% import-dependent". The association said the duty increase will encourage recycling of domestic scrap and reduce the share of scrap in total imports, which stood at 66% in 2020-21.

Title: LIC reports profit after tax of ₹1,437 crore in first half of FY22
Content: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) reported profit after tax of ₹1,437 crore in the April-September 2021 period. Its profit after tax in the same period in 2020 was ₹6.14 crore. LIC said its new business premium growth rate stood at 554.1% in H1 FY22, up from 394.76% in H1 FY21.

Title: Bengaluru 1st choice for returning NRIs to buy home, Pune 2nd: Survey
Content: Bengaluru has topped the choice of non-resident Indians looking to buy residential properties in India, as per a survey conducted by ANAROCK Property Consultants. Of the overall respondents, 22% preferred Bengaluru, 18% preferred Pune, while 17% preferred Chennai. Half of NRI respondents preferred luxury properties priced above ₹1.5 crore and 32% favoured premium properties starting from ₹90 lakh.

Title: PMC Bank merges with Unity Small Finance Bank
Content: Branches of Punjab and Maharashtra Co-operative Bank Ltd (PMC Bank) will operate as Unity Small Finance Bank Ltd (USFBL) branches from Tuesday, RBI said in a press release. RBI added that USFBL is making all necessary arrangements to implement provisions of the merger. The bank's amalgamation scheme envisages takeover of the assets and liabilities of PMC Bank.

Title: TPCI seeks support measures for food, beverage industry in Budget
Content: Trade Promotion Council of India (TPCI) said it seeks duty-free import of raw materials by Special Economic Zone units and setting up of modern R&D labs for the food and beverage industry in the upcoming Budget. It also seeks input tax credits, subsidy for testing in the food sector and funds for setting up machinery manufacturing plants for the industry.

Title: Adani Wilmar raises ₹940 cr from 15 anchor investors ahead of IPO
Content: Ahead of its IPO's rollout, Adani Wilmar on Tuesday said that it has garnered ₹940 crore from 15 anchor investors. The edible oil major has finalised allocation of 4.08 crore equity shares to anchor investors at a price of ₹230 per share, the company added in its BSE filing. Adani Wilmar's ₹3,600-crore IPO will open for subscription on January 27.

Title: Gems, jewellery exports up by 71% during Apr-Dec to $28.9 billion
Content: Gems and jewellery exports grew by 71% during April-December 2021 to $28.9 billion as compared to $16.9 billion in the same period last year, as per Commerce Ministry's data. The exports grew by 16.38% to $2.99 billion in December 2021, the data showed. US, Hong Kong, UAE, Belgium and Israel were the top five export destinations for the sector.

Title: Insurers seek high investment limit, GST reduction in Budget
Content: Insurance companies are seeking a separate deduction limit of ₹1 lakh for insurance premium payment under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act in the upcoming Budget. Insurers are also seeking reduction in GST on health insurance products from 18% to 5% to make them affordable. They are also seeking doubling of medical insurance limit under Section 80D to ₹50,000.

Title: Tencent fires 70 employees in 2021 amid campaign against fraud
Content: Chinese technology company Tencent sacked 70 employees as part of a campaign against fraud in 2021, CNBC reported on Tuesday. Tencent's recent report of internal investigations said the company identified cases of embezzlement and bribery and took action accordingly. Tencent added it has reported some of the sacked employees to the authorities.

Title: Pfizer and BioNTech begin clinical trial of Omicron-based COVID-19 vaccine
Content: Pfizer and BioNTech on Tuesday announced the initiation of a clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of an Omicron-based vaccine candidate. The study will evaluate up to 1,420 healthy adults aged between 18 and 55. The study will have three cohorts examining different regimens of the current Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine or an Omicron-based vaccine.

Title: Tesla countersues JPMorgan over deal affected by Musk's tweet
Content: Tesla has countersued JPMorgan over a disputed deal affected by Elon Musk's 2018 tweet where he said he might take Tesla private. The lawsuit accused JPMorgan of filing "cynical litigation" when the bank sued Tesla last year, claiming it was owed $162 million when Tesla stock warrants expired. Tesla said JPMorgan "pressed its exorbitant demand as an act of retaliation".

Title: Amazon worker records alleged sexual harassment she faces at warehouse on TikTok
Content: An Amazon packer alleged that she is routinely sexually harassed by male colleagues at the warehouse where she works and posted a TikTok video about it. The video, which went viral, showed the comments she received while working, which included "Let's chill on break" and "Ayye what's your name". Some users claimed they faced similar incidents at Amazon.

Title: Swiggy surpasses rival Zomato's valuation after $700 million funding
Content: Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy has surpassed its rival Zomato's valuation after it raised $700 million in a new funding round. The round valued Swiggy at around $10.7 billion, as per reports. Meanwhile, Zomato's market value fell below $10 billion on Monday after its shares slipped below the ₹100-mark for the first time since its listing.

Title: Will be dealt with urgency: Mahindra as farmer told 'you won't have ₹10' at showroom
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has responded after a farmer in Karnataka was allegedly insulted at a Mahindra showroom and was told, "You won't even have ₹10." Mahindra tweeted that one of the company's key core values is to uphold the dignity of the individual. "Any aberration from this philosophy will be addressed with great urgency," he added.

Title: Pumped to know world champ is desi: Mahindra as Manipuri breaks push-up record
Content: After 24-year-old Thounaojam Niranjoy Singh from Manipur created a new Guinness World Record for the most push-ups in one minute, businessman Anand Mahindra called him a 'source of motivation'. "No Olympic medal for it, but think about how dominant a form of one-upmanship it is around the world...Pumped me up to know the world champ is Desi!" said Mahindra.

Title: Will fold up if plea not heard: SpiceJet to Supreme Court on HC's winding up order
Content: SpiceJet urged the Supreme Court to hear its petition against Madras High Court's winding up order, saying the airline "will fold up" if case isn't heard. The court then agreed to hear the matter on January 28. The matter pertains to Credit Suisse's plea to wind up SpiceJet over $24-million dues. Earlier, Madras HC stayed its order till January 28.

Title: ₹19.5 lakh crore investor wealth wiped off in 5 trading sessions
Content: Around ₹19.5 lakh crore wealth of investors has been wiped off in five trading sessions. Since Tuesday last week, the Sensex has lost over 3,800 points, while the broader Nifty 50 lost over 1,150 points, Moneycontrol reported. On Monday (January 24), the Sensex ended 1,545 points lower, eroding over ₹9 lakh crore wealth of investors in a day.

Title: Mukesh Ambani's RIL to launch multi-channel beauty platform 'Tiara': Report
Content: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) is reportedly preparing to launch an omnichannel beauty platform, which is being developed by Fynd and Netmeds. Internally called 'Project Adore', the venture is likely to be named 'Tiara', ET reported citing sources. Reliance Retail has inked agreements with several cosmetic and beauty brands and Isha Ambani is leading the project, the report added.

Title: Future Group challenges lenders in SC to stop being named a defaulter: Report
Content: Future Group has challenged its own lenders in Supreme Court to avoid being declared a defaulter for missing payments, citing its dispute with Amazon, reported Reuters. Earlier this month, Future Retail had missed the due date to pay ₹3,494.56 crore to various lenders. It has asked the court to order lenders to grant more time to execute retail asset sale.

Title: Moody's upgrades Tesla's debt rating, says outlook remains positive
Content: Moody's upgraded Tesla's debt rating by two notches to "Ba1" from "Ba3" on Monday. It said in a note that Tesla's outlook remains positive and the company will continue to increase its scale rapidly and improve its profitability notably. Tesla is expected to deliver nearly 1.4 million vehicles this year, up from about 936,000 in 2021, Moody's said.

Title: Told Bezos people don't want to run errands for rich: US comedian
Content: US comedian Jon Stewart said he once told Amazon's Jeff Bezos that people want to feel proud of their work, not just run errands for the rich. Stewart said Bezos discussed what he saw as economy of the future, one that would rely on service workers to perform tasks. "He views everybody as like...part of a fulfilment centre," Stewart added.

Title: File FIR against Amazon over Indian flag themed goods: MP govt to DGP
Content: Madhya Pradesh government has directed the police to register an FIR against Amazon officials and its owner for allegedly selling products featuring the Indian flag. "It's intolerable that even it (the national flag) has been used on shoes," Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. Earlier, social media users criticised Amazon for selling such products and sought a ban on these items.

Title: Maruti Suzuki India profit falls 48% on chip crunch, high input costs
Content: Maruti Suzuki India recorded a 48% drop in its net profit in the third-quarter, as a global chip shortage slowed production and high raw material costs squeezed profit margins. Its profit stood at ₹1,012 crore compared with ₹1,941 crore a year earlier. The firm said it could not produce an estimated 90,000 units due to chip shortage.

Title: SHEIN revives plan to list in New York this year: Report
Content: Chinese fashion retailer SHEIN is reviving plans to list in New York this year, Reuters reported. According to the report, SHEIN's Chinese Founder Chris Xu is also considering a citizenship change partly to bypass China's new and tougher rules on overseas listings. Founded in 2008, SHEIN had started preparing for US IPO two years ago but later shelved the plan.

Title: FIR filed against Shopee for allegedly selling fake products in UP
Content: Uttar Pradesh police have filed an FIR against Singapore-headquartered e-commerce platform Shopee and its executives for allegedly selling counterfeit products. The FIR was filed following a complaint by a man alleging that the three products he bought from Shopee in December turned out to be duplicate. "The sale of counterfeit items...is strictly prohibited on our platform," Shopee said.

Title: OYO to submit revised draft document for ₹8,430-cr IPO to SEBI: Report
Content: Hospitality major OYO is ready to file a revised draft document with SEBI as it moves ahead with its ₹8,430-crore IPO, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. The company has reportedly received in-principle approval from BSE and NSE. Earlier, Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India alleged that OYO concealed information about criminal proceedings against it in its IPO papers.

Title: Unilever to cut 1,500 management jobs under organisational revamp
Content: Unilever announced plans to cut about 1,500 jobs this week as a part of its organisational restructuring. The Dove soap and Magnum ice cream maker will cut 15% of senior management roles and 5% of junior management roles. Unilever will now be organised into five business segments that are beauty and wellbeing, personal care, home care, nutrition and ice cream.

Title: Hong Kong billionaire loses half of her fortune in days amid China probe
Content: Hong Kong-based Huabao International's billionaire CEO Chu Lam Yiu's wealth declined by 50% as shares of her company plunged 67% after a Chinese city's supervisory committee began probe into Chu for suspected disciplinary violations. Her net worth stood at $2.6 billion on Monday, down from $5.5 billion on Friday. Huabao provides flavours and fragrances for tobacco, food, personal-care products.

Title: Economy has recovered, govt should reduce fiscal deficit: Ex-NITI Aayog VC
Content: A week ahead of the Union Budget, NITI Aayog's former Vice-Chairman Arvind Panagariya said that government should now signal its intention to reduce fiscal deficit by cutting it by half-to-one percentage point in 2022-23. ''The Indian economy has recovered handsomely, returning to its pre-COVID-19 GDP...Only private consumption is still below its pre-COVID-19 level,'' Panagariya added.

Title: India's fuel demand recovery to continue in Q4 FY22: Fitch
Content: India's fuel demand will continue to recover through Q4 of FY22 due to easing COVID-19-related restrictions boosting economic activity, Fitch Ratings said on Monday. It added that strong prices are expected to improve the financial profiles of upstream oil and gas companies. "We expect improved demand for petroleum products to reach pre-pandemic levels," Fitch said.

Title: JSW Steel to spend over $1 billion to cut carbon emissions
Content: JSW Steel has earmarked $1.3 billion to reduce carbon emissions and will shift to solar power for energy and use more scrap, joint MD Seshagiri Rao said. It's also in talks with GAIL India for supply of natural gas to its biggest mill. JSW Steel aims to reduce emissions to 1.95 tons for every ton of steel produced by 2030.

Title: Education sector seeks GST cut, focus on online education in Budget
Content: Firms working in the education sector seek focus on online education and its infrastructure, sufficient funds to improve internet connectivity and reduction in GST on educational services from 18% to 5% in the upcoming Budget. They also seek the opening of schools in batches while following COVID-19 appropriate behaviour and stronger adoption of the blended learning model.

Title: Restaurant industry seeks input tax credit, cheaper loans in Budget
Content: The pandemic-hit restaurant industry has sought restoration of the input tax credit, cheaper loans, and increased emergency credit line in Budget 2022-23. Restaurant owners and founders told ET that several restaurants may have to shut down if input tax credit is not extended. Restaurant industry expects government to throw a lifeline to the sector and protect jobs, they added.

Title: Inflation driven by supply shortage, not excess demand: Report
Content: A report by investment management company BlackRock has determined that inflation is being driven by a shortage of supply rather than excess demand. It found that this trend will "likely bring more macro volatility and force policymakers to live with higher inflation". It added that economy-wide and sector-specific supply constraints are pushing inflation higher.

Title: Cipla's profit after tax falls 2.6% YoY to ₹729 crore in Q3
Content: Cipla Limited on Tuesday reported a consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹729 crore in Q3 FY22, a 2.6% YoY decrease from ₹748 crore in Q3 FY21. Cipla reported PAT of ₹711 crore in Q2 FY22. The company's revenue in Q3 FY22 stood at ₹5,479 crore, a 6% YoY increase as compared with ₹5,169 crore in Q3 FY21.

Title: 445 infrastructure projects face cost overruns of ₹4.4 lakh cr: Govt
Content: Over 445 infrastructure projects worth ₹150 crore or more have been affected by cost overruns totalling ₹4.4 lakh crore, according to a government report. Total original cost of implementation of 1,673 projects was ₹22.23 lakh crore and their anticipated completion cost is likely to be ₹26.64 lakh crore, the report said. Of the 1,673 projects, 557 were delayed.

Title: 5 richest tech billionaires collectively lose $85 billion of wealth in Jan
Content: World's five richest tech billionaires collectively lost $85.07 billion of their wealth in the first few weeks of 2022, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. While Elon Musk lost about $26.9 billion, Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' wealth declined by $24.7 billion in 2022. Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and Google Co-founder Larry Page's wealth dropped by $9.5 billion and $11.9 billion, respectively.

Title: Swiggy raises $700 million, doubles valuation in 6 months to $10.7 billion
Content: Swiggy has closed a $700 million funding round led by Invesco, doubling its valuation in six months to $10.7 billion. The previous fundraise took place in July 2021 when Swiggy was valued at $5.5 billion. "This fundraise will enable Swiggy to further accelerate growth on the core platform and make meaningful investments to grow Instamart," Swiggy said in a statement.

Title: Amazon says Samara ready to buy Future Retail assets for ₹7,000 cr: Report
Content: Amazon has reportedly told the independent directors of Future Retail that Samara Capital "remains interested and committed" in investing ₹7,000 crore to buy all retail assets of the debt-ridden company, PTI reported. Earlier, Future Retail's independent directors had sought ₹3,500 crore in unsecured long-term loan from Amazon to help avoid its debt from being classified as non-performing assets.

Title: Zomato, Paytm, Nykaa shares drop to record lows, Zomato share price slips below ₹100
Content: The shares of Paytm, Zomato, Policybazaar and Nykaa on Monday fell to their record lows since their market debuts last year, TechCrunch reported. The share price of Zomato dropped below ₹100 for the first time. The fifth straight session of losses has seen Zomato slip 25% during the period, wiping out around ₹26,000 crore of investor wealth, Moneycontrol reported.

Title: Air India likely to be transferred to Tata Group on Jan 27: Report
Content: Air India is likely to be handed over to Tata Group on January 27, as per an official of the airline. In a purported email to employees, Air India's Director, Finance, Vinod Hejmadi said the airline’s disinvestment will take place on January 27 and the closing balance sheet as of January 20 will be provided to the Tata Group today.

Title: Amazon sells masks, cups featuring Indian flag, gets criticised
Content: Several users on social media shared screenshots of some products featuring the Indian flag being sold on Amazon. Users shared pictures of masks, apparels and cups, among others, with #AmazonInsultsNationalFlag and sought a ban on these items claiming it as an insult to the flag and a violation of the country's flag code.

Title: Have been waiting for a bear market: Zomato CEO reassures staff amid share price drop
Content: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal on Monday sent an email to his employees after its share price slipped record low. He wrote, "I've been waiting for a bear market…This is the thing about stock market…We had no control over our valuation going up from $8 billion in the IPO to $17 billion at our peak...What we do control is our execution."

Title: Inflation only problem keeping me awake at night: Pak PM during live programme
Content: Addressing a question on rising prices, Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday said that inflation was the "only problem keeping" him awake at night and added that the current inflation was a "global phenomenon". Khan said this during his live air programme 'Aap ka Wazir-e-Azam, Aap key Saath'. He also cited pandemic as a reason for current inflation in Pakistan.

Title: Taco Bell to start business school to train employees for franchise ownership
Content: Taco Bell is opening first of its kind business school to help its employees learn the skills required to become future franchise owners. The program, which is being organised in partnership with the US’ University of Louisville, will teach employees lessons on financing, marketing, and human resource protocols among others. The first class will begin in February 2022.

Title: Sensex crashes over 1,100 points, Nifty near 17,250
Content: Sensex fell for a fifth straight session, plunging over 1,100 points to under 58,000, while Nifty was trading at near 17,250. Both the indexes have declined more than 6% since scaling all-time highs in October last year. As many as 28 stocks in the 30-share Sensex benchmark were in the red zone today.

Title: CAIT appeals to CCI to close probe against Amazon, Flipkart soon
Content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) sought a meeting with Competition Commission of India's (CCI) Chairman Ashok Kumar Gupta seeking probe against Amazon and Flipkart to be completed soon. CAIT alleged the firms to have indulged in predatory pricing and capital dumping through preferred sellers. It added that the investigating officer's transfer mid-way has irked the business community.

Title: NPCI testing 'UPI Lite' to allow payments without internet: Report
Content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is testing a system to facilitate Unified Payments Interface (UPI)-based digital payments without active internet connection, Mint reported. Called 'UPI Lite', the system is likely to be initially used to enable digital payments under ₹200 in rural areas, the report said. The NPCI is testing two methods to make it work, it added.

Title: Reached this stage after hard work, IPO should be bumper: MobiKwik COO
Content: MobiKwik Co-founder and COO Upasana Taku told PTI the company will list on the stock exchanges once the market conditions become stable. "It's common sense that if markets are acting erratically...why do you want to risk the outcome of something for which you worked so hard?...We've reached this stage after hard work so IPO should be a bumper," she added.

Title: Supertech says advance payment made for Noida twin towers demolition
Content: Supertech has said that it has made an advance payment to Mumbai-based Edifice Engineering to carry out the demolition of its 40-storey twin towers in Noida. It has also shared details of the demolition agreement with the New Okhla Industrial Development Authority (NOIDA). Earlier, the Supreme Court had directed Supertech to execute the contract with Edifice Engineering within a week.

Title: CII seeks measures to step up demand, boost jobs in Budget
Content: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) said it is looking forward to a "growth-oriented Budget which would rejuvenate demand, facilitate private investments, and boost job creation while not losing sight of fiscal management". "The Budget is being presented at a time when the economy is at a turning point and recovery has already established its foothold," the industry body said.

Title: Travel agents body seeks 'One India One Tourism' approach in Budget
Content: The Travel Agents Association of India (TAAI) is seeking a 'One India One Tourism' approach, which is inclusive of 'One Tax Structure', in the upcoming Budget to revive domestic travel, tourism and hospitality industry. The travel agents body has proposed several steps including improving cash flows, reducing working capital burden on startups and reducing income tax rate and GST rate.

Title: India's electronics production likely to reach $300 bn by 2026: Report
Content: India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) said in a report that India's electronics production is expected to touch $300 billion by 2026. The National Policy on Electronics (NPE) 2019 had set a target of $400 billion by 2025 for the industry. The report said that the industry will be unable to achieve the target due to adverse impact of COVID-19.

Title: Axis Bank reports 224% YoY rise in net profit to ₹3,614 cr in Q3
Content: Axis Bank reported a 224% YoY rise in net profit to ₹3,614 crore in the October-December 2021 quarter. The bank also reported a 17% YoY rise in net interest income to ₹8,653 crore. "The Bank holds cumulative provisions of ₹13,404 crore at the end of Q3," Axis Bank said in a filing.

Title: SEPC looks to target $300 billion services exports in 2022-23
Content: The Services Export Promotion Council is looking to set a services export target of $300 billion for 2022-23 expecting resumption of regular international travel and other business activities. SEPC Chairman Sunil Talati said services exports would reach $240 billion by end of FY22. "Important to work towards...change in perception and giving services equal importance as manufacturing," he said.

Title: Vedanta to create $10 bn fund to bid for BPCL stake, other assets
Content: Vedanta Resources plans to create a $10 billion fund to bid for assets including the government's stake in Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL), Executive Chairman Anil Agarwal said. The fund will be made of Vedanta's own resources and outside investment. "We have a tremendous response for this, especially from the sovereign wealth funds," Agarwal said.

Title: CII suggests additional 1% CSR levy for COVID-19 vaccine booster shots
Content: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has suggested that the government include an additional 1% corporate social responsibility (CSR) levy, apart from the mandated 2%, for a 12-month period in the upcoming Budget to encourage corporates to spend on providing COVID-19 vaccine booster shots. The industry body said it expects the Budget to focus on measures for strengthening economic recovery.

Title: ICICI's net profit grows over 25% YoY in Q3, reaches ₹6,193.81 cr
Content: ICICI Bank Ltd reported a YoY rise of over 25% in net profit in the October-December quarter, reaching ₹6,193.81 crore from ₹4,939.59 crore in Q3 FY21. Provisions and contingencies fell 26.8% YoY to ₹2,007.30 crore from ₹2,741.72 crore. The bank also reported 6.3% YoY rise in gross non-performing assets to ₹37,052.74 crore from ₹34,860.43 crore in Q3 FY21.

Title: Barclays offers CEO £6,550 a month allowance to move to London: Report
Content: Barclays is offering its CEO CS Venkatakrishnan £6,550 (over ₹6.6 lakh) a month in housing allowance to encourage him to shift from New York to London, reported Sunday Times. The allowance is in addition to Venkatakrishnan's annual pay of £2.7 million. It will reportedly be paid to accommodation provider until October 2023, or until his family is able to relocate.

Title: Herculean task: AIMA on increasing MSMEs' share in GDP to 40% by 2025
Content: The All India Management Association called increasing the MSMEs’ contribution to India's GDP from nearly 30% to 40% by 2025 a "herculean task". AIMA's MSME Committee Chairman JS Juneja said that government and institutions have to provide big support to MSMEs and that bankers also have to provide lending resources.

Title: Consumer electronics industry seeks customs duty hike in Budget 2022
Content: Consumer Electronics and Appliances Manufacturers Association said the industry expects a hike in customs duty on finished goods to discourage imports and facilitate import substitution in Budget 2022. It also sought incentives for specific R&D and localisation projects under the Production Linked Incentive scheme. CEAMA also suggested a 5% differential duty between parts and finished goods.

Title: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions gets SEBI's approval for IPO
Content: Vedant Fashions, which owns ethnic wear brands like Manyavar, has received SEBI's approval to raise funds via an IPO. According to the draft papers filed by the company in September last year, the issue comprises a pure offer for sale of up to 36.36 million shares. The IPO will open for subscription on February 4 and close on February 8.

Title: Exporters seek support measures in Budget 2022 to boost shipments
Content: Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) said that exporters have demanded support measures like high import duty on plastic finished goods and setting up of an Indian shipping line for the upcoming Budget to promote shipments. They have also suggested fiscal incentives to address logistics challenges, and reduction of income tax on limited liability partnerships to support MSMEs.

Title: Chilling, cautionary tale: Mahindra as singer dies after deliberately catching COVID
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra referred to the death of 57-year-old Czech Republic's singer Hana Horka, who deliberately caught COVID-19 to avoid vaccine, as "a chilling, cautionary tale". He tweeted that he was confused with the recent messaging about superiority of natural immunity but this seemed "like a bucket of cold water". "Death isn't a risk worth challenging vaccinations for," Mahindra wrote.

Title: We didn't expect this kind of popularity: Dolo-650 maker after several memes amid COVID
Content: After several people shared memes about Dolo-650 amid rise in COVID-19 cases, the tablet's maker Micro Labs Limited MD Dilip Surana said, "We did not expect the kind of popularity that Dolo-650 gained recently." "Fever and body pain have been the main symptoms of COVID, for which Dolo-650 proved to be the right remedy," Surana added.

Title: Crypto slump erases $1 trillion from the market in 2.5 months
Content: Over $1 trillion has been lost from the global cryptocurrency market amid a slump in digital currencies in two-and-a-half months, Bloomberg reported. On Friday, world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell below $36,000 for the first time since July, while other cryptocurrencies like Ether also slumped. Bitcoin's decline since its November peak has eroded over $600 billion from its market value.

Title: Baby X is just like this: Musk on video of ape shared by Tamil Nadu IAS officer
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk responded to a video that showed an ape playing with straws, saying, "Baby X [Musk's son] is just like this haha." The video was tweeted in 2020 by Tamil Nadu IAS officer Supriya Sahu. A Twitter account recently re-shared it saying, "This...is a brilliant example of how play is...shared by great apes and humans."

Title: Future Retail seeks ₹3,500-cr loan from Amazon to pay banks, says confirm by Monday
Content: Future Retail's independent directors have sought a ₹3,500-crore long-term loan from Amazon after it asked the Kishore Biyani-led company not to sell its small-format store chains. FRL has to pay its lenders by January 29 to prevent its debt from being classified as non-performing assets. "Please confirm...you're willing to fund this amount by Monday," the letter, reviewed by ET, said.

Title: Ex-Freshworks executives' startup raises $18 million, celebrates with rap song
Content: Customer onboarding platform Rocketlane, founded by former Freshworks executives in 2020, raised $18 million in a funding round led by 8VC this week. To celebrate this, the company released a rap song to showcase its journey, which has gone viral on Twitter and LinkedIn. The US and Chennai-based startup had raised $3 million in seed funding in June 2021.

Title: Paytm stock slump erodes over $10 billion from IPO investors' wealth so far
Content: The slump in Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares has eroded a total of over $10 billion (₹74,400 crore) from IPO investors' wealth since its listing in November, Moneycontrol reported. On Friday, the stock fell 4% to a record low of ₹952.3 apiece on the NSE, but eventually ended the day at ₹960. Its market value stands at over ₹62,000 crore.

Title: He's a professor of management: Mahindra on viral auto driver with fridge, TV in auto
Content: Reacting to video of viral auto-rickshaw driver Anna Durai, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "This man's not only an auto driver...he's a Professor of Management." "If MBA students spent a day with him it would be a compressed course in Customer Experience Management," he added. Durai, a seven-time TEDx speaker, has facilities like books, mini-fridge, WiFi, TV and iPad in his auto-rickshaw.

Title: India's economy has some bright spots & a number of very dark stains: Rajan
Content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan on Sunday said the Indian economy has "some bright spots and a number of very dark stains". While the "bright spots" are the health of large firms and the business done by IT and IT-enabled sectors, the "dark stains" are the extent of unemployment and low buying power, especially amongst the lower middle-class, Rajan added.

Title: Oil giant Shell drops 'Royal Dutch' from its name after 115 years
Content: Oil giant Shell has officially dropped 'Royal Dutch' from its name, a phrase that was part of its identity for 115 years. The move follows its plans to scrap its dual share structure and relocate its headquarters from the Netherlands to London. Shell has been in a tussle with Dutch authorities over 15% dividend withholding tax on some shares.

Title: Reliance Industries net profit jumps 41.6% to ₹18,549 crore in Q3
Content: Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) posted a record ₹18,549 crore profit, which rose 41.6% year-on-year in the quarter ended December, according to its exchange filing. The company's revenue (minus excise duty) rose 57% over a year earlier to ₹1,85,047 crore. The results further show that the oil to chemical business of RIL reported a revenue of ₹1.31 lakh crore.

Title: iPhone-maker Foxconn signs EV partnership with Indonesia govt
Content: iPhone-maker Foxconn has partnered with Indonesia's government and several companies to support EV development in the country. It has signed an MoU for a wide scope of investment on EVs including battery manufacturing with the government as well as Indonesia Battery Corporation. Under the partnership, an open platform that provides both hardware and software services will be available to firms.

Title: He tries to make it personal: Warren on Musk calling her 'Senator Karen'
Content: US Senator Elizabeth Warren, while discussing her spat with Tesla's Elon Musk and him calling her 'Senator Karen', said, "It's about trying to make it personal instead of talking about what’s wrong with the tax system." Warren said Musk paid no federal income tax in 2018. "Every nurse who paid taxes, every firefighter who paid taxes, paid more," she added.

Title: Russia's crypto ban would drive out IT professionals: Telegram CEO
Content: Messaging app Telegram's Russia-born CEO Pavel Durov said Russia's proposed ban on cryptocurrencies could lead to an outflow of IT professionals from the country and destroy several technology industries. Likening the proposal to ban cryptocurrencies to "throwing the baby out with the bath water", Durov wrote on his Telegram channel, "None of the developed nations is banning cryptocurrencies."

Title: Morgan Stanley sells a portion of its stake in Paytm: Report
Content: Morgan Stanley Asia (Singapore) has sold a substantial portion of its stake in Paytm parent One97 Communications, Moneycontrol reported. While Morgan Stanley held 1.21% stake in Paytm in September quarter, its name is missing from key shareholders' list in latest data. Notably, in December, Morgan Stanley's research arm gave an overweight rating on Paytm stock with price target of ₹1,875.

Title: Tax benefits to increase disposable income likely in Budget: Report
Content: Brokerage firm KR Choksey has reported that the government may consider tax benefits in the upcoming Budget to increase the net disposable income of the citizens. The government will also put more focus on tax compliance. There might be some changes in InvIT and REIT tax structures to bring long-term capital gains treatment at par with other asset classes.

Title: Can't mandate veg, non-veg labels for cosmetics: Regulatory body
Content: Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has told Delhi High Court that vegetarian and non-vegetarian labels for cosmetic products can't be made mandatory for manufacturers. The CDSCO said that this "may complicate regulation and add regulatory burden on stakeholders". Labelling items like toothpaste and other cosmetics and toiletries can be done voluntarily, the regulatory body added.

Title: Govt calls all-party meet on January 31 to discuss budget session
Content: The Central Government has convened an all-party meet, which will likely be held at 3pm, on January 31 to discuss Budget Session. The Budget Session will get underway on the same day with the Presidential address at 11am followed by the laying of the Economic Survey. Notably, the government will present the Union Budget for 2022-23 on February 1.

Title: Make travel expenses deductible under ITR in Budget: FHRAI to govt
Content: The Federation of Hotel & Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) has urged the government to make travel expenses deductible under income tax returns in the upcoming Budget. Since foreign travel is at least 12 to 15 months away from returning to the pre-pandemic levels, the government should give impetus on domestic travel, FHRAI's Vice President Gurbaxish Singh Kohli said.

Title: YES Bank's net profit rises 76% y-o-y to ₹266.43 crore in Q3
Content: YES Bank has reported a 76% year-on-year jump in net profit to ₹266.43 crore for the quarter ended December 2021, compared with a profit of ₹150.71 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The bank's provisions for the quarter plunged 82% year-on-year to ₹374.64 crore. Its net interest income fell to ₹1,764 crore from ₹2,560 crore in the year-ago period.

Title: Vikram Dev Dutt takes charge as Air India's Chairman and MD
Content: Vikram Dev Dutt has assumed charge as Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Air India. The airline said Dutt took over the charge from Civil Aviation Secretary Rajiv Bansal. Dutt is an IAS officer of 1993 batch of AGMUT (Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, Mizoram and Union Territory) cadre. He's been appointed Air India CMD in rank and pay of Additional Secretary.

Title: JPMorgan raises its CEO Dimon's pay 10% to $34.5 million for 2021
Content: JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon will receive a total compensation of $34.5 million for 2021, marking a 10% raise in his annual pay. The package includes $28 million of restricted stock tied to performance, an annual base salary of $1.5 million and a $5 million cash bonus. Dimon, 65, received an annual compensation of $31.5 million for 2019 and 2020.

Title: Fabindia files papers for IPO, offer includes fresh issue of ₹500 cr: Report
Content: Ethnic wear retailer Fabindia has filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI to launch an IPO in 2022, reported Moneycontrol. The offer reportedly comprises a fresh issue of ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of around 2.5 crore equity shares. Fabindia's promoters, Premji Invest, Bajaj Holdings and Investment and the Nilekani family are among selling shareholders.

Title: Healthcare likely to receive top priority in Budget: ASSOCHAM survey
Content: Healthcare sector is likely to receive the highest priority in upcoming Union Budget 2022-23, an ASSOCHAM survey said. The organisation said that MSMEs, energy and infrastructure and technology were also on priority list as per the survey. Nearly 40% of respondents said the Finance Minister should reduce income tax among other measures to boost private demand and consumption, it added.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO Gorman to receive $35 million in pay for 2021
Content: Morgan Stanley's CEO James Gorman will receive a total compensation of $35 million for 2021 and is expected to be the best-paid CEO of a US bank for another year. The bank has raised his compensation 6% for 2021. The package includes annual base salary of $1.5 million, a cash bonus of $8.38 million and equity awards of $25.13 million.

Title: India no longer signs FTAs just to be a part of a group: Goyal
Content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal at a recent event said India no longer signs free trade agreements (FTAs) just to join a group, but is looking at reciprocal access, good market conditions and fair play in trade in goods and services. "An FTA is a two-way traffic," he said, adding that industry should inculcate a greater appetite for risk taking.

Title: ₹15,600 crore wiped off Zomato investors' wealth in 4 trading sessions
Content: Shares of Zomato fell for the fourth consecutive trading session to close below their listing price on Friday. Since January 17, the stock has fallen 15%, eroding over ₹15,600 crore from investors' wealth, Moneycontrol reported. On Friday, the shares fell nearly 10% and eventually settled at ₹114.10 apiece. Zomato listed at a 53% premium over IPO price in July 2021.

Title: Zomato shares tank 9%, hit record low for 1st time since listing day
Content: Shares of Zomato tanked around 9% during intraday trade on Friday, falling to the lowest level since its listing day. The food delivery platform's stock fell to a record low below ₹113 per share. The shares had listed at ₹115 apiece on the BSE on July 23, 2021, giving Zomato a market value of over ₹90,000 crore.

Title: Czech millionaire drives Bugatti Chiron at 414 kmph on highway; criticised by Germany
Content: Germany's Transport Ministry criticised a Czech millionaire for driving Bugatti Chiron on Germany's A2 Autobahn at speeds of up to 414 kmph. A YouTube video this month showed millionaire Radim Passer driving the car on the highway, and beneath the video, Passer wrote the stunt was filmed in July 2021. Notably, much of Germany’s Autobahn network has no speed limit.

Title: Adani Wilmar fixes price band for ₹3,600-crore IPO at ₹218-230 per share
