Content: Adani Wilmar, a joint venture between the Adani Group and Singapore's Wilmar group, has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹218-230 per share. The firm has cut its IPO size to ₹3,600 crore from ₹4,500 crore earlier. Its IPO will be open for subscription from January 27-31. Adani Wilmar will become the seventh Adani company to go public.

Title: I wanted to be a filmmaker: Mahindra on his old pic of shooting documentary in village
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Thursday took to Twitter to share an old picture of himself taken when he was shooting a documentary in a remote village near Madhya Pradesh's Indore. Mahindra tweeted, "I wanted to be a filmmaker and studied film in college." He added, "My thesis was a film I made at the '77 Kumbh Mela."

Title: Over ₹8 lakh crore investor's wealth wiped off in 4 days amid market sell-off
Content: The wealth of equity investors has been eroded by ₹8 lakh crore in four days as the Indian benchmark indices continued to witness a sell-off on Friday as well, Moneycontrol reported. At around 11:30 am, Sensex was trading nearly 500 points lower, falling below the 59,000-mark, while the broader Nifty50 was trading at 17,600 levels.

Title: Russian central bank proposes banning use, mining of crypto
Content: The Central Bank of the Russian Federation (CBRF) on Thursday proposed banning the use and mining of cryptocurrencies on Russian territory. CBRF cited threats to financial stability, citizens' wellbeing and the country's monetary policy sovereignty as reasons for the proposed ban. The bank also proposed preventing financial institutions from carrying out any operation with cryptocurrencies.

Title: Porsche India sells 474 units in 2021, highest since 2014
Content: Porsche India delivered 474 units in the country last year recording the highest number of cars sold in a year since 2014. The brand registered a growth of 62% over the previous calendar year. Porsche sold 187 units of Macan model which makes 39% of the total sales. Cayenne was the second best-seller contributing 17% of the total sales.

Title: Alibaba Co-founder's office buys US billionaire's penthouse for $188 mn
Content: Alibaba Co-founder Joseph Tsai's family office has bought US billionaire Daniel Och's New York City penthouse for $188 million, New York registry documents revealed. The firm took out a $71.5 million mortgage through JPMorgan Chase for the property on the 73rd floor. Och had paid about $95 million for the penthouse when he purchased it in 2019.

Title: Billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group linked to corruption case in China: FT
Content: Billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group has been linked to a corruption scandal involving the former party secretary of Chinese technology hub Hangzhou, the FT reported citing public records and sources. A unit of Ant Group bought plots of land at a discount in Hangzhou in 2019 after taking stakes in two mobile payment businesses owned by party secretary's younger brother.

Title: EV industry seeks sufficient funding for R&D, priority lending in Budget 2022
Content: The Society of Manufacturers of Electric Vehicles (SMEV) in its Budget 2022 wish list has asked the government for priority lending to accelerate EV adoption. SMEV also sought allocation of sufficient funds for R&D. It added that the Centre's Production Linked Incentive scheme needs amendment as there is an "unfair price advantage" for small, medium-sized EV players.

Title: SC asks Supertech to refund homebuyers of Noida twin towers by Feb 28
Content: The Supreme Court on Friday directed Supertech to refund all homebuyers still invested in the twin towers project in Noida by February 28. Last year, the apex court ordered demolition of the 40-storey twin towers over violation of norms. It directed the company to refund entire amount paid by homebuyers with 12% interest from the time of the booking.

Title: Jio gets Gujarat wildlife board's nod to install mobile towers in Gir forest
Content: The State Board of Wild Life (SBWL) has given nod to Reliance Jio to set up mobile towers in the protected areas of the Gir Forest and other sanctuaries in Gujarat. However, SBWL has put certain conditions for the telecom major like preparing a conservation plan relevant to a biological entity affected due to the project and depositing the fund.

Title: ₹47,541 crore to be released to states as advance instalment of tax
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has authorised the release of ₹47,541 crore as advance instalment of tax devolution to state governments, the Finance Ministry said on Thursday. "This is in addition to the regular devolution for the month of January 2022, also being released today," the Ministry said. Thus, states would receive a total of ₹95,082 crore during January 2022.

Title: Homes up to 500 sq ft in Thane may get property tax waiver: Eknath Shinde
Content: Maharashtra Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde said on Thursday that property tax on houses with an area of up to 500 square feet in Thane may be waived off. Shinde said that a proposal for the same was discussed at the government's weekly cabinet meeting. CM Uddhav Thackeray announced a similar relief for Mumbai residents on January 2.

Title: MFIs seek credit guarantee scheme extension, tax free bonds in Budget
Content: Microfinance institutions (MFIs) have asked the Centre for an extension of credit guarantee scheme (CGS), while permitting issuance of tax-free bonds to raise funds in its Budget 2022 wish list. The industry also seeks a ₹1,000 crore microfinance development fund to help overcome the pandemic's effects. The industry added that 75% CGS funds be earmarked for small, medium-sized MFIs.

Title: India's agricultural exports expected to cross $50 bn in FY22: Govt
Content: Commerce Ministry said that India's agricultural exports are likely to cross $50 billion for the "first time" in FY22. This comes after agricultural exports, including marine and plantation goods, increased 23.21% to $31.05 billion in April-November 2021. The Ministry added that exports of marine products and spices are likely to touch record levels of $8 billion and $4.8 billion respectively.

Title: MSMEs need credit assistance, tech upgradation to grow: MSME Secretary
Content: MSME Secretary BB Swain said that for MSMEs to achieve high growth, the two most significant interventions required are related to credit assistance and technology upgradation. "MSME units are together capable of constituting a complete supply chain and being globally competitive," Swain said. He added that Indian engineering MSMEs have tremendous potential for integration in global value chain.

Title: Indian economy likely to grow 7.6% YoY in FY23: India Ratings
Content: India Ratings and Research (IRR) said that the Indian economy is likely to grow 7.6% YoY in FY23. The Indian economy will show meaningful expansion as real GDP in FY23 is expected to be 9.1% higher than that in FY20 (pre-pandemic), IRR said. IRR Principal Economist Sunil Kumar Sinha said the Centre and RBI are expected to support growth recovery.

Title: Hindustan Unilever's net profit rises 16.8% YoY to ₹2,243 cr in Q3 FY22
Content: Hindustan Unilever Limited's (HUL) net profit in Q3 FY22 rose 16.8% YoY to ₹2,243 crore, the company reported on Thursday. HUL's revenue from operations grew 10.4% YoY to ₹13,092 crore while its underlying volume growth stood at 2% in the October-December 2021 quarter. "Growth was competitive and profitable with Domestic Consumer Growth of 11%," HUL said in a filing.

Title: Yes Bank's ex-MD Rana Kapoor denied bail in ₹466-crore fraud case
Content: A Delhi court has dismissed the bail application of Rana Kapoor, Yes Bank's former MD and CEO, in a money laundering case related to the wrongful loss of ₹466.51 crore to the bank. The court observed that the allegations against Kapoor were "most grave in nature". The court, however, granted bail to 15 other accused in the matter.

Title: Unity Small Finance Bank gets RBI nod to induct Vinod Rai as chairman
Content: Unity Small Finance Bank has received RBI's nod to appoint ex-Comptroller and Auditor General of India Vinod Rai as its independent chairman. This comes days after BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover went on voluntary leave amid controversy over his alleged use of inappropriate language against Kotak Group staff. Unity Small Finance Bank is a joint venture between BharatPe and Centrum Group.

Title: FICCI suggests tax impetus for health sector, execution of PPP model in Budget
Content: FICCI suggested that Union Budget 2022-23 should give tax impetus to providers and consumers of senior care services and products, to boost the healthcare system. It also said that creating robust framework for Public Private Partnership (PPP) model could help boost private sector investment. Meanwhile, Deloitte India recommended tax holidays for rural hospitals in its Budget expectations.

Title: Budget will target fiscal deficit of 5.9% of GDP in FY23: CLSA economist
Content: Union Budget will target relatively high fiscal deficit of 5.9% of GDP in 2022-23 following 6.8% of GDP in 2021-22, CLSA India economist Indranil Sen Gupta said in a Budget expectation report. There may be some income tax relief for lower incomes, Gupta added. CLSA is also expecting further cuts in oil taxes to boost consumption if prices keep rising.

Title: Hike stress fund quantum to ₹1.25 lakh cr: Hiranandani Group to govt
Content: The real estate sector needs home loan interest deductions to increase to ₹5 lakh and an enhanced quantum of stress fund of ₹1.25 lakh crore in Budget 2022, Hiranandani Group MD Niranjan Hiranandani said. He further suggested the government to offer the sector an industry status to spur growth and accelerate job creation and recommended increasing deduction on rental housing.

Title: Adani Wilmar may launch ₹3,600-crore IPO on January 27: Report
Content: FMCG company Adani Wilmar is likely to launch its IPO on January 27 and close it by January 31, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Adani Wilmar was initially planning to raise ₹4,500 crore but reportedly reduced the amount to ₹3,600 crore. Adani Wilmar, which sells edible oils under Fortune brand, is a joint venture between Adani Group and Singapore's Wilmar group.

Title: Walmart invites Indian e-commerce sellers to retail in US market
Content: Walmart has invited select Indian sellers to join its Walmart Marketplace that serves over 120 million shoppers monthly in the US as a part of its global drive. Walmart, which owns Flipkart, said that India is one of its top sourcing markets and it has set an ambitious goal of exporting $10 billion from India each year by 2027.

Title: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover takes voluntary leave till March-end
Content: BharatPe Co-founder & MD Ashneer Grover has taken a voluntary leave of absence from BharatPe till March-end. "The Board accepted Ashneer's decision which we agree is in the best interests of the company, our employees, investors and our merchants," a company statement said. The development comes amid the controversy over Grover's alleged use of inappropriate language against Kotak Group staff.

Title: Maha minister writes to FM, seeks import duty cuts on EVs for firms like Tesla
Content: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray has written to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, recommending a reduction in import duty on electric vehicles. "Pioneering companies like Tesla, Rivian, Audi, BMW, among many others must be given a time-bound concessionary customs rate for...import," he said. "A mere high import duty only adds to the burden of the customer," he added.

Title: 'Is this the best allocation of capital?' World Bank on Microsoft's $68.7 bn deal
Content: World Bank President David Malpass criticised Microsoft's $68.7-billion takeover of gaming developer Activision Blizzard, saying, "Wait a minute, is this the best allocation of capital?" He compared the deal with $23.5 billion donations made by wealthier nations to World Bank's fund for poorest countries in three years. "There has to be more money...flowing into...developing countries," he added.

Title: BharatPe board should've asked Ashneer Grover to apologise for bad behaviour: Pai
Content: After BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover went on a voluntary leave of absence, Infosys' ex-Director TV Mohandas Pai said, "The board should've...asked him to apologise for the bad behaviour." They're "playing second fiddle to a managing director whose abusive behaviour is in question", he added. Grover's voluntary leave came after his alleged use of inappropriate language against Kotak staff.

Title: Cinderella time won't last forever: Kotak warns IPO-bound startups on valuations
Content: India's richest banker Uday Kotak on Wednesday advised IPO-bound startups to brace for a time when interest rates go up and investors' expectations of returns change. "Cinderella times won't last forever. We are not very far away from the clock striking midnight," he said. He added that "risk pricing and present value pricing" will come into "valuations of startups" eventually.

Title: India, Tesla reach 'weird stalemate situation' over import duty cuts on EVs: Report
Content: Talks between India and billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla over potential import duty cuts have reached a "weird stalemate situation", Reuters reported citing sources. Tesla reportedly said it's open to sourcing more auto components locally and eventually moving towards manufacturing, but the government is seeking firm commitments. Currently, India levies 100% duty on EVs priced at $40,000 or more.

Title: Lord Jagannath's pic on KitKat wrapper angers people; Nestlé says 'packs withdrawn last year'
Content: Nestlé said it withdrew KitKat packs featuring Lord Jagannath's picture "last year" after people recently took to social media to object to it. People argued that the wrappers featuring Lord Jagannath's picture hurt their religious sentiments as these wrappers will eventually end up in the dustbins once the chocolate is consumed. "We understand the sensitivity of the matter," Nestlé said.

Title: 100-year-old McDonald's employee, who reviewed food in TikTok videos, dies in US
Content: A 100-year-old woman, who had been working at a McDonald's in US' Pennsylvania for nearly three decades, has died. "Ruthie Shuster's sunny optimism brought joy to everyone who knew her," the restaurant's owner said. Shuster appeared in several TikTok videos of the restaurant and reviewed menu items. In an interview last year, she said she had no plans of retiring.

Title: Over 100 millionaires worldwide write open letter, say 'Tax us, the rich, and tax us now'
Content: A group of more than 100 billionaires and millionaires, including Disney heiress Abigail Disney, issued a plea to political and business leaders to make them pay more tax at the World Economic Forum's online Davos meeting. "As millionaires, we know...the current tax system is not fair," the letter read. "Tax us, the rich, and tax us now," it stated.

Title: 4-day working week trial with no loss of pay to launch in UK
Content: A four-day working week trial with no loss of pay will begin in the UK from June 2022. The trial will last for six months with participation expected from around 30 companies. The trial is part of research by Cambridge University, Oxford University and Boston College, in partnership with think tank Autonomy and 4 Day Week Global.

Title: Ratan Tata's brother Jimmy lives in a humble 2 BHK in Mumbai: Harsh Goenka
Content: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka tweeted, "Did you know of Ratan Tata's younger brother Jimmy Tata who lives a quiet reticent life in a humble 2 BHK flat in Mumbai?" Goenka added, "Never interested in business, he was a very good squash player and would beat me every time." Jimmy Naval Tata is reportedly a shareholder in several Tata companies.

Title: ₹5.24 lakh crore investors' wealth wiped off in 2 days amid market sell-off
Content: Investors' wealth has eroded by ₹5,24,647.66 crore in two days as markets saw a hectic sell-off on Wednesday as well. The BSE Sensex plunged 656 points to settle at 60,098 on Wednesday, after tanking 554 points on Tuesday. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms, which reached a lifetime high of ₹280 trillion on Monday, slumped to ₹274 trillion on Wednesday.

Title: Musk should repay $13 bn for SolarCity deal: Tesla investors to judge
Content: Tesla's shareholders have urged a judge that Musk be ordered to return the stock he received from the SolarCity acquisition deal and pay Tesla $13 billion. "This case has always been about whether the acquisition...was a rescue from financial distress...orchestrated by...Musk," an attorney for shareholders said. Musk's lawyers have claimed the deal was not a bailout.

Title: China internet firms to require govt permit before investments: Report
Content: China's cyberspace regulator has drafted new guidelines that will require China's large internet companies to obtain government's approval before they undertake any investments or fundraisings, Reuters reported citing sources. Platforms having more than 100 million users, or with more than $1.58 billion in revenue, will require the permit. The draft rules are still subject to changes.

Title: Twitter blocks Mexican billionaire's account over abusive behaviour
Content: Twitter has blocked Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego's account due to abusive behaviour. "We consider abusive behaviour any attempt to harass, intimidate, or silence another person's voice," Twitter said. However, it did not specify why Salinas had been blocked. Salinas had earlier engaged in a dispute with Mexican journalist Denise Dresser and made comments about her appearance.

Title: SEBI launches Saa₹thi mobile app for investor education
Content: SEBI has launched its mobile app, Saa₹thi, to create awareness among investors about the basic concepts of securities market. The app, available in Hindi and English, will also explain about KYC process, trading and settlement, mutual funds (MF), recent market developments and investor grievances redressal mechanism, among other things. It would be made available in regional languages in future.

Title: Bajaj Auto's net profit falls 22% to ₹1,214 crore in Q3
Content: Bajaj Auto on Wednesday reported a 22% decline in net profit at ₹1,214 crore for the October-December period as compared to a net profit of ₹1,556 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose marginally to ₹9,022 crore. The two and three-wheeler maker's total volumes across categories declined by 10% to 11,81,361 units in the third quarter.

Title: Auto sector need GST reduction for e-two wheelers: Experts on Budget 2022
Content: The automobile sector needs reduction in GST for two-wheelers in EV segment to boost demand, experts have said ahead of the upcoming Budget. "Long-term strategy outline is a key expectation" of the sector, Saket Mehra, Auto Sector Leader at Grant Thornton Bharat, said. He further suggested that government should reduce cost of e-mobility and focus on net-zero carbon emission goals.

Title: Stop online sales, rampant ads of COVID self-test kits: AIOCD to DGCI
Content: All India Organisation of Chemists and Druggists (AIOCD) has written to the Drugs Controller General of India (DGCI) seeking a ban on online sales and advertising of COVID-19 self-test kits. Offline retailers are keeping a record of all sales whereas online players are not, said AIOCD. Uncontrolled sale of testing kits online is creating unrest among offline dealers, it added.

Title: Govt asks ministries to contain expenses within prescribed limit
Content: Ahead of the Union Budget, the Finance Ministry has asked ministries and departments to restrict their expenses with the revised estimates. The ministry also sought proposals for the third and final batch of Supplementary Demands for Grants and asked the ministries to submit proposals by February 10. The government estimates fiscal deficit at 6.8% of the GDP in 2022-23.

Title: Cabinet approves ₹1,500 cr infusion in Indian renewable energy agency
Content: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday approved infusion of ₹1,500 crore in the Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency Limited (IREDA) to enable it to lend loans up to ₹12,000 crore to the renewable energy sector. "IREDA's portfolio has increased from ₹8,800 crore to ₹28,000 crore in the past six years," Union Minister Anurag Thakur said after the cabinet meeting.

Title: India's fiscal deficit could narrow to 6.3% of GDP in 2022-23: Report
Content: India is on track to meet its fiscal deficit target for 2021-22 and will likely aim to narrow the gap to 6.3% of gross domestic product in 2022-23, according to SBI's research report. SBI's economist Soumya Kanti Ghosh expects about 8% growth in expenditure and 10.8% increase in receipts while estimating gross market borrowings at ₹12 lakh crore in 2022-23.

Title: Ex-Gujarat Cabinet Minister Dileep Sanghani elected IFFCO Chairman
Content: Dileep Sanghani, former Gujarat Cabinet Minister, on Wednesday was unanimously elected as the 17th Chairman of Indian Farmers Fertiliser Cooperative Limited (IFFCO) by its Board of Directors. He was elected after the demise of former IFFCO Chairman Balvinder Singh Nakai on October 11, 2021, IFFCO said in a statement. Sanghani was appointed IFFCO Vice Chairman in 2019.

Title: Premium auto dealer Landmark files papers with SEBI for ₹762 cr IPO
Content: Luxury auto dealer Landmark Cars Limited has filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to raise ₹762 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). The public issue consists of a fresh issue of equity shares totalling ₹150 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹612 crore, according to the DRHP.

Title: GAIL suspends marketing director after CBI arrest over ₹50-lakh bribe
Content: GAIL on Wednesday confirmed the suspension of its Director (Marketing) ES Ranganathan following his arrest by the CBI over allegedly taking a ₹50-lakh bribe to give discounts on petrochemical products to private companies. CBI also searched Ranganathan's Noida residence and his office. Ranganathan was appointed Director (Marketing) of GAIL in July 2020 and was to retire in May 2023.

Title: Hospitality sector seeks capital support, loan moratorium in Budget 2022
Content: Hospitality industry body FHRAI on Tuesday said it has asked Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for working capital support with a guarantee to banks and NBFCs from the Centre. It has also asked the government to consider a moratorium for the industry's loans and a special resolution framework for restructuring loans. These measures, FHRAI said, are to support the pandemic-battered industry.

Title: Banks urge govt to reduce tax-saving FD tenure from 5 to 3 years
Content: Indian Banks' Association (IBA) urged the government to reduce fixed deposit (FD) tenure from five to three years for availing tax benefits. "If the lock-in period is reduced, it would make the product more attractive and add more funds to the banks," IBA said in its pre-Budget proposal. They also sought special rebates for expenditure on financial inclusion activities.

Title: Billions need to be vaccinated at faster rate for pandemic to end: Adar Poonawalla
Content: In order to reach the end of the pandemic, billions of people need to be vaccinated at a faster pace, Adar Poonawalla, CEO of Serum Institute of India (SII), said on Tuesday. "The COVID vaccine supply is no longer a constraint...and we are in a much better place than last year to meet the demands," Poonawalla said.

Title: Pfizer CEO wins $1 million Genesis Prize for developing COVID-19 vaccine
Content: Pfizer's CEO Albert Bourla has been awarded the $1-million Genesis Prize, also known as 'Jewish Nobel', for his efforts in leading the development of a COVID-19 vaccine. Bourla, who's a son of Holocaust survivors, received highest number of votes in a recent vote, in which people from 71 countries participated. Pfizer's vaccine was "ready in record time", the committee said.

Title: Microsoft to buy video game maker Activision Blizzard for $68.7 bn in all-cash deal
Content: Microsoft said it will acquire American video game company Activision Blizzard in an all-cash transaction valued at $68.7 billion. When the transaction closes, Microsoft will become the world’s third-largest gaming company by revenue, behind Tencent and Sony. The acquisition includes iconic franchises from the Activision, Blizzard and King studios like 'Warcraft', 'Call of Duty' and 'Candy Crush'.

Title: K'taka invites Musk to build Tesla plant, says 'B'luru Tesla's maiden address in India'
Content: Karnataka has joined states like Telangana, West Bengal, Maharashtra, Punjab and Tamil Nadu to invite Elon Musk to set up a Tesla plant in the state. Karnataka Minister Murugesh R Nirani called Karnataka "EV hub of India," while adding, "Bengaluru is already Tesla's maiden address in India." Earlier, Musk had tweeted about "challenges with the government" for Tesla's India launch.

Title: Better.com's Vishal Garg, who fired 900 staff, returns to his full-time role as CEO
Content: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's Vishal Garg, who took time off after firing 900 employees on a Zoom call in December, has returned to his full-time duties as CEO. "We are confident in Vishal and in the changes he is committed to making," the company said in an internal memo. "Nobody wants him back," a current employee said.

Title: Airbnb CEO to live in Airbnbs & work remotely, says it's 'decentralisation of living'
Content: Airbnb's billionaire CEO Brian Chesky tweeted that his home will now "be an Airbnb somewhere" and he'll move to a different city every few weeks and work remotely. "The pandemic has created the biggest change to travel since the advent of commercial flying. For the first time, millions...can...live anywhere," he wrote. Chesky referred to it as "decentralisation of living".

Title: What is the Antrix-Devas deal called a 'fraud' by FM Sitharaman?
Content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman hailed the Supreme Court upholding the winding up of Bengaluru-based Devas Multimedia in the Antrix-Devas deal, calling the deal a "fraud". In 2005, Devas signed a deal with ISRO's Antrix to provide services on S-band spectrum but UPA government cancelled the deal in 2011. Devas approached international courts and reportedly holds ₹15,000 crore arbitral awards against Antrix.

Title: Antrix-Devas satellite deal was fraud against India, signed under UPA: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the satellite deal between ISRO's Antrix Corporation and Devas Multimedia, which was signed under Congress-led UPA government in 2005, "was a fraud on people of India and against the country". After the deal was cancelled in 2011, Devas went for international arbitration, FM added. On Monday, the Supreme Court upheld NCLAT order to liquidate Devas.

Title: Zero-bedroom house listed as 'worst house on the best block' sells for ₹14.7 cr in US
Content: A house built in 1900, that has zero bedrooms, one bathroom and kitchen, has been sold for nearly $1.97 million (₹14.7 crore) in US' San Francisco. It is "the worst house on the best block making it a fantastic opportunity", the Compass real-estate agents Todd and Kim Wiley wrote. "This is peak San Francisco," an Instagram user said.

Title: We will not be an ultra-low-cost airline: MD of Jhunjhunwala's Akasa Air
Content: Vinay Dube, the MD and CEO of billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed airline Akasa Air, has said that the airline will not be an ultra-low-cost carrier but will be an affordable one. "We certainly want to have a competitive cost structure," he added. The airline expects to start its commercial operations by late May or early June of 2022.

Title: Premji carries index cards, writes down every promise he has made: Nilekani's book
Content: Wipro's Azim Premji carries 5x7 index cards and writes down all the promises he has made, according to a book. He then files these cards in a way that makes them easy to recall when needed. The book, 'The Art of Bitfulness: Keeping Calm in the Digital World', has been authored by Tanuj Bhojwani and Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani.

Title: Vijay Mallya to lose London home 'worth millions of pounds' over unpaid loans to UBS
Content: A UK court has allowed Swiss bank UBS to take possession of fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya's London home, which is said to be worth "tens of millions of pounds", over unpaid dues. Mallya had obtained mortgage from UBS on the property. The court said it can't grant more time to Mallya to repay the £20.4-million (₹206 crore) loan to UBS.

Title: Vikram Dev Dutt appointed Chairman & Managing Director of Air India
Content: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet on Tuesday appointed Vikram Dev Dutt as the Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Air India. He has been appointed as the Air India chief in the rank and pay of an Additional Secretary. Dutt is an IAS officer of the 1993 batch of AGMUT (Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, Mizoram and Union Territory) cadre.

Title: Bitcoin's price may decline 50% as crypto bubble deflates: Invesco
Content: Investment management firm Invesco said that world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin is expected to see price decline of over 50% in 2022 from its peak of around $68,000 in November 2021. Invesco Global Head of Asset Allocation Paul Jackson said that mass marketing of Bitcoin reminds people of the activity of stockbrokers before the Wall Street Crash of 1929.

Title: US examines Alibaba's cloud unit for national security risks: Report
Content: The US government is reviewing Alibaba's cloud business to determine whether it poses a risk to national security, Reuters reported citing sources. It is probing if the Chinese government could gain access to the company's US clients' data. US regulators could ultimately choose to force the company to take measures to reduce risks or stop people from using its service.

Title: Musk engineered Tesla's SolarCity purchase as a bailout: Investors
Content: Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity was a "bailout" of the sun-power provider engineered by the electric carmaker's CEO Elon Musk, a lawyer for Tesla investors suing Musk told a judge in US. "Musk intended the acquisition to be a bailout, and he was the most important person to make that happen," the lawyer said in his closing arguments.

Title: Amazon sued by family of worker killed in warehouse collapse in US
Content: Amazon has been sued by the family of a delivery truck driver who was killed when the company's warehouse in US' Illinois collapsed after being hit by a tornado. The lawsuit claims Amazon officials "rolled the dice with peoples' lives to put profit over safety". The family of 26-year-old Austin McEwen is seeking damages in excess of multi-millions of dollars.

Title: Reliance calls for tighter regulation of e-comm platforms: Report
Content: Reliance Industries has called for tighter regulation of marketplace e-commerce platforms to ensure such websites treat all sellers equally, reported Reuters citing sources. The DPIIT held a meeting of stakeholders on e-commerce policy on Tuesday. During the meeting, a Reliance executive reportedly said marketplace websites must act independently and should have no relationship with their sellers.

Title: GAIL Marketing Director Ranganathan suspended by govt after CBI arrest
Content: The government suspended Gas Authority of India Limited's (GAIL) Director (Marketing) ES Ranganathan after he was arrested by the CBI in relation to a bribery case. CBI arrested him in connection with discounts Ranganathan had allegedly promised to private companies buying petrochemicals from GAIL in exchange of a ₹50 lakh bribe. Ranganathan was appointed Director in July 2020.

Title: Crude oil prices hit 7-year high following Houthi attack on UAE
Content: Benchmark oil prices soared to their highest levels since 2014 on Tuesday as a Houthi attack on UAE added to possibility of oil supply disruptions. Brent crude futures rose by 0.9%, or $0.74, to $87.22/barrel and West Texas Intermediate crude futures jumped 1.3%, or $1.07, to $84.89. Yemen's Houthi rebel group attacked UAE using drones on Monday, killing two Indians.

Title: Axis Bank sends legal notice to Zee, seeks ₹146 cr in dues: Report
Content: Axis Bank's subsidiary has sent a legal notice to promoters of Zee Entertainment over non-repayment of loans worth ₹146 crore, ET reported. Axis Finance also threatened to drag Subhash Chandra and his son Punit Goenka to court in case of non-recovery of loans before closure of Zee-Sony Pictures Network India merger. Zee has reportedly dismissed the allegations, calling them meritless.

Title: Jewellery council seeks import duty cut on gold, silver in Budget
Content: The Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council has urged the Centre to reduce import duty on precious metals such as gold, silver and platinum from 7.5% to 4% in Budget 2022-23. The Council also sought an import duty cut on cut and polished diamonds from 7.5% to 2.5%, besides permitting sale of rough diamonds in Mumbai's 'Special Notified Zone'.

Title: Jewellery industry body urges Centre to reduce cumulative GST to 1.25%
Content: The All India Gem and Jewellery Domestic Council (GJC) on Tuesday urged the government to consider reducing cumulative GST on gold and precious metals from 3% to 1.25%. GJC also urged the government to provide suitable clarification on the minimum quantity of gold which can be deposited under Centre's Gold Monetisation Scheme without questioning.

Title: Raise home-loan deduction limit in Budget to ₹5 lakh: Knight Frank to govt
Content: The government should raise tax deduction given under Section 24 for housing loan interest from ₹2 lakh to ₹5 lakh in the upcoming Budget, property consultancy firm Knight Frank India said. The firm suggested that the government allow input tax credit (ITC) to reduce developers' tax burden. Knight Frank also suggested extending 100% tax exemption for affordable housing projects.

Title: Bajaj Finance's net profit soars 84% y-o-y to ₹1,934 crore in Q3
Content: Bajaj Finance on Tuesday said its standalone net profit rose 84% over the preceding year to ₹1,933.85 crore in third quarter ended December 2021. The company’s net interest income for the quarter increased by 40% year-on-year to ₹5,553 crore. Its consolidated assets under management grew 26% to ₹1.81 lakh crore from ₹1.43 lakh crore in the year ago period.

Title: Reliance Jio pre-pays ₹30,791 cr to clear deferred spectrum liabilities
Content: Reliance Jio Infocomm has pre-paid ₹30,791 crore, including accrued interest, to the government to clear deferred spectrum liabilities. The liabilities pertain to spectrum acquired in auctions of 2014, 2015, 2016 and spectrum acquired in 2021 through trading of right to use with Bharti Airtel. The pre-payment will result in interest cost savings of around ₹1,200 crore annually, the company said.

Title: Centre reaps ₹6,651 cr dividend from 12 public sector enterprises
Content: The Centre has received about ₹6,651 crore as dividend from a dozen central public sector enterprises (CPSEs). "Government has received about ₹2,506 crore from Power Grid Corporation of India Limited as dividend tranches," DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey tweeted. He added that GAIL and National Mineral Development Corporation's dividends were about ₹913 crore and ₹1,605 crore respectively.

Title: KPMG to train BCom/BBA/MBA students for finance jobs: Masters' Union
Content: The 1-year part-time course, created by KPMG in India with Masters' Union aims to train BCom, BBA, and MBA students/pass-outs for finance jobs in Big 4s, MNCs, and startups. Fully taught by Partners & Directors of KPMG in India, the course offers 6-month virtual internship. The hands-on curriculum is similar to what freshers learn on joining Big 4s, etc, said Masters' Union.

Title: Wealth of India's 10 richest can fund school, higher studies of kids for 25 yrs: Oxfam
Content: The wealth of India's 10 richest people is enough to fund school and higher education of India's children for 25 years, an Oxfam study said. It said an additional 1% tax on the richest 10% can provide India with 17.7 lakh extra oxygen cylinders. The collective wealth of India's 100 richest people hit ₹57.3 lakh crore in 2021, it added.

Title: New billionaire created every 26 hours since COVID-19 pandemic began: Oxfam
Content: A new billionaire has been created every 26 hours since the COVID-19 pandemic began, an Oxfam study said. Meanwhile, 99% of the world's population became worse off because of lockdowns, lower international trade and less tourism, it stated. It added that inequality is contributing to the death of at least 21,000 people each day or one person every four seconds.

Title: Whom should we contract for using the CEAT bat? Goenka asks Twitter users
Content: Businessman Harsh Goenka, the Chairman of RPG group that owns the tyre manufacturing company CEAT, on Monday tweeted, "Need your advice on whom we should contract for the future for using the CEAT bat." He added, "Please suggest one senior player and one upcoming." When a user suggested Virat Kohli's name, Goenka responded, "Virat is with MRF."

Title: 40-yr-old Swiss college dropout's fintech startup shoots his wealth to $19.4 bn
Content: Guillaume Pousaz, the 40-year-old Swiss Founder of UK-based fintech startup Checkout.com, is now worth $19.4 billion after his startup's latest $1 billion funding round at a $40 billion valuation. Pousaz dropped out of college in 2005 after his father became ill with pancreatic cancer and later worked for a US firm. He launched the online payments startup in 2012.

Title: TN minister is 5th Indian politician to invite Musk, says 'we're India's EV capital'
Content: Tamil Nadu Minister for Industries Thangam Thenarasu on Monday became the fifth Indian politician to invite Tesla CEO Elon Musk to set up shop, saying, "Welcome to India's Electric Vehicle capital." Thenarasu tweeted, "Tamil Nadu accounts for 34% share in total planned investments for Electric Vehicles...Also [it's] one of the top nine renewable energy markets in the world."

Title: India has world's largest, safe, successful digital payments platform: PM
Content: PM Narendra Modi at WEF's Davos Agenda said India today has the world's largest, safe and successful digital payments platform. In the last month alone, 4.4 billion transactions have taken place in India through UPI, he added. PM said India is sending record number of software engineers to the world and over 50 lakh software developers are working in India.

Title: Pretty wild: Musk as tweet compares Tesla's $1 trillion m-cap to 14 automakers
Content: Tesla CEO and world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted "Pretty wild" after the Twitter account of a Tesla owners club compared Tesla's $1.1 trillion market valuation to that of 14 other automakers. The tweet claimed that GM, Ford, Toyota, BMW, Daimler, Ferrari, Honda, Nissan, Hyundai, Kia, Subaru, Mazda, Aston Martin and Volkswagen had a combined market value of $955 billion.

Title: 'Millions would die' if Tesla's FSD was in all cars, claims software CEO's ad
Content: Dan O'Dowd, CEO of Green Hills Software, whose software is used in BMW iX, claimed in a full-page NYT ad that Tesla's Full Self-Driving system is the "worst software sold by a Fortune 500 company". If FSD was in every car, "millions would die every day", the ad alleged. Elon Musk responded saying, "Green Hills software's a pile of trash."

Title: India had few 100 startups in 2014, today the number has crossed 60,000: PM at WEF
Content: In his World Economic Forum (WEF) special address, PM Narendra Modi said, "Entrepreneurship among Indian youth is at a new height today." He added, "In 2014, there were a few hundred registered startups in India. Their number has crossed 60,000 today." PM further said, "India also has more than 80 unicorns, of which more than 40 were made in 2021."

Title: Reliance acquires 54% stake in robotics startup Addverb for $132 million
Content: Reliance Industries has acquired a 54% stake worth up to $132 million in robotics startup Addverb Technologies, the latter's Co-founder and CEO Sangeet Kumar announced on Tuesday. He said Addverb will continue to operate independently. Founded in 2016 by former executives of Asian Paints, the latest round of investment has valued the Noida-based startup at $265 million to $270 million.

Title: Have zero doubt Paytm's going to be very very valuable: Early investor Elevation Capital
Content: Mukul Arora, co-managing partner at venture firm Elevation Capital, which is Paytm's early investor, told Moneycontrol, "I have zero doubt...Paytm is going to be a very very valuable company." His comments came over two months after Paytm's shares fell on its first trading day. "Vijay (Shekhar Sharma) is by far the most visionary founder we have in India," Arora added.

Title: This is the best time to invest in India: PM Modi in World Economic Forum speech
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Monday delivered the 'State of the World' special address at the World Economic Forum's Davos Agenda, being held virtually. He said, "The entrepreneurship spirit that Indians have, the ability to adopt new technology, can give new energy to each of our global partners. That's why this is the best time to invest in India."

Title: India has become the world’s third-largest pharma producer today: PM
Content: Addressing the World Economic Forum's (WEF) Davos Agenda on Monday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India has become the world's third-largest pharma producer today. "India is the pharmacy to the world," he added. "During COVID-19, we saw how India's vision of 'One Earth, One Health' helped save the lives of millions by sending medicines, vaccines to countries," he said.

Title: Omicron may be more of a flash flood than a wave, lifting prospects: RBI
Content: The RBI in its State of the Economy report said the expectations Omicron may "turn out to be more of a flash flood than a wave have brightened near-term prospects". The financial markets reflect this "optimism", it added. "Overall economic activity in India remains strong, with upbeat consumer and business confidence and upticks in...incoming high frequency indicators," the report said.

Title: 'Throw away' culture has made climate challenge more serious: PM
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his address at the World Economic Forum's Davos Agenda, said, "'We have to accept that our lifestyle is also a big challenge for the climate. 'Throw away' culture and consumerism have made climate challenge more serious." He further said it is very important to rapidly move from today's 'take-make-use-dispose' economy towards a 'circular' economy.

Title: Sri Lanka-born billionaire says 'nobody cares about what's happening to Uighurs'
Content: Sri Lankan-born Canadian venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya faced criticism after he said in a podcast, "Nobody cares about what's happening to Uighurs [in China]." "Of all the things that I care about, yes, it's below my line," he stated. In a statement released later, he said he re-listened to the podcast and recognised that he came across as "lacking empathy".

Title: Credit Suisse Chairman quits after breaking COVID-19 quarantine rules
Content: Credit Suisse Chairman António Horta-Osório has quit the financial services company less than a year after taking up the role. He resigned after he was investigated by the board for breaching COVID-19 quarantine rules. He reportedly attended the Wimbledon tennis finals in July 2021 during a visit to Britain when the country's COVID-19 rules required him to be in quarantine.

Title: Amazon halts plan to stop accepting Visa credit cards in UK
Content: Amazon on Monday said it will not stop accepting Visa-issued credit cards in the UK as it had earlier proposed to do. The e-commerce giant had last year announced that it would ban Visa cards in UK from January 19, 2022, citing high transaction fees charged by Visa. "We are working closely with Visa on a potential solution," Amazon said.

Title: Crypto markets could face another winter of price crashes: UBS bank
Content: Analysts at investment bank UBS have warned that cryptocurrency markets could face another "winter" of price crashes and could fail to recover for years. Led by James Malcolm, the analysts said interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve in 2022 will damage the appeal of cryptocurrencies for many investors. Other factors like regulations could affect the industry's development, they added.

Title: Walmart plans to create crypto and NFTs, reveal trademark filings
Content: Walmart is planning to create its own cryptocurrency and NFTs (non-fungible tokens), filings with the USPTO revealed. The retail giant has filed several trademarks suggesting plans to make and sell virtual goods, including electronics, decor, toys, sporting goods, personal care products. It has also filed trademarks for the names "Verse to Home", "Verse to Curb", and "Verse to Store".

Title: Delhivery gets SEBI's approval for ₹7,460-crore IPO
Content: Gurugram-based logistics startup Delhivery has received SEBI's approval to raise ₹7,460 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). Private equity firm Carlyle and SoftBank will make partial exits via the IPO. SoftBank will be selling shares worth ₹750 crore, while Carlyle will sell shares worth ₹920 crore. Delhivery is reportedly seeking over ₹44,000 crore in valuation.

Title: Reduce GST rate on two-wheelers to 18%: FADA urges govt
Content: Automobile dealers' body FADA has urged the government to reduce GST rate on two-wheelers to 18% to generate demand. FADA said two-wheelers aren't used as luxury but as a necessity to travel distances by lower class. "Hence, the rationale of 28% GST + 2% cess which is for luxury or sin products doesn't hold good for two-wheeler category," it added.

Title: Tata Motors to hike passenger vehicles prices by 0.9% from Jan 19
Content: Tata Motors will marginally hike the prices of its passenger vehicles by 0.9% starting January 19, the company announced on Tuesday. It cited "steep rise in overall input costs" as the reason for the price hike. The company also clarified that there will be no impact of the price hike on bookings made on or before January 18.

Title: OYO to target $9 billion valuation in IPO: Bloomberg
Content: OYO is targeting a valuation of about $9 billion in its upcoming initial public offering (IPO) after preliminary conversations with potential investors, reported Bloomberg. OYO had filed a draft prospectus to raise over $1.1 billion (₹8,430 crore) in October last year. Bloomberg reported that OYO may get an approval for the IPO from SEBI this week or the upcoming one.

Title: India's $650 billion export target for FY22 achievable: Goyal
Content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India's export target of $650 billion for both goods and services in FY22 is possible to achieve. Goyal assured all support to the various export promotion councils and said their issues will be resolved to attain even higher export targets in FY23. "Government is willing to listen to new ideas," Goyal said.

Title: Indian economy set to improve over next 12 months: PwC Global CEO Survey
Content: According to PwC's Global CEO Survey, India's economic growth is set to improve in the next 12 months. A total of 4,446 CEOs from across the world, including 77 Indian CEOs, were part of the survey conducted in 89 countries. "94% Indian CEOs...optimistic about global economic growth improving over the next 12 months," the survey said.

Title: Virat embodies the desire to win we wanted to see in our sportsmen: Mahindra
Content: After Virat Kohli stepped down as Indian cricket team's Test captain, businessman Anand Mahindra said, "He's been at the centre of controversies and this decision may evoke varied responses." Mahindra added, "To me, Virat embodies the fierce, unapologetic, unrelenting competitiveness and desire to win that we've always wanted to see in our sportspersons. May the Force be with him."

Title: Navjot Sidhu invites Musk's Tesla to Punjab to make Ludhiana an EV hub
Content: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu tweeted to Tesla CEO Elon Musk inviting him to set up base in the state. "Punjab Model will create Ludhiana as hub for electric vehicles and battery industry with time-bound single window clearance for investment," Sidhu wrote. Musk earlier said he was working through a lot of challenges with Indian government over Tesla launch.

Title: AB Fashion portal faces data breach, over 5 mn email addresses leaked online
Content: Over 5.4 million email addresses and other customer and employee information from Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited database have reportedly been made public in a massive data breach on its portal. Around 700 GB of data has reportedly been released online by 'ShinyHunters' hacker group. ABFRL spokesperson confirmed the incident, saying the company has reset passwords of all customers.

Title: After Telangana, Maharashtra minister tweets 'We invite you' to Tesla CEO Musk
Content: Maharashtra minister Jayant Patil has tweeted to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, "We will provide you all the necessary help from Maharashtra for you to get established in India." He added, "We invite you to establish your manufacturing plant in Maharashtra." This comes after Telangana's Industry and Commerce Minister KT Rama Rao offered help to Musk "to set shop in India/Telangana".

Title: Prima facie, malls don't have the right to collect parking fees: Kerala HC
Content: The Kerala High Court has said that prima facie, it was of the opinion that malls don't have the right to collect parking fees. The court was hearing a couple of pleas alleging that the Lulu International shopping mall was "illegally" collecting parking fees from its customers. The court has now sought the municipality's response on the issue.

Title: India added 40 billionaires in 2021 but income of 84% households fell: Oxfam
Content: The number of Indian billionaires grew from 102 in 2020 to 142 in 2021, according to the Oxfam. It also stated that 84% of households in India suffered a decline in their income in the beginning of the pandemic and the richest 98 Indian billionaires had the same wealth ($657 billion) as the poorest 555 million people in India.

Title: 'Drop by, West Bengal means business', tweets state minister to Tesla CEO Musk
Content: West Bengal Minority Affairs Minister Md Ghulam Rabbani invited Tesla CEO Elon Musk to the state, saying, "Drop (by) here." Rabbani tweeted, "We in West Bengal have the best infrastructure and our leader [CM Mamata Banerjee] has got the vision. Bengal means Business." Telangana's Industry and Commerce Minister KT Rama Rao had also tweeted to Musk.

Title: Wealth of world's 10 richest men doubled to $1.5 trillion during pandemic: Oxfam
Content: The fortunes of the world's 10 richest men, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, more than doubled during the pandemic to $1.5 trillion, according to Oxfam. Their soaring profits since the pandemic began have made them six times more wealthy than the world's poorest 3.1 billion people, the charity added.

Title: 56-year-old CEO of Atlanta's public transportation service dies by suicide
Content: Jeffrey A Parker, the CEO and General Manager of the Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority (MARTA), died by suicide after reportedly stepping in front of a train at a station. The 56-year-old had more than 35 years of experience in both the private and public sectors of the transportation industry. MARTA's Board of Directors called Parker's death "shocking".

Title: Who is Soumitra Dutta, IITian named dean of Oxford's Saïd Business School?
Content: The University of Oxford has appointed India-born Soumitra Dutta as the Dean of Saïd Business School. The 58-year-old completed his schooling from Kendriya Vidyalaya, B.Tech from IIT Delhi and Ph.D from University of California, Berkeley. Dutta, who has a three-decade-long academic career, is currently a Professor of Management at the Cornell SC Johnson College of Business at Cornell University.

Title: GSK rejected Unilever's $68.4 billion offer for its consumer goods unit: Report
Content: Pharmaceutical group GlaxoSmithKline rejected an unsolicited takeover offer from Unilever for its consumer goods business worth roughly 50 billion pounds ($68.4 billion), The Sunday Times reported. The offer was reportedly made in late 2021. GSK's board and Pfizer, which owns a minority stake in the unit, rejected the offer on the basis that it was too low, the report said.

Title: Govt to help increase exports to $1 tn in 10 yrs: Goyal to IT sector
Content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal virtually interacted with representatives of top IT companies and assured them full government support in pushing growth of the sector and increasing services exports to $1 trillion in a decade. He welcomed the industry’s proposal to create IT hubs in tier-2 and tier-3 towns. Businesses should identify the towns and government will assist them, he added.

Title: Tesla asked law firm to fire lawyer who worked on Musk probe: WSJ
Content: Tesla threatened law firm Cooley LLP to fire one of its attorneys or risk losing its business, the WSJ reported. The lawyer had previously worked at the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). He had interviewed Tesla's CEO Elon Musk during the agency's probe into Musk's 2018 tweet claiming he had obtained funding to take Tesla private, the report said.

Title: Reliance, Ola, M&M, 7 others bid for ₹18,100 cr battery PLI scheme
Content: The Ministry of Heavy Industries said 10 companies have submitted bids under the ₹18,100 crore production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for Advanced Chemistry Cell Battery Storage. Reliance, Hyundai, Ola Electric, Mahindra & Mahindra, Larsen & Toubro are among companies who have applied for the scheme. Selected companies would be required to set up manufacturing facilities within two years.

Title: Policybazaar parent PB Fintech acquires Visit Internet Services for ₹22.41 cr
Content: Policybazaar parent PB Fintech announced that it has acquired technology services provider Visit Internet Services for ₹22.41 crore, through its subsidiary Docprime Technologies. This is PB Fintech's second acquisition since it got listed in November 2021 and is expected to be completed by early February 2022. The company acquired MyLoanCare for ₹40.41 crore in December 2021.

Title: India's passenger vehicle exports rose by 46% in Apr-Dec 2021: SIAM
Content: India's passenger vehicle exports rose by 46% between April-December 2021, according to Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) data. Passenger car shipments grew 45% to 2,75,728 units while utility vehicle exports rose 47% to 1,46,688 units during the period. Data also showed that export of vans nearly doubled YoY from 877 units to 1,621 units in April-December 2021.

Title: Reduce import duty on parts used for making mobile phones: ICEA
Content: India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) demanded a reduction in import duty on parts used for manufacturing mobile phones. It said that increasing taxes on components will make products manufactured under the Production Linked Incentive scheme globally uncompetitive. It also demanded roll-back of GST from 18% to 12% as it is deterrent to growth of domestic market and manufacturers.

Title: Metro Brands shares rally after it reports 54% y-o-y jump in Q3 profit
Content: Shares of Metro Brands rallied on Monday after the company reported a 54.63% year-on-year jump in its consolidated net profit for the quarter ended December 2021. The company's net profit for the third quarter stood at ₹100.85 crore, while its total revenue from operations was ₹483.77 crore. Metro Brands shares jumped 19.99% to its upper circuit limit on the NSE.

Title: Oil India sells 20% stake in US shale oil venture for $25 mn
Content: Oil India Limited (OIL) has exited from a US shale oil venture and sold its 20% stake to venture partner Verdad Resources LLC for $25 million. OIL and Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) had together bought a 30% stake in Houston-based Carrizo Oil and Gas' Niobrara shale asset for $82.5 million in October 2012.

Title: GE suspends COVID-19 vaccine or test requirement after US Court's ruling
Content: General Electric (GE) suspended its COVID-19 vaccine or test requirement policy for employees on Friday after the US Supreme Court's ruling. The court called the Joe Biden administration’s requirements a ''blunt instrument'' that ''draws no distinctions based on industry or risk of exposure to COVID-19.'' GE is the first major company to halt its policy after the Supreme Court's ruling.

Title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala raises stake in Titan to 4.02% in Dec quarter
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala bought more shares of Titan Company in the quarter ended December 2021, increasing his stake in the company to 4.02% from 3.8% in the previous quarter. Meanwhile, Jhunjhunwala's wife Rekha's shareholding in Titan remained unchanged at 1.07%. The value of Jhunjhunwalas' stake in the Tata Group company stood at ₹11,738.10 crore as of Friday's closing price.

Title: NARCL Chairman to assist RBL Bank in finding full-time MD and CEO
Content: RBL Bank said it has inducted NARCL Chairman Pradip Shah as an external expert to assist its search panel in finding a full-time MD and CEO. In December, the private lender had named Rajeev Ahuja as its interim MD and CEO after RBL Bank's board approved former MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja's request to "proceed on leave with immediate effect".

Title: GAIL's Marketing Director arrested by CBI in alleged bribery case
Content: The CBI has arrested GAIL's Director (Marketing) ES Ranganathan and five others in an alleged bribery case. A case was registered against Ranganathan and several others for allegedly obtaining bribes from private companies buying petrochemical products marketed by GAIL. The CBI conducted a search at Ranganathan's residence and recovered about ₹1.29 crore cash, gold jewellery and other valuables.

Title: 3.8 lakh Kellogg's cereal boxes seized in Mexico over cartoons featured on them
Content: Mexico has seized 3.8 lakh boxes of Kellogg's cereals, including Corn Flakes and Special K, after raiding 75 sales outlets. The consumer protection agency claimed that cartoon drawings featured on the boxes violated recently enacted laws aimed at improving children's diets. It further said the cereal boxes did not clearly mention nutritional values like calories, fats, salt or sugar.

Title: Rejected 3 bids from Unilever that undervalued consumer goods arm: GSK
Content: GlaxoSmithKline has confirmed that it received three "unsolicited, conditional and non-binding proposals" from Unilever to acquire its consumer goods business. "The latest proposal received on December 20, 2021 was for a total acquisition value of £50 billion," GSK said. The company further said it rejected all bids "on the basis that they fundamentally undervalued" the consumer goods business.

Title: India's gold imports more than double in Apr-Dec 2021 to $38 bn
Content: India's gold imports rose to $38 billion in April-December 2021 from $16.78 billion in April-December 2020, a 126.4% YoY increase, as per Commerce Ministry's data. The surge in gold imports in April-December 2021 contributed to widening of India's trade deficit to $142.44 billion, a 132% YoY increase. India's trade deficit in April-December 2020 stood at $61.38 billion.

Title: Unilever confirms interest in GSK unit, says 'No certainty of any agreement'
Content: Unilever has confirmed that it had approached GlaxoSmithKline about acquiring its consumer goods business. The statement followed The Sunday Times' report saying Unilever had offered to buy GlaxoSmithKline's unit for roughly 50 billion pounds ($68.4 billion) last year, but the offer was rejected for being too low. "There can be no certainty that any agreement will be reached," Unilever said.

Title: 'Ratan Tata shares pic with Guns N' Roses star Slash, Ranveer comments 'Too cool'
Content: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata shared an old picture with Guns N' Roses star Slash. "The day I visited...Galpin Jaguar on...one of my retail outlet visits, I was excited to meet this gentleman...who was taking delivery of his new Jaguar XKR. A very polite rockstar, Slash," he wrote. "Wow!! This is too cool!" Ranveer Singh commented on the post.

Title: HCL Technologies to hire 20,000-22,000 fresher graduates in FY22
Content: HCL Technologies on Friday said it expects to hire 20,000 to 22,000 fresher graduates in FY22 and has already onboarded 17,500 freshers as of January 10, 2022. HCL's Chief Human Resources Officer Apparao VV said the company plans to double its fresher hiring in FY23. Its attrition rate rose to 19.8% in October-December period from 15.7% in the previous quarter.

Title: Telangana Minister tweets to Musk, says will help Tesla work through challenges in India
Content: Telangana's Industry and Commerce Minister KT Rama Rao tweeted to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, "Will be happy to partner Tesla in working through challenges to set shop in India/Telangana." This comes after Musk said he's facing "challenges with...(Indian) government" for Tesla's launch. "Our state is a champion in sustainability initiatives and a top notch business destination," Rao said.

Title: Sundar Pichai shares concept pics of UK office Google is buying for $1 billion
Content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai said that he's excited that Google is buying the Central Saint Giles office they moved into in 2011 in UK's London. Google said it would spend $1 billion to buy the office space. Releasing concept pictures, Pichai said, "It'll be a more flexible future workplace...Looking forward to having space for 10,000 Googlers across our UK offices!"

Title: Hero MotoCorp to invest up to ₹420 crore in Ather Energy
Content: Hero MotoCorp's board has approved an investment of up to ₹420 core in Bengaluru-based electric vehicle startup Ather Energy. The company said it currently holds a 34.8% stake in Ather on a fully diluted basis and its shareholding will increase after the investment. Founded in 2013 by Tarun Mehta and Swapnil Jain, Ather counts Hero MotoCorp as an early investor.

Title: Mahindra says Tamil is energy efficient language, 'poda dei' was 1st phrase he learnt
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted that one Tamil phrase, "poda dei", is enough to sum up a person's frustration, as opposed to two full English sentences. Mahindra, who did his schooling in Tamil Nadu, said, "This Tamil phrase is the one I learned first, used the most often...and have used consistently...throughout my life." He described Tamil as an "energy-efficient language".

Title: Union Budget 2022-23 to be presented on February 1
Content: The government will present the Union Budget for 2022-23 on February 1. The first part of the Parliament's budget session will begin on January 31 and conclude on February 11. The first day of the session will see the government presenting the Economic Survey. The second part of the session will begin from March 14 and conclude on April 8.

Title: Thieves raid Amazon & FedEx train cargo, leave empty packages on LA tracks
Content: Photos showing piles of empty packages, including those from retailers like Amazon and FedEx, on rail tracks in US' Los Angeles County have gone viral amid a rise in cargo theft. The thieves wait until trains are immobilised, break locks and leave behind empty boxes, reports said. Rail operator Union Pacific said thefts have risen 160% year-on-year in LA county.

Title: 'Pharma Bro' Shkreli barred from drug industry for life, ordered to pay $64 mn
Content: A US court has barred Vyera Pharmaceuticals Founder Martin Shkreli from the pharmaceutical industry for life. Nicknamed "Pharma Bro", Shkreli had hiked the price of the life-saving drug Daraprim, used to treat a parasitic infection called toxoplasmosis, by over 5,000% overnight in 2015. The court has also ordered him to pay $64.6 million in profits he earned from the scheme.

Title: Roundhill Investments to relinquish 'META' stock ticker in the US
Content: US-based Roundhill Investments, which uses 'META' for its Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF, has announced that it will relinquish the ticker symbol on January 31. Earlier, Facebook-parent Meta, which still trades under the ticker FB, had said it would change its ticker to 'MVRS'. However, days before the planned switch, Meta delayed changing the symbol without an explanation.

Title: Google to buy Central Saint Giles offices in London for $1 billion
Content: Google is purchasing Central Saint Giles development, a central London building where it is currently a tenant, for $1 billion. Google said it will refurbish the offices to create a future flexible workplace. Notably, Google's new London headquarters is currently under construction. The 11-storey building will include a swimming pool, an indoor basketball court, massage rooms and a roof garden.

Title: Flipkart acquires refurbished electronics seller Yaantra
Content: Flipkart on Thursday announced that it has acquired electronics recommerce company Yaantra to enhance its after sale offerings for its consumers in the smartphone segment. However, Flipkart did not disclose the acquisition amount. Yaantra, which repairs and sells refurbished consumer tech products such as smartphones, was incorporated in 2013 by Jayant Jha, Ankit Saraf and Anmol Gupta.

Title: Delhivery gets SEBI's approval for ₹7,460-crore IPO: Report
Content: Gurugram-based logistics startup Delhivery has received markets regulator SEBI's approval for its ₹7,460-crore IPO, reported ET Now. According to its DRHP, Delhivery's IPO will comprise a fresh issue of shares worth ₹5,000 crore and an offer-for-sale of shares worth ₹2,460 crore. Delhivery investors, including Carlyle, SoftBank, Times Internet, are planning to sell part of their stakes in the IPO.

Title: Block Amazon deal to acquire 100% stake in Cloudtail: CAIT to CCI
Content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has filed a petition before the Competition Commission of India (CCI) seeking to block Amazon's deal to acquire 100% shareholding in Cloudtail. "The petition provides evidence to show Cloudtail charges less fees/commission and is a preferential seller," CAIT said. Cloudtail is a joint venture between Amazon and NR Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures.

Title: Maruti Suzuki hikes vehicle prices by up to 4.3% to manage rise in input cost
Content: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki on Saturday said it is increasing prices of its models in the range of 0.1% to 4.3% to partially offset the impact of the rise in input costs. The company hiked prices at least thrice in 2021 by 1.4% in January, 1.6% in April and 1.9% in September, taking the total quantum to 4.9%.

Title: India's wholesale inflation eases to 13.56% in December
Content: India's Wholesale Price Index-based (WPI) inflation eased to 13.56% in December 2021, driven by a fall in prices of fuel items, data released by the Commerce Ministry showed. The food articles segment witnessed a 9.56 per cent surge. In November, the WPI rose to a 12-year high of 14.23%, while October's WPI data was revised to 13.83% from 12.54%.

Title: PM Modi to address WEF Davos virtual summit on January 17
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Davos Agenda 2022' virtual summit on January 17. Themed 'The State of the World', the week-long event will see world leaders speak on critical collective challenges. UN chief Antonio Guterres, Japan's PM Fumio Kishida, Australian PM Scott Morrison and Israeli PM Naftali Bennett among others will also participate.

Title: Aditya Birla Fashion to acquire 51% stake in House of Masaba for ₹90 crore
Content: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail has said that it will acquire 51% stake in Masaba Gupta's fashion label House of Masaba Lifestyle for ₹90 crore. The tie-up will mark ABFRL's entry into the beauty and personal care market in India. The two companies also target to build a business worth ₹500 crore in the next five years.

Title: India's exports rise 39% to record $37.8 bn in Dec, imports surge too
Content: India's merchandise exports in December 2021 surged by 39% on an annual basis to $37.81 billion, the highest-ever monthly figure recorded. The trade deficit marginally reduced to $21.68 billion when compared to November, Commerce Ministry data showed on Friday. Imports in December 2021 also increased 38.55% to $59.48 billion on account of an increase in petroleum and crude oil imports.

Title: Mindtree stock falls 4% after company posts rise in net profit
Content: Shares of IT firm Mindtree ended 4.19% lower on Friday after the company posted a 34% jump in consolidated net profit at ₹437.5 crore for the December quarter. The Bengaluru-based company's revenue came in at ₹2,750 crore in the third quarter, registering a growth of 36% from the year-ago period. Mindtree's stock has fallen after three days of consecutive gain.

Title: RIL, M&M submit bid for India's $2.4 billion battery scheme: Report
Content: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL), Mahindra & Mahindra and Hyundai Global Motors are reportedly among companies that have submitted bids under India's $2.4 billion battery scheme. Ola Electric, Larsen & Toubro and Exide have also submitted bids, Reuters reported citing sources. Indian government launched this incentive program last year to boost local manufacturing of batteries.

Title: China's trade surplus hits a record high at $676 billion in 2021
Content: China's trade surplus rose to $94.5 billion in December, taking the total trade surplus for 2021 to an all-time high of $676 billion. Its exports in December stood at $340.5 billion, taking the full-year total to $3.36 trillion, as per customs data. The country's total imports for 2021 were at $2.69 trillion, including $246 billion in December.

Title: Adani Wilmar cuts IPO size from ₹4,500 crore to ₹3,600 crore: Report
Content: Adani Wilmar, a joint venture between Adani Group and Singapore's Wilmar group, has cut the size of its initial public offering (IPO) to ₹3,600 crore, PTI reported. The company had earlier planned to raise ₹4,500 crore through a fresh issue of equity shares, as per its draft red herring prospectus. Adani Wilmar sells edible oils under the Fortune brand.

Title: HDFC Bank's net profit rises 18.1% y-o-y to ₹10,342 crore in Q3
Content: HDFC Bank's standalone net profit jumped 18.1% year-on-year to ₹10,342 crore in the quarter ended December 2021. The bank's net revenues, including net interest income (NII) and other income, increased by 12% to ₹26,627 crore, as against ₹23,760.8 crore in the year-ago period. Its NII grew by 13% to ₹18,443.5 crore as compared to ₹16,317.6 crore a year ago.

Title: Telcos seek ITC refund of ₹35,000 cr, GST waiver on licence fee in Budget
Content: Telecom operators are seeking a refund of around ₹35,000 crore in input tax credit (ITC), reduced levies and GST waiver on licence fees and spectrum usage in the upcoming Budget. In its pre-Budget recommendations, telecom industry body Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) also asked the government to suspend universal service obligation fund (USOF) to reduce burden on service providers.

Title: Amazon aggregator Thrasio to invest $500 mn for India e-commerce expansion
Content: Thrasio, an aggregator of private brands on Amazon, is planning to invest over $500 million for e-commerce expansion in India. Thrasio said it acquired consumer goods company Lifelong Online to commence the push. ''We plan to participate in the 'Make in India' movement by transitioning the manufacturing for some of our products to the country,'' Thrasio CEO Carlos Cashman said.

Title: HCL Technologies' profit falls 13.6% y-o-y to ₹3,442 crore in Q3
Content: HCL Technologies on Friday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,442 crore for the quarter ended December 2021, down 13.6% from ₹3,969 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company said its revenue from operations increased 15.7% year-on-year to ₹22,331 crore. Further, the board of HCL Technologies has declared an interim dividend of ₹10 per share for the FY2021-22.

Title: Navi Health Insurance promises to provide complete Covid-19 protection
Content: With the rise in Omicron and Covid cases in the country, Navi believes people need health plans that provide complete Covid coverage. That's why Navi Health Insurance is offering health plans that aim to cover all Covid-related hospitalization costs. With a waiting period of 30 days, Navi Health Insurance also offers monthly premiums starting at ₹241.

Title: Govt says Tesla trying to pressurise India after Musk tweets on launch hurdles: Report
Content: After Elon Musk said he's working through "a lot of challenges" for Tesla's India launch, a government official reportedly said, "Tesla's trying to put pressure...by using social media." Tesla can bring cars in "knocked down form with zero duty", the official told ET. The firm wants a reduction in import duties "without commitment to producing in India", the official added.

Title: Bezos' girlfriend shares montage of his childhood pics & early days at Amazon on b'day
Content: World's second richest person Jeff Bezos' girlfriend Lauren Sanchez shared a montage, which included pictures from his childhood and early days at Amazon, on his 58th birthday. "If I had one wish for you...it would be that the world will see you through my eyes," she wrote. Bezos was born on January 12, 1964 and founded Amazon in 1994.

Title: What's the rate at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
Content: India's top IT company TCS' attrition rate rose to 15.3% in the October-December period from 11.9% in the previous quarter, however, it claimed it's the "lowest in the industry". Second-largest IT firm Infosys' attrition rate rose to 25.5%, while Wipro's attrition rate rose to 22.7%. Attrition rate is used to describe the rate at which employees are leaving the company.

Title: TCS, Wipro, Infosys added record 1.7 lakh employees in 2021
Content: IT companies TCS, Infosys and Wipro added a record 1.7 lakh employees in 2021, as compared to the 31,000 they had hired in 2020. For the first three quarters of FY22, the three companies hired 1.34 lakh employees. While TCS recorded a net addition of 87,725 employees in 2021, Wipro and Infosys added 41,363 and 42,755 employees, respectively.

Title: Pakistan planning a complete ban on cryptocurrencies: Reports
Content: The Pakistan government and the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP), Pakistan's central bank, are planning a complete ban on the use of all cryptocurrencies, according to reports. An SBP panel recommended that cryptocurrencies should be declared illegal and urged the Sindh High Court to impose penalties on crypto exchanges. This comes after Pakistan detected an alleged $100-million crypto scam.

Title: Dogecoin jumps 20% as Elon Musk says Tesla merch now buyable with the crypto
Content: Dogecoin jumped around 20% after Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted, "Tesla merch buyable with Dogecoin." The electric carmaker has started displaying some of its products' prices in the meme-based cryptocurrency on its website, including 'Cyberquad' for kids and Cybertruck-inspired 'Cyberwhistle'. This comes a month after Musk, who is the world's richest person, had revealed plans to do so.

Title: Paytm shares erode over half of IPO investors' wealth in 2 months
Content: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares hit an all-time low below ₹1,030 apiece during intraday trade on Thursday, eroding over half of the value from its IPO price of ₹2,150 apiece. At the IPO price, the firm was worth around ₹1.39 lakh crore, but its market value now stands below ₹70,000 crore. Earlier, Macquarie Research retained 'underperform' rating on the stock.

Title: 118-year-old Ford's market cap tops $100 billion for the 1st time ever
Content: Ford Motor's market capitalisation soared to $100 billion for the first time ever on Thursday as its stock hit a 20-year high after it announced plans to increase EV production. This made the 118-year-old automaker more valuable than General Motors ($90 billion) and Rivian Automotive ($72 billion). However, it still lags behind Tesla's $1 trillion market capitalisation.

Title: Paytm stock slips below ₹1,000 for 1st time since listing, then rebounds
Content: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications slipped below ₹1,000 apiece in the opening trade on Friday for the first time since its listing in November. The stock hit an all-time low of ₹995 apiece before recovering some of its losses. It has eroded over half of the value from its IPO price of ₹2,150 apiece in less than two months.

Title: Working through lot of challenges with Indian govt: Elon Musk on Tesla launch
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has said that he's "still working through a lot of challenges" with the government for Tesla's launch in India. The Tesla CEO was responding to an Indian engineer's tweet which sought an update on the launch. Last year, Tesla urged India to slash import taxes on electric vehicles before it enters the market.

Title: Paytm CEO says global market conditions affected company's IPO
Content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said that the negative macro conditions affected Paytm's IPO. "Globally, we probably went in at a time (for IPO) when QE, free money and many other parameters brought in a little spookiness to the market," said Sharma. "South American companies are over 70% down...Well, that's not the reason completely. That's a macro reason," he added.

Title: Retail inflation rises to 5.59% in Dec compared to 4.91% in Nov
Content: India's retail inflation rose to 5.59% in the month of December from 4.91% in November, government data revealed. This is the sixth consecutive month that CPI data has come below the Reserve Bank of India's upper margin of 6%. India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a year-on-year growth of 1.4% in November.

Title: 10-year-old girl, who's made millions from her 2 companies, could retire at 15
Content: A 10-year-old Australian girl had set up a toy company called Pixie's Fidgets last year that has been making huge profits. Pixie Curtis also has a hair accessories business, Pixie's Bows, that her mother started when she was a baby, and she is making millions from both. "She can retire at 15 if she wants to," her mother said.

Title: Adani signs $5 bn pact with S Korea's largest steelmaker, plans steel mill in Gujarat
Content: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group and South Korea's largest steelmaker POSCO have signed a non-binding pact to explore business opportunities in India, including setting up of a green steel mill in Gujarat. The companies said the investment is estimated to be up to $5 billion. They intend to collaborate in various industries such as renewable energy, hydrogen and logistics.

Title: Volkswagen China shuts 2 Tianjin plants due to COVID-19 outbreaks
Content: Volkswagen's China unit has shut a plant it jointly runs with FAW Group in Tianjin, as well as a component factory, due to recent COVID-19 outbreaks there. "Both plants have conducted COVID-19 testing twice for all employees this week," the automaker said.
