The city of Tianjin on Wednesday started the second round of COVID-19 testing of its 14 million residents.

Title: NCLAT to hear plea against suspension of CCI's Amazon-Future deal approval
Content: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) agreed to hear Amazon's plea against Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order suspending its approval of the Amazon-Future Group deal. In 2019, Amazon had invested in Future Group by acquiring a 49% stake in Future Coupons. CCI suspended the deal's approval last month saying Amazon failed to notify its strategic interest in Future Group.

Title: Wipro shares tumble over 6% after company releases Q3 earnings
Content: Shares of Wipro declined by over 6% during intraday trade on Thursday, a day after the IT services provider declared its December quarter results. Wipro posted 29.6% rise in company's revenue to ₹20,313 crore but flat net profit growth at ₹2,970 crore in the third quarter. Wipro shares have declined 9.2% so far this year, as per Reuters.

Title: 20 lakh tonnes of food grains distributed under PMGKAY since Dec
Content: The government said it has distributed nearly 20 lakh tonnes of free food grains so far to eligible beneficiaries under the fifth phase of Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (PMGKAY). The Centre had allocated a total of 163 lakh tonnes of rice and wheat to all states and UTs for distribution from December 2021 to March 2022.

Title: Goyal meets UK's Int'l Trade Secretary over free trade agreement
Content: India's Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal today met with United Kingdom's Secretary of State for International Trade Anne-Marie Trevelyan for the formal launch of negotiations for a free trade agreement. Goyal said in a tweet that during the negotiation, "deliberations will be held over an array of trade opportunities of mutual interest benefitting both sides".

Title: India, UK to work on improving trade relation, address market barriers
Content: A joint statement issued by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and UK's State Secretary for International Trade Anne-Marie Trevelyan said that the two countries will work on improving trade relations. The statement added that India and UK will consider the option of an Interim Agreement that generates early benefits for both countries. The two countries will also address market access barriers.

Title: RIL commits ₹5.95 lakh cr investment to make Gujarat carbon-free
Content: Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) said that it has committed to invest ₹5.95 lakh crore in various green projects in Gujarat. RIL proposes to invest ₹5 lakh crore over the next 10-15 years to set up 100 GW of renewable energy projects. It also committed investment of ₹60,000 crore in setting up a new integrated manufacturing unit for new, renewable energy.

Title: Banks credit growth rises by ₹3.5 lakh crore in Q3: SBI report
Content: Demand for credit increased across sectors in the December quarter, according to a research report by State Bank of India (SBI). Incremental deposits in the banking system have declined by ₹2.2 lakh crore over this period, whereas credit growth has picked up by ₹3.5 lakh crore, the report stated. The report also suggested that demand from non-PSU credit will increase.

Title: RBI's sub-committee reviews global, domestic economic scenario
Content: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Financial Stability and Development Council (FSDC) met today under the chairmanship of RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das to review major global and domestic economic developments. "[FSDC] discussed the assessments of members about the scenario emerging from third wave of COVID-19 pandemic," RBI said in a statement. It also discussed use of Aadhaar based e-KYC.

Title: Go Airlines' ₹3,600-cr IPO plan put on hold amid Omicron surge: Report
Content: Wadia Group has reportedly deferred the ₹3,600-crore initial public offering plan of its company Go Airlines due to the rapid surge in Omicron COVID-19 variant cases and its adverse impact on the travel business. Wadia Group is likely to pump in the additional fund in Go Airlines as it requires capital for operational expenses, ET reported citing sources.

Title: Blackstone asks US staff to get COVID-19 booster shots to work in office
Content: Blackstone has asked its US staff to get COVID-19 booster shots "as soon as practically possible" to work in the office. Employees will need to be tested on-site three times a week, the company's spokesperson said on Wednesday. Blackstone recently pushed back the date to begin work from office from January 18 to January 28 amid Omicron scare.

Title: CBDT issues refunds of over ₹1.5 lakh cr from Apr 1, 2020 to Jan 10, 2021
Content: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) issued refunds of over ₹1,54,302 crore to more than 1.59 crore taxpayers between April 1, 2020, and January 10, 2021, the Income Tax Department said on Thursday. "This includes 1.20 crore refunds of AY 2021-22 amounting to ₹23,406.28 crore," it said. Of the total refunds, 1.46 crore cases are of income tax returns.

Title: Navi Mutual Fund launches Nifty Next 50 Index Fund, NFO closes on Jan 14
Content: Navi Nifty Next 50 Index Fund aims to replicate a portfolio comprising stocks of the Nifty Next 50 Index. It proposes to charge a TER of 0.12% p.a. for direct plans, the lowest in this category*. The fund is currently available to invest on platforms including Paytm Money, Kuvera, Coin, Groww and INDmoney. The NFO closes on Friday, January 14.

Title: Work from anywhere, commute by plane when needed: Yahoo to 8,000 Japan employees
Content: Yahoo Japan has told its 8,000 employees that they can work from anywhere and can even be flown into work when needed. The program will take effect on April 1 and Yahoo has set a commuting budget of 150,000 yen ($1,300) per month per worker. Before COVID-19, Yahoo had capped the number of work-from-home days to five days a month.

Title: Wipro to close offices globally for the next 4 weeks due to COVID-19 surge
Content: Wipro on Wednesday said it will shut down all its offices globally for the next four weeks following a surge in the COVID-19 cases. The company's CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company would re-calibrate return to office initiatives in light of the evolving situation. Wipro's senior executives have been coming to the office twice a week since September.

Title: Infosys to hire 10,000 additional freshers for 2021-22
Content: Infosys on Wednesday announced that it has expanded its college graduate hiring program by 10,000 to over 55,000 for 2021-22 to support its "growth ambitions". This comes after Infosys' attrition rate for the quarter zoomed to 25.5% compared to 20.1% in the second quarter. Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy said they have a three-pronged strategy to stop people from leaving.

Title: COVID-19 deaths made people think life can be short: Rolls-Royce CEO on record sales
Content: After British luxury carmaker Rolls-Royce recorded the best annual sales in its 117-year history, CEO Torsten Müller-Otvös said COVID-19 deaths helped spur sales. "Lot of people witnessed people in their community dying from COVID-19, that makes them think life can be short, and you'd better live now than postpone it to a later date," he told The FT.

Title: I would rather not be: Paytm CEO on becoming a shark on Shark Tank
Content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said that he won't be a shark on the startup reality show Shark Tank. "Do you see Michael Moritz (Sequoia) and Marc Andreessen (a16z) on Shark Tank? No! It's meant for a particular type of thing," said Sharma. He said this in a fireside chat with Sequoia India MD Rajan Anandan during India Digital Summit.

Title: Youth disillusionment among top 5 risks for India: World Economic Forum
Content: The World Economic Forum's (WEF) latest report listed "widespread youth disillusionment" among the top five risks for India. "Youth disillusionment" is negatively impacting social stability, individual well-being and economic productivity, the WEF said. The other risks are fracture of interstate relations, debt crises in large economies, failure of technology governance and digital inequality.

Title: US inflation jumps 7% in biggest annual increase in 39 years
Content: The consumer price inflation in the US jumped in December 2021 at its fastest year-over-year pace since June 1982, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. Inflation rose 7% in December 2021 from the same month a year ago, up from 6.8% in November. The largest contributors to the inflation were price increases in housing and used vehicles.

Title: World's worst-performing bank lent billions to China's crisis-hit Evergrande Group
Content: China Minsheng Banking Corp, which lent billions to property developers including crisis-hit Evergrande Group, has become the world's worst-performing banking stock on the 155-member Bloomberg World Banks Index. Minsheng's stock tumbled 31% in the 12 months through last week. Earlier, a report by Citigroup said Minsheng had about 130 billion yuan ($20 billion) of exposure to high-risk developers.

Title: Govt doesn't want to run Vodafone Idea, it wants 3 private telecom players: CEO
Content: Vodafone Idea CEO Ravinder Takkar has said the government stated in all its interactions that it doesn't want to run the company. The government wants "promoters to run the company" and wants three private telecom players, he added. This comes after Vi said the government will own 35.8% stake after converting its dues to equity, making it Vi's largest shareholder.

Title: Sensex reclaims 61,000 for the 1st time after two months
Content: Indian benchmark index Sensex jumped more than 500 points on Wednesday during intraday trade to reclaim the 61,000-mark for the first time after nearly two months. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 150 points to trade at 18,200 levels. The market rally came ahead of Q3 earnings report of three of India's top IT companies - TCS, Wipro, Infosys.

Title: Vodafone Idea shares jump 11% as CEO rules out takeover by government
Content: Shares of Vodafone Idea jumped over 11% on Wednesday after CEO Ravinder Takkar clarified that the government won't take over the company. He said the government wants promoters to run the company. Vi's stock tanked 21% on Tuesday after it announced that the government will own 35.8% stake following conversion of its dues into equity, making it the largest shareholder.

Title: Govt may seek ₹15 lakh crore valuation for LIC in India's biggest-ever IPO: Report
Content: The government may seek a valuation of about ₹15 lakh crore for LIC through its IPO, which will be India's biggest-ever, Bloomberg reported citing sources. LIC's embedded value, which combines current value of future profits with net value of assets, may reportedly be over ₹4 lakh crore. Earlier, reports said LIC may file IPO papers in last week of January.

Title: Infosys Q3 profit rises 12% y-o-y to ₹5,809 crore
Content: Indian IT giant Infosys reported a consolidated net profit of ₹5,809 crore for the three months ending December 31, 2021, recording a nearly 12% rise year-on-year. Its revenue from operations rose 23% at ₹31,867 crore as against ₹25,927 crore in the same period in 2020. Infosys scrip rose 1.09% on Wednesday to close at ₹1,875 apiece on NSE.

Title: BMW brand delivers record 2.21 million vehicles in 2021
Content: The BMW brand delivered an all-time high of 2.21 million vehicles in 2021, up 9.1% from 2020, the company revealed. It also more than doubled its sales of fully-electric vehicles globally. The BMW Group delivered 2.52 million vehicles, an 8.4% increase from 2020. Earlier, Rolls-Royce announced that it created history last year selling the most cars it has ever sold.

Title: Mercedes to become 1st global luxury carmaker to make EVs in India
Content: Luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz plans to start local assembly of its EQS electric sedan in India this year, becoming the first global luxury carmaker to assemble electric vehicles (EVs) in India. Mercedes expects to start selling the locally-assembled EQS in India in the fourth quarter of 2022. It started selling imported models of its EQC electric SUV in India in 2020.

Title: SC criticises Supertech over non-payment to home buyers in Noida
Content: The Supreme Court criticised real-estate developer Supertech over non-payment to home buyers of Noida's Emerald Court which was ordered to be demolished in August 2021. The bench headed by Justice DY Chandrachud told Supertech to ensure payment to home buyers by January 17. The bench also directed Supertech to not deduct any amount while returning the money to home buyers.

Title: TCS Q3 profits rise 12% YoY in FY22 to ₹9,769 crore
Content: Tata Consultancy Services' revenues rose 12% YoY in Q3 of FY22 to ₹9,769 crore according to the company's exchange filing. TCS also won new deals worth over ₹56,126 crore. Its revenue from operations rose 16% to ₹48,885 crore as compared to ₹42,015 crore in Q3 of FY21. The company has also approved buyback of shares worth up to ₹18,000 crore.

Title: Citi to exit consumer biz in Mexico, where it has operated for 100 yrs
Content: Citigroup will exit the consumer, small business and middle-market banking operations in Mexico, where it has operated for over 100 years, the bank announced. However, it'll continue to operate a locally-licensed banking business in Mexico through its global Institutional Clients Group. The bank's acquisition of Banamex for $12.5 billion in 2001 was the largest ever in Mexico at that time.

Title: FICCI suggests support measures for housing sector in upcoming Budget
Content: FICCI suggested the government to provide an interest subsidy of 3-4% on housing loans as one of the support measures for the housing sector in the upcoming Budget. It added that concessional tax rate of 15% must be extended to companies that invest in green technologies. It also suggested subsidy on usage of 6-7 cylinders per year for poor households.

Title: Vodafone Idea to issue 35.8% shares to govt in a month's time: CEO
Content: Vodafone Idea (Vi) expects to issue shares to the government in the coming month, CEO Ravinder Takkar has said. On Tuesday, Vi opted to convert the interest on its government dues into equity. Vi has estimated the net present value of the interest at ₹16,000 crore and that would result in issuance of 35.8% shares to the government.

Title: PM Modi's PLI scheme to help Indian economy beat China in FY23: World Bank
Content: PM Narendra Modi's Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme will likely help India grow faster than emerging market peers including China, the World Bank said. It revised India's estimated GDP growth rate for FY23 to 8.7% and for FY24 to 6.8% "to reflect an improving investment outlook...and increases in infrastructure investment". The Centre launched the five-year PLI scheme for 13 key sectors.

Title: Indian pharma industry's growth slows to 5.3% in December
Content: The growth in Indian pharma industry slowed to 5.3% year-on-year in December 2021, as compared to 8.5% growth in December 2020, as per a report by Motilal Oswal. According to India Ratings and Research, volumes declined 1.5% year-on-year, while price growth was at 5.4%. New product launches surged 1.4% over the preceding year, it said.

Title: Most complaints filed by foreign, private bank customers: RBI Report
Content: RBI's annual report on various ombudsman schemes stated that customers of foreign and private banks filed the most complaints between July 2020 and March 2021. Foreign and private banks witnessed 0.14 and 0.127 non-digital complaints against them per 1,000 accounts respectively. Public sector and small finance banks witnessed only 0.05 and 0.025 complaints against them per 1,000 accounts.

Title: Rupee won't have choice but to depreciate in long term: ICICI Bank
Content: The Indian rupee is likely to weaken after foreign inflows that have helped it appreciate at the start of the year begin to ebb in coming months, a senior ICICI Bank official said. "INR will appreciate short term but have no choice but to depreciate long term," Prasanna Balachander, ICICI Bank's group head for global markets sales, added.

Title: Airbus retains world's largest planemaker spot for 3rd straight year
Content: Airbus retained its world's largest planemaker title for the third consecutive year after the company delivered 611 jets in 2021, taking the sales up by 8% compared to the previous year. Airbus outstripped Boeing, which sold 340 jets in 2021. Airbus Chief Executive Guillaume Faury called this the ''first fruits of a recovery'' and said ''demand is real''.

Title: Wipro posts ₹2,970 crore net profit in Q3, revenue jumps 30%
Content: Wipro on Wednesday reported nearly flat consolidated net profit at ₹2,970 crore in the October-December quarter, as against ₹2,968 crore profit reported in the year-ago period. The company's revenue from operations grew 29.6% to ₹20,313 crore from ₹15,670 crore in the quarter ended December 2020. Wipro also declared an interim dividend of Re 1 per equity share.

Title: Tata Group replaces Chinese mobile manufacturer VIVO as IPL title sponsor
Content: Tata Group will replace Chinese mobile manufacturer VIVO as IPL title sponsor from the upcoming season, IPL Chairman Brijesh Patel said. VIVO had originally signed a ₹2,200-crore deal for IPL title sponsorship rights from 2018 to 2022, however, it backed out as title sponsor for IPL 2020 before returning in 2021. VIVO's contract was then extended till 2023.

Title: Japanese toaster company Balmuda's stock crashes after launching smartphone
Content: Japan's high-end toaster company Balmuda's stock has crashed after it entered the smartphone market with its 'Balmuda Phone', which received a poor response. Balmuda's shares fell as much as 10% in Tuesday trading, a day after Balmuda said it paused smartphone sales due to an unidentified issue regarding compliance. The 'Balmuda Phone' is more expensive than the iPhone 13 mini.

Title: Ant Group's stake in Paytm loses ₹16,000 crore in value in 2 months of listing: Report
Content: Paytm shares owned by China's Ant Group lost around ₹16,012 crore in value in first two months of its listing, Business Insider reported. Ant Group had sold 3% stake at IPO price of ₹2,150 apiece, but still owns around 24% stake. Value of its residual stake in Paytm could've been worth ₹34,669 crore if the stock maintained its IPO price.

Title: Standard income tax deduction could rise by 30-35% in Budget: Report
Content: The government is looking into a proposal to increase the standard deduction limit available to salaried taxpayers and pensioners by 30-35% in Budget 2022-23, an official from the Finance Ministry told ET. However, the income tax slabs are reportedly likely to remain unchanged. The standard deduction was enhanced to ₹50,000 by the government in the interim Budget in 2019.

Title: What are the 10 most severe threats the world is facing according to WEF?
Content: The World Economic Forum (WEF) listed the top 10 global risks on the basis of their severity over the next 10 years. Climate action failure is the most severe risk, followed by extreme weather, biodiversity loss, erosion of social cohesion, livelihood crises, infectious diseases, human environmental damage and others. Societal risks make up a third of the top 10 risks.

Title: Govt to change FDI rules for LIC's IPO, India's biggest-ever: Report
Content: Government authorities will amend rules on FDI for the success of LIC's IPO, set to be India's biggest-ever, Bloomberg reported. While equity stakes among foreigners are allowed for most Indian insurers, it's not allowed in LIC as it's a special entity created by an act of Parliament. LIC's IPO is expected to raise between ₹40,000 crore and ₹1 lakh crore.

Title: Dubai-based BR Shetty, who's stranded in India, ordered to pay $131 mn to Barclays
Content: India-born businessman BR Shetty, the Founder of Dubai-based NMC Health, has been ordered to pay $131 million (₹968.5 crore) to Barclays by a London court. Shetty's forex business failed to meet a transaction agreement with the British bank in 2020. Shetty, who has lost most of his wealth, is stranded in India after being banned from returning to the UAE.

Title: FICCI makes recommendations to Health Minister to tackle virus surge
Content: Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) made recommendations for tackling rising COVID-19 cases in a letter to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. FICCI made six suggestions including reduction in quarantine period to five days, especially for healthcare workers. "Mobility restrictions must be based on [a region's] hospital bed occupancy, oxygen consumption," it suggested.

Title: Need for global framework to guide national crypto regulation: IMF staff
Content: The increasing rate of adoption of crypto assets by governments warrants a global framework to guide their regulation and supervision, according to staff of the International Monetary Fund (IMF). Tobias Adrian, Tara Iyer and Mahvash Qureshi of the IMF wrote in an article that a framework is needed to "mitigate the financial stability risks stemming from the crypto ecosystem".

Title: Ex-Finance Secretary suggests 3 laws to regulate India's crypto market
Content: Former Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg on Tuesday suggested three laws around three use cases of crypto tech - digital currencies, crypto businesses and crypto assets. He suggested a ban on private cryptos except for limited use like stable coins. He then suggested a law to regulate crypto businesses like crypto exchanges and a different law to regulate crypto assets.

Title: Volkswagen sells 70,600 ID EVs in China in 2021, misses target
Content: German automaker Volkswagen sold 70,625 of its ID electric vehicles in China last year, missing its goal of selling 80,000 to 1,00,000 cars. The automaker said it would likely double sales of its ID battery electric vehicles in China this year. Volkswagen Group sold 3.3 million cars in China last year, a fall of 14% from 2020.

Title: Tesla's top-ranking Black executive and VP of People steps down
Content: Tesla's VP of People and one of the company's highest-ranking Black executives, Valerie Capers Workman, is stepping down from her position, Bloomberg confirmed. Workman is joining US-based career-network company Handshake next week as Chief Legal Officer. She joined Tesla's legal department in 2018 and was elevated to her current position in 2020, where she reported directly to CEO Elon Musk.

Title: Paytm shares fall to record low, down 47% from issue price
Content: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications fell to a record low on Tuesday despite the company reporting a jump in loan disbursals in the December 2021 quarter. The company's shares hit a record low of ₹1,113.65 on the NSE, down 47% from its issue price. Earlier on Monday, financial services provider Macquarie had retained its 'underperform' rating on Paytm's stock.

Title: India to add 16 GW of renewable energy capacity in 2022-23: ICRA
Content: India's renewable energy generation capacity addition in 2022-23 is estimated at 16 gigawatt (GW), rating agency ICRA said. The outlook for capacity addition remains strong due to a large project pipeline and highly competitive tariffs offered by these projects, ICRA added in its statement. India's renewable energy capacity addition during April-November 2021 stood at 8.2 GW.

Title: India to allow imports of US pork for 1st time: US Agriculture Secy
Content: India has agreed to allow imports of US pork and pork products for the first time, US Trade Representative Katherine Tai and Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack said. ''The deal marked the culmination of two decades of seeking market access for US pork to India,'' Vilsack added. In 2021, US exported more than $1.6 billion of agricultural products to India.

Title: COVID didn't impact India's long-term growth trajectory: N Chandrasekaran
Content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran on Tuesday said that the COVID-19 pandemic has not impacted India's long-term growth trajectory although it has delayed it. In this decade, the country will lead the global growth rates, he added. ''I think the Indian situation is pretty unique and India's growth is going to be more fundamentally important going forward,'' Chandrasekaran further said.

Title: Tata Teleservices opts for equity conversion, govt to own 9.5% stake
Content: Tata Teleservices said on Tuesday it will opt for the conversion of interest related to adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues into equity. "Following conversion, it is expected that the government will hold approximately 9.5% of the total outstanding shares of the company," Tata Teleservices said. The company estimates the net present value of the interest to be nearly ₹850 crore.

Title: Blackstone exits Mindspace REIT, sells stake for ₹1,740 cr: Report
Content: US private equity firm Blackstone has completely exited Mindspace Business Parks REIT by selling its balance 9.2% stake to Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) for around ₹1,740 crore, reports said. Blackstone had acquired a 15% minority stake in the K Raheja Corp portfolio in March 2017 and sold stake worth $100 million in the company's IPO in 2020.

Title: London Metal Exchange trading resumes after 5-hour outage
Content: London Metal Exchange, which sets global prices for commodities like copper and aluminium, resumed trading on Tuesday after an outage of more than five hours. The outage occurred due to connectivity issues at a third-party data centre, LME said. The exchange has migrated all systems to its backup data and trading is proceeding as normal, LME spokesperson Miriam Heywood said.

Title: Louis Simpson, who helped Warren Buffett pick stocks, dies at 85
Content: Louis Simpson, who helped pick stocks for Berkshire Hathaway's billionaire Chairman Warren Buffett, has died at the age of 85. Simpson died in Chicago on January 8 following a prolonged illness, according to the Northwestern University in Illinois. He managed the investment portfolio of insurance giant GEICO, which was fully acquired by Berkshire Hathaway in 1996, between 1979 and 2010.

Title: India to see 9.5% economic growth in FY22: Ex-Chief Economic Adviser
Content: Former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Virmani said on Tuesday that the Indian economy is likely to register a growth of 9.5% in FY22. He said that government expenditure and exports have peaked but private consumption is yet to recover from effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. "This decade’s (FY21-FY30) average growth will be 7.5% plus minus 0.5%," he added.

Title: SC reserves order on allowing FRL to proceed with Reliance deal
Content: Supreme Court has reserved order on pleas filed by Future Group companies seeking permission to proceed with procedural steps for its asset sale deal with Reliance. "If the final order is in Amazon's favour, the deal won't go through, but if we win, we'll have saved the time to then start the process," Future Retail's (FRL) counsel told the court.

Title: I-T return filing deadline for AY 2021-22 in specific cases extended to March 15
Content: Due dates for filing specific income tax returns and audit reports for AY 2021-22 were extended on Tuesday. The due date for furnishing certain audit reports is extended to February 15 and the deadline for furnishing tax returns that require auditing is extended to March 15, 2022. The deadline for individual taxpayers was December 31, 2021.

Title: India's economy expected to grow at 8.3% in FY22: World Bank
Content: The World Bank on Tuesday retained its forecast for India's GDP growth in the fiscal year ending March 2022. According to its Global Economic Prospects report, India's economy is expected to grow at 8.3% in FY22. The World Bank further upgraded its forecast for India's GDP growth in FY23 and FY24 to 8.7% and 6.8%, respectively.

Title: India, Republic of Korea aim to achieve $50 bn trade target before 2030
Content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal today met with Republic of Korea's Trade Minister Yeo Han-Koo and decided to actively pursue their aim of achieving bilateral trade worth $50 billion by 2030. The two ministers held wide ranging discussions on bilateral trade and investment related aspects. They also agreed to step up negotiations on Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA).

Title: Companies that win the talent war will be winners: Rishad Premji
Content: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji at Microsoft's Future Ready event said the number one challenge companies face right now is talent and any company that can win talent war will be the winner. "I'm a big believer of retaining employees. People don't only leave for compensation, they leave when they don't feel a sense of connectedness with the organisation," he added.

Title: Binance CEO richer than Mukesh Ambani with $96 billion wealth: Bloomberg
Content: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao is the world's richest cryptocurrency entrepreneur with $96 billion wealth, Bloomberg said after estimating his net worth for the first time. It added that the 44-year-old is richer than Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani, whose current net worth is $92.9 billion. Zhao is a former McDonald's employee and software developer.

Title: GTA maker Take-Two to buy FarmVille creator Zynga in a $12.7 billion deal
Content: Take-Two Interactive, the video game maker behind Grand Theft Auto, will acquire mobile gaming company Zynga in a cash-and-stock deal worth nearly $12.7 billion. Take-Two will acquire all outstanding shares of Zynga at a 64% premium to the company's closing price on Friday. Shares of FarmVille maker Zynga rose about 50% in US pre-market trading after the announcement.

Title: Meta leases half of Austin's tallest skyscraper set to open in 2023
Content: Facebook's parent company Meta has leased half of what will be Austin's tallest skyscraper, Bloomberg confirmed. The company is leasing 5,89,000 square feet across 33 floors, which accounts for the entire commercial half of the 66-storey tower, a company spokesperson said. The tower, known as Sixth and Guadalupe, is currently under construction and is scheduled to open in 2023.

Title: IndiGo to cancel 20% flights as COVID-19 cases surge
Content: IndiGo is cancelling 20% of its flights because of the surge in COVID-19 cases driven by the Omicron variant. It's waiving change fees and is offering free changes for all new and existing bookings made up to January 31, for flights up to March 31, 2022. Where possible, cancellation of flights will be done at least 72 hours in advance.

Title: Paytm shares fall to record low after Macquarie retains 'underperform' rating
Content: Paytm’s parent company One97 Communications’ shares fell to a record low on Monday after financial services provider Macquarie retained its 'underperform' rating on the stock. Macquarie cut its target price to ₹900 apiece. Paytm stock, which made its market debut nearly two months ago at ₹1,955 apiece, was trading below ₹1,200 apiece on Monday.

Title: What is the legal battle between BharatPe's MD & Kotak Mahindra Bank?
Content: BharatPe MD Ashneer Grover and his wife sent a legal notice to Kotak Mahindra Bank on October 30, accusing the bank of failing to provide financing in Nykaa's IPO. An alleged audio clip of Grover threatening and abusing a Kotak employee went viral, which Grover called "fake". Kotak Group on Sunday said it raised "objections to inappropriate language" by Grover.

Title: No breach or violation by us: Kotak Group on BharatPe MD's legal notice
Content: The Kotak Group confirmed receiving a legal notice from BharatPe's MD Ashneer Grover and his wife on October 30, 2021. "We would like to confirm that there is no breach or violation by the Kotak Group in any manner whatsoever," Kotak's statement read. Grover has accused the bank of failing to secure financing and allocation of shares in Nykaa's IPO.

Title: 60,000 employees fired by Chinese edtech firm after crackdown on tutoring firms
Content: China's edtech major New Oriental Education & Technology Group's Founder Yu Minhong revealed that the company fired 60,000 employees and saw its revenue fall 80% in 2021. He cited factors like China's crackdown on the after-school education sector, the COVID-19 pandemic and China's international relations for the move. "Much of our business remains in a state of uncertainty," he said.

Title: Lenskart Co-founder apologises for 'stay away from CAs' remark, says dad, sister are CAs
Content: Lenskart Co-founder Peyush Bansal has apologised after he was criticised for asking PNT Robotics' founders to "stay away from CAs" during a reality TV show. Bansal tweeted that it was a "light-hearted comment made in jest", aimed at promoting entrepreneurship. He added that his father, sister and Lenskart's CFO are all CAs and he depends on them "to run Lenskart".

Title: Anand Mahindra retweets pic of Indian road with 70 continuous hairpin bends
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra retweeted a picture of the Kolli Hills road with 70 continuous hairpin bends in Tamil Nadu, which was originally shared by former Norwegian diplomat Erik Solheim. Mahindra wrote, "Erik you keep showing me how little I know about my own country! This is just phenomenal. I want to find out who built this road."

Title: UC Berkeley professor Pierre-Olivier succeeds Gita Gopinath as IMF Chief Economist
Content: The IMF has appointed Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas as its next Chief Economist, succeeding India-born Gita Gopinath. Gourinchas is the University of California at Berkeley's Faculty Director of the Clausen Center for International Business and Policy. He will start his new position on January 24 part-time and transition to full-time on April 1. Gopinath will become IMF's First Deputy MD.

Title: Robert Durst, US multi-millionaire real estate heir convicted of murder, dies at 78
Content: Multi-millionaire real estate heir Robert Durst, who was sentenced to life in prison in October for murdering his best friend, has died at 78 in a California prison hospital, according to his attorney. He was also charged with murder of his first wife Kathleen Durst, who disappeared in 1982. Robert Durst was the subject of a 2015 HBO documentary series.

Title: Vodafone Idea says govt to own 36% stake in firm after converting dues, shares crash
Content: Vodafone Idea's board has approved the conversion of interest on spectrum auction instalments and adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues into equity. With this, the government will own about 35.8% stake in Vi, making it the largest shareholder. The promoter shareholders Vodafone Group would hold 28.5% and Aditya Birla Group 17.8%, Vi said. The stock fell around 17% following the news.

Title: Workers to return to Foxconn's TN plant gradually, says Apple
Content: Apple on Monday said that workers will return to work gradually at its Foxconn's plant at Sriperumbudur near Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Earlier, the state's CM MK Stalin had said that the Foxconn plant will resume operations on January 12, initially with 500 workers. The plant was shut last month after a food poisoning incident affected over 200 workers.

Title: Panasonic offers 4-day work week option to staff, allows side jobs
Content: Japanese multinational conglomerate Panasonic Corporation will offer employees an option to work four days a week, CEO Yuki Kusumi said in an investor briefing. Panasonic will also allow employees to take up side jobs or spend time volunteering on their extra days off. Further, employees will be able to work from home when their partners are transferred to other locations.

Title: Bitcoin falls below $40,000 for the first time in over five months
Content: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin's price fell below $40,000 for the first time in over five months on Monday. Bitcoin fell more than 5% to as low as $39,558, marking the largest decline for the cryptocurrency for a start of the year since at least 2012. Ether, the second largest cryptocurrency, also fell as much as 7.2% to $2,926 on Monday.

Title: ED attaches assets worth ₹36 crore in 'Morris Coin' crypto case
Content: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets of a Kerala-based businessman and his associates worth ₹36.72 crore under PMLA, 2002, in a cheating case. The accused had allegedly cheated 900 investors of ₹1,200 crore under the guise of offering 'Morris coin' cryptocurrency. The attached assets include balances in multiple bank accounts, immovable property and INR equivalent of cryptocurrencies.

Title: Haven't asked RBI to reconsider joint venture with BharatPe: Centrum
Content: Centrum Group has denied speculations suggesting the company has asked the RBI to reconsider its joint venture for Unity Small Finance Bank with BharatPe. The clarification comes amid allegations that BharatPe's Co-founder and MD Ashneer Grover abused an employee of Kotak Mahindra Bank. The RBI had issued a small finance bank (SFB) licence to the Centrum Group-BharatPe consortium last year.

Title: S Korea's SsangYong Motor sold for $254.6 million to local consortium
Content: A consortium led by South Korean electric automaker Edison Motors has agreed to acquire SsangYong Motor for 305 billion won ($254.65 million), the latter said on Monday. This comes after SsangYong's sales fell to 84,496 units in 2021, about 21% lesser than its 2020 sales, as per a regulatory filing. Indian automaker Mahindra also owns about 75% stake in SsangYong.

Title: Pine Labs files for US IPO seeking to raise $500 million: Report
Content: Merchant commerce platform Pine Labs has confidentially filed for an initial public offering (IPO) with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, Bloomberg reported. It is seeking to raise about $500 million and the listing could value the startup at $5.5 billion to $7 billion, the report said. Pine Labs is reportedly planning to list in the first half of 2022.

Title: Rolls-Royce car sales soar to highest in its 117-year history
Content: Rolls-Royce on Monday announced that it created history last year selling the most cars it has ever sold in its 117-year history. The luxury carmaker sold 5,586 cars globally last year, up 49% from its sales in the same period in 2020. Sales of the brand's vehicles hit all-time records in most regions, including China and the US.

Title: Airbnb questioned by US lawmakers over business in China's Xinjiang
Content: Two US lawmakers have raised concerns about home rental firm Airbnb's business activities in Xinjiang region, where China is accused of committing genocide against Uighur Muslims. The lawmakers cited an Axios report stating that Airbnb hosts homes in the region on land owned by an organisation sanctioned by US. Recently, Tesla was criticised after it opened a showroom in Xinjiang.

Title: Total employment in 9 sectors reached 3.1 crore in July-Sept 2021: Govt
Content: Labour Ministry's Quarterly Employment Survey said that total employment in nine select sectors reached 3.1 crore in the July-September quarter. This is 2 lakh more than that of the April-June quarter, when employment in these sectors was 3.08 crore. These nine sectors are Manufacturing, Construction, Trade, Transport, Education, Health, Accommodation and Restaurant, IT/ BPO, Financial Services.

Title: I-T detects ₹800 cr hidden cash transactions after raids in Andhra, Telangana
Content: Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted cash transactions of ₹800 crore after it raided three real estate groups in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) said. CBDT claimed that the groups had been accepting cash in addition to the registered value of properties. The Department raided over two dozen premises linked to the realty groups.

Title: India eyes place in top 25 of Global Innovation Index: Piyush Goyal
Content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Monday that the government is striving to take India to the top 25 in the Global Innovation Index. Addressing the Startup India Innovation Week, Goyal said that startups have played a significant role in India's rise from the 76th position in 2014 to the 46th position in the Index in 2021.

Title: Govt finalises medical insurance for retired staff of Air India: Reports
Content: The government has finalised a solution to provide medical insurance to the 30,000 retired staff members of Air India who had opted for the post-retirement medical scheme, Economic Times reported. "Retired employees will get the Central Government Health Scheme facility for OPD requirement and National Health Insurance Scheme for their hospitalisation requirements," a top government official said.

Title: Deposits in Jan Dhan accounts cross ₹1.5 lakh crore: Finance Ministry
Content: Deposits in bank accounts opened under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) crossed the ₹1.5 lakh crore mark in December-end last year, as per latest finance ministry data. Of the total 44.23 crore Jan Dhan accounts, 34.9 crore are with public sector banks, 8.05 crore with regional rural banks, and the rest 1.28 crore with private sector banks.

Title: Flying was like relaxing on wicker chair: Mahindra on pic of old UK flight interior
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted a picture from 1936, showing the interior of a commercial plane of Imperial Airways, which he said was the first British commercial airline. "In these times of anxiety-ridden air travel, a refreshing throwback to when flying was like relaxing on a wicker easy chair," said Mahindra on the picture.

Title: Citigroup to fire unvaccinated US employees by month end: Report
Content: Citigroup on Friday told its staff in the US that it would terminate the employees who are unvaccinated against COVID-19 as of January 14, enforcing a policy that was announced last year, according to reports. Their last day of employment will reportedly come at the month end. The company reportedly allowed the employees to apply for religious or medical exemptions.

Title: How much money did Kohli, Ronaldo and other celebrities earn per Instagram post in 2021?
Content:
Team India Test captain Virat Kohli earned $680,000 (₹5 crore) per Instagram post in 2021, as per a report by Forbes India. Cristiano Ronaldo earned $1,604,000 (₹12 crore) per post, the highest among all the celebrities. He was followed by Dwayne Johnson ($1,523,000/post) and 
Ariana Grande ($1,510,000/post). Priyanka Chopra earned $403,000 per Instagram post last year.

Title: Traffic jam inside Musk's 'Vegas Loop' built to ease congestion, user shares video
Content: A video showing a traffic jam inside an underground tunnel in the US built by Elon Musk's The Boring Company was shared on Reddit. The video was allegedly filmed inside the Las Vegas Convention Centre Loop that was built for easing traffic congestion. Reacting to it, a Reddit user said, "I was told it (traffic jam inside tunnel) was impossible."

Title: CCI orders probe into Google after complaint from news publishers
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered an investigation into Google following allegations from the Digital News Publishers Association. The watchdog said its initial view was that the company had broken some antitrust laws. Google dominates certain online search services in the country and may have imposed unfair conditions on news publishers, the CCI added.

Title: Tim Cook earned 1,447 times the average Apple employee in 2021
Content: Apple CEO Tim Cook's $98.7 million compensation in 2021 was 1,447 times that of the average employee at the company. Apple said the annual compensation of the median employee was $68,254 in 2021. The 61-year-old executive's compensation rose 570% compared with $14.8 million in 2020. While Cook's salary remained at $3 million, he received $82.3 million in stock awards.

Title: Inappropriate language used by BharatPe MD, legal action being pursued: Kotak
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank confirmed receiving a legal notice from BharatPe's MD Ashneer Grover and his wife Madhuri Grover in October. "The notice was replied to appropriately at the time, including placing on record our objections to inappropriate language used by Mr. Grover," Kotak said. Grover accused the bank of failing to secure financing and allocation of shares in Nykaa's IPO.

Title: BharatPe's Ashneer sent notice to Kotak for missing Nykaa IPO share allocation
Content: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover and his wife sent a legal notice to Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak and top bank executives on October 30, Moneycontrol confirmed. They accused the bank of failing to secure financing and allocation of shares in Nykaa's IPO. The news comes after an audio clip suggested Grover abused a Kotak employee, which Grover termed "fake".

Title: Jhunjhunwala's new 14-storey mansion to have football court, banquet hall: Report
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and his family will soon move to their 14-storey mansion in Mumbai that will have a banquet hall on one floor, swimming pool on one, gym on one and a theatre on one floor, TOI reported. There are plans to build a football court on the ground floor. The 12th floor will be the master floor.

Title: CSB Bank's MD & CEO Rajendran to retire early on health grounds
Content: CSB Bank on Saturday said C VR Rajendran will step down from his role of Managing Director (MD) and CEO on March 31, 2022, after over five years. He has decided to take an early retirement to take care of his health under the advice of his physicians, the bank said. Rajendran's term was scheduled to end in December 2022.

Title: Twitter user asks Anand Mahindra if he's Punjabi, billionaire replies, 'I'm an Indian'
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to a Twitter user who asked, "I know it's a stupid question to ask but then let me be stupid aap Punjabi hai Sir?" Mahindra replied, "Not a stupid question but my straight answer is that I'm an Indian." "Phenomenal mindset! Reminded me of that scene from chak de India," a user reacted.

Title: Ex-IAS officer to pen Tata's biography, publishing deal reportedly sealed for ₹2 crore
Content: Retired IAS officer Thomas Mathew will pen the authorised biography of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata. HarperCollins won the publishing rights for the book - 'Ratan N. Tata: The Authorized Biography' - in a reported ₹2 crore deal. "Mathew's comprehensive account of Tata's life includes unknown details and fascinating stories from his formative years," HarperCollins India said.

Title: Reliance to buy control of 5-star hotel in New York in a $98 million deal
Content: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industrial Investments and Holdings Limited (RIIHL) is buying a luxury 5-star hotel in New York's Manhattan in a $98.15 million deal. RIIHL will buy Columbus Centre Corporation, the indirect owner of a 73.37% stake in Mandarin Oriental, New York. RIIHL would acquire the remaining 26.63% stake if other owners of the hotel participate in the sale transaction.

Title: UPI is operational now: NPCI after users report issues with transactions
Content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Sunday tweeted that Unified Payments Interface (UPI) was operational after facing an "intermittent technical glitch". Earlier, several users took to Twitter to report they were unable to make transactions using digital wallets and online payment platforms. "Regret the inconvenience to UPI users...we are monitoring system closely," the NPCI said.

Title: Startup body IndiaTech seeks clarity on crypto tax rules, writes to FM
Content: IndiaTech, which represents tech startups, unicorns and investors, has written to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, seeking clarity on cryptocurrency taxation in Union Budget 2022-23, reported ET. "The Budget should ideally offer coherent rules on direct taxation and the GST Council should detail the applicability of taxation, else there will be confusion," IndiaTech CEO Rameesh Kailasam said.

Title: Amazon cuts paid COVID-19 leave time for US workers to 40 hours
Content: Amazon workers in US who test COVID-19 positive or have to quarantine after exposure to virus will be eligible for up to 40 hours of paid leave, instead of 10 days. Further, employees can come to work after isolating for a week after testing COVID-19 positive, Amazon said. The policy change comes after the US CDC updated its health guidance.

Title: Former Theranos President Ramesh Balwani's fraud trial delayed
Content: US blood-testing startup Theranos' former President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani's criminal fraud trial will be delayed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases in California, a judge said. Elizabeth Holmes, who dropped out of Stanford to start Theranos, was convicted of investor fraud and conspiracy earlier this week. Balwani faces the same charges as Holmes and has pleaded not guilty.

Title: Amazon challenges CCI's suspension of Future Coupons deal: Report
Content: Amazon has filed an appeal against the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) decision to suspend its 2019 deal with Future Coupons at the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal, reported Reuters. Separately, Amazon has reportedly filed a challenge in Supreme Court against Delhi High Court's decision to stay arbitration proceedings between Future Group and Amazon in Singapore until February 1.

Title: Forex reserves decline by $1.466 billion: RBI data
Content: The country’s foreign exchange reserves declined by $1.466 billion to $633.614 billion during the week ended December 31, 2021, RBI data showed. Notably, the country's forex reserves touched a record high of $642.453 billion in the week ended September 3, 2021. Forex reserves include foreign currency assets (FCAs), gold reserves, SDRs, and the country's reserve position with the IMF.

Title: New York Times to buy sports website The Athletic for $550 mn
Content: American daily The New York Times has agreed to buy subscription-based sports site The Athletic in an all-cash deal for $550 million. "We're now in pursuit of a goal meaningfully larger than 10 million subscriptions and believe The Athletic will enable us to expand our addressable market of potential subscribers," said The New York Times Company CEO Meredith Kopit Levien.

Title: Royal Caribbean pauses some cruise operations amid Omicron scare
Content: Royal Caribbean Cruises on Friday announced that it has paused some of its cruise operations amid rising numbers of Omicron cases. The sailings of three ships Serenade of the Seas, Jewel of the Seas, Symphony of the Seas have been paused while the return of Vision of the Seas to cruising has been postponed to March 7, the company said.

Title: Indonesia to decide over ban on coal exports by weekend
Content: Indonesian government aims to take the final decision over lifting the ban on coal exports likely on Saturday after the country faced a domestic supply crisis that sent international prices higher this week. The world's biggest thermal coal exporter suspended coal exports on January 1 after Indonesia's state power utility reported low inventory levels of the fuel, facing power outages.

Title: Urjit Patel appointed VP of Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank
Content: Former RBI Governor Urjit Patel has been appointed as the Vice President of the Beijing-based Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB). He will be replacing DJ Pandian, who has been VP and Chief Investment Officer of the Bank since its formation in 2016. Currently headed by China's Jin Liqun, AIIB currently has five vice-presidents.

Title: COVID-19 curbs caused 45% loss in business in 2022's first week: CAIT
Content: MSMEs and other traders faced a 45% average loss in business in 2022's first week due to COVID-19 curbs imposed by states, Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said. It added that panic among people, capital crunch and restrictions imposed without consultation were main reasons for loss in business. CAIT cited its survey conducted across 36 cities for the results.

Title: ICAI asks CBDT to waive penalty on late filing of tax audit reports
Content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has requested the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) to waive penalty on late filing of tax audit reports and other reports or certificates for AY 2021-22 till March 31, 2022. The ICAI cited the surge in COVID-19 cases and consistent technical glitches in new I-T portal as reasons for seeking waiver.

Title: JSW Steel to invest ₹15,000 cr to set up 5 MTPA capacity in Vijayanagara
Content: JSW Steel on Friday announced that it will invest ₹15,000 crore to set up 5 million tonnes per annual (MTPA) steel-making capacity at its integrated plant in Vijayanagara, Karnataka. Union Steel Minister Ram Chandra Prasad Singh laid the foundation stone of the expansion project on Friday. The company aims to take its Vijayanagara facility to 18 MTPA by FY24.

Title: Tata Steel Q3 output up by 2% to 7.68 MT, sales drop by 3%
Content: Tata Steel on Friday reported an over two percent rise in consolidated steel output to 7.68 million tonnes (MT) for the October-December quarter. However, the company's consolidated sales during Q3 fell by around three percent to 6.88 MT, compared to 7.09 MT during the previous year's Q3. Meanwhile, Tata Steel India crude steel production grew by 16% year-on-year.

Title: What is Apple CEO Tim Cook's compensation breakup as he earns $98.7 million in 2021?
Content: Apple CEO Tim Cook received $98.73 million in compensation in 2021, the company's SEC filing revealed. This includes his salary of $3 million, $82.3 million in stock awards and $12 million bonus for hitting Apple financial and environmental sustainability goals. He received $1.39 million in other compensations, including $712,488 in personal air travel.

Title: Musk trolls GM for selling only 26 EVs in Q4 2021 in US, says 'Room to improve'
Content: World's richest person and Tesla's CEO Elon Musk trolled rival company General Motors (GM) after it sold only 26 electric vehicles in the US in Q4 of 2021. "Room to improve," tweeted Musk. General Motors' sales numbers come amid the White House promoting it as a "leader" in the electric vehicle market.

Title: Reliance Retail buys 25.8% stake in Dunzo for $200 million
Content: Reliance Retail on Thursday announced it has acquired a 25.8% stake in delivery services startup Dunzo for $200 million. Bengaluru-based Dunzo raised $240 million in its latest funding round led by Reliance Retail, with participation from existing investors Lightbox, Lightrock, 3L Capital and Alteria Capital. Reliance Retail will also enter into certain business partnerships with Dunzo.

Title: Celebs peddling crypto as safe is quite disgusting: Zerodha CEO
Content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath said in a tweet that famous personalities triggering retail investors to invest in super risky asset classes without talking about the risks is "quite disgusting". He tweeted, "Thanks to crypto, it's been a case of 'never meet your heroes' with so many people I admired, for peddling crypto, NFTs (non-fungible tokens), etc. as safe and guaranteed."

Title: China fines 7-Eleven ₹17 lakh for listing Taiwan as a country on its website
Content: China has issued a warning to convenience store chain 7-Eleven for listing Taiwan as a country on its website and displaying maps containing incorrect borders for Xinjiang and Tibet. It has imposed a fine of $23,500 (₹17.5 lakh) on the company. "This incident is true, and we sincerely accept (the warning and the fine)," a spokesperson for the company said.

Title: Gupta brothers step down from Ashoka University's board after CBI probe
Content: Two of the Co-founders of Ashoka University Vineet Gupta and Pranav Gupta have stepped down from all boards and committees of the varsity. The brothers, who are also directors of Chandigarh-based pharmaceutical company Parabolic Drugs Ltd (PDL), have been booked by the CBI for allegedly cheating the Central Bank of India and other banks to the tune of ₹1,626 crore.

Title: Co-founders of Ashoka University Gupta brothers charged by CBI in ₹1,626-crore bank fraud
Content: Co-founders of Ashoka University Pranav Gupta and Vineet Gupta, who also own Chandigarh-based pharmaceutical company Parabolic Drugs Ltd (PDL), have been booked by CBI for alleged bank fraud of around ₹1,626 crore. The case has been registered on complaint from Central Bank of India that PDL and its promoters and directors cheated a consortium of banks led by SBI.

Title: Sensex plunges 800 points amid rising COVID-19 cases; Nifty around 17,700
Content: The Indian benchmark indices fell on Thursday with the Sensex plunging more than 800 points. Sensex was trading around 59,400 levels at 10.30am, while the broader Nifty 50 slumped over 200 points to trade around the 17,700-mark. Bharti Airtel was among the gainers, while Sun Pharma and Dr Reddy's Labs were trading in red.

Title: India’s GDP estimated to rise 9.2% in FY 2021-22 compared to 7.3% contraction in 2020-21
Content: In the first advance estimates released by the National Statistical Office, the growth in real GDP during 2021-22 is estimated at 9.2% as compared to the contraction of 7.3% in 2020-21. "Real GDP...in the year 2021-22 is estimated at ₹147.54 lakh crore, as against the Provisional Estimate of GDP for the year 2020-21 of ₹135.13 lakh crore," NSO stated.

Title: Reliance Industries raises $4 billion in India's biggest forex bond deal
Content: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries has raised $4 billion in US dollar bonds in India's largest-ever foreign currency bond deal. It raised $1.5 billion in a 10-year tranche, $1.75 billion in a 30-year tranche and $750 million in a 40-year deal. The deal eclipsed the record set by ONGC Videsh in 2014 when it raised $2.2 billion in US dollar bonds.

Title: Maersk dethroned as world's largest shipping company by MSC
Content: Danish carrier Maersk is no longer the world's largest shipping company and has been dethroned by Mediterranean Shipping Company (MSC) in terms of capacity. According to data compiled and published by Alphaliner on Wednesday, the Swiss-Italian international shipping line MSC has 4,284,728 standard 20-foot containers, 1,888 more than Maersk. However, both the companies have a 17% market share.

Title: Bitcoin falls below $41,000 to lowest level since September
Content: The price of the world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 5% on Friday to its lowest level since late September. Bitcoin was last trading around $40,938, down 40% since hitting a record high of $69,000 in November. Ether, the second largest cryptocurrency by market value, also fell as much as 8.6% to $3,114, its lowest since October 1.

Title: Ford Motor's vehicle sales in US fall by 6.8% in 2021
Content: Automobile manufacturer Ford Motor reported a 6.8% fall in 2021 US vehicle sales as the company faced issues like lingering supply-chain bottlenecks and a global chip shortage. Ford sold a total of 19,05,955 vehicles in 2021, ending up behind Toyota Motor and General Motors. Ford sold 27,140 units of Mustang Mach-E electric crossover in 2021.

Title: Sony plans to enter electric car market, says CEO
Content: Japan's multinational conglomerate Sony Corporation plans to launch a new company named Sony Mobility to examine entering the electric vehicle market, said Sony's CEO Kenichiro Yoshida. ''With our imaging and sensing, cloud, 5G, and entertainment technologies combined with our contents mastery, we believe Sony is well positioned as a creative entertainment company to redefine mobility,'' he said.

Title: MSME credit guarantee scheme saved 13.5 lakh firms, 1.5 cr jobs: Report
Content: The Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme has saved 13.5 lakh MSME firms from going bankrupt and consequently 1.5 crore jobs, a report by SBI Research said. It added that MSME loan accounts worth ₹1.8 lakh crore were saved from becoming NPAs, equivalent to 14% of all outstanding MSME credit during pandemic. "The scheme saved approximately six crore families," it said.

Title: Vibrant Gujarat Summit postponed amid COVID-19 surge
Content: The Gujarat government on Thursday announced that it has postponed the 10th edition of the Vibrant Gujarat Global Investors Summit (VGGIS) due to rise in COVID-19 cases in the state. The event was to be held from January 10 to 12 at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar. Nearly 26 nations were scheduled to join VGGIS as partner countries this year.

Title: Govt approves ₹12,031 crore green power transmission scheme
Content: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs on Thursday approved the second phase of the green energy corridor scheme which is estimated to cost ₹12,031 crore. The second phase of green energy corridor scheme will facilitate grid integration and power evacuation of about 20 GW of renewable energy projects in Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu and Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Omicron to hit India's FY22's Q4 GDP by 0.4%, overall GDP by 0.1%: Report
Content: Omicron will impact India's GDP in the January-March quarter of FY22 by 0.4% and shave-off 0.1% from FY22's overall GDP growth, according to India Ratings and Research (IRR). In Q4 of FY22, India will register a GDP growth rate of 5.7% against earlier estimates of 6.1%, IRR said. For FY22 overall, GDP is now expected to clock 9.3% growth.

Title: TCS board to consider share buyback proposal on January 12
Content: The board of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will consider a share buyback proposal on January 12, the company said in an exchange filing. The company's previous buyback offer worth about ₹16,000 crore had opened on December 18, 2020 and closed on January 1, 2021. TCS is due to report its earnings for the third quarter ended December on January 12.

Title: Power CPSEs capex up by 47% to over ₹40,000 cr in April-December
Content: Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs) under the Ministry of Power have incurred capital expenditure of ₹40,395.34 crore during April-December 2021, which is 47% higher compared to the corresponding period of FY 2020-21. As per the government data, CPSEs have also collectively met 80% of the capex target of FY 2021-22 which stands at ₹50,690.52 crore.

Title: DPIIT to revise India's FDI policy for LIC disinvestment: Secretary
Content: DPIIT Secretary Anurag Jain said that the department will come out with a revised FDI policy to facilitate LIC's disinvestment process. "We are working on further simplification of the FDI policy," Jain said. Currently, 74% foreign investment is permitted in the insurance sector. However, these rules do not apply to LIC as it is administered through a separate LIC Act.

Title: Darjeeling tea production hit record low in 2021
Content: The production of Darjeeling tea declined to 6.19 million kg in 2021, which is the lowest production on record, according to the data provided by the Tea Board. As per tea industry sources, there has been a 50% drop compared with the region's average production capability. Climate change and COVID-19 pandemic are some of the reasons for low tea production.

Title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman reviews progress on LIC's planned IPO
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday reviewed the progress of Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) planned IPO. The Secretary of Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), Department of Financial Services' Secretary and senior officials of LIC were also present. LIC's IPO is poised to be the biggest ever in India and is expected to hit the markets by March.

Title: World food prices jumped 28% in 2021, highest in 10 years
Content: World food prices jumped 28% in 2021, which is the highest rise recorded in 10 years, the UN's food agency said on Thursday. Prices for all categories in the food price index except dairy products fell slightly in December but continued to increase during the other months. FAO's vegetable oil price index also hit a record high in 2021.

Title: Govt selects TCS to drive next phase of Passport Seva Programme
Content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Friday said it has been selected by the government for the second phase of the Passport Seva Programme. ''Our partnership with MEA over the last decade has become a benchmark in a public-private partnership for citizen services. We are pleased to be selected for the next phase of the Passport Seva Programme,'' said the company.

Title: Tur dal imports at new high after govt eased restrictions
Content: Tur dal, a key variety in pulses, saw record import this fiscal year after government eased restrictions on import of pulses. As per reports, more than five lakh tonne of Tur dal had been imported till December 31, 2021, and total imports are likely to cross 6.5 lakh tonne by March-end compared to 4.42 lakh tonne in 2020-21.

Title: Musk's Starlink to refund pre-orders for internet services in India
Content: Billionaire Elon Musk's Starlink has told customers in India that the government has asked it to refund all pre-orders for its internet services until it receives licences to operate in the country, reported Reuters. Starlink said, "You can receive a refund at any time." The company had received over 5,000 pre-orders and had collected $99 (about ₹7,400) from Indian customers.

Title: Xiaomi India evaded ₹653 crore customs duty: Govt
Content: The government on Wednesday said that raids at Xiaomi India found that it evaded customs duty of ₹653 crore. "Neither Xiaomi India nor its contract manufactures included the amount of royalty paid by Xiaomi India in the assessable value of the goods imported," the government said. The government also said it sent three show-cause notices to Xiaomi India for recovery.

Title: Pvt sector should oppose China's genocide: US as Tesla opens showroom in Xinjiang
Content: After billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla opened a showroom in Xinjiang, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "We believe the private sector should oppose China's human rights abuses and genocide in Xinjiang." "The international community, including the public and private sectors, cannot look the other way when it comes to what is taking place in Xinjiang," she added.

Title: Toyota overtakes GM as US' top-selling automaker for first time since 1931
Content: Japan's Toyota Motor outsold General Motors (GM) in the US in 2021, marking the first time since 1931 that GM has not led auto sales in the country. It also marked the first time that a non-domestic automaker has taken the top spot in US. While Toyota sold 2.332 million vehicles in US last year, GM sold 2.218 million vehicles.

Title: World's tallest building Burj Khalifa's developer Emaar to build mall in Srinagar
Content: Dubai's Emaar Properties, the master developer of the world's tallest building Burj Khalifa, has said that it will develop a 5,00,000 square feet shopping mall in Jammu & Kashmir's Srinagar. An MoU has been signed between the governments of Dubai and J&K to facilitate investments. Emaar is also considering other investments into real estate, hospitality and other projects in J&K.

Title: SBI, HDFC Bank in RBI's 2021 list of 'Domestic Systemically Important Banks'
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday said that SBI, ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank continue to be identified as 'Domestic Systemically Important Banks' (D-SIBs). According to the RBI, SIBs are banks that are 'too big to fail' and are, therefore, subjected to additional policy measures to deal with the systemic risks and moral hazard issues posed by them.

Title: NCLAT sets Twin Star's plan for Videocon aside, allows fresh bidding
Content: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Wednesday set aside Twin Star Technologies' plan to buy Videocon Industries for ₹2,962 crore and allowed a fresh round of bidding for the company. While setting aside the plan, NCLAT said the plan had certain defects. Twin Star's plan to buy Videocon had earlier been approved by the National Company Law Tribunal.

Title: Berkshire Hathaway's stake in Apple hits record $162 bn in value
Content: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway's stake in Apple hit record $162 billion in value on Monday after Apple became the world's first company to briefly breach market capitalisation of $3 trillion. Berkshire owns about 887 million shares of Apple, giving it a stake of 5.4% in the company, Insider reported. Last year, Buffett described Berkshire's Apple holding as "family jewel".

Title: Delhi HC stays arbitration proceedings between Amazon, Future Group
Content: A two-judge bench of the Delhi High Court today stayed arbitration proceedings between Future Group and Amazon in Singapore until further orders. Future Group had appealed a larger bench of the High Court after its plea was rejected by a single-judge bench of the HC. The appeal on merits will be heard in detail on February 1 by the HC.

Title: BMW India sells 8,876 cars in 2021, sales surge by 34%
Content: BMW India reported a year-on-year (YoY) growth of 34% with a dispatch of 8,876 units in 2021, recording the highest growth in a decade in India. The automaker dispatched 8,236 BMW and 640 Mini units last year compared to 6,604 units across BMW and Mini brands in 2020. The company generated over 40% sales from its locally assembled SAV range.

Title: iD Fresh Food raises ₹507 crore from NewQuest, Premji Invest
Content: Bengaluru-based iD Fresh Food has raised ₹507 crore in funding led by NewQuest Capital Partners, along with existing investor Premji Invest. Helion Ventures, who had invested in the startup in 2014, exited the company in the current round with 10X return on the investment. The fresh food startup was founded by PC Musthafa, Abdul Nazer and their cousins in 2005.

Title: Future Group's pleas to end arbitration with Amazon dismissed by HC
Content: Delhi High Court has dismissed petitions filed by Future Group companies seeking to quash the arbitration proceedings initiated by Amazon in Singapore. Future Group had asked the court to end proceedings citing a CCI order passed in December, suspending a 2019 deal between Amazon and Future Coupons. Justice Amit Bansal said the filings were dismissed, without giving any further details.

Title: Walmart to hire more than 3,000 US drivers for grocery deliveries
Content: Walmart Inc plans to hire more than 3,000 US drivers and build out a fleet of all-electric delivery vans to support its home grocery delivery service, the company said on Tuesday. The retailer which now provides services to six million homes aims to reach 30 million homes by the end of 2022. The company currently has about 100 drivers.

Title: RBI cancels authorisation certificates of Muthoot Vehicle Finance, Eko India
Content: Reserve Bank of India on Tuesday cancelled the Certificate of Authorisation (CoA) of two Payment System Operators (PSOs) - Muthoot Vehicle and Asset Finance and Eko India Financial Services. The CoA were cancelled citing non-compliance with regulatory requirements. "These companies cannot transact the business of issuance and operation of prepaid payment instruments," RBI said in a statement.

Title: Airtel withdraws corporate restructuring plan announced last year
Content: Bharti Airtel has withdrawn its corporate restructuring plan announced in April 2021, saying that its corporate setup will be optimal for implementing telecom sector reforms announced by the government. "[We] are well positioned to invest aggressively in emerging growth opportunities," the company said in a statement on Tuesday. It also plans to achieve vision of converged services to customers.

Title: Jet Airways' CEO Sudhir Gaur steps down ahead of relaunch
Content: Jet Airways' CEO Sudhir Gaur stepped down from his position today ahead of the airline's relaunch. He will be replaced by former JetLite Senior VP (Operations) PP Singh. Jet Airways' owner, the Jalan Kalrock Consortium, had said in September that it will restart operations with a New Delhi to Mumbai flight and shift the airline's headquarters from Mumbai to Delhi-NCR.

Title: No extraordinary increase in trade with China in 2021: Piyush Goyal
Content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has said there was no extraordinary increase in trade with China in 2021. Trade deficit with China has come down to $44 billion in 2021 from $48 billion in 2014-15, he added. This comes after Congress alleged that government was continuing its $100-billion trade with China even as it tried to rename places in Arunachal Pradesh.

Title: BSE receives 362 investor complaints in Dec, fixes 473 grievances
Content: Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) said that it received 362 investor complaints against 207 companies pertaining to non-receipt of shares and debt securities in December 2021. During that period, the BSE resolved 473 grievances against 262 listed companies. BSE said that resolved grievances include those brought forward from the previous period. 14 of the 362 complaints were against suspended companies.

Title: FMCG distributors suspend boycott of HUL products in Maharashtra
Content: FMCG distributors have suspended their boycott of certain Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) products in Maharashtra after a six member committee of AICPDF met with HUL's top executives. HUL assured that it will give serious consideration to protecting the interests of its distributors. "If HUL doesn't improve practices after three months, then we'll start the campaign again," the association said.

Title: Bajaj Finance stock surges after company releases Q3 update
Content: Shares of Bajaj Finance Ltd surged on Wednesday after the company reported a 26.3% jump in the assets under management in the third quarter of FY22. The company reported more than 2% jump during the early trade on the BSE. As per company's Q3 report, the assets rose to ₹1,81,300 crore from ₹1,43,550 crore recorded in the Q3 of FY21.

Title: OPEC, allied countries decide to increase oil production
Content: Members of Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies (OPEC+) decided on Tuesday to pump more oil amid hopes that travel will not be disrupted despite the rapid spread of Omicron. The 23-member OPEC+ alliance decided to add 4,00,000 barrels of oil per day in February. OPEC+ aims to slowly restore output cuts made during the pandemic.

Title: Adani wins key tender to supply overseas coal to NTPC: Reports
Content: Adani Enterprises Ltd. has won a contract to supply overseas coal to NTPC, according to reports. The top power producer of India in October issued its first tender for coal imports in more than two years, the reports added. Adani will reportedly deliver one million tons of coal to NTPC, the reports further said.

Title: India needs over 8% GDP growth to become $5 tn economy: Ex-SBI head
Content: Former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar said that India needs to achieve a GDP growth rate of over 8% if it aims to become a $5 trillion economy by 2025. To achieve over 8% growth, India needs lower tax rates, ease of doing business and availability of land, said Rajnish. "We need private sector investment in a big way," he added.

Title: SEBI to hire agency to upgrade IT network, communication systems
Content: Capital markets regulator SEBI is planning to hire an agency to upgrade and revamp its IT infrastructure network and communication systems as it has invited Expression of Interest (EoI) from solution providers for the same. "The proposed solution should be robust, secure, stable, efficient and easy to manage and should have latest collaborative features,'' said SEBI.

Title: Hyderabad-based e-bus maker Olectra's shares surge 540% in a year
Content: Shares of Olectra Greentech, India's largest electric bus maker, surged 540% in the last 12 months. The company also recently announced setting up a 150-acre manufacturing unit on the outskirts of Hyderabad. Olectra Chairman KV Pradeep said that the company now wishes to venture into the electric truck market after it announced partnership with a truck maker.

Title: Colgate India in talks with sales agents after disruption threats
Content: Colgate-Palmolive India said that it is holding talks with sales agents after the latter threatened to disrupt supplies in Maharashtra. The threat came after 'kirana' stores in India partnered with Reliance Industries to secure lower prices of Colgate's products. This led to drop in sales of companies like Unilever, forcing agents to ask for same price deals as corporate distributors.

Title: Apple briefly hits $3 trillion market value, becomes world's first company to do so
Content: Apple on Monday briefly hit $3 trillion market value, becoming the world's first publicly-traded company to do so. The iPhone and Mac maker has reported strong earnings since the COVID-19 pandemic began as its products saw higher demand as more people worked from home. Apple's market value crossed the $1-trillion mark in August 2018 and $2-trillion mark in August 2020.

Title: Omicron isn't last variant, we need to brace for many variants: Biocon's Shaw
Content: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar Shaw told CNBC TV18 that Omicron is not the last variant of COVID-19 and "we need to brace up for many, many variants". She added, "Every pandemic will become endemic at some stage and I think we are veering towards that." She added that India is more prepared this time as more people are vaccinated.

Title: Apple hits $3 trillion m-cap milestone exactly 45 years after its formation
Content: Apple on Monday became the world's first company to briefly hit $3 trillion in market capitalisation, exactly 45 years after the company was formed. Apple was incorporated on January 3, 1977, in Cupertino by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Mike Markkula Jr as 'Apple Computer'. In January 2007, Jobs announced 'Apple Computer' is changing its name to 'Apple Inc'.

Title: Visa, Mastercard will be biggest business losers of 2022: Billionaire Chamath
Content: Sri Lankan-born Canadian venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya in a podcast said, "My biggest business losers for 2022 are Visa and Mastercard and traditional payment rails and the entire ecosystem around it." The billionaire said these payments systems are a "completely contrived duopoly that doesn't need to exist". He added that these companies will lose out to Web3-based payment projects.

Title: RBI releases framework for small value digital payments without internet
Content: The RBI released a framework for small value offline digital payments that don't require internet or telecom connectivity. Such payments can be carried out face-to-face using instruments like cards, wallets or mobile devices. Transactions are subject to a limit of ₹200 per transaction and an overall limit of ₹2,000 for all transactions until the balance in the account is replenished.

Title: Elon Musk gets $33.8 billion richer on 1st trading day of 2022
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk's net worth jumped by $33.8 billion on Monday, the first trading day of 2022, as Tesla's shares rallied. Musk's fortune rose to $304.2 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Tesla's shares surged 13.5% after the company reported record deliveries for the fourth quarter of 2021, taking its market value back above $1 trillion.

Title: Tesla criticised for opening showroom in Xinjiang, where China is accused of genocide
Content: Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has been criticised in the US after opening a showroom in Xinjiang, where China has been accused of genocide against Uighur Muslims. Tesla announced the showroom on its Weibo page on December 31.
