Alliance for American Manufacturing's President Scott Paul, said, "Any company doing business in Xinjiang is complicit in the cultural genocide taking place there."

Title: Shopping on social media to hit $1.2 trillion globally by 2025: Accenture study
Content: Shopping on social media platforms such as Facebook, TikTok and WeChat will hit $1.2 trillion worldwide by 2025, according to a study by Accenture. Shopping through social media platforms will grow three times faster than sales from traditional channels, the study predicted. The growth is predicted to be driven primarily by Gen Z and Millennial social media users.

Title: Stanford dropout & Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes convicted of fraud in US
Content: Blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes has been found guilty of four charges, including conspiracy to commit fraud against investors and three counts of wire fraud, in US. The 37-year-old could face up to 20 years in prison. Holmes dropped out of Stanford to start Theranos, which was valued at $9 billion before it collapsed in 2018 over fraud allegations.

Title: Who is Alka Mittal, first woman to head ONGC as Chairman & MD?
Content: Dr Alka Mittal, who has become the first woman to lead Oil and Natural Gas Corporation as Chairman and MD, had joined ONGC as a graduate trainee in 1985. She was appointed as ONGC's Director (Human Resources) in 2018 and continues to hold this post. Mittal is a postgraduate in Economics, MBA (HRM) and Doctorate in Commerce and Business Studies.

Title: ACE Group, MD Ajay Chaudhary raided by income tax officials in Delhi, Noida: Reports
Content: The I-T Department on Tuesday conducted raids at multiple premises of real estate company ACE Group and its MD Ajay Chaudhary, including in Delhi, Noida and Agra, reports said citing sources. Chaudhary is said to be close to a political leader of Uttar Pradesh, reports added. Last week, I-T officials raided perfume trader and Samajwadi Party MLC Pushpraj Jain's premises.

Title: Sri Lanka could go bankrupt in 2022 due to COVID-19 crisis: Report
Content: Sri Lanka is facing a deepening financial and humanitarian crisis due to COVID-19 and it could go bankrupt in 2022, The Guardian reported. It needs to repay an estimated $7.3 billion in domestic and foreign loans in the next 12 months. The World Bank estimates that 5,00,000 Sri Lankans have fallen below the poverty line since the beginning of COVID-19.

Title: Sensex surges 929 points on first trading day of 2022, Nifty ends above 17,600
Content: The benchmark indices ended the first day of trading of the new year 2022 with the most gains in more than three weeks. The BSE Sensex ended 929 points higher at 59,183 and the Nifty surged 271 points to close at 17,625 on Monday. All the sectoral indices, barring pharma, closed in the green.

Title: Alka Mittal becomes first woman to head ONGC as its Chairman and MD
Content: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) on Monday announced that its Director (Human Resources) Dr Alka Mittal has been entrusted with additional charge of Chairman and Managing Director (CMD). She has become the first woman to head the energy major, it added. The state-run company had been functioning without a CMD since the retirement of its former chief Subhash Kumar.

Title: HC reserves order on Future Group's plea to end arbitration with Amazon
Content: The Delhi High Court on Monday reserved its order on Future Group's plea seeking termination of the ongoing arbitration proceedings with Amazon. Future Group cited CCI order passed in December suspending its approval for a 2019 deal between Amazon and Future Coupons. The court said that it will pronounce its order on the plea at 4.30 pm on January 4.

Title: iPhone maker Foxconn's TN plant unlikely to reopen until Jan 7: Report
Content: Foxconn is unlikely to reopen its Tamil Nadu facility, which makes Apple's iPhones, until January 7, Reuters reported. The plant was closed on December 18 following protests after more than 250 of its workers were treated for food poisoning. Last week, Apple placed the plant on probation after finding that some worker dormitories and dining rooms didn't meet required standards.

Title: Tesla shares surge 10% after it reports record deliveries for Q4
Content: World's most valuable carmaker Tesla's shares surged 10% on Monday after the company reported record deliveries for the fourth quarter of 2021. Tesla delivered 308,600 cars in the fourth quarter, topping its previous record of 241,300 cars from the prior quarter. "This is a trophy-case quarter for Tesla as it blew away...bull-case expectations," said Daniel Ives, an analyst at Wedbush.

Title: State Bank of India invests $20 million in Pine Labs
Content: Merchant commerce platform Pine Labs on Tuesday announced that the State Bank of India (SBI) has invested $20 million in the startup. Pine Labs had raised $700 million in funding across two rounds last year. "We are thrilled to have the largest bank of India, the State Bank of India, place their trust in us," its CEO Amrish Rau said.

Title: India seeks emergency WTO meeting to discuss COVID-19 package: Official
Content: India has sought an emergency meeting at the World Trade Organisation's (WTO) General Council this month to discuss WTO's proposed COVID-19 response package, an official said. The package includes a Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights (TRIPS) waiver proposal to deal with the pandemic. The waiver proposal was first submitted by India and South Africa in October 2020.

Title: Subramanian Swamy seeks cancellation of Air India disinvestment
Content: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy has moved the Delhi High Court seeking to quash the Air India disinvestment process. Swamy also sought directions to the CBI to investigate role and functioning of respondent authorities and submit a detailed report to the Court. Tata Sons won the bid for acquiring Air India for ₹18,000 crore on October 8 last year.

Title: India's exports hit record $299.74 bn in first 9 months of 2021-22
Content: India's exports hit a historic high at $299.74 billion in the first nine months of FY 2021-22, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. The country also recorded highest-ever monthly figure in December as exports surged to $37 billion, 37% higher than the previous year. Meanwhile, the highest quarterly figure of $103 billion exports was recorded in the October-December period, Goyal added.

Title: LIC to file IPO papers by 3rd week of January: Report
Content: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) is likely to file the draft papers for its IPO with market regulator SEBI by the third week of January, TOI reported. Earlier, government officials said that the listing would be completed before the end of FY22. LIC IPO size is likely to be around ₹1 lakh crore, making it India's biggest ever public issue.

Title: Central Railway crosses 7MT freight loading in a month for 1st time
Content: The Central Railway zone crossed seven million tonnes (MT) freight loading in a month, surpassing the previous record of 6.96 MT. The freight loading of Central Railway in December 2021 was 7.21 MT as against 5.87 MT in December 2020. During April-December 2021, its freight loading was 55.06 MT, which is the highest ever during any April-December period.

Title: RBL Bank sees over 11% drop in retail, small business deposits in Oct-Dec
Content: RBL Bank witnessed a quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) drop of 11.3% in retail and small business deposits in the October-December quarter. Retail and small business deposits fell to ₹27,871 crore over the quarter. Total deposits in the quarter also fell 2.58% QoQ to ₹73,637 crore. This comes after the bank's MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja exited abruptly, reportedly making depositors nervous.

Title: Omicron will be short-term disruption for businesses: Piyush Goyal
Content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said on Monday that the Omicron variant will cause a short-term disruption for businesses. He added that supply chains and industrial activities will continue in full swing. He said this while announcing that India achieved the highest-ever monthly exports worth $37 billion in December 2021, a year-on-year increase of 37%.

Title: India on track to achieve export target of $400 billion: Piyush Goyal
Content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Monday that India has achieved the highest ever monthly exports of $37 billion in December 2021, a 37% year-on-year increase. He added that it is clear that India is well on its way to achieving an export target of $400 billion. "It is a time for Indians to feel proud," Goyal said.

Title: Interest rates on small savings schemes unchanged for Q4 of FY 2021-22
Content: The Centre has kept interest rates on small savings schemes unchanged for Q4 of financial year (FY) 2021-22, according to a report by PTI. Public Provident Fund and National Savings Certificate will continue to carry an annual interest rate of 7.1% and 6.8% respectively. The decision comes amid elevated inflation rates and increasing cases of Omicron in India.

Title: India sees record ₹8.26 lakh crore UPI transactions in December
Content: India saw value of UPI transactions in December rise to a record high of ₹8.26 lakh crore, NPCI data showed. The month also saw the volume of transactions jump to record high at 456 crore. For the year, UPI saw 3,874 crore transactions, up 105% from 2020. The value of these transactions rose by over 130% at ₹71.46 lakh crore.

Title: World's 2nd richest person Jeff Bezos rings in New Year with a disco party
Content: Amazon Founder and the world's second-richest person, Jeff Bezos, celebrated New Year with a disco-themed party with his girlfriend Lauren Sanchez and his family members. He wrote on Instagram, "New year is a great time to take stock and focus on personal growth, renewal, rebirth, and paying careful attention to each moment of your life." He added, "Celebrate and grow."

Title: Xiaomi, Oppo could face ₹1,000 crore fine for violating income tax law: Reports
Content: The I-T Department carried out raids across premises of two foreign-controlled mobile phone manufacturers and said they may face fines of over ₹1,000 crore. Reports claimed the two firms are Xiaomi and Oppo. Tax officials found that they didn't comply with certain rules under the Income-tax Act, 1961 and also may have understated taxable profit by over ₹1,400 crore.

Title: GST revenue collection rises 13% in December to ₹1.29 lakh crore
Content: The goods and services tax (GST) revenue collected in December 2021 saw a 13% rise year-on-year at ₹1.29 lakh crore, the finance ministry revealed. Out of the total revenue, ₹22,578 crore is CGST and ₹28,658 crore is SGST. December is the sixth month in a row when revenue from goods sold and services rendered stood at over ₹1 lakh crore.

Title: No property tax on residential properties up to 500 sq ft in Mumbai: Maha CM
Content: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has announced complete waiver of property tax on residential units of up to 500 square feet in Mumbai. "I promise Mumbaikars that we are able to take care of your health and well-being, just continue to give us your blessings," Thackeray said while announcing the decision, ahead of Mumbai municipal corporation elections due next month.

Title: India's unemployment rate hits four-month high of 7.9% in December: CMIE
Content: India's unemployment rate hit a four-month high in December, data from Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) showed. The unemployment rate rose to 7.9% in December from 7.0% in November, its highest since 8.3% in August. Urban unemployment rate rose to 9.3% in December from 8.2% in November while rural unemployment rate was up 7.3% from 6.4%, the data showed.

Title: Revoking FCRA licence will affect humanitarian work during COVID: Oxfam India
Content: A day after Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) refused to renew the registration of Oxfam India under Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, the organisation said the action would "severely affect" its humanitarian work, including COVID-19 relief work, in 16 states. The licence is needed to receive funding from abroad. "We'll urge the MHA to lift the funding restrictions," Oxfam India stated.

Title: Highway to hopeful future: Mahindra on pics of completed parts of Delhi-Mumbai highway
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra reacted to the pictures of completed sections of Delhi-Mumbai highway and tweeted, "It's an image that made me imagine a Highway into a more Hopeful future." "So glad to see this image on the first day of the New Year...When it's completed, I hope to be one of the first cruising on it," he added.

Title: Future Retail misses due date for payment of ₹3,500 crore to banks
Content: Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail, which runs the Big Bazaar chain of stores, missed the due date of December 31, 2021, to pay ₹3,494.56 crore to various consortium banks and lenders. The company said it missed the due date "due to ongoing litigation with Amazon". Future Retail would be co-operating with banks and lenders for payment in the next 30 days.

Title: H&M temporarily shuts NY store after employee shares pics of bugs crawling on clothes
Content: H&M temporarily shut a New York store after an employee who worked at the store shared pictures of bugs crawling on hoodies on Twitter. She had tweeted, "A customer discovered lice on a rack of hoodies...The section was just blocked off." After her tweet went viral, she tweeted, "I was annoyed that it was being treated like a minor issue."

Title: ₹70 cr tax evasion detected after raids on crypto exchanges: Report
Content: The Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) has detected tax evasions worth ₹70 crore after its officials searched half a dozen offices of cryptocurrency service providers, ANI reported citing official sources. "These service providers were charging a commission for their facilitation to indulge in exchange of Bitcoins but were not paying GST tax," an official source was quoted as saying.

Title: Morgan Stanley to pay $60 mn to settle suit alleging it exposed users' data
Content: Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay $60 million to settle a data security lawsuit by customers. The class action suit alleges that the bank exposed customers' personal data when it twice failed to properly retire some of its older information technology. As per the settlement, customers can apply for reimbursement of up to $10,000 each in out-of-pocket losses.

Title: Tata Motors overtakes Hyundai as 2nd largest PV seller in Dec 2021
Content: Tata Motors has overtaken Hyundai Motor India to become the second largest seller of passenger vehicles (PVs) in the domestic market for the first time in close to a decade in December 2021. Tata Motors registered sales of 35,299 PV units in December 2021, whereas Hyundai dispatched 32,312 units. Tata Motors said it dispatched close to 99,000 vehicles between October-December.

Title: OYO, Delhivery, 21 other firms to raise ₹44,000 cr via IPOs in Jan-Mar
Content: Nearly two dozen companies are looking to collectively raise about ₹44,000 crore through initial public offerings (IPOs) between January and March 2022, as per investment bankers. OYO, Delhivery, Adani Wilmar, Emcure Pharmaceuticals, ixigo, Medanta are among the companies expected to raise funds during this period. A large chunk of total fundraising is poised to be garnered by tech-driven firms.

Title: Negative YoY growth in credit to MSMEs for third straight month: RBI
Content: Data released by the Reserve Bank of India showed that year-on-year (YoY) growth in credit to MSMEs remained negative for the third straight month in November 2021. Credit to MSMEs stood at ₹10.99 lakh crore in November 2021, down 2.2% from ₹11.23 lakh crore in November 2020. YoY credit growth to MSMEs was -0.5% in October and -2.6% in September.

Title: Roll out draft e-commerce rules without dilution: CAIT to Goyal
Content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) asked Union Consumer Affairs Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday to roll-out the draft e-commerce rules without any dilution. "Any dilution in the rules...will percolate a strong feeling that the government has succumbed to some hidden pressures," CAIT said. The draft e-commerce rules intend on tightening the watch on e-commerce companies.

Title: Declare arbitration with Amazon illegal: Future Retail to Delhi HC
Content: Future Retail has asked Delhi High Court to declare arbitration proceedings in Singapore with Amazon as illegal. It has argued that since the 2019 deal with Amazon no longer has CCI's approval, it has "no legal existence" in India and Amazon can no longer assert its rights. "Continuation of the entire arbitration proceedings is a perpetuation of illegality," it added.

Title: Tesla delivers record 308,600 cars worldwide in 4th quarter of 2021
Content: Tesla on Sunday said it delivered 308,000 electric cars worldwide in the fourth quarter of 2021, beating its previous single-quarter record. Tesla's total sales for the year stood at more than 936,000, up about 87% over 2020's deliveries of just under half a million vehicles. Notably, Tesla joined the exclusive club of companies with $1 trillion market value in 2021.

Title: Goldman Sachs asks employees in US to work from home: Report
Content: Goldman Sachs is asking employees in US to work from home if they can until January 18, Bloomberg reported citing an internal memo. The decision comes amid a rapid surge of COVID-19 cases in US. The bank told its employees last week that anyone entering its offices must get a booster shot of vaccine by February 1, if they're eligible.

Title: Will take strict steps: AICPDF to Colgate over price disparity issue
Content: FMCG distributors have warned Colgate-Palmolive India of taking strict steps after it failed to respond to the issue of price disparity of products between traditional and B2B distributors. Citing Colgate's "obstinate attitude", AICPDF said no distributors in Maharashtra will sell Colgate's Max Fresh brand in the state. The company said it is looking to address the challenges of its distributors.

Title: India appeals against WTO panel ruling on sugar export subsidies: Official
Content: India has appealed against the ruling of World Trade Organisation's (WTO) trade dispute settlement panel which said that India's support measures for sugar and sugarcane are inconsistent with global trade norms, an official said. On December 14, 2021, the panel recommended India to withdraw alleged prohibited subsidies within 120 days. India stated that the findings are completely "unacceptable".

Title: Over 5.78 crore income tax returns filed for AY 2021-22: I-T Dept
Content: More than 5.78 crore income tax returns for Assessment Year (AY) 2021-22 were filed till 7pm on Friday, including 35.74 lakh filed on December 31 alone, the Income Tax Department said. The returns filed for AY 2021-22 were lesser than 5.95 crore returns filed for AY 2020-21. The last date for filing the returns was December 31, 2021.

Title: Reliance Industries to raise $5 billion to pay-off existing borrowings
Content: Reliance Industries Ltd said that it will raise $5 billion in foreign currency-denominated bonds to pay-off existing borrowings of the company. The company said in an exchange filing that its Finance Committee approved the proposal for issuance of US Dollar-denominated fixed-rate notes on Saturday. The bond sale is poised to become the single largest such borrowing by an Indian company.

Title: Global M&A volumes breach $5 trillion-mark for 1st time in 2021
Content: Global merger and acquisition (M&A) volumes crossed $5 trillion in 2021 for the first time ever, surpassing the previous record of $4.55 trillion set in 2007, Dealogic data showed. According to Refinitiv, the overall M&A value stood at $5.8 trillion, which is up by 64% compared to the previous year. There were a total of 62,193 deals made in 2021.

Title: Eight core sectors' output rises by 3.1% in November
Content: The output of eight core sectors including coal, crude oil, natural gas, refinery products, fertilisers, steel, cement and electricity grew by 3.1% in November 2021, as per data released by the Ministry of Commerce. The output for these core sectors had grown by 7.5% in October and the growth rate during the April-November period of 2021-22 stood at 13.7%.

Title: Vinod Kannan takes over as CEO of Vistara
Content: Vistara has announced that Vinod Kannan took over as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the airline on Saturday. "Kannan started his stint with Vistara as the Chief Strategy Officer in June 2019 and took over as Chief Commercial Officer in January 2020," the company said. Kannan replaced Leslie Thng who was the CEO from July 2017 to December 2021.

Title: Jet fuel price hiked by 2.75% to over ₹76,000/kilolitre
Content: Prices of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, have increased by ₹2,039.63, or 2.75%, to ₹76,062.04 per kilolitre in New Delhi, according to a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. The increase in rate comes on the back of two consecutive price cuts in the month of December 2021 that reflected a drop in international jet fuel prices.

Title: It's very worrying: Zoho CEO on record 40+ unicorns created in India in 2021
Content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu said that "anyone who has studied the history of investment bubbles" should find India's unicorn trend "very worrying". He was responding to a report that said, "43 unicorns in 2021 are more than the 30 unicorns created in the entire history of Indian startup scene." Vembu also shared a book "to read to prepare ahead".

Title: CCI orders probe into Apple's business practices in India
Content: The Competition Commission of India ordered a detailed probe against Apple for alleged unfair business practices in India with respect to its App Store. The watchdog said that Apple's App Store is the only channel for app developers to distribute their apps to iOS consumers. This prima facie results in denial of market access for potential app distributors, CCI stated.

Title: Apple, Amazon, 3 other tech giants gain $2.5 trillion in market cap in 2021
Content: Five of the US market's technology giants - Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon and Facebook parent Meta Platforms - added $2.5 trillion to their market value in 2021. Shares of Google's parent company surged 65% in the year, while that of Microsoft surged 51%. Shares of iPhone maker rose 34%, taking its market capitalisation to nearly $3 trillion.

Title: Next recession may be in spring 2022, but not later than 2023: Elon Musk
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk on Friday said on Twitter that the next recession may be "around spring or summer 2022, but not later than 2023". In an earlier tweet he wrote, "If history's any guide, many [unicorns] may not make it past the next recession." His comment came after a  tech columnist said the world has 936 unicorns.

Title: After WazirX, GST officials reportedly search offices of crypto service providers
Content: The Directorate General of GST Intelligence officials searched the offices of several cryptocurrency service providers across India on Saturday, ANI reported citing sources. This comes after the GST department detected GST evasion of ₹40.5 crore on commission earned by crypto exchange WazirX. It recovered ₹49.2 crore in cash as GST, interest & penalty from Zanmai Labs, which operates the exchange.

Title: Crypto exchange WazirX dodged ₹40.5 crore in tax, ₹49 crore recovered: GST dept
Content: Goods and Services Tax department has said that it detected GST evasion of ₹40.5 crore on commission earned by crypto exchange WazirX. "Recovered ₹49.2 crore in cash as GST, interest & penalty...from Zanmai Labs Pvt. Ltd," it tweeted. The indirect tax department reportedly said WazirX issued its own cryptocurrency, WRX coins, through Zanmai Labs but didn't pay GST on it.

Title: How much wealth did world's 10 richest people add to their fortunes in 2021?
Content: As per Bloomberg, world's richest person Elon Musk added $121 billion to his net worth, as of December 29, 2021. Jeff Bezos, the second richest, added $5 billion to his wealth, LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault added $61 billion and Bill Gates added $7 billion. Google Co-founder Larry Page's wealth rose $47 billion and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's by $24 billion.

Title: Hardeep Puri shares pictures of women workers in oil rigs, calls them 'super women'
Content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday lauded the contribution of women workers at the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation. Sharing pictures of them, he wrote, "The Super Women who 'woman' our oil and gas installations!" "They didn't back down from staying 60-70 days at a stretch on offshore platforms during the pandemic. They're...equal partners in India's progress," he added.

Title: LPG cylinder for commercial use becomes cheaper by ₹102.50 from today
Content: The price of commercial LPG cylinders have been slashed by ₹102.50 with effect from today. A 19-kg commercial cylinder will now cost ₹1,998.50 in Delhi, ₹1,948.5 in Mumbai, ₹2,076 in Kolkata and ₹2,131 in Chennai. In December, the price for commercial cylinders was increased by ₹100. Oil marketing companies did not cut prices of 14-kg domestic cylinder on January 1.

Title: Income tax return filing deadline won't be extended beyond today: Govt
Content: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that there's no proposal to extend the deadline for income tax (I-T) return filing for the Assessment Year (AY) 2021-22 beyond December 31, 2021. "Income tax return filing is going on smoothly. By 3pm today, 5.62 crore returns have been filed in total," he added. Over 20 lakh returns filed today, he added.

Title: After Piyush Jain, Samajwadi Party perfume trader Pushpraj Jain raided by tax officials
Content: Samajwadi Party on Friday said that Income Tax authorities are raiding its party MLC Pushpraj 'Pampi' Jain's premises in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj. This comes days after over ₹200-crore cash was seized from Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain. Pushpraj Jain is the perfume trader who launched Samajwadi Party's perfume ahead of the UP elections. Earlier reports linked Piyush Jain to SP's perfume.

Title: GST hike on textiles from 5% to 12% deferred by GST Council
Content: The GST Council has deferred the decision to hike GST on textiles from 5% to 12%. The hike was to come into effect from January 1, 2022. "The Council will review this matter in its next meeting in February 2022," Himachal Pradesh Industry Minister Bikram Singh said. Several states including Gujarat and Rajasthan were not in favour of the hike.

Title: Due date to file returns is Dec 31, 2021: I-T Dept amid calls to extend deadline
Content: The Income Tax Department on Thursday urged the people to file their income tax returns for the Assessment Year 2021-22 and tweeted, "The due date is December 31, 2021." The department's tweet came as several people on social media requested an extension in the deadline citing glitches on the portal. "24.39 lakh ITRs filed today itself," the department tweeted.

Title: Serum Institute applies for Covishield's full market authorisation in India
Content: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said they have applied for full market authorisation of Covishield in India. "Supplies of the Covishield vaccine in India, have exceeded 1.25 billion doses. The government of India now has enough data for full market authorisation," he said. Serum Institute got approval for Covishield's emergency use at the beginning of the year.

Title: How to e-verify income tax return using Aadhaar OTP?
Content: To e-verify income tax return (ITR) using Aadhaar OTP, one has to select e-Verify Return option on the income tax portal, select the option to verify using OTP on mobile number registered with Aadhaar and click on continue. Select the option to agree to validate Aadhaar details and generate Aadhaar OTP. Click 'Validate' option after entering the 6-digit OTP.

Title: Reliance Industries' solar unit to buy UK's Faradion in ₹1,000-crore deal
Content: Reliance New Energy Solar Ltd (RNESL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries, has signed an agreement to acquire 100% stake in UK's sodium ion battery firm Faradion. As per filings, RNESL will buy equity shares of Faradion through secondary transactions for a total value of £94.42 million based on an enterprise value of £100 million (over ₹1,000 crore).

Title: Couldn't find a compelling candy: Musk on not starting candy firm to challenge Buffett
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk told Babylon Bee he actually explored creating a candy company but couldn't find a "compelling candy that'd be better" than others. "If a company doesn't provide great products...it shouldn't exist," he said. In 2018, Musk said he's starting a candy company after Warren Buffett said Musk couldn't compete with Berkshire Hathaway-owned candy business, See's Candies.

Title: Harsh Goenka's RPG Group goes back to work from home, closes workplaces
Content: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka wrote on Twitter that his company has gone back to work from home and closed its workplaces with effect from Friday. The decision was taken in view of the rise in COVID-19 cases across India. "I hope other organisations also follow suit and try to break the chain," Goenka added in the tweet.

Title: Over $1 trillion added to net worths of world's 500 richest people in 2021
Content: The collective fortune of world's 500 richest people surged by over $1 trillion in 2021 despite the COVID-19 pandemic, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. At least 10 people now have fortunes worth over $100 billion, while over 200 have fortunes worth over $10 billion. Tesla CEO Elon Musk is the world's richest person with over $270 billion net worth.

Title: Favourite pic of the year: Mahindra on pic of boy studying on hand cart as man pushes it
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has shared a picture of a small schoolboy studying while sitting on a hand cart as a man pushes it. "And here's my favourite photo of the year. Apologies, I don't know who took it so cannot acknowledge the photographer...Hope, Hard Work, Optimism. The essence of why we live," he tweeted.

Title: China warns Walmart over non-availability of Xinjiang items on app
Content: China has issued a warning to Walmart over alleged removal of Xinjiang products on its members-only grocery chain Sam's Club app. "Walmart must respect China's standpoint and the Chinese people's feelings if they want to 'stand firm' in the Chinese market," the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection said. Chinese users had posted screenshots of no search results for Xinjiang items.

Title: Japanese firms to help Gates' firm build US nuclear reactor: Report
Content: The Japan Atomic Energy Agency and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries will be helping the US and Bill Gates' venture company TerraPower to build a high-tech nuclear reactor in Wyoming, US, Reuters reported citing the daily Yomiuri. The parties will sign an agreement as early as January. JAEA and Mitsubishi will provide technical support and data from Japan's own advanced reactors.

Title: Foreign carmakers interested in India's Ford plant: Tamil Nadu Minister
Content: Foreign carmakers have shown interest in acquiring Ford Motor Co's plant in Tamil Nadu, state Industries Minister Thangam Thenarasu said. He added that details of firms interested cannot be disclosed and "it is eventually up to Ford as it'll be a commercial arrangement". Tata Group also showed interest but the government is yet to hear from them, he said further.

Title: States demand rollback of hiked GST on textiles, footwear
Content: Several states including Telangana, Rajasthan, Kerala and Punjab have demanded the proposed hike in GST rates on textiles and footwear from 5% to 12% be rolled back. Finance ministers of various states voiced their concerns at the pre-Budget consultation held today. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said the hike is not good for the industry and must be rolled back.

Title: SBI acquires 9.95% stake in lndia lnternational Exchange (IFSC)
Content: State Bank of India (SBI) today announced the acquisition of a 9.95% stake in India International Exchange (IFSC). In a regulatory filing, SBI said the 9.95% stake in IIE (IFSC) is "to be acquired subject to a maximum investment of ₹34.03 crore". IFSC is the first exchange to be set up at the Gujarat International Fin Tec-City.

Title: Tech Mahindra to buy Allyis India, Green Investments for $125 million
Content: IT services major Tech Mahindra has approved a proposal to acquire 100% stake in Allyis India and Green Investments, a holding company for US-based Allyis Group. The company said it will pay a total consideration of up to $125 million (over ₹900 crore). The acquisition will help bolster business in areas such as cloud and automation engineering, it added.

Title: CMS Info Systems shares debut at 2% premium in last listing of 2021
Content: Shares of cash management company CMS Info Systems listed at a 2% premium over its IPO price of ₹216 per share on Friday. The stock started trading at ₹218.50 on the BSE and at ₹220.20 on the NSE. CMS Info Systems' stock is the last listing of 2021. Its ₹1,100-crore IPO had seen a 1.95 times subscription during December 21-23.

Title: Tesla recalls over 4,75,000 cars in US over risk of accidents
Content: Elon Musk-led Tesla has recalled over 4,75,000 cars in the US to address rearview camera and trunk issues that increase the risk of crashing. Tesla is recalling 3,56,309 Model 3 cars made between 2017-2020 and 1,19,009 Model S cars assembled from 2014. Tesla is not aware of any crashes, injuries or deaths related to the issues with the cars.

Title: Older than the independence of India: Rishad Premji on Wipro's 76th birthday
Content: Wipro's Chairman Rishad Premji tweeted on Wednesday, "It's Wipro's birthday today. We turn 76. Older than the independence of India." He also shared the company's Certificate of Incorporation. Wipro was founded on December 29, 1945, by Rishad Premji's grandfather as 'Western India Vegetable Products Limited' that made cooking oil.

Title: Nick Szabo may be behind idea of Bitcoin, don't know real creator: Musk
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk in a podcast discussing the identity of Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto said computer scientist Nick Szabo is "probably, more than anyone else, responsible for the evolution of those ideas". "He claims not to be Nakamoto, but I'm not sure that's neither here nor there," Musk added. However, he said he doesn't know the creator's identity.

Title: Private cryptos pose immediate risks, prone to frauds: RBI report
Content: The RBI's Financial Stability Report said that private cryptocurrencies pose immediate risks to customer protection. "They are also prone to frauds and to extreme price volatility, given their highly speculative nature," it added. "Longer-term concerns relate to capital flow management, financial and macro-economic stability, monetary policy transmission & currency substitution," the report said.

Title: 3rd largest crypto Binance Coin gains 1,300% in 2021, outperforms Bitcoin, Ether
Content: Binance Coin, the world's third largest cryptocurrency, has outperformed its two larger rivals Bitcoin and Ether this year. The coin by cryptocurrency exchange Binance gained around 1,300% in 2021 as compared to Bitcoin's gain of 65% and Ether's gain of 408%, as per Arcane Research. "We've seen a constant stream of capital trickling down into altcoins," the report said.

Title: Report on $42-billion deal to buy Alzheimer's drug maker Biogen untrue: Samsung
Content: Samsung Group's biotech unit Samsung BioLogics said that the report which claimed it was in talks to buy US drugmaker Biogen in a $42-billion deal was "not true". Shares of Biogen, which makes drugs for neurological conditions like Alzheimer's, had surged 9.5% after the report. The deal would have been the biggest overseas acquisition ever by a South Korean company.

Title: Try to be useful: World's richest person Elon Musk to young people
Content: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk, who appeared on the Lex Fridman Podcast, advised the young people to "try to be useful". He added, "Do things that are useful to your fellow human beings, to the world...It's hard to be useful." Musk also said, "If you're living a useful life, it's a life worth having lived."

Title: Chinese professor's wealth jumps to $4 billion with his AI startup's listing
Content: Chinese professor Tang Xiao'ou has become one of the world's richest people after his artificial intelligence (AI) firm SenseTime's shares surged up to 23% on its Hong Kong debut. His fortune surged to nearly $4 billion after the stock ended the morning session 11% above its IPO price. Earlier, SenseTime was blacklisted by the US over alleged human rights violations.

Title: It wasn't in offer letter: DoorDash engineer making $400,000 on delivering food
Content: An engineer working for America's food delivery platform DoorDash opposed the company requiring every employee to deliver food at least once a month from January. The engineer who reported earning $400,000 a year, wrote, "I didn't sign up for this, there was nothing in the offer letter/job description about this." The employee claimed DoorDash will track deliveries for performance reviews.

Title: Carmaker Citroën accused of normalising sexual harassment in Egypt ad, pulls it down
Content: French carmaker Citroën has withdrawn a commercial in Egypt and apologised for it after social media users accused it of normalising sexual harassment. The video showed 60-year-old singer Amr Diab using his car's camera to photograph a woman crossing the road without her consent. Women's rights activist Reem Abdellatif referred to it as "creepy" and said, "You're enabling sexual harassment."

Title: IndiaPlaza Founder, whose firm ran out of money in 2012, gets patent for new venture
Content: IndiaPlaza Founder K Vaitheeswaran, whose e-commerce company ran out of money in 2012, has received a product patent for Again Drinks, a venture he launched in 2019. He developed milk and yoghurt drinks, which don't contain preservatives, don't require refrigeration and have a 90-day shelf life. "Top FMCG...experts told me it can't be done. That spurred us on," he said.

Title: GST annual return filing deadline for 2020-21 extended till February 28, 2022
Content: The government has extended till February 28 the deadline for businesses to file GST annual returns for 2020-21 fiscal ended March 2021, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs (CBIC) said. The previous deadline was December 31, 2021. Furnishing annual return in Form GSTR-9 is mandatory for registered taxpayers who have an aggregate annual turnover above ₹2 crore.

Title: Follow 'No Vaccine-No Sale' policy in shops: CAIT's appeal to 40,000 trade groups
Content: Confederation of All India Traders' (CAIT) Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal has said that the trade body has issued an appeal to 40,000 trade associations to follow a 'No Vaccine-No Sale' policy in shops. It has also asked trader members to not sell goods to people who aren't wearing masks. This comes amid a rise in Omicron-related COVID-19 cases in India.

Title: Ratan Tata celebrates 84th birthday with cupcake, song from 28-yr-old assistant
Content: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata celebrated his 84th birthday on Tuesday by blowing out candles on a cupcake. A video posted by Vaibhav Bhoir, a manager at Tata Motors Finance, showed Tata's 28-year-old business assistant Shantanu Naidu singing a birthday song for him and feeding him the cupcake. "Simplicity....Nation's pride and inspiration for all," Bhoir wrote on LinkedIn.

Title: RBI extends deadline for periodic KYC update till March 31, 2022
Content: The RBI on Thursday extended the deadline for periodic KYC update from December 31, 2021, to March 31, 2022. The relaxation was provided "in view of the prevalent uncertainty due to the new variant of COVID-19". Regulated Entities have to carry out periodic updation of KYC of existing customers and accounts failing to comply are subject to restrictions on operations.

Title: Bank accidentally sends ₹1,300 crore to 75,000 accounts in UK on Christmas
Content: Spanish-owned bank Santander accidentally transferred £130 million (over ₹1,300 crore) to 75,000 accounts in the UK on Christmas Day. "We're sorry that due to a technical issue, some payments from our corporate clients were incorrectly duplicated on the recipients' accounts," Santander said. It is struggling to recover the money as most of it was deposited in accounts at rival banks.

Title: Which are India's biggest mergers & acquisitions of 2021?
Content: Piramal Group acquired Dewan Housing and Finance for nearly $4.7 billion, while Prosus' PayU announced a deal to acquire BillDesk for $4.7 billion. Adani Green Energy acquired SB Energy India for $3.5 billion, while Tata Group won the bid to acquire national carrier Air India for $2.4 billion. Zee Entertainment said it's merging with Sony Pictures in a $1.5-billion deal.

Title: US-blacklisted AI firm SenseTime shares jump 23% in Hong Kong debut
Content: Chinese artificial intelligence startup SenseTime jumped as much as 23% from their IPO price as they debuted on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. The startup had raised $740 million in its IPO and priced its shares at $0.4937 each. It was earlier blacklisted by the US over allegedly playing a role in human rights abuses against China's Muslim minority groups.

Title: China Evergrande's EV unit starts 1st mass production: Report
Content: China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group started its first mass production on Thursday, Reuters reported citing sources. The mass production of its inaugural Hengchi 5 sport-utility vehicles at its Tianjin production facilities came 12 days ahead of schedule. Earlier in November, the unit had said it's negotiating with potential buyers regarding the disposal of some assets.

Title: Alibaba in talks to sell Weibo stake to China-owned firm: Report
Content: Alibaba Group is in talks with state-owned Shanghai Media Group about a deal involving the sale of its stake in Weibo, Bloomberg reported. Alibaba is exploring options for its roughly 30% stake in the social-media platform. The discussions between Alibaba and Shanghai Media are at an early stage and there is reportedly no certainty they will result in a transaction.

Title: FM holds pre-budget meet, Chhattisgarh demands GST compensation
Content: At the pre-Budget meeting convened by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel demanded GST compensation and reimbursement of expenditure of ₹15,000 crore made by the state for Naxal eradication. "The state's economy has been impacted due to [the] COVID-19 pandemic," Baghel said during the meeting. State finance ministers were also present at the meeting.

Title: ED summons Amazon India VP in forex norms violation case: Report
Content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) issued summons to Amazon India Vice President Manish Tiwary for alleged forex norms violation by the company, Economic Times reported. ED is investigating alleged violation of Foreign Exchange Management Act when Amazon bought a 49% stake in Future Coupons for ₹1,431 crore in 2019. Amazon had recently moved the Delhi HC seeking relief from the probe.

Title: BMW plans to create up to 6,000 new jobs in 2022
Content: German automaker BMW plans to create up to 6,000 new jobs next year to prepare for growing demand for electric vehicles, CEO Oliver Zipse said. BMW is on a "very good path through the transformation" and has its plants prepared for e-mobility, he added. BMW is aiming for at least 50% of global sales to be fully electric by 2030.

Title: India's real GDP in FY2022-23 likely to grow at 9%: ICRA Report
Content: India's real gross domestic product (GDP) is likely to maintain growth at 9% in financial year (FY) 2022-23 amid rising Omicron cases in India, according to a report by ICRA Limited. Fresh curbs being imposed by governments due to rising Omicron cases may temporarily interrupt economic recovery in Q4 of FY2021-22, ICRA Chief Economist Aditi Nayar said in the report.

Title: EPFO aims to achieve 100% e-nomination registration by Feb 2022
Content: The Employees Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is aiming to achieve 100% registrations of e-nominations to PF accounts by February 2022. It underlined that it will be crucial for EPF withdrawals for non-medical purposes. EPFO directed employers and its over 120 offices to ensure e-nomination registrations by subscribers following a government directive, Moneycontrol reported quoting sources.

Title: Kalpataru Power shares jump 6% as it bags orders worth ₹1,560 crore
Content: The shares of Kalpataru Power Transmission surged nearly 6% on December 30 after the company bagged orders worth ₹1,560 crore for power transmission projects from India, Africa, CIS and South America. Its international subsidiary secured new power transmission projects in Europe. The company's MD & CEO Manish Mohnot said that these orders are in their core power T&D business.

Title: RBI approves Rajeev Ahuja's appointment as interim CEO of RBL Bank
Content: The RBI has given approval for the appointment of Rajeev Ahuja as RBL Bank's interim MD and CEO for three months with effect from December 25, 2021 or till the appointment of a regular CEO. Rajeev was appointed as the interim CEO by the board after Vishwavir Ahuja, who led the bank since 2010, went on leave abruptly.

Title: Which non-founders of Indian startups own stock options worth over ₹100 crore?
Content: As per research by Longhouse Consulting, around 35 non-founder executives of Indian startups have stock options worth over ₹100 crore. OYO's Global COO Abhinav Sinha has shareholdings worth ₹1,100-crore, Paytm Labs' CEO Harinder Takhar has ₹413-crore worth of shareholdings. Zomato's Chief Technology Officer Gunjan Patidar, Nykaa's Chief Product Officer Sanjay Suri are also on the list.

Title: Apple puts Foxconn's TN facility on 'probation' days after employees' food poisoning
Content: Apple has said that Foxconn's facility in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur, which makes iPhones, has been put on 'probation', days after hundreds of employees were hospitalised for food poisoning. Apple's decision came after it found that worker dorms at the plant didn't meet required standards. Foxconn said it's restructuring the local management team to achieve and maintain the standards needed.

Title: Chinese professor set to become ultra-rich with IPO of US-blacklisted AI firm
Content: Tang Xiao'ou, Founder of Chinese artificial intelligence start-up SenseTime, is about to become one of the world's richest people after his company lists in Hong Kong this week. The 53-year-old information engineering professor holds 21% stake in SenseTime and is worth $3.4 billion, as per Bloomberg. Earlier, his company was blacklisted by the US over alleged human rights violations.

Title: Lock-in period for anchor investors of IPOs extended to 90 days
Content: Market regulator SEBI has cleared several rules to tighten IPO process, including increasing lock-in period for anchor investors to 90 days for IPOs opening from April 1, 2022. The rule will apply to 50% of allocation to anchor investors, while the remaining portion will have 30-day lock-in period. The move will reportedly stabilise share price and prevent retail investors' losses.

Title: Learned about her for 1st time: Mahindra on India-born CEO of Tinder's parent firm
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared an article about Match Group's India-born CEO Shar Dubey on Twitter and wrote, "This is the first time I've learned about her." He questioned whether Dubey is often not cited in the lists of global Indian-origin CEOs because she leads matchmaking sites like Tinder and OKCupid. "She deserves to be in the spotlight," Mahindra said.

Title: Chinese people call model's 'slanted eye' makeup in Mercedes ad 'offensive'
Content: Mercedes-Benz took down an advertisement from its Weibo account after several Chinese users referred to it as "offensive", state-run Global Times newspaper reported. Users claimed that the makeup of a model featured in the ad looked like "slanted eyes" and said it reflected Western stereotypes about Asian people. Snacks retailer Three Squirrels' ad was also criticised for similar reasons.

Title: DoorDash asks all staff, from engineers to CEO, to deliver food once a month
Content: American food delivery platform DoorDash has asked all employees, from engineers to the CEO, to deliver food at least once a month from January. DoorDash is bringing back 'WeDash', a program started by founders to make every employee experience different parts of the product and donate the money earned by them. "I didn't sign up for this," an engineer complained.

Title: Ford's market value closes above GM's for the 1st time in 5 yrs
Content: Ford's market value closed above General Motors' at $83 billion for the first time in over five years. The last time Ford was valued at more than GM was September 14, 2016, when Ford closed the day with a market cap of $48.2 billion. This year, Ford's shares have more than doubled and have reportedly been trading around a 20-year-high.

Title: Taxpayers given time till February 2022 to verify income tax returns of 2019-20
Content: The Income Tax Department has announced that taxpayers who haven't verified their income tax return (ITR) for assessment year 2020-21 (fiscal 2019-20) can do so till February 2022. Such returns will be processed by June 30, 2022. As per the law, an ITR filed electronically without a digital signature has to be verified within 120 days of filing the return.

Title: Insurer can't refuse claim by citing existing medical condition once policy is issued: SC
Content: An insurer cannot refuse a claim by citing an existing medical condition that was disclosed by the insured once the policy is issued, Supreme Court has said. The court added that a proposer is under a duty to disclose to the insurer all material facts within his knowledge and is presumed to know all the facts concerning the proposed insurance.

Title: Major edible oil brands cut their MRP by 10-15%
Content: Major edible oil brands have reduced their MRP by 10-15% to provide relief to customers, industry body Solvent Extractors' Association of India (SEA) said. The prices were cut after Food Ministry asked companies to act in sync with the reduction in import duties on edible oils. Adani Wilmar, Ruchi Soya, Emami, Gemini and other companies have reduced edible oil prices.

Title: This normalcy is still clouded by uncertainty: Mukesh Ambani
Content: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, "We've been through a lot during the last nearly two years...Of course, now a semblance of normality is slowly returning. But this normalcy is still clouded by uncertainty." He added, "We simply cannot afford to lower the guard." He was addressing Reliance Family Day 2021 to mark the 89th birth anniversary of Dhirubhai Ambani.

Title: Direct selling firms like Tupperware, Amway banned from promoting pyramid schemes
Content: The Centre has banned direct selling companies like Tupperware, Amway, Oriflame and others from promoting pyramid and money circulation schemes as it notified new rules to regulate the industry. As per the order, companies should also specify details of refund, exchange, guarantee and grievance redressal mechanism on their websites. The entities have to comply with the rules within 90 days.

Title: Musk exercises all of his Tesla stock options expiring next year
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has exercised all of the options on 22.8 million shares in Tesla, which are due to expire in August, filings revealed. He has offloaded 15.7 million shares in Tesla, coming close to the 10% stake he has pledged to sell. Out of the 15.7 million shares, 10.3 million were related to the options exercise.

Title: Elon Musk sells $16 bn worth Tesla shares since Twitter poll in Nov
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has sold over $16 billion worth of Tesla shares since his Twitter poll in November about offloading 10% of his stake. He sold another 934,090 shares for $1.02 billion on Tuesday to pay for taxes on the exercise of his stock options, filings showed. Earlier, Musk had said he is "almost done" with the sale.

Title: We would love to see Intel, TSMC, Samsung invest in India: MoS IT
Content: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar told PTI that the government would love to see Intel, TSMC, Samsung, GlobalFoundries, and other semiconductor technology majors invest in India. "It's clear that interest levels in global majors after PM Narendra Modi's announcement of ₹76,000 crore initiative (to boost semiconductor production) is much higher and much more serious today," he added.

Title: Mutual funds must avoid crypto-based investments till there's a law: SEBI
Content: SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi has said that mutual funds should avoid cryptocurrency-related investments till there is a law for such digital assets in the country. During its board meeting on Tuesday, the markets regulator also made it mandatory for mutual fund trustees to take unitholders' consent before winding up any mutual fund scheme.

Title: Make flex-fuel vehicles: Gadkari to automobile manufacturers in India
Content: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari advised automobile manufacturers in India to begin manufacturing BS-VI compliant flex-fuel vehicles and flex-fuel strong hybrid electric vehicles within a period of six months. "[It] will drastically reduce...emissions from vehicles on Well-to-Wheel basis," Gadkari tweeted. This move is in line with PM Modi's vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat, added Gadkari.

Title: Reliance Retail to invest ₹300 cr in robotics firm Addverb: Report
Content: Reliance Retail, the retail arm of Reliance Industries, is likely to acquire a minority stake in warehouse robotics company Addverb Technologies for around ₹300 crore, Mint reported citing people familiar with the matter. If the deal goes through, Addverb will be valued at ₹1,590-1,660 crore, the report said. Noida-based Addverb was founded in 2016 by former executives of Asian Paints.

Title: Bajaj Auto to invest ₹300 cr in new EV manufacturing plant in Pune
Content: Bajaj Auto will be investing ₹300 crore to commence work at its new electric vehicle plant in Pune. This facility will have a production capacity of five lakh EVs per year and will employ nearly 800 people. The first vehicle from the new unit, spread over half-a-million square feet space, is expected to be rolled out by June 2022.

Title: Nonperforming loans fell to 6.9% by end-September 2021: RBI Report
Content: Non-performing loans (NPLs) of India's scheduled commercial banks fell to 6.9% of its total loans by September-end, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said in its "Trends and Progress of Banking" report. Gross NPLs stood at 7.3% in March 2021, the report further noted. Loans are categorised as NPLs when the borrower fails to make scheduled payments to the bank.

Title: Tender, contract info is 'material' in insider trading cases: SAT
Content: The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) said that having information on a company's tender bid being the lowest and that it might win the bid is "material information" in insider trading cases. SAT was hearing an appeal against a SEBI order which fined MD of Deep Industries ₹1.74 crore for purchasing shares while in possession of the company's contract-related information.

Title: ED attaches ₹293-cr assets of Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's ex-chairman
Content: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday said it has seized shares worth ₹293.91 crore belonging to Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's (TMB) former chairman Nesamanimaran Muthu under the FEMA law. According to ED, the shareholdings seized were of four Indian companies, of which three are unlisted entities. The investment was made without RBI's permission and non-disclosure to Indian regulators, ED added.

Title: 4.86 cr income tax returns filed so far, 19 lakh in a single day
Content: Over 4.86 crore income tax returns (ITRs) have been filed so far, including over 18.89 lakh returns filed on December 28, the Income Tax Department informed on Wednesday. The number of ITR-1 returns is over 2.57 crore. The deadline for individual taxpayers to file ITRs is December 31, 2021. The date was extended from original due date of July 31.

Title: Govt's total liabilities rise by ₹4.8 lakh crore in Sept quarter
Content: The government’s total liabilities rose by ₹4.8 lakh crore to ₹125.71 lakh crore in the July-September quarter from ₹120.91 lakh crore in the previous quarter, as per Finance Ministry data. Public debt accounted for 91.15% of total outstanding liabilities in the second quarter. The rise reflects a quarter-on-quarter increase of 3.97% in the July-September period of 2021-22.

Title: 35 non-founders own ₹100 crore worth ESOPs each in Indian startups: Report
Content: As many as 35 non-founder executives of India's recently-listed startups and privately-held technology companies now own stock options worth over ₹100 crore, as per research by Longhouse Consulting. They belong to firms such as Nykaa, Zomato, PolicyBazaar, Paytm, Flipkart, Ola and BYJU'S. Executives in ₹100-crore ESOP club are expected to increase to 100 by end of 2022, Longhouse Consulting said.

Title: 'Intel, welcome to India', says IT Minister as its exec lauds scheme for chipmakers
Content: Intel Foundry Services President Randhir Thakur congratulated the Centre after it announced a ₹76,000-crore incentive scheme for designing and manufacturing of semiconductors in India. "Glad to see a plan laid out for all aspects of the supply chain: talent, design, manufacturing, test, packaging and logistics," he tweeted. IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw responded saying, "Intel - welcome to India."

Title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg buys 110 more acres of land in Hawaii for ₹127 crore
Content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan have purchased 110 more acres of land on the island of Kauai, Hawaii for $17 million (₹127 crore). With this, total land holdings in Hawaii by Zuckerberg have reached nearly 1,500 acres. The purchase includes a century-old reservoir whose dam broke in 2006, leading to a flood that killed seven people.

Title: Lost my mother to COVID 2 days before she was due to get 1st vaccine: Branson
Content: Virgin Group's billionaire Founder Richard Branson revealed in a blog that he lost his mother, Eve Branson, to COVID-19, two days before she was due to get her first dose of vaccine. "She lived well into her nineties and had the most extraordinary life," Branson wrote. He said vaccines are best way to global recovery, not lockdowns or travel bans.

Title: 32-yr-old Pankhuri spoke of challenges of evaluating candidates a day before her death
Content: Entrepreneur Pankhuri Shrivastava, who died due to a cardiac arrest on December 24, had spoken about challenges of evaluating a candidate's potential in a one-hour job interview, a day before her death. In her last social media post, Shrivastava, 32-year-old Founder of women-focused social community platform Pankhuri, said candidates appear to have read the same articles and "know same hacks".

Title: Piyush Jain accepted ₹200 cr related to sales without GST payment: DGGI
Content: The DGGI has said that Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain, who was arrested on charges of tax evasion days after more than ₹200 crore cash was seized from his residence, has accepted that the cash is related to the sale of goods without payment of GST.  The overwhelming evidence indicates large scale evasion of GST by Odochem Industries, the DGGI added.

Title: Anand Mahindra shares video of man with no limbs driving vehicle, offers him job
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Monday tweeted a video of a differently-abled man with no limbs driving a modified vehicle fitted with the engine of a scooty in Delhi. Mahindra wrote, "I'm awestruck by this gentleman who's not just faced his disabilities but is GRATEFUL for what he has. Ram, can @Mahindralog_MLL make him a Business Associate for last mile delivery?"

Title: ₹11cr gold, sandalwood oil worth ₹6cr & more cash found in raids on Piyush Jain
Content: Successive search operations on premises linked to arrested UP perfume industrialist Piyush Jain have revealed ₹17 crore cash and 23 kg gold (worth around ₹11 crore) with foreign markings, the Ministry of Finance said. Huge amount of unaccounted perfume raw materials including 600 kg of sandalwood oil worth ₹6 crore hidden in underground storage, was also found, it added.

Title: Who is Piyush Jain, UP businessman arrested for hoarding over ₹200 crore?
Content: Police arrested UP's Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain for tax evasion after seizing over ₹200 crore unaccounted cash, 23 kg gold and Dubai property papers. Piyush and his brother Ambrish learned to make perfumes and essences from their chemist father. Their business expanded to Mumbai and Gujarat over the last 15 years as they sold perfume components to pan masala manufacturers.

Title: Ex-CEA says his wife received tax refund in 2 days, adds 'such speed unheard of'
Content: Former Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) KV Subramanian shared on Twitter that his wife filed her tax return on Sunday evening for a small amount and got her refund on Tuesday itself. "She called in excitement as she was so pleasantly surprised. Such speed from Government of India unheard of before," he wrote. "Kudos to Finance Ministry, Nirmala Sitharaman," he added.

Title: Which items will get costlier from Jan 1, 2022 due to changes in GST rules?
Content: Apparel, footwear and fabrics including blankets, tents and tablecloths, will get more expensive from January 1, 2022, due to a uniform 12% GST. The GST rate on apparel and footwear costing up to ₹1,000 per piece has been hiked from 5% to 12%. Autorickshaw rides booked via aggregators like Ola and Uber will attract 5% GST from January 1, 2022.

Title: 5G services to be rolled out in 13 Indian cities next year, list released
Content: India's Metro cities are among the first few cities that will get 5G telecom services from next year, the government said on Monday. The services will be rolled out in Gurugram, Bengaluru, Kolkata, Mumbai, Delhi, Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Pune, Chennai, Lucknow, Chandigarh, Jamnagar and Gandhinagar. The government plans to hold spectrum auctions for 5G in March-April 2022.

Title: Piyush Jain sent to 14-day judicial custody after tax raids recover over ₹200 cr
Content: Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain, who was arrested on Sunday, has been sent to 14-day judicial custody after raids at his residence led to the recovery of ₹194.45 crore of cash, 23 kg gold and 600 kg of sandalwood oil. As per the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, this is the biggest cash seizure in their history.

Title: Record ₹2,600 crore in fees collected by Indian bankers steering IPOs in 2021
Content: Indian investment bankers have collected almost ₹2,600 crore ($347 million) in fees from local IPOs in their best year ever, as per Bloomberg. These fees are more than four times the previous record set in 2017. Over 110 companies ranging from food delivery to beauty startups listed their shares in 2021, raising nearly $18 billion (₹1.35 lakh crore).

Title: Tina remembers Dhirubhai Ambani on his birth anniversary, says he was 'magnanimous'
Content: Tina Ambani took to Instagram to share a post remembering her father-in-law Dhirubhai Ambani on his birth anniversary. She wrote, he "wasn't just a revolutionary man but one of the most magnanimous, gentle and generous people". "Pappa gave his time, expertise, patience and learnings to us all, leaving us better...and more in tune with the world around us," she added.

Title: Shares of Thai firm that has mined 8 Bitcoin jumps 7,000% in months
Content: Thai technology company Jasmine Technology's stock has surged nearly 7,000% since it announced its plan to expand into Bitcoin mining in late July, Bloomberg reported. The firm has generated only eight Bitcoins from its 325 mining machines since operations were started a few months ago. The cryptocurrency project is yet to generate significant earnings for the firm.

Title: Withdraw permissions given to Amazon, Flipkart to operate in India: SJM
Content: RSS-affiliated Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) has demanded that all permissions granted to Amazon and Flipkart to operate in India be withdrawn and all their activities be declared illegal. "[They] are blatantly contravening and operating uncontrolled in India...Discounts offered by them are adversely impacting offline markets," SJM said. It further accused Amazon of bribing officials in India.

Title: Shiba Inu becomes most viewed crypto, Bitcoin ranks 2nd: Report
Content: Meme-based cryptocurrency Shiba Inu has emerged as the most viewed cryptocurrency of 2021, cryptocurrency price-tracking website CoinMarketCap reported. The cryptocurrency recorded more than 188 million views during the last 12 months, while Bitcoin came in second with 145 million views in 2021. Dogecoin ranked third among the most viewed cryptocurrencies with 107 million views.

Title: HDFC Bank partners with India Post Payments Bank for rural reach
Content: India Post Payments Bank (IPPB) has signed a memorandum of understanding with HDFC Bank to provide banking services in semi-urban and rural areas, primarily focussing on unbanked and underserved segments. This partnership is reportedly expected to benefit over 4.7 crore IPPB customers, of which 90% reside in rural areas. HDFC aims to strengthen its financial inclusion drive with this partnership.

Title: Rainbow Children's Medicare files draft papers for over ₹2,000 cr IPO
Content: Rainbow Children's Medicare Ltd has filed a draft red herring prospectus with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to raise over ₹2,000 crore via initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will consist of fresh issue of equity shares totalling ₹280 crore and an offer sale of up to 2.4 crore shares by the selling shareholders, the DRHP stated.

Title: India's exports jump 36% to $23.8 bn in first 3 weeks of December
Content: India's exports rose by 36.2% to $23.82 billion between December 1 and 21 this year, according to data released by the Commerce Ministry. During the same period in 2020-21, the value of exports stood at $17.49 billion, the Ministry said. India's overall exports have risen by 37% to $419 billion in  April-November 2021 as against the year-ago period.

Title: ITC commissions ₹76-cr solar plant in Tamil Nadu to cut carbon footprint
Content: Multi-business company ITC has commissioned its first offsite solar plant in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul, built with an investment of ₹76 crore. The 14.9 MW solar plant will generate over 22 million units of renewable energy annually and help reduce ITC's carbon footprint. It will meet 90% of ITC's power needs in Tamil Nadu from renewable sources, the company said.

Title: Medanta owner Global Health gets SEBI's approval for IPO
Content: Global Health Private Limited, which operates hospitals under the Medanta brand, has received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO). As per the draft papers, Global Health's IPO consists of a fresh issue of ₹500 crore and an offer-for-sale of 4.84 crore shares. The proceeds will be used to pay debt and for general corporate purposes.

Title: CAIT urges FM to defer implementation of 12% GST on textiles
Content: Indian traders' body CAIT has urged Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to defer the implementation of GST hike on textiles and footwear from 5% to 12% from January 1, 2022. "It is illogical and beyond the canon of GST tax structure," CAIT said. It also requested that a task force be formed under the Chairmanship of CBIC's Chairman to bring consensus.

Title: 4 employees of Titan, Mindtree fined ₹1 lakh each by SEBI
Content: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has imposed a monetary fine of ₹1 lakh each on two employees of Mindtree, for disclosure lapses, in violation of insider trading norms. Mindtree had informed SEBI regarding instances of violation of code of conduct framed by the company. SEBI also fined two Titan employees ₹1 lakh each for failing to make disclosures.

Title: Supriya Lifescience debuts with 55% premium over issue price
Content: Pharma company Supriya Lifescience made a strong market debut on Tuesday, listing at a premium of 55.1% over the issue price of ₹274 per share. The stock opened at ₹425 on the BSE, while the opening price on the NSE was ₹421. The ₹700-crore IPO of the Mumbai-based company was subscribed 71.51 times from December 16 to 20.

Title: Air India handover to Tata Group to be delayed by a month: Report
Content: The government's plan to handover Air India to the Tata Group is most likely to be delayed by a month, PTI reported citing an official. Some regulatory approvals and certain formalities are yet to be completed, the report said, adding that the process is likely to be completed by January. Recently, the CCI approved Tata Group's acquisition of Air India.

Title: We need a booster policy, don't know what's holding it up: Mazumdar-Shaw
Content: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw told Bloomberg, "We need a booster policy for sure...I really don't know what's holding it up, it's got nothing to do with vaccine availability." She said that three weeks ago, 12 people in her household, including her husband, tested positive for COVID-19. However, since they were fully inoculated, they had only mild symptoms, she added.

Title: Pankhuri and Grabhouse founder Pankhuri Shrivastava passes away aged 32
Content: Pankhuri Shrivastava, founder of a women-focussed social community platform called Pankhuri, passed away at the age of 32. She had also founded rental startup Grabhouse, which was sold to online classifieds company Quikr in a cash and equity deal in 2016. "Her demise is a loss for our startup ecosystem," Vani Kola, founder of Kalaari Capital, tweeted.

Title: Nexus Venture Partners co-founder Naren Gupta passes away aged 73
Content: Nexus Venture Partners co-founder Naren Gupta passed away aged 73 on Saturday, the venture capital firm said in a statement on Sunday. The IIT and Stanford University alumnus founded Nexus Venture Partners along with Suvir Sujan and Sandeep Singhal in 2006 and had been actively investing in Indian startups for last 15 years. He was based in Menlo Park, California.

Title: India imposes anti-dumping duty on 5 Chinese goods for 5 years
Content: India has imposed anti-dumping duty on five Chinese goods for five years. The duties have been imposed on certain flat-rolled products of aluminium, sodium hydrosulphite, silicone sealant, hydrofluorocarbon (HFC) component R-32 and hydrofluorocarbon blends. Probes concluded that the products have been exported at a price below normal value in Indian markets, which has resulted in dumping.

Title: For the first time ever, world economy will top $100 trillion in 2022: Report
Content: The world's economic output will exceed $100 trillion for the first time next year, according to British consultancy Cebr. India is set to overtake France next year and Britain in 2023 to regain its place as the world's sixth biggest economy, Cebr said. Further, Cebr predicted that China will become the world's top economy in dollar terms in 2030.

Title: Winning Air India bid most important milestone of 2021: Tata Sons Chairman
Content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran in a letter to his employees said, "Our most important milestone this year culminated in our bid to win Air India. It is indeed a historic moment." Noting that second wave of COVID-19 was "a very difficult period", he said, "We rose to the challenge and showed the courage and selflessness in the Tata spirit."

Title: Mahindra shares pics of Archbishop Tutu wearing 'Bandi' for his love for India
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share pictures of Archbishop Desmond Tutu from 2013, where he's seen wearing a 'Bandi' to show his affection for India. "Archbishop Desmond Tutu passed away today...A Titan...We won't forget him," wrote Mahindra. Archbishop Tutu, the Nobel Peace Prize laureate who helped end apartheid in South Africa, has passed away aged 90.

Title: ₹1,000 crore worth of Nirav's properties to be auctioned to recover PNB's dues
Content: The Enforcement Directorate has de-attached properties worth around ₹1,000 crore belonging to PNB scam accused fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi. They will be auctioned to recover the bank's pending dues. These properties include the building that housed music store Rhythm House at Kala Ghoda, a flat at Nepean Sea Road in Mumbai and some jewellery, among others.

Title: Impose lockdown after consulting trade bodies, we suffer most: CAIT
Content: Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) on Saturday said that the Centre and state governments should impose lockdowns only after consulting the trade bodies. Taking to Twitter, CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said, ''No lockdown. It will kill the trade which is on recovering mode.'' He added that the trade bodies are the biggest sufferers during lockdown.

Title: Japan to pay companies to keep sensitive patents secret: Reports
Content: Japan will compensate companies to maintain the secrecy of patents with potential military applications under its proposed economic security legislation, the Nikkei reported on Sunday. This will include patents concerning the development of nuclear weapons and innovations like quantum tech, Nikkei said. PM Kishida pledged last month that he will make economic security a priority.

Title: iPhone maker Foxconn asked to improve working conditions by TN govt
Content: Tamil Nadu government has asked Foxconn to come up with a slew of measures to improve the working conditions of its employees. Several employees had protested after more than 100 employees, who work at the factory that makes Apple's iPhones, were hospitalised due to food poisoning. Foxconn has assured it will urge contractors to provide quality food for all employees.

Title: iPhone maker Foxconn's TN plant to be shut for 3 more days: Report
Content: A Foxconn factory in Tamil Nadu which manufactures Apple's iPhone 12 models has extended its week-long closure by an extra three days, reported Reuters. The state government reportedly conducted inspections of workers' hostels after over 150 Foxconn employees were hospitalised for food poisoning. The factory is now expected to resume production with 1,000 workers on December 30, the report said.

Title: I think of Amazon as a worthy rival: Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke
Content: E-commerce company Shopify's CEO Tobi Lütke told Bloomberg in an interview, "I think of Amazon as a worthy rival." He added, "If they knock it out of the park and make it super easy to start new businesses on it, then I actually accomplished my mission." Lütke, who co-founded Shopify in 2006, said he's willing to be the underdog again.

Title: Shamefully low blow: Musk as WSJ says he's living in PayPal exec's mansion
Content: After The Wall Street Journal reported that the world's richest person Elon Musk has been staying at a $12-million mansion owned by PayPal Co-founder Ken Howery in Texas, Musk said "it was a shamefully low blow from" the publication. "Elon doesn't live at my home...He stayed at the house as my guest occasionally when traveling to Austin," Howery told WSJ.

Title: SoftBank faces legal action from Credit Suisse over Greensill debt
Content: Credit Suisse has launched a legal action against SoftBank to recover funds it says are owed to its Greensill-linked supply chain finance funds. The lawsuit relates to $440m in funds that were owed to Credit Sussie's customers by Softbank-backed Katerra, which filed for bankruptcy in June. Katerra had estimated liabilities of $1 billion-$10 billion and assets of $500 million-$1 billion.

Title: Paytm Lending CEO Bhavesh Gupta to lead offline payments vertical
Content: Paytm on Friday announced that it has elevated Bhavesh Gupta, CEO of Paytm Lending, to take on the leadership for the offline payments vertical in addition to his existing responsibilities. Before joining Paytm, Bhavesh had over 22 years of experience in the financial sector. The firm also plans to hire 30 senior leaders for product, technology and business roles.

Title: IRDAI has no data on insurance coverage of MSMEs: Finance Ministry
Content: Replying to a Rajya Sabha question, MoS for Finance Bhagwat Karad said that the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) does not have data on MSMEs covered by insurance in India. The IRDAI had revised guidelines for trade credit insurance from November 1. It aimed to promote insurance policies with customised cover to improve business for MSMEs.

Title: I started deleting recurring meetings on employees' calendars: Shopify CEO
Content: Shopify Co-founder and CEO Tobi Lütke told Bloomberg he started periodically exploiting the "god mode" on his employees' calendars and deleting regularly recurring meetings. "Nothing can become truly resilient when everything goes right," he added. In 2017, he sent his employees home to work virtually for a month as an experiment. "The tools were terrible," he said of the experience.

Title: RBL Bank stable, well capitalised: RBI assures depositors as shares plunge
Content: The Reserve Bank of India on Monday said that RBL Bank depositors and investors need not worry about the bank's health after the latter's shares plunged 25% in the first half today. In a statement, RBI said that the bank is "well capitalised" and its "financial health remains stable". It also asked depositors to not react to the speculative reports.

Title: Govt puts stock limits on soya meal till June 2022 to control prices
Content: The Centre has imposed stock holding limits on soya meal till June 30, 2022 to check price rise and stop hoarding and black marketing. Under this, soya meal processors, millers and plant owners can hold a maximum stock of 90 days production. Meanwhile, government-registered traders and private chaupals can hold a maximum of 160 tonne in a declared storage location.

Title: Campus Activewear files DRHP with SEBI for IPO
Content: Footwear brand Campus Activewear has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to garner funds via an initial public offering. Promoters Hari Krishan Agarwal and Nikhil Aggarwal will cumulatively sell 1.4 crore equity shares of the total 5.1 crore shares which will be put up for sale by promoters and investors.

Title: RBL Bank's MD & CEO to proceed on leave with immediate effect
Content: Private lender RBL Bank's board has approved the request of its MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja to "proceed on leave with immediate effect". Current Executive Director Rajeev Ahuja has been named interim MD & CEO with immediate effect, the board said. Vishwavir, who had been leading RBL since 2010, was MD & CEO of Bank of America, India from 2001-2009.

Title: HP Adhesives shares list at a 16% premium on market debut
Content: The shares of HP Adhesives listed at ₹319 on BSE on their market debut on Monday, a premium of 16% over the issue price of ₹274 apiece. After the debut, the company's market capitalisation stood at more than ₹615 crore.
