HP Adhesives raised ₹126 crore through its IPO and the offer was oversubscribed 20.96 times by investors between December 15-17.

Title: Centre begins consultation on national database on cooperatives
Content: The Centre has started consultation with various stakeholders on setting up of a national database on cooperatives, aiming for convergence of various central and state government schemes. "This will be the most important policy-making tool in the cooperative sector," a senior Cooperation Ministry official told PTI. Currently, there is no authentic data repository of cooperatives in the country.

Title: India's forex reserves drop by $160 million to $635.66 billion
Content: India's foreign exchange reserves dropped by $160 million to $635.66 billion during the week ended December 17, due to a sharp drop in foreign currency assets (FCAs), according to data released by the RBI. The FCAs, a major component of the overall reserves, fell by $645 million to $572.21 billion. Further, gold reserves rose by $475 million to $39.18 billion.

Title: NCLAT stays CCI order imposing ₹873 cr fine on UBL, other beer makers
Content: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has imposed a stay on the orders passed by the CCI imposing penalties on several beer makers, including United Breweries Limited (UBL). In September, the CCI had imposed penalties totalling over ₹873 crore on UBL, Carlsberg India, All India Brewers' Association and others for cartelisation in the sale and supply of beer.

Title: Leading travel distribution platform TBO.com files draft papers for ₹2,100 cr IPO
Content: Leading global travel distribution platform TBO.com filed a draft red herring prospectus with the SEBI to raise as much as ₹2,100 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). TBO serves over 100,000 travel buyers in more than 110 countries. TBO.com was founded in 2006 by Gaurav Bhatnagar and Ankush Nijhawan.

Title: Poonawalla shares meme video showing boy in Home Alone fighting 'Omicron' with booster
Content: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla shared a meme video showing a booster shot defeating Omicron. The video showed the boy from 'Home Alone' movie fighting two thieves marked as 'Delta' and 'Omicron' with buckets marked as 'vaccine' and 'booster'. "What's going on here!?" Poonawalla wrote while sharing the clip created by Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.

Title: 160 IIT students get ₹1-crore salary package in 1st phase of campus hiring: Report
Content: India's top eight IITs attracted nearly 9,000 jobs for their students, including at least 160 offers with a ₹1-crore salary package each in the first phase of campus placement, Moneycontrol reported. The average salary hike at the older campuses this year has reportedly been in the range of 15%-35% so far. At IIT-Bombay, a record 1,382 offers have been accepted.

Title: 63 Indian IPOs raise ₹1.19 lakh crore in 2021, break previous record
Content: Sixty three Indian corporates raised nearly ₹1.19 lakh crore in funds through main board IPOs in 2021, surpassing the 2017 record. The amount is 4.5 times the ₹26,613 crore raised through 15 IPOs in 2020, according to PRIME Database Group data. The largest IPO in 2021, which was also the largest Indian IPO ever, was from Paytm for ₹18,300 crore.

Title: Indian engineer tweets Tesla neared bankruptcy on Christmas Eve 2008; Musk responds
Content: Pranay Pathole, a 23-year-old Pune-based engineer, wrote on Twitter, "On Christmas Eve 2008, Tesla funding round completed, Tesla was literally a few days from bankruptcy." "Elon Musk had to put in all his money and assets," he added. Musk responded saying, "That was a crazy tough year. Tesla financing closed at 6pm Christmas Eve – last hour of...last day possible."

Title: That's why I'm pro Doge: Musk as Dogecoin creator says Bitcoin 'gives power to rich'
Content: Amid a discussion on Web3 on Twitter, meme-based cryptocurrency Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus wrote, "Bitcoin just gives power to new rich people." Responding to this, world's richest person Elon Musk said, "That's why I'm pro Doge." Block CEO and former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey wrote, "No one rich individual or institution has any more power over Bitcoin than anyone else."

Title: My Wiki's a dumpster fire: Musk as report says his page was 3rd most-popular in 2021
Content: After a report said Elon Musk's page was the third-most popular on Wikipedia in 2021, the world's richest person tweeted, "My Wiki is such a dumpster fire. That's how you know it isn't curated." "History is written by...victors, except on Wikipedia, as your enemies are still alive and have lots of time on their hands," the Tesla CEO added.

Title: If you could die by irony, she'd be dead: Musk after Warren calls him a 'freeloader'
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk in an interview criticised US Senator Elizabeth Warren for calling him a "freeloader and a grifter who doesn't pay taxes". "If you could die by irony, she'd be dead," he said. "I'm literally paying the most tax than any individual in history...and her salary is paid for by the taxpayer like me," Musk added.

Title: Which are India's 10 biggest IPOs of 2021?
Content: Paytm's ₹18,300-crore IPO is India's largest ever public issue in terms of size. The second-largest IPO of this year was by Zomato, which raised ₹9,375 crore. It's followed by PowerGrid InvIT's ₹7,735-crore IPO and Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health and Allied Insurance's ₹7,249-crore IPO. Policybazaar raised ₹5,625 crore, Sona Comstar raised ₹5,550 crore, while Nykaa raised ₹5,352 crore.

Title: Govt asks phone firms to keep call records for 2 yrs for security reasons
Content: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has asked telecom and internet service providers to maintain commercial and call detail records for at least two years, instead of the current one-year practice, for security reasons. "Many security agencies pointed out...that they needed data even after a year since most investigations take more than that to be completed," a senior DoT official said.

Title: I-T raids on businessman who launched Samajwadi Party perfume reportedly unearth ₹150 cr
Content: Cash worth at least ₹150 crore has reportedly been detected during Income Tax raids on multiple premises linked to Kanpur perfume trader Piyush Jain so far. Pictures purportedly showed officials sitting on the floor and using note-counting machines. In November, Jain had launched a perfume for Samajwadi Party called 'Samajwadi Attar' in light of the upcoming Uttar Pradesh elections.

Title: Which are India's 5 most valuable state-controlled companies of 2021 as per Hurun?
Content: According to 2021 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 list, State Bank of India with a value of ₹4.65 lakh crore is India's most valuable state-controlled company of 2021. This is followed by Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (₹1.92 lakh crore), NTPC (₹1.32 lakh crore), Power Grid Corporation of India (₹1.29 lakh crore) and Indian Oil Corporation (₹1.23 lakh crore).

Title: Data Patterns shares list at 48% premium on market debut
Content: Shares of Data Patterns India made a strong market debut on Friday, listing at ₹864 apiece on the BSE. The stock listed with a premium of around 48% as against its IPO price of ₹585 per share. The ₹588-crore IPO of defence and aerospace electronics solutions provider was oversubscribed by 120 times, with non-institutional investors' portion getting subscribed 254 times.

Title: HSBC AMC to acquire L&T's investment management unit for ₹3,193 cr
Content: HSBC Holdings' asset management arm has signed an agreement to fully acquire L&T Investment Management, a wholly-owned subsidiary of L&T Finance Holdings, for $425 million (₹3,193 crore). The proposed acquisition will be funded from existing resources, HSBC said. LTIM had assets under management of $10.8 billion (₹80,300 crore) and over 2.4 million active folios as of September, it added.

Title: Deadline for tokenisation of credit, debit cards extended to June 30, 2022
Content: RBI on Thursday extended deadline for card tokenisation to June 30, 2022. "In addition to tokenisation, industry stakeholders may devise alternate mechanisms to handle...recurring e-mandates and EMI option, or post-transaction activity that currently involves/requires storage of CoF data by entities other than card issuers and card networks," said RBI. The earlier deadline was December 31, 2021.

Title: ₹1 crore fine each imposed by RBI on One Mobikwik Systems, Spice Money
Content: RBI has imposed monetary penalty on two payment system operators, One Mobikwik Systems Private Limited and Spice Money Limited, for violation of norms. They've been fined ₹1 crore each. "These actions are based on deficiencies in regulatory compliance and are not intended to pronounce upon...validity of any transaction or agreement entered into by the entities with...customers," said RBI.

Title: Thanks to tech, we can look towards a healthier 2022: Mazumdar-Shaw
Content: Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw while discussing COVID-19 and its part in digitising several sectors said, "Thanks to technology, we can look towards a healthier...2022." She said the use of digital technology in healthcare will make it accessible to economically-disadvantaged individuals. She added e-pharmacies could help eliminate inadequacies in drugs' last mile delivery.

Title: Chinese users claim Walmart's not selling Xinjiang items at grocery chain
Content: Chinese social media users criticised Walmart on Friday for allegedly stopping the sale of items from Xinjiang at its members-only grocery chain Sam's Club in China. Users posted screenshots of no search results for the word "Xinjiang" on Sam's Club's app on Weibo. This comes after US framed a law banning goods made from the province.

Title: Bitcoin price rises to $51,000, hits highest in over 2 weeks
Content: Bitcoin price rose to about $51,000 on Friday, touching the highest level in more than two weeks. Bitcoin has jumped some 4% over the past two days and at one point reached $51,524 on Friday in Asian trading. Ether, the coin linked to Ethereum blockchain and the second largest cryptocurrency, also surged over 4% to $4,114.

Title: Hero MotoCorp to hike prices of 2-wheelers by up to ₹2,000 from Jan
Content: Hero MotoCorp will increase the prices of its motorcycles and scooters with effect from January 4, 2022. The ex-showroom prices will be increased by up to ₹2,000 and the exact quantum of increase will depend on the model and the market. "The price revision has been necessitated to partially offset the impact of steadily increasing commodity prices," the company said.

Title: Centre working to bring changes in GST Act: BJP's Jayant Sinha
Content: BJP leader and Chairman of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance Jayant Sinha said that the government is working to bring changes in the GST Act and other public platforms. He said that GST is fast becoming the backbone of the country. The changes, Sinha said, will aim to aid companies utilise data to grow big in size and scale.

Title: Omicron may cast shadow on recovering Indian economy: RBI Governor
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that the Indian economy is facing severe headwinds due to global factors emanating from Omicron's spread, according to the minutes of the Monetary Policy Committee meeting. "Supply disruptions, other bottlenecks...gained additional shelf life stretching into 2022," Das said and added, "Omicron may cast some shadow on services that were showing signs of recovery."

Title: No confidence in govt's understanding of crypto: Former Finance Secretary
Content: Former Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg said that he has no confidence in the government's ability of understanding complexities of cryptocurrency. He said this after the government failed to table the Cryptocurrency and Regulation of Official Digital Currency Bill in the Parliament. "I am not surprised to see...zero clarity over what is the Bill," Garg told IANS.

Title: Railways earns over ₹100 crore from 5 passenger trains in 8 months
Content: The West Central Railway zone collected an amount of ₹100.03 crore from five passenger train services in eight months, it said. Among the five passenger trains, Jabalpur–Nizamuddin Gondwana Express earned ₹21.32 crore, Rewa–Anand Vihar Express earned ₹20.52 crore and Jabalpur–Howrah Shaktipunj Express made ₹19.93 crore. Meanwhile, Jabalpur–Durg Amarkantak Express earned ₹19.59 crore.

Title: Economic bullying: China on US ban on imports from Xinjiang region
Content: China's commerce ministry has expressed "strong dissatisfaction and firm opposition" to a US ban on imports from Xinjiang region. The ministry has termed the action by the US as "economic bullying", reported state news agency Xinhua on Friday. US President Joe Biden has signed into law a legislation that bans imports from China's Xinjiang region over concerns about forced labour.

Title: Crocs to acquire footwear brand Hey Dude for $2.5 billion
Content: Crocs said on Thursday that it will acquire privately-owned footwear label Hey Dude for $2.5 billion. Of this, it will pay $2.05 billion in cash, while the remaining $450 million will be issued as Crocs shares to Hey Dude Founder and CEO Alessandro Rosano. Crocs CEO Andrew Rees said that the acquisition of the Italian-origin company will be "highly profitable".

Title: Data Patterns shares end 28.3% higher over IPO price on market debut
Content: Data Patterns' shares closed at ₹750.50 on the first day of trading at the stock exchanges on Friday, 28.3% higher than its IPO price of ₹585. The defense and aerospace electronics solutions provider's stock listed at ₹856.05 on the NSE and reached an intraday high of ₹864. Data Patterns' ₹588-crore IPO was among top 15 most subscribed IPOs of 2021.

Title: India's monetary policy financially inclusive by design: RBI Deputy Guv
Content: RBI's Deputy Governor Michael D Patra on Friday said that India's monetary policy is financially inclusive by design. This strategy will result in policy effectiveness and welfare maximisation going ahead, he added. "Financial inclusion appears to have gone up, with the level of the RBI's financial inclusion index rising from 49.9 in March 2019 to...53.9 in March 2021," Patra said.

Title: Bitcoin jumps most in a day since November, climbs back above $49,000
Content: Bitcoin climbed back above $49,000 in New York trading on Tuesday, marking its biggest single-day gain since November. The world's largest cryptocurrency rose as much as 5% to $49,331, before paring some of its gains. Bitcoin had slumped about 30% over the past five weeks after hitting a record high of nearly $69,000 in early November.

Title: US millionaire's friends file sticky notes to claim share in $500 mn estate: Report
Content: American online clothing retailer Zappos' late millionaire Founder Tony Hsieh's friends have filed sticky notes as evidence in court to stake claim in his $500 million estate, reported WSJ. Hsieh died in November last year from injuries sustained in a house fire in Connecticut. The 46-year-old, who struggled with alcohol and drug use and mental-health issues, didn't leave a will.

Title: Foxconn's India arm & Xiaomi phone maker Bharat FIH files for ₹5,000-crore IPO
Content: Bharat FIH, the India unit of Foxconn and Hong Kong-listed FIH Mobile, has filed draft papers for an IPO to raise over ₹5,000 crore. The IPO comprises fresh issue of up to ₹2,502 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹2,502 crore. Electronic manufacturing services provider Bharat FIH manufactures and assembles Xiaomi mobile phones in India.

Title: Elon Musk sells $15 bn worth Tesla shares since Twitter poll, says 'almost done'
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has sold over $15 billion worth of Tesla shares since early November when he polled Twitter users about offloading 10% of his stake. "There are still a few tranches left, but almost done," Musk tweeted. Musk exercised stock options that expire next year and sold a portion of stocks to pay taxes, Tesla filings said.

Title: Elon Musk denies report he's living in a $12 mn mansion owned by PayPal co-founder
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has denied the WSJ's report which claimed that he's been staying in a $12-million mansion, owned by PayPal Co-founder Ken Howery, in Texas for about a year. "I don't live there and am not looking to buy a house anywhere," he told Insider. Earlier, Musk said he was living in a $50,000 house on rent.

Title: Amazon terms ED's probe into 2019 deal as 'fishing, roving', moves Delhi HC: Report
Content: Amazon has reportedly filed a petition in the Delhi High Court, seeking relief from ED's probe into its 2019 deal with Future Group. Amazon accused ED of conducting a "fishing and roving enquiry" against it, Reuters reported citing a court filing. It also said multiple executives had been summoned by the ED in recent weeks, which amounts to "unnecessary harassment".

Title: Who are Rakesh and Rashmi Verma, the husband-wife duo behind MapmyIndia?
Content: The husband-wife duo behind recently-listed MapmyIndia is 71-year-old Rakesh and 65-year-old Rashmi Verma. BITS Pilani passout Rakesh and IIT Roorkee passout Rashmi, studied at the Eastern Washington University and quit their 12-year career in the US to return to India in the 1990s. They began MapmyIndia as CE Info Systems in 1995 and are now worth $586 million after IPO.

Title: I admire ingenuity of people: Mahindra on man who built 4-wheeler with ₹60,000
Content: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared a video of a man in Maharashtra who spent ₹60,000 and built a jeep-like four-wheeler, that runs on the kick-start mechanism seen in two-wheelers, using scrap metal. "This clearly doesn't meet with any...regulations but I'll never cease to admire the ingenuity and 'more with less' capabilities of our people," Mahindra wrote on Twitter.

Title: Snapdeal's IPO papers reveal salaries of co-founders, other officials
Content: Snapdeal's draft IPO papers revealed that Co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, who were appointed as Executive Directors this year, will receive ₹5 crore salary each in 2021-22. Both of them earned ₹3.5 crore in 2020-21, while CFO Vikas Bhasin received ₹3.1-crore compensation. Each independent director earns ₹1,00,000 sitting fee per meeting and will earn ₹24 lakh annually till 2024.

Title: IT Dept raids offices of Chinese mobile firms OPPO, OnePlus, others in India: Report
Content: The Income Tax Department is conducting searches on leading Chinese mobile companies across the country, said reports. Mobile companies OPPO, Xiaomi, and OnePlus are being covered in the searches, according to ANI. Over two dozen premises are being raided in the searches. The searches were reportedly conducted based on the intelligence inputs of huge tax evasion by these firms.

Title: Zee Entertainment, Sony India sign merger agreement; Punit Goenka to be CEO
Content: Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI) and Zee Entertainment Enterprises on Wednesday announced the signing of definitive agreements to merge the two companies. As per the deal, Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) will indirectly hold 50.86% stake in the merged entity, ZEEL founders will hold 3.99% and public shareholders will hold 45.15%. Punit Goenka will be the MD and CEO of entity.

Title: McDonald's halts sale of large French fries in Japan amid potato supply crunch
Content: McDonald's Japan has said that it will suspend selling medium and large-sized French fries for a week starting Friday as COVID-19-led supply chain issues and floods in Canada delay potato shipments. The fast-food company will continue to sell small-sized French fries in Japan. The potatoes used for the French fries are imported from North America, it said.

Title: Expect a dozen chipmakers to begin local production in 2-3 yrs: Govt
Content: Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in an interview with BloombergTV said at least a dozen semiconductor manufacturers are expected to start local production in the next two to three years. He revealed that all the big players in the industry are in talks with Indian partners and many want to come directly to set up their units in India.

Title: Tesla rival Nikola to pay $125 mn over Founder's misleading statements
Content: Tesla rival Nikola has agreed to pay $125 million to US SEC over allegedly misleading statements made by its Founder and former CEO Trevor Milton to investors about the electric-vehicle startup. "Nikola is responsible both for Milton's allegedly misleading statements and for other alleged deceptions, all of which falsely portrayed the true state of the company," SEC's enforcement director said.

Title: Musk's SpaceX reports 132 COVID-19 cases at California headquarters
Content: Billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX has had an outbreak of 132 coronavirus cases at its headquarters in Hawthorne, California, as per the Los Angeles County Health Department. The outbreak is the largest among businesses in Los Angeles County. Last year, Musk had defied COVID-19 restrictions imposed by the local authorities and resumed operations at his Tesla factory in Alameda County, California.

Title: Amazon seeks CCI's nod to buy Catamaran's stake in Prione: Report
Content: Amazon is seeking CCI's approval to buy Catamaran Ventures' stake in Prione, TechCrunch reported. Catamaran owns 76% stake in Prione, while Amazon earlier held 49%, but diluted it down to 24% to comply with the local laws. Catamaran and Amazon had launched the joint venture in India in 2014. However, in August they announced they will be ending the partnership.

Title: McDonald's to sell AI startup Dynamic Yield to Mastercard
Content: McDonald's on Tuesday announced that it has signed an agreement to sell Dynamic Yield, an artificial intelligence (AI) startup, to Mastercard for an undisclosed amount. McDonald's had acquired the startup in 2019 for more than $300 million in its biggest deal in two decades. Dynamic Yield's technology is used to personalise menus and browsing options online and at physical stores.

Title: Adar Poonawalla acquires a 20% stake in JetSynthesys' Wakau
Content: Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla has acquired a 20% stake in Wakau Interactive, a subsidiary of digital entertainment and technology company JetSynthesys, for an undisclosed amount. Poonawalla joins Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan as one of Wakau's investors. "New content formats like short entertainment and fashion videos are gaining wide-scale popularity," Poonawalla said.

Title: India added 1.3 GW of rooftop solar installations from Jan-Sept: Report
Content: According to the Mercom India Rooftop Solar Market Report Q3 2021, India added 1.3 gigawatt (GW) of rooftop solar installations (RSI) between January and September 2021. This marks a 202% year-on-year (YoY) increase. Additionally, between July and September, India added 448 megawatt of RSI, a 189% YoY increase. "Market [is]...showing signs of recovery," said Raj Prabhu, CEO, Mercom Capital Group.

Title: CIA seeks GST exemption, fresh NPA norms for MSMEs in Budget 2022
Content: The Consortium of Indian Associations (CIA) has sought in Budget 2022 that MSMEs with a turnover of up to ₹5 crore be exempted from GST for 12 months. CIA also recommended that non-performing assets (NPAs) be considered for MSMEs 120 days after missing an EMI and that raw material ration-cum-fair price shops be established to tackle inflating raw material costs.

Title: UK offers £1 billion to hospitality businesses affected by Omicron
Content: The UK announced on Tuesday it will offer £1 billion in grants to the hospitality industry hit by the spread of the Omicron variant of COVID-19, after pressure from several business groups. Businesses in the hospitality industry will be eligible for one-time grants up to £6,000 each (over ₹6,00,000). New COVID-19 infections spiked by 60% in a week.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' shares list at 12.8% discount
Content: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' shares listed at a 12.8% discount to the issue price today. The stock opened at ₹436 on the BSE against the final offer price of ₹500 per share, while the listing price on the NSE was ₹437. The three-day ₹1,367.5 crore IPO of Metro Brands was subscribed 3.64 times on the last day of bidding.

Title: Kotak Mahindra acquires Ford Credit India's vehicle finance portfolio
Content: Kotak Mahindra Prime Limited (KMPL) today said it has acquired Ford Credit India's vehicle financing portfolio. KMPL said in an exchange filing that the deal is expected to give it access to 16,000 "high-quality" customers with total loan outstanding of ₹425 crore. "The acquisition...reiterates our commitment to grow our vehicle financing business," Vyomesh Kapasi, MD, KMPL, said in the filing.

Title: MedPlus Health's shares list at 30% premium over issue price
Content: Shares of pharmacy retailer MedPlus Health listed at ₹1,040 per share on the NSE, a premium of over 30% as compared to its IPO issue price of ₹796 apiece. The shares started the trade on its first day at ₹1,015 on the BSE. MedPlus had fixed the price band for its ₹1,398.29-crore IPO at ₹780-₹796 per share.

Title: YES Bank's board approves plan to raise up to ₹10,000 crore
Content: YES Bank has received its board's approval to raise up to ₹10,000 crore, the private lender informed the exchanges in a regulatory filing on Tuesday. The board has approved raising of funds by issue of equity shares, depository receipts, convertible bonds, debentures, warrants, or any other equity-linked securities. The bank said it will now seek approval from its shareholders.

Title: ED probing Supertech after money laundering complaints: MoS Finance
Content: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has initiated an investigation against Supertech, its directors, promoters, and others. The probe is based upon several FIRs, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002, he told the Rajya Sabha. It concerns entire Supertech Group and isn't limited to any particular residential project, he added.

Title: Our booster dose appears to protect against Omicron: Moderna after initial study
Content: Moderna has said that initial lab tests showed that a booster dose of its COVID-19 vaccine appeared to protect against the new Omicron variant. A 50-microgram booster dose increased neutralising antibodies against the variant 37 fold, the company said. It added that a 100-microgram booster drove neutralising antibodies to more than 80 times pre-boost levels.

Title: Cardi B asks if crypto will replace US dollar, Jack Dorsey replies 'Bitcoin will'
Content: After American rapper Cardi B asked on Twitter whether cryptocurrency is going to replace the US dollar, Twitter's Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey replied, "Yes, Bitcoin will." Dorsey, who stepped down as Twitter CEO last month, had earlier said, "Bitcoin changes absolutely everything...If [Bitcoin] needed more help than Square (now, Block) or Twitter, I would leave them for Bitcoin."

Title: MapmyIndia shares list at a 53% premium on market debut
Content: The shares of CE Info Systems, the parent company of digital mapping company MapmyIndia, were listed at a 53% premium on their market debut on Tuesday. The stock made its debut at ₹1,581, a gain of 53.04% from the issue price of ₹1,033 on the BSE. MapmyIndia IPO was subscribed 154.71 times on the last day of subscription last week.

Title: Elon Musk's Tesla loses all gains made since Hertz announced 1,00,000 cars order
Content: Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has erased all gains it made from a 35% stock rally that followed US car rental company Hertz's announcement in October that it ordered 1,00,000 Tesla cars. Tesla's market capitalisation had crossed $1 trillion in October, however, the stock has fallen 21% in December so far. The stock fell after CEO Musk offloaded his company stake.

Title: Husband-wife duo who founded MapmyIndia worth $586 mn after IPO
Content: Husband-wife duo Rakesh Verma and Rashmi Verma, who founded MapmyIndia more than two decades ago, are jointly worth about $586 million after their startup's IPO, according to Bloomberg. The digital mapping services startup's stock rose around 35% to ₹1,393.65 on its market debut on Tuesday. The husband-and-wife team owns nearly 54% of the company post IPO.

Title: Better.com CEO wanted to give 900 fired staff only 1-2 weeks of severance pay: Report
Content: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg, who laid off 900 employees on Zoom call, initially wanted to give them one or two weeks of severance pay, Business Insider reported citing current and former employees. Garg offered four weeks of severance after executives reportedly pushed for a longer period. The number was further raised to 60 days after lawyers threatened to sue Better.com.

Title: Snapdeal files papers for IPO, offer includes fresh issue of ₹1,250 crore
Content: SoftBank-backed Snapdeal on Tuesday filed its draft papers for an initial public offering (IPO), which comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹1,250 crore. The IPO also comprises an offer for sale of up to 3.07 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, who founded the Delhi-based e-commerce startup in 2010, won't dilute their stake.

Title: Influencer known as China's 'live streaming queen' fined $210 m for tax evasion
Content: Chinese influencer Huang Wei, who is widely regarded as the country's "queen of live streaming" has been fined 1.34 billion yuan ($210.16 million) for tax evasion. The 36-year-old, who goes by the name 'Viya', was accused of failing to disclose her personal income in 2019 and 2020. In a statement, she apologised for the tax violations and 'accepted the punishment'.

Title: Indian rupee to be worst-performing currency in Asia in 2021: Report
Content: The Indian rupee is set to end 2021 as Asia's worst-performing currency, as per Bloomberg. It has declined 1.9% in this quarter as global funds pulled $4.2 billion of capital out of India's stock market, the most among regional markets where data is available, Bloomberg reported. Earlier, Goldman Sachs and Nomura lowered their outlook for Indian equities, citing expensive valuations.

Title: Officer's Choice whisky maker plans IPO at over ₹18,800 crore valuation: Report
Content: Mumbai-based Allied Blenders & Distillers, which makes Officer's Choice whisky, Kyron brandy, Jolly Roger rum and other spirits, is considering an IPO, Bloomberg reported. The company could raise as much as $300 million (over ₹2,260 crore) and is seeking a valuation of at least $2.5 billion (over ₹18,800 crore). It plans to file preliminary documents by the Q1 of 2022.

Title: P&G recalls over 30 hair care products over cancer-causing chemical in US
Content: Procter & Gamble Company (P&G) has recalled over 30 hair care products in the US due to the presence of the cancer-causing agent benzene. The recalled products include dry conditioner and dry shampoo sprays from Pantene, Herbal Essences, Old Spice and other brands. Notably, exposure to benzene can result in leukemia, blood cancer of the bone marrow and blood disorders.

Title: IDBI Bank says diamond group owes ₹16.72 cr after report claims ₹6,710 cr default
Content: After a report claimed that diamond firm Sanghavi Exports International defaulted on loans worth ₹6,710 crore to IDBI Bank, the bank issued a clarification saying the report contained "factual inaccuracies". The Mumbai-based group's account is a non-performing asset, but current principal outstanding is only ₹16.72 crore, it said. The bank added that it initiated requisite actions to recover dues.

Title: Sensex jumps 900 points after crashing 1,100 points on Monday amid Omicron fears
Content: The Sensex jumped more than 900 points on Tuesday to trade at 56,700 levels after crashing over 1,100 points on the previous day amid concerns over the Omicron COVID-19 variant. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 260 points to trade near the 16,900-mark. Tata Steel, HCL Tech, Tech Mahindra and Wipro were among the top Sensex gainers.

Title: Walmart sued for illegally dumping over a million toxic items a year in California
Content: California officials have sued Walmart, accusing the world's largest retailer of illegally dumping pesticides, lithium batteries and other hazardous materials in landfills across the state. The suit referred to Walmart as a "repeat offender" and said that it unlawfully disposes 159,600 pounds of toxic waste each year amounting to over a million items. Walmart referred the lawsuit as "unjustified".

Title: Wipro to acquire US-based cybersecurity firm Edgile for $230 million
Content: Wipro on Monday announced it has signed an agreement to acquire US-headquartered Edgile for $230 million (approximately ₹1,744 crore). Founded in 2001, Edgile is a privately held company and has an on-site workforce of 182 employees. Wipro expects the transaction will be completed before March 31, 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions.

Title: Oracle to buy Cerner for $28 billion in its biggest acquisition ever
Content: Oracle on Monday announced that it will buy electronic medical records company Cerner in an all-cash deal for approximately $28.3 billion, marking the enterprise software maker's biggest acquisition ever. Cerner shareholders will receive $95 per share, representing a premium of 5.8% to the company's closing price on Friday. The deal is expected to close in 2022, the company said.

Title: iPhone maker Foxconn to shut TN plant for 5 days amid workers' protests
Content: Foxconn, which makes Apple's iPhones, will shut its plant in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur for five days this week, the Superintendent of Police in Kancheepuram said. This comes after 150 employees were hospitalised due to food poisoning, sparking protests by plant workers and their relatives on the Chennai-Bengaluru national highway. Several protestors who had been detained were released on Monday.

Title: India's auto component manufacturing marks 65% YoY increase: ACMA
Content: Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India (ACMA) announced on Tuesday that India's automotive component manufacturing industry witnessed a turnover of ₹1.96 lakh crore between April and September 2021. This marks a 65% year-on-year (YoY) increase. The industry's exports also saw a growth of 76% between the same period in comparison to last year, rising to ₹68,746 crore.

Title: Bipin and I will not sell any shares in the IPO: MobiKwik Co-founder
Content: MobiKwik Co-founder Upasana Taku told Business Insider that one of the fintech startup's Co-founders Bipin Preet Singh and she have decided not to sell any shares in the initial public offering (IPO). "I am told that it's a positive signal that promoters are so gung-ho about their business that they don't want to sell at the current issue," Taku said.

Title: Vedanta acquires Nicomet, becomes India's sole nickel producer
Content: Vedanta Resources on Monday said it acquired leading nickel and cobalt producer Nicomet and became India's only nickel producer. A company statement said that the acquisition is a significant step in making India self-reliant in key minerals. Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal said, "India currently imports 100% of its nickel requirement. Our focus will be to boost India's domestic production."

Title: IOCL acquires 4.93% equity stake in Indian Gas Exchange
Content: The Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) said on Tuesday that it has acquired a 4.93% stake in Indian Gas Exchange Limited, India's first automated national level gas exchange. "The Board...accorded approval for acquisition of 36,93,750 shares with face value of ₹10 each," IOCL said in a statement. Indian Gas Exchange Limited is regulated by Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board.

Title: Axis Bank may be highest bidder for Citi's India retail business: Reports
Content: Axis Bank may be the highest bidder for Citibank's India retail business, CNBC TV 18 reported on Monday citing sources. Axis Bank is also reportedly likely to strike an all-cash deal with Citibank, which could be worth $1.5 billion, the news channel said. Reportedly, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Induslnd Bank are also in the race to buy Citibank's assets.

Title: PM interacts with CEOs of top companies ahead of Budget
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Monday interacted with the CEOs of companies from various sectors of industry. "We discussed various aspects relating to the economy. The CEOs shared insightful suggestions for the upcoming Budget," PM said. Just like India aspires for a podium finish at Olympics, it wants to see its industries among world's top five in every sector, he added.

Title: World Economic Forum's Davos Summit postponed due to Omicron
Content: The World Economic Forum (WEF) has deferred its annual summit, which is usually held in Switzerland's Davos, until mid-2022, Sky News reported on Monday citing communication from organisers. The Davos Summit was planned to be held in January 2022 but has been postponed amid rising Omicron cases globally. The annual summit is a gathering of global business and political leaders.

Title: Trump sues New York Attorney General to block inquiry into his company
Content: Former US President Donald Trump has sued New York Attorney General Letitia James seeking to block her from continuing to investigate his company. The lawsuit comes after it was reported that James' office would seek to question Trump as it probes whether the Trump Organization manipulated the valuations of its real estate properties. Trump alleged the probe is "politically motivated".

Title: Unitech's ex-promoters arrested by ED in money laundering case
Content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Unitech's ex-promoters Sanjay and Ajay Chandra in a money laundering case. Officials said the brothers, who were earlier lodged in a Mumbai jail, were brought to Delhi on Monday. The arrests were made after the Supreme Court allowed the ED to carry out custodial interrogation of the brothers on the basis of new evidence.

Title: ATL completes one of India's largest intra-state transmission lines in UP
Content: Adani Transmission Limited (ATL), a part of the Adani Group, has completed construction of one of India's largest intra-state transmission lines of 897 circuit kilometres in Uttar Pradesh. The line has been built on a Build, Own, Operate, Maintain (BOOM) basis. "Completion of this project even during the pandemic is a significant achievement," said Anil Sardana, CEO and MD, ATL.

Title: What is the Panama Papers case in which Aishwarya was questioned by ED?
Content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan appeared before the ED for questioning in a case linked to the 2016 'Panama Papers' global tax leaks. Leaked papers showed Aishwarya and her family members were in 2005 appointed as directors of Amic Partners under the laws of the British Virgin Islands. The process to wind up the company was initiated in 2008 after Aishwarya-Abhishek's marriage.

Title: I will pay over $11 billion in taxes this year: World's richest person Musk
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "For those wondering, I will pay over $11 billion in taxes this year." The Tesla CEO's tweet comes days after he had a Twitter spat with US Senator Elizabeth Warren over taxes and called her "Senator Karen". Musk had earlier said he'll pay "more taxes than any American in history this year".

Title: JPMorgan employees discuss business on WhatsApp, firm to pay $125 mn fine
Content: JPMorgan Chase subsidiary JP Morgan Securities will pay a $125-million penalty to the US SEC over its business recordkeeping. From at least January 2018 through November 2020, its employees often communicated about business matters on their personal devices, using text messages, WhatsApp, and personal email accounts. None of these records were preserved as required by the federal securities laws.

Title: 150 employees hospitalised after food poisoning at iPhone maker Foxconn in TN
Content: Over 150 employees, who work at a Foxconn factory that makes Apple's iPhones in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur, were hospitalised for food poisoning this week. "There was an outbreak of acute diarrhoea reported among the Foxconn employees," the Thiruvallur district administration said. As many as 256 workers were treated as out-patients and 159 were hospitalised, of whom 155 have been discharged.

Title: RBI tells board it favours a complete ban on cryptos: Report
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) conveyed to its central board that it favours a complete ban on cryptocurrencies, The Economic Times reported. In a detailed presentation, RBI highlighted "serious concerns" relating to financial stability and exchange management. As per RBI's statement, "The board discussed various aspects relating to central bank digital currency and private cryptocurrencies."

Title: It feels different to leave the addiction of monthly salary: Ex-Twitter India head
Content: Twitter India's former head Manish Maheshwari, who quit Twitter this month to launch his edtech startup Invact Metaversity, tweeted, "It feels different to leave the addiction of monthly salary." His tweet received various reactions, with MBA dropout Prafull Billore, who founded MBA Chai Wala, tweeting, "Welcome to the club." A Twitter user also wrote, "You're going to miss that SMS."

Title: World's topmost organisations have Indian CEOs: Rajnath Singh
Content: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at FICCI's 94th Annual General Meeting said that the world's topmost organisations have Indian CEOs. "India is an emerging economy that has started moving towards growth. We have trained, scientific, technological and managerial talent," he said. Recently, Twitter and Chanel named Indian-origin Parag Agrawal and Leena Nair as their CEOs, respectively.

Title: World Bank approves $195 million loan for Pakistan
Content: The World Bank has approved $195 million in financing for Pakistan. It will help in improving electricity distribution and implementing energy sector reforms to increase service quality for consumers in Pakistan. The Electricity Distribution Efficiency Improvement Project (EDEIP) will also invest in climate-resilient infrastructure, particularly grid stations and transmission lines.

Title: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points to end at 55,822 amid Omicron worries
Content: The benchmark indices ended lower for the second consecutive session on Monday on rising concern over the Omicron variant. At close, the Sensex was down 1,189.73 points or 2.09% at 55,822.01, and the Nifty was down 371 points or 2.18%, at 16,614.20. BPCL, Tata Steel, Tata Motors, IndusInd Bank and SBI were among the top Nifty losers.

Title: ₹9 lakh crore investor wealth wiped off as markets crash amid Omicron worries
Content: Over ₹9 lakh crore wealth of investors was wiped off on Monday as stock markets mirrored the weak global trends amid Omicron worries and Sensex and Nifty slumped nearly 3%. While the Sensex ended 1,189 points lower at 55,822, Nifty slumped 371 points to end at 16,614. In the last two months, ₹25 lakh crore of investor wealth has eroded.

Title: ICICI once refused to give credit card to me, then-MD Kamath arranged it later: Gadkari
Content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recently revealed that ICICI Bank had once refused to issue a credit card to him. He said when he met the bank's then-MD KV Kamath, he told him about this. "Kamath said the bank has a policy that they don't issue credit cards to lawyers and politicians. Later, he arranged one immediately for me," Gadkari added.

Title: SEBI bans futures trading in 7 agricultural commodities for one year
Content: Markets regulator SEBI on Monday barred futures trading in five more commodities - paddy (non-basmati), wheat, soybean and its derivatives, crude palm oil and moong - for one year. The derivative contracts in chana, and mustard seeds and its derivatives, had already been suspended. This comes amid the retail inflation surging to a three-month-high of 4.91% in November 2021.

Title: Sensex plunges 1,000 points, Nifty slips below 16,700
Content: Sensex plunged 1,000 points to sit near 56,000 in the opening session, while Nifty slipped below 16,700 to around 16,677. Shares of Future Retail jumped 18% after India's antitrust agency suspended Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group on Friday. Among Nifty stocks, 47 out of the 50 were in the red today.

Title: Indian-origin Anand Eswaran named Veeam Software's new CEO
Content: Switzerland-headquartered data protection and backup software maker Veeam Software has named Indian-origin Anand Eswaran as its new CEO. Prior to joining Veeam, Eswaran was RingCentral's Chief Operating Officer and President. He holds a master's degree in computer science and engineering from University of Missouri, Columbia and a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from Mumbai University.

Title: Amazon delays plan to ban phones in warehouses as tornado kills 6 in US
Content: Amazon is delaying its plans to ban cell phones in warehouses, allowing employees to keep their devices with them at work "until further notice". The development comes after six workers died at an Amazon facility in Illinois as it was struck by a tornado last week. Amazon has, for years, prohibited employees from having their phones on warehouse floors.

Title: Messed up lie: Musk on US Senator's ads calling him 'freeloading billionaire'
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk reacted to a Twitter post showing Facebook ads purchased by US Senator Elizabeth Warren, calling Musk a "freeloading billionaire". Musk said, "This is such a deeply messed up lie to the American people...She is the one freeloading off taxpayers." He claimed he will be paying the largest amount of tax than any individual in history.

Title: ixigo gets SEBI's approval for ₹1,600-crore IPO
Content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has approved the ₹1,600-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Le Travenues Technology, which operates travel platform ixigo. The offer comprises a fresh issue of shares worth ₹750 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹850 crore. As part of OFS, ixigo Co-founders Aloke Bajpai and Rajnish Kumar will divest stakes worth ₹50 crore each.

Title: CCI order shows Amazon deliberately dodged Indian laws: CAIT
Content: Competition Commission of India (CCI) ordered suspension of Amazon-Future Group's deal and imposed a ₹202 crore fine on Amazon. Reacting to this, the Confederation of All India Traders said on Sunday that the order concludes that Amazon deliberately attempted to dodge Indian laws and policies. Amazon had proposed to buy a 49% minority stake in Future Coupons under the deal.

Title: Future Group companies' shares rally after CCI revokes Amazon deal
Content: Shares of Future Group companies on Monday rallied 20% after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) suspended Amazon's 2019 investment in Future Coupons and imposed a ₹202-crore fine on the e-commerce giant. Future Retail shares gained 19.92% to hit the upper circuit of ₹57.50 on NSE and shares of Future Consumer, Future Supply and Future Enterprise also rose nearly 20%.

Title: 9-10% growth expected in current fiscal year: CEOs in CII poll
Content: Indian economy is set for a growth of 9-10% in the current fiscal year, according to 56% of CEOs polled by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII). About 10% of the CEOs polled, however, think that growth could exceed even the 10% mark. Many CEOs also said they are worried about Omicron's potential effect on the services and manufacturing sectors.

Title: International banks in UAE to switch to Mon-Fri work week from Jan
Content: Several international banks operating in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) are set to adopt a Monday-Friday work week from January 2022. Wall Street-based JPMorgan Chase & Co and France's Societe Generale said they will implement a Saturday-Sunday weekend from January. UAE recently announced that it will adopt a four-and-a-half day working week with a Saturday-Sunday weekend from January 1, 2022.

Title: Plan on course for LIC IPO in last quarter of this fiscal: DIPAM Secy
Content: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has refuted reports stating that the Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) initial public offering (IPO) is unlikely to take place in the current financial year ending March 2022. "It is reiterated that plan is on course for the IPO in the last quarter of this fiscal," Pandey said.

Title: ₹13,109 cr recovered from assets sale of Nirav Modi, Mallya, Choksi: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said a total of ₹13,109.17 crore has been recovered from assets sale of defaulters Nirav Modi, Vijay Mallya and Mehul Choksi, as of July. She said ₹792 crore was also realised from sale of assets belonging to Mallya and others. PSBs recovered ₹5.49 lakh crore through resolution of bad loans in last seven years, she added.

Title: Tata Group's acquisition of Air India approved by CCI
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday approved Tata Group's acquisition of Air India, Air India Express and Air India SATS Airport Services. In October, Talace, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tata Sons, had won the bid to acquire Air India for ₹18,000 crore. The amount includes a cash payment of ₹2,700 crore and taking over ₹15,300 crore debt.

Title: China Evergrande Founder's wealth plunges by $17.2 billion in 2021
Content: China's eight real estate tycoons have seen their wealth plunge in 2021, with China Evergrande Group's Founder Hui Ka Yan leading the decline. Hui, who was Asia's second-richest person with a fortune of $42 billion in 2017, lost $17.2 billion this year, reported Bloomberg. Hui's current net worth stands at $6.1 billion as shares of his companies' units have tumbled.

Title: ArcelorMittal Nippon to invest ₹1.02 lakh cr to build steel plant in Odisha
Content: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India has received approval from the Odisha government to set up a 24 million tonnes-a-year steel plant in the Kendrapara district. The facility will produce steel using the latest green steel-making technology and will also produce 18.75 million tonnes of cement annually. The company will invest ₹1.02 lakh crore which will create direct employment for 16,000 people.

Title: Serum Institute's Covovax COVID-19 vaccine gets WHO approval for emergency use
Content: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Friday issued an emergency use listing (EUL) for the Covovax COVID-19 vaccine manufactured by Serum Institute of India. SII CEO Adar Poonawalla called it "another milestone in our fight against COVID-19". Covovax is the ninth COVID-19 vaccine that's been granted EUL, WHO said, adding that its listing will increase vaccine access in lower-income countries.

Title: CCI suspends Amazon-Future 2019 deal, imposes ₹200-crore fine on Amazon: Report
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has revoked its clearance to Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Coupons, a unit of Future Retail Ltd, Reuters reported. The competition regulator also reportedly imposed a fine of over ₹200 crore on the e-commerce giant for concealing facts. This comes amid Amazon-Future legal battle over Future's deal with Reliance Retail to sell its assets.

Title: I refused to see age as a handicap: Falguni Nayar who founded Nykaa at 50
Content: Nykaa's billionaire CEO Falguni Nayar at FICCI's 94th Annual Convention said, "When I decided to start Nykaa at 50 with no experience in beauty, technology, or retail, it was all a learning curve." She said she refused to see "age as a handicap". "I wasn't an engineer, I'm not from IIT...but I was ready to ask stupid questions," Nayar added.

Title: Amazon stands exposed: CAIT as CCI revokes Amazon-Future Coupons deal
Content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has welcomed the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order suspending Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group's Future Coupons and penalising the e-commerce giant for ₹200 crore. "Amazon stands fully exposed for its malpractices and the trading community of India under the flag of CAIT stands vindicated," its Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said.

Title: Rejected Reliance's tender as state minister once, saved ₹2,000 crore: Gadkari
Content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recalled that he had rejected a tender by Reliance for the Mumbai-Pune express highway as Maharashtra minister in 1995. "My CM was also upset and so was Balasaheb Thackeray...Reliance had quoted ₹3,600 crore. We rejected it and completed the project through the MSRDC at a cost of ₹1,600 crore. We saved ₹2,000 crore," he stated.

Title: CNG, PNG prices increased for 2nd time in 3 weeks in Mumbai from today
Content: For the second time in three weeks, Maharashtra government-run Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) has hiked the prices of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and Piped Natural Gas (PNG) in Mumbai from December 17 midnight. The price of CNG is increased by ₹2 per kilogram and PNG by ₹1.50 per standard cubic metre. Over eight lakh consumers will reportedly be impacted.

Title: India likely to become fastest growing economy in 2021-22: Amit Shah
Content: Union Home Affairs Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that India is likely to become the fastest growing economy in the world in the year 2021-2022. "We are reaching the pre-COVID-19 levels...I will not be surprised if we touch double-digit growth," he added. Shah further said out of the 22 parameters of the economy, India has exceeded in 19 parameters.

Title: Emirati billionaire Majid Al Futtaim, who once worked as a bank clerk, passes away
Content: Emirati billionaire Majid Al Futtaim, who once worked as a bank clerk, has passed away. Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum announced Al Futtaim's death in a post on Twitter on Friday, and wrote, "May God have mercy on...one of Dubai's most important merchants and senior men." The cause behind his death and his age haven't been announced.

Title: Fashion alley also catching 'good Indian CEO virus': Anand Mahindra on Leena Nair
Content: After Leena Nair was named Chanel's new global CEO, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "So it's not just Silicon Valley but also Fashion Alley that's catching the 'good virus' of Indian CEOs." "Bravo Leena! Keep making us proud," he added. Earlier, former PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi also congratulated Leena Nair.

Title: Asia's richest man Mukesh Ambani names 5 best books of 2021
Content: Asia's richest man and Reliance Industries Limited Chairman Mukesh Ambani has named five best books of 2021 according to him. The books include 'Ten Lessons for a Post-Pandemic World', 'Principles for Dealing With the Changing World Order: Why Nations Succeed and Fail' and '2030: How Today's Biggest Trends Will Collide and Reshape the Future of Everything' among others.

Title: Indiabulls Housing's shares fall after its Founder sells 11.9% stake
Content: Indiabulls Housing Finance's shares ended 8.34% lower on Friday after its Founder Sameer Gehlaut sold an 11.9% stake. Gehlaut said he'll step down from the company's board by the end of this financial year. "I and my promoter companies now own 9.8% of the company. I intend to hold these shares and participate in the future growth story," he added.

Title: China's Alibaba pledges carbon neutrality by 2030
Content: China's Alibaba has announced that it will aim to achieve carbon neutrality in its own operations by 2030. The company also pledged to cut overall CO2 across all its businesses by 1.5 gigatonnes by 2035. It plans to deploy new energy-saving, high-efficiency technologies, make further use of renewables and also explore "carbon removal initiatives".

Title: China may ban online brokerages from offering offshore trading: Report
Content: Chinese officials are planning to ban online brokerages such as Futu Holdings and UP Fintech from offering offshore trading services to mainland clients, Reuters reported citing sources. Firms affected by the crackdown are likely to be notified of a ban in "the coming months". Futu said it had been communicating with authorities but had not received any formal orders.

Title: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $884 mn, bringing total to $13.6 bn
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sold another 9,34,091 shares of Tesla worth $884.1 million, filings showed. The billionaire sold the shares to pay for taxes on the exercise of stock options to buy 2.2 million shares. This brings the total shares sold to 12.9 million for about $13.6 billion since Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.

Title: Flipkart looking to list outside India by the end of 2022: Report
Content: Flipkart is looking at an initial public offering (IPO) outside India around November-December 2022, the company’s Group CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy reportedly said at an offsite meeting. A US listing may get stretched to March 2023, reported Economic Times. "He said IPO would potentially happen in next 12 months...unless things change dramatically, triggered by external events," a source told ET.

Title: Fraud-accused Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes' case goes to jury
Content: The criminal fraud case of blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes has been handed to the jury after the prosecution and defence wrapped up closing arguments. If convicted, Holmes, who pleaded not guilty, faces up to 20 years in prison. Theranos was founded in 2003 after Holmes dropped out of Stanford and was valued at $9 billion before it collapsed.

Title: Tesla sued over CEO Elon Musk's Twitter poll on stock sale
Content: Tesla is being sued by an investor over its CEO Elon Musk's social media posts including his Twitter poll asking users whether he should sell 10% of his Tesla stock. The lawsuit alleges that Musk's tweets "ultimately have an impact on Tesla's stock prices". "It is unclear who at Tesla, if anyone, is currently reviewing Musk's tweets," the suit says.

Title: NYPD mulling $12.36 million deal with Tesla for 250 cars: Report
Content: The New York City Police Department (NYPD) is planning to purchase as many as 250 fully electric Model 3 sedans from Tesla, Bloomberg reported. The deal is expected to be worth about $12.36 million, with the NYPD paying $51,940 for each vehicle, as per a draft of the procurement contract. The NYPD bought a Model 3 for $47,740 in June.

Title: Amazon shareholders call for tax disclosures
Content: Greater Manchester Pension Fund and the Oblate International Pastoral Investment Trust have filed a shareholder proposal at Amazon, calling on it to disclose global tax practices and risks to investors, shareholder adviser PIRC said. Their proposal also calls on Amazon to implement the new GRI Tax Standard, including public country-by-country reporting of financial, tax and worker information.

Title: Sharp drops in stock prices of new-age tech firms scary: Zerodha CEO
Content: Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath took to Twitter to say that the "sharp drops in stock prices of listed new-age tech companies across the world is quite scary". "If history is a guide, only a small percentage of them will maybe bounce back," he added. He said companies, when projecting growth, should prioritise lower volatility long-term versus maximum short-term gain.

Title: Vedanta Chairman meets Raj CM, says 'discussed investment opportunities'
Content: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Saturday tweeted that he met Ashok Gehlot, the Chief Minister of Rajasthan. "We discussed the investment opportunities in natural resources and job creation potential in Rajasthan with focus on inclusive development of the communities," Agarwal wrote on Twitter. "I am sure that under your leadership the state will reach new heights," he further said.

Title: Bank of England raises interest rate to 0.25% amid inflation surge
Content: The Bank of England (BoE) became the first major bank globally to raise interest rate from 0.1% to 0.25% amid rising inflation triggered by the pandemic. BoE said inflation rate is likely to hit the 6% mark by April, which is three times its target level. "There are signs of greater persistence in domestic cost, price pressures," BoE said.

Title: Foxconn India's workers hospitalised after food poisoning: Report
Content: Several employees of a Foxconn India unit, which makes iPhones for Apple, were hospitalised after a bout of food poisoning, reported Reuters. The food poisoning reportedly occurred earlier this week at the company's dormitories. On Saturday, hundreds of Foxconn workers staged a protest on the Chennai-Bengaluru national highway demanding to know the status of their colleagues, TOI reported.

Title: RateGain Travel's shares list at 15% discount on market debut
Content: The shares of RateGain Travel Technologies listed at ₹360 on the NSE on Friday, marking a discount of 15% over an issue price of ₹425 apiece. RateGain's initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed 17.41 times between December 7 and December 9. The offer comprised a fresh issue of ₹375 crore, and an offer-for-sale of ₹960.74 crore by investor and promoters.

Title: Vodafone Idea planning to increase capex to ₹15,000 crore: Report
Content: Vodafone Idea (Vi) is planning to increase its annual capital expenditure to $2 billion (about ₹15,000 crore), The Economic Times reported. Vi's promoters Aditya Birla Group and UK's Vodafone Plc are likely to put in more equity, it said. Vi, with a cash balance of ₹250 crore at September-end, is expected to complete its fund-raise by March 2022, it added.

Title: Sensex falls 889 points to end at 57,011, Nifty closes below 17,000
Content: The Sensex fell 889 points to end 1.54% lower at 57,011.74 on Friday, weighed by an across-the-board selloff. Out of the 30 Sensex stocks, 26 closed in the red with IndusInd Bank losing nearly 5%. Infosys, HCL Technologies, Power Grid Corporation and Sun Pharmaceutical were among top gainers. Meanwhile, the Nifty 50 index plunged 263.20 points or 1.53% to 16,985.20.

Title: Airtel prepays ₹15,519 cr in liability for spectrum acquired in 2014
Content: Bharti Airtel has paid ₹15,519 crore to the Department of Telecom towards prepayment of the entire deferred liabilities pertaining to spectrum acquired in 2014 auction. Airtel said it had acquired 128.4 MHz spectrum (including Telenor spectrum) for ₹19,051 crore in the auction. The company expects an interest cost savings of ₹3,400 crore over the residual life for fully substituted capital.

Title: Musk compares US Senator Warren to an 'angry mom', calls her 'Karen'
Content: Elon Musk in a Twitter spat with Elizabeth Warren, over taxes, compared the US Senator to his friend's "angry mom who'd randomly yell at everyone". Musk also tweeted, "Please don't call the manager on me, Senator Karen." He added, "If you opened your eyes for 2 seconds, you'd realize I'll pay more taxes than any American in history this year."

Title: Bezos should spend less time in hot tub & more at Blue Origin: Musk
Content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in an interview discussing Blue Origin's Jeff Bezos said, "As a friend of mine says, he should spend more time at Blue Origin and less time in the hot tub." Musk added Bezos has a "reasonably good engineering aptitude", but he doesn't seem to want to use his "mental energy getting into the details of engineering".

Title: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S to go public through SPAC deal: Report
Content: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S is in advanced talks to go public through a merger with one of Churchill Capital's special-purpose acquisition companies (SPAC), Bloomberg reported on Thursday. BYJU'S would raise a total of $4 billion at a valuation of about $48 billion. BYJU'S is the world's 13th most valuable startup with a $21 billion valuation, according to CB Insights.

Title: 9 lakh employees of PSU banks to go on 2-day strike from Thursday
Content: Nine lakh employees of state-run banks will go on a two-day nationwide strike beginning Thursday to protest against the government’s move to privatise two public sector banks (PSBs), according to union leaders. Most of the banks have cautioned customers about the strike's possible impact on banking operations. In Budget 2021-22, the government had announced its intent to privatise two PSBs.

Title: Money manager vanishes with $313 million of Chinese builder
Content: China Fortune Land Development Company has said that it has "lost contact" with a money manager that it gave over $313 million for investment in 2018. The builder had handed the money to China Create Capital Ltd, a British Virgin Islands-registered firm. The Chinese builder, that's debt-laden, was hoping for an annual return of 7-10% from the investment through 2022.

Title: Only months old US company offers two free houses as incentives for employees
Content: Florida-based company Mechanical One, which provides air conditioning and plumbing services, is offering a drawing for two houses as incentives for its employees. Opened just in July, the company has bought two units of a three-bedroom, two-bath home for the project. To qualify for the drawing, employees must be with the company for a year, so no employees qualify yet.

Title: Everyone, she is one to watch: Indra Nooyi as Leena Nair named Chanel CEO
Content: Former PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi congratulated Leena Nair on being named Chanel's CEO. Nooyi tweeted, "It's been an honor seeing you rise. In all the moments we've shared together, you’ve come with a certain joie de vivre and determination — a testament to the leader you are." She added, "Everyone, she is one to watch."

Title: Tallest girl in class: Chanel's new CEO Leena Nair's teacher on her school pic
Content: A teacher who taught Chanel's new Indian-origin global CEO Leena Nair has shared a group photo from Nair's school days and said that Nair was the "tallest girl in the class". The picture was shared on Twitter by Dallas resident Vijaylakshmi Nadar and was later liked by Nair herself. The 52-year-old graduated from XLRI, Jamshedpur with a gold medal.

Title: RBI fines PNB ₹1.80 crore and ICICI Bank ₹30 lakh for rule violations
Content: The RBI has fined PNB ₹1.80 crore and imposed a ₹30-lakh penalty on ICICI Bank. PNB's fine related to the bank's shareholding in borrower companies, as pledgee, of an amount exceeding 30% of paid-up share capital of those companies. ICICI Bank was fined for violating rules regarding levy of penal charges on non-maintenance of minimum balances in savings bank accounts.

Title: Global economy remains hostage to uncertainty due to Omicron: RBI
Content: The global economy remains hostage to heightened uncertainty, with the Omicron variant of COVID-19 sparking fresh containment measures, the RBI said. The emergence of Omicron has accelerated risks to global trade with the resumption of travel restrictions and quarantine rules at major ports and airports, it added. "The looming threat of Omicron calls for observing greater caution," RBI added.

Title: Govt unlikely to bring bill on crypto in winter session: Reports
Content: The government is unlikely to bring a bill on cryptocurrency in the winter session of Parliament, according to reports. Whenever the bill will be brought, it will be referred to the parliamentary standing committee for wider deliberations with stakeholders, they added. The bill's agenda says, "To create a facilitative framework for creation of the official digital currency issued by RBI."

Title: Cryptos need to be blocked if being used for illegal means: Lekhi
Content: Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakshi Lekhi has said that cryptocurrencies need to be blocked if they are being used for illegal means to harm the sovereignty and integrity of the country. "Cryptocurrency platforms and exchanges are owned by a set of people who are trying to avoid tax, taking the money out of the country," she added.

Title: TVS Motor and BMW Motorrad partner to make EVs in India
Content: TVS Motor and BMW's motorcycle brand have announced that they will develop electric vehicles (EVs) in India. TVS shares jumped as much as 7.4% after media reports said the companies were likely to announce a partnership for making and exporting electric vehicles from India. The first product from this partnership will be showcased in the next 24 months, TVS said.

Title: Emerging economies should regulate cryptos instead of banning them: Gopinath
Content: International Monetary Fund (IMF) Chief Economist Gita Gopinath said that emerging economies should regulate cryptocurrencies instead of banning them. "Banning...may not work as crypto exchanges are located offshore, which makes it easier for an individual to trade in them despite the ban," she added. "There is a need for a global policy on it urgently," Gopinath said.

Title: Will pay for news content to agencies: Google to French antitrust body
Content: Google has submitted a proposal to France's Competition Authority (CA) on how it would deal with news agencies and publishers in a dispute regarding the latter losing ad sales revenue. Google has proposed negotiation in "good faith" with news websites over the amount required to be paid to use their protected content as one of the measures.

Title: Musk's behaviour similar to that of abusive man I knew: SpaceX ex-employee
Content: A former SpaceX engineer Ashley Kosak, in an essay detailing her experiences of harassment at SpaceX, said, "Elon Musk's behaviour bears a...similarity to the behaviour of a sadistic and abusive man who had...been part of my life." Kosak, who started as an intern, alleged some men at SpaceX hug women without consent and stare at them while they work.

Title: CAIT writes to FM Sitharaman against Shopee, alleges Chinese links
Content: Traders' body CAIT has written to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman alleging that e-commerce firm Shopee violated norms as it entered India without seeking a government approval despite having a Chinese investor. Pointing to a complex ownership structure of Shopee, CAIT's Praveen Khandelwal said it is "nothing but an attempt to hoodwink the Indian government and infuse Chinese funds into India".

Title: We condemn Amazon for saying CCI has no power to revoke its Future deal: CAIT
Content: Traders' body CAIT has condemned Amazon's "high-handed and arrogant attitude" as well as its "diversionary tactics" for saying CCI has no power to revoke the Future-Amazon deal. It said that the argument reportedly presented by Amazon is an "afterthought just to get the matter escaped from...CCI". Amazon is showing a "my way or the high way attitude", CAIT added.

Title: UK's inflation hits decade-high of 5.1% in November 2021
Content: The inflation rate in the United Kingdom reached a decade-high of 5.1% in November 2021. The inflation rates in October were 4.2%, marking an increase of 19.3% in inflation rates over a one-month period. Rising petrol prices, jump in value of second-hand cars, and increase in clothing prices are reportedly driving the high inflation rates.

Title: India could export 60 lakh tonnes of sugar despite WTO ruling: Officials
Content: India could sell over 60 lakh tonnes of sugar worldwide this year, trade officials said. This comes after World Trade Organization (WTO) panel ruled that India violated international trade rules when it offered excessive subsidies for the production and export of sugar and sugarcane. "There's...no impact of order...with regard to Indian sugar exports," ISMA's Director General Abinash Verma said.

Title: CMS Info Systems fixes price band for ₹1,100-cr IPO at ₹205-216 apiece
Content: CMS Info Systems, one of India's largest cash management firm, has fixed the price band for its ₹1,100-crore IPO at ₹205-216 per share. The IPO is entirely an offer for sale by promoter Sion Investment Holdings. Of the issue size, 50% portion is reserved for qualified institutional buyers, 35% for retail investors and 15% for non-institutional investors.

Title: RIL aims to get 1st oil cargo from UAE trade arm in Dec: Report
Content: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) aims to get the first cargo of oil from its new Abu Dhabi-based trading unit in December, Reuters reported. In October, RIL had announced plans to set up Reliance International (RINL) to trade in crude oil, petroleum, petrochemical products and agricultural commodities. RIL is reportedly aiming to get 5,00,000 barrels cargo of Das crude.

Title: SBI collected ₹346 crore in additional services fee since FY18: Govt
Content: SBI collected around ₹346 crore from 2017-18 up to October 2021 in the form of additional services to customers holding basic savings, including Jan Dhan accounts, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said. The amount was collected for additional services beyond the bank's free services, he added. SBI levied charges worth ₹72.38 crore in 2020-21, Karad said.

Title: Biggest 1-year global debt increase since World War II in 2020: IMF
Content: The International Monetary Fund said that global debt rose to $226 trillion in 2020 after seeing its biggest yearly increase since World War II. Wealthier nations made up 90% of last year's debt increase, data showed. "The large increase in debt was justified by the need to protect people's lives, preserve jobs and avoid a wave of bankruptcies," it said.

Title: Supriya Lifescience's ₹700-cr IPO fully subscribed within 2 hrs of opening
Content: The ₹700-crore IPO of Supriya Lifescience was fully subscribed within two hours of opening for subscription on Thursday. As of 1pm, portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 7.14 times. The IPO, which will close on December 20, comprises fresh issue of shares worth ₹200 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of up to ₹500 crore by its promoter.

Title: Around 9% MSMEs got shut down due to COVID-19: Govt
Content: Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Narayan Rane said an online survey conducted by National Small Industries Corporation found that about 9% MSMEs closed down due to COVID-19. As per National Crime Records Bureau, 9,052 MSME business owners committed suicide in 2019, while the number increased to 11,716 in 2020, he added. MSMEs contribute 29% to India's GDP.

Title: Jury is still out: RBI DG on allowing big corporates into banking space
Content: RBI's Deputy Governor M Rajeshwar Rao said the "jury is still out" on issue of allowing big corporates into the banking space. Speaking at Mint Annual Conclave, he added, "Given that banking is a highly leveraged business dealing with public money, it makes sense to keep industry/business and banking separate." "This separation is expected to avoid spillover risks," Rao said.

Title: Pfizer says its COVID-19 pill cuts death risk by 89%, works against Omicron
Content: Pfizer has said that the final data available from high-risk patients enrolled in its study  confirmed that its antiviral COVID-19 pill reduced risk of hospitalisation or death by 89% (within three days of symptom onset) and 88% (within five days of symptom onset). Further, Pfizer added Paxlovid will retain robust antiviral activity against current Variants of Concern including Omicron variant.

Title: Cabinet clears ₹76,000-cr PLI scheme for semiconductor production
Content: The Union Cabinet has cleared a ₹76,000-crore production linked incentive (PLI) scheme for semiconductor production. Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur said an ambitious project to establish a complete ecosystem of semiconductors and display boards manufacturing has been sanctioned. He added that ₹76,000 crore will be spent on this project in six years.

Title: Tesla will accept Dogecoin for merchandise: CEO Elon Musk
Content: Dogecoin jumped as much as 24% on Tuesday after Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Tesla will make some merch buyable with Doge & see how it goes." Tesla sells merchandise such as apparel, belt buckle, mini models of its vehicles and quad bike 'Cyberquad' for kids. Earlier, Tesla had said it would stop accepting bitcoin for car purchases.

Title: Revoking FCPL deal will let Reliance restrict competition: Amazon to CCI
Content: Amazon has warned the Competition Commission of India (CCI) that revoking its 2019 deal with a Future Group unit would send a negative signal to foreign investors and allow Reliance to "further restrict competition", Reuters reported citing a legal document. The CCI had earlier alleged that Amazon concealed facts while seeking approval to invest ₹1,431 crore in Future Coupons (FCPL).

Title: Indian-origin Leena Nair named as new global CEO of Chanel
Content: French fashion house Chanel on Tuesday named 52-year-old Indian national Leena Nair as its new global CEO. Prior to this, Nair was associated with Unilever for the last 30 years. She was the first female, first Asian and the youngest ever Chief Human Resources Officer of Unilever. She'll join Chanel at the end of January and be based in London.

Title: Who is Leena Nair, Chanel's new global CEO?
Content: Indian-origin Leena Nair, Chanel's new Global CEO, did her bachelor's from Walchand College of Engineering, Sangli. She then earned her MBA from XLRI, Jamshedpur, with a gold medal. The 52-year-old joined HUL as a management trainee in 1992 and was appointed the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) in 2016 as the first female, first Asian, and youngest-ever CHRO of Unilever.

Title: Tata Group to return to beauty business it exited 23 years ago
Content: Tata Group is returning to the beauty business, a business that the conglomerate exited 23 years ago, according to Bloomberg. Beauty products will be "a key focus for us" from now on, Noel Tata, the non-executive Chairman of Tata's unit Trent, said. Noel Tata's mother Simone Tata helped create Lakmé, which was sold to Unilever's local unit in 1998.

Title: Unacceptable: Govt as WTO rules against India over sugar subsidies
Content: A World Trade Organization (WTO) panel ruled that India violated international trade rules when it offered excessive subsidies for the production and export of sugar and sugarcane. The ruling comes after Brazil, Australia and Guatemala filed parallel complaints in 2019 against India. The government said the findings were "unacceptable" and its sugar subsidies are consistent with WTO agreements.

Title: I am reading every comment: Leena Nair after being named Chanel's CEO
Content: Indian-origin businesswoman Leena Nair tweeted, "Overwhelmed by the love and support my appointment as Chanel CEO has got...Please trust that I am reading every comment, even if I don't reply to everyone individually." The 52-year-old, who's spent 30 years at Unilever, said, "I am grateful for my long career at Unilever." She'll take over as Chanel's CEO in January 2022.

Title: Facebook parent acquires name rights for 'Meta' for $60 million
Content: Facebook's parent company Meta Platforms has acquired the trademark assets of US-based regional bank Meta Financial Group for $60 million in cash. Meta Financial and its subsidiary MetaBank will have one year to remove "Meta" from its name and all branding. Earlier in October, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the parent company would change its name to Meta.

Title: Time to pay taxes: US lawmaker as Musk named TIME Person of the Year
Content: After the world's richest person and Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk was named TIME magazine's '2021 Person of the Year', US lawmaker Pramila Jayapal said, "It's *TIME* for him to pay his fair share in taxes."
