US Senator Elizabeth Warren tweeted, "Let's change the rigged tax code so [Musk] will actually pay taxes and stop freeloading off everyone else."

Title: Tesla US employee says she barricaded herself to stop men from staring at her
Content: One of the six more Tesla US employees who have sued Tesla over workplace harassment told The Washington Post that she barricaded herself with boxes to stop the unwanted attention she received and to stop the men gawking at her. Jessica Brooks alleges a supervisor told his subordinates to "check out the new girl" on her first day of orientation.

Title: Uber looking to sell stake in Didi, other non-strategic investments: CEO
Content: Uber is looking to sell stakes in non-strategic investments in other companies, including its shares in Chinese ride-hailing firm Didi Global, its CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said. "Our Didi stake we don't believe is strategic. They're a competitor," he said. Many companies in which Uber has stakes have gone public recently and are still subject to a lockup period, he added.

Title: Paytm's shares fall 11% as lock-in period for anchor investors ends
Content: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications plunged 11% during intraday trade on Wednesday as the lock-in period of 30 days for anchor investors ended. The firm's shares fell to an intraday low of ₹1,297.70 on the BSE. The percentage of anchor shares outstanding is 5.9% in Paytm, or about 3.83 crore shares, according to a report by Edelweiss Alternative Research.

Title: Toyota Kirloskar to hike vehicle prices from January
Content: Toyota Kirloskar Motor on Wednesday said that it will increase prices across its entire product portfolio from January. "The price realignment is necessitated on the back of sustained increase in input costs including raw materials," the company added. "All efforts have been made to ensure that the impact of...cost increase has a minimum effect on our esteemed customers," Toyota said.

Title: Govt earned ₹8 lakh cr from taxes on petrol, diesel in last 3 fiscals: FM
Content: The Centre earned nearly ₹8.02 lakh crore from taxes on petrol and diesel during the last three fiscal years, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed the Parliament. Of the total, over ₹3.71 lakh crore was collected in 2020-21, she added. Excise duty on petrol rose from ₹19.48/litre as on October 5, 2018 to ₹27.90/litre as on November 4, 2021, she said.

Title: HP Adhesives' ₹126-cr IPO fully subscribed within an hour of opening
Content: The ₹125.96-crore IPO of HP Adhesives was fully subscribed within an hour of opening for subscription on Wednesday. As of 12:40 pm, the portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 11.08 times. The IPO comprises a fresh issue worth ₹113.44 crore and an offer for sale of ₹12.53 crore. The company has fixed IPO's price band at ₹262-274 apiece.

Title: NCLT, NCLAT can't force parties to settle dispute under IBC: SC
Content: The Supreme Court has said that the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) and the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) can't compel parties to settle a dispute under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC). SC further said that they cannot act as "courts of equity". NCLT and NCLAT can either allow or reject the insolvency proceedings against the firm.

Title: India has 1 registered investment advisor per 76,510 investors: Govt
Content: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the ratio of mutual fund investors and demat account holders to SEBI-registered investment advisors (RIAs) in India is around 76,510:1. As of October 31, there were around 2.75 crore mutual fund investors, 7.38 crore demat account holders and 1,324 RIAs, he added. Chaudhary also said there were total 738 lakh demat accounts.

Title: Air India was profitable, unfounded decisions drove it into ground: Scindia
Content: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia at CII Partnership Summit said, "Air India was initially a profitable company, but it was driven into the ground because of many unfounded decisions." He called the Tata-Air India deal a win-win transaction for everybody and said, "It's an opportunity for Air India to rise as a phoenix...having gone back to its original owner."

Title: Only 8 PSUs' disinvestment complete out of 36 selected in 2016: Govt
Content: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat K Karad said disinvestment process has been completed for only eight out of the 36 public sector units that it had listed for disinvestment in 2016. "The execution and outcome of disinvestment transactions inter alia depends on the prevailing market conditions and bidders' interest," he added. DIPAM is currently processing 18 transactions, Karad said.

Title: SBI gets board's approval to sell 6% stake in mutual fund arm via IPO
Content: The State Bank of India (SBI) on Wednesday said its board has given approval for selling 6% in its mutual fund joint venture through the initial public offering (IPO) route. SBI Funds Management's JV partner Amundi also said that it intends to sell 4% stake in the IPO. The IPO will reportedly seek to raise about $1 billion (₹7,600 crore).

Title: Saudi Aramco looking to invest in Reliance New Energy Solar: Report
Content: Saudi Aramco is looking to invest in Reliance New Energy Solar, Mint reported. This comes after Aramco and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries recently called off a $15 billion deal for the oil giant to buy 20% stake in RIL's oil-to-chemicals business. "Reliance and Aramco have...longstanding relationship and will continue to look for investment opportunities in India," Aramco said.

Title: Serum Institute pledges $66 mn to Oxford University for research campus
Content: World's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII) has pledged $66.2 million to the University of Oxford for setting up a research campus. The research building would be named after SII's billionaire owners, the Poonawalla family. The investment was made through Serum Life Sciences unit, Oxford University said.  In September, SII had invested $68 million in Oxford Biomedica.

Title: ADB cuts India's GDP growth estimate to 9.7% for 2021-22
Content: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has cut India's GDP growth forecast for 2021-22 to 9.7% from its previous estimate of 10%. This is the second time in three months that the bank has scaled down India's growth estimate. "The reduction...comes amid supply chain issues that are affecting industry," the Manila-based multilateral development bank said in its latest supplement.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' IPO booked 3.64 times on final day
Content: The ₹1,367.5 crore IPO of footwear retailer Metro Brands, which is backed by billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 3.64 times on the last day of bidding on Tuesday. The retail portion of the offer was subscribed 1.13 times and that of non-institutional investors saw 3.02 times subscription. The price band for the IPO was fixed at ₹485-₹500 apiece.

Title: India's Nov exports rise 27% to $30.04 bn, trade deficit at $22.91 bn
Content: India's merchandise exports rose 27.16% to $30.04 billion in November, according to the data released by the government. Export sectors that recorded positive growth during the month include petroleum products, engineering goods and electronic items, among others, data showed. Meanwhile, the country's trade deficit stood at $22.91 billion, while imports increased by 56.58% to $52.94 billion.

Title: SII will launch Novavax vaccine for children in India in 6 months: CEO
Content: Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that the company will launch the Novavax COVID-19 vaccine for children in India in six months. "It's under trial and has shown excellent data all the way down to the age group of 3," he added. Poonawalla also said global vaccine supplies were outstripping the absorption capacity of many countries.

Title: Elon Musk named TIME magazine's 2021 Person of the Year
Content: Tesla's billionaire founder and CEO Elon Musk has been named TIME magazine's 2021 Person of the Year. The 50-year-old had in October 2021 become the world's first person to cross a net worth of $300 billion. "This is the man who aspires to save our planet and get us a new one to inhabit," said TIME on Musk.

Title: Unvaccinated taking a risk, but people do risky things all the time: Musk
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an interview opposed the vaccine mandate saying the unvaccinated people are "taking a risk, but people do risky things all the time". "I believe we've got to watch out for the erosion of freedom in America," he added. Musk said he and his eligible children are vaccinated and that he is not against vaccinations.

Title: Glad we didn't cross the fine line between being brave & stupid: Zomato CEO on IPO
Content: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal spoke about his company's IPO, and said, "Fortune favours the brave. There's a fine line between being brave and being stupid, I'm glad we actually didn't cross that line." He said, "People tell us that 'you guys timed the IPO really well'." Goyal added, "I tell them you can't time things like an IPO."

Title: I used to fail in school: Zomato's IITian CEO Deepinder Goyal
Content: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal at an event said, "I was a terrible student during school...I used to be at the bottom of the class...I used to fail." He added, "A teacher gave me the answers to every exam in the first semester of Class 8 and I ranked third." Goyal later studied at IIT Delhi and founded Zomato in 2008.

Title: India bans Kiwi fruit import from Iran due to rise in pest-infested consignments
Content: India has suspended the import of fresh Kiwi fruits from Iran due to the rise in pest-infested consignments from the country despite repeated warnings. Since October 2021, India has intercepted quarantine pest 'Aspidiotus netil' in 22 consignments and 'Pseudococcu Calceolariae' pest in two Kiwi fruit consignments. Earlier in 2019 too, India had intercepted pest-infested consignments.

Title: Retail inflation rises to 4.91% in November from 4.48% in October
Content: India's retail inflation rose to 4.91% in the month of November from 4.48% in October, data released by the Ministry of Statistics & Programme Implementation showed. The rise was led by an increase in food prices, particularly vegetables. This is the fifth consecutive month that CPI data has come below the Reserve Bank of India's upper margin of 6%.

Title: Wholesale inflation rises to 12-year-high of 14.23% in November
Content: India's wholesale price inflation rose to a 12-year-high of 14.23% in November, data released by the Ministry of Commerce & Industry showed. In October 2021, the figure stood at a five-month high of 12.54%. "The high rate is primarily due to rise in prices of mineral oils, basic metals, crude petroleum, natural gas, chemical products and food," the Ministry said.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' ₹1,368-cr IPO subscribed 52% on day 2
Content: The ₹1,367.5-crore initial public offering (IPO) of footwear retailer Metro Brands, backed by billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 52% on the second day of bidding. The company received bids for 99.49 lakh equity shares against an IPO size of 1.91 crore. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 87%, while that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 17%.

Title: Adani's realty unit in talks to buy Ozone Group at $1 billion: Report
Content: Billionaire Gautam Adani's Adani Realty is in advanced talks to buy Bengaluru-based developer Ozone Group at an enterprise valuation of $1 billion, Bloomberg reported. Ozone Group, which has ongoing projects in Mumbai, Bengaluru and Chennai, reportedly has an outstanding debt of over ₹6,000 crore. As part of the transaction, Adani will be taking over the debt of Ozone Group.

Title: Aditya Birla Fashion & Retail to take over Reebok's operations in India
Content: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited (ABFRL) has signed a long-term licensing agreement to distribute and sell Reebok products in India and other ASEAN countries. "This deal marks a foray for ABFRL into India's fast-growing sports and activewear segment," the company said. The cost of acquisition is estimated to be between ₹75 crore and ₹100 crore, reports said.

Title: Cabinet committee yet to take decision on privatisation of 2 banks: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said cabinet committee on privatisation is yet to take a decision with regard to divesting two public sector banks (PSBs). Government had in Budget 2021-22 announced its intent to take up privatisation of two PSBs during the year, she added. Centre has budgeted ₹1.75 lakh crore from stake sale in PSUs and financial institutions in 2021-22.

Title: 6 out of 13 SpiceJet's 737 MAX aircraft started operating flights: Govt
Content: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said that six out of 13 of SpiceJet's 737 MAX aircraft have started operating commercial passenger flights. DGCA had lifted ban on them after almost two-and-a-half years. The planes were grounded worldwide in March 2019 following two crashes, which killed 346 people. SpiceJet is the only operator of MAX planes in India.

Title: India plans to produce 500 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses in 2022: Goyal
Content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has said that India plans to produce 500 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines next year. He further said that India is one of the shining examples of both vaccinating her own population and providing vaccines to the world. "We hope to contribute to making the world a safer place to live in," Goyal added.

Title: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $906 mn, bringing total to $12.7 bn
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sold another 9,34,091 shares of Tesla worth $906 million, filings showed. The billionaire sold the shares to pay for taxes on the exercise of stock options to buy 2.13 million shares. This brings the total shares sold to 11.97 million for about $12.7 billion since Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.

Title: Govt should clarify whether it's going to recognise cryptos or not: Adhir
Content: The leader of Congress in the Lok Sabha, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, said, "The government should clarify in Parliament whether it is going to recognise cryptocurrency or not." He added, "At a time when the government is planning to ban cryptocurrencies...Prime Minister's Twitter handle is compromised and a link is tweeted saying...government is going to recognise cryptocurrencies."

Title: MGM Resorts lets candidates try out jobs in virtual reality before signing on
Content: American hospitality company MGM Resorts is letting applicants try out casino and hotel jobs in virtual reality (VR) before signing on. "It can be very difficult just to verbally explain the types of positions or show a video," MGM's chief HR officer told Insider. She said VR experience allows candidates to "throw a headset on and really experience the job".

Title: Amazon worker killed in US roof collapse wasn't allowed to leave: Girlfriend
Content: Amazon worker Larry Virden, who was killed after a tornado hit the company's Illinois warehouse and its roof collapsed, wasn't allowed to leave the facility, his girlfriend said. "That was the last text message I got from him...He had 20 minutes to get home," she said. Virden, who started working for Amazon five months ago, is survived by four children.

Title: Musk's brother congratulates him on being TIME's 2021 Person of the Year
Content: Tesla's billionaire Founder and CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk congratulated him on being named TIME magazine's 2021 Person of the Year. "Congratulations bro. I can't think of a more deserving person ever. You are changing the world and humanity for the betterment of all," Kimbal  said. "Thanks bro," Musk replied. The Tesla CEO is currently worth $266 billion.

Title: MapmyIndia's ₹1,039 crore IPO subscribed 154.71 times on final day
Content: Digital mapping company MapmyIndia's ₹1,039.61 crore initial public offer (IPO) was subscribed 154.71 times on the final day of bidding on Monday. It received bids for 108.98 crore shares against an offer size of 70.44 lakh shares. The portion reserved for non-institutional investors was booked 424.69 times, whereas that of qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) was subscribed 196.36 times.

Title: States yet to receive ₹37,134 crore GST compensation for 2020-21: Govt
Content: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said GST compensation amounting to ₹37,134 crore is due to states and Union Territories for 2020-21. He also said that ₹14,664 crore was due to states and UTs for April-September 2021. Chaudhary added that ₹1.10 lakh crore and ₹1.59 lakh crore were released to states as back-to-back loans in FY21 and FY22, respectively.

Title: Anand Rathi Wealth lists at ₹602, 9% premium over IPO price
Content: Shares of Anand Rathi Wealth listed at ₹602 apiece on the BSE, a 9.46% premium to its IPO price of ₹550. The non-bank wealth solutions provider's IPO, which was entirely an offer-for-sale by promoters, was subscribed 9.78 times. The portion set aside for non-institutional investors was subscribed 25.42 times, while that of retail investors was subscribed 7.76 times.

Title: Data Patterns' ₹588-cr IPO fully subscribed within an hour of opening
Content: The ₹588.2-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Data Patterns was fully subscribed within an hour of opening for subscription on Tuesday. As of 1 pm, the portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 3.42 times. The Chennai-based defence and aerospace electronics solutions provider has fixed a price band of ₹555-585 for the IPO, which will remain open till December 16.

Title: Vedanta withdraws cases against govt to settle retro tax dispute
Content: Vedanta has withdrawn cases against the government in the Delhi High Court and before an international arbitration tribunal to settle a ₹20,495 crore retrospective tax dispute. The company further declared, "No further proceedings or claims shall be initiated in any court or tribunal." The Parliament passed the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021, in August to scrap the retrospective tax law.

Title: India's largest syringe maker allowed to restart production by CAQM
Content: India's largest syringe maker Hindustan Syringes and Medical Devices (HMD) has been allowed to restart production after it was told to temporarily shut down its plants in Haryana to control pollution. HMD had earlier warned that syringes were already in short supply. "We're thankful to CAQM and Haryana State Pollution Control Board for the partial reprieve," MD Rajiv Nath said.

Title: Amazon-backed More Retail plans IPO to raise ₹3,780 crore: Report
Content: Grocery chain More Retail is considering an initial public offering (IPO) to raise as much as $500 million (₹3,780 crore), Bloomberg reported. The listing will likely consist largely of new shares and could value the company at $5 billion (₹37,800 crore). Amazon and Samara Capital Partners acquired More Retail from billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla's Aditya Birla Group in 2019.

Title: Raymond shares hit 2-year high on plan to issue NCDs worth ₹100 crore
Content: Raymond's shares surged nearly 7% during intraday trade to hit a two-year high of ₹704. This comes after the company said that its board of directors will meet on December 17 to consider and approve issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCDs) to raise up to ₹100 crore. NCDs are proposed to be listed on NSE's wholesale debt market segment, it added.

Title: Bezos criticised for celebrating space trip as Amazon US warehouse collapsed
Content: Amazon's billionaire Founder Jeff Bezos has been criticised for celebrating the launch of Blue Origin's spaceflight after a tornado hit an Amazon warehouse in Illinois killing at least six people. Bezos had shared a picture from launch site on Instagram, captioned, "Happy crew this morning in the training centre." "You should worry about the tornado situation more," a user commented.

Title: Before and after pics show Amazon warehouse hit by tornado in US killing 6
Content: Satellite pictures by Maxar Technologies showed the extent of destruction after a tornado hit an Amazon warehouse in the US' Illinois killing six people this weekend. Amazon didn't have a specific count on employees because there was a shift change underway when it happened. The tornado caused both sides of a building to collapse inwards, leading the roof to fall.

Title: Alibaba employee who accused her manager of sexual assault fired
Content: An Alibaba employee, who had accused her manager of sexually assaulting her, told a Chinese newspaper the company terminated her last month, Bloomberg reported. The employee said Alibaba fired her for spreading false information in August about being raped by a senior manager. She further claimed she didn't receive any severance pay and was compensated till the date of termination.

Title: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance looks to buy bankrupt textile firm Sintex Industries
Content: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RIL), along with a partner, is looking to buy Gujarat-based bankrupt textile firm Sintex Industries, according to a stock exchange filing by Sintex Industries. Reliance is partnering with Assets Care & Reconstruction Enterprise Limited to bid for the company.  Other bidders for the company are Easygo Textiles (Welspun Group), GHCL, and Himatsingka Ventures.

Title: Expect to complete Phase 2/3 trials of mRNA vaccine by Jan: Emcure President
Content: Emcure Pharmaceuticals' President Samit Mehta has said that the company's subsidiary Gennova Biopharmaceuticals expects to complete Phase 2 and 3 trials of its mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccine by January 2022. Gennova has applied for manufacturing and stockpiling of the vaccines at risk, he added. Gennova is the first Indian pharma company to develop an indigenous mRNA platform, Mehta said.

Title: Omicron's impact on economy will be less severe: Finance Ministry
Content: The impact of Omicron variant of COVID-19 on the economy will be less severe due to rapid vaccination, the Finance Ministry said in a report. However, it said that Omicron may pose a fresh risk to the ongoing global recovery. The ministry also urged all the citizens to stay safe and follow all the COVID-19 guidelines.

Title: Samsung names new mobile, consumer electronics unit 'DX Division'
Content: Samsung Electronics has named its newly merged mobile phone and home appliances businesses as "DX Division". DX stands for "Device eXperience" and reflects Samsung's focus on creating new experiences for customers, the company said. This comes after Samsung announced it is merging two of its three divisions, marking biggest reshuffle since appointing three co-CEOs for its three divisions in 2017.

Title: HCL underpaid H1-B visa holders by at least $95 mn a year: Report
Content: HCL Technologies has been accused of wage theft by underpaying thousands of skilled migrants with H-1B visas. The Economic Policy Institute said, "We estimate that HCL is saving at least $95 million per year by illegally underpaying H-1B employees." The report was released as part of a whistleblower lawsuit against HCL Technologies, the US-based think tank said.

Title: Global chip shortage to continue till second half of 2022: Samsung
Content: Samsung said it believes that the ongoing global chip shortage shall continue till the second half of 2022. The company is reportedly taking many steps to mitigate the shortage, which includes stocking up four weeks' worth of chip supplies instead of two weeks. Samsung is also going to push for annual contracts with chip foundries to secure chip production capacity.

Title: SpiceJet to introduce drone delivery service for essential goods
Content: SpiceJet is planning to introduce drone delivery service to transport vaccines, life-saving medicines and essential goods to remote areas. It said customised drones of different payloads, including 0-5 kg, 5-10 kg and 10-25 kg, will be introduced. A SpiceXpress-led consortium was earlier shortlisted by the DGCA for conducting experimental Beyond Visual Line of Sight (BVLOS) drone operations.

Title: Heartbroken: Bezos as Amazon workers die after tornado hits US warehouse
Content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos said he was "heartbroken" after at least six people were killed at an Amazon warehouse in Illinois, US, when it was struck by a tornado late Friday. "Our thoughts and prayers are with their families and loved ones," Bezos tweeted. Amazon's CEO Andy Jassy said the company is "working closely with local officials and first responders".

Title: COVID-19, lack of funds for survival compelled Zomato to go public: CEO
Content: Zomato's Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said that COVID-19 induced disruptions, lack of funds for survival and reluctant private investors compelled the company to go public. Goyal added that he was determined to go for it even if it was to be a $50 million IPO at a valuation of $500 million. "We were just trying to survive," he said.

Title: Urge MP CM to order accused Amazon officials' arrest in ganja case: CAIT
Content: The Secretary General of Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), Praveen Khandelwal, has urged Madhya Pradesh's Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan to order the arrest of Amazon officials who are named as accused in the marijuana case. Khandelwal said, "MP government has shown the way how government works and...(we) expect it to create a landmark as to how law works."

Title: Govt to organise innovation week to encourage startup ecosystem
Content: The government will be hosting a week-long event to encourage the startup ecosystem in India in January 2022, as a part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. The "Celebrating Innovation Ecosystem" event will aim to bring together key startups, entrepreneurs, investors, policymakers and other stakeholders. It will help provide market access opportunities to startups and mobilise capital investment.

Title: Centre planning to hike DA for its employees on New Year: Reports
Content: The Centre is planning to increase dearness allowance (DA) for its employees under the 7th pay commission by the beginning of next year, according to reports. The employees will get a 3% hike in their DA and the increase in salary can be as much as ₹20,000, the reports said. In October, Centre had hiked DA by 3% to 31%.

Title: Depositors should be careful while chasing high returns: RBI Governor
Content: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Sunday said that depositors should be careful while chasing high returns. "There are institutions offering higher rates. Higher return, higher interest rate also has higher risk," he added. Das also said that India can become a gross driver of the world economy if all stakeholders in the banking sector work together.

Title: Govt to follow auction route for coal block allocation: Coal Minister
Content: Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi on Monday defended the government's decision to auction four coal blocks located near the Singareni Collieries Company (SCCL) in Telangana and said it is being done according to policy. He was replying to Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy during the Zero Hour. "Now the auction regime has begun," Joshi added.

Title: 41,177 posts vacant at public sector banks as on Dec 1: FM Sitharaman
Content: As many as 41,177 positions or 5% of the total sanctioned posts at public sector banks (PSBs) were vacant as on December 1, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said in a written reply in Lok Sabha. There are over 8,05,986 sanctioned positions at PSBs. No vacancy/post was abolished in last six years, except one in Punjab & Sind Bank, Sitharaman said.

Title: PSBs lost ₹2.85 lakh crore due to loan dues of 13 corporates: UFBU
Content: Public sector banks (PSBs) have lost nearly ₹2.85 lakh crore on account of loan dues of 13 corporates, United Forum of Bank Unions (UBFU) alleged. UBFU has called for a two-day nationwide bank strike on December 16 and 17. The strike has been called to protest against Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021 and opposing government's alleged move to privatise PSBs.

Title: Shaktikanta Das begins his extended 3-year term as RBI Governor
Content: Shaktikanta Das has started his extended three-year term as Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor. Das has become the first RBI Governor to get a second term since PM Narendra Modi-led government came into power in 2014. The reappointment is effective for three years beyond December 10, 2021, or until further orders, whichever is earlier, an official statement earlier said.

Title: Bank deposit insurance cover increased to ₹5 lakh, refund in 90 days: Goyal
Content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the Centre has increased the bank deposit insurance cover, in case of problems occurring such as closure, from ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh. The amount has to be refunded to the depositor within 90 days, he added. "The most important thing is that earlier it used to take nearly 10 years," Goyal said.

Title: Tega Industries lists at 68% premium on market debut
Content: The shares of Kolkata-based Tega Industries listed at ₹753 apiece on the BSE and ₹760 on the NSE. This is a 68% premium to its IPO price of ₹453. Its initial public offer (IPO), which was a complete offer-for-sale, was subscribed 219.04 times on the last day of subscription. The portion reserved for non-institutional investors was booked 666.19 times.

Title: Supriya Lifescience's ₹700-cr IPO to open on Dec 16 at ₹265-274/share
Content: Supriya Lifescience's ₹700-crore initial public offering (IPO) will open on December 16 at a price band of ₹265-274 per share. The offer comprises fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹200 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to ₹500 crore by its promoter. Currently, the promoter holds 99.26% stake in the company, which manufactures and supplies active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs).

Title: Banks write off ₹2.02 lakh cr in FY21; ₹10.7 lakh cr in last 7 yrs: RTI
Content: Banks have written off ₹2,02,781 crore of bad loans in financial year 2020-21, the RBI said in an RTI reply to The Indian Express. Five banks, led by SBI, wrote off ₹89,686 crore in FY21, with SBI accounting for ₹34,402 crore, it added. As much as ₹10.72 lakh crore was written off by banks since financial year 2014-15, RBI said.

Title: Vedanta shares rise 3% after it declares interim dividend of ₹13.5/share
Content: Shares of Vedanta surged by 3% during intraday trade on Monday after the company announced that its board has approved an interim dividend of ₹13.50 per share, amounting to ₹5,019 crore, for 2021-22. Vedanta's promoters, who have a shareholding of 65.18%, are poised to receive ₹3,271 crore. The date for the payment of dividend has been set as December 18.

Title: Govt unlikely to announce capital infusion for PSBs in Budget 2022: Reports
Content: The government is unlikely to announce capital infusion for public sector banks (PSBs) in Budget 2022-23 as their financial health has improved on the back of reduction in bad loans, according to reports. Banks would be encouraged to raise funds from the market and also by selling their non-core assets to augment their resources, reports said.

Title: Increasing deposit insurance cover will protect ₹76 lakh cr of savings: PM
Content: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that the move to increase deposit insurance cover to ₹5 lakh from ₹1 lakh will protect ₹76 lakh crore of savings. "We amended the law for time-bound resolution of deposit insurance claims in 90 days," he added. So far, ₹1300 crore, stuck for years, have been returned to over 1 lakh depositors, he said.

Title: Oracle Co-founder gains $12 billion in a day as shares surge
Content: Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison's net worth surged by $12 billion on Friday after his company's shares rose 16% following strong second-quarter earnings. Currently, the 77-year-old has a fortune of $119.5 billion and ranks ninth among the world's richest people, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Ellison owns over 40% stake in the software company, he co-founded in 1977.

Title: Businessman says Musk connects with people for fun despite $260 bn wealth; he replies
Content: After Elon Musk tweeted 'Hahaha', American businessman Jeremy Padawer said, "Despite his massive wealth and responsibilities, he connects with the people for fun." Musk, who has "$260 billion net worth, six kids, three massive businesses and 150,000 employees" was "blowing off steam" with the tweet, Padawer wrote. World's richest person Musk responded saying, "I do aspire to entertain the people!"

Title: Crypto should be used to empower democracy, not undermine it: PM Modi
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that emerging technologies such as cryptocurrencies should be used to empower democracy, not to undermine it. Speaking at the virtual 'Summit for Democracy' event hosted by US President Joe Biden, PM further said, "We must also jointly shape global norms for emerging technologies like social media and cryptocurrencies."

Title: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg who fired 900 employees on Zoom call takes time off
Content: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, is "taking time off effective immediately", according to the company's internal memo accessed by Business Insider. "Board has engaged an independent 3rd party firm to do a leadership and cultural assessment," the memo stated, adding that Kevin Ryan as CFO will manage the day-to-day decisions in his absence.

Title: Blue Origin spaceflight with 1st American astronaut's daughter, 5 others launched
Content: Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin launched its third human spaceflight, a first one with six crew members, to the edge of space on Saturday. The crew members include Laura Shepard Churchley, the eldest daughter of first American in space Alan Shepard and Good Morning America host Michael Strahan. Evan Dick, Dylan Taylor, Cameron Bess and Lane Bess are the other members.

Title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff, topped LinkedIn's top 50 US startups list in Sept
Content: Days after Better.com CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, LinkedIn's list of top 50 startups in the US in 2021 resurfaced online. Better.com had topped the list that was released in September. The mortgage lending startup also topped the 2020 list. Notably, Garg sent an e-mail to employees referring to them as "dumb dolphins" in 2020.

Title: What made him think his action would be rewarded: Mahindra on Better.com CEO's time off
Content: After Better.com CEO Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, took time off, Anand Mahindra said, "Seemed inevitable...What type of culture led to this CEO thinking his action would be rewarded?" Mahindra stated that CEOs act in a manner they believe will help them succeed, adding, "Boards of directors need to reflect on the culture they foster."

Title: We're scared, expecting to get fired next: Better.com employee after 900 layoffs on Zoom
Content: After 900 Better.com employees were laid off on a Zoom call, a current employee said, "Everyone has been on edge. We're all looking behind our backs, expecting to get fired next. It's not a healthy environment." "The mood...lifted a little bit since [CEO Vishal] Garg's break was announced, but everyone's still scared," the employee told Business Insider.

Title: Couldn't tell my kids, but when news went viral I had to: Fired Better.com employee
Content: A man, who was among 900 Better.com employees laid off on a Zoom call, said he and his wife agreed not to tell their five children about it. "But when news of...mass-layoff went viral, we were left with no choice," Christian Chapman told Business Insider. "My employment status changes things for the holidays. Christmas vacation? Probably not anymore," he added.

Title: Ola, Uber auto rides may get costlier from Jan 1 as Centre levies 5% GST
Content: Auto rides booked through app aggregators like Ola and Uber are likely to become costlier from January 1, 2022 with the Centre levying a 5% GST. Demanding a reconsideration of the move, an Uber spokesperson said, the move will "hurt earnings of auto drivers" and the government's "digitisation agenda". The government recently withdrew GST exemption on auto rides booked online.

Title: India's largest syringe maker asked to shut Haryana plant to control pollution
Content: India's largest syringe maker Hindustan Syringes and Medical Devices (HMD) has shut its units after Haryana Pollution Control Board asked it to temporarily close down or face prosecution. HMD has written to PM Narendra Modi, asking for declaration of syringes for COVID-19 vaccination as critical medical devices to ensure uninterrupted operations. "Syringes are already in short supply," HMD said.

Title: Which are India's 5 biggest business houses as per Hurun?
Content: As per the 2021 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 list, Tata Group with as many as 14 companies in the list is India's biggest business house. This is followed by Adani Group, Aditya Birla Group, Murugappa Group and Bajaj Group. "The top 5 business groups...has a combined value of more than [₹46 lakh crore]," Hurun India stated.

Title: Started wearing saree after I began social work, you need to be like aam aadmi: Murthy
Content: Speaking about what she changed about herself when she began social work, Infosys Foundation Chairperson Sudha Murthy said she used to wear "jeans and a T-shirt". "When I used to go to a community...they always felt..I'm different from them. [Later] I started wearing a saree, tied my bun," she stated. "You should dress or...be like...aam aadmi," the 71-year-old added.

Title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala makes over ₹6,000-crore profit after Star Health listing
Content: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala made a profit of over ₹6,000 crore from his investment in Star Health and Allied Insurance Company after its shares reached an intraday high of ₹940 on Friday. According to the company's RHP, Jhunjhunwala held 14.98% equity shares that he had acquired at an average of ₹155.28/share. He didn't put up any shares for sale in the IPO.

Title: Most virtual meetings will move to metaverse in 2-3 yrs: Bill Gates
Content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said, "Within the next 2-3 years, I predict most virtual meetings will move from 2D camera image grids...to the metaverse, a 3D space with digital avatars." He added, "The idea is you'll eventually use your avatar to meet with people in a virtual space that replicates the feeling of being in an actual room with them."

Title: Pragmatic step: CAIT as SIT to probe alleged ganja sale on Amazon set up
Content: After the government of Madhya Pradesh set up a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the alleged sale of marijuana through Amazon, CAIT's Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal called it a "pragmatic step". He said, "Accused Amazon officials should be arrested immediately." MP Police had earlier arrested two people for allegedly selling 20kg of marijuana worth ₹1.1 crore on Amazon India.

Title: MedPlus Health raises ₹418 cr from anchor investors ahead of IPO
Content: India's second-largest pharmacy retailer MedPlus Health Services has raised ₹418 crore from anchor investors ahead of its IPO. Investors who participated in this round included Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, Blackrock Global Funds, Nomura, Fidelity, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Aditya Birla Sun Life MF. MedPlus has fixed the price band for its ₹1,398.29-crore IPO at ₹780-₹796 per share.

Title: India's largest syringe maker HMD urges PM to lift factory shutdown order
Content: India's largest syringe and needle manufacturer, Hindustan Syringes and Medical Devices (HMD), has urged PM Narendra Modi to revoke an order to shut its units. Haryana Pollution Control Board had asked HMD to temporarily close down the plants to curb heavy pollution. "We won't use...diesel generator sets and have...equipped our plants with renewable energy sources," HMD's MD Rajiv Nath said.

Title: Edible oil prices fell by ₹8-10 per kg in last 30 days: Trade body
Content: Edible oil prices declined ₹8-10 per kg in last one month on the back of lower import duties, Solvent Extractors' Association of India (SEA) said. The prices may fall ₹3-4 per kg in the coming months on higher domestic output of oilseeds and bearish trend in global markets, the trade body added. Centre had reduced import duties on edible oils.

Title: 2 workers confirmed dead after tornado hits Amazon warehouse in US
Content: At least two workers were confirmed dead when an Amazon warehouse collapsed near St. Louis, US, after tornadoes and strong storms hit the area late on Friday. About 50 workers were believed to be trapped at the warehouse. Local authorities said at least 30 workers were transported by bus from the scene and others may have left on their own.

Title: Vedanta declares interim dividend of ₹13.5/share amounting to ₹5,019 cr
Content: Billionaire Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta on Saturday approved a second interim dividend for the financial year 2021-22. The company said in an exchange filing that an interim dividend of ₹13.50 per share, amounting to ₹5,019 crore has been approved. As a result, Vedanta's promoters are poised to receive ₹3,271 crore. In September, Vedanta paid a total of ₹6,877 crore as dividend.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' ₹1,368-cr IPO booked 27% on day 1
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear retailer Metro Brands' IPO was booked 27% on the first day of bidding on Friday. The company earlier said it had raised ₹410 crore from anchor investors. The price band for the IPO has been fixed at ₹485-₹500 per share and the company will raise ₹1,367.5 crore at the upper price band.

Title: India needs 'self-belief' to draw from its past success: Rajan
Content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said India needs "aatmavishwas (self-belief)" to draw from its past success. "India needs to find out why it's a success story in making two-wheelers and pharmaceuticals but cannot make clay Ganeshas," Rajan said at the Chennai International Centre, adding, "India must make pasta and market Haldirams' bhujia and vathal to all parts of the world".

Title: Growth to gain further traction in remaining quarters: Finance Min
Content: India's real GDP, which grew 8.4% in September quarter and exceeded the pre-pandemic output level, will likely gain further traction in the remaining quarters of this fiscal, the Finance Ministry said in a report. “India will be among the few economies to rebound so strongly from the contraction...due to COVID-19," it added. "Recovery suggests kick-starting of investment cycle," it said.

Title: Billionaire Yusuff Ali's LuLu Group to invest ₹2,000 cr in Gujarat
Content: UAE-based retail giant LuLu Group on Saturday announced it will invest ₹2,000 crore to develop a shopping mall near Ahmedabad. The mall is expected to create employment opportunities for more than 5,000 people. "Gujarat holds a very special place in my heart, this is where I first learnt the basics of business," LuLu Group's billionaire MD Yusuff Ali MA said.

Title: DoT moves NCLAT against Twin Star takeover bid for Videocon
Content: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has moved before the NCLAT against the NCLT order approving the consolidated resolution plan for 13 companies of Videocon Group. It urged NCLAT to set aside order allowing Twin Star Technologies' ₹2,962 crore takeover of Videocon. Videocon Telecommunications had secured dues with 131 Bank Guarantees from SBI in favour of DoT for ₹881.92 crore.

Title: Thinking of quitting my jobs & becoming an influencer full-time, says Elon Musk
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "Thinking of quitting my jobs and becoming an influencer full-time wdyt (what do you think)." Responding to the Tesla and SpaceX CEO's tweet, American YouTuber Jimmy Donaldson aka MrBeast said, "I'll coach you on how to get YouTube views!" "What makes you think you're not already one (influencer)," a Twitter user wrote.

Title: Most unusual, difficult year of my life: Bill Gates on spending 2021 mostly online
Content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in his blog post described how he had "the most unusual and difficult year" of his life, like many other people, amid COVID-19 pandemic. "My personal world...never felt smaller than it did," he said about spending his time mostly online. Talking about his divorce with Melinda, he added, "It's been a year of great personal sadness."

Title: Which 5 Indian companies employ most number of people as per Hurun?
Content: At least 139 Indian companies employ more than 10,000 people, with TCS being the country's largest employer, as per Hurun India 500 list of 2021. The IT major employs 5.06 lakh people and is followed by Quess Corp with 3.63 lakh employees. Larsen & Toubro (L&T) has 3.6 lakh employees, Infosys has 2.59 lakh and Reliance Industries employs 2.36 lakh.

Title: Underestimated how tough it would be convincing people for vaccine: Gates
Content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in a blog expressed that he "underestimated how tough it would be to convince people to take the vaccine and continue to use masks". "I think the acute phase of the pandemic will come to a close some time in 2022," he added. However, Gates accepted that the "Omicron variant is concerning".

Title: TRAI asks Musk's Starlink not to solicit business, collect fees: Report
Content: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has asked Elon Musk-led SpaceX's satellite broadband arm Starlink not to "solicit any telecom business or collect any related fees" without necessary authorisations, reported Economic Times citing a directive. Earlier, the Department of Telecommunications had barred Starlink from taking bookings or pre-orders for its internet services in India.

Title: Which are the oldest & youngest firms on Hurun India's 500 most valuable firms list?
Content: As per Hurun India's list of 500 most valuable companies, 21 are older than 100 years and 52 companies are younger than 10 years. Forbes & Company, founded in 1767, is the oldest firm featured on the list, followed by E.I.D-Parry (India), founded in 1788. Mensa Brands, founded by ex-Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan over six months ago, is the youngest.

Title: Amazon fined $1.28 billion by Italy for alleged abuse of market dominance
Content: Italy's antitrust authority has imposed a fine of 1.13 billion euros ($1.28 billion) on Amazon for alleged abuse of market dominance. Amazon leveraged its dominant position "to favour the adoption of its own logistics service - Fulfilment by Amazon (FBA) - by sellers active on Amazon", the watchdog said. The authority said it will also impose corrective steps on Amazon.

Title: Reject PharmEasy's proposed ₹6,250-crore IPO: CAIT to SEBI
Content: Indian traders' body CAIT has written to SEBI seeking the rejection of PharmEasy's proposed ₹6,250-crore IPO. CAIT's Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said selling medicines online is illegal as per an order passed by the Delhi High Court in 2018. He further said that PharmEasy mentions Thyrocare as its subsidiary in the DRHP even though CCI hasn't yet approved the acquisition.

Title: Which are India's 10 most valuable unlisted companies as per Hurun?
Content: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India is the most valuable unlisted company in India with ₹1.83 lakh crore in value, as per the 2021 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 list. NSE and BYJU'S stood second and third with a value of ₹1.68 lakh crore and 1.35 lakh crore, respectively. They're followed by InMobi, OYO, Ramcharan & Co and Dream11.

Title: Is it fair to give 2nd chance: Mahindra after CEO who laid off 900 staff apologises
Content: After Better.com CEO Vishal Garg apologised for the way he laid off 900 employees on a Zoom call, businessman Anand Mahindra questioned his Twitter followers whether he deserved a second chance. "I'm curious whether you think a CEO can survive after a blunder like this? Is it fair, or not, to allow a second chance?" the Mahindra Group Chairman wrote.

Title: Russian billionaire Vladimir Potanin faces one of the biggest divorce claims of $7 bn
Content: Russia's second-richest man Vladimir Potanin is facing a $7-billion divorce claim, one of the world's biggest divorce claims after Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates, from his ex-wife Natalia Potanina. Vladimir's ex-wife has reached a London court seeking 50% of the value of his stake in his mining company Nornickel. The amount could exceed $7 billion, Bloomberg reported.

Title: Govt offices in UAE's Sharjah to have 4-day workweek
Content: The government agencies in the United Arab Emirates' (UAE's) Sharjah city are moving to a four-day workweek and the working hours will be from 7:30 am to 3:30 pm. While the working days will be from Monday to Thursday, the weekend will be from Friday to Sunday. It follows the UAE's switch to a 4.5-day workweek from January 1, 2022.

Title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies in 2021 as per Hurun?
Content: Reliance Industries has topped the list of 500 most valuable Indian companies in 2021 with ₹16.65 lakh crore, according to Hurun India. TCS and HDFC Bank with a value of ₹13.09 lakh crore and ₹9.05 lakh crore, respectively, stood second and third. They are followed by Infosys with ₹7.51 lakh crore, ICICI Bank, HDFC, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank.

Title: Biocon in talks with Mylan to merge biosimilar businesses: Report
Content: Biocon is in talks with Mylan for a merger of their biosimilar businesses, Moneycontrol reported. Biocon will seek to hold a controlling majority stake in the merged entity and the firms will look for an initial public offering (IPO) for the entity post-merger, it said. The firms will seek a valuation of over $10 billion from the IPO, it added.

Title: Haven't sold stake because I have confidence in Star Health management: Jhunjhunwala
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who is a promoter of Star Health and Allied Insurance, has said that he has "full confidence in the management" and that's why he hasn't sold any shares. Jhunjhunwala and his wife have around 18% stake, the second-largest shareholding. On Friday, Star Health's shares listed at a 6% discount over its IPO price of ₹900 apiece.

Title: COVAX still seeing strong demand for India-made AstraZeneca doses: GAVI
Content: COVAX is still seeing strong demand for India-made doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunizations (GAVI) said. This comes after Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla recently said it would temporarily halve vaccine's production as it had no fresh orders from government. COVAX was also placing orders at a "very slow" rate, he added.

Title: Retail portion of MapmyIndia's ₹1,040-cr IPO fully booked in an hour of opening
Content: The retail portion of MapMyIndia's ₹1,040-crore initial public offering (IPO) was fully subscribed within an hour of opening on Thursday. Meanwhile, its overall subscription stood at 0.74 times as of 12 pm. The company, which had mobilised ₹311.88 crore from 34 anchor investors ahead of the IPO, has fixed price band of ₹1,000-1,033 per share for the issue.

Title: RBI could lose control over money supply if crypto is allowed: Ex-Governor
Content: Former RBI Governor Duvvuri Subbarao has said the central bank could lose control over money supply and inflation management if cryptocurrency is allowed in India. "There are also concerns that crypto will disrupt the monetary policy," he added. Rao also said that India's case for issuing a central bank digital currency may not be strong as there are capital controls.

Title: Paytm Payments Bank receives Scheduled Bank status from RBI
Content: Paytm on Thursday said that Paytm Payments Bank Limited (PPBL) has received Scheduled Bank status from the RBI. PPBL has been included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934, and can now explore new business opportunities, it added. The bank would now also be eligible to partner in government-run financial inclusion schemes, Paytm said.

Title: 8-yr-old Nubank becomes Latin America's biggest bank after US IPO
Content: Eight-year-old Nubank has become Latin America's biggest bank by market capitalisation after listing on New York Stock Exchange. It raised $2.6 billion in an initial public offering at $9 a share on Wednesday, giving it a market value above $40 billion. Earlier, Nubank had cut its proposed IPO price range by a fifth, to $8-$9 per share from $10-$11.

Title: Elon Musk sells another 9.34 lakh Tesla shares worth $963.2 mn
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold another 9.34 lakh shares of Tesla worth $963.2 million, US securities filings showed. He also exercised stock options to buy 2.17 million shares of Tesla. Earlier this month, Musk had sold over 9.34 lakh shares worth $1.01 billion. In November, Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.

Title: Construction steel prices rose up to 117% since Nov 2016: Govt
Content: Prices of steel products used in the infrastructure sector such as wire rods, plates and TMT bars have gone up by 117% in last six years, Steel Minister RCP Singh informed the Parliament. Average price of plates (10 mm) increased to ₹69,852 per tonne (excluding GST) in November as against ₹32,244 per tonne in November 2016, he added.

Title: China Evergrande defaults for 1st time on bonds worth $1.2 bn: Fitch
Content: Fitch Ratings on Thursday said that China Evergrande Group has defaulted for the first time on more than $1.2 billion worth of bond debt. Fitch has downgraded the firm's status to 'restricted default' rating. The rating agency also downgraded Kaisa Group Holdings to 'restricted default', citing its failure to repay a $400 million bond that matured on Tuesday.

Title: Vi rises 15% on reports that it raised funds for interest repayment
Content: Shares of Vodafone Idea (Vi) rose by 14.98% to close at ₹16.43 on the BSE on Thursday. This comes after reports claimed that the company has raised enough funds for the repayment of interest to its bondholders amounting to nearly ₹6,000 crore. Last month, Vi had hiked mobile call and data tariffs by 18% to 25% for prepaid customers.

Title: LIC gets RBI nod to double its stake in IndusInd Bank to 9.99%
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted approval to Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) to increase its stake in IndusInd Bank to up to 9.99%, the bank said in a filing. LIC currently holds 4.95% of the total issued and paid up capital of IndusInd Bank. Shares of IndusInd Bank marginally rose to an intraday high of ₹966.60 on BSE.

Title: Shares of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health list at 6% discount
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health and Allied Insurance shares got listed at 6.11% discount over its issue price of ₹900. The stock opened at ₹848 on the BSE, while the opening price on the NSE was ₹845. The initial public offering of Star Health was subscribed 79% during November 30 to December 2.

Title: Govt plans to privatise 25 airports under NMP by 2025: MoS Civil Aviation
Content: Minister of State for Civil Aviation General Dr VK Singh told Lok Sabha the government has earmarked 25 airports for asset monetisation between 2022-2025 under the National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP). When asked about the criteria adopted for such privatisation, he said airports with annual traffic above 0.4 million passengers and a sizeable ongoing/proposed capex plan as per NIP were selected.

Title: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at record low of 4% for 9th time in a row
Content: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Wednesday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% and reverse repo rate at 3.35% amid concerns over the new COVID-19 variant Omicron. The rates were also left unchanged during the last MPC meeting in October 2021. This is the ninth straight time repo rate has been unchanged at 4%.

Title: Indian economy not immune to global spillovers, new variants like Omicron: RBI Governor
Content: While announcing the monetary policy, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that Indian economy is relatively "well-positioned on the path of recovery". However, he added, "It cannot be immune to global spillovers or to possible surges of infections from new mutations including the Omicron variant." The highest priority will be to put in "place credible and consistent policies", Das stated.

Title: No new Covishield orders, production to be halved from next week: SII's Poonawalla
Content: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla said that Covishield's production will be cut by at least 50% starting next week as it has no further orders from the government. World's biggest vaccine maker SII is currently producing 25 crore doses per month. "Over the eight months when we couldn't export...[Indian companies] lost a lot of market share," Poonawalla added.

Title: 3rd dose of our vaccine neutralises Omicron: Pfizer, BioNTech after initial studies
Content: Pfizer and BioNTech in a joint statement on Wednesday said that preliminary laboratory studies demonstrate that the third dose of their COVID-19 vaccine neutralises the Omicron variant. "Data shows that the third dose increases the neutralising antibody titers by 25-fold compared to two doses against the Omicron variant," the companies said.

Title: RBI to launch UPI-based payment product for feature phones
Content: The RBI on Wednesday said it will launch a UPI-based payment product for feature phone users. "Feature phone users have limited access to innovative payment products," RBI said. "Although feature phones have National Unified USSD Platform (NUUP) as an option for availing basic payment services using the short code of *99#, the same has not picked up," it added.

Title: Apple halted iPhone production for the first time in 10 years in Oct: Report
Content: Apple had to halt iPhone and iPad production for the first time in over a decade in October 2021, Nikkei Asia reported on Wednesday. iPhone and iPad assembly was halted for several days due to supply chain constraints and restrictions on power usage in China. In September and October, iPhone 13 lineup's production reportedly fell 20% short of previous plans.

Title: Elon Musk's last remaining house sells for $30 million
Content: Elon Musk, world's richest person with $282 billion fortune, has sold his last remaining home, a 47-acre Bay Area estate in Hillsborough, California, for $30 million, according to MLSListings.com. The property was listed for $37.5 million earlier this year. Tesla CEO Musk had said he was downsizing his life to work on sustainable energy for Earth and making life multi-planetary.

Title: Ambani lists 5 ideas for connectivity, says '5G rollout should be national priority'
Content: Speaking at India Mobile Congress, Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani shared five ideas related to the theme 'Connectivity for the next decade'. He said, "India must complete...migration from 2G to 4G to 5G at the earliest...Rollout of 5G should be India's national priority." He added that India should move towards greater digital inclusion and ubiquitous fibre connectivity should be done.

Title: UPI limit for investing in IPOs, government securities raised to ₹5 lakh: RBI
Content: The RBI announced that it's enhancing the transaction limit of UPI payments for investment in RBI Retail Direct Scheme for government securities (G-Secs) and IPOs from the current limit of ₹2 lakh to ₹5 lakh. To deepen digital payments further, the RBI will launch UPI-based payment products for feature phone users, Governor Shaktikanta Das said while announcing the monetary policy.

Title: Fired Better.com employee says his work screens went black right after CEO's Zoom call
Content: A man, who was among 900 Better.com employees laid off by CEO Vishal Garg on a Zoom call, told CNN his screens went black and he lost access to his company computer, phone and email. Christian Chapman said he resorted to Facebook to ask his colleagues about the layoffs. "It was...surreal moment," Chapman, a father of five children, said.

Title: Better.com's 3 top execs resign after CEO fires 900 staff over a Zoom call: Reports
Content: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's three top executives have resigned after CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, TechCrunch and Insider reported. The three executives are VP of Communications Patrick Lenihan, Head of PR Tanya Gillogley, and Head of Marketing Melanie Hahn. Separately, Garg apologised to his current employees for the "blundered execution" of layoffs.

Title: The brave die never...: Anand Mahindra on CDS General Bipin Rawat's demise
Content: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra condoled CDS General Bipin Rawat's death in the Tamil Nadu helicopter crash by tweeting, "The brave die never, though they sleep in the dust: Their courage nerves a thousand living men." He added, "We salute our fallen heroes. Om shanti." CDS General Rawat, his wife Madhulika Rawat and 11 others died in the helicopter crash.

Title: RBI retains real GDP growth forecast at 9.5% for 2021-22
Content: While announcing the monetary policy, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said real GDP growth projection for 2021-22 has been retained at 9.5% and projected growth for Q1 of 2022-23 is 17.2%. The Indian economy has "hauled itself out of one of the deepest contractions in first quarter of 2020-21", Das added. GDP growth expanded by 13.7% in first half of 2021-22.

Title: Who are the Indians in Forbes list of World's Most Powerful Women 2021?
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is ranked 37th in the Forbes list of World's Most Powerful Women 2021. She has featured in the annual list for three years in a row. HCL Corporation CEO Roshni Nadar Malhotra is ranked 52nd. Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw is ranked 72nd, while India's richest self-made female billionaire Falguni Nayar is ranked 88th.

Title: List of world's 100 most powerful women released by Forbes, MacKenzie Scott on top
Content: The 2021 list of world's 100 most powerful women has been released by Forbes. Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, has topped the list. She is followed by the US Vice President Kamala Harris. Christine Lagarde, the first woman to head the European Central Bank, is on the third spot. GM CEO Mary Barra comes fourth.

Title: Sensex jumps 800 points, reclaims 58,000 ahead of RBI monetary policy
Content: Indian benchmark indices extended their gains from the previous day and opened higher on Wednesday ahead of RBI's monetary policy decision. The Sensex jumped over 800 points in early trade to cross 58,400, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 220 points to hit 17,400. IT, banking and financial stocks, including Infosys and Bajaj Finance, were among top gainers.

Title: Investors gain ₹7.5 lakh crore in 2 days as Sensex rises 1,903 points
Content: Investors' wealth has surged by ₹7.5 lakh crore as Sensex gained nearly 2,000 points in two days. The benchmark index ended 1,016 points higher at 58,650 on Wednesday after closing 887 points higher on the previous day. The rally followed positive global cues and RBI's decision to keep repo rate unchanged at record low of 4%.

Title: Sensex ends 1,016 points higher after RBI keeps repo rate steady at 4%
Content: The Indian benchmark indices extended their gains on Wednesday after the RBI kept repo rate unchanged at 4% for the ninth straight time amid concerns over Omicron COVID-19 variant. The Sensex jumped 1,016 points to close at 58,650, while the Nifty 50 index climbed 293 points to end at 17,470. Bajaj Finance, Maruti Suzuki and SBI were among top gainers.

Title: Serum Institute's Executive Director Dr Suresh Jadhav passes away aged 71
Content: Dr Suresh Jadhav, Executive Director of world's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII), has passed away in Pune at the age of 71. He had been with SII since 1979 and was also instrumental in the production of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield. "The Biotech world has lost an irreplaceable stalwart," Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw wrote on Twitter.

Title: Mobile industry vital for India's vision for $5 tn economy by 2025: Birla
Content: Chairman of Aditya Birla Group Kumar Mangalam Birla at India Mobile Congress event said, "I believe...the mobile industry will be vital in achieving India's vision to be a $5 trillion economy by 2025." Birla asserted that a robust industry is necessary to invest and accelerate achievement of Digital India vision. He called the industry "the growth engine" of Indian economy.

Title: Cybersecurity, frauds main concerns with digital currency: RBI Governor
Content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has said cybersecurity and the possibility of digital frauds are main concerns with rolling out a central bank digital currency. He added one has to ensure cyber security and take preemptive steps to prevent any kind of fraud. Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar said work is being done on two types of CBDCs, retail and wholesale.

Title: Elon Musk backs estate tax, says his marginal tax rate is high
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to a question about how billionaires should be taxed at a Wall Street Journal summit, said, "Generally, I think...estate tax is a good tax." He said that his marginal tax rate is high, and that he pays sales tax as well. Musk also reiterated opposition to a proposal by Democrats to tax billionaires.

Title: RateGain IPO subscribed 41% on day 1, retail portion booked 2.23 times
Content: The ₹1,335 crore-IPO of travel and hospitality solutions provider RateGain Travel Technologies was subscribed 41% on the first day of bidding. The portion set aside for retail investors, which was subscribed 100% within the first hour of opening, was subscribed 2.23 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 4%. The price band for the IPO is ₹405-425 per share.

Title: Fitch cuts India's GDP forecast for 2021-22 to 8.4%
Content: Fitch Ratings has cut India's GDP growth forecast for 2021-22 to 8.4% from its previous estimate of 8.7%, saying the rebound after the second wave of COVID-19 infections has been subdued than expected. Growth in the manufacturing sector is constrained by ongoing supply shortages, it added. However, it raised GDP growth projection for the next financial year to 10.3%.

Title: 1.26 lakh jewellers registered for gold hallmarking since June: Govt
Content: Over 1.26 lakh jewellers have registered for gold hallmarking since its mandatory implementation from June this year, the government said. About 4.29 crore pieces of jewellery were hallmarked between July 1 and November 30, Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey informed the Parliament. An advisory committee was constituted to deal with the issues faced in its implementation, he added.

Title: RBI will work on PMC Bank resolution very quickly: Governor
Content: The RBI will act "very quickly" on Punjab and Maharashtra Cooperative (PMC) Bank's resolution once it receives feedback on the draft amalgamation scheme with Unity Small Finance Bank, its Governor Shaktikanta Das said. RBI has given stakeholders time till December 10 for comments on the scheme. According to the scheme, acquiring bank will pay up to ₹5 lakh to depositors.

Title: United Breweries challenges ₹752 crore CCI penalty before NCLAT
Content: United Breweries (UBL) has approached the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) against ₹751.8 crore penalty imposed on the company by the Competition Commission of India (CCI). In September, CCI had imposed the fine for alleged cartelisation in the sale and supply of beer. CCI had also imposed penalties on Carlsberg India, All India Brewers' Association (AIBA) and 11 individuals.

Title: Tweets cite old interview to claim BioNTech CEO didn't take COVID jab; firm responds
Content: Several posts on social media, including Twitter, falsely claimed that Ugur Sahin, CEO of BioNTech, the German firm that made a COVID-19 vaccine with Pfizer, hasn't taken the jab. The posts cited Sahin's interview from December 2020, AP reported. Sahin got vaccinated in early 2021 using his company's product, a BioNTech spokesperson said, adding that the interview is "completely outdated".

Title: Govt has no plans for boosting crypto sector in India: MoS Finance
Content: MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary told the Parliament on Monday that the government has "no plans for boosting the cryptocurrency sector in India". When questioned about how trustable cryptocurrency is and whether it's possible for government to regulate it, he said, "Currently, cryptocurrencies are unregulated in India." He added, "The government doesn't collect data on the cryptocurrency sector."

Title: Apple CEO signed $275 bn deal with China in 2016 to quash regulatory actions: Report
Content: Apple CEO Tim Cook signed a five-year agreement with Chinese officials in 2016, worth about $275 billion, promising Apple would do its part to develop China's economy, reported The Information. The deal was reportedly signed to quash the regulatory actions against Apple. As per internal company documents, Chinese officials believed Apple wasn't contributing enough to local economy before the deal.

Title: Govt may give crypto holders a deadline to declare assets, fine violators: Report
Content: The government may reportedly give cryptocurrency holders a deadline to declare their assets and meet any new rules that will be announced through the cryptocurrency bill. Any violators could be fined up to ₹20 crore or face 1.5 years of imprisonment, Bloomberg reported citing sources. It may also prescribe a minimum threshold for investing in crypto assets, the report said.

Title: Which are now the world's top 10 cryptos as Luna overtakes Dogecoin, Shiba Inu?
Content: Terraform Labs' Luna token has become the world's 10th largest cryptocurrency by market capitalisation, overtaking meme-based tokens Dogecoin and Shiba Inu. Bitcoin remains the world's largest cryptocurrency, followed by Ether, Binance Coin, Tether, Solana, Cardano, USD Coin, XRP and Polkadot. As per CoinMarketCap, Luna gained 30% in the last seven days, giving it a market value of $25 billion.

Title: Samsung merges mobile & consumer electronics businesses in biggest rejig since 2017
Content: Samsung Electronics is merging two of its three divisions, mobile and consumer electronics businesses, into a newly-formed SET Division. The company will now have two new CEOs for its two divisions - the semiconductors business named Device Solutions and the newly-formed SET Division. It's the biggest management shakeup by Samsung since appointing three co-CEOs for its three divisions in 2017.

Title: Deeply sorry, I blundered execution: Better.com CEO who fired 900 staff on Zoom call
Content: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg, who recently fired 900 employees on Zoom call, has said he's "deeply sorry" for the way he "handled the layoffs". "I failed to show...appropriate amount of respect and appreciation for individuals who are affected," he wrote in his memo to current employees. "In communicating I blundered the execution...I embarrassed you," Garg said.

Title: You're a bunch of dumb dolphins: CEO who fired 900 employees in old e-mail to staff
Content: An old e-mail by Vishal Garg to his employees, the CEO of US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com who recently fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, has resurfaced. In the e-mail obtained by Forbes, Garg wrote, "You are too slow. You are a bunch of Dumb Dolphins and…dumb dolphins get caught in nets and eaten by sharks."

Title: Novelist sues Amazon as seller lists his book as centuries old, with $1,008 price tag
Content: A novelist is suing Amazon after he discovered fake editions of his books being "fraudulently" advertised by third-party sellers as hundreds of years old on the website. One such edition of the $7-book was listed for $1,008, John C Boland's suit said. "When a seller claims to have a 1602 edition...it's defaming me by implying...that I'm a plagiarist," Boland said.

Title: No data on COVID-related suicides among traders, businessmen: Govt
Content: The Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) on Monday said in the Rajya Sabha that the government does not have any data on COVID-19-related suicides among vendors, tradesmen and businessmen. "This Ministry doesn't maintain data of suicides," the MSME stated. Notably, 11,716 businessmen died by suicide in 2020 as per the NCRB 2020 report, released in September 2021.

Title: Deposit $5 million in two weeks or face liquidation: Madras HC to SpiceJet
Content: The Madras High Court has stayed its earlier order of winding up SpiceJet and appointing an official liquidator for SpiceJet's non-payment of $24 million to Credit Suisse AG. The Madras High Court has now asked SpiceJet to deposit $5 million within a period of two weeks. "The company is examining the order and shall initiate appropriate remedial steps," SpiceJet said.

Title: India 'very unequal country'; top 10% hold 57% of total national income: Report
Content: The World Inequality Report 2022 states, "India stands out as a poor and very unequal country, with an affluent elite." "While the top 10% hold 57% of total national income, the bottom 50 per cent's share has gone down to 13 per cent in 2021," it said. The report has also flagged a drop in global income during 2020.

Title: UAE to move its weekend to Saturday and Sunday from Jan 1, 2022
Content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE), which currently has a Sunday-Thursday working week, will switch its weekend to Saturday and Sunday from January 1, 2022. It will also adopt a four-and-a-half-day working week as the country looks to bring itself more in line with other countries. Friday, a holy day in Islam, will be a half-day in the UAE.

Title: Sensex briefly jumps 1,100 points, ends 887 points higher ahead of RBI policy
Content: The Sensex on Tuesday briefly jumped more than 1,100 points and eventually ended 887 points higher at nearly 57,634 ahead of RBI's monetary policy announcement on December 8 (Wednesday). Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped 264 points to close at 17,177. Tata Steel, Axis Bank, ICICI Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank were the top Sensex gainers.

Title: Sensex jumps 900 points, a day after losing 950 points amid Omicron concerns
Content: The Sensex jumped more than 900 points during intraday trade, a day after it ended nearly 950 points lower at 56,747 amid concerns regarding Omicron COVID-19 variant. On Tuesday, Sensex was trading at 57,600 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 250 points to trade near 17,200. Kotak Mahindra Bank, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank were top gainers.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands to sell shares at ₹485-500 apiece in ₹1,368-cr IPO
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear retailer Metro Brands has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹485-500 per share. At the upper price band, the company will raise ₹1,367.5 crore. The IPO will open for subscription on December 10 and close on December 14. Founded in 1947, Metro Brands operates brands such as Metro, Mochi, Walkway and Crocs.

Title: HCL Technologies to hire 12,000 in US over 5 years
Content: HCL Technologies will hire 12,000 people in the US over the next five years. Nearly 2,000 of the new jobs will go to college graduates over the next three years, HCL said, adding it will focus its recruitment drive on seven states. Hiring will be done across roles including in IT consulting, cloud, data analytics and digital engineering.

Title: Tesla adds $40 billion to its market value in a day as shares rise
Content: Tesla added $40 billion to its market value as shares rose as much as 4.4% on Tuesday, marking the strongest intraday gain in more than a week. World's richest person Elon Musk-led electric carmaker's shares rose after UBS boosted its price target to $1,000 from $725. "No rival will even get close to Tesla in 2022," a UBS analyst said.

Title: Hyundai to invest ₹3,995 cr to launch 6 EVs in India by 2028
Content: Hyundai Motor plans to invest ₹3,995 crore to launch six electric vehicles in India by 2028. It will launch affordable and premium electric models including sport utility vehicles (SUVs) and sedans, starting with its first electric vehicle (EV) in 2022. "We want to be a key contributor to...EV story in India," Hyundai India's Director for sales and marketing said.

Title: Retail portion of RateGain IPO 100% booked within 1st hour of opening
Content: The retail portion of the IPO of travel and hospitality solutions provider RateGain Travel Technologies was subscribed 100% within the first hour of the opening of the issue on December 7. The ₹1,335 crore-IPO was subscribed 19%. Investors bid for 33 lakh equity shares against an IPO size of 1.73 crore units. The issue will close for subscription on Thursday.

Title: I work seven days and some 'pretty crazy hours': Elon Musk
Content: Tesla and SpaceX's CEO Elon Musk at a Wall Street Journal conference said the role of a chief executive officer (CEO) is a "made-up title" and that he is splitting his time roughly evenly between Tesla and SpaceX. "It really depends on where I'm needed most," Musk said, adding that he works seven days and some "pretty crazy hours".

Title: MedPlus fixes price band for ₹1,398 crore IPO at ₹780-₹796 apiece
Content: India's second-largest pharmacy retailer MedPlus Health Services has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹780-₹796 per share. The issue will open for subscription on December 13 and close on December 15. MedPlus is seeking to raise as much as ₹1,398.29 crore through the IPO. The offer comprises fresh issuance of ₹600 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹798.29 crore.

Title: Tesla shares fall on report of SEC probe into solar panel defects
Content: Tesla shares fell as much as 5.5% on Monday after Reuters reported that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has opened an investigation into the company. The agency reportedly launched a probe over a whistleblower complaint from a former employee alleging Tesla failed to properly notify shareholders and the public of fire risks associated with its solar panel systems.

Title: RateGain Travel raises ₹598 cr from anchor investors ahead of IPO
Content: RateGain Travel Technologies has raised ₹598.83 crore from 34 anchor investors, including the Government of Singapore, Monetary Authority of Singapore, Nomura, Goldman Sachs, BNP Paribas, HSBC, the company said. RateGain, a SaaS provider to the hospitality and travel industry, aims to raise ₹1,335 crore through IPO. The issue will open for subscription on December 7 and close on December 9.

Title: RIL forms $2 billion production JV with Abu Dhabi chemical company
Content: Reliance Industries and Abu Dhabi state-owned Chemicals Derivatives Company (TA'ZIZ) have agreed to start a more than $2 billion chemical production partnership in Ruwais, Abu Dhabi. The joint venture will construct and operate a chloralkali, ethylene dichloride (EDC) and polyvinyl chloride (PVC) production facility. The project marks Reliance's first investment in the MENA region, TA'ZIZ said.

Title: FabIndia set to file for ₹3,770 crore IPO early next year: Report
Content: Clothing brand FabIndia plans to file the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an initial public offering (IPO) of as much as ₹3,770 crore ($500 million) as soon as early next year, Bloomberg reported.
