The company is reportedly considering seeking a valuation of about ₹15,084 crore ($2 billion). The IPO will largely consist of investors selling existing shares, it added.

Title: LG Energy Solution aims to raise $10.9 bn in S Korea's biggest IPO
Content: LG Chem's wholly owned battery subsidiary LG Energy Solution is planning to raise up to 12.75 trillion won ($10.87 billion) in what would be South Korea's biggest-ever IPO. The offering could give LG Energy a market value of as much as 70.2 trillion won ($59.55 billion), making it South Korea's third most valuable company after Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix.

Title: Zoho's billionaire CEO drives Mahindra auto, offers Anand Mahindra suggestions
Content: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted that he recently got a new Mahindra Electric Treo auto and added, "I love driving it around!" Vembu went on to offer some suggestions to Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra, which included bringing the auto's price down by increasing volume. "Please offer a variety of designs and colours," Vembu added.

Title: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg fires 900 employees over a video call
Content: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg announced the mortgage company is laying off 900 employees over a video call. "If you're on this call...you're part of the unlucky group being laid off," Garg said on the call that surfaced on social media. "This is the second time in my career I'm doing this...The last time I did it, I cried," he added.

Title: 250 of them were working just 2 hours a day: Better.com CEO who fired 900 staff
Content: US-based mortgage lender Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a video call, claimed that 250 of them were working two hours a day while clocking over eight hours daily in the payroll system. "They were stealing from you and stealing from our customers who pay the bills that pay our bills," he wrote in a blog post.

Title: Sensex falls 949 points to end at 56,747, Nifty below 16,950 amid Omicron concerns
Content: Sensex fell 949 points to close at 56,747 while Nifty ended 284 points lower at 16,912 on Monday amid concerns regarding the Omicron COVID-19 variant. Among sectors, the IT index fell over 2%, while other sectors lost a percent each. Key benchmark indices have extended losses and registered fresh intra-day lows with major weakness witnessed in IT and FMCG stocks.

Title: Salesmen threaten to disrupt supplies to kirana stores in protest against Reliance
Content: Household goods salesmen have threatened to disrupt supplies to kirana stores if consumer companies provide products at lower prices to Reliance Industries, Reuters reported. Last year, salesmen of companies like Unilever and Colgate-Palmolive saw a 20-25% drop in their sales. The drop in sales was attributed to kirana stores ordering digitally from JioMart owing to 'deeply discounted offerings'.

Title: Granting cryptos the status of financial asset fraught with risks: CEA
Content: Chief Economic Adviser KV Subramanian said granting cryptocurrencies the status of a financial asset is fraught with risks currently. "A cryptocurrency doesn't derive its value from any underlying assets or earnings...So, valuation can be easily swayed with speculative bids, causing excessive volatility," he added. "Retail investors...would struggle to cope with such wild fluctuations," he said.

Title: Let's not repeat past mistakes in electric mobility: NITI Aayog CEO
Content: NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant said India must learn from the mistakes made in electronics and solar manufacturing and not repeat them with electric mobility. Kant said, "In the last 70 years, India has always been getting into the sunset areas of industry." "We must make India the centre of manufacturing both for Indian market and...the world," he added.

Title: Bitcoin falls 5% to trade below $48,000, Ether down 5.5%
Content: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as low as 5% on Monday and was trading below $48,000. Ether, the second-largest digital currency, was also trading 5.5% lower at $3,965. The development came after several global cryptocurrencies plunged over the weekend amid worries about the Omicron variant of coronavirus. Bitcoin lost over a fifth of its value at one point on Saturday.

Title: MapmyIndia IPO to open on December 9 at ₹1,000-1,033 per share
Content: The IPO of CE Info Systems, which operates MapMyIndia, will open for subscription on December 9. The company, which powers Apple maps in India, has fixed a price band at ₹1,000-1,033 per share for the IPO. The IPO is entirely an offer for sale of 1,00,63,945 shares with a face value of ₹2 each by existing shareholders and promoters.

Title: Create a powerful, seamless platform like UPI: Vaishnaw to bankers
Content: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has challenged bankers to create a platform as powerful and seamless as the UPI (Unified Payments Interface) for providing quick and easy credit to people at the bottom of the pyramid. "Work on the challenge for the next three months...I'll work the whole day with you to look at the concepts you have brought," he said.

Title: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley to bid for MapmyIndia's IPO: Report
Content: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are among institutional investors bidding to participate in the initial public offering (IPO) of digital-map provider MapmyIndia, Bloomberg reported. Mutual funds of HDFC, SBI, Aditya Birla Group and ICICI Bank are also bidding to become anchor investors in the IPO, it added. The price band for the IPO has been fixed at ₹1,000-1,033 per share.

Title: We must look beyond valuations for startup IPOs: Edelweiss Chairman
Content: Edelweiss Group's Chairman Rashesh Shah said that everyone should look beyond valuations in case of startup IPOs. "Like most other markets, the startup market also goes through up cycles and down cycles. We are currently in what is clearly an upcycle," he added. "We must...focus on the real and tangible change that these startups are bringing...to the ecosystem," Shah said.

Title: States entering into MoUs with Amazon unfortunate: CAIT
Content: Traders' body CAIT said it is "most unfortunate and regrettable" that several Indian states have entered into memorandum of understandings (MoUs) with Amazon to sell products of government agencies. Such MoUs are strongly contradicting "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" and "Vocal for Local" campaign initiated by PM Narendra Modi, it added. "Amazon is continuously violating Indian laws & rules," CAIT said.

Title: Long waiting periods amid chip shortage can impact demand: Maruti official
Content: Longer waiting periods with semiconductor shortage affecting production can have a negative impact on car demand, Maruti Suzuki India's Senior Executive Director (Marketing and Sales) Shashank Srivastava said. Maruti has a pending order of around 2.5 lakh units, while production was over 80% of normal in November, he added. Supply constraints have improved in last few months, he said.

Title: ₹100 cr unaccounted income detected after raids on Kolkata-based group
Content: The Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted income of about ₹100 crore after it raided a Kolkata-based group, engaged in manufacturing of TMT bars and construction material, the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) said. It further said that ₹75 lakh cash and jewellery valued at ₹2.26 crore were seized. Some bank lockers were put under restraint, it said.

Title: Will pay ₹1,000 cr to Reliance Infra's arm in 48 hours: Delhi Metro to HC
Content: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) told the Delhi High Court that it will pay ₹1,000 crore to Anil Ambani-led Reliance Infrastructure's subsidiary, Delhi Airport Metro Express, within 48 hours. DMRC has sought time to compute entire amount of liability. In September, Supreme Court had upheld an arbitration award worth over ₹4,600 crore in favour of Reliance Infrastructure against DMRC.

Title: Evergrande shares hit 11-year-low after it gives no guarantee on repayments
Content: China's Evergrande Group shares fell 12% to an 11-year low on Monday after the firm said there was no guarantee it would have enough funds to meet debt repayments. A 30-day grace period on a coupon payment of $82.5 million due on November 6 ends on Monday. Evergrande said it received a demand from creditors to pay about $260 million.

Title: Ted Baker Chairman John Barton dies aged 77
Content: British luxury clothing retail firm Ted Baker on Monday said that its Chairman John Barton has died at the age of 77. The firm did not specify the cause of his death, but said it was sudden. Senior independent director Helena Feltham will take on the role of Interim Chairman with immediate effect, the company added.

Title: Infosys to do away with COO role after Rao's retirement: Report
Content: Infosys will do away with the role of Chief Operating Officer (COO) after incumbent Pravin Rao retires this month, reported Moneycontrol. The company will instead create a leadership structure giving key leaders additional responsibilities, it added. Rao was inducted in 2014 as a member of the company's board and also serves as the board's Whole-time Director.

Title: Talks of reverse repo rate hike at RBI MPC meet may be premature: SBI report
Content: The talks of a reverse repo rate hike at the RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting on December 8 may be premature, SBI's house economists said in a report. "RBI has been able to narrow the corridor without the noise of rate hikes and ensuing market cacophony," they added. They also urged the RBI to delay liquidity normalisation measures.

Title: IPO-bound LIC improves asset quality, lowers net NPA to 0.05%
Content: Ahead of its proposed initial public offering (IPO), LIC has improved its asset quality for financial year 2020-21. According to LIC's latest annual report, its sub-standard assets are ₹254.37 crore, whereas the doubtful assets are ₹20,369.17 crore and loss assets are ₹14,506.35 crore. LIC's net NPA was at 0.05% at March-end, as against 0.79% in the previous year.

Title: Agri products' FY22 export target of $43 bn set to be achieved: Minister
Content: Union Minister Anupriya Patel has said that India's record export target of $43 billion for agricultural products in 2021-22 would be achieved. The target would be achieved because of the efforts by farmers and APEDA, she added. India has set a $400 billion target for merchandise exports for FY22, of which $262 billion has already been achieved, Patel said.

Title: India's airlines incurred loss of ₹19,564 crore in 2020-21: Govt
Content: The airlines in India incurred an estimated loss of ₹19,564 crore in 2020-21 due to disruption caused by COVID-19 pandemic, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said. Indian airports also suffered an estimated loss of ₹5,116 crore in the last fiscal, he added. Scheduled domestic flights were suspended in India from March 25 to May 24 last year.

Title: Ethos, Senco plan to launch IPOs worth ₹500 crore each in Jan: Report
Content: Luxury watch retailer Ethos and jewellery retailer Senco, are planning to launch IPOs worth ₹500 crore each, The Economic Times reported. The IPOs could be launched in January, it added. Ethos, which is an authorised retailer for watch brands such as Rolex, Omega and Tag Heuer, is reportedly working with Emkay Global and Incred Capital for the IPO.

Title: Over 3 crore ITRs filed for AY 2021-22 on new I-T portal: Govt
Content: More than 3 crore income tax returns have now been filed for the assessment year 2021-22 on the new I-T portal, the Ministry of Finance said in a statement. "The number of ITRs filed per day is over 4 lakh and increasing everyday," it added. The last date for filing ITR for individual taxpayers is December 31.

Title: Hindustan Unilever MD Sanjiv Mehta to be appointed FICCI President
Content: The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) on Monday announced that Hindustan Unilever's Chair and Managing Director Sanjiv Mehta will be appointed as its President on December 18. Mehta, who currently serves as FICCI's Senior Vice President, will succeed Uday Shankar, the former President of The Walt Disney Company Asia Pacific.

Title: Companies raised ₹52,759 crore from IPOs in 2021-22 till October: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday informed the Lok Sabha that 61 companies have raised ₹52,759 crore through initial public offerings (IPOs) in financial year 2021-22 till October. Out of the 61 firms, 34 entities were small and medium enterprises (SMEs), she added. In the last fiscal, 56 companies had garnered ₹31,060 crore from IPOs, Sitharaman said.

Title: Bitcoin plunges 20%, cryptocurrency market's value falls to $2.2 trillion
Content: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin plunged more than 20% on Saturday and fell to as low as $42,296, before paring some of the losses. Meanwhile, the second-largest cryptocurrency Ether also fell as much as 17.4%. The overall cryptocurrency sector shed around a fifth of its market capitalisation, taking its total value to $2.2 trillion, according to CoinGecko.

Title: Banks may lose parts of traditional business to Google Pay, PhonePe: Uday Kotak
Content: India's richest banker Uday Kotak has said Indian lenders may end up losing large parts of their traditional business to digital wallet platforms like Google Pay and Walmart-backed PhonePe. Banks need to scale up technology, Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO added. "Bankers were short-sighted over the last three years...Their standard response was 'oh, there's no money in payments'," Kotak said further.

Title: $1 trillion wiped off Chinese stocks in US in 10 months amid tech crackdown
Content: Chinese stocks trading in the US have lost over $1 trillion in market value since their record highs in mid-February amid a crackdown on tech industry. Billionaire Jack Ma's Alibaba Group lost the most during the period as its market value fell by $430 billion or 60%. On Friday, Nasdaq Golden Dragon China Index, which tracks these stocks, fell 9.1%.

Title: A lot of speculation is happening on crypto, it's not healthy: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit 2021 said there is a lot of unregulated speculation happening on cryptocurrencies. "It is not healthy at all," she added. She reiterated that a "well-consulted bill" on cryptocurrency is coming through and it will be introduced in the Parliament after the Cabinet clears it.

Title: Wouldn't want crypto investors to marry into my family: 97-yr-old billionaire Munger
Content: Charlie Munger, Warren Buffett's longtime business partner, said in an interview that he "wouldn't want" anyone who invests in cryptocurrencies "to marry into my family". "The people who are getting in cryptocurrencies are not thinking about the customer, they're thinking about themselves," the 97-year-old billionaire added. Munger also praised China's crypto ban as the "correct decision".

Title: Got copies of Musk's straight, male, PayPal mafia e-mail group: Courtney Love
Content: US singer Courtney Love Cobain told the world's richest person Elon Musk on Twitter, "You know your straight, male, PayPal mafia email group? I was on bcc for months on that." She wrote, "With that information in mind, don't you think in a 'civilised society' one should embrace paying...fair share of tax?" "Don't pick on [Senator] Bernie [Sanders]," Cobain said.

Title: Trump's social media venture TRUTH Social claims to raise $1 billion
Content: Donald Trump's new social media venture, TRUTH Social, said it has entered into agreements to raise about $1 billion from a group of investors. "$1 billion sends an important message to Big Tech that censorship and political discrimination must end. America is ready for TRUTH Social, a platform that will not discriminate on the basis of political ideology," said Trump.

Title: Ratan Tata to be conferred Assam's highest civilian award 'Asom Baibhav'
Content: The Chief Minister of Assam, Himanta Biswa Sarma, on Saturday announced that the state has chosen 19 personalities for its three newly-instituted awards - Asom Baibhav, Asom Sourav and Asom Gourav. He said industrialist and Tata Trusts' Chairman Ratan Tata will be conferred the state's highest civilian award, Asom Baibhav, for his exceptional contribution towards furthering cancer care in Assam.

Title: PepsiCo's patent on potato variety grown for Lay's chips revoked by India
Content: The Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights (PPVFR) Authority has revoked a patent for a potato variety grown exclusively for PepsiCo's Lay's potato chips. The body agreed with activist Kavitha Kuruganti's contention that PepsiCo can't claim a patent over a seed variety. In 2019, PepsiCo sued some Gujarati farmers for cultivating FC5 potato variety, saying they infringed patent rights.

Title: Which are the world's cheapest cities to live in?
Content: As per the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU)'s Worldwide Cost of Living 2021 survey, Damascus in Syria is the world's cheapest city to live in. Tripoli (Libya), Tashkent (Uzbekistan), Tunis (Tunisia) and Almaty (Kazakhstan) are also among the top five cheapest cities. Pakistan's Karachi is in the sixth position and India's Ahmedabad (in Gujarat) is ranked seventh.

Title: Which cities have the highest petrol prices in the world?
Content: As per Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) Worldwide Cost of Living 2021 survey, petrol is the most expensive in Hong Kong at $2.50 (around ₹190) per litre. Netherlands' Amsterdam ($2.18/litre) and Norway's Oslo ($2.06/litre) have the second and third-highest petrol costs. Israel's Tel Aviv ($2/litre), which emerged as the world's most expensive city overall, ranked fourth in the petrol prices list.

Title: Which are the best and worst cities for expats in 2021 as per a recent survey?
Content: Kuala Lumpur has been ranked the best place to live for expats in 2021, according to a survey conducted by Munich-based expat network InterNations. Kuala Lumpur is followed by Málaga in Spain, Dubai, Sydney and Singapore in the top five. Rome was ranked the worst place for expats, while Milan, Johannesburg, Istanbul and Tokyo were among the bottom five.

Title: Vodafone files for settlement of ₹20,000-cr retro tax dispute with India
Content: Vodafone Group has filed an application with the Indian government to settle its ₹20,000-crore retrospective tax dispute. Vodafone further said it has "always been confident" that no tax is due on the company. The government in August passed the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021 to do away with retrospective tax demand provisions.

Title: IMF likely to lower global economic growth estimates due to Omicron: MD
Content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is likely to lower its global economic growth estimates due to the Omicron variant of COVID-19, its MD Kristalina Georgieva said. "A new variant that may spread very rapidly can dent confidence...we're likely to see some downgrades of our October projections," she added. The Omicron variant has been detected in around 40 countries, officials said.

Title: Hero Electric plans to raise $200 million to $300 million: Report
Content: India's largest electric two-wheeler maker Hero Electric is planning to raise fresh funds to the tune of $200-$300 million, reported Moneycontrol. It will reportedly look to tap private equity funds and pension funds for the new round. Hero Electric's MD Naveen Munjal told Moneycontrol that seeking investments are a continuous process for any company to scale and meet market demand.

Title: El Salvador buys Bitcoin worth $7.3 mn as it falls as low as 22%
Content: El Salvador purchased Bitcoin worth more than $7.3 million after the world's largest cryptocurrency plunged as low as 22% to $41,967 on Saturday. "El Salvador just bought the dip! 150 coins at an average USD price of ~$48,670," the country's President Nayib Bukele tweeted. The market capitalisation of global cryptocurrencies has dropped nearly 15% to $2.34 trillion, as per CoinGecko.

Title: Tesla's duty cut proposal being evaluated by govt: NITI Aayog CEO
Content: NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant told ET the government is currently evaluating Tesla's proposal seeking a reduction in import duties ahead of a local launch and a decision will be taken shortly. Kant earlier told CNBC-TV18, "India's objective is to ensure Tesla makes in India for the world." He said Tesla wants to test the market before investing in India.

Title: SoftBank COO seeking $2 bn in compensation over next few yrs: NYT
Content: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's Chief Operating Officer Marcelo Claure is seeking roughly $2 billion in compensation over the next several years, reported The New York Times. SoftBank executives are reportedly willing to pay Claure "tens of millions of dollars" at most. The company said, "SoftBank and Claure are actively engaged in discussions about his role at the company and his compensation."

Title: I'm hopeful this year's GDP will be very encouraging: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, said "I am very hopeful that this year's GDP would be very encouraging and we will still be the fastest-growing economy in the world." She added, "An element of uncertainty continues over the Omicron variant of the coronavirus. But Indians are resilient, they've shown they can adapt to any situation."

Title: Indian economy fastest in world to come out of COVID-19's impact: Shah
Content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Indian economy is the fastest in the world to come out of the impact of COVID-19 pandemic. It was due to the policy decisions taken by Modi government, he added. PM Modi visualised that economic slump would affect the world, but government's policy decisions ensured that global economic slowdown didn't touch India, Shah said.

Title: SBI to auction KSK Mahanadi's NPA account to recover ₹4,100 cr dues
Content: The SBI will auction a non-performing asset (NPA) account of KSK Mahanadi Power on December 31 to recover outstanding dues of over ₹4,100 crore. It has invited bids from asset reconstruction firms, banks, NBFCs and financial institutions for the sale. The reserve price for the sale has been set at ₹1,423.17 crore, the bank said in an auction notice.

Title: Working from home will not go away post COVID-19: Anand Mahindra
Content: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted that working from home will not go away even after the COVID-19 pandemic is over. "Some form of hybrid work culture will endure," he said. Mahindra also posted a report announcing that Tech Mahindra has acquired a 100% stake in Activus Connect, a work-at-home customer experience management solutions provider, for $62 million.

Title: Emphasis on infra spending to continue in Budget 2022: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that emphasis on infrastructure spending will continue in the upcoming Budget 2022 to some extent. Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, she also said that the government is continuously taking policy decisions for ease of doing business. "If decision-making is complicated, time-consuming and burdensome, it cannot help," she added.

Title: Star Health cuts IPO size after 79% subscription on last day: Report
Content: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health and Allied Insurance will cut the offer-for-sale portion of its ₹7,249-crore IPO, Reuters reported. The development comes after the company's offer was subscribed 79%, despite extending the subscription period. India's largest private health insurer Star Health's IPO was set to be the country's third-largest IPO of 2021 after Paytm and Zomato.

Title: Time of extreme pain in India, economy below 2019 levels: Abhijit Banerjee
Content: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee has said people in India are in extreme pain and the economy is still below the 2019 levels. Speaking at Ahmedabad University's convocation ceremony, he further said, "I...spent some time in rural West Bengal and the stories you hear about...dashed aspirations of...people are very real." People had small aspirations which have become smaller now, Banerjee added.

Title: Shriram Properties fixes price band at ₹113-118 per share for ₹600-cr IPO
Content: Shriram Properties has fixed the price band for its ₹600-crore IPO at ₹113-₹118 per share. The IPO, which will open for subscription on December 8, comprises a fresh issue of ₹250 crore and an offer for sale of ₹350 crore by investors. Of the issue size, 75% portion is reserved for qualified institutional buyers and 15% for non-institutional investors.

Title: Grab opportunity created by closure of plants in China: Rane to entrepreneurs
Content: Union Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Narayan Rane has urged Indian entrepreneurs to take advantage of closure of factories in China. "China is number one in the world in terms of production...However, many companies are shutting down [in China]," Rane said. "I've urged...industrialists to capture this opportunity and start manufacturing these products in India," he said.

Title: Millennials can now start goal-based investments even with ₹500: Moneyfy
Content: Aiming to make investing easy and uncomplicated, Tata Capital's Moneyfy App promises to take care of your financial needs and aspirations from goal-setting to transacting. With Moneyfy App, you can invest in a SIP with as low as ₹500. Goal-based financial planning is now achievable as one can choose from diverse well-researched and unbiased mutual fund schemes, said Tata Capital.

Title: Google indefinitely delays office return plan amid concerns over Omicron: Report
Content: Alphabet's Google has indefinitely delayed its mandatory return-to-office plan globally amid concerns over the Omicron variant of COVID-19, Reuters reported. In August, Google said it'd expect workers to come in three days a week from January 10, 2022, ending its voluntary work-from-home policy. Google was one of the first companies to ask employees to work from home during COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: $230 billion wiped off Meta's market value in last three months
Content: Facebook parent Meta has lost about $230 billion from its market value since September 7. The slump in Meta's shares in the recent months has been driven by former employee and whistleblower Frances Haugen's revelations and disappointing quarterly results. Meta shares fell 8% for the week ending December 3, on track to suffer its worst weekly decline since June 2020.

Title: Elon Musk loses $15 billion in a day as tech stocks slump
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth dropped by $15 billion on Friday, the most among tech billionaires, as Tesla shares extended losses amid fears of inflation. His net worth fell to $268.9 billion, Bloomberg reported. Jeff Bezos' net worth dropped by $2.7 billion as Amazon shares declined. Top 10 US tech billionaires' combined wealth fell by $27.4 billion on Friday.

Title: Musk, Bezos sell over $20 billion worth of Tesla, Amazon stock this year
Content: World's two richest person Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos have sold over $20 billion of their companies' shares between them so far this year, as stock sales by CEOs soared to a record high. Tesla CEO Musk sold over $10 billion worth of shares, as of Thursday. Amazon's Founder and former CEO Bezos has shed $10 billion worth of shares.

Title: Adani shares pic with Mamata, says 'discussed investment scenarios in WB'
Content: Industrialist Gautam Adani on Thursday shared an image with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and said he discussed different investment scenarios with her. "Discussed different investment scenarios and the tremendous potential of West Bengal. I look forward to attending the Bengal Global Business Summit (BGBS) in April 2022," Adani tweeted. Reportedly, the meeting lasted over one hour.

Title: Ratan Tata likens COVID-19 to world war, calls it opportunity to innovate
Content: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata in an interview with YourStory likened coronavirus to world war and called it an opportunity for entrepreneurs to innovate. "The virus will disappear in a period of time, but the innovativeness that we bring...would be something we could look back on and say there was a good part of what we faced," he added.

Title: Grab CEO briefly turns billionaire before ride-hailing app loses $17 bn in m-cap
Content: Southeast Asia's biggest ride-hailing and delivery app Grab fell over 20% in US stock market debut on Thursday, wiping about $17 billion from its market capitalisation. Its Co-founder and CEO Anthony Tan briefly became a billionaire before the value of his stake dropped to $725 million. "The price makes no difference...I'm going to celebrate tonight," Tan said after the listing.

Title: Paytm shares jump after it receives first 'buy' rating post IPO
Content: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications jumped after receiving the first 'buy' rating since the company's stock market debut. Dolat Capital said it expects Paytm to turn profitable by March 2026 and has set a target price of ₹2,500, 16% higher than its issue price of ₹2,150. The company's shares closed 3.08% higher on Friday at ₹1649.80 on the BSE.

Title: Anand Mahindra shares pics of sunset in Kochi, says 'God's own country, indeed'
Content: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has tweeted pictures of sunset taken in Kerala's Kochi. "God's own country? Yes indeed. Without exaggeration," he wrote with the pictures. "Beautiful no doubt about it, truly it's God's own country having spent some wonderful time there with family," a Twitter user reacted on his post.

Title: US woman wins $10mn case against Walmart after stepping on nail, losing part of leg
Content: Walmart has been ordered to pay $10 million in damages to a woman who filed a lawsuit against the company after losing part of her leg after she stepped on a rusty nail in their store in US. The woman said that because of the infection from the nail in 2015, most of her right leg was amputated.

Title: India-born Gita Gopinath to become IMF's second-highest ranking official in 2022
Content: IMF has announced that Chief Economist Gita Gopinath will take up the role of First Deputy Managing Director (FDMD) in 2022, becoming its second-highest ranking official. India-born Gopinath, who was scheduled to return to Harvard University in January 2022, has decided to stay at IMF. "She is the right person at the right time," IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said.

Title: World's largest shipping company to give $1,000 each to 80,000 employees
Content: World's largest shipping company Maersk will give a $1,000 bonus each to 80,000 employees worldwide as the company heads for record profits this year, Bloomberg reported citing an internal memo. The company's top 400 managers are not included in the programme. As per estimates, Maersk is set to report a net income of more than $17 billion this year.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear firm Metro Brands' IPO to open on December 10
Content: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear retailer Metro Brands' IPO will open for subscription on December 10 and close on December 14. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹295 crore and an offer for sale of 2.14 crore shares by its existing shareholders and promoters. Founded in 1947, Metro Brands operates brands such as Metro, Mochi, Walkway and Crocs.

Title: Billionaire Mark Cuban buys entire town named Mustang with population of 23 in US
Content: US billionaire Mark Cuban has bought the entire town of Mustang in Texas for an undisclosed amount. The 77-acre town is said to have a population of 23 people and was first put up on sale in 2017 with an asking price of $4 million. "I don't know what, if anything, I will do with it (Mustang)," Cuban told media.

Title: I believe in blockchain tech, it's different from crypto: Ambani
Content: Speaking at the InFinity Forum, Asia's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, "Blockchain is the technology I believe in and it's different from cryptocurrency." He noted that digital technology is "a great leveller" and "democratiser". "We are witnessing the fourth revolution...the digital-first revolution," he said, adding that it will be "the people's first world".

Title: I wish cryptocurrencies had never been invented: Berkshire's Munger
Content: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice Chairman Charlie Munger said he wishes cryptocurrencies had never been invented. "I admire the Chinese, I think they made the correct decision, which was to simply ban them. In my country, the English-speaking civilisation has made the wrong decision," Munger said at the Sohn conference. "I just can't stand participating in these insane booms," he added.

Title: Distinction needed between crypto as asset & currency: CEA Subramanian
Content: Chief Economic Adviser KV Subramanian on Friday said that a distinction is needed between cryptocurrency as an asset and as a currency. "For currencies, there are important considerations that need to come in. There is no underlying that backs the cryptocurrency price," he said. "A financial innovation that is a zero-sum game has to be treaded carefully," Subramanian added.

Title: OYO appoints SBI's ex-Chairman Rajnish Kumar as Strategic Group Advisor
Content: Hospitality firm OYO on Thursday said that it has appointed former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar as Strategic Group Advisor. Kumar will advise the company's management on short and long-term strategies, regulatory and stakeholder engagement besides enhancing the brand of the company globally, OYO said. Recently, fintech startup BharatPe had appointed Kumar as Chairman of its board.

Title: Binny Bansal sold 0.3% Flipkart stake worth $200 mn in July: Report
Content: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal sold a part of his stake in the firm worth $200-250 million to Tencent Holdings in July when Flipkart last raised funds, The Economic Times reported. Flipkart had raised $3.6 billion in funding at $37.6 billion valuation in July. Bansal, who earlier held 2.7% stake, still holds around 2.4% in the company after the stake sale.

Title: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $1 bn, bringing total to over $10 bn
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold another 9,34,091 shares of Tesla worth $1.01 billion, US SEC filings showed. The sales were to help him offset taxes on the exercise of about 2.1 million options. This brings the total of shares sold to 10.1 million for about $10.9 billion since Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.

Title: FBI yet to find proof for claim that Saudi hacked Bezos' phone: Report
Content: The FBI is yet to find proof to support claims of alleged hacking of Amazon's Jeff Bezos' phone by Saudi Arabia, Business Insider reported citing a WSJ report. The FBI began investigating the hacking theory after the National Enquirer story on Bezos' affair with Lauren Sanchez was published. However, Saudi Arabia had called the hacking allegations "absurd".

Title: Fraud-accused Theranos Founder's 4 am daily schedule shared amid trial
Content: American blood-testing startup Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes' handwritten note detailing her daily schedule was shared during her fraud trial. The schedule begins with a 4 am wakeup time to "rise & thank God" and ends with lunch and dinner menus. It also includes a set of notes that Holmes claims were her ex-boyfriend and ex-Theranos President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani's precepts.

Title: Need reasons why petrol products can't be brought under GST: Kerala HC
Content: The Kerala High Court said that genuine reasons were needed as to why petroleum products cannot be brought under GST. This comes after GST Council said it would be difficult to bring the products under GST during the pandemic. "Pandemic period can't be cited as a reason...even during the pandemic, several decisions were taken involving revenue, after deliberations," HC added.

Title: Jet Airways in talks with Boeing, Airbus to purchase 100 aircraft
Content: Jet Airways is in talks with Boeing and Airbus to purchase at least 100 narrowbody jets, its owners, Murari Lal Jalan and Kalrock Capital, said. "It'll be at least something that covers us for...next five to six years," Jalan said. The group is set to invest about $200 million through equity and debt in Jet in next six months.

Title: Tega Industries' ₹619-crore IPO subscribed 219 times on final day
Content: Kolkata-based Tega Industries' ₹619-crore initial public offer (IPO) was subscribed 219.04 times on the last day of subscription. It received bids for 209.58 crore shares against an offer size of 95.68 lakh shares. The portion reserved for non-institutional investors was booked 666.19 times. The issue, which is a complete offer-for-sale, was fully subscribed within an hour of bidding on Wednesday.

Title: Sensex surges 776 points to close at 58,461, Nifty ends above 17,400
Content: The Sensex on Thursday surged by 776.50 points or 1.35% higher to close at 58,461.29, while the broader Nifty 50 rose 234.80 points or 1.37% to end at 17,401.70. HDFC soared 4% to end as top Sensex gainer, followed by PowerGrid, Sun Pharma, Tata Steel, Tech Mahindra and Bajaj Finserv. ICICI Bank and Axis Bank were among the top losers.

Title: Current vaccines likely protect against severe COVID from Omicron: BioNTech CEO
Content: German company BioNTech's CEO Uğur Şahin has said the current generation of COVID-19 vaccines will likely still protect against severe illness in people infected by Omicron variant. "Our message is: Don't freak out, the plan remains the same: Speed up the administration of a third booster shot," he added. BioNTech and Pfizer made one of the first vaccines against COVID-19.

Title: Who is Vineeta Agarwala, new Twitter CEO's wife & adjunct Stanford professor?
Content: Vineeta Agarwala, wife of Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal, is a physician and an adjunct clinical professor at Stanford School of Medicine. She's also a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) where she leads investments for the venture capital firm's bio fund. Vineeta holds a BS in biophysics from Stanford University and MD and PhD degrees from Harvard Medical School/MIT.

Title: Elon Musk mocks Twitter's CEO change with meme showing Parag Agrawal as Stalin
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk mocked Twitter's recent changes by sharing a meme showing new Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal as former Soviet Union dictator Joseph Stalin. It also showed Jack Dorsey as Stalin's aide Nikolay Yezhov, who was assassinated. Musk's tweet may've been a dig on Agrawal's past comments on free speech as Twitter banned posting of pictures without people's consent.

Title: India exports its best test taking talent: Zoho CEO on many India-born CEOs in US
Content: After Parag Agrawal became Twitter's CEO, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explained why many large US tech companies have India-born CEOs. "India has specialised in exporting its best test taking talent," he tweeted. This talent pool will excel in a system like US that's "too focused on metrics", he added. "Is there a more competitive test than IIT JEE?" Vembu asked.

Title: Nothing wrong with Indians going abroad & excelling, I'd applaud them: Narayana Murthy
Content: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy told Moneycontrol that a small percentage of Indians going abroad and excelling in their profession only "enhances the brand image of India". "[They're] our ambassadors...I'd like to applaud them rather than say they've to stay back in India. There's nothing wrong," Murthy said. His comments come days after India-born Parag Agrawal was appointed Twitter CEO.

Title: $50 'Cyberwhistle' sold out in hours after Musk's tweet, reseller lists it for $2,250
Content: Tesla's 'Cyberwhistle', which costs $50 (₹3,750), appeared to have sold out within hours after CEO Elon Musk tweeted about its launch. Resellers have already been listing the item on eBay at high prices of up to $2,250 (₹1.68 lakh). Earlier, world's richest person Musk referred to Apple's $19 'Polishing Cloth' as "silly" and asked people to buy the 'Cyberwhistle' instead.

Title: Dorsey's Square changes company name to 'Block' after he resigns as Twitter CEO
Content: Payments company Square has announced that it's changing its corporate name to 'Block', effective December 10, amid its plan to expand into new technologies like blockchain. This comes days after its Founder and CEO Jack Dorsey stepped down as Twitter CEO. The name change is intended to house the company's products, including Cash App, TBD, and Square, under one brand.

Title: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki to hike prices in January
Content: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki on Thursday said that it will hike prices in January next year due to increase in various input costs. "It has become imperative for the company to pass on some impact of the...additional costs to customers through a price hike," Maruti said. The price hike shall vary for different models, the company added.

Title: MP Police officer who took action against Amazon in weed smuggling case transferred
Content: Bhind SP Manoj Kumar Singh, who took action against Amazon India officials in the alleged smuggling of marijuana through its platform, is among 13 IPS officers who were transferred in Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. Sharing the list, Confederation of All India Traders' Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said, "It shows how the government's working under pressure of Amazon on MP government."

Title: GST collection in November at ₹1.31 lakh crore, second-highest ever
Content: The government on Wednesday said that ₹1,31,526 crore gross GST revenue was collected in November 2021, registering the second-highest amount collected since GST's introduction. The revenues are 25% higher than the GST revenues in the same month last year and 27% over 2019-20. In April, the government's GST collection stood at around ₹1.40 lakh crore, making it the highest ever.

Title: Zara Co-founder's 37-yr-old daughter Marta Ortega to lead the parent company
Content: Marta Ortega, the 37-year-old daughter of Zara Co-founder Amancio Ortega, has been named the next Chairwoman of Zara's parent company Inditex following a "generational handover process". Spanish retail giant Inditex owns high street chains Zara, Bershka and Massimo Dutti. Marta Ortega, who's been with the firm for 15 years, will take over as Chairwoman of Inditex from April 1, 2022.

Title: Founders smiling with pride: Mahindra as govt unveils special stamp on Group's 75th yr
Content: Minister of State for Communications, Devusinh Chauhan, on Wednesday released the commemorative stamp marking 75 years of the Mahindra Group. Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra wrote on Twitter, "Our founders started the company to serve the nation & I know, wherever they are now, they're smiling with pride." "They [Mahindra Group] showcase Atmanirbhar Bharat," Chauhan said.

Title: SC to sentence Mallya for contempt on Jan 18, says 'can't wait forever'
Content: The Supreme Court said it can't wait "forever" for fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya and has fixed January 18 as final date for deciding quantum of sentence against him in the 2017 contempt of court case. "It's up to Mallya to appear in person," the SC added. Mallya was found guilty of contempt for transferring $40 million to his children.

Title: Disney names Susan Arnold as its 1st woman Chairman in 98-year history
Content: Walt Disney has elected a woman to become its chairman for the first time in its 98-year history. Susan Arnold, who has been a board member for 14 years, will succeed Bob Iger as Chairman on December 31. Iger, who stepped down as Disney's CEO in 2020 after 15 years in the role, will leave the company later this month.

Title: Vaccinating the world against COVID-19 to cost $50 billion: OECD
Content: OECD has estimated it would cost $50 billion to vaccinate the world against COVID-19. It's a measure that's key to tackling the imbalances "plaguing the recovery", OECD Chief Economist Laurence Boone said. "When you balance things out, $10 trillion for supporting our economy...compared with $50 billion to bring the vaccine to...world population, that looks completely disproportionate," she added.

Title: China plans to ban loophole used by tech firms for foreign IPOs: Report
Content: China is planning to ban companies from going public on foreign stock markets through variable interest entities, Bloomberg said. It is among changes included in a new draft of China's overseas listing rules that may be finalised as soon as this month. Companies using the VIE structure would still be allowed to pursue IPOs in Hong Kong, subject to approval.

Title: Cryptos not suitable for transactions due to volatility: Nilekani
Content: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said cryptocurrencies are not suitable for transactions because of volatility and high transaction costs. "If we've a...well regulated...crypto market, not as currency but as assets and lot of young people build innovative applications around that then these...people could create a wave of global companies," he added. There's a role for crypto as assets, he said.

Title: ₹500 cr undisclosed income detected after raids on Jaipur-based group
Content: The Income Tax Department has detected undisclosed income of over ₹500 crore after it raided a Jaipur-based group, involved in manufacturing and export of jewellery and coloured gem stones, the CBDT said. Out of the total, ₹72 crore was admitted by the group entities as undisclosed income, CBDT added. Jewellery worth ₹9 crore and ₹4 crore cash was also seized.

Title: Tata Group to get stake in Cochin airport after Air India takeover: Report
Content: Tata Group will receive stake in Kerala's Cochin airport after it acquires Air India, Business Standard reported. The conglomerate will become the only airline to have an operational stake in a major Indian airport, the report added. Air India has 3% stake in the airport and the stake will be with the buyer, as per government's disinvestment documents, it said.

Title: Taliban's curbs on working women could cost Afghan economy $1 bn: UN report
Content: The Taliban's move to restrict women from working could immediately cost the Afghan economy up to $1 billion or 5% of its GDP, the United Nations Development Programme said in a report. Women account for 20% of the country's workforce, it added. Preventing women from working could shave half a billion dollars alone from household consumption, the report said.

Title: General Atlantic appoints Mastercard's ex-CEO Banga as Vice Chairman
Content: Private equity firm General Atlantic has appointed former Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga as its Vice Chairman. Banga will advise on strategic matters for the firm, its investment teams and its portfolio of more than 165 growth companies around the world, General Atlantic said. Banga, who started his career at Nestle India, has also served as CEO of Citigroup Asia Pacific.

Title: Tega Industries' ₹619-cr IPO fully subscribed within 1 hour of opening
Content: The ₹619.23-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Tega Industries was fully subscribed within one hour of opening for subscription on Wednesday. As of 12 pm, the portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 3.28 times. The firm has fixed a price band of ₹443-453 per share for the IPO, which will remain open till December 3.

Title: Raymond approves ₹800 crore IPO of subsidiary JK Files & Engineering
Content: Raymond has said that its board approved listing of its wholly-owned material subsidiary JK Files & Engineering (JKFEL) through an initial public offering (IPO). The company, which aims to mobilise ₹800 crore through its subsidiary's IPO, said that the issue will help deleverage Raymond. Post-IPO, JKFEL would continue to remain its material subsidiary, Raymond added.

Title: India's Nov exports rise 26% to $29.8 bn, trade deficit at record $23 bn
Content: India's exports rose by 26.49% to $29.88 billion in November, as against $23.62 billion in the same month last year, provisional data released by the government showed. Trade deficit widened to an all-time high of $23.27 billion as gold imports grew by about 8% to $4.22 billion during the month. Imports rose 57.18% to $53.15 billion in November.

Title: India's GDP likely to grow more than 9.5% in FY22: SBI Research
Content: India's GDP is likely to grow over 9.5% in financial year 2021-22, an SBI Research report said. In first half of FY21, India exhibited a real GDP loss of ₹11.4 lakh crore due to complete lockdown in April-May and partial lockdown in June-September, it added. However, in first half FY22, the real gain was around ₹8.2 lakh crore, it said.

Title: Bharti Airtel in talks to buy majority stake in Dish TV: Report
Content: Bharti Airtel is in early talks to buy a majority stake in Essel Group-owned Dish TV India, Mint reported. Accounting firm EY, which Airtel hired to inspect Dish TV's financials, has submitted the due diligence report to the telecom company, the report said. Shares of Dish TV rose by 4.8% during early trade to hit upper circuit at ₹18.40.

Title: Star Health IPO subscribed 20% on day 2, retail portion booked 89%
Content: Star Health and Allied Insurance's IPO, backed by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 20% on the second day of bidding, receiving bids for 89.67 lakh shares against offer size of 4.49 crore shares. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 89%, while that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 2%. It plans to mobilise ₹7,249.18 crore through the IPO.

Title: Mahindra shares poster of film named 'Omicron', says 'someone beat me to writing script'
Content: After COVID-19 strain Omicron was identified, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra shared the poster of a 1963 Italian film titled 'Omicron'. "And after my last tweet, a school buddy sent me this...someone already beat me to writing a script titled Omicron," he tweeted. The film was about an alien taking over a man's body to learn about Earth.

Title: Yearbook photos of 6 billionaires including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates go viral
Content: A collage of yearbook photos of six billionaires shared by a journalist has gone viral on social media. It includes photos of Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs, Apple CEO Tim Cook, Google Co-founder Larry Page, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos. Musk replied to a fake image of Warren Buffet with a laughing emoji.

Title: Great moment for India's depth of talent: Billionaire Adani on Twitter's new CEO
Content:
After Twitter appointed Parag Agrawal as CEO, India's second richest person Gautam Adani wrote on Twitter, "Another great moment for India's depth of talent and USA's meritocracy system." 
"Congrats...You'll do Twitter and Jack Dorsey proud," the billionaire said. He added, "After Microsoft, Google, IBM, Adobe, Flex, VMware and more, yet another Indian rises to lead the digital world."

Title: Virtual land sells for ₹32 crore in most expensive 'metaverse' property sale
Content: A virtual land in The Sandbox metaverse has been sold for $4.3 million (₹32.2 crore), marking the biggest metaverse property sale, The Wall Street Journal reported. Republic Realm, which invests in and develops virtual real estate, made the purchase. Last week, Metaverse Group had set a record by purchasing a patch of digital land for $2.4 million (₹17.8 crore).

Title: Previous cryptocurrency bill reworked, new bill to be introduced soon: FM
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has informed the Rajya Sabha that the government will introduce a new bill on cryptocurrency once Cabinet clears it. "Last time there was a bill proposed...that's been reworked...[into one] that's far more recent," Sitharaman said. Earlier, Lok Sabha's list said the bill seeks to prohibit private cryptocurrencies with some exceptions to promote underlying tech.

Title: Musk mocks $19 Apple Cloth as 'silly' as Tesla launches $50 'Cyberwhistle'
Content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared on Twitter that the automaker has launched a 'Cyberwhistle', whose shape is inspired by its upcoming Cybertruck. "Don't waste your money on that silly Apple Cloth, buy our whistle instead!" he wrote. Apple's 'Polishing Cloth' costs $19 each, while Tesla's 'Cyberwhistle', which is made from medical-grade stainless steel, costs $50.

Title: Anil Agarwal congratulates Parag Agrawal; tweets chart of Indians heading global brands
Content: Billionaire Anil Agarwal, the Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources Limited, on Tuesday congratulated newly appointed Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal. "Indian managers are the best in the world," he tweeted while sharing a chart of 'Indians heading global brands'. It included Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, IBM CEO Arvind Krishna and Novartis CEO Vas Narasimhan among others.

Title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella sells half of his stake in the company
Content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella sold half of his stake in the company in multiple tranches by offloading about 8,40,000 shares for over $285 million. He sold the stake for personal financial planning and diversification reasons, Microsoft said. This comes ahead of the impending implementation of capital gains tax law by Washington, which attracts 7% tax on stock sales over $2,50,000.

Title: Meta ordered to sell gif-sharing platform GIPHY by UK regulator
Content: Facebook's parent Meta has been ordered to sell gif-sharing platform GIPHY by the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). The deal could harm social media users and UK advertisers, the CMA found. "It has already removed GIPHY as a potential challenger in display advertising market," it added. "We disagree with this decision," Meta said, adding that it's considering all options.

Title: Musk's Starlink stops taking internet services bookings in India after govt warning
Content: Elon Musk-led Starlink has stopped taking bookings or pre-orders for its internet services in India after warning from the Department of Telecommunications. "Starlink is not yet available in your area but as we launch more satellites, we continue to expand our coverage area," Starlink's site stated. The government had said Starlink isn't licensed to offer internet services in India.

Title: I spend an hour per day with 5 employees to hear them out: Cognizant CEO
Content: Cognizant CEO Brian Humphries told AP that he spends "an hour every day with five employees to hear them out". "What's on their minds, what's working, what's not, how do they feel about our communication...etc," the Nasdaq-listed global IT major's chief explained. He added the next generation of workers "really want to work for a company that has a purpose".

Title: SpaceX going bankrupt in severe global recession not impossible: Musk
Content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a report on him telling staff that SpaceX could face "genuine risk of bankruptcy", said, "If a severe global recession were to dry up capital availability/liquidity while SpaceX was losing billions...then bankruptcy, while still unlikely, is not impossible." "The magnitude of the Starship program is not widely appreciated," he added.

Title: I dropped out of Stanford after I was raped: Fraud-accused Theranos Founder Holmes
Content: During her fraud trial, US blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes testified that she was raped while studying at Stanford University and that's what led her to dropping out. "I decided I was going to build a life by building [Theranos]," she said. Holmes added her ex-boyfriend and ex-Theranos President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani "forced me to have sex with him".

Title: SpaceX faces 'risk of bankruptcy', Musk reportedly tells employees
Content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk reportedly told employees that the company faces a "genuine risk of bankruptcy if we cannot achieve a Starship flight rate of at least once every two weeks next year", CNBC reported. In a companywide email sent the day after Thanksgiving, Musk wrote, "The Raptor production crisis is much worse than it seemed a few weeks ago."

Title: India's GDP grows by 8.4% in Q2 of FY22 against record 20.1% growth in last quarter
Content: The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation on Tuesday said that the country's GDP grew by 8.4% during the second quarter (July-September) of 2021-22 compared to 7.4% contraction in the second quarter of 2020-21. India had posted a growth of record 20.1% in the first quarter (April-June) of 2021-22.

Title: LPG cylinder for commercial use becomes costlier by ₹100 from today
Content: The price of a commercial LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹100 from Wednesday. A 19-kg commercial cylinder now costs ₹2,101 in Delhi, while the price rose to ₹2,051 in Mumbai. In Kolkata, the commercial LPG rate surged to ₹2,174.50, while in Chennai, it'll be available for ₹2,234.50. On November 1, the price was hiked by ₹266 per cylinder.

Title: Cathie Wood's ARK buys 1.1 mn Twitter shares after Dorsey steps down
Content: Cathie Wood's ARK Investment Management bought 1.1 million shares of Twitter, a day after Jack Dorsey stepped down as the CEO of the platform. ARK acquired the shares worth $48.9 million at Tuesday's closing price of $43.94, according to the firm's daily trade report. Shares of Twitter jumped up to 11% on Monday as Dorsey's stepping down news broke.

Title: 8 cases of crypto-related fraud under probe by ED: FM Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that eight cases related to cryptocurrency fraud are under investigation by the Directorate of Enforcement (ED). Calling cryptocurrencies a "risky area", she said attempts have been made to create awareness through RBI and SEBI. She also informed that a new bill on cryptocurrency will be introduced once Cabinet clears it.

Title: Amazon under-reported COVID-19 cases contracted at work: US labour group
Content: Amazon has been accused of under-reporting COVID-19 cases contracted at work by American labour group Strategic Organizing Center. "How is it possible for the company to say it had 20,000 cases and only 27 were transmitted at work? That defies science and logic," its Health and Safety Director said. The group has called on the federal government to investigate Amazon.

Title: Snapdeal to file for ₹1,875-crore IPO in next few weeks: Report
Content: Snapdeal is planning to file draft papers for an initial public offering (IPO) to raise as much as ₹1,875-crore ($250 million) in the next few weeks, Bloomberg reported. The e-commerce startup is aiming to go public in early 2022 and may seek a $1.5 billion valuation, it added. Its largest shareholders, including Alibaba and SoftBank, reportedly won't be selling shares.

Title: A lot has happened in 8 years: Elon Musk on SpaceX staying private
Content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said "a lot has happened in 8 years" after a Twitter user shared a 2013 email from Musk on why he wanted to keep the space-exploration company private. Musk wrote in the email that SpaceX was valued at $4 billion to $5 billion at the time. SpaceX hit $100 billion valuation last month after secondary sale.

Title: Tesla's China factory on track to make 5 lakh cars this yr: Report
Content: Tesla's Shanghai factory is on track to meet its goal of making five lakh vehicles this year, Chinese think tank EV100 reported. The Shanghai factory has localised more than 90% of its supply chain. Earlier this week, China's Beijing Daily newspaper reported that Tesla plans to invest around $188 million to expand the factory's production capacity.

Title: Eight core sectors' output rises by 7.5% in October
Content: The output of India's eight core infrastructure sectors grew by 7.5% in October, government data showed. During the month, the production of coal, natural gas and refinery products increased 14.6%, 25.8% and 14.4%, respectively. However, the production of crude oil declined by 2.2% year-on-year in October. The output of the eight sectors had contracted by 0.5% in October 2020.

Title: Jhunjhunwala backed-Star Health's IPO subscribed 12% on Day 1
Content: The ₹7,249-crore IPO of Star Health and Allied Insurance, backed by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 12% on the first day of bidding. It received bids for 53.19 lakh equity shares against an IPO size of 4.49 crore equity shares. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 0.64 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 0.01 times.

Title: India's April-October fiscal deficit at 36.3% of Budget estimates
Content: India's April to October period fiscal deficit is at ₹5.47 lakh crore or 36.3% of the Budget estimates, as per data released by Controller General of Accounts. The deficit figure was 119.7% of the Budget estimates in the same period last year. Last month, the deficit was at ₹5.26 lakh crore or 35% of the estimates.

Title: SC allows Yes Bank to vote in Essel Group-owned Dish TV's AGM
Content: The Supreme Court has stayed criminal proceedings against Yes Bank by Uttar Pradesh Police and allowed the bank to vote in Essel Group-owned Dish TV's AGM. UP police had frozen Yes Bank's voting rights in its stake held in Dish TV. "We cannot permit police officers sitting in Gautam Buddha Nagar to freeze voting rights of a shareholder," SC said.

Title: India's manufacturing PMI hits 10-month high in November at 57.6
Content: India's manufacturing sector activity grew at its fastest pace in 10 months in November, according to a private survey. The IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 57.6 in November, remaining above the 50-mark threshold, that separates expansion from contraction, for the fifth straight month. This figure was at 55.9 in October.

Title: Jack Dorsey steps down as Twitter CEO, Parag Agrawal to replace him
Content: Twitter co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey has stepped down from his role and the company's Indian American CTO Parag Agrawal has been named as his replacement. "I believe the company is ready to move on from its founders. My trust in Parag as Twitter's CEO is deep," said Dorsey in a statement. Agrawal was unanimously appointed CEO by Twitter's board.

Title: Crypto named 'Omicron' surges over 900% as WHO gives name to new COVID variant
Content: A relatively unknown cryptocurrency called Omicron (OMIC) shot up by over 900% since the WHO gave the same name to the newly-discovered COVID-19 variant. The crypto token, which was priced at around $65 (around ₹4,880) on November 27, touched a peak of $689 (around ₹51,730) on Monday. This came even as the crypto market tumbled after the variant's discovery.

Title: 6 US tech giants now run by Indian-origin CEOs: Stripe CEO on Twitter's new CEO
Content: Patrick Collison, the CEO of world's third-largest unicorn startup Stripe, said it's "wonderful to watch the amazing success of Indians in the technology world" after Indian-American Parag Agrawal was appointed as the new CEO of Twitter. "Google, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, and now Twitter run by CEOs who grew up in India," Collison said.

Title: New Twitter CEO's old tweet quoting 'Daily Show' joke on white people goes viral
Content: Hours after Indian-American Parag Agrawal became Twitter's CEO, his decade-old tweet quoting a joke made on 'The Daily Show with Jon Stewart' went viral. Twitter users and Republicans criticised the tweet about how treating all Muslims as terrorists was analogous to treating all white people as racists. "I was quoting Aasif Mandvi from The Daily Show," Agrawal said in 2010.

Title: Several old tweets by Parag Agrawal go viral after he becomes Twitter CEO
Content: After Parag Agrawal became Twitter's CEO, many of his old tweets resurfaced. One such tweet read, "Whatay headline: Woman's boyfriend nearly died when she suffocated him with her enormous breasts." Another tweet that surfaced read, "On women's day, Pakistani bowlers learn that length does matter." A 2010 tweet read, "I've been a vegetarian since I got to India...I've been vegetating."

Title: How much salary will Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal receive?
Content: Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal will receive an annual salary of $1 million, plus bonuses, the company informed the US Securities and Exchange Commission. He'll receive restricted stock units valued at $12.5 million that'll vest in 16 equal quarterly increments, starting February 1, 2022. In April, the IIT-Bombay graduate will get performance-based restricted stock units valued at $12.5 million.

Title: Twitter's m-cap surges $4 bn on news of Dorsey stepping down, later erases all gains
Content: Shares of Twitter jumped as much as 11% on Monday as the news of CEO Jack Dorsey stepping down surfaced. That amounted to a gain of $4.2 billion in market capitalisation, before trading was temporarily halted. However, the stock later erased its entire gain and ended nearly 3% lower. Indian-American Parag Agrawal was named as the company's new CEO.

Title: Dorsey shares 3 reasons for stepping down as Twitter CEO in last e-mail to staff
Content: Outgoing Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in an e-mail to his team conveying his decision to step down, said, "I'm really sad...yet really happy." He said Parag Agrawal was a reason he could step down, saying Agrawal was behind 'critical decisions' that turned Twitter around. Board Chairman Bret Taylor and the team's "ambition, potential" were the other two reasons, he said.

Title: Twitter's new CEO Parag shares e-mail to Dorsey, says 'grateful for your trust'
Content: Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal in an e-mail to outgoing CEO Jack Dorsey said, "I'm grateful for your continued mentorship and your friendship." He added, "I'm grateful for the service you built, the culture, soul, purpose you fostered among us and for leading [Twitter] through really significant challenges. I'm grateful for the trust you've put in me...for your continued partnership."

Title: US benefits greatly from Indian talent: Musk after Parag Agrawal named Twitter CEO
Content: After Indian-American Parag Agrawal was appointed as the new CEO of Twitter, world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "USA benefits greatly from Indian talent!" Musk was responding to a tweet by Stripe CEO Patrick Collison, which said, "Google, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, and now Twitter run by CEOs who grew up in India."

Title: Indian CEO virus, a pandemic we're proud of: Mahindra as Agrawal becomes Twitter CEO
Content: After Twitter named Indian-American Parag Agrawal as its CEO, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra wrote, "This is one pandemic...we're happy and proud to say originated in India." "It's the Indian CEO Virus...No vaccine against it," he tweeted. Mahindra was replying to a tweet on Indian-origin persons leading some of the world's top tech companies, such as Google and Microsoft.

Title: 37-yr-old Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal becomes youngest CEO in top 500 US firms
Content: Twitter's new Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal is now the youngest CEO in the S&P 500. Agrawal is 37 years old, the same age as Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who held this youngest CEO tag earlier. Twitter didn't disclose Agrawal's birthday due to security reasons, but confirmed that he was born later in 1984 than Zuckerberg's May birthday, Bloomberg reported.

Title: RBI supersedes Reliance Capital board citing defaults, appoints administrator
Content: The RBI on Monday said that it has superseded board of directors of Anil Ambani-owned Reliance Capital due to the defaults of the company in meeting various payment obligations to its creditors. The board hasn't been able to address serious governance concerns effectively, RBI added. It appointed Bank of Maharashtra's former Executive Director, Nageswar Rao Y, as the firm's administrator.

Title: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey to step down: Report
Content: Twitter co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey is expected to step down from his executive role, CNBC reported, quoting sources. Twitter's stock, meanwhile, jumped more than 10% in early trading on Monday on the report of Dorsey stepping down. The 45-year-old had, in his last tweet on November 28, said, "I love Twitter".

Title: Bitcoin surges as much as 3.4% to rise above $58,000
Content: Bitcoin rose as much as 3.4% to trade around $58,266 on Monday. Several other cryptocurrencies, including Dogecoin and Polkadot, also bounced back. The development came after cryptocurrency prices fell on Friday amid concerns regarding the new COVID-19 variant, Omicron, found in South Africa. Bitcoin saw its value decline 20% from the record high it hit earlier in November.

Title: Govt has provided no additional favours to RuPay: Former NPCI CEO
Content: NPCI's former CEO AP Hota told Moneycontrol the Indian government has provided no additional favours to RuPay apart from inclusion in Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana. Hota's comments come after Visa reportedly complained to US government that India's promotion of RuPay hurts the US payments major. "Visa need not get scared. They should focus on what India needs," Hota added.

Title: We categorically deny any intent to bid for BT Group: Reliance Industries
Content: Reliance Industries on Monday said it "categorically denies" any intent to bid for the UK's biggest telecoms company BT Group. The company's statement came after The Economic Times reported that Reliance could make an unsolicited offer to buy into BT Group or even stake a claim for a controlling stake. Reliance said the report was "completely speculative and baseless".

Title: Twitter missed US tech rally: Zerodha Co-founder after Dorsey steps down
Content: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath commenting on Twitter's stock after Jack Dorsey stepped down said, "What's happening at Twitter, Twitter. I personally see a lot of traction, but the stock has totally missed the US tech rally." Shares of Twitter jumped up to 11% on Monday after Dorsey's news broke, adding $4.2 billion in market capitalisation, but ended nearly 3% lower.

Title: MicroStrategy buys Bitcoin worth $414 mn, total holding valued at $7 bn
Content: American business intelligence company MicroStrategy has acquired an additional 7,002 Bitcoins for over $414 million in cash, its Founder and CEO Michael Saylor announced on Monday. The new tokens were acquired for an average price of $59,187 per Bitcoin, he wrote on Twitter. This takes MicroStrategy's total Bitcoin holding to 121,044, worth nearly $7 billion as of Monday.

Title: SC gives Amazon 2 weeks to put case before CCI in Future dispute
Content: The Supreme Court has granted two weeks more to ﻿Amazon﻿ to argue before the CCI in its dispute with Future Group. Earlier, CCI had declined adjournment of hearing in a case related to revocation of approval given to Amazon's investment transaction with Future Coupons. The Delhi HC on November 16 had asked CCI to conclude the case within two weeks.

Title: Elon Musk says he will return for Tesla's next earnings call
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in tweets discussing Cybertruck revealed that he will be attending Tesla's next earnings call, saying, "This year has been such a supply chain nightmare & it's not over! I will provide...updated product roadmap on next earnings call." Earlier, Musk had said he might not attend future earnings calls unless he had something important to say.

Title: ₹52,000 crore GST compensation due to states as of Sept: MoS Finance
Content: Nearly ₹52,000 crore of GST compensation was due to the states as of September 2021, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary informed the Parliament. Over ₹1.10 lakh crore and ₹1.59 lakh crore was released to the states as back to back loan in FY21 and FY22, respectively, he added. COVID-19's economic impact led to higher compensation requirement, he said.

Title: Protestors in Lebanon block roads, burn tyres amid economic crisis
Content: Protestors in Lebanon blocked roads on Monday by burning tyres in Beirut, Tripoli and Sidon to protest against looming economic turmoil in the country. The protests come as the value of the Lebanese pound sank to over 25,000 against the US dollar last week. The turmoil, which erupted in 2019, has pushed more than three-quarters of the population towards poverty.

Title: Go Fashion shares list at 90% premium over IPO price of ₹690
Content: Go Colors brand operator Go Fashion made stock market debut with a premium of 90% at ₹1,310 per share on the NSE as compared to its IPO issue price of ₹690 per share. Its shares were trading at ₹1,316 on the BSE. Go Fashion raised ₹1,014 crore via share sale through initial public offering (IPO) which closed on November 22.

Title: Tuticorin plant facing severe corrosion, needs maintenance: Vedanta to SC
Content: Vedanta has informed the Supreme Court that its Sterlite Copper plant in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin is facing severe corrosion and faces threat of total structure collapse. In its affidavit, Vedanta urged the court to urgently hear its plea for granting it access to the plant to carry out essential maintenance work. The plant has been shut since May 2018.

Title: LIC gets RBI nod to increase stake in Kotak Mahindra Bank to 9.99%
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank said the RBI has granted its approval to Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) to increase holding in the bank to up to 9.99%. The approval is valid for a period of one year, it added. LIC has 4.96% stake in the bank as of September 30 and is its fifth largest shareholder, according to Refinitiv data.

Title: DGTR recommends continuation of anti-dumping duty on Chinese tiles
Content: The Commerce Ministry's investigation arm Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has recommended continuation of anti-dumping duty on Chinese tiles for five more years. In its probe, it concluded that the product continues to be exported to India at prices below normal value resulting in continued dumping. DGTR recommended duty of $1.87 per square meter tonne.

Title: Delhi govt starts TV show to help school children pitch startup ideas to investors
Content: The Delhi government has launched a TV programme to allow Class 11 and 12 students of government-run schools to present their startup ideas to investors and obtain investment capital. Under the 'Business Blasters' initiative, the show will include students' business ideas, shortlisted from 51,000 entries submitted by 3 lakh students. Each participating student will receive ₹2,000 as seed money.

Title: Pic shows Jeff Bezos' effigy sitting on rocket during protest against Amazon in UK
Content: Extinction Rebellion protesters demonstrating against climate change blocked 13 Amazon distribution centres in the UK and carried an effigy of Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos sitting on top of a rocket. The fake rocket had "to extinction and beyond" and "amazon crime" written on it. The group said they're raising awareness against the "exploitative and environmentally destructive business practices".

Title: After Airtel and Vodafone Idea, Jio hikes prepaid tariffs
Content: Reliance Jio on Sunday announced new unlimited plans and a hike in its tariffs with its lowest plan now starting at ₹91 instead of ₹75. The new plans will be available from December 1 of this year for its customers. Jio's tariff hike announcement comes days after Airtel and Vodafone Idea (now Vi) announced a 20-25% hike on prepaid plans.

Title: Concerned about India's policies backing rival RuPay: Visa in complaint to US govt
Content: Visa complained to the US government that India's promotion of its local rival RuPay hurts the US payments major, according to memos seen by Reuters. Visa said it remains concerned about "India's informal and formal policies that appear to favour the business of NPCI", that runs RuPay. It said India promotes RuPay over other domestic and foreign electronic payments companies.

Title: ED summons Amazon India, Future Group officials over 2019 deal
Content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned senior management of Future Group and Amazon India, including its country head Amit Agarwal, next week in connection with their deal in 2019. ED is reportedly examining whether Amazon violated Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) when it invested ₹1,431 crore to buy 49% stake in Future Coupons (FCPL). FCPL owns 10% stake in Future Retail.

Title: No proposal to recognise Bitcoin as a currency: Finance Minister Sitharaman
Content: The government has no proposal to recognise Bitcoin as a currency in the country, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the Lok Sabha. She also informed that the government does not collect data on Bitcoin transactions. Bitcoin is a digital currency that allows people to buy goods and services and exchange money without involving banks, credit card issuers or third parties.

Title: I exercise 5 days a week, get good sleep: Rishad Premji on dealing with burnout
Content: When asked about how Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji deals with a burnout amid the COVID-19 pandemic, he said at a conclave, "I exercise five days a week and get good sleep." "The pandemic has taught us that life isn't just about work and hence drawing a line from a young age is very important," he added.

Title: Govt panel seeks more data from Serum Institute on Covovax: Report
Content: An expert panel of Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has sought additional data from Serum Institute of India (SII) on its COVID-19 vaccine Covovax, according to reports. It also noted that Covovax hasn't yet been approved in the country of origin, reports added. In October, SII sought permission from DCGI to manufacture Covovax for restricted use in emergency situations.

Title: COAI asks govt to cut 5G spectrum base price by more than half: Reports
Content: Telecom industry body COAI  has asked the government to reduce spectrum base price by more than half, especially for 5G services, according to reports. In March, government offered 2,308.80 MHz of spectrum in seven bands at a reserve price of nearly ₹4 lakh crore. However, airwaves in 700 MHz and 2,500 MHz bands went unsold due to high base prices.

Title: Nissan to spend $17.6 bn in 5 yrs to 'accelerate vehicle electrification'
Content: Nissan has said it will spend $17.59 billion over the next five years to accelerate vehicle electrification. The Japanese automaker added that it will introduce 23 electrified vehicles by 2030, including 15 electric vehicles (EVs). The company also said it wants to reduce cost of lithium-ion battery by 65% within eight years and introduce all solid-state batteries by March 2029.

Title: Paytm shares fall after it reports a net loss of ₹474 crore in Q2
Content: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares fell on Monday after the company reported its Q2 results. Paytm's shares slumped 5% in early trade to reach an intraday low of ₹1,700. The company reported a net loss of ₹474 crore during the July-September quarter as against ₹437 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations grew 64% year-on-year to ₹1,090 crore.

Title: Lower import duty on EVs for some time will help boost demand: BMW India CEO
Content: BMW Group India President and CEO Vikram Pawah said reduction in import duties on electric vehicles (EVs) for a limited time or for limited number of units will help create demand for them. It will also help in manufacturing EVs and bring new technologies quicker to India, he added. BMW will launch three EVs in India in next six months.

Title: Govt mulling to help restart MSMEs that shut down amid COVID-19: Rane
