Content: Union Minister Narayan Rane said the government is planning providing help to the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) which were closed during the COVID-19 pandemic. "I had raised this issue with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and we have had a meeting regarding this," he said. Restarting closed factories will create jobs and raise production and the GDP, he added.

Title: Amazon urges CCI to revoke nod for ₹24,713-cr Future-Reliance deal: Report
Content: Amazon has written to the Competition Commission of India (CCI), urging it to revoke the approval for Future Retail's ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance Industries, according to a letter seen by Reuters. The approval was a "nullity in the eyes of law", Amazon said. Amazon had won an injunction against the deal from Singapore arbitrator but CCI later cleared the deal.

Title: Amazon's counsels walked out of CCI hearing: Future Retail
Content: Future Retail (FRL) has said that Amazon's counsels walked out of a Competition Commission of India (CCI) hearing last week. This came after CCI said that the hearing cannot be postponed to give Amazon further time to make oral submissions, FRL added. "The conduct of Amazon smacks of arrogance...CCI should deal with this conduct of Amazon appropriately," it said.

Title: I may be kidnapped once again and taken to Guyana: Mehul Choksi
Content: PNB scam accused Mehul Choksi said, "I may be coerced and kidnapped once again and taken to Guyana, where there's a strong Indian presence." The fugitive diamantaire, who is currently in Antigua, added his poor health doesn't allow him to move anywhere. "My lawyers are fighting cases in...Antigua and Dominica and I've...faith that I shall emerge victorious," Choksi said.

Title: Chidambaram, son Karti summoned by Delhi court in Aircel-Maxis case
Content: A Delhi court has issued summons to former Finance Minister P Chidambaram, his son Karti Chidambaram and others in the ongoing Aircel-Maxis case. The court said it took cognisance of chargesheets filed by the CBI and the ED. There's sufficient evidence to summon Chidambaram and the other accused in the alleged corruption and money-laundering case, Special Judge MK Nagpal said.

Title: SEBI as a regulator doesn't get into IPO valuations: Chairman
Content: SEBI as the regulator doesn't and shouldn't get into IPO valuations, its Chairman Ajay Tyagi said. Start-ups getting listed in India provides an opportunity for domestic investors to participate, he added. "SEBI has to make sure...investor interests are protected and...there isn't over-regulation so that companies don't get discouraged to list here," Tyagi said in interview to Business Standard.

Title: 438 infrastructure projects show cost overrun of ₹4.34 lakh crore
Content: As many as 438 infrastructure projects, each worth ₹150 crore or more, have been hit by cost overruns of over ₹4.34 lakh crore, a report by Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation showed. Out of 1,680 such projects, 539 were delayed, the report said. Total original cost of implementation of the 1,680 projects was over ₹21.74 lakh crore, it added.

Title: Govt working to reduce burdensome compliance for businesses: Goyal
Content: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has said that the Centre, along with states, is making efforts to eliminate burdensome compliances for businesses. "Our effort...is to...reduce the need for licensing, reduce the regulatory burden, permissions and rationalise the renewal process," he added. "Self regulation and self certification should be the way forward," Goyal said.

Title: Sovereign Gold Bond to open for subscription on Nov 29 at ₹4,791/gram
Content: The eighth tranche of Sovereign Gold Bond Scheme 2021-22 will open for subscription on Monday. The RBI has fixed the issue price at ₹4,791 per gram and a discount of ₹50 per gram will be given to investors applying online and making the payment through digital mode. The tenor of the bond will be for a period of eight years.

Title: Religare's NBFC arm all set to restart business in Jan: Chairperson
Content: Religare Enterprises Chairperson Rashmi Saluja has said that the company's NBFC arm, Religare Finvest (RFL), is all set to restart its business from January. "The company has put on block ₹600 crore NPA and it is at an advanced stage," she added. RFL has been barred from undertaking fresh business as it is under RBI's corrective action plan since 2018.

Title: PNB puts up MP-based steel & agri firm for sale to recover ₹200-cr dues
Content: State-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) has put up Madhya Pradesh-based National Steel and Agro Industries for sale to recover its outstanding dues of nearly ₹200 crore. The bank has fixed the reserve price (on cash basis) for the sale process at ₹95 crore. The lender has set December 8 as the last date for completion of due diligence exercise.

Title: IndusInd's Hindujas welcome RBI move to raise promoter stake to 26%
Content: The Hindujas, who had earlier sought to increase their holding in IndusInd Bank, have welcomed RBI's move to allow promoters to raise their stake in private banks to 26% from the current 15%. "We eagerly await the operating guidelines as it gives the promoters an opportunity to inject capital to increase stake up to 26%," IIHL Chairman Ashok Hinduja said.

Title: Tega Industries fixes price band at ₹443-453 per share for ₹619-cr IPO
Content: Tega Industries said it has fixed a price band of ₹443-453 a share for its ₹619.23-crore IPO. The IPO, which will open on December 1, is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.37 crore equity shares by its existing shareholders and promoters. Currently, the promoters hold an 83.21% stake, which will come down to 77.21% post the IPO.

Title: MSCI’s decision to drop us from climate change indices disappointing: Adani
Content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) said it is disappointed by MSCI's decision to drop its stock from four climate change indices. MSCI said it will drop APSEZ from the indices following its link with Carmichael thermal coal project in Australia. APSEZ said it had clarified to MSCI that it never had any shareholding in Carmichael mine.

Title: Current GST rates not in sync with demand creation: Industry body PHDCCI
Content: Industry body PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHDCCI) said the current GST rates aren't in sync with the demand creation and employment generation in the country. "We urge...government to rationalise the GST rates into three major slabs of 5%, 10% and 15%," PHDCCI President Pradeep Multani said. He added that few sin goods should be in the 28% slab.

Title: Airline, hotel, multiplex stocks fall up to 8% amid new COVID-19 variant fears
Content: The stocks of multiplexes, food chains and airlines in India witnessed a slump on Friday following fears over the detection of a new COVID-19 variant in South Africa. Shares of INOX, PVR, Indian Hotels Company and IndiGo dipped around 8% each during intraday trade. Meanwhile, shares of SpiceJet, Barbeque Nation and Speciality Restaurants, which operates Mainland China, fell around 5%.

Title: Investors lose ₹7.45 lakh crore in 1 day as Sensex sees worst fall in 7 months
Content: The investors' wealth dropped by ₹7.45 lakh crore on Friday as the BSE Sensex crashed 1,688 points to close at 57,107. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, fell to ₹258.3 lakh crore. The Sensex witnessed its worst single-day fall in seven months amid fears of a new COVID-19 variant in South Africa.

Title: What are US vaccine makers doing to address new COVID-19 variant 'Omicron'?
Content: US vaccine maker Moderna said it's "rapidly advancing" a booster candidate for the new COVID-19 variant 'Omicron'. Pfizer said if 'Omicron' emerges as an "escape variant", it may be able to develop a tailor-made vaccine in around 100 days. Novavax said it's working on a vaccine to target the variant and may have a shot ready in next few weeks.

Title: World trade body postpones its biggest meeting in 4 years over new COVID-19 variant
Content: The World Trade Organization (WTO) has postponed its ministerial conference, the global body's biggest meeting in four years, due to the emergence of a new COVID-19 variant 'Omicron' in South Africa. "It is better to err on the side of caution...This new variant reminds us...of the urgency of the work we're charged with," WTO's Director-General Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala said.

Title: Sensex tanks 1,688 points, Nifty ends at 17,026 in worst fall in 7 months
Content: The Sensex crashed as much as 1,800 points during intraday trade on Friday and eventually ended 1,688 points or 2.9% lower at 57,107. This came amid fears over the detection of a new COVID-19 variant in South Africa. Meanwhile, Nifty 50 index slumped over 500 points to close at 17,026. The indices posted their worst daily fall in seven months.

Title: Moderna shares jump 20% after new COVID-19 variant found in South Africa
Content: Shares of US vaccine maker Moderna soared as much as 25% and ended 20.57% higher on Friday after the detection of a new COVID-19 variant in South Africa. Pfizer shares ended 6% higher, while that of BioNTech closed 14% higher. Stocks related to staying at home also surged with Zoom Video shares rising as much as 11% in intraday trade.

Title: LatentView Founder becomes India's newest billionaire after strong stock listing
Content: LatentView Analytics' Chairman Adugudi Viswanathan Venkatraman has become a billionaire as the Chennai-based company's shares continue to rally following its strong market debut. As of Thursday's closing price of ₹702.35 per share, his stake was valued at around ₹8,275 crore or $1.1 billion, Livemint reported. Venkatraman, who founded LatentView in 2006, is an IIT Madras and IIM Calcutta graduate.

Title: Happy to lose $13 mn by quitting Facebook, Instagram: UK cosmetics retailer's CEO
Content: UK cosmetics retailer Lush shut its Facebook, Instagram, and other social media accounts globally on Black Friday, citing harmful effects on teenagers. Lush CEO Mark Constantine told The Guardian he's "happy" to lose $13.3 million in sales by quitting Facebook. "I...thought 'That's their own research...they're ignoring it and we're attracting people to their platform'," the 69-year-old said.

Title: Bitcoin falls 7%, Ether down 9% amid new COVID-19 variant concerns
Content: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 7.5% to $54,430 on Friday amid concerns over a new variant of COVID-19 found in South Africa. The cryptocurrency was down almost 20% from the record high of almost $69,000 it recorded earlier this month. Ether, the second largest digital currency, also fell 9%, while the Bloomberg Galaxy Crypto Index dropped 4%.

Title: Amazon alleges ₹11,300 crore may have been diverted from Future Retail
Content: Amazon has alleged that "significant amounts may've been diverted from Future Retail". In a letter seen by Bloomberg, Amazon said, Future Retail transferred ₹7,000 crore in 2019-20 as payments to a Kishore Biyani-controlled company. It created unusual rental security deposits and made advances to suppliers worth ₹4,300 crore, Amazon added. Future Retail said Amazon is making "false speculations".

Title: Newly-listed Paytm posts ₹474 crore net loss in Q2, revenue jumps 64%
Content: Paytm parent One97 Communications on Saturday reported a net loss of ₹474 crore during the July-September quarter as against ₹437 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations grew 64% year-on-year to ₹1,090 crore in the second quarter, driven by non-UPI payment volumes. Paytm recently got listed on stock exchanges at a 9% discount after India's biggest IPO ever.

Title: Zoho CEO shares video of 2 snakes dancing together in rain in TN; calls it 'amazing'
Content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu has shared a video of two snakes dancing together in rain in Tamil Nadu. "Amazing snake dance that happened today during heavy rains here in Tenkasi," Vembu said while thanking Akshaya Sivaraman, who recorded the video on her phone while going for a walk. "Living with Nature is a gift by Almighty," a Twitter user reacted.

Title: Ikea offers tiny 10-sqm home for less than $1 monthly rent in Japan
Content: Swedish furniture retailer Ikea is renting out a tiny 10-square-metre (107-square-foot) apartment in the Shinjuku district of Japan's Tokyo for ¥99 ($0.82). The apartment comes fully furnished with Ikea furniture and accessories designed to fit into the snug space and will be rented out with a lease until January 15, 2023. Ikea said it's accepting applications till December 3.

Title: P&G recalls certain Old Spice deodorants after cancer-causing chemical found
Content: Procter & Gamble (P&G) has announced that it's voluntarily recalling certain Old Spice and Secret aerosol spray antiperspirants in the US with expiration dates through September 2023. This comes after it found the presence of benzene, a cancer-causing chemical, in certain products. However, it added that the levels of chemical detected "wouldn't be expected to cause adverse health consequences".

Title: Sensex crashes 1,300 points after new COVID-19 variant detected in South Africa
Content: The Sensex on Friday extended losses from its early trade and plunged more than 1,300 points to trade below 57,500 levels. This comes after its Asian peers fell amid concerns over the detection of a new COVID-19 variant in South Africa. Meanwhile, the broader Indian benchmark Nifty 50 fell more than 390 points to trade below the 17,200-mark.

Title: RBI raises promoter stake cap in private banks to 26% after 15 yrs
Content: RBI said on Friday it has accepted 21 out of the 33 recommendations made by a working group. This includes raising the cap on promoters' stake in private banks to 26% of paid-up voting equity share capital after 15 years, from the current 15%. The promoters may choose to bring down their stake to below 26% after the lock-in period.

Title: One of my biggest regrets is losing Hindustan Zinc in 2002: Birla
Content: Kumar Mangalam Birla, the Chairman of Aditya Birla Group, said that one of the biggest regrets in his life was losing Hindustan Zinc to Vedanta in 2002. "We had lost it by a whisker. There were some inventories which we had not accounted for, otherwise we could have made it," said Birla during the ICC's Annual Session and AGM.

Title: Serum Institute resumes COVID-19 vaccine exports to COVAX after months
Content: World's largest vaccine manufacturer Serum Institute of India on Friday shipped the first batch of its COVID-19 vaccine to the COVAX vaccine-sharing platform after an eight-month hiatus. SII said the resumption came after it surpassed its original target to produce 1 billion doses of Covishield by the end of 2021. The vaccines will be distributed to low- and middle-income countries.

Title: Subsidies should be eliminated: Musk as Tesla forgoes German aid
Content: After Tesla withdrew application for state aid for its planned battery factory in Germany, CEO Elon Musk said, "It has always been (the company's) view that all subsidies should be eliminated." Tesla was expected to receive €1.14 billion in funding under the plan. The company itself is investing €5 billion in the battery plant, according to German Economy Ministry's estimates.

Title: Tata in talks to set up $300-mn semiconductor plant in India: Report
Content: Tata group is in talks with Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Telangana to invest up to $300 million to set up a semiconductor assembly and test unit, Reuters reported. A source said Tata has looked at potential locations, adding a venue was likely to be finalised by next month. The factory is expected to start operations late next year.

Title: El Salvador bought 100 more coins: President as Bitcoin falls 7.7%
Content: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele on Friday said that his country bought 100 more Bitcoins after the world's largest cryptocurrency declined 7.7% to below $55,000. "El Salvador just bought the dip. 100 extra coins acquired with a discount," Bukele tweeted. Last week, Bukele announced plans to build the world's first "Bitcoin City" in El Salvador, funded initially by Bitcoin-backed bonds.

Title: Former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar joins Hero MotoCorp board
Content: India's largest two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp has appointed SBI's former Chairman Rajnish Kumar as an Independent non-executive Director on the firm's board. It has also onboarded Choko la Founder Vasudha Dinodia Munjal as a non-executive Director. Kumar completed his term as Chairman of the SBI in October 2020. Earlier, BharatPe had announced Kumar's appointment as the Chairman of its board.

Title: RBI imposes a penalty of ₹1 crore on State Bank of India
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said it imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1 crore on the State Bank of India, citing "contravention of sub-section (2) of section 19 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 (the Act)". It added, "The bank held shares in borrower companies, as pledgee, of an amount exceeding 30% of paid-up share capital of those companies."

Title: ITC to buy 16% stake in personal care firm Mother Sparsh for ₹20 cr
Content: ITC on Friday announced that it will acquire a 16% stake in Mother Sparsh, a direct-to-consumer Ayurvedic and natural personal care brand, for ₹20 crore through a share subscription agreement. The acquisition is expected to be completed within eight months from the date of execution of agreements. Mother Sparsh, incorporated in 2016, reported a turnover of ₹15.44 crore in FY2020-21.

Title: Evergrande Founder cuts stake in his firm for 1st time since 2009
Content: China Evergrande Group's billionaire Founder Hui Ka Yan has cut his stake in the company for the first time since it went public in 2009. Hui sold 1.2 billion shares in Evergrande for $344 million, bringing his stake down to 67.87% from 76.96%. Chinese regulators have reportedly urged Hui to use his personal wealth to help pay Evergrande's bondholders.

Title: Ashok Leyland CEO Vipin Sondhi steps down citing personal reasons
Content: Ashok Leyland's Managing Director and CEO Vipin Sondhi has resigned from his position within two years of appointment. "Sondhi has expressed his intention to devote more time to take care of certain personal and family commitments in the post-Covid-19 pandemic situation," the company said. Meanwhile, Chairman Dheeraj Hinduja will once again take up an executive role with immediate effect.

Title: Tarsons Products shares rise 27% on debut day, hit upper circuit
Content: Shares of life sciences company Tarsons Products made stock market debut on Friday, listing at a premium of nearly 6%. The company's shares listed at ₹700 apiece on the BSE over its issue price of ₹662. Its shares extended gains sharply after the listing, rising as high as 26.89% over the issue price, to hit an upper circuit of 20%.

Title: Covaxin meets WHO efficacy criteria for Delta variant: Bharat Biotech on Lancet study
Content: Bharat Biotech has responded to the real-world assessment published in Lancet, which said Covaxin was 50% effective against symptomatic COVID-19 when Delta variant was dominant in India. The study shows that Covaxin "meets the WHO efficacy criteria" for Delta variant, it said. These results "compare well with the 65.2% efficacy" against the variant obtained during Phase 3 trials, it added.

Title: Wish COVID-19 was some annoying guy I could beat up: Mahindra on new S Africa variant
Content: After scientists in South Africa said they've detected a new COVID-19 variant, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Man, I've had enough of this COVID-19 thing." "I wish COVID-19 was just some annoying guy I could take into a boxing ring and just beat the crap out of," he wrote. "Dark side of Anand Mahindra," a Twitter user joked.

Title: ITC starts clinical trials of nasal spray for COVID-19 prevention
Content: ITC on Thursday confirmed that it is developing a nasal spray for COVID-19 prevention for which it has initiated clinical trials. The company will reportedly market the nasal spray under the Savlon brand once it gets all the requisite regulatory approvals. An ITC spokesperson told PTI, "We are unable to share more details...as...trials are underway." The stock jumped nearly 2%.

Title: Reliance Industries to own franchise cricket team in UAE's T20 League
Content: Reliance Industries, through its subsidiary Reliance Strategic Business Ventures, will acquire the rights to own and operate a new franchise cricket team in the upcoming UAE T20 League. Mukesh Ambani's son and owner of Mumbai Indians Akash Ambani said, "We're...confident of shaping another successful brand in UAE." The move is the first major overseas expansion of RIL's cricket operations.

Title: Indonesian data firm becomes world's best-performing IPO in 2021 after 10,000% jump
Content: Cloud data service provider PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCI) has delivered the world's best-performing IPO this year. It has soared 10,852% or more than 100 fold since its 150 billion rupiah ($10.5 million) listing in January, Bloomberg reported. Indonesian billionaire Anthoni Salim, whose business empire spans from food to telecommunications to real estate, owns 11% stake in the company.

Title: Crypto trading hamster 'Mr. Goxx' who outperformed US stock market index dies
Content: Cryptocurrency trading hamster 'Mr. Goxx', whose performance beat US' S&P 500's returns of 10.9%, has passed away. "In deep sorrow, we have to announce the loss of our beloved furry friend," his German owners tweeted. In Twitch livestreams, Mr. Goxx ran through a 'buy' or a 'sell' tunnel inside his office to select which cryptocurrency he'd like to trade.

Title: Samsung to hire over 1,000 engineers from India this year, one-fourth from IITs
Content: South Korean electronics maker Samsung is looking to hire more than 1,000 engineers from India this year for its R&D centres in Bengaluru, Delhi and Noida. "One-fourth of these engineers will be coming from IITs and the balance would be coming from other tier-one colleges," said Sameer Wadhawan, Senior VP & Head of HR of Samsung India.

Title: I'm very positive about crypto, it'll be the mainstream tech in 5 years: Paytm CEO
Content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said, "I am very positive about crypto. It is fundamentally based on cryptography and will be the mainstream technology in a few years like the internet." He added, "Every government is confused. In five years, it will be the mainstream technology." His remarks come as the government looks to ban private cryptocurrencies with some exceptions.

Title: Tamil Nadu govt signs MoUs worth ₹35,200 crore with 59 companies
Content: CM MK Stalin-led Tamil Nadu government has signed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with 59 companies worth ₹35,200 crore at an investors' meet in Coimbatore. The companies that signed the MoUs include Larsen & Toubro, Hindustan Unilever, Adani Enterprises and TVS Motor, among others. The agreements would create employment opportunities for 76,795 persons, the government said in a statement.

Title: Sensex tanks 850 points as Asian markets fall over fears of new COVID-19 variant
Content: Indian benchmark indices plunged on Friday following a selloff in Asian markets amid concerns over a new COVID-19 variant being detected in South Africa. The Sensex plunged around 850 points to trade below the 58,000-mark, while the broader Nifty 50 slumped more than 250 points to trade at 17,200 levels. Maruti Suzuki, Kotak Mahindra Bank were top Sensex laggards.

Title: Reliance Industries, Saudi Aramco end $15 bn deal amid valuation differences: Report
Content: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) and Saudi Aramco have reportedly called off a $15 billion deal for the oil giant to buy 20% stake in RIL's oil-to-chemicals (O2C) business due to valuation concerns. Last week, the two companies announced that they were re-evaluating their 2019 agreement. RIL had sought $75 billion valuation for its O2C arm, Reuters reported citing sources.

Title: Pfizer sues employee who's leaving, alleges she stole secret COVID vaccine documents
Content: Pfizer has sued an employee for allegedly stealing confidential documents, including those related to its COVID-19 vaccine. Pfizer said Chun Xiao Li transferred over 12,000 files without permission to her personal accounts and provided a "decoy" laptop upon confrontation. Pfizer believes that Li, who's resigning from the company after 15 years, has an offer to join its competitor Xencor.

Title: JPMorgan CEO jokes his bank will outlast Communist Party, adds 'can't say it in China'
Content: JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon said he made a "joke" in Hong Kong recently that China's "Communist Party is celebrating its 100th year - so is JPMorgan. I'd make a bet that we last longer". Speaking at a Boston event, Dimon joked, "I can't say that in China..They're probably listening anyway." US' largest bank is operating in China since 1921.

Title: If your client is in shorts, t-shirt & flip flops, be like them: Hinduja heir to staff
Content: Karam Hinduja, the 31-year-old grandson of Hinduja Group's Srichand Hinduja, told his bank's employees to be more like bank's clients. "If your client is in shorts, t-shirt and a pair of flip flops, feel free to do the same, meet them at their level," he said. Karam Hinduja took charge of Swiss bank SP Hinduja Banque Privée in early 2020.

Title: Truly regret joking that JPMorgan will outlast China's Communist Party: CEO Dimon
Content: Jamie Dimon, CEO of US' largest bank JPMorgan Chase, apologised for a joke he made about his bank outlasting China's Communist Party. "I truly regret my recent comment because it's never right to joke about or denigrate any group of people," Dimon said. "I was trying to emphasise the strength and longevity of our company," Dimon added.

Title: Amazon urges SC to pause review of deal with Future Group: Report
Content: Amazon has approached the Supreme Court to pause the review of allegations by CCI that it concealed information while seeking antitrust clearance for a 2019 deal with Future Group, Reuters reported citing legal papers. CCI has decided not to give extensions to Amazon for explanation and will now issue an order in due course.

Title: BlackRock, Canada Pension bought more Paytm shares after plunge: Report
Content: Several anchor investors of Paytm, including BlackRock and Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, bought more shares of the firm after it plunged by as much as 41% below the IPO price, Bloomberg reported. Its shares had listed at 9% discount on market debut. Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma had said shares' early tumble was "no indicator of the firm's value".

Title: Hero Electric EV sales jumps 100% y-o-y between Oct 1-Nov 15
Content: India's largest electric two-wheeler company Hero Electric has reported that it had sold 24,000 units between October 1 and November 15 of this year. This translated to a 100% jump in the sales as compared to the same period last year when it sold 11,339 units. Hero MotoCorp will launch its electric vehicle by March 2022.

Title: Have right to take countermeasures against US sanctions on firms: China
Content: China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said that the country will take all necessary measures to defend its companies and reserves the right to take countermeasures against US sanctions. This comes after the US put 12 Chinese companies on its trade blacklist over national security and foreign policy concerns. US added a total of 27 new entities to the list.

Title: Govt sets up committee for providing 'stable gas prices' to power units
Content: The government has set up a committee to work out measures needed to make natural gas available to power plants at "reasonably stable prices", Oil Secretary Tarun Kapoor said. "If the price of natural gas goes up, power generators cannot increase...price of electricity they produce," he added. "We're looking at...how we can increase...penetration of natural gas in...power sector," Kapoor said.

Title: ₹90,000 cr to be invested in airport sector in 5 yrs: Civil Aviation Secy
Content: Civil Aviation Secretary Rajiv Bansal said investments totalling ₹90,000 crore will be made in India's airport sector in five years. Of the total, around ₹20,000-22,000 crore will be invested by Airports Authority of India, while the remaining amount of about ₹68,000 crore would be from the private sector, he added. Government expects to have 220 operational airports in five years.

Title: Take necessary steps to lower oil prices: IEA head urges OPEC
Content: International Energy Agency's (IEA) head Fatih Birol has urged the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) to take necessary steps to help bring down oil prices to "reasonable levels". He also said, "Russia can easily increase exports to Europe about 15%...and significantly comfort...European gas markets." Oil prices have increased in the last year to over $80 per barrel.

Title: Price hike inevitable due to rising costs: Coal India
Content: Coal India has said that price hike of supplies in long-term deals is inevitable due to the rising costs. "The coal-price increase is something where we have to bring all stakeholders on board. That process is on," its Chairman Pramod Agrawal said. "Everybody understands that we've have reached a point where coal price increase has become inevitable," he added.

Title: Making all efforts to complete Air India disinvestment by Dec-end: Official
Content: Civil Aviation Secretary Rajiv Bansal said the government is making all efforts to complete the disinvestment process of Air India by the end of December. The airline has been incurring a monthly loss of more than ₹600 crore, he added. Earlier, government had accepted Tata Group's offer to pay ₹2,700 crore cash and take over Air India's ₹15,300 crore debt.

Title: RIL to transfer Jamnagar gasification unit into wholly-owned subsidiary
Content: Reliance Industries (RIL) said its board has decided to implement a scheme of arrangement to transfer gasification undertaking at Jamnagar into a wholly-owned subsidiary. "Repurposing...gasification assets will help use of syngas as a reliable source of feedstock to produce chemicals and cater to growing domestic demand," it added. This will result in an attractive business opportunity, RIL said.

Title: RBI fines Tata Communications Payment Solutions ₹2 cr for non-compliance
Content: The RBI has imposed a penalty of ₹2 crore on Tata Communications Payment Solutions (TCPSL) and ₹54.93 lakh on Appnit Technologies (ATPL). TCPSL was non-compliant with the directions issued by RBI on White Label ATM deployment targets and net-worth requirement, the central bank said. Meanwhile, ATPL was non-compliant on maintenance of escrow account balance and net-worth requirement, it added.

Title: ED claims ex-Unitech promoter's wife hid association with 9 firms: Report
Content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has claimed that Preeti Chandra, the wife of former Unitech Group promoter Sanjay Chandra, didn't disclose a number of company associations and financial transactions, The Economic Times reported. She had claimed to be associated with only four companies, but a probe revealed that she was director or proprietor of nine other firms, it added.

Title: Govt to bring bill to ban pvt cryptos with some exceptions to promote underlying tech
Content: Cryptocurrency Bill is among the 26 bills to be introduced in Parliament's winter session. The bill's agenda says, "To create a facilitative framework for the creation of the official digital currency issued by RBI." The bill also seeks to prohibit private cryptos in India, however, it allows for certain exceptions to promote the underlying tech of crypto and its uses.

Title: Tesla fans flood JPMorgan's Yelp with '1-star' reviews for suing Musk's automaker
Content: Tesla fans flooded JPMorgan Chase's Yelp page with one-star reviews after the world's richest person Elon Musk told WSJ he would do so himself if JPMorgan doesn't withdraw their lawsuit against the automaker. "I'm here for Tesla obviously. Giving you one star for suing the company," a user wrote. Following this, Yelp has temporarily disabled posting reviews of the bank.

Title: Musk, Binance CEO argue on Twitter as Musk calls Binance's Dogecoin glitch 'shady'
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao argued on Twitter after Musk called Binance's handling of its Dogecoin glitch "shady".  Binance has suspended dogecoin withdrawals due to a glitch after a network update. Responding to Musk, Binance CEO tweeted news about Tesla glitch that prompted a safety recall of cars and asked, "What happened here?"

Title: LatentView Analytics stock triples in two days of trading
Content: Global data and analytics company LatentView Analytics' stock continued to see buying interest from investors for the second consecutive session on Wednesday as the stock rallied as much as 19% to hit a record ₹581.65 on the BSE. The shares of the company have almost tripled in two straight sessions. They gained 148% on their market debut on Tuesday.

Title: Elon Musk sells over half of 10% Tesla stock he vowed to offload after Twitter poll
Content: World's richest person Elon Musk has now sold over half of the Tesla stock he promised to offload after Twitter users voted 'yes' to his poll. Of the 10% stake or 17 million shares, Musk has so far offloaded 9.2 million shares worth $9.9 billion. He sold shares worth $1.05 billion and also exercised 2.15 million stock options on Tuesday.

Title: Local prices fall as govt plans bill to ban pvt cryptocurrencies with some exceptions
Content: Prices of cryptocurrencies on India platforms fell sharply overnight as selling accelerated after the government said a Cryptocurrency Bill will be introduced in Parliament. On WazirX, as of 9 am, Bitcoin was down 24% in last 24 hours, while Ether was down 23%. The bill seeks to prohibit private cryptocurrencies in India, with certain exceptions to promote the underlying tech.

Title: Virtual real estate plot sells for record ₹17.8 crore on 'metaverse' platform
Content: A subsidiary of Tokens.com, called the Metaverse Group, has purchased a plot of virtual real estate in Decentraland for a record $2.4 million (₹17.8 crore). It bought the 6,090 virtual square-foot patch for 618,000 tokens of Decentraland's cryptocurrency MANA. Decentraland is a self-proclaimed 'metaverse' platform where users can buy land, visit buildings and meet people as avatars.

Title: I overreacted due to the word 'shady': Binance CEO after Twitter spat with Musk
Content: Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao tweeted "I overreacted a bit due to the word shady" to Tesla CEO Elon Musk after their Twitter argument. Musk had called Binance's handling of its Dogecoin glitch "shady" after Binance suspended Dogecoin withdrawals due to a glitch after a network update. When Musk questioned Zhao, he hit back at Musk with news about Tesla's glitch.

Title: Most cryptos unlikely to survive with high values going forward: Rajan
Content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has said most cryptocurrencies in existence today are unlikely to survive with high values going forward. "If things have value only because they will be pricier down the line, that's a bubble," he told CNBC-TV18. "Cryptocurrencies may pose the same problem as unregulated chit funds, which take money from people and go bust," Rajan added.

Title: Why file 23 volumes, is it to drag case or harass judges: SC asks Amazon, Future Group
Content: The Supreme Court has deferred the hearing in the legal tussle between Amazon and Future Group over the ₹24,713-crore Future Retail-Reliance Industries deal after the parties submitted a "truckload" of documents. "What's the fun in filing 22-23 volumes of records...Is it the purpose of just dragging on or otherwise to harass the judges," Chief Justice of India NV Ramana asked.

Title: Deposit 10% of ₹200 crore penalty in 3 weeks: NCLAT to Maruti Suzuki
Content: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) stayed the ₹200 crore penalty imposed on India's largest car manufacturer, Maruti Suzuki, by the Competition Commission (CCI). It, however, asked the carmaker to deposit 10% of the total amount within three weeks. The CCI in August this year imposed a ₹200-crore fine on Maruti Suzuki for allegedly restricting discounts offered by dealers.

Title: Paytm shares surge over 13% in second session of gains
Content: Shares of Paytm surged more than 13% on Wednesday, marking their second straight session of gains. However, the shares are still down 20% from their offer price of ₹2,150. The shares of Paytm had sunk 27% last Thursday and another 13% on Monday, marking one of the worst debuts by a major technology company globally.

Title: Aim is to take turnover of auto sector to ₹15 lakh crore in 5 yrs: Gadkari
Content: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said that the Centre's aim is to increase the turnover of the automobile industry to ₹15 lakh crore within the next five years. "Our turnover is ₹7.5 lakh crore...₹3 lakh crore is export," he added. Gadkari was at the inauguration of the 'Scrapping Facilitation Centre' of Maruti Suzuki.

Title: Tomato prices cross ₹100 per kg in several cities, at ₹140 per kg in Chennai
Content: Tomatoes were being sold for ₹100 per kg in Delhi on Tuesday, while in many other cities the prices of the vegetable have crossed ₹100 per kg. In Chennai, the price has reached ₹140 per kilo while in Kerala, tomato price reached ₹120/kg in Kottayam and ₹103/kg in Thiruvananthapuram. Tomato price reached ₹119 per kg in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram.

Title: Govt to bring amendments to enable privatisation of 2 public sector banks
Content: The Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill 2021 is among 26 bills that will be tabled in Parliament's winter session. The bill seeks "to effect amendments in Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Acts, 1970 and 1980 and...Banking Regulation Act, 1949" in the context of privatisation of two public sector banks. The privatisation was announced during the Union Budget 2021-22.

Title: Jhunjhunwala backed-Star Health sets price band for ₹7,249-crore IPO at ₹870-900
Content: Star Health and Allied Insurance, backed by billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹870-900 per share. The IPO, which will fetch ₹7,249.18 crore at the upper band, will open for subscription on November 30 and close on December 2. This will be India's third largest IPO of 2021 after Paytm and Zomato.

Title: FedEx India gets CCI nod to acquire minority stake in Delhivery
Content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved FedEx India's acquisition of minority stake in Delhivery. It also gave approval to acquisition of certain operating assets of FedEx India and TNT India by Delhivery, which recently filed draft papers with SEBI for IPO. Some customers and employees of FedEx will also be transferred to Delhivery, subject to obtaining their consent.

Title: Paytm may be forgotten by the time next IPO comes: Zerodha Co-founder
Content: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath told ET NOW that Paytm's weak stock market debut will have an impact on the upcoming IPOs. "Markets...are driven by sentiment and at least in the short-term, this will remain in people's memory," he said. "I do not think it is a longstanding thing...By the time the next IPO comes by, people will forget," Kamath added.

Title: TVS Motor to invest ₹1,200 crore in EVs, future tech in Tamil Nadu
Content: TVS Motor has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Tamil Nadu government for an investment of ₹1,200 crore in future technologies and electric vehicles (EVs) in the next four years. The investment will be used for the design, development and manufacturing of new products and capacity expansion in the electric vehicle space, the company said in a statement.

Title: Will get back all money taken away from banks: Nirmala Sitharaman
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said all money taken away from banks will be returned as the government is actively pursuing loan defaulters' cases. She said, "Any wrongdoing that has happened...any loans which have been taken away and not repaid...[Our] system will work in...a way that...wrongdoers and...money..will be brought back." She said this during her two-day visit to J&K.

Title: ED attaches assets of Kolkata-based firm for defrauding SBI of ₹164 cr
Content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹42 crore of Shree Mahalaxmi Corporation for allegedly defrauding SBI to the tune of ₹164 crore. ED launched a probe on basis of CBI's FIR against the Kolkata-based firm and its directors for availing loan based on forged documents. ED said ₹164 crore was diverted after being rotated among multiple bank accounts.

Title: ₹400 cr undisclosed income detected after raids on 2 Delhi-NCR realty groups
Content: The Income Tax Department has detected an estimated undisclosed income of ₹400 crore after it raided two real estate groups based in Delhi-NCR, the CBDT said. Preliminary analysis of the seized data found that the groups received part of the sale consideration in cash for sale of flats, it added. This wasn't recorded in the books of accounts, CBDT said.

Title: IOB, Central Bank of India shares rise 13% on reports of privatisation
Content: Shares of Indian Overseas Bank (IOB) and Central Bank of India (CBI) rose on Wednesday as reports said the government is planning to privatise them. The government is set to bring amendments during Parliament's winter session to enable privatisation of two state-owned banks. IOB's shares rose 13% to ₹22.45 during intraday trade, while CBI's stock also surged nearly 13%.

Title: Tata Group plans to set up solar plant worth ₹3,000 cr in TN: Report
Content: Tata Group's solar arm, Tata Power Solar, is planning to invest ₹3,000 crore to set up a 4 GW integrated solar photovoltaic cell manufacturing plant in Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu, TOI reported. Tata is reportedly in final stages of consolidating the deal with the state government. The state has a target of generating around 25 GW of renewable energy by 2030.

Title: Zee shares rise 7% after MD says merger deal with Sony in final stages
Content: Shares of Zee Entertainment surged by as much as 7% to ₹334.45 during intraday trade on Wednesday. This comes after Zee's MD and CEO Punit Goenka said that the company's merger with Sony India is "in the final stages of stitching up". Post the merger, 47.07% stake will be held by Zee's shareholders, while Sony will hold 52.93% stake.

Title: 737 MAX jets faced great scrutiny, now they're world's safest: SpiceJet CMD
Content: SpiceJet's Chairman and MD Ajay Singh said, "Boeing 737 MAX planes have gone through the greatest scrutiny of any aircraft in history." He added that they are the safest in the world today. "SpiceJet started to fly this aircraft two days ago...so far, with all the flights that we've flown, there's not even been a minor issue," Singh said.

Title: If JPMorgan doesn't withdraw lawsuit, I'll give them 1-star review on Yelp: Musk
Content: Tesla CEO and the world's richest man Elon Musk told The Wall Street Journal, "If JPMorgan Chase doesn't withdraw their lawsuit, I'll give them a one-star review on Yelp." He added, "This is my final warning!" JPMorgan sued Tesla for $162 million, accusing it of breaching a 2014 contract relating to stock trading options that Tesla sold to the bank.

Title: Amazon, Apple fined €200 mn for colluding over sale of products in Italy
Content: Amazon and Apple have been fined a total of more than €200 million ($225 million) by Italy's antitrust authority for anti-competitive cooperation in the sale of Apple and Beats products. It said that certain clauses of an agreement signed between the companies in 2018 only allowed selected resellers to sell Apple and Beats products on Amazon.it, violating European Union rules.

Title: No breach of systems: PNB on claims its customers' data was exposed
Content: Punjab National Bank (PNB) has denied claims made by CyberX9 that personal data of PNB's 180 million customers was exposed due to a vulnerability in its internal server. "We have...checked our ICT systems those on internet-facing and operating in the background. There has been no breach of systems and pilferage of any data of any of our customers," PNB said.

Title: I personally told Policybazaar CEO, 'do whatever but list before Paytm': BharatPe CEO
Content: BharatPe's CEO Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol, "I had personally told Policybazaar CEO, do whatever you do but list before Paytm." Grover added, "Thankfully, he listened to me and closed his IPO before; otherwise, it would have been a very different story for Policybazaar." Grover said "everything is going to get priced down" following Paytm's IPO.

Title: It should be known as 'Ganja Company' instead of Amazon: CAIT
Content: Confederation of All India Traders' (CAIT) Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal hit out at Amazon over the alleged sale of marijuana through its platform. "It should be known as 'Ganja Company' rather (than) Amazon," he tweeted. His tweet came after Visakhapatnam Police reportedly seized 48 kg of marijuana from Amazon's partner, days after the marijuana seizure in MP connected to Amazon.

Title: 'Gave as small a portion of my kidney as I could', jokes LatentView Founder on IPO
Content: Talking about LatentView Analytics' ₹600-crore IPO, Founder Venkat Viswanathan joked that an IPO felt "like I'm giving away a kidney". I wanted to give "as small a portion of kidney as I can, live comfortably and see it grow", Viswanathan explained. Post-IPO, promoters' shareholding fell from 80% to 68%. On Tuesday, LatentView shares listed at 169% premium over IPO price.

Title: MobiKwik delays planned IPO days after Paytm shares plunge on market debut
Content: MobiKwik Founder and CEO Bipin Preet Singh has told Reuters that the digital payments startup has delayed its planned ₹1,900-crore IPO. Earlier, reports said MobiKwik's IPO valuation declined after its rival Paytm's shares closed 27% below its IPO price on their first trading day. MobiKwik will go public "when we feel we're going to have a successful IPO", Singh said.

Title: Wouldn't spend a penny for a $20 bn IPO: BharatPe CEO on not applying for Paytm
Content: BharatPe's CEO Ashneer Grover, who didn't apply for Paytm's IPO, told Moneycontrol, "If Paytm had issued a $10 billion IPO, I would have personally applied for stocks worth ₹500 crore." He added, "For $20 billion I wouldn't even spend a penny." Grover also said, "I wish everyone the very best but I would invest my money where there is conviction."

Title: Paytm shares gain 7% after losing over ₹50,000 crore in market cap in 2 days
Content: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications' shares surged around 7% to ₹1,453 apiece on Tuesday, its third day of trading. During the first two days, the company's stock fell over 35% below its IPO price of ₹2,150, losing more than ₹50,000 crore in market value. Earlier, Paytm said it recorded a 418% year-on-year growth in value of loans disbursed in October.

Title: Co-operative societies can't use the word 'bank' in their names: RBI
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday cautioned about co-operative societies using the word "bank" in their names and accepting deposits from non-members. "Co-operative societies cannot use the words "bank", "banker" or "banking" as part of their names, except as permitted under the provisions of BR Act, 1949 or by the RBI," the central bank said.

Title: Latent View shares list at 169% premium after India's most-subscribed IPO
Content: The shares of Chennai-based Latent View Analytics listed at ₹530 per share on the BSE on Tuesday, a 169% premium over its IPO price of ₹197. The opening price on the NSE was ₹512 per share. Earlier, the digital analytics company's ₹600-crore IPO became India's most subscribed public issue in terms of number of times. It was subscribed 326.49 times.

Title: Ambani considers forming trust-like structure to control $200-billion RIL: Report
Content: Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani is considering moving his family's holdings into a trust-like structure that will control the Mumbai-listed Reliance Industries, Bloomberg reported citing sources. The 64-year-old billionaire's succession plan is similar to that of Walmart's Walton family, which is the world's richest, the report said. Reliance Industries is currently worth over $200 billion.

Title: Vodafone Idea to hike prepaid mobile tariffs by 20-25% a day before Bharti Airtel
Content: Vodafone Idea on Tuesday announced that it is raising prepaid mobile tariffs by 20-25% and top-up plan tariffs by 19-21% with effect from November 25 (Thursday). This will help address "the financial stress faced by the industry", it said. Its announcement comes a day after Bharti Airtel said it will increase prepaid mobile tariffs by 20-25% starting November 26 (Friday).

Title: SBI clarifies on report on ₹164-crore unpaid refund to Jan Dhan a/c holders
Content: SBI has clarified on a report claiming that the bank is yet to refund ₹164 crore of undue fee charged from account holders of Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY). SBI said it is in full compliance with government and regulatory directives. The IIT-Mumbai report claimed that SBI collected ₹254 crore from digital payments between April 2017 to September 2020.

Title: Jeff Bezos donates $100 mn to Obama Foundation, $166 mn to NYU
Content: World's second richest person and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos has donated $100 million to former US President Barack Obama's foundation in its largest-ever individual contribution. The gift was given in honour of civil rights icon and Congressman John Lewis who died last year, said Obama Foundation. Separately, New York University's medical centre also received $166 million from Bezos and family.

Title: CCPA notice to e-comm firms over substandard pressure cookers' sale
Content: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has issued notices to e-commerce companies, including Amazon, Flipkart, ShopClues, Snapdeal and Paytm Mall, for selling pressure cookers in violation of the quality standards set by the government. It has sought response from the e-commerce entities within 7 days, failing which necessary action may be initiated against them, the CCPA said.

Title: Chemicals of bombs used in Pulwama attack sourced via Amazon: CAIT
Content: Indian traders' body CAIT has alleged that Amazon's e-commerce platform was used to source chemicals of bombs used in the 2019 Pulwama terror attack. It claimed that ammonium nitrate, among other materials, was purchased through Amazon to prepare the improvised explosive devices (IEDs) for the attack. A case of treason should be registered against Amazon and its officials, it added.

Title: MedPlus Health, RateGain Travel, 4 others get SEBI nod for IPOs
Content: Six companies, including MedPlus Health Services, RateGain Travel Technologies and Fusion Micro Finance, have received market regulator SEBI's approval to raise funds through initial public offering (IPO). Other firms that received SEBI's approval are Prudent Corporate Advisory Services, Tracxn Technologies and Puranik Builders. The equity shares of the firms will be listed on the BSE and NSE.

Title: Go Fashion's ₹1,014-crore IPO subscribed 135 times on final day
Content: The ₹1,014-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Go Fashion, which owns women's bottom-wear brand Go Colors, was subscribed 135.46 times on Monday, the third and final day of bidding. While the portion reserved for retail investors was booked 49.70 times, that of qualified institutional buyers and non-institutional investors was subscribed 100.73 times and 262.08 times respectively.

Title: Complete Jaypee Infratech's insolvency proceedings in 2 months: SC to NCLT
Content: The Supreme Court has directed the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) to complete Jaypee Infratech's insolvency proceedings within two months. SC was hearing a plea filed by homebuyers of the Jaypee Kensington Boulevard project in Noida. More than 20,000 flats were yet to be completed by Jaypee when the insolvency proceedings began for the firm in 2017.

Title: 14 companies approach govt to settle retro tax cases: Revenue Secy
Content: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said 14 companies, against whom retrospective tax demands were raised, have approached the government to settle cases. "All of them have approached. There were 17 cases, out of which 3-4 had no trace," he added. "Cairn is working on it...As soon as they take the cases back, we will give them the cheque," Bajaj said.

Title: Vedanta promoters look to increase stake by 4.57% for ₹5,950 cr: Report
Content: Promoters of Vedanta, Twin Star Holdings and Vedanta Netherlands Investments BV, are looking to purchase up to 17 crore equity shares of Vedanta at ₹350 each, for total valuation of ₹5,950 crore, Business Standard reported. The promoter group companies had an outstanding purchase offer size of up to 4.57% of total shares as of September 30, it added.

Title: Reconsider GST hike on apparel and textiles: Industry body RAI to FM
Content: Retailers Association of India (RAI) has urged Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, state governments and GST Council to reconsider proposed hike in GST rate on apparel and textiles from 5% to 12%, effective from January 1. It will adversely impact 85% of the industry, RAI added. "A far more beneficial...solution is to make...entire value chain subject to...5% GST rate," it said.

Title: India's GDP to grow 8% in 2021 and 9.1% in 2022: Goldman Sachs
Content: Goldman Sachs has pegged India's economic growth at 8% for 2021 and 9.1% in 2022, led by  increase in consumption. "We also expect government capital spending to continue, see nascent signs of a private corporate capital expenditure recovery and...revival in housing investment," it said. Goldman Sachs also projected CPI inflation to increase to 5.8% in 2022 from 5.2% in 2021.

Title: Future Retail staff urge SC to allow Reliance deal, cite 27,000 jobs at risk
Content: Employee Welfare Association of Big Bazaar operator Future Retail has asked the Supreme Court to allow the company to sell its retail assets to Reliance Industries, according to a legal filing seen by Reuters. If the deal fails, "Future will be pushed into liquidation, resulting in...27,000 employees losing...livelihoods", it said. It also urged the court to rule against Amazon.

Title: India's GDP likely to grow 8.1% in Q2 of 2021-22: SBI report
Content: India's GDP growth is likely to be around 8.1% in the second quarter of financial year 2021-22, according to an SBI research report. "The full year (FY22) GDP growth is now revised upwards to 9.3-9.6% from our earlier estimate of 8.5-9%," the report added. The country's economy grew by 20.1% in the first quarter of the current financial year.

Title: SpiceJet plans to induct 50 Boeing 737 MAX planes by Dec 2023: CMD
Content: SpiceJet's Chairman and MD Ajay Singh on Tuesday said that the airline plans to induct 50 Boeing 737 MAX planes in its fleet by December 2023. Currently, SpiceJet has 13 MAX planes in its fleet. "The first two have started flying already and the other 11 would start flying in the next 15 to 20 days," Singh added.

Title: Chhattisgarh announces VAT reduction of 2% on diesel prices, 1% on petrol
Content: Chattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday announced a VAT reduction of 2% on diesel prices and 1% on petrol prices. Chhattisgarh CMO took to Twitter to say that the state government will incur a loss of approximately ₹1,000 crore. The decision comes after the Centre recently reduced the excise duty on diesel and petrol prices by ₹10 and ₹5, respectively.

Title: PNB server security issue put data of all customers at risk for 7 months: Report
Content: A vulnerability in an internal server of the PNB exposed the data of over 180 million or all of the bank's customers for about seven months, Cyber security firm CyberX9 claimed. "It could've allowed any malicious attacker to achieve the highest level of admin privilege," CyberX9 said. The bank confirmed the vulnerability but denied any exposure of critical data.

Title: Billionaire allegedly kept spreadsheet of 5,000 women he had sex with; complaint filed
Content: US tech billionaire Michael Goguen has been accused of keeping a spreadsheet documenting his sexual encounters with 5,000 women. It was claimed in a complaint by four former employees who set up Goguen's Amyntor Group and are now seeking $800 million in damages. According to New York Post, the complaint also claims Goguen ordered his security chief to kill detractors.

Title: Musk's mother accuses Kamala Harris of ignoring Tesla, asks 'Should we keep her updated?'
Content: Maye Musk, the mother of Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk, has accused US Vice President Kamala Harris of "ignoring" Tesla. Reacting to Harris' tweet about building electric vehicles, batteries and other parts in the US instead of relying on other countries, Maye tweeted, "Now VP is ignoring Tesla." She further asked, "Should we keep her updated?"

Title: 50% of my tweets were made on a porcelain throne: Elon Musk
Content: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "At least 50% of my tweets were made on a porcelain throne," apparently referring to a toilet seat. He added, "It gives me solace." Musk's tweet comes days after he sold $9 billion in Tesla stock after a Twitter poll on whether he should sell his Tesla shares.

Title: Musk responds to Tesla customer's complaint in 3 minutes, apologises
Content:
World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a Tesla customer's issue within three minutes on Twitter. "Experiencing 500 server error to connect my 
Tesla Model 3 on my iOS app in Seoul...Seems like it's a worldwide issue," the customer tweeted. Three minutes later, Musk responded "Checking...", and also apologised to the customer after the issue was fixed.

Title: Avax m-cap hits $30 billion, surpasses m-caps of Shiba Inu and Dogecoin
Content: Avax, the native token of smart contract blockchain platform Avalanche, saw its market cap touching $30.25 billion, surpassing Shiba Inu's $25 billion market cap and Dogecoin's $30.20 billion market cap. At the time of writing, Avax was trading at $138.19 as the world's 10th largest crypto. Major cryptos like Bitcoin, Ether and Binance Coin witnessed a fall this week.

Title: Let's keep our head low and focus on execution: Paytm CEO to staff after IPO
Content: After Paytm shares opened at a 9% discount on IPO price on Thursday, Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma told employees they have an additional responsibility to respect the faith of shareholders. He said that to achieve this, they'll have to put their head down and get into execution mode. Sharma virtually addressed the town hall meeting from Mumbai, Moneycontrol reported.

Title: Get your facts right: Kotak as man blames him for 'wrong pricing' of Paytm IPO
Content: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak tweeted "get your facts right" to a man who blamed Kotak for "wrong pricing of Paytm IPO" and asked him to "take responsibility". "Kotak didn't lead manage Paytm," tweeted Kotak. He added, "Kotak did lead manage Zomato at issue price ₹76 (current price ₹150) and Nykaa at issue price ₹1,125 (current price ₹2,100)."

Title: Paytm disrupted Indian market to return Chinese investors' money: BharatPe CEO
Content: BharatPe CEO Ashneer Grover in an interview with Moneycontrol accused Paytm of disrupting the Indian market to return its Chinese investors' money through its IPO. "You did a ₹18,300-crore IPO out of which 55% was secondary. You did a price optimisation," the BharatPe CEO said. "It's the Chinese investors who sold their shares through this IPO," he added.

Title: Paytm CEO compared his company to Tesla after shares fell on listing: Report
Content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma in a town hall meeting with employees compared Paytm to Elon Musk-led Tesla after the company's shares tanked on market debut on Thursday, Bloomberg reported. Sharma reminded employees that Tesla's stock used to be among the most-shorted in the world. He added that Tesla overcame years of struggle to become the world's most valuable automaker.

Title: Coal India to give ₹16 cr for treatment of employee's daughter with rare disorder
Content: Coal India has said it'll sanction ₹16 crore towards Zolgensma injection for the treatment of an employee's two-year-old daughter, who's suffering from the rare genetic disorder Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA). CIL said it "believes its employees and families are its real wealth", adding that it decided to bear the cost as it was 'impossible' for the employee to afford it.

Title: Bharti Airtel to raise prepaid mobile tariffs by 20-25% from Friday, shares hit 52-week high
Content: Bharti Airtel will increase prepaid mobile tariffs by 20-25% starting November 26 (Friday), the telecom company said. It added that the move is aimed at increasing Average Revenue Per User (ARPU) of the company to enable substantial investments in the network as it plans 5G roll out in India. The telecom operator's shares touched a 52-week high of ₹756 today.

Title: Sensex plunges 1,000 points; below 59,000 for 1st time in over 2 months
Content: Sensex plunged over 1,000 points on Monday, going below the 59,000-mark for the first time in over two months. Nifty also plunged over 300 points to go below 17,500. About 774 shares have advanced, 2306 shares declined and 141 shares are unchanged, Moneycontrol reported. Shares of newly-listed One97 Communications, Paytm's parent company tanked around 14% today.

Title: Sensex crashes 1,170 points to close at 58,466, Nifty ends below 17,500
Content: The Sensex crashed 1,500 points during intraday trade on Monday and eventually ended 1,170 points lower at 58,466. Meanwhile, the Nifty closed 348 points lower at 17,416. All the sectoral indices ended in the red with realty, healthcare, auto, oil & gas, and the PSU bank indices down 2-4%.

Title: Paytm loses ₹50,700-crore in market value as shares plunge 36% from IPO price
Content: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications' shares plunged more than 10% on Monday, extending the company's post-IPO trading slump to over 36%. With this, the company has lost over ₹50,700 crore in market value. Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, who holds 9.1% stake in Paytm, lost ₹5,800 crore due to the slump.

Title: Govt allows SII to export 50 lakh Covishield doses under COVAX: Report
Content: The Centre has allowed the Serum Institute of India (SII) to export 50 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield under the UN-backed COVAX, according to reports. SII will export the doses to Bangladesh, Nepal, Tajikistan and Mozambique, reports said. The Health Ministry was recently informed by SII that it has manufactured stock of 24.89 crore Covishield doses, the reports added.

Title: Ericsson to buy Vonage for $6.2 bn in its largest-ever acquisition
Content: Swedish telecommunications company Ericsson on Monday announced that it has agreed to buy cloud communications firm Vonage for $6.2 billion in its largest-ever acquisition deal. Ericsson will pay $21 per share for Vonage using existing cash, according to a company statement. The deal is expected to close in the first half of 2022, subject to Vonage shareholder and regulatory approvals.

Title: Amazon approached Future Group to withdraw complaint before CCI: Report
Content: Amazon asked Future Group to withdraw its complaint before the Competition Commission of India (CCI) last month, Economic Times reported. Future's complaint accuses Amazon of flouting foreign investment and Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) rules by misrepresenting facts, it said. Amazon had also asked Future for compensation for withdrawing its objections to the Reliance deal, it added.

Title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health's IPO to open by Nov-end: Report
Content: Star Health and Allied Insurance plans to launch its initial public offering (IPO) in the last week of November, The Economic Times reported. The firm, backed by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, aims to raise ₹7,500 crore from the issue. The IPO consists of a fresh issue of ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹5,500 crore by existing shareholders.

Title: Crude oil prices fall to 7-week low amid COVID-19 surge in Europe
Content: Crude oil prices fell to seven-week low on Monday. This comes amid the surge in COVID-19 cases in Europe, which could hit demand and on concerns about excess supply after Japan said it was weighing releasing oil reserves. Brent lost 57 cents to $78.32 a barrel and West Texas Intermediate crude futures were down 39 cents at $75.55 a barrel.

Title: Emirates open to tie-ups with Tata, other Indian airlines: CCO
Content: Emirates Airlines Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) Adnan Kazim said the company is open to tie-ups with the Tata Group and other Indian carriers. "Our objective is to have and build...solid win-win relationships between our network and their networks," he added. Kazim also said that Emirates' agreement with SpiceJet is on and it couldn't be utilised properly due to COVID-19.

Title: MTNL shares rise 8% as govt lists real estate assets on sale
Content: Shares of Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Limited (MTNL) rose over 8% to ₹20.40 during intraday trade on Monday. This comes after the government listed real estate assets of MTNL located in Vasari Hill, Goregaon in Mumbai for sale at a reserve price of around ₹270 crore. MTNL's 20 flats located in Oshiwara have also been put up for sale.

Title: RBI issues draft scheme for PMC Bank's takeover by Unity Small Finance Bank
Content: The RBI has placed in public domain a draft scheme for the acquisition of Punjab and Maharashtra Cooperative (PMC) Bank by Delhi-based Unity Small Finance Bank (USFB). According to the draft scheme of amalgamation, PMC Bank's depositors will get their money back over a period of 3-10 years. USFB is being set up with a capital of about ₹1,100 crore.

Title: RIL shares fall 4% as it decides to re-evaluate $15 bn Saudi Aramco deal
Content: Shares of Reliance Industries (RIL) fell by 4% during intraday trade on Monday. This comes after RIL and Saudi Aramco decided to "re-evaluate" the world's biggest oil exporter's proposed $15 billion investment in RIL's oil-to-chemicals (O2C) business. Reliance had announced a sale of a 20% stake in the unit to Aramco in 2019, but the deal was delayed.

Title: Sensex may hit 80,000 by Dec 2022 in bull-case scenario: Morgan Stanley
Content: The BSE Sensex may hit 80,000 points by December 2022 in a bull-case scenario, according to investment banking firm Morgan Stanley. It said that the 80,000-mark is achievable, where India would see nearly $20 billion inflows on the back of inclusion in global bond indices. "A new profit cycle will likely help keep the bid on Indian shares," it added.

Title: Will continue to look for investments in India: Aramco after RIL halts deal
Content: World's biggest oil exporter, Saudi Aramco, has said that it will continue to look for investment opportunities in India. This comes days after Reliance Industries and Saudi Aramco decided to "re-evaluate" the oil giant's proposed $15 billion investment in RIL's oil-to-chemicals (O2C) business. "India offers tremendous growth opportunities over the long term," Aramco added in a statement.

Title: El Salvador plans to build 1st Bitcoin City, backed by Bitcoin bonds
Content: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele has said that the country plans to build the world's first Bitcoin City, which will be funded initially by Bitcoin bonds. The city would get its energy supply from a volcano and would not levy any taxes except for VAT, he added. "We'll start funding in 2022...bonds will be available in 2022," Bukele said.

Title: CEO of largest crypto exchange buys 1st home in Dubai, says 'govt's very progressive'
Content: World's biggest cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao told Bloomberg that he bought his first home last month in Dubai, a city he describes as "very pro-crypto". "The government there is very progressive, and it's a very good business environment...I want to show that we're committed to the place, so I bought an apartment there," he said in the interview.

Title: Apple tells workers they can 'freely' discuss wages, working conditions
Content: Apple has told its employees that the company's policies don't preclude them from "speaking freely" about wages, hours, working conditions. The memo was published on Apple's internal site and was reportedly accessible to 80,000 salaried and hourly US employees. "We encourage any employee with concerns to raise them in the way they feel most comfortable, internally or externally," Apple wrote.

Title: What is the 'world's first Bitcoin City' being planned by El Salvador?
Content: El Salvador plans to build the 'world's first Bitcoin City' that would be funded initially by bitcoin-backed bonds and would get geothermal power from a volcano. It won't levy any taxes except for VAT and half of the VAT levied would fund the bonds issued to build the city. The other half would pay for services such as garbage collection.

Title: Global IPOs raise over $600 billion in best year on record, Rivian tops list
Content: About 2,850 businesses and special purpose acquisition companies have raised over $600 billion through initial public offerings (IPOs) so far this year, surpassing the previous record hit in 2007, Bloomberg reported. Tesla's rival Rivian Automotive's IPO, which raised $11.9 billion, became the world's largest public issue of 2021, while China Telecom's $8.4 billion IPO topped in Asia.

Title: Musk reportedly offers Tesla managers 3 options or to resign according to leaked email
Content: According to a report, Tesla CEO Elon Musk sent an email to employees in October, saying that there are only three options available to managers when he sends directions: explain why he's wrong, request further clarification, or execute orders. "If none of the above are done, that manager will be asked to resign immediately," the leaked email by Musk said.

Title: I support listening to music in the factory: Musk in e-mail to employees
Content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an e-mail to employees about listening to music at work, said, "I very much support music in the factory." He added, "An associate asked if we could have one earbud for music...so the other ear can listen for safety-related issues...That sounds fine to me." Musk sent the e-mail in early October that has surfaced now.

Title: ₹100 cr unaccounted income detected after raid on Gujarat-based group
Content: The Ministry of Finance said the Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted income of around ₹100 crore after raids on premises of a Gujarat-based group, engaged in manufacturing of chemicals and real estate. Incriminating evidence in the form of documents, diary noting and digital data were seized, it added. The group also received on-money in immovable property transactions, it said.

Title: Amazon India executives named as accused in weed smuggling case: MP Police
Content: Police in MP's Bhind has said it has charged Amazon India's Executive Directors under the NDPS Act, in connection to the case of alleged smuggling of marijuana. Police had earlier arrested two men with 20 kg marijuana (worth ₹1.1 crore) for allegedly using the Amazon India website to order and further smuggle it under the guise of natural sweetener stevia.

Title: Was honoured to be part of his earthly journeys: Mahindra on 71-yr-old Kerala tea-seller
Content: After 71-year-old Kerala-based tea stall owner KR Vijayan, who became famous for global trips with his wife, passed away, businessman Anand Mahindra wrote, "Godspeed...You became the embodiment of...explorer in all of us." Mahindra, who sponsored the couple's Australia trip in 2019 after learning about them from a video, added, he was honoured to be a part of his "earthly journeys".

Title: Subway Co-founder and nuclear physicist Peter Buck passes away aged 90
Content: Peter Buck, the nuclear physicist who co-founded Subway restaurants, has passed away at the age of 90. "Dr Buck made a lasting impact, leaving behind a spirit of hard work & dedication across nearly 40,000 locations. His legacy continues through Subway, a brand he worked hard to build," the restaurant chain tweeted. The cause of his death hasn't been revealed.

Title: Govt puts MTNL, BSNL assets worth around ₹1,100 crore on sale
Content: The government has listed for sale real estate assets of state-run telecom firms MTNL and BSNL at a reserve price of around ₹1,100 crore, according to government documents. BSNL properties in Hyderabad, Chandigarh, Bhavnagar and Kolkata have been posted for sale at around ₹800 crore. MTNL's 20 flats located in Mumbai have also been put up for sale.

Title: Anand Mahindra shares memes to dismiss a quote falsely attributed to him
Content: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share two memes to call out an Instagram post carrying a quote falsely attributed to him. "Another completely fabricated quote falsely attributed to me. I'll be taking legal action," Mahindra tweeted as he shared the post. A few days ago, he had dismissed an article claiming that he owns cryptocurrency.

Title: China fines Alibaba, Baidu, others for failing to declare 43 deals
Content: China's market regulator has fined companies, including Alibaba and Baidu, for failing to declare 43 deals that date as far back as 2012 to authorities and violating China's anti-monopoly legislation. The firms involved in the cases would be fined $78,000 each, the maximum under China's 2008 Anti-Monopoly Law. The earliest deal listed was a 2012 acquisition involving Baidu.

Title: Expect to resolve credit card fee dispute with Amazon in UK: Visa
Content: Visa said it expects to resolve its credit card fee dispute in the UK with Amazon after the e-commerce firm said that it would stop taking payments from Visa credit cards. Visa CFO Vasant Prabhu said, "Restricting consumer choice doesn't help merchants either." He added the firm hopes to go back to what its relationship was with Amazon.

Title: China Evergrande's EV unit to raise $347 million from share sale
Content: China Evergrande's electric vehicle division said it is planning to raise about HK$2.7 billion ($347 million) from a share sale to fund the production of new-energy cars. China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group will sell about 900 million shares at HK$3 apiece. The new shares are priced at a 15% discount to the stock's last traded price, the company said.

Title: Maruti Suzuki to stay away from diesel segment: CTO
Content: Maruti Suzuki India's Chief Technical Officer (CTO) CV Raman has said that company will not get back into the diesel segment. "In 2023...new phase of emission norms will come, which is likely to drive up the cost. So we believe...diesel percentages may further come down," he added. Maruti had discontinued diesel models with the onset of stricter BS-VI emission norms.

Title: Virgin Atlantic in talks to raise $540 million in funding: Report
Content: Virgin Atlantic is in discussions with shareholders to raise about £400 million ($540 million) in funding, Sky News reported. The amount of potential capital injection is yet to be finalised and the carrier's billionaire Founder and majority investor Richard Branson could contribute to the funding, it added. This comes amid the company's decision to delay its IPO until early 2022.

Title: Govt plans to install 6,000 charging stations for EVs: Minister
Content: Heavy Industries Minister Mahendra Nath Pandey said that the government is planning to install 6,000 charging stations for electric vehicles (EVs) across nine expressways in the country. He also asked the Automotive Research Association of India (ARAI) to develop technology to reduce the charging time for EVs. "About 30% of the cost of...EV is...cost of the battery itself," he added.

Title: EPFO adds 15.41 lakh subscribers in Sept, increase of 13% over August
Content: Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) said it added 15.41 lakh net subscribers in September, an increase of over 13% over August. Of the total, about 8.95 lakh are new members, while around 6.46 lakh rejoined EPFO by changing jobs. The age-group of 22-25 years registered the highest number of net enrolments at 4.12 lakh during the month.

Title: EPFO gets approval to invest up to 5% in InvITs, alternative funds
Content: The central board of Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has approved a proposal to allow the retirement fund body to invest up to 5% of annual deposits in alternative investments funds, including infrastructure investment trusts (InvITs). "We shall only focus on government-backed alternatives, which are category one funds like public sector InvITs," Labour Secretary Sunil Barthwal said.

Title: It might be early to say that aviation sector is out of the woods: Vistara
Content: Vistara on Sunday said that it might be too early to conclude that India's aviation sector is out of the woods. It added that the prolonged suspension of scheduled international flights to and from India is impacting the financial health of most airlines. ''Recovery of demand in...international segment still has a long way to go," Vistara CEO-designate Vinod Kannan said.

Title: Govt's tax collection to surpass FY22 budget estimate: Revenue Secretary
Content: Government's tax collection will surpass 2021-22's budget estimate, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said. Net direct tax collection till October was around ₹6 lakh crore and average monthly GST mop-up is likely to be around ₹1.15 lakh crore, he added. Relief in excise duty on petrol, diesel and customs duty on edible oil will cost exchequer about ₹80,000 crore, Bajaj said.

Title: Saudi Stock Exchange operator seeks to raise up to $1 bn from IPO
Content: Saudi Tadawul Group, operator of Saudi Stock Exchange, said it is seeking to raise as much as $1 billion from its initial public offering (IPO). The company plans to sell 36 million shares in the price range of 95 riyals to 105 riyals a share. The IPO proceeds will go to the Public Investment Fund, the exchange's sole shareholder.

Title: Latent View Analytics shares trade at 150% premium in grey market
Content: The unlisted shares of analytics services provider Latent View Analytics are trading at a premium of 150% in the grey market ahead of listing, Moneycontrol reported. The company's shares are available at ₹497-₹547, marking a premium of ₹300-₹350 over IPO price band of ₹190-₹197. Latent View's ₹600 crore IPO was subscribed 326.49 times, becoming India's most subscribed public issue ever.

Title: Govt should empower ONGC rather than giving assets to private sector: Union
Content: ONGC's officers' union ASTO said government should empower and give the company a level-playing field rather than giving away prime assets to the private sector on a platter. It petitioned Oil Minister against proposal to give away 60% stake in Mumbai High, Bassein fields to foreign firms. Giving stake shall not yield desired results of enhancing domestic production, it added.

Title: Maharashtra govt cuts excise duty on imported scotch whiskey by 50%
Content: Maharashtra government has cut excise duty on imported scotch whiskey by 50%, a senior official said.
